Anchored by key contributions from Ravichandran Smaran, who scored 101 runs, and a match-winning cameo by Abhinav Manohar with 79 runs, Karnataka posted a formidable total of 348/6. This victory adds to their previous titles in 2013-14, 2014-15, 2017-18, and 2019-20, cementing their status as one of the most successful teams in domestic cricket.

questions.question: Which city’s Musi River heritage sites were recently added to the World Monuments Watch?
questions.explanation: Hyderabad’s Musi River heritage sites, including landmarks like the Telangana High Court, State Central Library, Osmania General Hospital, and British Residency, were added to the World Monuments Watch. This recognition highlights the need for preservation amid challenges like urbanization and pollution. The Musi River, a tributary of the Krishna River, originates in the Ananthagiri Hills and plays a significant role in the region's history and culture by supporting vital reservoirs and historic structures.

questions.question: Which bank received RBI approval to open 20 new branches in India, marking its largest expansion in over a decade?
questions.explanation: HSBC India has been granted approval by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to establish 20 new branches across key cities, marking its largest expansion in over a decade. This strategic move reflects the bank’s focus on India’s rapidly growing affluent and ultra-high net worth market. With the addition of these branches, HSBC India’s total network will increase to 46. The bank has also been strengthening its wealth solutions, including launching Global Private Banking in 2023 and acquiring L&T Investment Management in 2022, showcasing its commitment to catering to India’s burgeoning wealth markets.

questions.question: Who won the Men’s Singles title at the India Open Badminton 2025?
questions.explanation: Viktor Axelsen from Denmark secured the Men’s Singles title at the India Open Badminton 2025. His victory was part of a tournament featuring champions from various countries: South Korea’s An Se Young won the Women’s Singles, while the Men’s Doubles went to Malaysia’s Goh Sze Fei and Nur Izzuddin. Japan's Arisa Igarashi and Ayako Sakuramoto clinched the Women’s Doubles, and the Mixed Doubles title was won by China’s Jiang Zhen Bang and Wei Ya Xin.

questions.question: Where is the World Economic Forum 2025, which Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw is attending, being held?
questions.explanation: The World Economic Forum 2025 is being held in Davos, Switzerland. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw will represent India at the event, showcasing the nation’s inclusive development model. His participation emphasizes India's commitment to ensuring progress for all sections of society, particularly those historically excluded. The forum serves as a platform for global leaders to discuss pressing economic and social challenges and explore collaborative solutions.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Director General of the CRPF till November 30, 2027?
questions.explanation: Gyanendra Pratap Singh, a 1991 batch IPS officer from the Assam-Meghalaya cadre, has been appointed as the Director General of the CRPF, with tenure extending till November 30, 2027. He succeeds Anish Dayal Singh and follows the interim charge held by Vitul Kumar. Singh’s significant career achievements include serving as Assam’s Director General of Police and playing a pivotal role during the anti-CAA agitation. His appointment underscores his extensive experience and leadership within India’s police and security framework.

questions.question: In which city is the Cultural Center, named Thiruvalluvar Cultural Center, located?
questions.explanation: The Thiruvalluvar Cultural Center is located in Jaffna, a city in northern Sri Lanka. This cultural center was built with Indian assistance and serves as a symbol of the strong cultural, linguistic, historical, and civilisational ties between India and Sri Lanka. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed his support for the naming of the center, highlighting the significance of this cultural hub.

questions.question: Which region's Virgin Coconut Oil recently received the prestigious Geographical Indication (GI) tag?
questions.explanation: The Virgin Coconut Oil (VCO) from Nicobar district in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands was recently awarded the prestigious Geographical Indication (GI) tag. This achievement highlights the region’s unique production and quality standards. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during the 118th episode of "Mann Ki Baat," emphasized this milestone as a step towards empowering women through self-help groups (SHGs) and specialized training in marketing and branding. The GI tag is expected to enhance the global recognition of Andaman's VCO and boost its contribution to the global market while supporting tribal and local communities economically.

questions.question: Which country did the winner of the men’s elite race at the 20th Mumbai Marathon 2025 represent?
questions.explanation: The men’s elite race at the 20th Mumbai Marathon 2025 was won by Berhane Tesfay, representing Eritrea. This marathon, held at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus and flagged off by Maharashtra Governor C.P. Radhakrishnan, showcased exceptional talent. Alongside Eritrea's victory in the men’s category, Kenya’s Joyce Chepkemoi Tele triumphed in the women’s elite race. The event included categories for differently-abled individuals and senior citizens and also served as a qualifier for the World Athletics Championships, highlighting its global relevance.

questions.question: Which entity is India collaborating with to boost economic ties through a 6-point plan?
questions.explanation: India is working with the European Union to strengthen economic ties through a 6-point plan that emphasizes integrating their $24 trillion market. Key areas of focus include promoting fair trade, fostering SME growth, advancing cutting-edge technologies, and ensuring resilient supply chains. The partnership aims to align trade practices with sustainability and address global challenges, with the ultimate goal of finalizing a robust Free Trade Agreement. This collaboration highlights India and the EU's commitment to mutually beneficial economic growth.

questions.question: Which country clinched victory in both men's and women's categories at the inaugural Kho Kho World Cup 2025?
questions.explanation: India emerged victorious in the inaugural Kho Kho World Cup 2025, with both the men’s and women’s teams winning their respective titles. The tournament took place at the Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium, New Delhi. The women’s team defeated Nepal 78–40, and the men’s team triumphed 54–36. This success was attributed to excellent teamwork and strategies, as highlighted by Captain Priyanka Ingle and coach Sumit Bhatia.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Group CEO of Angel One, effective March 2025?
questions.explanation: Ambarish Kenghe has been appointed as the Group CEO of Angel One, effective March 2025. He brings over two decades of experience in fintech, technology, and e-commerce. Kenghe previously held significant roles, including Vice President and General Manager at Google Pay APAC and Chief Product Officer at Myntra. His leadership experience in scaling digital platforms and integrating AI-driven innovations positions him well to steer Angel One through a competitive and rapidly transforming financial services landscape.

questions.question: In which state was Eastern India’s first astronomical observatory inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The first astronomical observatory in Eastern India was inaugurated atop Panchet Hill in the Garpanchkot area of Purulia district, West Bengal. This observatory, named after the renowned physicist Satyendra Nath Bose, is a significant milestone in advancing astronomical research in the region. It is the sixth astronomical observatory in India, contributing to the country's efforts in promoting research in astronomy, astrophysics, and atmospheric sciences. The observatory is managed by the Satyendra Nath Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences in collaboration with Sidhu Kanu Birsa University.

questions.question: In which year was the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana launched?
questions.explanation: The Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana was launched on 22nd January 2015 as part of the Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao campaign to promote financial inclusion for the girl child in India. This scheme allows parents to open an account for their daughters at any post office or designated commercial bank branch. The initiative has been widely successful, with over 4 crore accounts opened across the country, and 2025 marks its 10th anniversary. It aims to secure the financial future of girls through savings and interest.

questions.question: Which country participated with India in the 7th Maritime Cooperation Dialogue held in New Delhi?
questions.explanation: The 7th India-France Maritime Cooperation Dialogue was held in New Delhi, where India and France discussed enhancing cooperation in the Indian Ocean Region. Both nations reaffirmed their shared vision for maritime security and their commitment to upholding international law and supporting multilateralism. France, as a key partner of India, plays a significant role in fostering maritime cooperation and ensuring stability in the region. This dialogue reflects the deep strategic relationship between the two countries in promoting global security and regional collaboration.

questions.question: Which country collaborated with India to finalise the energy price for the Sampur solar power plant?
questions.explanation: India and Sri Lanka collaborated to finalise the energy price for the Sampur solar power plant, strengthening their bilateral energy cooperation. A price of 5.97 US cents per kilowatt-hour was agreed upon for the 135 MW project. This joint venture between India’s National Thermal Power Corporation and Sri Lanka’s Ceylon Electricity Board highlights India's commitment to supporting renewable energy initiatives in neighbouring countries, fostering sustainable energy solutions, and enhancing regional ties.

questions.question: Which of the following states did not celebrate its Statehood Day on January 21?
questions.explanation: Manipur, Meghalaya, and Tripura celebrated their 53rd Statehood Day on January 21, 2025, marking their attainment of full statehood under the North Eastern Region (Reorganization) Act of 1971. Mizoram, however, is not part of this group as it became a state later, on February 20, 1987, through a separate agreement. This distinction makes Mizoram the odd one out in this context.

questions.question: In which state did the Flamingo Festival 2025 take place?
questions.explanation: The Flamingo Festival 2025 took place in Andhra Pradesh, with a focus on the conservation of biodiversity in Pulicat Lake and Nelapattu Bird Sanctuary. The festival, which concluded on January 20, 2025, attracted visitors from across Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, and beyond. It served as an important platform to raise awareness about the ecological significance of these areas, which are crucial for migratory birds like flamingos. Ministers highlighted the need for sustainable tourism and conservation efforts to preserve the region’s vital ecosystems. The festival’s revival was credited to the leadership of the state government.

questions.question: What is the target year for achieving 35% EV sales as highlighted in SIAM's 3rd International Conference on Sustainable Circularity?
questions.explanation: SIAM's 3rd International Conference on Sustainable Circularity highlighted the importance of promoting electric vehicles (EVs) as a step towards achieving sustainability and green job creation. The conference underscored initiatives like the FAME and PLI schemes, which aim to increase EV adoption and achieve 35% EV sales by 2030. This goal is part of India's broader strategy to reduce environmental impact, promote a circular economy, and transition towards cleaner energy sources. By setting 2030 as the target year, the government demonstrates its commitment to fostering economic growth while addressing climate change and reducing dependency on fossil fuels.

questions.question: What is India’s current rank as a coffee producer globally?
questions.explanation: India has emerged as the seventh-largest coffee producer globally, showcasing significant growth in the sector. In the last financial year, India’s coffee exports reached 1.29 billion dollars, nearly doubling from 719 million dollars in 2020-21. Karnataka leads in coffee production, followed by Kerala and Tamil Nadu, which are key contributors to this achievement. This growth highlights India's increasing importance in the global coffee industry and the country’s capability to expand its presence in international markets.

questions.question: On which date is the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) Raising Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) celebrates its Raising Day annually on January 19. Established in 2006, the NDRF is a specialized rescue force dedicated to disaster response and relief. This day honours the formation and contributions of the NDRF in managing natural and man-made disasters effectively. The NDRF consists of battalions drawn from paramilitary forces like the Border Security Force, Central Reserve Police Force, Central Industrial Security Force, and Indo-Tibetan Border Police. Recognizing this day highlights the essential role of the NDRF in ensuring public safety and disaster preparedness in India.

questions.question: Where was the Indian Sustainable Natural Rubber (iSNR) initiative launched?
questions.explanation: The Indian Sustainable Natural Rubber (iSNR) initiative was launched in Kottayam, Kerala, to align with global sustainability principles and the EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR). This initiative focuses on promoting sustainable rubber farming practices by offering free certification and training to farmers, thereby empowering smallholders. It also aims to prevent deforestation and improve supply chain traceability. Kerala, known for its significant rubber cultivation, was an ideal location for launching this initiative to enhance sustainability in the rubber sector.

questions.question: Who was sworn in as the 47th President of the United States?
questions.explanation: Donald Trump was sworn in as the 47th President of the United States in a ceremony held at the US Capitol, attended by tech billionaires, cabinet nominees, and former presidents. Leaders from around the world, including Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, extended their congratulations to President Trump on his assumption of office. This event marks a significant moment in US political history and international relations.

questions.question: Which country completed the world’s longest expressway tunnel?
questions.explanation: China completed the Tianshan Shengli Tunnel in Xinjiang, which at 22.13 km is the world’s longest expressway tunnel. The tunnel is part of the Urumqi-Yuli Expressway and significantly reduces travel time across the Tianshan Mountains from several hours to just 20 minutes. Built-in a remarkable 52 months, the project faced and overcame extreme environmental and geological challenges at high altitudes, showcasing China’s engineering and infrastructure development capabilities.

questions.question: What is the revised GDP growth forecast for India in FY25 according to Moody's?
questions.explanation: Moody’s has revised India’s GDP growth forecast for FY25 to 7%, a decrease from the 8.2% growth observed in the previous fiscal year. This revision reflects a combination of global and domestic economic slowdowns, including weaker-than-expected performance in key sectors. Despite this forecast, India’s GDP per capita at purchasing power parity increased by 11% year-on-year, indicating a positive trend in the standard of living. The revision aligns with similar adjustments made by other organizations like FICCI and the Asian Development Bank.

questions.question: Which country has signed a 20-year strategic partnership treaty with Russia on January 17, 2025?
questions.explanation: On January 17, 2025, Russia and Iran signed a 20-year "Comprehensive Strategic Partnership Treaty" in Moscow, which aims to enhance bilateral cooperation in various sectors including economic, military, and cultural fields. This agreement comes as a response to shared challenges such as common security threats and Western sanctions. The treaty includes plans for joint defence efforts, scientific exchanges, and energy collaboration, strengthening the relationship between Russia and Iran, which has evolved from historical rivalries to a closer alignment in recent years.

questions.question: What is the name of India’s first AI-powered credit card expert introduced by CheQ?
questions.explanation: CheQ, a company founded by former Flipkart executive Aditya Soni, has launched Wisor, India’s first AI-powered credit card expert. Wisor offers personalized insights, smart spend analysis, and reward optimization to simplify credit card management for users. By providing enhanced clarity and saving time, Wisor is designed to revolutionize how people handle their credit cards. Currently in its beta phase, Wisor is part of CheQ’s innovative expansion, which already serves a user base of over 3 million.

questions.question: By which year has Piyush Goyal set a target to achieve 10,000 GI tags?
questions.explanation: Piyush Goyal has set an ambitious target of achieving 10,000 Geographical Indication (GI) tags by 2030. Currently, India has 605 GI tags, with authorized users increasing from 365 to 29,000. To support this initiative, a committee will be formed to oversee the expansion of GI tags. Efforts include better branding, collaboration with FSSAI and BIS to combat counterfeit products, and engaging private sector players, e-commerce platforms, and embassies to promote GI products globally.

questions.question: Which state has signed MoUs for investments in the energy and space sectors, including a private rocket manufacturing unit?
questions.explanation: Telangana has signed MoUs for major investments in the energy and space sectors. The state partnered with Skyroot Aerospace to establish a ₹500 crore private rocket manufacturing unit, strengthening Hyderabad's position as a global hub for private space activity. Additionally, MEIL will invest ₹13,000 crore in three energy projects, including a 2,160 MW pumped storage plant. These initiatives are expected to generate approximately 4,000 jobs, showcasing Telangana's commitment to fostering innovation and economic growth.

questions.question: Which state’s transport corporation is set to launch the ‘Clean and Beautiful Bus Station Campaign’?
questions.explanation: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) is set to introduce the "Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray Clean, Beautiful Bus Station Campaign" to promote cleanliness at bus stations. Announced by Maharashtra transport minister Pratap Sarnaik, the year-long campaign will commence at the Kurla-Nehru Nagar bus station. This initiative reflects the state’s commitment to maintaining hygiene and enhancing the user experience at bus stations across Maharashtra.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the recently launched ‘Entity Locker’ by the Government of India?
questions.explanation: The Government of India launched Entity Locker, a secure, cloud-based platform for efficient business document management. It is developed by the National eGovernance Division under the Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology. Key features include Aadhaar-authenticated access, 10 GB encrypted storage, real-time integration with MCA, GSTN, DGFT, and legally valid digital signatures. This initiative aligns with the goals of Digital Public Infrastructure to improve the ease of doing business and ensure the secure handling of documents for enterprises.

questions.question: Who has recently been sworn in as the Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court?
questions.explanation: Justice Alok Aradhe has taken oath as the Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court, succeeding Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya. The oath ceremony was administered by Maharashtra Governor C. P. Radhakrishnan at Raj Bhavan in Mumbai. Justice Alok Aradhe previously served as the Chief Justice of Telangana High Court, bringing extensive judicial experience to his new role. This appointment underscores his significant contributions to the judiciary.

questions.question: Which company partnered with ESAF Small Finance Bank for tailored vehicle financing solutions?
questions.explanation: Ashok Leyland has entered into a partnership with ESAF Small Finance Bank to provide customized vehicle financing solutions. This collaboration aims to offer flexible loan options with tailored monthly repayment plans, making vehicle ownership more accessible for customers. ESAF Bank will also provide a range of comprehensive financial services to Ashok Leyland’s customers, strengthening the partnership's value proposition and enhancing customer convenience.

questions.question: Which platform has partnered with DPIIT to provide skilled manpower to startups?
questions.explanation: DPIIT has signed an MoU with Apna to support DPIIT-registered startups by offering skilled manpower. Through this partnership, each of the 7,00,000 entities on Bhaskar receives ₹2,000 in hiring credits on Apna, amounting to an initial value of ₹140 crore. These credits allow startups to post job openings and leverage Apna's AI-driven talent-matching tools. As the startup ecosystem expands, the initiative's potential worth could increase to ₹300 crore, helping startups efficiently recruit talent and grow their businesses.

questions.question: Which state’s governor reviewed the NIK-SHAY and TB Control Programme?
questions.explanation: The Governor of Manipur reviewed the NIK-SHAY and TB Control Programme to assess progress and strategies in tackling tuberculosis. During the meeting, Governor Bhalla emphasized the importance of technology-driven solutions and active community involvement in combating the disease. The state is participating in the 100-day TB campaign, part of the national effort to eradicate TB by 2025. Key measures include enhancing patient support, improving diagnostic tools, and introducing advanced treatments. Updates were also provided on the Pradhan Mantri TB Mukht Bharat Abhiyan by the State Health Minister.

questions.question: Which state launched the advanced disaster risk warning system ‘Kavacham’?
questions.explanation: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurated 'Kavacham,' an advanced disaster risk warning system in Thiruvananthapuram. Developed by the State Disaster Management Authority with support from the National Disaster Management Authority and the World Bank, this system aims to improve disaster preparedness. It includes 91 sirens installed across the state to issue timely warnings and ensure public safety. The initiative highlights the importance of proactive measures in mitigating disaster risks and protecting communities.

questions.question: In which city did the Army Hospital perform India’s first LVAD implantation using the HeartMate 3?
questions.explanation: The Army Hospital (Research & Referral), located in New Delhi, performed India’s first Left Ventricular Assist Device (LVAD) implantation using the HeartMate 3. This groundbreaking procedure was conducted on a 49-year-old woman with end-stage heart failure who had been awaiting a heart transplant for over two years. The HeartMate 3, often referred to as a "mechanical heart," is a critical innovation for supporting cardiac function in patients with severe heart conditions.

questions.question: What position did India hold in the Edelman Trust Barometer 2025 rankings?
questions.explanation: In the Edelman Trust Barometer 2025, India slipped to third place globally in terms of public trust in institutions such as government, businesses, media, and NGOs. Despite India’s score remaining unchanged, it lost its second position to Indonesia, which saw an increase in its score. The report highlighted significant disparities in trust levels across various income groups and nations, with China and Indonesia occupying the first and second spots, respectively.

questions.question: Which company signed an MoU to invest Rs 800 crore in a Telangana Unmanned Aerial Systems manufacturing plant?
questions.explanation: JSW Defence signed an MoU with the Telangana government to establish a Rs 800-crore manufacturing facility for Unmanned Aerial Systems. The unit will be developed in partnership with a US defence technology company. The agreement was formalized at the World Economic Forum in the presence of Telangana CM Revant Reddy and Parth Jindal of JSW Group, reflecting JSW’s commitment to advancing India’s defence manufacturing capabilities.

questions.question: Who recently became India's top-ranked chess player and 4th globally in the FIDE rankings?
questions.explanation: D Gukesh, at just 18 years old, became India's highest-ranked chess player, securing the 4th position globally in the FIDE rankings. He achieved this milestone by defeating Vincent Keymer in the Tata Steel Tournament. Gukesh has a rating of 2784 points, surpassing Arjun Erigaisi, who ranks 5th with 2779.5 points. This marks a significant achievement for Gukesh in the global chess arena.

questions.question: What is the name of India’s first AI and Emotional Intelligence-driven fashion forecasting platform launched by NIFT?
questions.explanation: VisionNxt is India’s first AI and Emotional Intelligence-driven fashion forecasting platform, launched at NIFT’s 40th Foundation Day in Hyderabad. Developed under the Ministry of Textiles, it aims to provide insights specific to Indian fashion trends. This initiative highlights the integration of advanced technology like AI with Emotional Intelligence to revolutionize fashion forecasting.

questions.question: Which country initiated its withdrawal from the World Health Organization (WHO) citing financial disparities and political influence concerns?
questions.explanation: The United States, under President Donald Trump, initiated its withdrawal from the World Health Organization (WHO) on January 20, 2025, citing mishandling of the COVID-19 pandemic, financial disparities, and political influence concerns. Additionally, the U.S. suspended all foreign aid for 90 days to reassess its distribution strategies. This decision is expected to have significant global implications, particularly on health initiatives funded by the U.S., such as combating HIV, tuberculosis, and malaria. The U.S. has been a major contributor to the WHO, providing 18% of its budget.

questions.question: In which city was India’s first CSIR Mega Innovation Complex inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The CSIR Mega Innovation Complex, India’s first facility of its kind, was inaugurated in Mumbai on January 17, 2025, by Union Minister Dr. Jitendra Singh. The complex aims to support start-ups, MSMEs, and industries by providing advanced infrastructure such as incubation labs, office spaces, and networking zones. Additionally, it promotes innovation, regulatory compliance, and technology transfers, facilitating collaboration between start-ups, researchers, and innovators. This initiative contributes to India’s vision of Atmanirbhar Bharat and aims to enhance growth in sectors like healthcare, chemicals, energy, and materials science.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the CEO and Executive Director of Reliance Power?
questions.explanation: Neeraj Parakh has been appointed as the CEO and Executive Director of Reliance Power, effective from January 20, 2025. With over 29 years of experience, Parakh has played a crucial role in leading major projects within the Reliance Group, particularly in thermal power and renewable energy ventures. He has been integral in executing large-scale projects like Yamuna Nagar and Sasan, contributing significantly to power generation. Parakh's leadership skills have been essential in driving technological advancements, vendor localization, and regulatory compliance within the company.

questions.question: Which state is set to host the first Olympic Research Conference as part of India’s ambition to host the 2036 Olympics?
questions.explanation: Gujarat will host the first Olympic Research Conference, a significant step in India’s ambition to host the 2036 Olympics. The event, organized by the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) in collaboration with the Union Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, will bring together experts and officials to discuss strategies for sustainable sports infrastructure, economic models, and global competitiveness. Key themes include sustainability, financing, gender equity, and learning from successful Olympic host cities. This four-day event plays a critical role in shaping India’s Olympic aspirations for 2036.

questions.question: Which organization will showcase the 'Raksha Kavach' theme on Republic Day?
questions.explanation: DRDO will showcase its tableau titled 'Raksha Kavach – Multi-layer Protection against Multi-domain Threats' on Republic Day. It highlights innovations like Quick Reaction Surface-to-Air Missiles, Satellite-Based Surveillance, and Advanced Artillery Systems. Key features include the Long Range Hypersonic Anti-Ship Missile, Divyastra, Light Tank Zorawar, and Light Weight Bullet Proof Jacket ‘ABHED.’ This reflects DRDO’s commitment to developing cutting-edge defence technologies for multi-domain protection.

questions.question: Which company unveiled India’s first eVTOL air taxi ‘Shunya’?
questions.explanation: Sarla Aviation, a Bengaluru-based aerospace startup, unveiled ‘Shunya,’ India’s first electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) air taxi. Designed for short trips of 20-30 km, it can carry six passengers at speeds up to 250 km/h. This prototype aims to address urban congestion and provide a sustainable alternative to ground transportation. Sarla Aviation also plans to launch ‘Shunya’ in Bengaluru by 2028, with future expansions to cities like Mumbai, Delhi, and Pune. Additionally, they have partnered with Sona SPEED to manufacture essential components for the eVTOL.

questions.question: Which state launched a Rs 10,000 annual aid scheme for landless agricultural labourers?
questions.explanation: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai launched a scheme providing Rs 10,000 annually to approximately 7.5 lakh landless agricultural labourers. This initiative fulfills a key pre-poll promise and aims to improve the financial stability of these labourers. The scheme is part of the government’s ongoing welfare measures, including other similar schemes like the Godhan Nyay Yojana and Rajiv Gandhi Kisan Nyay Yojana. This move reflects the government's commitment to uplifting vulnerable sections of society and enhancing their livelihoods.

questions.question: Which company launched strategic pilots with Indian startups to enhance its US supply chain and sourcing operations?
questions.explanation: Walmart launched strategic pilot programs with Indian startups to enhance its US supply chain and sourcing operations. The selected startups include KBCols Sciences from Pune, GreenPod Labs from Chennai, and Cropin from Bengaluru. This initiative focuses on leveraging innovative solutions to build a more resilient global supply network, showcasing Walmart’s commitment to fostering innovation and collaboration in its operations.

questions.question: Which city is home to INCOIS, the winner of the 2025 Subhash Chandra Bose Aapda Prabandhan Puraskar?
questions.explanation: The Indian National Centre for Ocean Information Services (INCOIS), located in Hyderabad, won the 2025 Subhash Chandra Bose Aapda Prabandhan Puraskar in the Institutional Category. Known for its excellence in disaster preparedness, INCOIS operates the Indian Tsunami Early Warning Centre and innovative tools like SARAT. Recognized by UNESCO as a leading Tsunami Service Provider, INCOIS plays a crucial role in ocean-based disaster management and mitigation.

questions.question: Which bank has partnered with RuPay to launch the FIRST EA₹N RuPay Credit Card?
questions.explanation: IDFC FIRST Bank has collaborated with RuPay to introduce the FIRST EA₹N RuPay Credit Card. This secured card combines the benefits of a fixed deposit with cashback rewards on UPI transactions. Users can earn cashback on UPI payments, with a minimum fixed deposit of ₹5,000, providing financial flexibility. The card also offers additional perks, including complimentary roadside assistance and personal accident cover, making it a convenient choice for users.

questions.question: Which company received in-principle approval from the RBI to operate as a Payment Aggregator-Cross Border entity?
questions.explanation: Skydo Technologies, a Bengaluru-based fintech firm, received in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to operate as a Payment Aggregator-Cross Border (PA-CB) entity. This approval allows Skydo to provide seamless and cost-effective cross-border payment solutions to Indian exporters. Skydo, which serves over 12,000 Indian exporters, is now poised to scale operations, expand its services globally, and diversify its offerings. The RBI's endorsement strengthens Skydo’s position in the competitive fintech industry and supports the international growth aspirations of Indian businesses.

questions.question: Which company won the 300 MW solar project from NHPC?
questions.explanation: NTPC Green Energy Limited (NGEL) has emerged as the winner of a 300 MW solar project from NHPC through a competitive bidding process conducted via an e-reverse auction. The bid was made by NTPC Renewable Energy Limited (NTPC REL), a subsidiary focused on renewable energy projects. This project is part of a broader 1200 MW solar initiative aimed at enhancing India’s renewable energy capacity. By leveraging the interstate transmission system (ISTS), the project will contribute significantly to the country's commitment to clean energy and meeting its sustainability goals. This milestone underlines NGEL's growing leadership in India's renewable energy sector.

questions.question: Which organization conducted the successful ground test of a scramjet engine for missiles?
questions.explanation: The DRDO successfully conducted a 120-second ground test of an active-cooled scramjet combustor, marking a significant advancement in hypersonic missile technology. Hypersonic missiles, capable of travelling at speeds greater than Mach 5, can evade modern air defences. The Defense Research and Development Laboratory (DRDL) is spearheading these efforts to develop next-generation hypersonic weapons. India joins nations like the US, Russia, and China in pushing the boundaries of advanced weaponry, positioning itself as a key player in this strategic defence sector.

questions.question: What is India’s projected share of global consumption by 2050?
questions.explanation: India’s share of global consumption is expected to increase from 9% in 2023 to 16% by 2050, making it the second-largest contributor after North America, which stands at 17%. This growth is attributed to India’s youthful and expanding population, coupled with rising incomes. Meanwhile, advanced economies are seeing declining fertility rates, shifting global demographic attention to regions like India.

questions.question: On which date is Uttar Pradesh Foundation Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh Foundation Day is celebrated annually on January 24. This tradition began in 2017, following the suggestion of then-Governor Ram Naik. The state observed its first foundation day in 2018, marking the transition of the United Provinces to Uttar Pradesh on January 24, 1950. This date signifies the state’s official recognition as part of India’s post-independence reorganization. The celebration honors the rich history and contributions of Uttar Pradesh to the nation.

questions.question: What is the name of the Battlefield Surveillance System launched by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to boost Army surveillance?
questions.explanation: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launched the Battlefield Surveillance System named SANJAY to strengthen the Indian Army's reconnaissance capabilities. This advanced system integrates data from both ground and aerial sensors, offering real-time surveillance and situational awareness to aid in strategic decision-making. Developed in collaboration with Bharat Electronics, SANJAY represents a significant step forward in modernizing India’s defence infrastructure and is planned for phased deployment by October 2025. The system underscores the importance of technology in enhancing national security.

questions.question: Which company launched the CyberEdge cyber insurance solution for Indian businesses?
questions.explanation: Tata AIG launched CyberEdge, a comprehensive cyber insurance solution aimed at protecting Indian businesses, particularly SMEs, from the growing threat of cyber risks. The product provides extensive coverage, including data recovery, legal fees, and business interruption losses. Tata AIG’s goal is to capture 25% of the cyber insurance market in the next five years. With cyberattacks on the rise in India, this initiative is timely, offering essential protection to businesses vulnerable to cyber threats, including small and medium enterprises that often lack strong cybersecurity measures.

questions.question: In which city has ACKO Insurance launched its e-challan portal to simplify traffic checks?
questions.explanation: ACKO Insurance has launched an e-challan portal in Hyderabad to simplify traffic checks and enhance convenience for residents. This platform allows users to access their traffic violation history and pay fines effortlessly. The initiative leverages technology to streamline urban daily tasks, particularly addressing the challenges of increasing traffic in cities. By offering an easy way to stay updated on road safety laws and manage challans, the portal is set to improve the overall customer experience and encourage better compliance with traffic regulations.

questions.question: On which date is National Girl Child Day observed in India?
questions.explanation: National Girl Child Day is observed annually on January 24 in India to raise awareness about the issues faced by girls and to promote their rights and welfare. Initiated in 2008 by the Ministry of Women and Child Development, this day emphasizes the importance of gender equality, the education of girls, and the eradication of harmful practices such as child marriage. It also coincides with the day Indira Gandhi assumed office, symbolizing progress in women's empowerment and the ongoing fight for gender equality in India.

questions.question: Where did the 5th Khelo India Winter Games begin?
questions.explanation: The 5th Khelo India Winter Games commenced in Ladakh at Leh’s NDS Ice Hockey Stadium. This event saw participation from over 400 athletes across India in sports such as ice hockey and ice skating. The opening ceremony featured cultural performances, including Jabro by the changpas, and even foreign visitors participated in the celebrations.

questions.question: In which city is the Kidwai Memorial Institute of Oncology located, which recently achieved the milestone of 1,000 robotic surgeries?
questions.explanation: The Kidwai Memorial Institute of Oncology, located in Bengaluru, has completed 1,000 robotic surgeries, marking a significant milestone. It is the first government hospital to adopt the advanced Da Vinci robotic surgical system. The hospital is also notable for its extensive inpatient care and for providing the highest number of treatments under the Ayushman Bharat Arogya Karnataka scheme.

questions.question: What position did India secure in the Global Firepower Index 2025?
questions.explanation: India ranks 4th in the Global Firepower Index 2025, maintaining its strong military position globally. This ranking is based on over 60 parameters, including manpower, resources, and geography, reflecting India’s significant military capabilities. India’s score is 0.1184, just behind the United States, Russia, and China. The Global Firepower Index evaluates the military strength of 145 countries, and India's consistent position in the top ranks showcases its military prowess.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Education observed?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Education is celebrated annually on January 24, recognizing the crucial role of education in fostering peace and sustainable development. Established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2018, the day promotes a global commitment to achieving inclusive and quality education for all. The theme for 2025, "AI and Education: Preserving Human Agency in a World of Automation," highlights the transformative potential of AI in education, while emphasizing the need to maintain human agency in this evolving technological landscape. The day serves as a call to action for global educational challenges and reforms.

questions.question: On which date is National Voters’ Day celebrated in India?
questions.explanation: National Voters’ Day is celebrated annually on January 25, a day before Republic Day. The 15th edition of the event highlights the theme “Nothing Like Voting, I Vote for Sure.” It recognizes the growing strength of India’s electoral rolls, which now stand at 99.1 crore voters. This year, President Droupadi Murmu will present the Best Electoral Practices Awards, while a docu-drama series and new publications on the 2024 elections will also be launched to mark the occasion. The day emphasizes the importance of voting in a democracy and encourages greater participation.

questions.question: Which company is a bronze sponsor for the 38th National Games in Uttarakhand?
questions.explanation: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) is the bronze sponsor for the 38th National Games, which will be hosted in Uttarakhand for the first time. The event features "Mouli," the mascot inspired by the Monal, Uttarakhand's state bird, and the tagline "Sankalp Se Shikhar Tak," symbolizing a journey from resolution to achievement. The sponsorship highlights Indian Oil's commitment to promoting sports and national events in India.

questions.question: Which state launched the ‘Samman Sanjeevani’ app to track benefits under the ‘Mahila Evam Kishori Samman Yojana’?
questions.explanation: Haryana introduced the ‘Samman Sanjeevani’ app to enhance the delivery of benefits under the ‘Mahila Evam Kishori Samman Yojana,’ focusing on BPL women and girls aged 10-45 years. The app ensures the monthly distribution of sanitary napkins via Anganwadi centres and schools while maintaining updated beneficiary data. Launched by WCD Minister Shruti Choudhry, this initiative aligns with the state’s commitment to women’s health and empowerment, coinciding with the 10th anniversary of the ‘Beti Bachao Beti Padhao’ campaign.

questions.question: Which country recently joined the Eurodrone (MALE RPAS) programme as an observer?
questions.explanation: India has joined the Eurodrone (MALE RPAS) programme as an observer, marking a significant step in international defence cooperation. This €7.1 billion initiative, led by Airbus Defence and Space and managed by OCCAR, focuses on various advanced capabilities like intelligence, surveillance, target acquisition, and reconnaissance (ISTAR). With payload capabilities of up to 2.3 tonnes and endurance of 40 hours, Eurodrone aims to bolster maritime surveillance, anti-submarine warfare, and early warning systems.

questions.question: In which city will Reliance Industries build the world’s largest data centre?
questions.explanation: Reliance Industries has announced plans to build the world’s largest data centre in Jamnagar, Gujarat. This massive project will have a capacity of one gigawatt and will play a key role in advancing India’s digital transformation, especially in artificial intelligence (AI). With strategic partnerships, including one with NVIDIA for Blackwell AI processors, the data centre will become a pivotal hub for AI, machine learning, and data processing. This ambitious initiative aligns with India’s goal of becoming a leader in digital infrastructure and AI capabilities.

questions.question: Which country hosted the 1st International Pashmina Festival?
questions.explanation: Nepal hosted the 1st International Pashmina Festival, a 3-day event featuring over 150 stalls and promoting its "Chyangra Pashmina," known for its traditional craftsmanship and use of natural dyes. Nepali Pashmina holds a prominent position in global markets such as the US, Japan, and Europe. The festival aims to address challenges like raw material shortages through policy reforms. While India also produces high-quality Pashmina in regions like Ladakh and Kashmir, the market faces competition from blended and cheaper alternatives.

questions.question: Which state topped the inaugural Fiscal Health Index (FHI) 2025 launched by NITI Aayog?
questions.explanation: Odisha secured the top position in the Fiscal Health Index (FHI) 2025, launched by NITI Aayog to evaluate the fiscal health of 18 major Indian states. The index assesses states on five sub-indices: Quality of Expenditure, Revenue Mobilisation, Fiscal Prudence, Debt Index, and Debt Sustainability. Odisha achieved a composite score of 67.8, outperforming other states like Chhattisgarh (55.2) and Goa (53.6). This ranking underscores Odisha's strong fiscal management and prudent financial policies.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the Chairman of Bharti AXA Life Insurance in June 2024?
questions.explanation: In June 2024, Akhil Gupta, Vice Chairman of Bharti Enterprises, was appointed as the Chairman of Bharti AXA Life Insurance. Gupta brings over 40 years of experience, having played a pivotal role in Bharti Airtel's growth and forging strategic partnerships with leading investors such as Warburg Pincus, Temasek, and Sequoia Capital. His leadership has been instrumental in Bharti Enterprises' expansion, including overseeing public listings and joint ventures, cementing his reputation as a key figure in corporate governance and strategy.

questions.question: Which state has approved funding for 100 villages under the Forest Right Act for forest management and protection?
questions.explanation: Odisha has taken a significant step by allocating ₹16 crore for forest management and protection in 100 villages under the Forest Right Act. The funds will be directly managed by gram sabhas, reflecting a shift from the Forest Department to community-based management. This initiative is part of a broader plan to implement Community Forest Resource plans across 400 villages, showcasing Odisha’s commitment to sustainable forest governance.

questions.question: On which date is Himachal Pradesh Statehood Day celebrated each year?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh celebrates its Statehood Day annually on January 25, marking its transition to India’s 18th state in 1971. This day symbolizes the state's historical journey from being a Chief Commissioner's province in 1948 to attaining full statehood. It is a moment of pride and reflection for the residents of Himachal Pradesh, recognizing their state's progress and development over the years.

questions.question: What is the top speed of the high-speed rail connecting Abu Dhabi and Dubai?
questions.explanation: The high-speed rail connecting Abu Dhabi and Dubai, announced by Etihad Rail, will operate at a top speed of 350 km/h, reducing travel time between the cities to just 30 minutes. This project is expected to boost the UAE's GDP by Dh145 billion over 50 years. The rail system will feature four passenger stations in Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Sharjah, and Fujairah, integrating with existing metro and bus networks. With premium amenities inspired by Emirati heritage, the project reflects the UAE's commitment to modernizing transportation infrastructure.

questions.question: In which city was Telangana's first 24-hour drinking water supply project launched?
questions.explanation: Telangana’s first 24-hour drinking water supply project was launched in Karimnagar Smart City. Inaugurated by Union Minister Manohar Lal, the project cost ₹18 crore and included 6,000 water connections across 5 divisions. Karimnagar also saw the inauguration of a ₹12.35 crore multipurpose building and a ₹22 crore sports school complex, showcasing significant investments in urban infrastructure and development.

questions.question: Which country recently benefited from the Indian Navy's hydrographic survey of 25,000 square nautical miles?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy conducted a hydrographic survey of Mauritius’ waters, mapping 25,000 square nautical miles. This survey, carried out by INS Sarvekshak, provided nautical charts to enhance Mauritius' maritime infrastructure and coastal resource management. The initiative reflects the strong India-Mauritius partnership and aligns with India’s SAGAR (Security and Growth for All in the Region) policy, which emphasizes regional cooperation in maritime security and development. This survey strengthens Mauritius’ maritime capabilities and reinforces India’s role in supporting Indian Ocean littoral states.

questions.question: Which country became the first Southeast Asian nation to legalize same-sex marriage?
questions.explanation: Thailand made history on January 23, 2025, by becoming the first Southeast Asian nation to legalize same-sex marriage. The Marriage Equality Act, passed in 2024 and ratified later that year, grants LGBTQ+ couples equal legal rights, including adoption, inheritance, and medical decisions. This landmark decision reflects a growing acceptance of LGBTQ+ rights in Thai society. The law’s enactment was celebrated nationwide, with over 1,800 couples registering their unions on the first day, showcasing the societal significance of this progressive milestone.

questions.question: On which date is National Tourism Day celebrated annually in India?
questions.explanation: National Tourism Day is observed every year on January 25 to promote responsible, sustainable, and accessible tourism across India. The day celebrates India’s diverse cultural heritage, natural landscapes, and tourist destinations. It also highlights tourism's role as a key driver of economic growth, cultural exchange, and sustainable development. National Tourism Day emphasizes the importance of preserving India’s cultural and natural assets while promoting inclusivity and eco-friendly tourism practices.

questions.question: Which company’s bid cleared the technical evaluation for the P-75I submarine project in collaboration with TKMS of Germany?
questions.explanation: The bid from Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited (MDL), in collaboration with Germany’s Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems (TKMS), cleared the technical evaluation for the ₹43,000 crore P-75I submarine project. The project involves the acquisition of six advanced conventional submarines with a focus on indigenous content and technological upgrades. MDL-TKMS’s offering is based on the Class 214 submarine design, known for its operational success and proven Air Independent Propulsion (AIP) module, a key criterion for qualification. With commercial negotiations set to begin, this bid emphasizes the importance of indigenization in India’s defence capabilities.

questions.question: What was the theme for Republic Day 2025?
questions.explanation: The theme for Republic Day 2025 was ‘Swarnim Bharat: Virasat aur Vikas’, which translates to ‘Golden India: Heritage and Progress’. This theme highlighted India’s rich cultural heritage while emphasizing its strides in development and progress. The celebration also featured Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto as the Chief Guest, symbolizing India’s commitment to fostering international relations.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the brand ambassador for the 25th anniversary edition of FICCI Frames?
questions.explanation: Bollywood actor Ayushmann Khurrana has been appointed as the brand ambassador for the 25th-anniversary edition of FICCI Frames, India’s premier global media and entertainment convention. This marks a significant milestone for the event, and Ayushmann expressed his honour and commitment to promoting the theme “RISE: Redefining Innovation, Sustainability, and Excellence” to celebrate and propel the media and entertainment industry’s contributions globally.

questions.question: Which institution led the study on climate change's impact on dengue outbreaks and proposed an early warning system?
questions.explanation: The Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM), Pune, conducted a study on how climate change affects dengue outbreaks. The study identified key climate factors like rainfall, temperature, and humidity as contributors to mosquito prevalence. IITM also developed an early warning system using AI and machine learning, enabling dengue outbreak predictions two months in advance. This predictive system helps authorities implement timely preventive measures, highlighting IITM’s role in combining climate research with public health solutions.

questions.question: Which rocket is set to launch the NVS-02 satellite as part of ISRO’s 100th mission from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre?
questions.explanation: ISRO’s 100th mission from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre will launch the GSLV–F15 rocket on January 29, 2025. The GSLV–F15, equipped with an indigenous cryogenic upper stage, is designed to place satellites in a Geosynchronous Transfer Orbit (GTO). This mission will deploy the NVS-02 satellite, part of the NavIC initiative, India’s independent regional navigation system. The mission demonstrates India’s strategic autonomy in space technology, showcasing advanced satellite and launch vehicle capabilities while contributing to sectors like defence, disaster management, and civil navigation.

questions.question: Which Indian state recorded over 800 farmer suicides in 2024?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra recorded the highest number of farmer suicides in 2022, accounting for 38% of the total farmer suicides in India. The state's Marathwada region has been particularly affected, with over 800 farmer suicides recorded in 2024 alone. The crisis is attributed to a combination of factors, including debt, weather extremes, and regional disparity.

questions.question: Where is the Bankapur Wolf Sanctuary, the first wolf sanctuary in the state, located?
questions.explanation: The Bankapur Wolf Sanctuary is located in Karnataka and is the state’s first wolf sanctuary. Spanning 332 hectares, it provides a protected habitat for the Indian grey wolf, an endangered species under the IUCN and Schedule I of the Wildlife Protection Act, of 1972. The sanctuary features scrub forests, hills, and caves suitable for wolves, and it also supports diverse wildlife, including leopards and blackbucks. As India’s second dedicated wolf sanctuary, it plays a crucial role in conserving these apex predators in semi-arid and grassland ecosystems, addressing their declining population of 2,000–3,000 individuals.

questions.question: Which bank became the first in India to adopt Clari5’s NCRP Integration Solution for real-time fraud prevention?
questions.explanation: Punjab National Bank (PNB) became the first Indian bank to implement Clari5’s NCRP Integration Solution, enabling real-time fraud prevention and efficient complaint management. This innovative solution offers features such as real-time lien marking, debit freeze, and dynamic dashboards, ensuring enhanced security across various banking channels. Additionally, it supports emerging technologies like Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs), setting a benchmark for the banking industry to adopt more advanced fraud prevention measures.

questions.question: When is the International Day of Clean Energy observed?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Clean Energy is observed on January 26 each year, established by the UN in 2009. The day emphasizes the importance of clean energy access and the efforts led by the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) in driving global energy transitions and innovations. With over 685 million people lacking electricity and 1.8 billion projected to use unsafe cooking methods by 2030, this day draws attention to the urgent need for sustainable energy solutions worldwide.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as India’s new Ambassador to Israel in January 2025?
questions.explanation: Senior Diplomat Jitender Pal Singh, an Indian Foreign Service officer from the 2002 batch, was appointed as India’s Ambassador to Israel on January 24, 2025. Singh has extensive experience in managing sensitive diplomatic roles, including serving as Deputy High Commissioner to Pakistan and leading the Pakistan-Afghanistan-Iran division. His appointment comes during Israel's post-conflict recovery phase and emphasizes strengthening India’s strategic and technological ties with Israel. He succeeds Sanjeev Kumar Singla, who has taken up the role of India’s Ambassador to France.

questions.question: Who won gold in the women’s 60m indoor hurdles at the Meeting de Nantes Metropole 2025?
questions.explanation: Jyothi Yarraji secured gold in the women’s 60m indoor hurdles at the Meeting de Nantes Métropole 2025, achieving a remarkable time of 8.04 seconds and breaking her own national record of 8.12 seconds set at the 2024 Asian Indoor Championships. This achievement highlights her consistent performance and exceptional talent in athletics. Meanwhile, Tejas Shirse also made headlines by setting a new national record in the men's 60m hurdles in Luxembourg, clocking 7.65 seconds.

questions.question: Who won the 9th Johor International Open Chess Tournament in 2025?
questions.explanation: Indian Grandmaster Iniyan Panneerselvam claimed the 9th Johor International Open Chess Tournament title in Malaysia with a dominant performance, scoring 8.5 points across nine rounds. The 22-year-old from Erode, Tamil Nadu, finished 1.5 points ahead of his closest rival, securing the title even before the final round. His victory included defeating notable players, such as 4 International Masters and 1 Grandmaster. Iniyan’s triumph further highlights his remarkable talent, adding to his earlier success at the Chennai Open in January 2025.

questions.question: Who won the men’s singles title at the 2025 Australian Open?
questions.explanation: Jannik Sinner emerged victorious in the men’s singles category at the 2025 Australian Open, which took place at Melbourne Park from January 12 to 26. This prestigious Grand Slam marked its 113th edition, showcasing world-class tennis talent. Alongside Sinner’s triumph, Madison Keys won the women’s singles title, while Harri Heliövaara and Henry Patten secured the men’s doubles championship. The tournament highlighted exceptional performances across all categories, solidifying its reputation as one of tennis's most celebrated events.

questions.question: When is International Customs Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: International Customs Day is observed annually on January 26 to honour customs officials and agencies for their significant role in ensuring the smooth and secure transit of goods across borders. The World Customs Organization (WCO) commemorates this day to highlight the importance of customs in global trade and security. In 2025, the theme for the day is “Customs Delivering on its Commitment to Efficiency, Security, and Prosperity.” This celebration underscores the vital contributions of customs to global economic development.

questions.question: Who was the renowned cardiac surgeon who performed India’s first coronary bypass and heart-lung transplant?
questions.explanation: Dr. K.M. Cherian, a pioneering cardiac surgeon, passed away on January 25, 2025, in Bengaluru. He was celebrated for performing India’s first coronary bypass and heart-lung transplant. He also founded the Frontier Lifeline Hospital and Frontier Mediville, which were dedicated to advanced cardiac research and treatment. His contributions to the medical field were immense, and his autobiography, Just an Instrument, was released shortly before his passing, providing a glimpse into his extraordinary life and career.

questions.question: When is International Holocaust Remembrance Day observed?
questions.explanation: International Holocaust Remembrance Day is observed on January 27 each year to honour the victims of the Holocaust and commemorate the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau by Soviet troops on this date in 1945. Proclaimed by the United Nations in 2005, the day also serves to promote awareness and counter antisemitism and intolerance worldwide. The 2025 observance marks the 80th anniversary of Auschwitz's liberation, with UNESCO organizing global educational events starting on January 23.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the Director of ISRO's Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC) in January 2025?
questions.explanation: M. Mohan was appointed as the Director of ISRO's Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC) in Thiruvananthapuram on January 25, 2025. He succeeded Dr. V. Narayanan, who became the ISRO Chairman earlier that month. M. Mohan has been an integral part of ISRO's propulsion initiatives and his expertise in liquid propulsion systems has played a significant role in advancing India's space capabilities. The LPSC has been central to the development of liquid propulsion stages for India’s launch vehicles and spacecraft, contributing to key missions like PSLV, GSLV, Chandrayaan, and Mangalyaan.

questions.question: Which team won the inaugural Women’s Hockey India League title?
questions.explanation: Odisha Warriors emerged victorious in the inaugural Women’s Hockey India League (HIL), defeating JSW Soorma Hockey Club 2-1 in the final held in Ranchi. The tournament highlighted exceptional performances, with Yibbi Jansen of Odisha Warriors being one of the top scorers. Other notable players included Jyoti (Player of the Tournament) and Savita Punia (Best Goalkeeper), both from JSW Soorma Hockey Club. Odisha’s victory signifies their outstanding teamwork and determination in the competition.

questions.question: When is National Geographic Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: National Geographic Day is celebrated every year on January 27 to honour the foundation of the National Geographic Society, which was established on this date in 1888. The day commemorates the organization's significant contributions to science, exploration, and environmental conservation. National Geographic has inspired generations with its stunning photography, research, and educational initiatives. The day serves as a reminder of society’s commitment to preserving the planet and promoting curiosity about Earth, nature, and humanity.

questions.question: Which state launched four beneficiary schemes, including Rythu Bharosa and Indiramma Atmiya Bharosa?
questions.explanation: The Telangana government introduced four major beneficiary schemes: Rythu Bharosa, Indiramma Atmiya Bharosa, Indiramma Indlu, and New Ration Cards. These schemes aim to support farmers, farm labourers, and the homeless poor, benefiting over 6.15 lakh citizens. The government allocated more than ₹570 crore through BDT for financial assistance. Implemented across 561 villages in all mandals of Telangana, these initiatives reflect the state's commitment to social welfare and economic upliftment.

questions.question: Which state/Union Territory emerged as the winner of the 5th Khelo India Winter Games 2025?
questions.explanation: The Union Territory of Ladakh emerged as the overall winner of the 5th Khelo India Winter Games 2025, securing a total of seven medals, including four golds. Tamil Nadu followed in second place with five medals, including three golds, while Maharashtra secured the highest number of medals (10) but finished third due to having only two golds. The event featured over 400 athletes, highlighting Ladakh’s growing significance as a winter sports destination in India.

questions.question: Who has been reappointed as the MD & CEO of IDBI Bank for a three-year term starting March 19, 2025?
questions.explanation: Rakesh Sharma has been reappointed as the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer (MD & CEO) of IDBI Bank for a three-year term starting March 19, 2025, following approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). He has played a crucial role in improving the bank’s financial performance, leading it out of the Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework in 2021. Sharma has extensive experience in the banking sector, having previously served as MD & CEO of Canara Bank and held leadership roles at Lakshmi Vilas Bank and the State Bank of India (SBI). His reappointment aims to ensure stability and continued growth for IDBI Bank.

questions.question: Which city hosted the inaugural International Pashmina Festival?
questions.explanation: Kathmandu, the capital of Nepal, hosted the inaugural International Pashmina Festival, organized by the Nepal Pashmina Industries Association and the Confederation of Nepalese Industries. The festival, held over three days, showcased over 150 domestic stalls, with 40 dedicated to pure Nepali Pashmina. The event highlighted the traditional craftsmanship behind the iconic Pashmina fabric, especially the superior quality "Chyangra Pashmina." It also underscored Nepal's global recognition as a leading producer of this exquisite, hand-woven textile made from the undercoat of Chyangra goats.

questions.question: Who won a seventh term as President of Belarus in a controversial election?
questions.explanation: Alexander Lukashenko has been re-elected as the President of Belarus for a seventh term, securing nearly 87% of the vote in an election widely condemned as fraudulent. Opposition candidate Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya received only about 3%, and many opposition figures were either exiled or imprisoned. Western nations, including the European Union and the United States, rejected the election results, citing human rights violations and suppression of political dissent. Meanwhile, Russia and China extended their support to Lukashenko, reinforcing his long-standing authoritarian rule in Belarus.

questions.question: Which AI startup recently surpassed ChatGPT on the U.S. App Store?
questions.explanation: DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup founded in 2023, has recently surpassed OpenAI's ChatGPT as the most downloaded free app in the U.S. on Apple’s App Store. The company gained recognition with its advanced AI models, particularly the R1 reasoning model, which rivals OpenAI’s technology. Despite challenges like cybersecurity threats and regulatory scrutiny, DeepSeek has managed to achieve success due to its innovative approach and relatively low development costs, growing out of the AI research unit of High-Flyer, a quantitative hedge fund.

questions.question: Which country is set to launch its first human-operated underwater submersible as part of the Deep Ocean Mission?
questions.explanation: India is preparing to launch its first human-operated underwater submersible as part of the Deep Ocean Mission. The submersible is initially designed to reach depths of up to 500 meters, with plans to extend its capability to 6,000 meters by the following year. This mission is significant for India’s advancement in marine exploration, resource identification, and the development of marine and space technologies. It aligns with the country’s broader goals of enhancing scientific knowledge, exploring new marine biodiversity, and contributing to sustainable development through its blue economy.

questions.question: Which organization was honoured for its voter awareness campaign during the 2024 Lok Sabha Elections?
questions.explanation: Doordarshan, India’s national broadcaster, was recognized for its exceptional voter awareness and education campaign during the 2024 Lok Sabha Elections. The award was given in the Electronic Media category, specifically for its special series “Chunav Ka Parv Desh Ka Garv”. This initiative played a key role in educating voters, particularly first-time voters, and strengthening India’s democratic process. The award was presented by President Droupadi Murmu to Doordarshan’s Director-General Kanchan Prasad on Republic Day 2025, highlighting the broadcaster's commitment to responsible media outreach across the country.

questions.question: Which platform is renaming the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America for US users?
questions.explanation: Google Maps is implementing a change where the Gulf of Mexico will be renamed as the Gulf of America for users in the United States. This update aligns with modifications in the U.S. Geographic Names System, as previously directed by former President Donald Trump. However, the name remains unchanged for users outside the U.S., including Mexico. Google Maps has a history of using different naming conventions for disputed locations, such as "Sea of Japan (East Sea)" and "Persian Gulf (Arabian Gulf)," to accommodate regional perspectives.

questions.question: Which city has recently witnessed a surge in Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS) cases?
questions.explanation: Pune, Maharashtra, has recently reported a sudden increase in cases of Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS), a rare but serious neurological disorder. This condition occurs when the body's immune system mistakenly attacks the peripheral nervous system, leading to muscle weakness, numbness, and, in severe cases, paralysis. The exact cause of GBS remains unknown, but it is often triggered by infections, vaccinations, or major surgeries. Given the rising cases, health authorities in Pune are actively investigating the situation and implementing necessary measures to manage and control its impact.

questions.question: Where will the Prime Minister inaugurate the ‘Utkarsh Odisha, Make-in-Odisha Conclave’?
questions.explanation: The ‘Utkarsh Odisha, Make-in-Odisha Conclave’ is a flagship Global Investment Summit hosted by the Odisha government. It aims to establish Odisha as a leading industrial hub and investment destination in India. The event will take place at Janata Maidan in Bhubaneswar, which is the capital of Odisha and a key centre for economic and industrial activities in the state. The conclave aligns with the Purvodaya vision, emphasizing the growth of eastern India as a major economic powerhouse.

questions.question: Which two Indian cities have joined the Global Wetland Cities list?
questions.explanation: Indore and Udaipur have been recognized as part of the Global Wetland Cities list, an exclusive group of 31 cities worldwide that integrate wetland conservation into their urban planning. Indore, known for its cleanliness, is home to Sirpur Lake, which is designated as a Ramsar site. Udaipur, famous as the "City of Lakes," has several significant wetlands, including Pichola, Fateh Sagar, Rang Sagar, Swaroop Sagar, and Doodh Talai. Their inclusion highlights efforts toward sustainable urban development and wetland preservation.

questions.question: Which country has declared 2025 as the ‘Year of Community’?
questions.explanation: UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan has declared 2025 as the ‘Year of Community’ under the slogan “Hand in Hand.” This initiative aims to promote unity, inclusion, and social cohesion within the country. It emphasizes shared responsibility and sustainable growth by encouraging community service and cultural diversity. Through various programs and initiatives, the UAE seeks to strengthen social bonds and foster a spirit of collaboration among its residents.

questions.question: Which satellite will be deployed by ISRO’s 100th GSLV rocket launch on January 29?
questions.explanation: ISRO is set to launch its 100th GSLV rocket, GSLV-F15, from Sriharikota on January 29 at 6:23 am. This mission will deploy the NVS-02 satellite, which is part of the second-generation NavIC (Navigation with Indian Constellation) system. NVS-02 features L1 band support and weighs 2,250 kg, contributing to enhanced accuracy and reliability of India’s indigenous navigation system. This launch marks a significant milestone for ISRO, reinforcing India's advancements in space technology and satellite-based navigation capabilities.

questions.question: Which company is partnering with SBI Payments to enhance digital commerce in India?
questions.explanation: Pine Labs has deepened its partnership with SBI Payments to accelerate the adoption of digital commerce across India. The two companies, with a 12-year-long relationship, aim to enhance merchant solutions, provide seamless payment experiences, and promote financial inclusion. Their collaboration will focus on improving business productivity and offering diverse payment methods. By integrating SBI Payments' extensive network with Pine Labs' advanced technology, the partnership seeks to improve consumer experiences, drive digital payment adoption, and bridge the gap between urban and rural India for better financial access.

questions.question: Which country signed a protocol with India to amend the Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA)?
questions.explanation: India and Oman have signed a protocol to amend the Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA), ensuring alignment with international cross-border taxation standards and simplifying tax procedures. This agreement aims to enhance economic cooperation and prevent tax evasion between the two nations. Additionally, both countries have agreed to accelerate negotiations for an early signing of a proposed Free Trade Agreement, further strengthening bilateral trade relations. Oman, with its capital in Muscat and currency as the Omani Rial, continues to be a key economic partner for India in the Gulf region.

questions.question: Which northeastern state became the first to partner with Bhashini for multilingual e-governance?
questions.explanation: Tripura became the first northeastern state to sign an MoU with the Digital India Bhashini Division under MeitY to enhance multilingual e-governance. Led by Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha, this initiative integrates AI-driven real-time translation and speech technologies supporting 22 Indian languages. The partnership aims to bridge linguistic and digital divides, improving accessibility for rural and tribal communities. By incorporating Bhashini into its governance systems, Tripura is taking a significant step toward inclusive digital governance and ensuring better communication between citizens and the administration.

questions.question: Which country signed five MoUs with India to strengthen bilateral ties in January 2025?
questions.explanation: In January 2025, India and Indonesia signed five Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) to strengthen their bilateral ties. These agreements cover diverse areas including health, maritime security, traditional medicine, digital development, and cultural exchange. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto visited India from January 23 to 26, 2025, marking his first visit since taking office. This partnership emphasizes cooperation between the two countries in several crucial sectors, aiming to enhance both nations' strategic and cultural relationships, with a particular focus on health, security, and digital growth.

questions.question: Which Indian institution ranked 99th in computer science in THE World Rankings 2025, becoming the first Indian institution to enter the global top 100 for this subject?
questions.explanation: IISc Bengaluru achieved a historic milestone by securing the 99th position in computer science in THE World Rankings 2025. This marks the first time an Indian institution has entered the global top 100 for this subject. The ranking highlights India's growing presence in the field of computer science, with 53 Indian universities ranked, up from 47 in the previous year. While global leaders like Oxford, Cambridge, and MIT continue to dominate the rankings, IISc Bengaluru's achievement is a significant step forward for Indian higher education on the international stage.

questions.question: Which country has developed a seabed radar capable of tracking high-altitude aircraft from underwater depths?
questions.explanation: China has developed an advanced seabed radar that can detect aircraft flying at altitudes of up to 5,000 meters from a depth of 1,000 meters. This breakthrough enhances submarine capabilities, allowing them to track aerial targets more effectively and potentially shifting their role from passive observers to active hunters in naval warfare. Unlike conventional radar systems, this technology uses sophisticated acoustic sensors to counteract distortions caused by seawater layers and turbulence. Such advancements could significantly impact modern naval strategy by improving underwater surveillance and threat detection capabilities.

questions.question: On which date is Indian Newspaper Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: Indian Newspaper Day is observed every year on January 29 to commemorate the introduction of the first newspaper in India, Hicky’s Bengal Gazette, in 1780 by James Augustus Hicky. Also known as the Calcutta General Advertiser, this publication marked the beginning of journalism in India. Despite facing challenges and being shut down in 1782 due to its criticism of the British administration, its legacy remains significant. Indian Newspaper Day serves as a reminder of the crucial role newspapers play in shaping public discourse, promoting freedom of expression, and keeping citizens informed.

questions.question: Which organization has launched the IFTV platform nationwide in partnership with Skypro and PlayboxTV?
questions.explanation: BSNL has launched the IFTV platform across India, offering over 550 live TV channels and premium OTT apps in collaboration with Skypro and PlayboxTV. This initiative aims to enhance digital entertainment accessibility for both urban and rural users. Skypro handles content delivery, while PlayboxTV curates high-quality entertainment. With a strong base of over 4 million FTTH users, BSNL now provides premium TV and OTT services at no extra cost, strengthening its position in the telecom and digital content sectors. This move aligns with BSNL’s goal of expanding its broadband and multimedia offerings nationwide.

questions.question: Which country won the ICC Women’s Championship Trophy for the third consecutive time?
questions.explanation: Australia secured the ICC Women’s Championship Trophy for the third straight time, reaffirming its dominance in women's cricket. The team finished at the top of the 10-team competition with 39 points from 24 matches. Captain Alyssa Healy received the trophy in Melbourne from Cricket Australia Chair and ICC Director Mike Baird. The ICC Women’s Championship, introduced in 2014, plays a vital role in promoting women's cricket by ensuring regular bilateral series and serving as a qualification pathway for the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025. Australia's consistency and excellence continue to set the benchmark in the sport.

questions.question: Which city has been announced as the second capital of Assam?
questions.explanation: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced Dibrugarh as the state's second capital during the Republic Day celebrations.
