This marks a significant milestone in the development of the VSHORADS system, which is designed to neutralize aerial threats, including drones, flying at very low altitudes and high speeds. The successful trials demonstrate the system's capabilities and its potential to enhance India's air defence capabilities.

questions.question: In which city did the U.S. Air Force C-17 Globemaster aircraft land with Indian deportees?
questions.explanation: The U.S. Air Force C-17 Globemaster aircraft landed in Amritsar, carrying around 100 Indian nationals deported from the United States for illegal immigration. This was notable because the deportation was conducted using a military transport aircraft instead of commercial repatriation flights. The Punjab Police took charge of the deportees upon arrival, and many of them were from districts like Hoshiarpur, Gurdaspur, Jalandhar, and Kapurthala. This event highlights the U.S.’s strict immigration policies and the ongoing collaboration between India and the U.S. in handling illegal migration cases.

questions.question: Until which year has the Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) been extended?
questions.explanation: The Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) was launched in 2019 to provide tap water to every rural household by 2024. Initially, only 17% of rural households had tap water connections, but as of 2024, the coverage increased to 80%. To ensure complete access and sustainable infrastructure, the mission has been extended until 2028. This extension focuses on improving service delivery, public participation, and maintenance of rural water supply systems. JJM is expected to bring significant health benefits, save time for rural households, and contribute to a reduction in child mortality through access to safe drinking water.

questions.question: Which country won the ICC Under-19 Women’s T20 World Cup 2025?
questions.explanation: India emerged as the champion of the ICC Under-19 Women’s T20 World Cup 2025, defeating South Africa in the final held in Malaysia. This victory marks India’s second title in the tournament's history, following their maiden win in 2023 against England. The ICC Under-19 Women’s T20 World Cup is a prestigious international competition that features national teams competing in the T20 format. Governed by the ICC, the tournament plays a vital role in nurturing young cricketing talent. The win further establishes India's dominance in women's cricket at the junior level.

questions.question: By how many basis points did the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut the repo rate?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points (bps), bringing it down to 6.25%. This marks the first rate cut in 57 months, reflecting a shift in the RBI’s policy stance after a series of rate hikes since 2022. The move is aimed at supporting economic growth while keeping inflation in check. A lower repo rate typically results in reduced borrowing costs for businesses and consumers, stimulating demand in key sectors such as housing and automobiles. Despite the cut, the RBI remains cautious due to global uncertainties and inflation risks.

questions.question: Which country participated with India in the 3rd India-Japan Steel Dialogue held in New Delhi?
questions.explanation: The 3rd India-Japan Steel Dialogue took place in New Delhi as part of the Memorandum of Cooperation (MoC) on the steel sector signed in 2020. The discussions focused on economic developments, steel trade, and technological collaboration. India assured ease of doing business for Japanese companies, while Japan reaffirmed its support for investments in advanced steel technologies. Both nations also discussed the impact of the European Union’s Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (EU CBAM) on the steel industry. This dialogue strengthens bilateral cooperation in the steel sector, promoting sustainable growth and innovation.

questions.question: In which region is the TROPEX-25 military exercise conducted?
questions.explanation: TROPEX-25 is a biennial large-scale military exercise conducted in the Indian Ocean Region (IOR). It involves around 65 Indian Navy ships, 9 submarines, and over 80 aircraft, along with assets from the Indian Army, Air Force, and Coast Guard. The exercise focuses on validating the Indian Navy’s maritime operational strategies and enhancing joint operational readiness against various threats, including conventional, asymmetric, and hybrid threats. By conducting TROPEX-25 in the Indian Ocean, India ensures the protection of its maritime interests, strengthens fleet management capabilities, and refines its combat readiness in real-world maritime scenarios.

questions.question: Which Indian state has mandated the use of Marathi in all official communication?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra has mandated the use of Marathi in all official communication across government, semi-government, and local self-government bodies. Marathi was designated as the official language of Maharashtra in 1960 and attained the status of a classical language in 2024. The Indian Constitution allows states to choose their official languages under Article 345. Other states, such as Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Jharkhand, and West Bengal, have also implemented language policies to promote their regional languages. These policies aim to preserve linguistic heritage while ensuring accessibility and governance for local populations.

questions.question: What is India's rank in terms of economy-wide digitalisation globally?
questions.explanation: India ranks as the 3rd largest digitalized economy globally, behind the United States and China, according to the State of India’s Digital Economy (SIDE) Report 2024. Despite this strong position in overall digitalisation, India ranks 12th among G20 nations in terms of individual user digitalisation. The digital economy contributed 11.74% to India’s GDP in 2022-23, with projections to reach 13.42% by 2024-25. By 2029-30, it is expected to contribute 20% of GDP, surpassing both agriculture and manufacturing. The report also highlights disparities in digitalisation levels across different Indian states.

questions.question: Which ministry issued a circular advising government officials to avoid using AI tools on official devices?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Finance, through its Department of Expenditure (DoE), issued a circular on January 29 cautioning government officials against using AI tools like ChatGPT and DeepSeek on official devices. The advisory was driven by concerns over data confidentiality and the risk of sensitive government information being accessed or exposed. The Finance Secretary approved the decision, making it an official directive across government departments. The government is adopting a cautious stance on AI tools, aiming to balance their potential benefits with the need for data security and privacy in handling official documents and communications.

questions.question: Which country is set to launch the EFTA Desk to strengthen trade relations?
questions.explanation: India is set to launch the EFTA Desk in New Delhi to enhance economic relations with the European Free Trade Association (EFTA). This initiative aligns with the India-EFTA Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement and aims to boost trade, investment, and business collaboration between India and EFTA member nations. The EFTA consists of Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland. By establishing this desk, India seeks to facilitate smoother economic interactions and expand its engagement with these European economies, fostering stronger trade partnerships and investment opportunities.

questions.question: Which state is set to host the world's largest Jhumur festival in 2025?
questions.explanation: Assam is set to host the world's largest Jhumur dance festival on February 24, 2025, as a prelude to the Advantage Assam 2.0 Investment Summit. The event aims to achieve a Guinness World Record with over 7,500 dancers performing Jhumur, a traditional folk dance. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced that the Prime Minister would be attending the festival, highlighting Assam’s rich cultural heritage. The festival serves as both a cultural celebration and an opportunity to attract global investors to Assam, showcasing the state's commitment to tradition and economic growth.

questions.question: Which country is participating with India in the joint military exercise 'Cyclone 2025'?
questions.explanation: The joint military exercise 'Cyclone 2025' between India and Egypt has commenced at the Mahajan Field Firing Range in Rajasthan. This 14-day exercise aims to enhance defence cooperation and interoperability between the special forces of both nations. The training focuses on counter-terrorism operations, reconnaissance, sniping, surveillance, and other specialized military tactics in challenging desert conditions. The Indian Army is represented by the Parachute Regiment (Special Forces), while Egypt has deployed its Commando Squadron and Airborne Platoon. The exercise strengthens bilateral defence ties and improves coordination in tackling modern security threats.

questions.question: What is India's rank in the Global LEED Green Buildings 2024 rankings?
questions.explanation: India secured the 3rd position in the U.S. Green Building Council’s (USGBC) Global LEED Green Buildings 2024 rankings, with 370 projects covering 8.50 million gross square meters (GSM) of green-certified space. China ranked first with over 25 million GSM, followed by Canada with 10 million GSM. LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certification is a globally recognized standard for sustainability, energy efficiency, and reduced carbon footprint in buildings. India's consistent ranking highlights its growing commitment to eco-friendly infrastructure and sustainable construction, reinforcing its leadership in green building development in the Asia-Pacific region.

questions.question: In which state did Chief Minister N. Biren Singh resign before a no-confidence motion?
questions.explanation: N. Biren Singh resigned as the Chief Minister of Manipur ahead of a no-confidence motion in the state assembly. He submitted his resignation to Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla in Imphal, accompanied by BJP leader Sambit Patra and Manipur BJP State President A. Sharda Devi. Biren Singh has been serving as the 12th Chief Minister of Manipur since 2017. His resignation marks a significant political development in the state, influencing the political landscape and governance moving forward.

questions.question: Which country signed an MoU with India for implementing Quick Impact Projects (QIPs)?
questions.explanation: India and Nicaragua have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to implement Quick Impact Projects (QIPs) aimed at enhancing physical and social infrastructure. India will provide grant assistance for projects focusing on roads, community centres, education, and sanitation, ensuring direct benefits to Nicaraguan communities. This collaboration, formalized in Managua, strengthens diplomatic ties between the two nations. India’s approach to QIPs aligns with its broader development cooperation strategy, which prioritizes high-impact, small-scale projects that bring rapid and visible change to partner countries, fostering stronger bilateral relations.

questions.question: Who won the gold medal in the women's 75kg boxing category at the 38th National Games?
questions.explanation: Lovlina Borgohain won the gold medal in the women's 75kg boxing category at the 38th National Games. The event also saw Shiva Thapa securing a silver medal in the men's 63.5kg category, while Ankushita Boro made history by winning the 66kg welterweight event. Other notable winners included Jasmine Lamboria and Nivedita Kari. The medal tally was led by Services with 66 medals, followed by Karnataka with 58 medals. The National Games continue until February 14, showcasing top athletic talent from across the country.

questions.question: Which country has the world's most powerful passport in 2025?
questions.explanation: Singapore holds the title of the world's most powerful passport in 2025, allowing visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 193 countries. It surpasses South Korea and Japan, which are tied in second place with access to 190 nations. The United Arab Emirates made significant progress, reaching 8th place, while the United States dropped to 9th. Venezuela experienced the steepest decline, falling from 2nd place in 2015 to 44th in 2025. Meanwhile, India ranked 80th with access to 56 countries, and Pakistan ranked 96th, placing near the bottom of the list.

questions.question: In which country was "Operation Devil Hunt" launched to crack down on violence?
questions.explanation: Bangladesh launched "Operation Devil Hunt" to address political violence and unrest, resulting in the arrest of over 1,300 individuals. The operation was initiated following violent attacks on properties linked to former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina’s family and her political party. Joint forces, including the army and police, have been deployed across the country to restore order and prevent further disturbances. The crackdown aims to control mobs and political factions responsible for escalating tensions, ensuring stability and security in Bangladesh amidst rising political turmoil.

questions.question: On which date is World Pulses Day celebrated annually?
questions.explanation: World Pulses Day is observed every year on February 10 to highlight the importance of pulses as a sustainable and nutritious food source. Established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2019, the day builds on the success of the 2016 International Year of Pulses. It emphasizes the role of pulses in global food security, nutrition, and environmental sustainability. Pulses, such as lentils, chickpeas, and beans, are rich in proteins, dietary fibre, and essential nutrients. The observance promotes their contribution to eradicating hunger, improving human health, and supporting sustainable agricultural practices worldwide.

questions.question: Which country signed an MoU with Nepal for the HydroNepal Project?
questions.explanation: Nepal and France have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for the HydroNepal Project, focusing on digitizing Nepal’s river basins and optimizing hydropower resources. The agreement was signed by Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) Managing Director Kul Man Ghising and Blue Water Intelligence (BWI) CEO Jeremy Fain, with the French Ambassador to Nepal, Virginie Corteval, also present. The project aims to enhance Nepal’s hydrological risk preparedness and improve sustainable water management. This collaboration highlights France’s support in advancing Nepal’s renewable energy sector and ensuring efficient hydropower utilization.

questions.question: Which country recently formed its first government since 2022 to end political deadlock?
questions.explanation: Lebanon has successfully formed its first government since 2022, marking the end of a prolonged political stalemate. Nawaf Salam was appointed as the Prime Minister, and President Joseph Aoun accepted the caretaker government's resignation. The newly established 24-member cabinet is expected to focus on key issues such as judicial reforms, economic stability, and ceasefire implementation with Israel. Salam has also committed to overseeing Israeli troop withdrawal and facilitating war reconstruction efforts. This move is seen as a crucial step toward restoring governance and stability in Lebanon after years of political gridlock.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Director in the Ministry of Steel under the Central Staffing Scheme?
questions.explanation: Maimun Alam, an IRS officer from the 2007 batch, has been appointed as the Director of the Ministry of Steel under the Central Staffing Scheme. Her appointment was recommended by the Department of Revenue for Central Deputation, and she will serve in this role for five years or until further orders. With a strong background in tax administration and policy formulation, she is expected to play a key role in strategic initiatives within the steel sector, contributing to its growth and policy development at the national level.

questions.question: On which date did Donald Trump declare 'Gulf of America Day'?
questions.explanation: Former U.S. President Donald Trump signed a proclamation officially recognizing February 9 as "Gulf of America Day" after renaming the Gulf of Mexico. The executive order was signed on January 20, instructing the Department of the Interior to implement the change. Following this directive, the U.S. Coast Guard also adopted the term "Gulf of America" in its official communications. This move was part of Trump's broader policies on national identity and territorial rebranding.

questions.question: In which city was India's first automated biomedical waste treatment rig, "Sṛjanam," inaugurated?
questions.explanation: Dr. Jitendra Singh inaugurated "Sṛjanam," India's first automated biomedical waste treatment plant, at AIIMS, New Delhi. Developed by CSIR-NIIST Thiruvananthapuram, this facility ensures the eco-friendly disposal of biomedical waste, promoting sustainability in healthcare waste management. The initiative aligns with India's "Waste to Wealth" mission, which aims to convert waste into useful resources while reducing environmental hazards. This innovation marks a significant step forward in sustainable medical waste disposal practices.

questions.question: Matthew Breetzke, who became the first batter to score 150+ runs on ODI debut, represents which country?
questions.explanation: South African cricketer Matthew Breetzke created history by becoming the first batter to score 150+ runs on his ODI debut. He scored 150 off 148 balls against New Zealand in a tri-series match, surpassing the previous record of 148 runs set by D.L. Haynes of West Indies in 1978. His innings included 11 fours and 5 sixes. Before Breetzke, Colin Ingram's highest ODI debut score for South Africa was 124 against Zimbabwe in 2010. His remarkable performance set a new benchmark for debutants in ODI cricket.

questions.question: What is the new name of the Hindustan Jet Trainer (HJT-36) after modifications?
questions.explanation: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has renamed the Hindustan Jet Trainer (HJT-36) as 'Yashas' after making significant modifications to enhance its spin resistance and stability. The aircraft is equipped with an advanced glass cockpit, a FADEC-controlled AL55I engine, and Indian-made avionics, improving its efficiency for pilot training. 'Yashas' plays a crucial role in Stage II pilot training, counter-insurgency operations, and aerobatics, with the capability to carry a 1,000 kg armament load. The renaming aligns with HAL’s efforts to modernize Indigenous aircraft for defence applications.

questions.question: What type of rice has India introduced new HS codes for to facilitate exports?
questions.explanation: India has introduced new Harmonized System (HS) codes to facilitate the export of GI-recognized rice varieties such as Red Rice, Black Rice, and Kalanamak Rice. These codes help differentiate premium GI-tagged rice from general non-basmati rice, ensuring better market positioning and protection from export restrictions. The initiative aims to promote fair pricing, simplify trade processes, and strengthen India’s presence in global speciality rice markets. By assigning specific HS codes, India acknowledges the cultural and economic importance of these rice varieties while safeguarding farmers’ interests and boosting agricultural exports.

questions.question: How many new languages have been added to the Lok Sabha translation service?
questions.explanation: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced the addition of translation services for 6 new languages: Bodo, Dogri, Maithili, Manipuri, Urdu, and Sanskrit. This expansion builds upon the previously available 10 languages, ensuring greater accessibility and inclusivity in parliamentary proceedings. By incorporating more regional languages, the Lok Sabha aims to promote linguistic diversity and enable better communication for members representing various linguistic backgrounds across India.

questions.question: In which city was the Para-Archery Asia Cup held?
questions.explanation: The Para-Archery Asia Cup took place in Bangkok, where Indian archer Sarita secured a gold medal in the Women’s Compound Open category by defeating Singapore’s Nur Syahidah Alim 143-142. Additionally, Adil Mohammed won a bronze medal in the Men’s W1 category, further showcasing India’s strong performance in the tournament. The competition saw intense matches, with India achieving significant success on the international para-archery stage.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new CEO of Nokia, effective April 1, 2025?
questions.explanation: Justin Hotard has been named the new CEO of Nokia, effective April 1, 2025, succeeding Pekka Lundmark. Previously serving as Intel’s Executive Vice President and General Manager of Data Center & AI Group, Hotard brings significant expertise in artificial intelligence and data centres, aligning with Nokia’s strategic growth areas. Nokia’s Chair, Sari Baldauf, emphasized Hotard’s ability to drive technological advancement and business growth. Lundmark, who led Nokia since 2020, will remain as an advisor until the end of the year to facilitate a smooth leadership transition.

questions.question: Which country signed an Executive Programme of Cooperation (EPC) with India for archival cooperation from 2025 to 2028?
questions.explanation: India and Oman have signed an Executive Programme of Cooperation (EPC) for the years 2025-2028 to strengthen their collaboration in the field of archives. This agreement is intended to enhance historical ties and promote future cooperation between the National Archives of India and the National Records and Archives Authority of Oman. Such initiatives help in preserving shared history and cultural heritage, further solidifying diplomatic relations between the two nations.

questions.question: Which institute signed an MoU with DPIIT to enhance cooperation in logistics and infrastructure development?
questions.explanation: DPIIT (Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade) of India signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Korea Transport Institute (KoTI) to enhance logistics and infrastructure cooperation. This partnership focuses on the PM GatiShakti National Master Plan, aiming to improve logistics efficiency through knowledge exchange, research-driven initiatives, and technology adoption. Strengthening bilateral ties with global institutions like KoTI helps India advance its logistics sector and adopt best practices from leading economies.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Women and Girls in Science celebrated annually?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Women and Girls in Science is observed annually on February 11 to promote gender equality in STEM fields. Established by the United Nations in 2015, this day highlights the crucial role of women and girls in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. The 2025 theme, "Unpacking STEM Careers: Her Voice in Science," emphasizes encouraging young women to pursue careers in these fields and addressing barriers that hinder their progress. Achieving gender equality in science is essential for innovation, economic development, and the success of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

questions.question: On which date will International Epilepsy Day 2025 be observed?
questions.explanation: International Epilepsy Day is observed on the second Monday of February each year to raise awareness about epilepsy, its diagnosis, treatment, and impact on individuals. In 2025, it falls on February 10, with the theme “MyEpilepsyJourney,” encouraging people with epilepsy to share their experiences. The event aims to foster a supportive community, improve public understanding, and enhance medical accessibility for epilepsy patients worldwide. With millions affected by epilepsy, particularly in developing nations, this observance plays a crucial role in advocating for better care and reducing the stigma associated with the condition.

questions.question: On which date is Anti-Smuggling Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: Anti-Smuggling Day is observed annually on February 11 to raise awareness about the threats posed by smuggling to national security and the economy. Organized by FICCI’s CASCADE initiative, this day highlights the dangers of illegal trade, including arms smuggling, fake currency circulation, and drug trafficking. Smuggling not only weakens economic stability by causing revenue losses but also strengthens organized crime and terrorist activities. By promoting international cooperation and coordinated enforcement efforts, Anti-Smuggling Day serves as a crucial reminder of the need to combat illicit trade through awareness campaigns, seminars, and policy discussions.

questions.question: Which city is hosting the largest MRO Middle East & AIME 2025 event?
questions.explanation: Dubai is hosting the largest MRO Middle East & AIME 2025, bringing together over 250 exhibitors and key aviation stakeholders. The event highlights major developments in the aerospace industry, including GE Aerospace’s $10 million investment and Airbus’s projection of a $32 billion global service demand by 2043. Industry leaders are discussing emerging trends such as AI applications and modernization programs at the Go Live! Theatre, reinforcing Dubai’s position as a global hub for aviation advancements.

questions.question: Which institute collaborated with ISRO to develop the ‘IRIS’ chip for space applications?
questions.explanation: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) partnered with IIT Madras to develop the ‘IRIS’ (Indigenous RISC-V Microprocessor for Space Applications) chip, a semiconductor designed for space missions. Derived from the SHAKTI microprocessor project, the chip is based on the open-source RISC-V architecture. It enhances self-reliance in space technology and aligns with India’s ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ initiative. The chip’s design was carried out at IIT Madras, with fabrication at the Semiconductor Laboratory (SCL) in Chandigarh and packaging by Tata Advanced Systems. This marks a major milestone in India’s indigenous semiconductor development efforts.

questions.question: Which city will host the inaugural Olympic Esports Games in 2027?
questions.explanation: The inaugural Olympic Esports Games will be hosted in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in 2027 as part of a 12-year agreement. The International Olympic Committee (IOC) is organizing this event to tap into the growing popularity of Esports and attract younger audiences. Following the success of the Olympic Virtual Series, a six-member committee will be responsible for selecting the games that will be featured in this historic event. This marks a significant step in integrating Esports into the global sporting community under the Olympic framework.

questions.question: Which organization selected SpaceX for the Pandora mission launch?
questions.explanation: NASA has chosen SpaceX to launch the Pandora mission as part of the VADR (Venture-Class Acquisition of Dedicated and Rideshare) contract. The mission aims to study over 20 exoplanets and their host stars by analyzing atmospheric observations. Equipped with a 17-inch telescope, Pandora will complement the work of NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope, enhancing the understanding of exoplanet atmospheres and their potential habitability. This mission represents another significant step in exoplanet research and deep space exploration.

questions.question: Who won the 10th men's snooker championship at the Indian Snooker Championship?
questions.explanation: Pankaj Advani, India's most decorated cueist, secured his 36th national title and 10th men’s snooker championship at the Yashwant Club. In a thrilling final, he defeated Brijesh Damani, avenging his only group-stage loss. Advani showcased remarkable skill, winning the final with an 84 break in the last frame. His victory ensures his qualification for the upcoming Asian Snooker Championship on February 15, 2025, further cementing his legacy in Indian cue sports. His consistent performances continue to strengthen India’s global representation in both billiards and snooker.

questions.question: Which country is the FAO launching a $95 million climate-resilient agriculture project in?
questions.explanation: The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) has launched a $95 million, seven-year climate-resilient agriculture project called "Ugbaad" in Somalia. The initiative aims to strengthen Somalia’s agrifood systems, restore degraded landscapes, and protect the livelihoods of farmers. With agriculture supporting 65% of the country’s population, the project plays a crucial role in enhancing food security and climate adaptation efforts. Somalia’s Deputy Prime Minister has emphasized the government’s commitment to tackling climate challenges as the nation faces increasing weather shocks.

questions.question: Which ministry has launched the 'Culinary, Crafts & Clicks – Moods & Magic' festival?
options: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
questions.answer: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA), in collaboration with MyGov, has launched the 'Culinary, Crafts & Clicks – Moods & Magic' festival to celebrate India's cultural heritage. The event, held at locations like Kartavya Path and Amrit Udyan, brings together artisans, photographers, and food enthusiasts. A key attraction is the ‘Moods & Magic’ photography contest, encouraging participants to capture vibrant public spaces. Winners of the contest will receive cash prizes, and selected photos will be showcased on official platforms, highlighting the dynamic interaction between people and urban environments.

questions.question: Where is the 14th Asian Fisheries Forum (AFAF) being held in 2025?
questions.explanation: The 14th Asian Fisheries Forum (AFAF) is being hosted in New Delhi from February 12-14, 2025, under the theme "Greening the Blue Growth in Asia-Pacific". Organized by ICAR and AFS, the event brings together 1,000 delegates from 24 countries to discuss sustainable fisheries and the future of the blue economy. India, as the world's second-largest producer of fish and aquaculture, is showcasing its advancements in the sector, reinforcing its commitment to sustainable and eco-friendly fisheries practices.

questions.question: Which state will host the 39th National Games in 2027?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya has been chosen as the host for the 39th National Games, scheduled to take place in 2027. The National Games is India's premier multi-sport event, bringing together athletes from across the country to compete in various disciplines. The 2025 edition of the National Games, currently ongoing, features top-performing teams like the Services Sports Control Board, Maharashtra, and Karnataka leading the medal tally. Hosting the event in 2027 will provide Meghalaya with an opportunity to showcase its sporting infrastructure and boost sports culture in the region.

questions.question: What percentage tariff has Trump imposed on steel and aluminium imports?
questions.explanation: U.S. President Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on all steel and aluminium imports, effective March 4, 2025, with no exemptions for key exporters like Canada, Brazil, Mexico, and South Korea. The decision aims to boost domestic production and counter foreign dumping but has sparked a global backlash. Countries such as Canada and the European Union have condemned the move and are preparing retaliatory measures. This tariff reinstates Trump's earlier protectionist trade policies and could lead to heightened trade tensions and economic uncertainty in global markets.

questions.question: Where was the 63rd session of the Commission for Social Development (CSoCD) held?
questions.explanation: The 63rd session of the Commission for Social Development (CSoCD) took place in New York, bringing together representatives from 49 countries. The session focused on inclusive social policies and global well-being, with India's participation emphasizing "Women-led development." Smt. Savitri Thakur addressed the event, highlighting India's commitment to strengthening social cohesion and solidarity. The discussions aimed at fostering policies that promote inclusive growth and address social challenges worldwide.

questions.question: Which state is drafting a new leather and footwear policy to boost exports?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh is formulating a new leather and footwear policy to enhance exports, provide financial aid, and introduce technological upgrades. The initiative aims to double the state’s ₹20,000 crore leather industry within five years, focusing on key hubs such as Kanpur, Agra, Unnao, and Noida. This policy aligns with the Union Budget 2025-26, which sets a target of $50 billion in Indian leather exports by 2030. By implementing this strategy, Uttar Pradesh seeks to strengthen its position as a major contributor to the country’s leather sector.

questions.question: Which company launched the 'Spinner' sports drink with Muttiah Muralitharan?
questions.explanation: Reliance Consumer Products Ltd (RCPL) introduced 'Spinner,' a new sports drink co-created with cricket legend Muttiah Muralitharan. The drink is priced at ₹10 for 150 ml and is available in Lemon, Orange, and Nitro Blue flavours. To enhance its brand presence, Spinner has partnered with IPL teams like MI, GT, PBKS, SRH, and LSG. RCPL aims to build a $1 billion sports beverage market within the next three years, positioning Spinner as a key player in the segment.

questions.question: Which state launched the ‘Har Khet-Swasth Khet’ campaign to improve soil health?
questions.explanation: Haryana launched the ‘Har Khet-Swasth Khet’ campaign to boost soil health and promote sustainable farming. The initiative includes collecting soil samples from every acre of farmland across the state over the next 3-4 years. As part of the campaign, farmers are receiving Soil Health Cards to help them make informed decisions regarding soil fertility, nutrient management, and crop productivity. The state has already collected millions of soil samples, set up new testing labs, and introduced digital platforms to aid farmers in monitoring soil health.

questions.question: What was India's industrial output growth in December 2024?
questions.explanation: India's industrial output growth slowed to 3.2% in December 2024, compared to 5% in November. This slowdown was primarily driven by weaker performance in the manufacturing and mining sectors. While the manufacturing sector grew by 3% and mining by 2.6%, electricity generation showed a positive performance with a 6.2% increase. Despite these sectoral variations, the overall industrial output growth decelerated, raising concerns for the nation's economic momentum as it headed into 2025.

questions.question: When is National Productivity Day celebrated in India?
questions.explanation: National Productivity Day is celebrated annually on February 12 in India to raise awareness about the importance of productivity in driving economic growth, sustainability, and innovation. It is organized by the National Productivity Council (NPC) and marks the beginning of a week-long celebration from February 12 to 18. The day also emphasizes the need to enhance efficiency across industries, with a special focus on startups and intellectual property protection in 2025. Additionally, it commemorates the establishment of the NPC on this date in 1958.

questions.question: Who wrote the memoir 'I Am a Soldier’s Wife: The Life and Love of Toni Lidder'?
questions.explanation: The memoir 'I Am a Soldier’s Wife: The Life and Love of Toni Lidder' was written by Geetika Lidder, the wife of Brigadier LS Lidder. The book is a tribute to her husband's remarkable journey as both a soldier and a devoted family man. Geetika Lidder’s writing captures the essence of his leadership, bravery, and humanity, offering personal insights into his life. The memoir also reflects on Geetika's own resilience after the tragic 2021 helicopter crash, making it a deeply emotional and inspiring account of love and loss.

questions.question: How many Sinhala-translated Jataka Tales books were launched by Sri Lanka?
questions.explanation: Sri Lanka launched five Sinhala-translated Jataka Tales books. These books were unveiled on Nawam Poya Day by Prof. Kollupitiye Mahinda Sangharakkhita Thero and Indian Deputy High Commissioner Dr Satyanjal Pandey. The event also included the distribution of 5,000 copies of the books to Dhamma schools, emphasizing the importance of preserving and promoting Buddhist heritage. The initiative reflects a significant cultural collaboration between Sri Lanka and India, supported by the publication of Amar Chitra Katha.

questions.question: Where will the first Regional Dialogue on Global Coalition for Social Justice be hosted?
questions.explanation: The first Regional Dialogue on the Global Coalition for Social Justice will be hosted in India, specifically in New Delhi. The event, taking place on February 24-25, 2025, will be inaugurated by Dr Mansukh Mandaviya and will focus on the role of responsible businesses in fostering inclusive and sustainable societies. Over 80 partners, including international figures like ILO Director-General Gilbert F. Houngbo, are expected to participate, further emphasizing India’s role as the host for this significant event.

questions.question: Where is the 14th Asian Fisheries and Aquaculture Forum (AFAF) being held?
questions.explanation: The 14th Asian Fisheries and Aquaculture Forum (AFAF) is being held in New Delhi from February 12-14, 2025. This forum focuses on "Greening the Blue Growth in Asia-Pacific" and brings together over 1,000 delegates from 24 countries, including researchers, policymakers, and industry leaders. India, being the second-largest global producer of fish and aquaculture, is hosting the event for the second time. The event highlights India's significant role in the global fisheries and aquaculture industry.

questions.question: Who was named as one of the event ambassadors for the ICC Champions Trophy?
questions.explanation: Shikhar Dhawan, the former Indian opener, was named as one of the four event ambassadors for the ICC Champions Trophy, which will be held in Pakistan and Dubai from February 19 to March 9. Along with Dhawan, other notable ambassadors include Pakistan's Sarfaraz Ahmed, Australia's Shane Watson, and New Zealand's Tim Southee. Dhawan’s inclusion highlights his significant contribution to Indian cricket, and his role as an ambassador helps promote the prestigious tournament globally.

questions.question: Where did the electric energy conference 'Elecs Korea 2025' begin?
questions.explanation: 'Elecs Korea 2025' began in Seoul, which is the capital city of South Korea. This is important because large-scale conferences, especially those involving global and local companies, are typically hosted in major cities like Seoul, which offer the infrastructure, accessibility, and prominence necessary to support such events. This event focuses on advanced power technologies and innovations in the energy sector, making Seoul an ideal location for such a significant conference.

questions.question: When is World Radio Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: World Radio Day is celebrated on February 13th, a date chosen to commemorate the establishment of UN Radio in 1946. The event was first proposed by Spain in 2010 and officially recognized by UNESCO in 2011. The 2025 theme, "Radio and Climate Change," underscores radio’s vital role in raising awareness about climate issues and encouraging sustainable practices. The first World Radio Day celebration took place in 2012, marking the global importance of radio in communication and education.

questions.question: Which institution partnered with ERNET India to establish a joint research lab for IoT?
questions.explanation: The Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design and Manufacturing (IIITDM) Kancheepuram has partnered with ERNET India to establish a joint research laboratory focusing on the Internet of Things (IoT). This collaboration formalized through a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), aims to enhance research and development in cutting-edge technologies. The lab will validate the functionality of various IoT solutions, advancing real-world applications. The partnership strengthens IIITDM Kancheepuram’s role in driving technological innovation and academic-industry collaboration in key areas such as IoT, sensors, connectivity, and data management.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Chief Economist of Canara Bank?
questions.explanation: Dr Madhavankutty G has been appointed as the Chief Economist of Canara Bank, effective from January 2025. With over 20 years of experience in economic research, banking, and corporate sectors, he will be instrumental in shaping the bank's economic strategies. Dr. Madhavankutty's expertise will guide the bank's decision-making, providing valuable economic insights and policy recommendations. Prior to this role, he held senior positions at the Bank of India, Aditya Birla Group, and The Times Group.

questions.question: From which state is Muskan Rana, the gold medalist in rhythmic gymnastics at the 38th National Games?
questions.explanation: Muskan Rana is from Jammu and Kashmir (J&K), where she has made significant achievements in gymnastics. At the 38th National Games in Uttarakhand, she won the gold medal in rhythmic gymnastics, furthering J&K's legacy in the sport. Muskan has also earned several accolades in national championships, including one gold, two silver, and one bronze. Her success continues the tradition of strong performances from J&K gymnasts, following the achievements of Bavleen Kaur.

questions.question: Where will India's FIFA window matches be hosted in March?
questions.explanation: The AIFF has chosen Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in Shillong to host India’s FIFA window matches in March. India will play a friendly match against the Maldives on March 19 and face Bangladesh in the AFC Asian Cup 2027 Qualifiers on March 25. This is significant as it marks the first senior international matches at the stadium since its refurbishment. Shillong, known for its passion for football, provides a fitting venue for these important fixtures in Indian football.

questions.question: When is International Darwin Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: International Darwin Day is celebrated on February 12th. This date marks the birthday of Charles Darwin, the renowned naturalist whose groundbreaking work on the theory of evolution revolutionized biology. The day not only celebrates his birthday but also honours his significant contributions to science, particularly his theory of evolution as outlined in "On the Origin of Species." The event serves to promote scientific thinking and recognize Darwin's enduring influence on modern biology.

questions.question: Which country has approved the construction of a deepwater research facility in the South China Sea?
questions.explanation: China has approved the construction of a deepwater research facility in the South China Sea, set to be built at a depth of 2,000 meters. This cold seep ecosystem station will be one of the most advanced underwater structures, with a projected completion date of 2030. The project holds significant strategic and scientific value, particularly amid ongoing territorial disputes in the region. The facility will contribute to underwater research and expand China's technological capabilities in the marine environment.

questions.question: Which company partnered with Garuda Aerospace to develop advanced UAVs for defence, agriculture, and smart cities?
questions.explanation: Tata Elxsi and Garuda Aerospace signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) at Aero India 2025 to collaborate on the development of advanced UAVs (Unmanned Aerial Vehicles) aimed at sectors like defence, agriculture, and smart cities. The partnership focuses on creating AI-powered solutions that can cut energy use by 20%, reduce costs, and ensure regulatory compliance. This initiative is aligned with India's goal of enhancing self-reliance in UAV technology, contributing to both defence capabilities and employment opportunities in the country.

questions.question: Which company developed the world’s first DIVA marker vaccine for Lumpy Skin Disease (LSD)?
questions.explanation: Biovet has developed Biolumpivaxin, the world’s first DIVA marker vaccine for Lumpy Skin Disease (LSD), and has received CDSCO approval for it. The vaccine is based on the LSD virus strain developed by ICAR-NRCE and is noted for its high safety and efficacy. It also helps differentiate between infected and vaccinated animals, making it an important tool for managing LSD in livestock. With an annual production capacity of 500 million doses, this innovation supports India's self-reliance in veterinary healthcare.

questions.question: Which company has signed a $7-9 billion LNG deal with ADNOC Gas?
questions.explanation: ADNOC Gas and Indian Oil Corporation have finalized a 14-year agreement for the supply of up to 1.2 million tonnes of LNG annually, starting in 2026. The deal, valued between $7 billion and $9 billion, is part of India's broader strategy to increase gas usage to 15% of its energy mix by 2030. The LNG will be sourced from ADNOC Gas's Das Island facility, which has been operational for years and has delivered over 3,500 LNG cargoes since its inception.

questions.question: In which country were the Jurassic-era bird fossils, offering new insights into bird evolution, discovered?
questions.explanation: The Jurassic-era bird fossils were discovered in Fujian Province, China, by a team of researchers led by Professor Wang Min from the Institute of Vertebrate Paleontology and Paleoanthropology (IVPP). These fossils, estimated to be 149 million years old, provide crucial new insights into the early evolution of birds. The discovery challenges previous assumptions about bird evolution, revealing that birds were more diversified by the end of the Jurassic period than previously thought. The fossils also push back the origin of the short-tailed bird feature by nearly 20 million years.

questions.question: Which country is hosting the first-ever International Conference on Governance in 2025?
questions.explanation: India is hosting the first-ever International Conference on Governance, the IIAS-DARPG India Conference 2025, from February 10-14, 2025, in New Delhi. This global event brings together experts from over 55 countries to discuss innovations in public administration, governance, and policymaking. The conference is jointly organized by the International Institute of Administrative Sciences (IIAS) and the Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances (DARPG) of the Government of India. It offers a platform for addressing key administrative reforms and empowering citizens.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with UPM to modernize its IT infrastructure in the Nordic region?
questions.explanation: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has partnered with UPM, a Finland-based company, to modernize its IT infrastructure. This collaboration focuses on cloud migration, AI-driven workplace transformation, and enhancing IT management for UPM's 19,000 employees. TCS will handle key IT functions such as data centre operations, network services, and end-user support. The partnership aims to improve operational efficiency and streamline business operations, reinforcing TCS's growing presence in the Nordic region and highlighting its capability to drive digital transformation for large enterprises.

questions.question: Who will take over as Romania’s interim president until the new elections take place in May?
questions.explanation: Ilie Bolojan has been sworn in as Romania’s interim president. He is set to serve in this role until new presidential elections are held in May. Previously, Bolojan had been a local politician and became the president of the Senate in December. Although he was due to leave office after the previous presidential elections, which were annulled, he now assumes this interim position until the elections take place.

questions.question: Which company signed an MoU with Saab to manufacture the Electronic Warfare Laser Warning System-310 (LWS-310) in India?
questions.explanation: Saab signed an MoU with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) to collaborate on the production and maintenance of the Electronic Warfare Laser Warning System-310 (LWS-310) in India. The agreement allows HAL to manufacture this advanced system domestically and involves the transfer of critical maintenance technology. This partnership aligns with India’s "Make in India" initiative, enhancing the country's self-reliance in key defence technologies. The system will improve the survivability of military assets by providing early warnings against laser-guided weapons.

questions.question: In which city was the symposium on Aquatic Animal Diseases inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The symposium on "Aquatic Animal Diseases - Addressing Emerging Challenges and Preparedness" was inaugurated in New Delhi by Union Minister Shri George Kurian. The event is part of the 14th Asian Fisheries and Aquaculture Forum (14AFAF) being held from 12-15 February 2025. The theme of the forum is “Greening the Blue Growth in Asia-Pacific,” which focuses on sustainable practices in the fisheries and aquaculture sectors. The symposium aims to address emerging challenges in aquatic animal diseases and discuss preparedness strategies.

questions.question: Which company partnered with ONGC to collaborate on Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS)?
questions.explanation: ONGC has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Tata Power Renewable Energy Ltd to collaborate on Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). The partnership aims to improve grid stability, integrate renewable energy sources, and support India’s clean energy target of 500 GW by 2030. Additionally, ONGC has set a goal to achieve 10 GW of renewable capacity by 2030, which aligns with its broader objective of reaching net-zero carbon emissions by 2038. This collaboration strengthens efforts to transition toward sustainable energy solutions.

questions.question: Which city is associated with the siblings who won the Global Best M-Gov Gold Award 2025?
questions.explanation: Zain Ahmed Samdani and Faria Zubair, siblings from Hyderabad, won the prestigious Global Best M-Gov Gold Award 2025 at the World Government Summit in Dubai. They were recognized for their innovative creation, ExoHeal, an AI-powered robotic glove designed to enhance neurorehabilitation for stroke and paralysis patients. This technology not only accelerates therapy but also offers personalized treatment and remote monitoring, making rehabilitation faster and more affordable.

questions.question: Which state in India signed an MoU with the Swiss-Indian Chamber of Commerce for fostering international business collaboration?
questions.explanation: The Karnataka government signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Swiss-Indian Chamber of Commerce to enhance international business collaboration during the Global Investors 2025 event. The MoU signing ceremony took place with the Minister for Large and Medium Industries, M B Patil, and representatives from 19 leading Swiss companies present. This agreement aims to strengthen the economic ties and trade relations between Karnataka and Switzerland, supporting further growth and investment opportunities in the region.

questions.question: In which state has the government approved Nilgai culling to mitigate human-wildlife conflicts?
questions.explanation: The Haryana government has approved Nilgai culling to address the growing human-wildlife conflicts, particularly due to the damage these animals cause to agricultural lands. Nilgais, or blue bulls, have been causing significant harm to crops, prompting the state to introduce new Wildlife (Protection) Rules allowing the culling of male Nilgais. While the decision aims to protect agriculture, it has faced opposition from environmentalists and local communities, particularly the Bishnoi community, who consider the Nilgai sacred. This move has sparked debates over its ethical and ecological implications.

questions.question: Which institution developed solar dehydration technology to help farmers preserve agricultural produce?
questions.explanation: IIT Kanpur, with the support of NABARD, developed solar dehydration technology to help farmers preserve their agricultural produce. This innovation aims to reduce post-harvest losses and improve farmers' income by allowing them to store fruits and vegetables for longer periods. By using this technique, farmers can sell their produce at peak prices, increasing profitability. The Namami Gange project also conducted live demonstrations and training sessions for farmers to enhance the adoption of this technology, contributing to the sustainable growth of agriculture.

questions.question: What is the primary function of SEBI's MITRA platform?
questions.explanation: SEBI’s MITRA (Mutual Fund Investment Tracing and Retrieval Assistant) platform was introduced to help investors track inactive or unclaimed mutual fund folios. It allows investors to search for overlooked investments, ensuring they are not missed. Additionally, MITRA encourages KYC (Know Your Customer) updates to prevent fraudulent redemptions. Developed by RTAs, MITRA provides a searchable database that aims to assist investors in managing their mutual fund investments more effectively, helping them stay informed about inactive or unclaimed assets.

questions.question: Where is the Kashi Tamil Sangamam 3.0 event being held in February 2025?
questions.explanation: The Kashi Tamil Sangamam 3.0 event is being held in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, from February 15-24, 2025. This event celebrates the cultural ties between Tamil Nadu and Kashi (Varanasi), emphasizing unity and the integration of traditional Indian knowledge with modern education as per the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.

questions.question: Which team won the most medals in the 38th National Games held in Uttarakhand?
questions.explanation: The Services team won the most medals in the 38th National Games, securing a total of 121 medals. Their medal tally included 68 gold, 26 silver, and 27 bronze. This impressive performance put them ahead of other states and teams, including Maharashtra and Haryana, in terms of overall medal count. Uttarakhand, the host state, finished in 7th place with 103 medals, including 24 golds. The Games showcased a wide range of athletic talent from across India, with athletes competing for honours in various categories.

questions.question: What is India's rank among the top 10 countries most affected by extreme weather events from 1993 to 2023?
questions.explanation: India holds the 6th position among the top 10 countries most affected by extreme weather events between 1993 and 2023. During this period, India experienced significant economic losses amounting to $180 billion and over 80,000 fatalities due to various disasters, including floods and heatwaves. Notable incidents include floods in 1993, 1998, and 2013, and heatwaves in 2002, 2003, and 2015. On a global scale, extreme weather events resulted in 765,000 fatalities and $4.2 trillion in damages, which is comparable to the GDP of Germany, emphasizing the severe impact of climate-related disasters worldwide.

questions.question: In which state were 114 infrastructure projects worth ₹1,028 crore launched?
questions.explanation: 114 infrastructure projects worth ₹1,028 crore were inaugurated in Uttar Pradesh by Rajnath Singh, Nitin Gadkari, and Yogi Adityanath. The projects include the construction of Munshipulia and Khurramnagar flyovers, aimed at improving transportation and urban connectivity. The investment in India's urban infrastructure has significantly increased, from ₹1.78 lakh crore (2004-14) to ₹28.52 lakh crore (2014-24). The Kanpur-Lucknow motorway also incorporates India’s first automated, machine-guided construction system, showcasing innovation in infrastructure development.

questions.question: Which institution collaborated with ISRO to develop the Indigenous Space Chip IRIS?
questions.explanation: ISRO and IIT Madras jointly developed the Indigenous RISCV Controller for Space Applications (IRIS) based on the SHAKTI processor. IRIS is built on the RISC-V architecture, making it suitable for a wide range of applications from IoT to strategic computing systems. This collaboration highlights India’s advancements in semiconductor technology, as the chip was fully designed, fabricated, and tested within the country, showcasing India’s growing capabilities in the field of space and electronics.

questions.question: Which company won the Forward Faster Sustainability Award 2025 in the Water Resilience category?
questions.explanation: NTPC Ltd. won the Forward Faster Sustainability Award 2025 in the Water Resilience category from the UN Global Compact Network India (UN GCNI) on 13th February in Chennai. This award recognizes NTPC's efforts in water conservation, wastewater treatment, and sustainable water management practices, highlighting the company's leadership in these areas. Additionally, NTPC has set a target to achieve 60 GW of renewable energy by 2032, reinforcing its commitment to sustainability.

questions.question: Which company partnered with Safran Electronics & Defense to manufacture the HAMMER weapon in India?
questions.explanation: Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) partnered with Safran Electronics & Defense to jointly manufacture and maintain the HAMMER (Highly Agile Modular Munition Extended Range) weapon in India. HAMMER is a precision-guided, air-to-ground weapon that can be adapted for use with Rafale and LCA Tejas jets. This collaboration is part of India’s effort to strengthen its defence manufacturing capabilities under the Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative, reducing dependency on imports for advanced weaponry and supporting the growth of Indigenous defence technology.

questions.question: In which state did two remote tribal hamlets recently receive electricity for the first time in 78 years?
questions.explanation: Two remote tribal hamlets, Buriga and China Konela, located in Andhra Pradesh's ASR district, celebrated "freedom from darkness" after receiving electricity for the first time in 78 years. This historic milestone included the installation of streetlights and the electrification of homes, significantly improving the quality of life for the residents. The electrification will enhance night-time safety, education, healthcare, and infrastructure in the region. This development also highlights the importance of rural electrification for sustainable growth in remote areas.

questions.question: Which country is involved in the bilateral trade mission with India aiming to reach $500 billion by 2030?
questions.explanation: The India-U.S. bilateral trade is expected to reach $500 billion by 2030 under the ‘Mission 500.’ This growth is driven by expanding trade, energy cooperation, and technological partnerships between the two countries. Key areas of collaboration include energy imports, nuclear technology, and defence cooperation. Strengthening ties with the United States is also expected to bolster India's strategic positioning globally and contribute to trade deficit reduction. The United States plays a central role in this evolving partnership, with significant implications for both countries' economic and geopolitical strategies.

questions.question: When was the Central Council for Research in Unani Medicine (CCRUM) established?
questions.explanation: The Central Council for Research in Unani Medicine (CCRUM) was established in 1978 as an autonomous body under the Ministry of Ayush. CCRUM is the apex government organization dedicated to research in Unani medicine, a traditional healing system based on the balance of the body's four humours. The organization's research and efforts aim to enhance the understanding and application of Unani medicine, contributing to integrative health solutions. The President's participation in the recent conference highlights the growing recognition of Unani medicine in India.

questions.question: In which year was the Income Tax Act amended over 4,000 times and originally enacted?
questions.explanation: The Income Tax Act, of 1961, has been the primary framework for taxation in India and has undergone more than 4,000 amendments since its enactment. The Finance Minister's proposal to introduce the Income Tax Bill 2025 aims to simplify and streamline this existing Act, which has grown increasingly complex over the years. The new Bill aims to reduce its word count and simplify terminology, thus reducing confusion for taxpayers and tax authorities alike while improving compliance and efficiency. The Act's original version was passed in 1961.

questions.question: Where was the first-ever 'Living Will Information Counter' set up in India?
questions.explanation: The Government Medical College Hospital (GMCH) in Kollam introduced India's first-ever 'Living Will Information Counter.' This initiative aims to raise awareness and assist people in drafting living wills, which specify their healthcare preferences if they become incapacitated. The counter has already helped hundreds of individuals obtain soft copies of their living wills within three months. The program promotes patient autonomy and informed decision-making, while also reducing emotional and financial burdens on families in cases of terminal illness or life-threatening conditions.

questions.question: What percentage of urban consumers reported unchanged income in January 2025, the highest in 11 years?
questions.explanation: 55% of urban consumers reported unchanged income in January 2025, marking the highest such figure in 11 years. This reflects a stagnant income trend, which may contribute to weakening economic sentiment and reduced consumer spending, particularly on non-essential items. The report highlights broader economic concerns, including a decline in job opportunities and reduced optimism about income growth. This stagnation may impact overall economic growth and consumer confidence, suggesting the need for targeted government interventions to stimulate the economy.

questions.question: In which year was the Representation of the People Act (RP Act) enacted?
questions.explanation: The Representation of the People Act, of 1951, was enacted to regulate elections and establish disqualification criteria for elected officials. It includes provisions such as Section 8(3), which disqualifies individuals convicted of serious criminal offences, and Section 8(1), which covers disqualification for heinous crimes like rape and corruption. The Act plays a critical role in the electoral system by ensuring that individuals with criminal backgrounds are excluded from holding public office, contributing to efforts to decriminalize politics in India.

questions.question: Where was India Energy Week 2025 held?
questions.explanation: India Energy Week 2025 was held in New Delhi, organized under the patronage of the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, along with the Federation of Indian Petroleum Industry (FIPI). The event featured over 700 exhibitors from the global energy sector and focused on key areas such as energy access, security, sustainability, and decarbonization. It served as a platform for India to sign multiple strategic agreements aimed at enhancing energy security, diversifying energy supply sources, and advancing the country’s energy transition efforts.

questions.question: What percentage of the global population is potentially exposed to zoonotic diseases according to the study?
questions.explanation: The study indicates that nearly 44% of the global population, which equates to 3.5 billion people, is potentially exposed to zoonotic diseases. These diseases are transmitted from animals to humans, and the study highlights wildland-urban interfaces (WUIs) as high-risk zones where zoonotic spillovers are more likely. Factors such as human activities and rapid urbanization in these regions contribute to the increased risk. This makes it crucial to focus on regions with high host species richness and populations at risk from zoonotic diseases.

questions.question: Which state is currently under President’s Rule due to ongoing ethnic violence and governance issues?
questions.explanation: Manipur has been facing ethnic violence between the Kuki–Zo and Meitei communities since May 2023, resulting in significant loss of life and displacement. In response to the situation and governance challenges, the President’s Rule was imposed under Article 356 of the Indian Constitution. The state government was unable to function effectively, prompting the President’s intervention. The Manipur Legislative Assembly is in “suspended animation,” and the Union government now governs the state, pending parliamentary approval for the continuation of the President's Rule.

questions.question: How many border gates have been activated under the revised Free Movement Regime (FMR) along the India-Myanmar border?
questions.explanation: Under the revised Free Movement Regime (FMR), 22 out of the 43 planned border gates along the India-Myanmar border have been activated. This is part of efforts to regulate movement while maintaining security across the largely unfenced northeastern border. The FMR, which was introduced in 1968 to facilitate cross-border movement due to ethnic and familial ties, has undergone changes over time, such as reducing the free movement limit from 40 km to 10 km. The border gates now require border passes that are validated with biometric data.

questions.question: Where will the 17th BRICS Summit be hosted in 2025?
questions.explanation: The 17th BRICS Summit will take place in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on July 6-7, 2025. The summit will bring together leaders from BRICS countries and selected invited nations to discuss critical global governance reforms and cooperation. The event is particularly significant as it occurs amid U.S. threats of imposing 100% tariffs on BRICS nations, adding an extra layer of complexity to discussions. The summit is also expected to address the growing influence of BRICS and its efforts to reshape global trade and diplomacy.

questions.question: On which date will World Pangolin Day be observed in 2025?
questions.explanation: World Pangolin Day, held annually on the third Saturday of February, will be observed on February 15, 2025. The day is dedicated to raising awareness about pangolins, which are the most trafficked mammals in the world. Conservation efforts focus on protecting these creatures from illegal trade, habitat destruction, and other threats. The day also highlights the importance of pangolins in maintaining ecosystem balance by controlling insect populations.

questions.question: Which country is set to acquire a $200 million Akash missile system from India?
questions.explanation: India is finalizing a $200 million deal with the Philippines for the acquisition of its Akash surface-to-air missile system. This deal is part of India’s growing defence exports, showcasing the advanced technology of the Akash missile system. The system’s capabilities, including targeting various threats and its mobility, make it an attractive defence option for countries like the Philippines, which is enhancing its military strength amid tensions in the South China Sea. This acquisition underscores the growing defence collaboration between India and the Philippines.

questions.question: Which bank pledged ₹104 crore to Ashoka University to enhance its research programs?
questions.explanation: Axis Bank has pledged ₹104 crore to Ashoka University over the next four years to strengthen its PhD and Post-Doctoral research programs. The funding will support the development of research labs in Neurosciences, Behavioral Studies, and Physics, as well as provide fellowships and grants for scholars. This initiative aims to improve interdisciplinary research in India, addressing global challenges like climate change, public health, and economic sustainability. Axis Bank’s contribution emphasizes its commitment to fostering world-class research infrastructure in India.

questions.question: In which district has the Digital Inner Line Permit System for tourists been launched?
questions.explanation: The Digital Inner Line Permit System has been launched in Chamoli for tourists visiting the India-Tibet border areas. This system replaces the previous offline process and allows tourists to obtain their permits online via pass.chamoli.org. The new digital platform simplifies the application process, with approvals from the local police and health department. It also offers real-time weather and road updates, aimed at improving tourism and administrative efficiency in the region.

questions.question: Who is the World No.1 tennis player suspended for 3 months due to doping tests?
questions.explanation: Jannik Sinner, the World No.1 tennis player, has been suspended for three months due to two positive doping tests. The suspension will last from February 9 to May 4th. Although initially cleared by the International Tennis Integrity Agency, Sinner reached a settlement with the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) to accept the suspension. This suspension highlights the serious consequences athletes face in doping cases, even if they are initially cleared by other bodies.

questions.question: Which space agency's mission, Euclid, discovered a stunning Einstein ring near galaxy NGC 6505?
questions.explanation: The European Space Agency's (ESA) Euclid mission has made a remarkable discovery of an Einstein ring near galaxy NGC 6505, approximately 590 million light-years away. This rare phenomenon is a result of gravitational lensing, where light from a distant galaxy 4.42 billion light-years away is bent around a massive object. The discovery highlights Euclid's capabilities in studying dark matter and energy.

questions.question: Where was India showcased as the theme country for the first time at the 27th Annual New Year Celebration?
questions.explanation: India was showcased as the theme country for the first time at the 27th Annual New Year Celebration of the Asia Pacific Cultural Centre, which took place at the Tacoma Dome in Washington. The event highlighted India’s rich cultural heritage, including traditional prayers and vibrant art forms. The Indian Consul General in Seattle honoured officials with tri-colour stoles, and messages from U.S. leaders were read during the ceremony.

questions.question: In which country is the emergency European summit on the Ukraine crisis being hosted?
questions.explanation: The emergency summit on the Ukraine crisis is being organized by Emmanuel Macron, the President of France. As Macron is from France, it follows that the summit will take place in this country. The summit involves leaders from several European nations discussing the implications of the Ukraine situation on European security, making France the host country for this key event.

questions.question: In which country will India's joint military exercise 'Dharma Guardian' 2025 with Japan take place?
questions.explanation: The sixth edition of Exercise Dharma Guardian 2025 will be held at Mount Fuji, Japan, from February 25 to March 9. The exercise will focus on urban warfare and counter-terrorism. This military exercise strengthened the defence cooperation between India and Japan, building on the momentum from the Indian Army Chief’s visit to Japan in October 2024. The location of Mount Fuji in Japan has been specifically chosen for the exercise.

questions.question: What is the name of the pilot project launched for urban land survey in India?
questions.explanation: The National Geospatial Knowledge-based Land Survey of Urban Habitations (NAKSHA) has been launched by the Ministry of Rural Development in India. This pilot project aims to modernize urban land records in 152 Urban Local Bodies across 26 States and 3 UTs. It focuses on ensuring accurate land ownership documentation, reducing disputes, and improving urban planning. NAKSHA is a significant initiative with a budget of ₹194 crore, backed by key partners such as the Survey of India, MPSEDC, and NICSI.

questions.question: Who set the new half-marathon world record by running in under 57 minutes?
questions.explanation: Jacob Kiplimo from Uganda set a new half-marathon world record by completing the race in 56 minutes and 42 seconds in Barcelona. His achievement made him the first person to run the half-marathon in under 57 minutes, surpassing the previous record of 57:30 set by Ethiopia's Yomif Kejelcha. Kiplimo's record-breaking performance improved the previous time by 48 seconds, marking the largest improvement in the history of the event.

questions.question: Which state approved the Industrial Park & Green Energy Policy 2025?
questions.explanation: Assam has approved a major industrial park project spanning 569 bighas of land in Morigaon district. Additionally, the state has cleared the Assam Integrated Clean Energy Policy 2025, focusing on promoting renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydro, and hydrogen energy. These initiatives are part of the state's strategy to enhance industrial growth while transitioning to sustainable energy solutions.

questions.question: When will the new Income Tax Bill, 2025, take effect?
questions.explanation: The new Income Tax Bill, 2025, which was tabled by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in the Lok Sabha on February 13, 2025, is set to replace the current Income Tax Act of 1961. The bill is scheduled to take effect starting from April 1, 2026, as confirmed by the bill after a review of the existing law that was announced in July 2024.

questions.question: Which company is behind Project Waterworth which involves laying a 50,000 km undersea cable?
questions.explanation: Meta's Project Waterworth is a major initiative to lay a 50,000-kilometer undersea cable aimed at enhancing digital connectivity between India, the United States, and other regions. The cable will provide faster and more reliable internet, supporting technologies like artificial intelligence, cloud computing, and global business operations. This project is designed to improve digital infrastructure, meet rising global demand for high-speed internet, and connect multiple continents including India, the US, Brazil, and South Africa.

questions.question: On which date is Global Tourism Resilience Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: Global Tourism Resilience Day is observed annually on February 17. The day highlights the importance of building a resilient tourism industry that can withstand various challenges, such as pandemics, economic crises, and environmental changes. The observance encourages nations to adopt strategies that ensure the continuous growth, sustainability, and recovery of the tourism sector. Activities such as workshops, conferences, and awareness campaigns are conducted globally to promote climate-resilient tourism practices and strategies for recovery.

questions.question: Which bank has received RBI approval to establish a branch in GIFT City?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has approved the Bank of Maharashtra (BoM) to establish a branch in Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT City), Gujarat. This approval will enhance the bank's offshore banking operations and align with its expansion plans in the region. The bank already operates 101 branches in Gujarat and is targeting a 25% business growth to ₹15,000 crore by the second quarter of FY25. This move supports GIFT City's development as a prominent financial hub and strengthens India’s global financial standing.

questions.question: Which submersible developed under India’s Deep Ocean Mission recently passed its wet tests?
questions.explanation: The Matsya-6000 submersible, developed under India’s Deep Ocean Mission by the National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT), successfully passed its wet tests at Kattupalli Port. This submersible is a significant part of India’s Samudrayan Project, which aims to advance deep-sea exploration. It features state-of-the-art systems such as thrusters, ballast, navigation sensors, and life-support systems, making it crucial for India’s shallow-water and deep-sea exploration goals. The success of these tests brings India closer to conducting 500-meter shallow-water trials by 2025.

questions.question: Which bank launched the ‘SIB Quick FD’ for seamless digital investment?
questions.explanation: South Indian Bank launched the ‘SIB Quick FD’ service, allowing customers to open Fixed Deposits digitally through UPI, without needing an existing account with the bank. The process is paperless, takes only 5 minutes, and requires minimal documentation. This service is designed to make Fixed Deposit investments accessible to a wider customer base and is available 24/7, making it convenient for users to invest at any time. Additionally, the FD investments are insured up to ₹5 lakhs under DICGC, ensuring security for customers.

questions.question: Which state introduced India’s first Global Capability Centers (GCC) Policy 2025?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh introduced India’s first Global Capability Centers (GCC) Policy 2025 with the goal of transforming Tier-2 cities like Indore, Bhopal, and Jabalpur into global business hubs. This policy aims to attract multinational corporations by providing a conducive business environment, infrastructure, and financial incentives. The policy not only enhances the state's global business standing but also decentralizes economic growth, supporting balanced development across India. It offers several benefits such as financial subsidies, R&D support, and simplified investment processes to make these cities more attractive to international businesses.

questions.question: Where was the statue of Thiruvalluvar unveiled?
questions.explanation: The statue of the Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar was unveiled in the Philippines, specifically at the Gullas College of Medicine (GCM) in Cebu. The Indian Ambassador, Harsh Kumar Jain, participated in the unveiling ceremony. The event was organized by the Gullas College of Medicine under the leadership of Dr. David Pillai, the Chief Executive Adviser of GCM, who had commissioned the statue. This event highlights the cross-cultural appreciation and recognition of Thiruvalluvar's contributions.

questions.question: Which country won its first-ever Asia Mixed Team Badminton Championship title by defeating China 3-1?
questions.explanation: Indonesia achieved a historic milestone by winning its first Asia Mixed Team Badminton Championship title, defeating the defending champions China with a decisive 3-1 victory. The final match was held at the Conson Sports Centre in Qingdao, China.
