This annual observance aims to raise awareness about safety measures in various industries and workplaces to prevent accidents and ensure the well-being of employees. The event is organized by the National Safety Council (NSC) of India, emphasizing the importance of safety for achieving a developed and progressive nation. The theme for this year, "Safety & Well-being Crucial for Viksit Bharat," focuses on the essential role of safety in India's growth.

questions.question: What is India's rank in the 2024 Air Pollution Rankings?
questions.explanation: In the 2024 Air Pollution Rankings, India holds the 5th position, behind countries like Chad, Bangladesh, Pakistan, and the Democratic Republic of Congo. While the average PM2.5 levels in India improved by 7%, falling to 50.6 mg/cu m, the country still struggles with severe pollution levels. India is home to 12 out of the top 20 most polluted cities globally, with Byrnihat topping the list. The WHO recommends PM2.5 levels of no more than 5 mg/cu m, a standard that only 17% of cities globally met last year, illustrating the extent of the pollution problem.

questions.question: Which ship participated in the 57th Mauritius National Day celebrations in 2025?
questions.explanation: INS Imphal, commissioned in December 2023, participated in the 57th Mauritius National Day celebrations on March 12, 2025. This marked the ship's maiden port call in Mauritius, where it contributed a marching contingent, a naval band, and a helicopter for the flypast. INS Imphal is the third ship of the four Project 15B (Visakhapatnam-class) indigenous destroyers, designed to enhance India's naval capabilities. Participation in the National Day celebrations highlights the strengthening of ties between India and Mauritius.

questions.question: In which city has India signed an MoU for the development of a Multi-Modal Logistics Park?
questions.explanation: India has signed an MoU to develop a state-of-the-art Multi-Modal Logistics Park (MMLP) in Varanasi. The park, covering 150 acres, will significantly enhance regional connectivity. It will be strategically connected to NH7, the Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor, and National Waterway-1, offering easy access to the Lal Bahadur Shastri Airport. This development aims to improve logistics and transportation infrastructure in the region, boosting economic activity and accessibility.

questions.question: On which date is CISF Raising Day commemorated annually?
questions.explanation: CISF Raising Day is observed every year on March 10 to honour the important role of the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) in safeguarding vital infrastructure across India. In 2025, the country celebrates the 56th CISF Raising Day with a grand event in Thakkolam, Tamil Nadu. The CISF was established on March 10, 1969, and this day highlights their contributions to national security and economic stability through parades, award ceremonies, and various community service initiatives.

questions.question: Who has climbed to the 5th spot in the ICC Women's All-Rounders Rankings?
questions.explanation: Deepti Sharma has reached the 5th position in the ICC Women's All-rounders Rankings, accumulating 344 points and surpassing Amelia Kerr. Along with her all-rounder ranking, she is also ranked 3rd in the T20 all-rounder rankings and 4th in the ODI bowling rankings. Deepti is known for her versatile skills, batting left-handed and bowling right-arm off break. Her impressive rankings highlight her all-round contribution to the game.

questions.question: Where will the 150th Anniversary Test between Australia and England be held in 2027?
questions.explanation: The 150th Anniversary Test between Australia and England in 2027 will be held at the iconic Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). This historic one-off day-night Test commemorates the first-ever Test match that was played at the MCG in 1877. The match will not only celebrate the rich history of Test cricket but also introduce the modern-day pink-ball format at this famous venue. The MCG holds special significance in cricket history, having previously hosted the Centenary Test in 1977, marking 100 years since the first-ever Test.

questions.question: Which company launched the 'SheTARA' campaign to mark International Women’s Day?
questions.explanation: Star Health Insurance launched the 'SheTARA' campaign in Tamil Nadu to mark International Women’s Day. This initiative aims to promote preventive healthcare among women and encourage more women to join as insurance agents. The campaign includes organizing over 40 health camps across Tamil Nadu, offering subsidized health screenings and a special webinar on work-life balance and women’s health in the age of AI. The initiative highlights Star Health Insurance’s commitment to enhancing women’s health and empowering women in the workforce.

questions.question: Which organization released the 'Handbook on Indian Insurance Statistics 2023-24' in March 2025?
questions.explanation: The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) released the ‘Handbook on Indian Insurance Statistics 2023-24’ in March 2025. This report provides valuable insights into the Claim Settlement Ratio (CSR) of various insurers, which helps consumers and stakeholders assess the efficiency and reliability of insurance companies in India. The report is vital in understanding the performance of private and public insurers in settling claims, offering a detailed breakdown of CSR metrics across different life insurance companies.

questions.question: Which city led the growth in warehousing demand in India in 2024?
questions.explanation: Mumbai led the growth in warehousing demand in India in 2024, with 10.3 million square feet of warehousing transactions. India's overall warehousing transactions rose by 12% year-on-year to 56.4 million square feet, driven by the expansion of manufacturing and third-party logistics (3PL). Other cities like Bengaluru, Kolkata, and Chennai also saw significant growth in demand, but Mumbai took the lead. Additionally, private equity investments surged, reflecting the growth of e-commerce and the supply chain sector.

questions.question: On which date will No Smoking Day be observed in 2025?
questions.explanation: No Smoking Day is observed on the second Wednesday of March every year, and in 2025, it falls on March 12. This annual health awareness event aims to encourage smokers to quit and educate the public about the risks associated with tobacco consumption. It highlights the harmful effects of smoking on health, including respiratory issues, skin problems, and cardiovascular diseases. The day also supports global efforts to reduce tobacco use and raise awareness about secondhand smoke’s impact on non-smokers.

questions.question: In which position did Indian pharmaceutical exports rank globally in 2023?
questions.explanation: Indian pharmaceutical exports ranked 11th globally in terms of value in 2023, according to a secondary market research analysis published by Bain and Company in 2025. The country's pharmaceutical exports accounted for 3% of the total global pharmaceutical exports. This recognition highlights India's growing significance in the global pharmaceutical industry, alongside its efforts to improve product quality through regulatory measures like the amendments to the Drugs and Cosmetics Act in 2008.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Central Council for Research in Homoeopathy (CCRH)?
questions.explanation: The Central Council for Research in Homoeopathy (CCRH) is located in New Delhi. Recently, it signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Adamas University, Kolkata, to foster academic and research collaboration in the field of Homoeopathy. This partnership is expected to advance scientific research in Homoeopathy by encouraging knowledge exchange and collaborative initiatives, marking a significant milestone in the field.

questions.question: Which country is participating with India in the CORPAT and BONGOSAGAR naval exercises in 2025?
questions.explanation: Bangladesh is participating with India in the 6th edition of the Coordinated Patrol (CORPAT) and the 4th edition of the bilateral exercise 'BONGOSAGAR' in 2025. These exercises, held in the Bay of Bengal, aim to enhance maritime security, improve cooperation, and combat criminal activities at sea. The exercises have been a part of the ongoing naval collaboration between India and Bangladesh since 2018, focusing on intelligence exchange, maritime patrols, and operational interoperability between the two nations' naval forces.

questions.question: Which company announced an agreement with SpaceX to bring Starlink's high-speed internet services to India?
questions.explanation: Airtel has entered into an agreement with SpaceX to provide Starlink's high-speed internet services to its customers in India. This agreement is subject to SpaceX receiving the necessary authorizations to sell Starlink in India. The partnership aims to explore how Starlink can complement and expand Airtel's existing offerings, enhancing its customers' internet experience. This move marks a significant development in India's internet services market.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian to receive the highest civilian award of Mauritius?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi became the first Indian to receive the highest civilian award of Mauritius, the Grand Commander of the Order of the Star and Key of the Indian Ocean. This prestigious honour adds to PM Modi's growing list of international accolades, marking it as his 21st such recognition. The award highlights his significant contributions to strengthening India's relations with Mauritius and enhancing international diplomacy.

questions.question: Which country became the top contributor of Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) into Dubai in 2024?
questions.explanation: India emerged as the leading source of Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) into Dubai in 2024, surpassing the United States, France, and the United Kingdom. India accounted for 21.5% of total FDI into Dubai, which reflects the growing business ties between the two countries. Dubai’s business-friendly environment, tax policies, and infrastructure attracted a significant increase in Indian investments, further cementing Dubai's position as the world's leading destination for Greenfield FDI. This surge in investments underscores the strong economic relationship between India and Dubai.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian to receive the Ramsar Award for 'Wetland Wise Use'?
questions.explanation: Jayshree Vencatesan, co-founder of Care Earth Trust, became the first Indian to receive the prestigious Ramsar Award for 'Wetland Wise Use.' This award, recognized globally, celebrates her contributions to the sustainable management of wetlands, particularly her work in conserving the Pallikaranai Marsh in Chennai. Through her research, flood mitigation efforts, and mentorship, she has significantly impacted wetland conservation in India, highlighting the importance of these ecosystems. Her dedication to wetland preservation earned her recognition as one of the 12 women changemakers honoured for their pioneering work in environmental conservation.

questions.question: Which company launched the ‘Shakti’ all-women branches on Women’s Day?
questions.explanation: IIFL Finance, a prominent non-banking financial company (NBFC) in India, launched ‘Shakti’ all-women branches in celebration of Women’s Day. Seven of its existing branches were transformed into exclusively women-staffed branches located in the Delhi NCR and Mumbai Metropolitan Regions. This initiative promotes gender diversity and inclusion in the financial sector, empowers women entrepreneurs, and focuses on offering financial literacy and skill development programs to help women scale their businesses. IIFL Finance’s goal is to support women in underserved communities and strengthen financial inclusion across India.

questions.question: Which state's Legislative Assembly launched a searchable engine to access its debates and proceedings?
questions.explanation: The Punjab Legislative Assembly has launched a searchable engine that allows access to debates and proceedings from 1947 till the present day. This makes Punjab the first Vidhan Sabha in the country to introduce such an initiative. The engine was developed in collaboration with Punjabi University Patiala, IIIT Hyderabad, and CDAC Noida. This move enhances transparency and public access to legislative proceedings, enabling citizens to easily search for and view the discussions and decisions made in the state assembly over the years.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Head of Security Operations at ICICI Bank?
questions.explanation: Kamal Wali has been appointed as the Head of ICICI Bank’s Security Operations Center, bringing with him over 18 years of expertise in cybersecurity and IT operations. In his new role, Wali will lead security initiatives to enhance the bank's cybersecurity infrastructure, focusing on mitigating risks and protecting customer data. His extensive experience, including leadership positions at Jio Platforms Limited, Wipro, and IBM, equips him to strengthen the bank’s digital resilience in the face of growing cyber threats.

questions.question: Which airport won the prestigious ASQ Award for Best Airport in Asia-Pacific for the seventh consecutive year?
questions.explanation: Delhi International Airport, operated by GMR Airports Infrastructure Limited, won the ASQ Airport Experience Award 2024 for the Best Airport Over 40 Million Passengers in the Asia-Pacific region. This marks the seventh consecutive year that the airport has received this prestigious recognition, reflecting its consistent commitment to excellence in customer service, operational efficiency, and passenger experience. The award is based on real-time feedback from passengers and highlights Delhi Airport's leadership in the global aviation industry. Its achievements have solidified its reputation as a world-class airport.

questions.question: In which city did the World Para-Athletics Grand Prix open?
questions.explanation: The World Para-Athletics Grand Prix opened in New Delhi at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium. This event marks a significant occasion as it is the first-ever World Para-Athletics Grand Prix hosted in India. The three-day event features over 90 competitions and includes the participation of para-athletes from across the world, including 145 athletes from India and 105 international participants from 19 different countries. New Delhi was chosen as the venue, highlighting its role as a central location for international sporting events in India.

questions.question: Where was the Water Sustainability Conference 2025 held?
questions.explanation: The Water Sustainability Conference 2025 took place at the NDMC Convention Centre in New Delhi. This event, organized by the Bureau of Water Use Efficiency (BWUE) in collaboration with The Energy and Resources Institute (TERI), focused on promoting industrial water use efficiency. The conference was inaugurated by Union Minister of Jal Shakti, Shri C. R. Patil, and brought together industry leaders, government officials, and experts to discuss sustainable water management practices and innovative strategies for water conservation in industries.

questions.question: Where was the 4th ‘No Money for Terror’ (NMFT) Conference held?
questions.explanation: The 4th ‘No Money for Terror’ (NMFT) Conference, which focused on global initiatives to tackle terror financing, was held in Munich. India, actively involved in the conference since 2018, reiterated its commitment to combating terrorism through enhanced international collaboration. During the conference, discussions centred around the challenges of digital financial networks and cross-border transactions used in terror financing, stressing the need for unified international action against these evolving threats.

questions.question: Which country has India decided to elevate its ties to an "enhanced strategic partnership"?
questions.explanation: India has decided to elevate its ties with Mauritius to an "enhanced strategic partnership". This upgrade in relations includes the signing of eight pacts aimed at boosting cooperation in various sectors like maritime security and trade. The decision reflects the strengthening of diplomatic and economic ties between the two nations. Furthermore, India's new vision for the Global South, called "MAHASAGAR," aims to foster mutual advancement in security and growth, underscoring the importance of the partnership with Mauritius.

questions.question: In which country did the 12th Special Olympics World Winter 2025 take place?
questions.explanation: The event was held in Turin, Italy, as stated in the given text. Italy was the host country for the 12th Special Olympics World Winter 2025, where athletes from various countries competed in winter sports. The success of India, winning medals on the first day, highlights Italy's role in organizing and facilitating the global sporting event. Turin, a city known for its sports history, was the perfect location for such an international event.

questions.question: In which region has the government decided to allocate Rs 3 crore annually for each MLA under the Constituency Development Fund (CDF) scheme?
questions.explanation: The Jammu and Kashmir government has made the decision to allocate Rs 3 crore annually for each Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA) under the Constituency Development Fund (CDF) scheme. This fund allows MLAs to recommend and oversee the implementation of key development projects in their respective constituencies, ensuring that essential projects are funded and managed at the regional level. By empowering the MLAs with this fund, the government aims to enhance local development in the Jammu and Kashmir region.

questions.question: On which date is World Sleep Day celebrated in 2025?
questions.explanation: World Sleep Day in 2025 will be observed on March 14th. The event, organized by the World Sleep Society, is dedicated to raising awareness about the importance of sleep for overall health and well-being. It encourages people to adopt healthy sleep habits and highlights issues related to sleep disorders. The theme for 2025, 'Make Sleep Health a Priority,' emphasizes the significance of prioritizing sleep health for better quality of life.

questions.question: What is the milestone achieved by the PM Surya Ghar Scheme as of 10th March 2025?
questions.explanation: The PM Surya Ghar Scheme reached the significant milestone of 10 lakh rooftop solar installations by 10th March 2025. This achievement marks a crucial step in India's efforts towards energy self-reliance and environmental sustainability. The scheme, launched in February 2024, is on track to solarize 1 crore households by 2026-27, with substantial subsidies and financial support to encourage solar adoption and reduce electricity costs for households.

questions.question: In which country was the 'Honorary Order of Freedom of Barbados' conferred upon India's Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: The 'Honorary Order of Freedom of Barbados' was conferred upon India's Prime Minister during a meeting in November 2024, which took place in Guyana during the India-CARICOM Summit. While Barbados' diplomatic history is discussed, the ceremony and announcement occurred in Guyana. This highlights Guyana as the country where the recognition was given.

questions.question: What is India's rank on the Global Innovation Index 2024?
questions.explanation: India ranks 39th on the Global Innovation Index 2024, which highlights a gap in its innovation capabilities despite being the 2nd-largest producer of STEM graduates globally. This low ranking is attributed to insufficient research and development (R&D) funding, especially in comparison to countries like China and South Korea, which have significantly higher R&D investment. India’s focus on R&D needs to be strengthened to improve its global innovation standing and economic growth.

questions.question: Which company launched the 'Club Enerji Eco Crew' initiative to promote solar energy adoption among students?
questions.explanation: Tata Power launched the 'Club Enerji Eco Crew' initiative with the aim to educate 5 lakh students across 1,000 schools in 24 cities on solar energy adoption. This initiative aligns with the PM Surya Ghar Yojana, which promotes rooftop solar energy and sustainable practices. By targeting cities like Lucknow, Varanasi, and Kanpur, Tata Power is fostering eco-conscious awareness among students and encouraging them to adopt environmentally friendly energy solutions.

questions.question: In which city were pelicans and painted storks recently observed?
questions.explanation: The Indira Gandhi Zoological Park, located in Visakhapatnam, was the site where pelicans and painted storks were recently observed. The park provides a suitable habitat for these species, and their presence there highlights the area's biodiversity. The other options are not associated with this specific observation.

questions.question: Which regulatory body is considering changes to short-selling norms to expand access and address settlement challenges?
questions.explanation: SEBI (Securities and Exchange Board of India) is the regulatory body currently considering revamping short-selling norms. The proposed changes aim to expand access to short-selling, remove disclosure requirements, and address settlement challenges. SEBI's role is to regulate the securities market, and its involvement in these proposed adjustments reflects its responsibility for overseeing market activities and ensuring smooth functioning.

questions.question: In which year was the Oilfields (Regulation and Development) Act originally enacted?
questions.explanation: The Oilfields (Regulation and Development) Act was originally enacted in 1948. This act provides the regulatory framework for the exploration and development of oilfields in India. The current Bill is amending this act to address contemporary issues, such as separating petroleum operations from mining and improving regulatory clarity. The act's establishment in 1948 serves as the foundation for the legal adjustments being proposed today.

questions.question: Which state allegations regarding voter duplication due to EPIC number issues?
questions.explanation: The Chief Minister of West Bengal has accused the Election Commission of India (ECI) of facilitating voter duplication by issuing the same Electors Photo Identity Card (EPIC) numbers for multiple voters across different states. The issue revolves around EPIC number duplication, which the ECI clarified stems from legacy data errors before the introduction of ERONET.

questions.question: What percentage of the global seasoning market does India hold?
questions.explanation: India, despite being the largest spice producer globally, holds just 0.7% of the global seasoning market. This low market share is largely due to the country's focus on raw spice exports rather than processed or value-added products. Only 48% of India's spice exports are processed, and there are concerns regarding the quality of products, such as instances of adulteration and pesticide residues. Addressing these issues and increasing value addition in exports could help India gain a larger share of the global seasoning market.

questions.question: On which date is World Consumer Rights Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Consumer Rights Day is celebrated annually on March 15 to promote consumer rights globally. This date holds historical significance due to a speech delivered by U.S. President John F. Kennedy on March 15, 1962, where he formally recognized the importance of consumer rights. The day aims to highlight consumer-related issues, raise awareness, and advocate for fair practices in the marketplace. The theme for World Consumer Rights Day 2025 is ‘A Just Transition to Sustainable Lifestyles,’ emphasizing the need for sustainable and healthy lifestyle choices for all consumers.

questions.question: Where did India begin its first-ever Exploration Licence auction on March 13, 2025?
questions.explanation: India launched its first-ever Exploration Licence auction on March 13, 2025, specifically in Goa. This auction aims to unlock deep-seated mineral reserves and covers 13 mineral blocks across 10 states. Goa was chosen as the venue for this significant event. Additionally, the AI Hackathon 2025, focused on "Mineral Targeting using AI," was also held as part of this initiative, further emphasizing the importance of Goa in the event's proceedings.

questions.question: Which country will host the SCO defence officials' meeting in March 2025?
questions.explanation: China will host the SCO defence officials' meeting in Qingdao on March 26-27, 2025. The meeting aims to discuss future security cooperation among the member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO). In addition to the defence meeting, China will also host the SCO leaders' summit in Tianjin in the autumn of 2025. The country has chosen the theme "Upholding the Shanghai Spirit: SCO on the Move" for its SCO presidency in 2025 and declared the year as the "SCO Year of Sustainable Development."

questions.question: Which company introduced the Gemma 3 AI model?
questions.explanation: Google has unveiled Gemma 3, the latest addition to its family of lightweight open AI models. Gemma 3 is designed to run efficiently on devices such as smartphones, laptops, and other computing platforms, offering low-latency processing capabilities and multi-modal processing with text-only output. This innovation aims to enhance user experiences and provide developers with a scalable and efficient AI solution.

questions.question: What is the primary focus of Indian Railways' involvement in Mission Amrit Sarovar?
questions.explanation: Indian Railways' participation in Mission Amrit Sarovar focuses primarily on water conservation. The initiative aims to combat water scarcity near railway tracks by digging and rejuvenating ponds. This project is part of the second phase of Mission Amrit Sarovar, which emphasizes both climate resilience and community participation. Additionally, the material excavated from the ponds will be repurposed for railway embankments, contributing to sustainable development and water conservation efforts. The completion of this project is targeted for August 15, 2025.

questions.question: Which company has extended its motorsports partnership with PETRONAS Lubricants International?
questions.explanation: TVS Motor has extended its partnership with PETRONAS Lubricants International to strengthen the motorsports sector in India. As part of the extended alliance, PETRONAS will continue to be the title sponsor for TVS Racing, the factory racing team, for the next three years. This collaboration builds upon their previous relationship, where PETRONAS Lubricants India held the title sponsorship for TVS Racing during the 2022-23 season. This partnership emphasizes both companies' commitment to motorsports and its growth in the Indian market.

questions.question: Who has been elected as the new Chairman of the Automotive Tyre Manufacturers’ Association (ATMA)?
questions.explanation: Arun Mammen, the Vice-Chairman and Managing Director of MRF Ltd., has been elected as the new Chairman of the Automotive Tyre Manufacturers’ Association (ATMA). This leadership transition coincides with ATMA's Golden Jubilee Year in 2025. Arun Mammen has been an influential figure in MRF Ltd., and his leadership is expected to drive India's global competitiveness in the tyre industry. His strong background in business and technology has been crucial in MRF’s market growth, and now as ATMA’s Chairman, he aims to lead the organization towards further advancements in the sector.

questions.question: Which country has deployed a sophisticated Large Phased Array Radar (LPAR)?
questions.explanation: China has deployed a Large Phased Array Radar (LPAR) system in Yunnan province, enhancing its surveillance capabilities, especially regarding India’s strategic defence operations. The radar, with a detection range exceeding 5,000 kilometres, can monitor vast areas, including significant portions of Indian territory and the Indian Ocean region. This advanced radar system raises concerns for India due to its ability to track missile tests and monitor maritime activities. India has responded by strengthening its own radar capabilities and exploring counter-surveillance strategies.

questions.question: Which organization launched the SPHEREx space telescope to map the universe’s cosmic glow?
questions.explanation: NASA successfully launched its SPHEREx space telescope on March 11, 2025, from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket. This mission, valued at $488 million, aims to map the entire sky using infrared technology to study galaxy evolution, the early universe, and interstellar ice. Unlike other telescopes, SPHEREx will focus on the collective cosmic glow from all galaxies, providing unique insights into the universe's formation and expansion. NASA's role in this mission highlights its ongoing efforts to explore and understand the cosmos.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Chairman of Tata Communications?
questions.explanation: N Ganapathy Subramaniam (NGS) has been appointed as the Chairman of Tata Communications, effective from March 14, 2025. Before this appointment, NGS had a distinguished 40-year career with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), where he played a key role in its growth and digital transformation. His leadership and experience in the IT industry have led him to hold significant positions in other Tata Group companies. His appointment to Tata Communications is expected to drive the company’s global expansion, particularly in cloud computing, cybersecurity, and next-generation networking solutions.

questions.question: On which date is Pi Day celebrated annually?
questions.explanation: Pi Day is celebrated annually on March 14, a date that mirrors the first three digits of the mathematical constant Pi (3.14). This day is significant to mathematicians, scientists, and number enthusiasts, as it celebrates the infinite and important nature of Pi. The celebration was first introduced in 1988 by physicist Larry Shaw and has since gained recognition, with the United States House of Representatives officially designating it as National Pi Day in 2009. March 14 is also the birthday of the renowned physicist Albert Einstein, further linking the date to scientific significance.

questions.question: What is the projected GDP growth rate for India in FY 2025-26 according to Moody's?
questions.explanation: Moody’s Ratings has projected that India’s GDP growth will exceed 6.5% in the fiscal year 2025-26, an increase from 6.3% in FY 2024-25. This growth is expected to be driven by higher government capital expenditure, tax cuts to stimulate consumption, and monetary easing through interest rate cuts. Moody’s expects these factors will help India achieve robust economic growth despite challenges in the banking sector, including moderate deterioration in asset quality and stress in certain loan categories.

questions.question: Which Act is being amended by the Bill to delink petroleum from mining operations and ensure lease stability?
questions.explanation: The Oilfields (Regulation and Development) Act, of 1948, is a crucial legislation that regulates the oil and gas sector in India. The Bill aims to amend this Act to delink petroleum from mining operations, ensure lease stability, and decriminalize certain offences. This amendment is expected to attract foreign investments and provide regulatory clarity, but critics argue that it lacks a long-term vision for energy security and domestic exploration incentives.

questions.question: What is the age group targeted by the PM-YUVA 3.0 scheme for mentoring young authors?
questions.explanation: The PM-YUVA 3.0 scheme, launched by the Ministry of Education, targets young authors below the age of 30 years. The scheme aims to promote reading, writing, and the book culture in India while projecting Indian literature on a global scale. It focuses on training young authors to contribute to national and international literary conversations. By supporting themes like the contribution of the Indian diaspora, Indian knowledge systems, and modern Indian history, the program aligns with NEP 2020, empowering young minds to become future leaders.

questions.question: Which virus primarily spreads through the urine, droppings, and saliva of rodents, causing life-threatening illnesses?
questions.explanation: Hantavirus is a rare but severe virus that primarily spreads through rodent waste, including urine, droppings, and saliva. It can cause serious illnesses such as Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome (HPS) and Hemorrhagic Fever with Renal Syndrome (HFRS). The virus is typically transmitted through aerosolization of rodent waste, direct contact, or rarely through bites. Preventive measures, such as keeping homes free of rodents and wearing protective gear, are crucial to reduce the risk of infection, particularly for high-risk groups like farmers and hikers.

questions.question: According to the World Air Quality Report 2024, what is India's ranking among the most polluted countries globally?
questions.explanation: According to the World Air Quality Report 2024, India was ranked as the 5th most polluted country globally, showing a slight improvement from its 3rd place position in 2023. Despite the improvement, pollution levels in India remain concerning, with cities like Delhi continuing to suffer from extremely high particulate matter (PM2.5) concentrations. This persistent pollution has significant health and environmental impacts, with major contributors including vehicle emissions, industrial pollution, and biomass burning, particularly in northern India.

questions.question: Which country hosted the 6th edition of Exercise Dharma Guardian?
questions.explanation: The 6th edition of Exercise Dharma Guardian, a bilateral military exercise between India and Japan, was successfully held in Japan. This exercise is aimed at enhancing defence cooperation and interoperability between the two countries, focusing on counter-terrorism training in urban settings, as well as United Nations Peacekeeping Operations (UNPKO) and Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) drills. The exercise is conducted alternately in India and Japan to improve combat readiness and strengthen bilateral military ties.

questions.question: What is the highest MGNREGS wage rate currently paid in states?
questions.explanation: The highest MGNREGS wage rate, currently ₹374 per day, is paid in states like Haryana and Sikkim. These wages are linked to the Consumer Price Index (CPI) for agricultural labourers but have not been fully adjusted for inflation. The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Rural Development has recommended revising these wages to ensure they better reflect the rising cost of living and make the scheme more effective in supporting rural livelihood security. Additionally, pending wage dues and budget constraints have impacted the scheme's overall effectiveness.

questions.question: In which year was India's Patents Act, Section 3(d) introduced, which prevents the evergreening of patents?
questions.explanation: India's Patents Act, of 1970, includes Section 3(d), which was designed to prevent the evergreening of patents. Evergreening refers to the practice of making slight modifications to existing drugs to extend their patent life, thus hindering the production of generic versions. The introduction of this section has been a key policy to protect the generic pharmaceutical industry in India, making medications more affordable and available, especially in the global market.

questions.question: Which organization is responsible for the PUNCH mission, aimed at studying the Sun's corona?
questions.explanation: NASA is responsible for the PUNCH (Polarimeter to Unify the Corona and Heliosphere) mission, which focuses on studying the Sun's corona, an important aspect of solar activity. The mission is part of a broader trend of increasing solar studies due to the Sun's nearing solar maximum. Solar maximum, when solar activity is at its peak, can affect satellite communications and power grids. NASA's PUNCH mission is one of the three major solar missions initiated since 2023 to better understand solar phenomena such as sunspots, solar flares, and coronal mass ejections.

questions.question: Which two countries have partnered to advance research on healthy brain ageing using AI and biomarkers?
questions.explanation: India and the United Kingdom have partnered to advance research on healthy brain ageing through the integration of AI, biomarkers, and diverse population studies. The collaboration involves the Centre for Brain Research (CBR) at IISc and the UK Dementia Research Institute (UK DRI). Their focus is on understanding brain health, preventing cognitive decline, and improving early diagnosis and treatments for neurodegenerative diseases. The partnership also includes cross-institutional collaborations, structured internships, and resource-sharing to enhance global brain health research.

questions.question: What does the APAAR ID aim to standardize?
questions.explanation: The Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry (APAAR) ID is designed to standardize student records by assigning a unique 12-digit ID to each student. This ID links academic records to platforms like DigiLocker and the Academic Bank of Credits, ensuring streamlined access and verification of records across various educational institutions. While APAAR aims to simplify academic transitions, it has raised concerns about data privacy and implementation, particularly regarding its integration with Aadhaar and the handling of sensitive personal information.

questions.question: Which state’s team won the 15th Hockey India Senior Women National Championship in 2025?
questions.explanation: Hockey Jharkhand triumphed in the 15th Hockey India Senior Women National Championship 2025, claiming their first-ever national title. They defeated the defending champions, Hockey Haryana, in a thrilling final that ended in a 1-1 draw, leading to a penalty shootout. Jharkhand won the shootout 4-3, with contributions from players like Rajni Kerketta, Nirali Kujur, Binima Dhan, and Captain Alebla Rani Toppo. This victory marked a historic achievement for Jharkhand in Indian women's hockey, as it was their first title after a previous runner-up finish in 2015.

questions.question: Which country has entered into negotiations with India for a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) to enhance economic cooperation?
questions.explanation: India and New Zealand have officially launched negotiations for a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement (FTA) to strengthen their bilateral relations and boost economic cooperation. This agreement aims to enhance supply chain integration, expand market access, and promote economic resilience for both nations. The FTA negotiations were announced in March 2025 during a meeting between Indian Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and New Zealand Trade Minister Todd McClay. This agreement marks India's second FTA in the Oceania region, following the India-Australia Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement signed in 2022.

questions.question: Who inaugurated the first-ever Fit India Carnival held at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, New Delhi?
questions.explanation: The first-ever Fit India Carnival was inaugurated by Dr Mansukh Mandaviya, the Union Minister for Youth Affairs and Sports, at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi on March 16, 2025. This three-day event aimed to promote physical fitness, mental well-being, and healthy lifestyle choices among citizens. It featured a variety of activities such as fitness challenges, traditional martial arts demonstrations, and wellness programs. High-profile participants like Bollywood actor Ayushmann Khurrana and wrestling champion Sangram Singh contributed to the event's success.

questions.question: Which team won their second Women's Premier League title by defeating Delhi Capitals in the final?
questions.explanation: Mumbai Indians won their second Women’s Premier League title by defeating Delhi Capitals by 8 runs in the final at Brabourne Stadium. Harmanpreet Kaur's impressive knock of 66 and Nat Sciver-Brunt’s all-round performance, which included three key wickets, were crucial in securing the victory. Harmanpreet Kaur was named Player of the Match, while Sciver-Brunt earned the Player of the Tournament and the Orange Cap for her outstanding performances throughout the season.

questions.question: Which institution is home to the Hyperloop testing facility where the world’s longest high-speed tube is being developed?
questions.explanation: The Hyperloop testing facility where the 410-meter-long Hyperloop tube is being developed is located at IIT Madras. This tube is set to become the world’s longest high-speed tube. The project is supported by the Indian Railways Ministry, with funding and technical assistance, while the Integral Coach Factory (ICF) Chennai is responsible for developing the necessary electronic technology for the Hyperloop system. IIT Madras is also known for its innovations in fields like semiconductors, artificial intelligence, and data science, as showcased during the Open House 2025 exhibition.

questions.question: On which date is National Vaccination Day observed annually in India?
questions.explanation: National Vaccination Day is observed annually on March 16 to emphasize India’s commitment to public health through immunisation. This day marks the first dose of the oral polio vaccine administered under the Pulse Polio Immunisation Programme in 1995. The day serves to raise awareness about the importance of vaccines, honour healthcare workers, and encourage community participation in immunisation drives. It is a reminder of the importance of vaccination in eliminating vaccine-preventable diseases and protecting future generations.

questions.question: In which country have over 300 measles cases been reported in 2025?
questions.explanation: In 2025, the United States has reported over 300 cases of measles, a highly contagious viral disease. Measles can lead to severe complications such as blindness, pneumonia, and death, particularly due to Vitamin A deficiency. The disease spreads through airborne transmission, and vaccination with the MMR (measles, mumps, rubella) vaccine is the key preventive measure.

questions.question: In which state was the Lachit Barphukan Police Academy inaugurated by Amit Shah?
questions.explanation: The Lachit Barphukan Police Academy was inaugurated by Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Dergaon, Assam. This state-of-the-art facility aims to enhance law enforcement training. It spans 340 acres and includes modern infrastructure such as smart classrooms, a weapon training simulator, research labs, and a modern parade ground.

questions.question: Where will the MoU for implementing the Pradhan Mantri Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) be signed on March 18, 2025?
questions.explanation: The MoU for implementing the Pradhan Mantri Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) will be signed in New Delhi on March 18, 2025. This significant development involves the establishment of 1,139 Urban Ayushman Arogya Mandirs (U-AAMs), the upgrading of 553 mohalla clinics, and the creation of new healthcare facilities. The agreement comes after a legal and political process, where the new Delhi government has decided to move forward with this initiative, aiming to improve primary healthcare services across the region.

questions.question: Which country reached a historic peace agreement with Azerbaijan on March 13, 2025, to end nearly four decades of conflict?
questions.explanation: Armenia and Azerbaijan reached a historic peace agreement on March 13, 2025, aimed at ending their long-standing conflict over the Nagorno-Karabakh region. The peace treaty was a significant step toward establishing stability in the South Caucasus. Although both nations agreed on the text of the treaty, Azerbaijan called for constitutional amendments in Armenia before the official signing could occur, introducing some uncertainty in the timeline for finalizing the agreement. This treaty aims to end nearly four decades of tension and hostilities between the two nations.

questions.question: Where was the 353rd Governing Body Meeting of the International Labour Organisation (ILO) held?
questions.explanation: The 353rd Governing Body Meeting of the International Labour Organisation (ILO) took place in Geneva, Switzerland, from March 10 to March 20, 2025. India participated actively in the meeting, with Ms Sumita Dawra, Secretary of the Ministry of Labour & Employment, leading the Indian delegation. During the meeting, India highlighted its achievements in areas such as social protection, fair migration pathways, and living wages, while supporting various ILO initiatives. The meeting was an important event for fostering global collaboration on labour and employment issues.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Vice Chairman of TAFE?
questions.explanation: Dr. Lakshmi Venu has been appointed as the Vice Chairman of Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited (TAFE). With her vast experience in the farm mechanization and auto component sectors, she has been instrumental in various leadership roles, including serving as a Director at TAFE. Additionally, Dr. Lakshmi is the Managing Director of Sundaram-Clayton Ltd. Her appointment reflects TAFE's commitment to strengthening its leadership team and expanding its global presence. Dr. Lakshmi's academic and professional achievements further highlight her impact in the corporate and industrial sectors.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Faya Palaeolandscape, nominated for UNESCO status?
questions.explanation: The Faya Palaeolandscape, located in Sharjah, has been nominated for UNESCO status. It provides evidence of human survival in extreme desert conditions for over 210,000 years. Excavations at the site have uncovered 18 phases of human occupation, stone tools, burial sites, and trade links with Mesopotamia and the Indus Valley, offering a unique insight into early human adaptation to desert life. Geological formations, water sources, and climate shifts were essential in sustaining these early human settlements and trade connections.

questions.question: Which company topped the AI-driven Revenue Cycle Management rankings in the Black Book 2025 report?
questions.explanation: IKS Health was ranked as the leader in AI-driven Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) in the 2025 Black Book Research report. The company excelled in claims processing and denial prevention and was ranked No.1 among 20 vendors. IKS Health supports over 700 U.S. healthcare organizations with its AI-powered RCM solutions. The rankings were determined based on a survey of 1,037 RCM professionals working across hospitals, health systems, and medical groups.

questions.question: What was the WPI inflation rate in India for February 2025?
questions.explanation: In February 2025, India's Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation stood at 2.38%. This increase was driven by higher prices in food products, textiles, and manufacturing. Additionally, the WPI Food Index dropped, and food inflation declined from 7.47% to 5.94%. The Fuel & Power index rose by 2.12%, while Primary Articles decreased by 1.74%, and Manufactured Products saw a 0.42% increase month-over-month.

questions.question: Which organization launched the "Frontier Seed" program to enhance private sector growth in the Pacific region?
questions.explanation: The "Frontier Seed" program was launched by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to promote private sector growth and economic resilience in the Pacific region. The initiative focuses on strengthening local capital markets and supporting sustainable business ventures. ADB's initial commitment of $4 million, along with support from international partners, aims to foster economic growth, attract investment, and create jobs. This program aligns with ADB's broader mission to support sustainable infrastructure and regional development across its member countries.

questions.question: Which state government launched the 'Rajiv Yuva Vikasam' scheme to promote self-employment?
questions.explanation: The Telangana Government launched the 'Rajiv Yuva Vikasam' scheme with the goal of promoting self-employment and economic development. This initiative was launched by Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy aims to empower unemployed youth, particularly from marginalized communities, by providing financial assistance for establishing their own businesses. The scheme is backed by a ₹6,000 crore budget and aims to benefit five lakh youth across the state. It includes a tiered subsidy structure, offering financial aid of up to ₹3 lakh, along with affordable loan options for youth entrepreneurs.

questions.question: Which state is set to introduce a more stringent anti-conversion law?
questions.explanation: The BJP-led government in Chhattisgarh, under Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai, is working on introducing a more stringent anti-conversion law to prevent illegal religious conversions. While the state already has the Chhattisgarh Freedom of Religion Act, 1968, the new law aims to address issues such as conversions through coercion, inducements, or gatherings under the guise of “faith healing.” This move follows political discussions and allegations regarding foreign-funded NGOs involved in conversion activities. The new law is intended to enforce stricter legal actions against unlawful conversions in the state.

questions.question: By which year is India projected to become the third-largest economy in the world, according to Morgan Stanley?
questions.explanation: According to Morgan Stanley, India’s GDP is projected to reach $5.7 trillion by 2028, making it the third-largest economy globally, surpassing Germany and Japan. Currently, India is ranked fifth but is expected to overtake Japan by 2026 to become the fourth-largest economy. This growth is driven by strong macroeconomic policies, improved infrastructure, and a growing consumer market, which will increase India’s share of global GDP from 3.5% in 2023 to 4.5% in 2029.

questions.question: Where was the Shri S Ramakrishnan Centre of Excellence in Fluid and Thermal Science Research launched?
questions.explanation: The Shri S Ramakrishnan Centre of Excellence in Fluid and Thermal Science Research was launched at IIT Madras. This state-of-the-art facility aims to address thermal challenges in space applications, particularly focusing on heat dissipation in satellites and launch vehicles. The centre is part of a collaboration between ISRO and IIT Madras, designed to enhance India’s self-reliance in space technologies and contribute to the country's future deep-space missions. The centre will also foster industry-academia collaborations to improve space research capabilities.

questions.question: Which bank is launching a dedicated unit to handle project financing for AI, fintech, and e-commerce?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) is setting up a specialized unit to handle project financing for emerging sectors such as artificial intelligence (AI), e-commerce, and fintech. This initiative is part of SBI's broader strategy to diversify its project finance portfolio beyond traditional infrastructure projects. The bank plans to complete the setup of this unit within a year, recruit specialized professionals, and appoint an external consultant for its successful execution. The unit will be named the "Center of Excellence for Project Financing" and will provide financing solutions to new-age industries.

questions.question: Which company appointed Lip-Bu Tan as its new CEO effective March 18, 2025?
questions.explanation: Intel Corporation appointed Lip-Bu Tan as its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO), effective March 18, 2025. This leadership change marks a pivotal moment for the company as Tan, a veteran technology leader with significant experience in the semiconductor industry, takes over from Interim Co-CEOs David Zinsner and Michelle Johnston Holthaus. Tan’s leadership style, rooted in customer-centric strategies and his prior success at Cadence Design Systems, is expected to help drive Intel’s turnaround and innovation in the competitive semiconductor market.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the CEO of Anusandhan National Research Foundation (ANRF)?
questions.explanation: Dr. Shivkumar Kalyanaraman has been appointed as the CEO of the Anusandhan National Research Foundation (ANRF), succeeding Prof. Abhay Karandikar. Dr. Kalyanaraman is an alumnus of IIT Madras and Ohio State and has previously held key roles at Microsoft. He is also a Fellow of IEEE, INAE, and ACM.

questions.question: Which company partnered with GIC Housing Finance to offer credit life insurance to home loan customers?
questions.explanation: Canara HSBC Life Insurance has partnered with GIC Housing Finance (GICHF) to provide credit life insurance to home loan customers. Through this collaboration, GICHF customers are offered the 'Group Asset Secure' product, which provides financial protection against loan liabilities. This partnership aims to support India's growing homeownership aspirations by integrating strong insurance solutions into the home loan process, ensuring customers are financially protected in case of unforeseen circumstances.

questions.question: Which city's police force has launched the 'Shishtachar' squad to combat eve-teasing?
questions.explanation: The Delhi Police has introduced 'Shishtachar' squads across all districts to strengthen women's security in public spaces. These specialized teams are designed to prevent and tackle harassment cases effectively by conducting regular patrols, covert surveillance, and collaboration with the public. The initiative focuses on prevention, intervention, and victim assistance to create a secure environment for women in the capital.

questions.question: Which organization developed the 32-bit microprocessors Vikram 3201 and Kalpana 3201 for space applications?
questions.explanation: ISRO (Indian Space Research Organisation) has developed two 32-bit microprocessors, Vikram 3201 and Kalpana 3201, for space applications. The Vikram 3201 is India's first fully indigenous 32-bit microprocessor, specifically qualified for use in launch vehicles. This development is a significant advancement from the 16-bit Vikram 1601, which has been operational in ISRO's avionics systems since 2009. These microprocessors will enhance the capabilities of ISRO's space missions and technologies.

questions.question: Which country is partnering with India for the VARUNA 2025 naval exercise?
questions.explanation: VARUNA 2025 is a bilateral naval exercise between India and France, aimed at strengthening their maritime cooperation. It is the 23rd edition of this annual exercise, which has been held since 2001. The exercise showcases various naval capabilities, including aircraft carriers, fighter aircraft, and submarines. It focuses on improving coordination in air defence, anti-submarine warfare, and surface combat. VARUNA 2025 reflects the strong naval partnership between the two nations and their shared commitment to maintaining a free, open, and secure maritime environment in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: Which organization partnered with DigiLocker to reduce unclaimed assets in the Indian securities market?
questions.explanation: SEBI (Securities and Exchange Board of India) has partnered with DigiLocker to help investors store their demat and mutual fund holdings digitally, thus reducing the occurrence of unclaimed assets in the Indian securities market. This initiative includes a nomination facility that allows legal heirs to seamlessly transition assets upon the investor's demise. Additionally, KYC Registration Agencies (KRAs) will verify and notify the nominees, ensuring smooth access to financial information and streamlining the process for asset inheritance.

questions.question: In which country is the Kabaddi World Cup 2025 being hosted?
questions.explanation: The Kabaddi World Cup 2025 is being hosted in England, marking a historic milestone as it is the first time the tournament is being held outside of Asia. The event will take place across several venues, including Birmingham, Coventry, Walsall, and Wolverhampton. This decision reflects Kabaddi's growing popularity and global appeal, as the sport traditionally has its strongholds in countries like India, Pakistan, and Iran. Hosting the tournament in England aims to expand the sport’s reach in Europe and other parts of the world.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with UIDAI to enhance Aadhaar services with AI-powered solutions?
questions.explanation: UIDAI has partnered with Sarvam AI, a Bengaluru-based Generative AI company, to enhance Aadhaar services. This collaboration, starting on March 18, 2025, aims to introduce AI-driven voice interactions, real-time fraud detection, and multilingual support to improve the security, efficiency, and accessibility of Aadhaar services. The partnership focuses on offering AI-powered solutions while ensuring data privacy and sovereignty, with a custom-built GenAI stack operating securely within UIDAI's infrastructure. The initiative is a part of UIDAI's commitment to incorporating cutting-edge technologies for a better user experience.

questions.question: On which date is World Sparrow Day celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: World Sparrow Day is celebrated annually on March 20th to raise awareness about the declining population of house sparrows and to encourage conservation efforts. The event, first initiated by Nature Forever Society in 2010, has grown in importance and recognition worldwide. It aims to highlight the threats to sparrow populations, promote bird-friendly urban planning, and encourage conservation campaigns. By celebrating this day, people from over 50 countries work together to protect sparrows and ensure their survival in both urban and rural environments.

questions.question: Which company launched PBMoney to boost financial wellness?
questions.explanation: Paisabazaar launched PBMoney, a platform designed to help users improve their financial wellness by offering a unified view of their financial accounts. It combines data from bank accounts, mutual funds, stocks, and more into a single dashboard. The platform also provides personalized investment advisory services powered by advanced algorithms, helping users make better financial decisions. Built on the Account Aggregator framework, PBMoney will eventually integrate insurance and GST data for a more comprehensive financial overview.

questions.question: Which bank signed an MoU with the RBI to promote trade in local currencies?
questions.explanation: The Bank of Mauritius (BOM) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to facilitate trade transactions in Indian Rupees (INR) and Mauritian Rupees (MUR). This agreement is aimed at promoting bilateral trade and financial cooperation between India and Mauritius by enabling transactions in their respective local currencies, reducing costs and improving efficiency in cross-border trade. The MoU is a step toward strengthening the economic and financial ties between the two nations.

questions.question: Which company partnered with Observer Research Foundation to launch the book "Trading Blue Gold: A Blueprint for Water Credit Valuation in India"?
questions.explanation: Bisleri International has partnered with Observer Research Foundation to launch the book "Trading Blue Gold: A Blueprint for Water Credit Valuation in India". This book focuses on water credits, a market-based mechanism that promotes sustainable water management practices. The publication aims to explore the expansion of the water credit framework beyond the beverage industry, highlighting Bisleri's commitment to environmental sustainability.

questions.question: On which date is Ordnance Factory Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: Ordnance Factory Day is observed every year on March 18 to commemorate the establishment of the first Ordnance Factory in colonial India near Kolkata in 1801. This day highlights the crucial role of Indian Ordnance Factories in enhancing the country's defence sector. The first-ever Ordnance Factories Day was celebrated on March 15, 1802, marking a significant milestone in India's defence history. The celebration emphasizes the research, development, and production capabilities of the Indian Ordnance Factories, which continue to support the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force.

questions.question: Which state government signed an MoU with the Gates Foundation for AI and development initiatives?
questions.explanation: The Government of Andhra Pradesh signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation in New Delhi. This collaboration aims to integrate Artificial Intelligence (AI), digital technologies, and data-driven governance across various sectors like healthcare, education, agriculture, and employment. By leveraging AI and digital solutions, the government intends to enhance service delivery, promote innovation, and drive efficiency in public administration, with a particular focus on healthcare and education reforms to improve outcomes for the state's residents.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Executive Director (ED) of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI)?
questions.explanation: Indranil Bhattacharyya was appointed as the Executive Director (ED) of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on March 19, 2025. In his new role, he will oversee the Department of Economic and Policy Research (DEPR), which plays a crucial role in shaping monetary policies and conducting economic research. Bhattacharyya brings with him nearly three decades of experience in critical areas such as monetary policy, fiscal policy, banking regulations, and international economic relations, making him a key figure in the RBI's policy-making processes.

questions.question: Which country is now India's largest source of remittances, according to the RBI survey?
questions.explanation: According to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Remittances Survey for 2023-24, the United States has overtaken the United Arab Emirates (UAE) as India's largest source of remittances. The US contributed 27.7% of total remittances to India, surpassing the UAE's contribution of 19.2%. This shift is attributed to an increase in skilled professionals migrating to advanced economies, leading to higher remittance inflows from countries like the US, the UK, Canada, and Australia, while Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) nations' share has decreased.

questions.question: Who inaugurated the National Dope Testing Laboratory (NDTL) Annual Conference-2025?
questions.explanation: Dr Mansukh Mandaviya inaugurated the NDTL Annual Conference-2025, where the focus was on innovations and challenges in anti-doping science. During the event, he highlighted India's dedication to promoting clean sports, raising awareness about doping, and emphasizing early education, especially in rural areas. His involvement underscores the government's proactive approach to tackling doping-related issues in sports.

questions.question: Which country has ranked as the world's happiest for the eighth consecutive year?
questions.explanation: Finland has been ranked as the happiest country in the world for the eighth consecutive year, according to the 2024 World Happiness Report. India is ranked 118th in the 2025 report, reflecting challenges in areas like social support and economic disparity. This ranking is based on various factors such as social trust, economic stability, life expectancy, and freedom to make life choices. Despite challenges like increased geopolitical tensions due to its proximity to Russia, Finland continues to maintain high levels of happiness among its citizens, demonstrating the importance of social support and trust in contributing to overall well-being.

questions.question: In which state has the Union Cabinet approved the establishment of a new Ammonia-Urea Complex?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet approved the establishment of a new 12.7 LMT Brownfield Ammonia-Urea Complex at Brahmaputra Valley Fertilizer Corporation Limited in Namrup, Assam. The project, costing Rs. 10,601.40 Crore, aims to boost Urea production capacity, particularly benefiting the North-East and nearby regions. Additionally, the complex will enhance energy efficiency and create employment opportunities, contributing to both local and regional development.

questions.question: What is the name of the challenge launched by MeitY and Drone Federation India to enhance drone innovation?
questions.explanation: The National Innovation Challenge for Drone Application and Research (NIDAR) was launched by MeitY and the Drone Federation India under the 'SwaYaan' initiative. This challenge aims to boost India's capabilities in Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS), particularly in applications such as agriculture, disaster management, and healthcare. NIDAR is part of India's goal to become a global drone hub by 2030, promoting innovation and research in the drone industry.

questions.question: In which state have melioidosis outbreaks been linked to environmental factors such as temperature, rainfall, and solar radiation?
questions.explanation: The study on melioidosis outbreaks highlights how environmental factors like temperature, rainfall, and solar radiation in Odisha contribute to the peak occurrence of the infection during and after the monsoon season. The state's agricultural areas and extreme weather conditions increase human exposure to melioidosis-causing bacteria, with districts such as Cuttack and Khordha showing a higher rate of infection. This emphasizes the impact of climate and geography on disease transmission in the region.

questions.question: On which date is UN French Language Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: UN French Language Day is celebrated on March 20, highlighting the significance of multilingualism, cultural diversity, and education. This day commemorates the creation of the Agency for Cultural and Technical Cooperation (ACCT) in 1970, which later became the International Organization of La Francophonie (OIF). The OIF plays a vital role in promoting the French language and cultural cooperation across its 88 member states. The celebration emphasizes the role of education in sustainable development and global peace, contributing to the broader goals of multilingualism within the UN.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Happiness celebrated?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Happiness is celebrated every year on March 20. This day was established to promote happiness as a fundamental human goal, with the United Nations emphasizing the importance of well-being and sustainable development for global happiness. The celebration encourages governments, organizations, and individuals to prioritize happiness in policies and daily life, making it an essential occasion for promoting a more inclusive and balanced approach to economic growth and overall human well-being.

questions.question: In which state was the new plant species Uniyala keralensis discovered?
questions.explanation: The new plant species, Uniyala keralensis, was discovered in the Agasthyamala Biosphere Reserve in Kerala. The species is endemic to southwest India and was first collected in 1998. It has distinctive light purple flowers and stands out from similar species in the Uniyala genus. The species thrives in open areas of the Western Ghats, with an estimated population of around 5,000 individuals, highlighting the region's rich biodiversity.

questions.question: By what percentage is Tata Sons increasing its stake in Tata Play?
questions.explanation: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Tata Sons’ plan to acquire an additional 10% stake in Tata Play from Baytree Investments (Mauritius) Pte Ltd. This move is part of Tata Sons' strategy to strengthen its position in India's digital entertainment and content distribution market. The acquisition will enhance Tata Play’s market standing, especially in providing Pay TV and OTT services, positioning the company more prominently in the growing digital entertainment sector.

questions.question: Where were the six mobile dental clinics flagged off from?
questions.explanation: The six mobile dental clinics were launched by Delhi Health Minister Pankaj Kumar Singh to provide free oral healthcare services to residents. These clinics were flagged off at Maulana Azad Institute of Dental Sciences (MAIDS) in New Delhi, with the aim of enhancing access to dental care, particularly in underserved areas like slums.

questions.question: What event is celebrated in the book ‘March of Glory’ released on March 18, 2025?
questions.explanation: The book ‘March of Glory’ was launched to celebrate the 50th anniversary of India's historic victory in the 1975 Hockey World Cup. It details the journey of the Indian hockey team, including key matches, player quotes, and over 250 rare photographs, documenting their path to glory in Kuala Lumpur. The launch event was attended by various hockey legends and enthusiasts, with Hockey India president Dilip Tirkey emphasizing the importance of the book in preserving the rich history of Indian hockey for future generations.

questions.question: Who was honoured with the Knight’s Cross of the Order of Dannebrog by the King of Denmark?
questions.explanation: Vijay Sankar, the Honorary Consul General of Denmark for Southern India and Chairman of The Sanmar Group, was awarded the Knight’s Cross of the Order of Dannebrog by the King of Denmark. This prestigious honour recognized his exceptional consular services and significant contributions to strengthening Indo-Danish relations. The award was presented at a ceremony held in Chennai on March 18, 2025. This recognition also highlights the Sankar family's longstanding association with Denmark’s consular services, spanning three generations.

questions.question: In which city did the police launch the 'Shishtachar' squads to enhance women's safety?
questions.explanation: The Delhi Police launched the 'Shishtachar' initiative with 30 squads patrolling hotspots to tackle eve-teasing and harassment in public spaces. The squads, consisting of both male and female officers, focus on law enforcement, victim protection, and public awareness, without imposing cultural morality. This initiative aims to prevent harassment, intervene in unsafe situations, and promote community collaboration to ensure women’s safety in New Delhi, showcasing the city’s commitment to addressing issues related to women's safety in public spaces.

questions.question: Which country became the first team to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup after the host nations?
questions.explanation: Japan became the first team to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup after the host nations (United States, Canada, and Mexico). This achievement was secured with a 2-0 victory over Bahrain on March 20, 2025, at Saitama Stadium. Goals from Daichi Kamada and Takefusa Kubo in the second half helped Japan secure its spot in the tournament, marking its eighth consecutive World Cup appearance. Coach Hajime Moriyasu emphasized the need for further improvement, while Bahrain's coach praised Japan's strength and predicted a strong performance in the World Cup.

questions.question: Which country sent $1 million worth of machinery to Suriname to support the Passion fruit industry?
questions.explanation: India sent $1 million worth of machinery to Suriname to boost the Passion fruit industry as part of its development partnership with the country. This initiative is aimed at enhancing agricultural productivity and strengthening bilateral relations between India and Suriname. This step highlights India's involvement in agricultural development across various countries. Suriname, located in South America, benefits from India's assistance in improving its agricultural infrastructure.

questions.question: What is the new minimum investment for Zero Coupon Zero Principal (ZCZP) instruments on the Social Stock Exchange (SSE)?
questions.explanation: SEBI reduced the minimum investment for Zero Coupon Zero Principal (ZCZP) instruments on the Social Stock Exchange (SSE) from Rs 10,000 to Rs 1,000. This change aims to make social impact investing more accessible to a broader audience, allowing more people to contribute to non-profit organizations listed on the SSE. ZCZP instruments enable donations to these organizations while promoting social initiatives. This initiative helps encourage greater participation in funding social causes, making it easier for individuals to engage in impactful investments.

questions.question: Which company launched the 'Emerge' cohort to support energy startups?
questions.explanation: BPCL launched the 'Emerge' cohort under the Ankur Fund to support startups in the Energy Efficiency and City Gas Distribution (CGD) sectors. The initiative focuses on startups with Proof of Concept (PoC) or Minimum Viable Product (MVP) solutions in Oil & Gas, especially those utilizing AI-driven energy management, predictive maintenance, and heat recovery. Since 2016, BPCL Ankur has funded 30 startups with Rs. 28 crores, contributing to innovation and development in the energy sector. This reflects BPCL’s ongoing commitment to fostering advancements in energy efficiency and sustainability.

questions.question: When is World Day for Glaciers celebrated?
questions.explanation: World Day for Glaciers is celebrated on March 21, as declared by the United Nations through resolution A/RES/77/158. This day aims to raise awareness about the critical role glaciers play in our ecosystem, including their contributions to freshwater storage, regulating sea levels, and supporting biodiversity. It also emphasizes the urgent need for glacier conservation due to the threats posed by climate change, which is causing glaciers to melt at an alarming rate.

questions.question: On which date is World Poetry Day celebrated globally?
questions.explanation: World Poetry Day is celebrated globally on March 21 to emphasize the importance of poetry as a universal medium of expression. Established by UNESCO in 1999, the day promotes the reading, writing, publishing, and teaching of poetry, while acknowledging its role in preserving cultural heritage and fostering peace. The theme for World Poetry Day 2025 is “Poetry as a Bridge for Peace and Inclusion,” reflecting poetry’s role in encouraging social harmony and cultural exchange. March 21 was chosen by UNESCO to unify global efforts in celebrating the art of poetry.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination observed?
questions.explanation: The International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination is observed annually on March 21. This day commemorates the tragic Sharpeville Massacre that occurred on March 21, 1960, in South Africa, during a peaceful protest against apartheid laws. The day highlights progress made in combating racial discrimination and acknowledges the ongoing challenges. The year 2025 marks the 60th anniversary of the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD), a key treaty in the fight against racism.

questions.question: Which bank launched the ACE feature for smart mutual fund investments?
questions.explanation: IDFC FIRST Bank launched the ACE feature on its mobile banking app, designed to assist customers with DIY mutual fund investing. This feature offers access to over 2,500 mutual funds, providing detailed information on fund categories, historical performance, holdings, and expert ratings. ACE delivers a premium user experience by integrating public data, insights, and a seamless investment journey, allowing customers to make informed and efficient investment decisions. This initiative aims to enhance customer experience in the growing space of mutual fund investments.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Forests celebrated globally?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Forests is celebrated globally on March 21 each year. In 2025, the theme for the day is "Forests and Food," which highlights the significant connection between forests and food security, as well as their crucial role in providing resources such as fruits, seeds, and wild meat for communities worldwide. The day aims to raise awareness about forest conservation, sustainability, and their vital contributions to the environment and human well-being. The United Nations established this day in 2012 to encourage action toward protecting forests.

questions.question: Which Indian state has inaugurated its first scientific coal mining block, marking a shift from traditional rat-hole mining?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya has taken a significant step towards reviving its coal mining industry by inaugurating its first scientific coal mining block, "Saryngkham-A", at Byndihati in East Jaintia Hills. This move marks a shift from the hazardous and unscientific rat-hole mining practices that were banned by the National Green Tribunal (NGT) in 2014. The new scientific coal mining approach prioritizes safety, environmental protection, and regulatory compliance.

questions.question: Which state approved a 100% salary hike for the CM, ministers, and MLAs?
questions.explanation: Karnataka has approved a 100% salary increase for the Chief Minister, ministers, and Members of the Legislative Assembly (MLAs). This decision has been a topic of considerable debate and is based on the Karnataka Ministers’ Salaries and Allowances (Amendment) Bill 2025 and Karnataka Legislature Members’ Salaries Bill 2025. Home Minister G Parameshwara justified the hike by pointing out the rising expenses faced by lawmakers.

questions.question: Where will the 58-foot statue of Potti Sriramulu be installed?
questions.explanation: A 58-foot statue of Potti Sriramulu, a key figure in the formation of Andhra Pradesh, will be installed in Amaravati as a tribute to his pivotal role. Sriramulu's 58-day hunger strike in 1952 was crucial for the state's creation. The statue, along with a memorial, will be completed before his next birth anniversary. The installation of this statue honours his sacrifice and highlights his contribution to the formation of the state, along with further developments planned in his native village.

questions.question: Which country’s army took full control of the Presidential Palace in its capital, Khartoum?
questions.explanation: The Sudanese army took full control of the Presidential Palace in Khartoum after months of intense conflict with the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF). The situation escalated with search operations around the palace amidst ongoing gunfire. This ongoing conflict has led to a severe humanitarian crisis in Sudan, with widespread famine and disease affecting many people across the country.
