questions.question: On which date is the World Day for Safety and Health at Work observed annually?
questions.explanation: The World Day for Safety and Health at Work is observed every year on April 28th. It was initiated by the International Labour Organization (ILO) in 2003 to highlight the importance of maintaining safe and healthy working environments. The day serves as a global platform to raise awareness and promote action to prevent workplace accidents and diseases. For the year 2025, the chosen theme is “Revolutionising Health and Safety: The Role of AI and Digitalisation at Work,” which emphasizes how modern technology can enhance workplace safety standards and transform occupational health frameworks around the world.

questions.question: On which date is World Veterinary Day 2025 being observed?
questions.explanation: World Veterinary Day 2025 is observed on April 26 and is dedicated to acknowledging the essential contributions of veterinarians to global health. The observance not only highlights the role of veterinarians in ensuring the health of animals but also underscores their impact on public health and food safety. The 2025 theme, “Animal Health Takes a Team,” emphasizes the collaborative efforts required among professionals to safeguard animal welfare. This day serves as an important reminder of the interconnectedness of animal and human health and promotes awareness of the challenges and responsibilities veterinarians face globally.

questions.question: How many gold medals did India win at the 2nd Asian Yogasana Sport Championship held in New Delhi?
questions.explanation: India achieved a historic milestone by clinching 83 gold medals at the 2nd Asian Yogasana Sport Championship, held at the KD Jadhav Arena in New Delhi. The championship, which concluded on April 27, 2025, saw participation from 21 countries, making India's dominance particularly noteworthy. India not only topped the medal tally by a significant margin but also demonstrated its deep cultural and athletic roots in yogasana. The event featured global recognition of yogasana as a competitive sport, and India's overwhelming performance reinforced its leadership in the discipline, further promoting yogic practices on an international scale.

questions.question: How many individuals were conferred Padma Awards by President Droupadi Murmu during the Civil Investiture Ceremony?
questions.explanation: During the Civil Investiture Ceremony at the Rashtrapati Bhawan, President Droupadi Murmu honoured 71 individuals with the Padma Awards. These prestigious civilian awards—Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan, and Padma Shri—recognize outstanding contributions across various fields, including art, public service, sports, science, and literature. Notable recipients this year include filmmaker Shekhar Kapur, cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin, actor S. Ajith Kumar, and late singer Pankaj Udhas. The wide-ranging backgrounds of the awardees reflect India's commitment to honouring excellence and dedication in diverse spheres of public life, both within the country and internationally.

questions.question: On which date is International Dance Day celebrated annually?
questions.explanation: International Dance Day is celebrated every year on April 29, a date chosen by the Dance Committee of the International Theatre Institute (ITI), the official partner of UNESCO in the performing arts. Established in 1982, this observance highlights the universality of dance as an art form and aims to bring people together across cultures through movement and expression. Each year, a distinguished figure from the world of dance is invited to deliver a message that reflects the importance and transformative power of dance. For 2025, the honour of writing the message has been given to renowned dancer Mikhail Baryshnikov.

questions.question: Which country held the presidency for the 11th BRICS Labour & Employment Ministers’ Meeting where a declaration on AI and climate change was adopted?
questions.explanation: The 11th BRICS Labour & Employment Ministers’ Meeting was presided over by Brazil, highlighting the country’s role in shaping the global discourse on pressing labour issues. During this meeting, member nations adopted a declaration that addressed the dual challenges of artificial intelligence's growing role in the workplace and the impact of climate change on employment trends. Brazil’s leadership in this context underscores its commitment to facilitating multilateral cooperation among BRICS countries to prepare labour forces for future disruptions and transformations in the global job market.

questions.question: In which city was the 53rd meeting of the International Charter Space and Major Disasters, organized by NRSC/ISRO, held?
questions.explanation: The 53rd meeting of the International Charter Space and Major Disasters was hosted in Hyderabad by the National Remote Sensing Centre (NRSC) under ISRO. This event marked a significant moment as ISRO assumed leadership of the Charter for a six-month term starting April 2025. The Charter is a collaboration among global space agencies to provide satellite data in response to natural and man-made disasters. Hosting the meeting in Hyderabad not only showcased India’s space capabilities but also emphasized the city’s growing importance as a hub for technological and scientific collaboration on an international scale.

questions.question: Which country held the 6th Joint Group of Customs (JGC) Meeting with India in April 2025 to enhance customs cooperation and trade facilitation?
questions.explanation: Bhutan hosted the 6th Joint Group of Customs (JGC) Meeting with India in Thimphu from April 24 to 25, 2025. The bilateral meeting focused on reinforcing customs cooperation, streamlining trade processes, enhancing digitisation, and improving border infrastructure. Bhutan, a landlocked nation, relies heavily on India for trade, with approximately 80% of its overall commerce conducted with its southern neighbour. With ten operational land Customs Stations along the West Bengal and Assam borders, efficient customs procedures are crucial for Bhutan’s economy. The meeting highlighted the mutual commitment to secure, modern, and technology-driven trade facilitation between the two countries.

questions.question: Which football club won the 2024–25 Premier League title with a 5-1 victory over Tottenham Hotspur?
questions.explanation: Liverpool secured their 20th English League title by defeating Tottenham Hotspur 5-1, clinching the 2024–25 Premier League championship with four matches remaining in the season. The triumph was a significant achievement under new manager Arne Slot, who led the team to success in his debut season. Star player Mohamed Salah played a pivotal role throughout the campaign, contributing 28 goals and 18 assists. This dominant performance not only reflected Liverpool’s strength on the field but also reaffirmed their historic status in English football by equaling Manchester United’s record of 20 top-flight league titles.

questions.question: Who has been elected as Canada’s next prime minister, having previously served as the governor of both the Bank of England and the Bank of Canada?
questions.explanation: Mark Carney, a distinguished figure in global finance, has been elected as the next prime minister of Canada. He gained international recognition by becoming the first non-British governor of the Bank of England in its 300-year history. Prior to that, he played a crucial role in leading Canada through the 2008 financial crisis as the governor of the Bank of Canada. His unique blend of economic leadership and public service positioned him as a strong candidate for national leadership, culminating in his successful run for the highest political office in Canada.

questions.question: Which Indian state has received approval for the ₹2,100 crore PM MITRA Textile Park project aimed at boosting the textile industry?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh has been approved for the ₹2,100 crore PM MITRA Textile Park, a significant initiative under the central government’s plan to strengthen India’s textile sector. Spanning 2,100 acres, the park will feature advanced infrastructure including a Zero Liquid Discharge (ZLD) plant, solar-powered energy systems, and Built-To-Suit (BTS) units tailored to industry needs. The project is expected to draw major investments, generate employment, and enhance India's competitiveness in global textile markets. This development highlights Madhya Pradesh’s strategic role in supporting the country’s industrial and economic growth through sustainable and modern manufacturing practices.

questions.question: Which Article of the Indian Constitution, known for its role in constitutional amendments, is discussed in Fali Nariman’s book "Beyond the Courtroom"?
questions.explanation: Fali Nariman’s book "Beyond the Courtroom" delves into key aspects of India’s constitutional law, particularly focusing on Article 368, which deals with the procedure for amending the Constitution. The book traces the article’s evolution through judicial interpretations and its relationship with the Basic Structure Doctrine—a principle established by the Supreme Court to ensure that certain fundamental aspects of the Constitution remain unaltered. Nariman, a legendary constitutional jurist, provides deep insights into these legal frameworks, reaffirming the delicate balance between parliamentary power and constitutional integrity. The work is both a legal reflection and a philosophical journey.

questions.question: Which Indian institute is collaborating with HMD Global and Tejas Networks to launch Direct-to-Mobile (D2M) phones in India?
questions.explanation: IIT Kanpur is playing a pivotal role in the development and launch of Direct-to-Mobile (D2M) phones in India, in partnership with HMD Global and Tejas Networks. This innovative technology enables multimedia content, including OTT and television broadcasts, to be delivered directly to mobile devices without relying on Wi-Fi or mobile data. The initiative is aimed at expanding access to digital content across diverse population segments and aligns with the 'Make in India' vision by promoting indigenous technological solutions. IIT Kanpur’s involvement brings strong research capabilities and technical expertise to the project, reinforcing its reputation as a leader in applied innovation.

questions.question: Which bank has partnered with the Government of India to promote investor education through digital outreach under the IEPFA initiative?
questions.explanation: Kotak Mahindra Bank has entered into a strategic partnership with the Government of India, through the Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority (IEPFA), to promote financial literacy and investor protection. This collaboration, formalized by a Memorandum of Understanding, will leverage Kotak’s extensive digital and physical infrastructure—such as ATMs, mobile apps, websites, and social media—to display educational content. The initiative is designed to raise awareness about responsible investing, financial fraud prevention, and investor rights, and is scheduled for rollout in the 2025–2026 financial year. Importantly, the program imposes no financial burden on IEPFA, highlighting its cost-effective and impactful approach.

questions.question: Which Indian state is home to the Kokborok language, spoken by tribes like the Jamatia and Reangs?
questions.explanation: Kokborok is the native language of the Borok people and is primarily spoken in the state of Tripura, India. It is part of the Sino-Tibetan language family and is widely used among indigenous tribes such as the Jamatia, Reangs, Brus, Noatia, and Rupini. Due to decreasing usage, UNESCO has classified Kokborok as a vulnerable language in its Atlas of the World’s Languages in Danger. The demand to include Kokborok in the 8th Schedule of the Indian Constitution reflects efforts to protect and promote the language through official recognition and broader institutional support.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 'Sachet' app launched by the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA)?
questions.explanation: The 'Sachet' app, launched by the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), is designed to provide early alerts for natural disasters such as floods, cyclones, and earthquakes. It delivers real-time, geotagged warnings and weather updates sourced from the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD), making it a vital tool for disaster preparedness. The app supports 12 Indian languages to ensure accessibility and usability across different regions. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has actively promoted the app, encouraging citizens to use it to stay informed and safe during emergencies, reinforcing the government's commitment to proactive disaster risk reduction and public safety.

questions.question: Which company launched its first satellites under Project Kuiper to compete with Starlink?
questions.explanation: Amazon has officially entered the satellite internet race by launching the first 27 satellites under its Project Kuiper. The initiative is a $10 billion plan to deploy a total of 3,236 satellites in low-Earth orbit by 2026, targeting the delivery of high-speed broadband internet, especially in underserved and rural areas around the world. This move positions Amazon as a direct competitor to SpaceX’s Starlink, which already has a significant number of satellites in orbit. Despite earlier delays, Amazon has confirmed contact with the launched satellites and aims to begin services later this year, signalling a major expansion into space-based internet infrastructure.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the 52nd Chief Justice of India?
questions.explanation: Justice B.R. Gavai has been appointed as the 52nd Chief Justice of India by President Droupadi Murmu on April 30, 2025. He is set to take the oath on May 14, 2025. Justice Gavai will serve as the CJI until November 23, 2025, when he reaches the retirement age of 65. Notably, he became the second person from the Scheduled Caste (SC) community to hold this prestigious position, following Justice K.G. Balakrishnan. Throughout his career, Justice Gavai has contributed to significant rulings on matters such as Article 370, Electoral Bonds, and environmental issues.

questions.question: What is the name of the newly discovered bacterium capable of conducting electricity?
questions.explanation: The newly discovered bacterium, Ca. Electrothrix yaqonensis, was found in the mud flats of Oregon. This bacterium has a unique ability to conduct electricity, thanks to its nickel-based fibers, which facilitate long-distance electron transport. The discovery has significant implications for bioelectronics, such as improving energy-efficient technologies and contributing to pollutant cleanup. This bacterium could also provide valuable insights into bacterial evolution and sediment chemistry, opening up new avenues for scientific research and environmental applications. The ability to conduct electricity could pave the way for future advancements in microbial fuel cells and environmental biotechnology.

questions.question: Which city became the first in India to issue a Certified Green Municipal Bond to fund a Tertiary Sewage Treatment Plant?
questions.explanation: Ghaziabad has made a significant step in urban sustainability by issuing India's first Certified Green Municipal Bond. The bond raised ₹150 crore to fund the construction of a Tertiary Sewage Treatment Plant (TSTP) under the Swachh Bharat Mission–Urban. This advanced facility, designed with state-of-the-art water recycling technologies, aims to treat water and improve recycling capabilities. Ghaziabad's pioneering move sets a benchmark for other cities in terms of environmental responsibility and financial innovation, utilizing the Public-Private Partnership – Hybrid Annuity Model (PPP-HAM) to fund this essential project for urban development.

questions.question: What is the Fair and Remunerative Price (FRP) for sugarcane for the 2025–26 season approved by the Union Cabinet?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet, under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, has approved the Fair and Remunerative Price (FRP) for sugarcane at Rs. 355 per quintal for the 2025–26 season. This price is set for a basic recovery rate of 10.25 per cent. The FRP is the minimum price that sugar mills are required to pay to sugarcane farmers and plays a crucial role in protecting farmer interests, especially in a country like India, which is the world's largest producer and consumer of sugar.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) of Bihar ahead of the 2025 Assembly elections?
questions.explanation: IAS Vinod Kumar Gunjiyal has been appointed as the new Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) of Bihar by the Election Commission of India ahead of the state’s 2025 Assembly elections. He is a 2007-batch IAS officer from the Bihar cadre and brings with him extensive administrative experience. His previous roles include Secretary in the Prohibition, Excise & Registration Department, and Director in the Animal Husbandry Department. Known for his administrative acumen, Gunjiyal is tasked with ensuring the smooth conduct of free and fair elections in Bihar in October-November 2025, replacing the previous CEO, H R Srinivas.

questions.question: On which date is International Jazz Day celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: International Jazz Day is celebrated every year on April 30. This event was initiated by UNESCO in 2011 to recognize jazz not only as a music genre but also as a global tool for promoting peace, unity, and understanding across cultures. The day is supported by jazz legend Herbie Hancock and includes global celebrations such as concerts, workshops, and discussions, aimed at fostering dialogue and mutual respect through the universal language of jazz. It is a reminder of how music can contribute to social change and educational growth worldwide.

questions.question: Who has returned as the Prime Minister of Trinidad and Tobago after winning the recent election?
questions.explanation: Kamla Persad-Bissessar, aged 73, has made a significant political comeback by winning the election in Trinidad and Tobago, marking her return as Prime Minister. She previously served in the same role from 2010 to 2015 and remains the only woman to have ever led the country. Her campaign emphasized key social welfare issues, including pension security and job creation, which resonated with voters. The ruling People's National Movement (PNM) party, led by former Prime Minister Keith Rowley, conceded defeat following the election results. Her return highlights a renewed mandate and hope for transformative leadership in the Caribbean nation.

questions.question: Which Indian state reported the death of over 3,000 pigs due to an African Swine Fever outbreak?
questions.explanation: Mizoram has experienced a severe outbreak of African Swine Fever (ASF), resulting in the death of over 3,000 pigs within a month. The outbreak has primarily affected four districts, with Siaha being the worst impacted. In response to the spread of the disease, authorities culled nearly 1,000 pigs and declared 46 localities as ASF-infected zones to contain the virus. The economic damage has been substantial, with losses in 2024 alone amounting to Rs 336.49 crore, adding to the burden from earlier outbreaks. The situation underscores the need for robust veterinary and biosecurity measures in the region.

questions.question: Which two states are connected by the ₹22,864-crore greenfield highway project approved by the Cabinet Committee?
questions.explanation: The Cabinet Committee, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, approved a greenfield highway project worth ₹22,864 crore that will connect Mawlyngkhung in Meghalaya with Panchgram in Assam. The proposed four-lane access-controlled highway will stretch over 166.8 km, of which 144.80 km lies in Meghalaya and 22.00 km in Assam. The project is to be developed under the Hybrid Annuity Mode (HAM), which blends government support with private-sector investment. This initiative is part of broader infrastructure development efforts in the Northeast region, aiming to enhance connectivity and support economic growth through improved transportation links.

questions.question: In which country has the US deployed anti-ship missile launchers on Batan Island near Taiwan?
questions.explanation: The United States has strategically deployed anti-ship missile launchers on Batan Island, located in the Philippines, as part of a broader military posture near Taiwan. This move aligns with ongoing tensions in the region, especially following China’s extensive military drills signalling opposition to any push for Taiwan's independence. The deployment is occurring alongside the Balikatan military exercises, which involve around 9,000 US troops and forces from the Philippines, Australia, Japan, and others. These exercises are taking place near the highly contested South China Sea, reinforcing regional defence cooperation and strategic deterrence in response to rising geopolitical tensions.

questions.question: Where was the 2-day National Workshop on MERU under PM-USHA inaugurated by Dr. Sukanta Majumdar held?
questions.explanation: The 2-day National Workshop on Multi-Disciplinary Education and Research Universities (MERU) under the PM-USHA initiative was inaugurated by Dr. Sukanta Majumdar in New Delhi. This centrally sponsored scheme, launched by the Ministry of Education, focuses on enhancing the quality of higher education, particularly in state-run institutions. New Delhi, being the capital and a central hub for major policy-level events, frequently hosts national-level academic and administrative workshops like this one. The workshop aimed at fostering dialogue and sharing strategies to elevate the standards of multidisciplinary research and education in India.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the head of the revamped National Security Advisory Board (NSAB)?
questions.explanation: Alok Joshi, the former chief of the Research and Analysis Wing (R&AW), has been appointed as the new Chairman of the revamped National Security Advisory Board (NSAB). This appointment is part of a strategic restructuring to strengthen India's national security framework, particularly in response to rising terror threats and the Pahalgam attack. The reshaping of the NSAB aims to enhance the country's security responses and offer strategic advice on military, intelligence, and diplomatic matters, signalling India's commitment to improving its defence strategies amidst growing security challenges.

questions.question: Which company announced a $500 billion investment to establish AI chip manufacturing in the United States?
questions.explanation: Nvidia has unveiled a historic $500 billion investment plan to set up AI chip manufacturing within the United States, marking a significant shift in the company's strategy. Traditionally dependent on Asian manufacturing, especially in Taiwan, this move signals Nvidia's commitment to boosting domestic tech production and supporting AI infrastructure. The investment is backed by the Trump administration and aims to make the U.S. a global leader in AI technology while reducing reliance on foreign supply chains. This is also a step toward creating large-scale employment and reinforcing the national tech industry.

questions.question: Who relinquished the post of Chief of Integrated Defence Staff on April 30 upon superannuation?
questions.explanation: Lt Gen JP Mathew stepped down from his role as Chief of Integrated Defence Staff (CISC) on April 30 after serving the Indian Armed Forces for nearly four decades. During his tenure, he played a crucial role in promoting jointness among the Army, Navy, and Air Force, and made significant contributions to the development of Defence Cyber and Space capabilities. His leadership also strengthened collaboration with the Indian defence industry. In recognition of his exemplary service and dedication, he was awarded prestigious honours, including the Param Vishisht Seva Medal. His retirement marks the conclusion of a highly impactful military career.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the government's upcoming 'Depot Darpan' portal?
questions.explanation: The 'Depot Darpan' portal is being introduced by the government as a real-time monitoring system for food storage depots. Its core purpose is to ensure that these depots maintain top-tier standards in quality and safety. This initiative supports the broader goal of enhancing food security for more than 80 crore beneficiaries across India. By integrating scientific warehousing methods and smart storage technologies, the government aims to reduce spoilage, increase efficiency, and better manage the public distribution system. The launch of this portal reflects a strategic move towards a more resilient and technologically empowered food supply chain.

questions.question: What was the new national record time set in the men’s 4x100m relay at the 2nd Indian Open Relay Competition?
questions.explanation: At the 2nd Indian Open Relay Competition held in Chandigarh, the men’s 4x100m relay team—comprising Gurindervir Singh, Animesh Kujur, Manikanta Hoblidhar, and Amlan Borgohain—set a new national record with a time of 38.69 seconds. This outstanding performance broke the previous record of 38.89 seconds, which had stood since the 2010 Commonwealth Games held in Delhi. The achievement reflects significant progress in Indian sprinting and underlines the growing competitiveness of relay events in national athletics. Such milestones also serve as inspiration for future athletes and contribute to India's track and field legacy.

questions.question: On which date is Gujarat Foundation Day, also known as Gujarat Sthapana Divas, observed?
questions.explanation: Gujarat Foundation Day, or Gujarat Sthapana Divas, is celebrated annually on May 1 to mark the formation of the state of Gujarat in 1960. The reorganization was a result of the Bombay Reorganisation Act, which divided the erstwhile Bombay State into Gujarat and Maharashtra on linguistic lines—Gujarati-speaking regions became Gujarat, while Marathi-speaking regions formed Maharashtra. This date holds historical and cultural significance for the people of Gujarat and is commemorated with various events and ceremonies across the state, honouring its unique heritage and contributions to the nation.

questions.question: Which company signed an MoU with the Ministry of Labour & Employment to boost employment through the National Career Service portal?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Labour & Employment has partnered with Rapido by signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to enhance employment opportunities in the logistics and transport sector through the National Career Service (NCS) portal. This collaboration aims to create over 50 lakh livelihood opportunities within the next one to two years. A key focus of the initiative is inclusive hiring, particularly encouraging youth and women to take up flexible work roles. Rapido will list job opportunities for roles such as bike taxi drivers, auto-rickshaw operators, and cab drivers on the NCS platform, making the process of job discovery more accessible.

questions.question: In which city was the Indian Institute of Creative Technology (IICT) launched during the WAVES 2025 event?
questions.explanation: The Indian Institute of Creative Technology (IICT) was officially launched in Mumbai during the WAVES 2025 event by the Union Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Ashwini Vaishnaw. This institution is part of a national effort to promote excellence in the AVGC (Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, and Comics) sector, aiming to position India as a global hub for digital creativity. Mumbai, being a major centre for media and entertainment, was a strategic choice for the launch. The IICT will provide training, research, and industry collaboration opportunities to empower young creative professionals and advance India’s digital content ecosystem.

questions.question: On which date is International Labour Day, also known as May Day, celebrated annually?
questions.explanation: International Labour Day, widely known as May Day, is celebrated every year on May 1 to honour the contributions of workers and to promote awareness of their rights and welfare. The observance traces its roots to labour union movements that advocated for fair working hours and better conditions. The first Labour Day parade was held in New York City in 1882, which later influenced global efforts to recognize and support the labour force. In India, it is celebrated under various names such as Kamgar Divas or Antrarashtriya Shramik Divas and is marked by rallies, awareness campaigns, and public gatherings supporting workers’ rights.

questions.question: Which country is introducing a new law to restrict Mount Everest permits to experienced climbers?
questions.explanation: Nepal is introducing a new draft law to limit Mount Everest access only to climbers who have prior experience scaling peaks above 7,000 meters. This move is part of the country’s broader effort to address the growing issues of overcrowding, rising fatalities, and environmental degradation on the world’s highest mountain. By ensuring that only experienced mountaineers attempt Everest, Nepal aims to improve safety standards and promote more sustainable expedition practices. The new regulation is also seen as a step toward preserving the ecological integrity of the Everest region, which has increasingly suffered from waste accumulation and unregulated tourism.

questions.question: Which country signed an economic partnership agreement with the United States granting access to its rare earth minerals?
questions.explanation: The United States has signed an economic partnership agreement with Ukraine, granting it access to Ukraine’s rare earth minerals—critical for advanced technologies, including defence and clean energy sectors. In return, the agreement includes the formation of a joint Reconstruction Investment Fund aimed at aiding Ukraine’s rebuilding efforts amid ongoing challenges. This strategic move not only strengthens economic ties between the two nations but also aligns their interests in geopolitical stability and resource security. Ukraine’s rich mineral reserves play a crucial role in global supply chains, making this deal significant for both economic and strategic reasons.

questions.question: On which expressway did the Indian Air Force recently conduct a flypast and landing exercise involving Rafale, Jaguar, and Mirage aircraft?
questions.explanation: The Indian Air Force (IAF) carried out a major exercise to demonstrate its operational preparedness by performing a flypast and landing drill on the Ganga Expressway in Uttar Pradesh. The exercise took place on a 3.5-kilometre stretch of the under-construction expressway near Shahjahanpur. It involved the participation of advanced fighter jets like Rafale, Jaguar, and Mirage, along with transport aircraft, emphasizing the strategic utility of such infrastructure for emergency operations and national defence purposes.

questions.question: How many years since the end of the Vietnam War did Vietnam commemorate in 2025?
questions.explanation: In 2025, Vietnam marked 50 years since the end of the Vietnam War, which concluded with the fall of Saigon on April 30, 1975. This historic event, known in Vietnam as the “Day of Southern Liberation for National Reunification,” symbolized the unification of North and South Vietnam. The 50th anniversary celebrations were held with significant fanfare, including military parades, an air show, and participation from international allies and observers. The commemoration honoured the sacrifices made during the 20-year-long conflict and reflected Vietnam's growing stature in global diplomacy and defence.

questions.question: What percentage stake will Jubilant Beverages Limited acquire in Hindustan Coca-Cola Holdings as per the approved transaction?
questions.explanation: Jubilant Beverages Limited will acquire a 40% stake in Hindustan Coca-Cola Holdings (HCCH) as part of a strategic transaction approved by the Competition Commission of India (CCI). The deal also involves capital infusion into JBL through compulsorily convertible preference shares (CCPS) by Jubilant BevCo Ltd. and Goldman Sachs-backed investors. This acquisition strengthens the Jubilant Group’s presence in India's food and beverage sector and aligns with Coca-Cola’s operations in the country. The deal highlights significant foreign investment and collaboration in India's fast-growing beverage industry.

questions.question: In which city were 400 DEVI electric buses flagged off to enhance last-mile connectivity?
questions.explanation: In a significant move to enhance last-mile connectivity and reduce urban pollution, 400 electric buses under the Delhi Electric Vehicle Interconnector Service (DEVI) were flagged off in New Delhi. The event was attended by Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan and Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta. The initiative aims to strengthen links between metro stations and bus terminals, providing a cleaner and more efficient public transport option for residents of the National Capital. This aligns with broader efforts to promote electric mobility and environmental sustainability in urban areas.

questions.question: What was India’s overall rank at the inaugural Asian U-15 & U-17 Boxing Championships held in Amman, Jordan?
questions.explanation: India delivered an impressive performance at the inaugural Asian U-15 & U-17 Boxing Championships in Amman, Jordan, securing a total of 43 medals across various categories. These included 15 gold, 6 silver, and 22 bronze medals. Despite this strong medal haul, India finished Third in the overall rankings, coming in just behind Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. This ranking highlights India’s emerging strength in youth boxing on the Asian stage and sets a promising tone for the future of the sport in the country.

questions.question: On which date is World Tuna Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Tuna Day is observed every year on May 2 to raise awareness about the critical need to manage tuna fish stocks sustainably. Tuna is not only a significant source of nutrition, rich in Omega-3, protein, and vitamin B12, but also a vital economic resource for many countries. Recognizing the increasing pressure on tuna populations due to overfishing, the United Nations General Assembly officially designated this day nine years ago to promote responsible practices and ensure the long-term conservation of this essential marine species.

questions.question: Which Indian state launched the country’s first AI-powered real-time forest alert system?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh has pioneered India’s first AI-powered real-time forest alert system, aimed at enhancing forest conservation and management. The system integrates satellite imagery from the Google Earth Engine, artificial intelligence, and mobile-based field reporting to detect illegal activities such as land encroachment and deforestation. Currently piloted in five forest divisions—Shivpuri, Guna, Vidisha, Burhanpur, and Khandwa—the initiative enables immediate alerts and on-ground verification by forest officials. This proactive approach enhances the efficiency and sustainability of forest monitoring and serves as a model for other states to replicate for better environmental governance.

questions.question: Where were the BRS COPs 2025 held, where India took a leading role in advocating for stronger global action on chemicals and waste?
questions.explanation: The BRS COPs 2025 conference, where India played a pivotal role in pushing for global action on chemicals and waste, was held in Geneva. Led by India's Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav, the Indian delegation emphasized the need for collaborative solutions to plastic pollution, technology transfer, and financial support for developing nations. The conference’s theme, "Make visible the invisible," highlighted the global concern over chemical mismanagement. India reaffirmed its leadership in environmental governance by promoting its regulatory framework and advocating for stronger international agreements to address chemical and waste challenges.

questions.question: In which city was the Yoga Mahotsav 2025 held to mark the 50-day countdown to the International Day of Yoga?
questions.explanation: Yoga Mahotsav 2025 was organized in Nashik, Maharashtra, to celebrate the 50-day countdown to the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY), which is observed globally on June 21. The event was conducted by the Morarji Desai National Institute of Yoga under the Ministry of Ayush. A mass yoga demonstration following the Common Yoga Protocol (CYP) was held at Gauri Maidan in the Ramkund Parisar, Panchavati area. This initiative underscores the government's continued efforts to promote yoga as a global health and wellness practice, involving large-scale community participation leading up to the IDY.

questions.question: What is India’s rank in the 2025 World Press Freedom Index?
questions.explanation: In the 2025 World Press Freedom Index, India ranks 151st, reflecting ongoing challenges related to press freedom. This marks an improvement from its 159th position in 2024 but still indicates a concerning climate for journalists. The index highlights issues such as economic hardship faced by media outlets, leading to closures, as well as growing threats and restrictions on independent reporting. Globally, the report identifies the Middle East and North Africa as the most dangerous regions for journalists, with severe media suppression, especially in conflict zones like Gaza. India's rank underscores the urgent need for stronger protections for press freedom.

questions.question: Which country signed a renewed Memorandum of Understanding with India to strengthen cooperation in clean and sustainable energy?
questions.explanation: India and Denmark have signed a renewed Memorandum of Understanding to deepen their energy cooperation, with a strong focus on clean and sustainable energy solutions. This agreement supports India’s broader climate goals, including its commitment to achieving net-zero emissions by 2070. The MoU emphasizes mutual knowledge exchange and technological collaboration to drive innovation in the renewable energy sector. Denmark, known for its expertise in wind energy and green technologies, is a key partner in India's green transition, making this renewed partnership a strategic move toward shared sustainability objectives and climate action.

questions.question: Who recently assumed charge as a Member of the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC)?
questions.explanation: Anuradha Prasad has been appointed as a Member of the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), bringing with her 37 years of extensive experience in the Indian civil services. She has held influential roles across major ministries such as Defence, Finance, and Labour. Her expertise spans critical areas including defence acquisitions, labour reforms, and welfare initiatives during the Covid-19 pandemic. Additionally, she has made substantial contributions to policy development in domains like federalism, food safety, and reforms in the unorganized sector. Her appointment is expected to strengthen the UPSC with a wealth of practical administrative knowledge and reformist insight.

questions.question: Which Central Armed Police Force achieved the first-ever CAPF ascent of Mt. Makalu?
questions.explanation: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) made history by becoming the first Central Armed Police Force (CAPF) to successfully scale Mt. Makalu, the fifth-highest mountain in the world. A 12-member team undertook the challenging expedition as part of a dual-peak mission and achieved an impressive 83% summit success rate. In addition to the climbing feat, ITBP also promoted environmental responsibility through the “Clean Himalaya - Save Glacier” campaign, collecting 150 kilograms of waste from high-altitude camps. This achievement marks ITBP’s continued dominance in high-altitude operations, having now climbed six of the world’s 14 eight-thousanders.

questions.question: On which date is World Press Freedom Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Press Freedom Day is observed every year on May 3. It was established by the United Nations in 1993 as a way to honour and promote the fundamental principles of press freedom globally. The date also commemorates the Windhoek Declaration of 1991, which emphasized the need for a free, independent, and pluralistic press. This day serves as a reminder of the challenges journalists face worldwide, including censorship, harassment, violence, and threats to their safety, even in democratic nations. It encourages efforts to safeguard the rights of journalists and uphold freedom of expression as a cornerstone of democratic societies.

questions.question: In which state was the Khelo India Multipurpose Hall inaugurated by Dr. Mansukh Mandaviya?
questions.explanation: The Khelo India Multipurpose Hall was inaugurated by Dr. Mansukh Mandaviya in Kamle, Arunachal Pradesh. This initiative, backed by Rs. 8 crore in central government funding, is part of the broader Khelo India programme aimed at strengthening grassroots-level sports infrastructure. The hall is designed to host multiple indoor sports and serve as a training hub for budding athletes, helping them prepare for national and international competitions. Establishing such infrastructure in remote areas like Arunachal Pradesh highlights the government's commitment to inclusive sports development across all regions of India.

questions.question: At which location did Indian Ocean Ship SAGAR arrive during its operational deployment in the South-West Indian Ocean Region?
questions.explanation: Indian Ocean Ship (IOS) SAGAR arrived at Port Victoria in Seychelles as part of its ongoing operational deployment across the South-West Indian Ocean Region. This visit came after successfully completing an Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) surveillance mission around Mauritius in coordination with its National Coast Guard. The arrival in Seychelles marks a significant step in strengthening maritime security cooperation with Indian Ocean island nations. These deployments underline India’s commitment to ensuring maritime safety and regional stability and enhancing bilateral ties with strategic partners such as Seychelles through coordinated naval operations and capacity-building initiatives.

questions.question: By what percentage did India’s non-petroleum exports grow in the financial year 2024-25 compared to the previous year?
questions.explanation: In the financial year 2024-25, India’s non-petroleum exports reached a record 374.08 billion dollars, marking a 6% increase from the previous year. This growth contributed significantly to India’s overall export performance, which hit an all-time high of 824.9 billion dollars. The rise in non-petroleum exports reflects improved competitiveness and diversification in India’s export basket, particularly in manufactured goods and services. This 6% growth is a positive indicator for India’s external sector, helping to reduce the trade deficit and support overall economic momentum amid global challenges in trade and supply chains.

questions.question: In which city will President Droupadi Murmu inaugurate the first National Mediation Conference?
questions.explanation: The first National Mediation Conference will take place in New Delhi and will be inaugurated by President Droupadi Murmu. The event is a significant step toward promoting mediation as an effective alternative dispute resolution mechanism. Organized by the Attorney General’s office and the Ministry of Law, the conference aims to facilitate the exchange of best practices in mediation and highlight its role in reducing the burden on the judiciary. With participation from key legal figures like Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna and Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal, the event underscores the government’s commitment to legal reforms and faster justice delivery.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with Kuwait's Jazeera Airways for an AI-led digital transformation initiative?
questions.explanation: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has partnered with Kuwait’s Jazeera Airways to lead a comprehensive AI-driven digital transformation. This initiative aims to enhance the airline’s digital ecosystem by upgrading its website and mobile applications, as well as implementing an AI-powered chatbot to improve customer engagement. TCS will also deploy a retail ancillary platform and a unified payment gateway to boost operational efficiency and drive bookings. The collaboration is focused on delivering a scalable, personalized travel experience while modernizing the airline’s overall digital infrastructure, showcasing TCS's capabilities in leveraging advanced technologies for business transformation.

questions.question: Which company partnered with the Indian Army's Madras Regimental Centre for a five-day rally across Tamil Nadu to honour Veterans and Veer Naris?
questions.explanation: Ultraviolette, an Indian electric vehicle company, partnered with the Madras Regimental Centre of the Indian Army to conduct a five-day rally across Tamil Nadu. The initiative was undertaken to honour the Veterans and Veer Naris of the Madras Regiment. As part of the collaboration, Ultraviolette provided its F77 electric motorcycles for the rally, which spanned diverse terrains across six districts, including Tirupur, Karur, Dindigul, Madurai, Theni, and Coimbatore. The event highlights a growing synergy between defence institutions and indigenous electric vehicle manufacturers, promoting both national pride and sustainable mobility solutions.

questions.question: Which institution secured the second position nationwide for implementing a paperless and queue-less OPD registration system under the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission?
questions.explanation: AIIMS Bhopal achieved the second position nationwide for its innovative implementation of a paperless and queue-less OPD registration system under the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission. The hospital’s 'Scan and Share' service has successfully generated over 1.45 million OPD tokens, significantly streamlining the patient registration process. This digital transformation has notably reduced waiting times and eliminated long queues, greatly enhancing patient convenience and overall experience. The initiative reflects the hospital's commitment to improving healthcare delivery through technological advancements, contributing to the efficiency and modernization of India's healthcare infrastructure.

questions.question: Which bank has partnered with the Land Ports Authority of India to provide modern banking services at 26 land ports across the country?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the Land Ports Authority of India (LPAI) to provide comprehensive banking services at 26 land ports across 8 Indian border states. This collaboration aims to improve infrastructure for cross-border trade and passenger movement, offering services like forex, insurance, and digital banking. This strategic move supports India’s broader vision of economic development under Viksit Bharat 2047 by increasing trade capacity and ensuring smooth financial operations at border checkpoints connecting with neighbouring countries like Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar.

questions.question: Who has recently joined the World Bank’s Private Sector Investment Lab to promote job creation in developing countries?
questions.explanation: Sunil Bharti Mittal, Chairman of Bharti Enterprises, has been inducted into the World Bank’s Private Sector Investment Lab (PSIL) as part of its renewed initiative launched on April 24, 2025. The PSIL focuses on stimulating private sector investments in key sectors like infrastructure, energy, healthcare, and more within developing economies. Mittal’s inclusion underscores the rising influence of Indian business leaders in shaping global investment strategies aimed at overcoming financial and regulatory barriers. His role will contribute to driving job creation and fostering economic development in emerging markets, aligning with PSIL’s core objective of sustainable growth through private enterprise.

questions.question: What percentage of patients in India with carbapenem-resistant Gram-negative (CRGN) infections received the appropriate antibiotic treatment?
questions.explanation: In 2019, only 7.8% of patients in India suffering from carbapenem-resistant Gram-negative (CRGN) infections received the correct antibiotic treatment. This low percentage underscores a critical gap in healthcare infrastructure, particularly in diagnostic testing, standardized treatment protocols, and antibiotic availability. The study, published in The Lancet Infectious Diseases, revealed that India fared only slightly better than the average of 6.9% across eight low- and middle-income countries. With nearly a million CRGN cases in India and fewer than one lakh treated appropriately, the result was approximately 3.5 lakh preventable deaths, highlighting an urgent need for improved access to effective antibiotics and robust stewardship programs.

questions.question: In which country's trench is the Emden Deep, the world's third-deepest point, located?
questions.explanation: The Emden Deep, also known as the Galathea Deep, is located in the Philippines Trench, a narrow and deep oceanic trench in the western Pacific Ocean. The trench is a seismically active region, experiencing frequent earthquakes due to the convergence of tectonic plates. It was first discovered by the German ship Emden in 1927 and later explored in greater detail by the Danish ship Galathea in 1951. The Philippines Trench is a notable geological feature, and the Emden Deep is one of the deepest points in the world.

questions.question: Which country played a crucial role in completing the main magnet system of the ITER nuclear fusion project by contributing to the cryostat and related infrastructure?
questions.explanation: India has emerged as a key player in the ITER (International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor) project by contributing significantly to the completion of its main magnet system, including the cryostat — a massive vacuum-insulated steel chamber critical to the fusion process. As one of the founding members of this global nuclear fusion initiative, India’s efforts underline its expanding influence in high-tech energy research. This contribution not only supports ITER’s goal of achieving carbon-free energy through nuclear fusion but also showcases India’s advanced engineering capabilities and commitment to sustainable scientific advancement on a global scale.

questions.question: Which inland water body is projected to drop by up to 21 meters by 2100 due to climate-driven evaporation, threatening biodiversity and regional stability?
questions.explanation: The Caspian Sea, the world’s largest inland water body and a tectonic lake is facing a drastic decline in water levels due to rising global temperatures. Even with global warming kept below 2°C, it is expected to drop 5–10 meters and could fall by as much as 21 meters by the end of the century. This poses a severe threat to unique species like the endangered Caspian seal and the critically endangered Beluga sturgeon. In addition, ports, hydrocarbon sites, and public health are at risk due to the exposure of contaminated seabeds, mirroring the disastrous consequences observed in the Aral Sea region.

questions.question: Who has recently been appointed as the Vice Chief of the Air Staff of the Indian Air Force as of May 2, 2025?
options: Air Marshal Rakesh Kumar Singh Bhadauria
questions.explanation: Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari was appointed as the Vice Chief of the Air Staff of the Indian Air Force on May 2, 2025. A veteran officer with over 3600 hours of flying experience and several prestigious awards such as the PVSM, AVSM, and VM, he brings deep operational and strategic expertise to his new role. His career includes key contributions to the Kargil War, leadership in the LCA Tejas program, and diplomatic service as Air Attache in Paris. With a career spanning nearly four decades, his elevation reflects the IAF’s strategic focus on modernization and experienced leadership.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the brand ambassador of the SoBo Mumbai Falcons for the T20 Mumbai League 2025?
questions.explanation: Kapil Dev, the legendary cricketer and captain of India’s 1983 World Cup-winning team, has been named the brand ambassador for SoBo Mumbai Falcons, a new franchise in the T20 Mumbai League 2025. His appointment aims to enhance the team’s visibility and credibility ahead of the league’s third edition, which will be held from May 26 to June 8 at Wankhede Stadium. Kapil Dev's association brings immense prestige and connects cricket fans with the heritage of Indian cricket, while also supporting the growth of domestic T20 leagues in India through his mentoring and promotional presence.

questions.question: Which country is hosting the Global Media Dialogue (GMD) during the WAVES 2025 event to promote international cooperation in the media sector?
questions.explanation: India is hosting the Global Media Dialogue (GMD) for the first time as part of the WAVES 2025 event in Mumbai, underscoring its growing leadership in global media and entertainment diplomacy. Organized by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, with support from the Ministry of External Affairs, the dialogue includes participation from over 60 nations, including major players like the UK, Japan, and Russia. The event aims to foster international collaboration through policy alignment, content innovation, talent exchange, and the launch of the ‘WAVES Declaration’. It positions India as a key media hub on the global stage.

questions.question: Which organization brokered the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) of 1960 between India and Pakistan?
questions.explanation: The Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) of 1960, a landmark water-sharing agreement between India and Pakistan, was brokered by the World Bank. It allocated exclusive rights to India over the eastern rivers (Ravi, Beas, Sutlej) and granted Pakistan control over the western rivers (Indus, Jhelum, Chenab) while allowing India limited non-consumptive use of the western rivers. The treaty remains one of the most enduring water-sharing agreements in the world. Despite tensions between the two countries, the treaty has largely held firm due to its robust legal structure and international backing, with the World Bank playing a crucial role in its formation and continuing oversight.

questions.question: Which insecticide did India oppose banning under the Stockholm Convention during the 2025 BRS Conventions in Geneva?
questions.explanation: Chlorpyrifos, an organophosphate insecticide widely used in India since 1977, became the centre of global debate during the 2025 BRS Conventions in Geneva. While many countries supported its inclusion under Annex A of the Stockholm Convention due to its association with serious health risks such as neurological damage, developmental issues, and cancer, India opposed the ban. The country argued that removing Chlorpyrifos without suitable alternatives would jeopardize food security and agricultural output, particularly for key crops like rice, cotton, and sugarcane. This reflects the ongoing global tension between environmental health priorities and national agricultural needs.

questions.question: Which Indian state has signed MoUs with UK and Australian universities to set up international university campuses?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra has taken a significant step toward internationalizing higher education by signing Memorandums of Understanding with the University of York from the UK and the University of Western Australia. These partnerships will lead to the establishment of campuses within the state, offering undergraduate and postgraduate programs starting from the 2026/27 academic year. The initiative is designed to provide Indian students with access to world-class education domestically, reducing the need to go abroad for quality academic programs. This move reinforces Maharashtra’s role in expanding global academic collaboration and creating new educational opportunities within India.

questions.question: Which Indian state is set to host the 72nd edition of the Miss World pageant from May 10 to 31?
questions.explanation: Telangana has been chosen as the host for the 72nd Miss World pageant, scheduled from May 10 to 31. The event will bring together contestants from 120 countries in Hyderabad, the state capital. Beyond being a global beauty event, the pageant is an opportunity for the state government to highlight Telangana’s rich cultural, historical, and spiritual heritage. The initiative aims to place Telangana on the international tourism map by positioning it as a “Multidimensional Tourism Hub.” Hosting such a prestigious event underscores the state’s growing global relevance and infrastructural capability.

questions.question: Which state has launched the Mahila Samvad campaign to reach 2 crore women?
questions.explanation: The Bihar government has launched the Mahila Samvad campaign, a significant initiative aimed at reaching 2 crore women across 70,000 locations in the state. The campaign focuses on promoting women’s empowerment through various schemes such as reservations in Panchayati Raj, government jobs, and self-help groups. To facilitate widespread outreach and gather valuable feedback, special mobile vans will be deployed. This initiative is designed to enhance the impact of women-centric programs, ensuring they are effectively implemented and that women are better informed about their rights and available opportunities.

questions.question: Which organization successfully conducted the maiden flight trials of the Stratospheric Airship Platform in Madhya Pradesh?
questions.explanation: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has achieved a key milestone by successfully conducting the first flight trials of its Stratospheric Airship Platform. The trial was held at the Sheopur site in Madhya Pradesh, with the airship ascending to an altitude of approximately 17 kilometres while carrying a specialized instrumental payload. The platform was developed by the Aerial Delivery Research and Development Establishment (ADRDE) based in Agra, Uttar Pradesh. This innovation is part of DRDO’s ongoing efforts to develop advanced aerial surveillance and research capabilities at high altitudes for strategic and scientific applications.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with TCS to build India’s largest Quantum Computing Hub?
questions.explanation: IBM has partnered with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) to establish India’s largest Quantum Computing Hub at the Quantum Valley Tech Park in Andhra Pradesh. Central to this hub is the IBM Quantum System Two, which features a 156-qubit Heron processor, making it the most advanced quantum computing system currently in India. The collaboration focuses on developing quantum algorithms and applications that can solve complex problems across various sectors, including industry and academia. This joint initiative reflects the growing emphasis on cutting-edge technology to drive innovation and scientific research in India’s tech landscape.

questions.question: Which Indian state has proposed the Lakkundi monuments for UNESCO’s World Heritage tentative list?
questions.explanation: Karnataka has proposed the Lakkundi monuments, dating back to the Kalyana Chalukya period, for inclusion in UNESCO’s World Heritage tentative list. These monuments, including the Kasi Visvesvara and Manikesvara temples, are known for their architectural significance, particularly the step-wells integrated into the temple complexes. The proposal emphasizes the blending of Nagara, Dravida, and Bhumija architectural styles into the Vesara style. This recognition would highlight the unique cultural heritage of the region and contribute to preserving its rich historical and architectural legacy for future generations.

questions.question: Which Indian state launched the Film Tourism Policy 2025 and AVGC XR Policy 2025 during the “Digital Dreams & Cinematic Visions” session at Waves 2025?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh has positioned itself as an emerging creative hub by launching the Film Tourism Policy 2025 and the AVGC XR (Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, Comics, and Extended Reality) Policy 2025 during a dedicated session at Waves 2025. The event, titled “Digital Dreams & Cinematic Visions,” featured film industry veteran Ekta Kapoor and highlighted the state’s commitment to nurturing media, entertainment, and digital technologies. Additionally, the second phase of the Madhya Pradesh Film Cell Portal was unveiled to further support filmmakers and content creators. These initiatives aim to attract investment, boost local employment, and promote the state’s scenic locales for filmmaking.

questions.question: Who has won a second consecutive term as Prime Minister of Australia?
questions.explanation: Anthony Albanese has been re-elected as the Prime Minister of Australia, securing a second consecutive three-year term. This marks a significant political milestone, being the first back-to-back win for a Prime Minister in over two decades. His opponent, Peter Dutton, not only conceded defeat but also lost his seat in Queensland, underscoring the public's rejection of his aggressive campaign strategy and rhetoric, which many likened to American-style politics. Albanese’s victory is seen as a strong mandate from the Australian electorate for continued leadership and a repudiation of divisive political tactics.

questions.question: Which Indian state is set to develop India’s first Transmedia Entertainment City?
questions.explanation: Andhra Pradesh is taking a major step in transforming its entertainment landscape by developing India’s first Transmedia Entertainment City, named “Creator Land.” This city will house state-of-the-art facilities focused on various aspects of the entertainment industry, including cinema, gaming, advertising, virtual production, and technology-driven storytelling. The Andhra Pradesh State government has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Creativeland Asia Private Limited to bring this ambitious project to life. The initiative is expected to establish the region as a key hub for creative industries, driving innovation and economic growth.

questions.question: Which Indian state has become the first to introduce a dedicated policy for shipbuilding, ship repair, and ship recycling?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra has taken a pioneering step by becoming the first state in India to launch a standalone policy focused on shipbuilding, ship repair, and ship recycling. The initiative is designed to attract an investment of Rs 6,600 crore and generate 40,000 jobs by the year 2030. Key features of the policy include capital subsidies, skill development initiatives, and long-term land lease options, all aimed at transforming the state into a major maritime hub. This comprehensive approach demonstrates the state's commitment to strengthening its industrial base and contributing to India’s maritime economy.

questions.question: Which railway zone has partnered with Chhota Bheem to promote railway safety and raise public awareness?
questions.explanation: Western Railway has teamed up with the popular cartoon character Chhota Bheem to spread messages about railway safety. This collaboration will utilize various media formats such as print, digital platforms, and educational school programs over the span of a year. By targeting younger audiences, the initiative aims to effectively communicate safety practices using a familiar and engaging character. This strategic partnership highlights the use of popular media to influence public behaviour positively, particularly among children, making safety education more accessible and impactful.

questions.question: Which country won the 2025 Sudirman Cup, marking its 14th title in the tournament's history?
questions.explanation: China claimed its 14th Sudirman Cup title in 2025 by defeating South Korea 3-1 in the final held in Xiamen, China. Despite a valiant effort by South Korea’s An Seyoung, who extended her unbeaten streak to 25 consecutive wins, the Chinese team showcased superior depth and coordination to dominate the overall match. The Sudirman Cup, a prestigious World Mixed Team Badminton Championship organized by the Badminton World Federation, has largely been dominated by China, which has now won 14 out of the 18 editions. This consistent performance underscores China’s long-standing supremacy in the global badminton arena.

questions.question: What is the name of the CBI operation launched in 2025 to combat international online child sexual exploitation networks?
questions.explanation: Operation Hawk 2025 was launched by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to dismantle global online child sexual exploitation networks. Working in coordination with international law enforcement agencies, the CBI acted on intelligence inputs, especially from the United States, leading to the registration of cases against individuals exploiting minors via platforms like Discord and Arisu. This operation builds on the success of earlier missions such as Operation Carbon (2021) and Operation Megh Chakra (2022), underscoring India’s ongoing commitment to tackling cybercrimes involving minors. Operation Hawk exemplifies the importance of international collaboration in addressing complex digital threats across borders.

questions.question: Which country has announced the development of an $8.8 billion International Financial Centre in partnership with MBS Global Investments?
questions.explanation: The Maldives has unveiled plans to establish the Maldives International Financial Centre (MIFC) in its capital, Malé, with a massive $8.8 billion investment. This ambitious project, in collaboration with the Qatari-owned MBS Global Investments, is expected to be completed by 2030. Designed as a sustainable financial-free zone, the MIFC will serve as a hub for global financial institutions, fintech startups, and remote-working professionals. The initiative reflects the Maldives' strategic move to diversify its economy beyond tourism and position itself as a prominent financial player in the Indian Ocean region.

questions.question: On which date will World Asthma Day be observed in 2025?
questions.explanation: World Asthma Day 2025 will be observed on Tuesday, May 6. Organized annually by the Global Initiative for Asthma (GINA), this day is dedicated to raising global awareness about asthma, a chronic respiratory condition affecting over 250 million people. The 2025 theme, “Make inhaled treatments accessible for all,” underscores the need to improve access to essential inhaled medications, particularly in low- and middle-income countries where asthma-related mortality remains high. The event has grown significantly since its inception in 1998, now engaging over 100 countries in asthma education, advocacy, and efforts to reduce health disparities.

questions.question: Which state has announced May 5 as Traders Day to honour the business community?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu has officially designated May 5 as Traders Day to recognize and honour the contributions of the business community. This initiative, announced by Chief Minister MK Stalin, aligns with the Dravidian Model of governance that emphasizes inclusive development and economic empowerment. The decision comes after sustained requests from the state's business sector, reflecting the government's responsiveness to stakeholder needs. In addition to trade support, Tamil Nadu has demonstrated leadership in education, boasting a Gross Enrollment Ratio (GER) of 47% and hosting some of India’s top colleges, underlining the state’s multifaceted approach to development.

questions.question: Which country is collaborating with France to develop a 1-gigawatt AI data centre in Europe?
questions.explanation: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is partnering with France to develop a 1-gigawatt AI data centre, which is projected to be the largest of its kind in Europe. This multi-billion-euro initiative is part of a broader vision shared by both countries to become global leaders in artificial intelligence. The AI data centre will also serve as a hub within a larger AI campus, promoting not just cutting-edge technological infrastructure but also the cultivation of AI talent and innovation. This collaboration highlights the strategic importance of international alliances in advancing the global AI ecosystem.

questions.question: Which country hosted the 58th Annual Meeting of the Asian Development Bank where India discussed the Strategic Action Plan 2025–2029?
questions.explanation: Italy hosted the 58th Annual Meeting of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) in Milan, where significant discussions took place between India and Italy regarding their Strategic Action Plan 2025–2029. Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman met with her Italian counterpart Giancarlo Giorgetti to explore deeper cooperation in digital innovation, renewable energy, green hydrogen, and climate sustainability. With bilateral trade exceeding $14.5 billion in FY2023–24, both nations emphasized strengthening multilateral ties and leveraging their technological capabilities for mutual growth. This meeting marked a continued effort to implement structured economic collaboration under the Joint Strategic Action Plan and reinforce shared global commitments.

questions.question: Which Indian Navy ship arrived in the Maldives for a Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) exercise?
questions.explanation: INS Sharda arrived at Maafilaafushi Atoll in the Maldives to participate in a week-long Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) exercise. This joint initiative aims to improve coordination and operational readiness between the Indian Navy and the Maldives National Defence Force in times of natural disasters or humanitarian crises. The exercise reflects India's broader "MAHASAGAR" vision, which emphasizes maritime cooperation, regional peace, and sustainable development in the Indian Ocean Region. Deployments like that of INS Sharda demonstrate India's commitment to being a responsible maritime partner and first responder in the region.

questions.question: Which force successfully scaled Mt. Makalu as part of a historic twin peak expedition?
questions.explanation: A 12-member team from the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) achieved a remarkable feat by successfully scaling Mt. Makalu, the fifth tallest mountain in the world, as part of a dual expedition targeting both Mt. Makalu and Mt. Annapurna. This marked the ITBP's first-ever attempt to summit both peaks. The successful ascent of Mt. Makalu on April 19, 2025, with an 83% success rate, underscores the ITBP's expertise in high-altitude mountaineering, endurance, and environmental conservation. Their legacy in mountaineering is further strengthened through this historic achievement in the Himalayan region.

questions.question: What position is India projected to attain in the global economy rankings by 2025, according to the IMF?
questions.explanation: According to the International Monetary Fund's latest World Economic Outlook, India is expected to rise to the position of the world’s fourth-largest economy in 2025, surpassing Japan. The projection is based on nominal GDP estimates, with India anticipated to reach $4,187.02 billion, slightly ahead of Japan’s $4,186.43 billion. This milestone reflects India's rapid economic growth and resilience, reinforcing its position as a major global economic power. The shift also highlights the broader trend of emerging markets gaining prominence in the global financial landscape, with India at the forefront of that transition.

questions.question: Which city’s airport has launched a digital-first Airport Operations Control Centre to boost efficiency and coordination?
questions.explanation: Mumbai International Airport, operated by the Adani Group, has introduced a modernized, digital-first Airport Operations Control Centre (AOCC). The upgraded facility is equipped with advanced technology including real-time data systems, high-resolution visual displays, and integrated communication platforms. This development is aimed at significantly improving the airport’s operational efficiency and coordination among various stakeholders such as airlines, ground staff, and air traffic controllers. The AOCC represents a major step toward smart infrastructure in aviation, reinforcing Mumbai's role as a major global air travel hub with cutting-edge technological capabilities.

questions.question: Which country will lead discussions on land governance at the 2025 World Bank Land Conference?
questions.explanation: India will take a leading role in the 2025 World Bank Land Conference, presenting key initiatives like the SVAMITVA Scheme and the Gram Manchitra platform. The SVAMITVA Scheme, a central government initiative under the Ministry of Panchayati Raj, was launched across the nation on April 24, 2021, following a successful pilot phase in nine states. This leadership role underscores India's commitment to innovative land governance, mapping, and transparency in rural property ownership. India's participation emphasizes its growing influence and proactive policy-making in global discussions on land management and development.

questions.question: In which state was the 7th Khelo India Youth Games 2025 inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi?
questions.explanation: The 7th edition of the Khelo India Youth Games 2025 was inaugurated in Bihar by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking a significant moment in India's sports development agenda. The event is part of the broader Khelo India initiative aimed at promoting grassroots sports and identifying young talent across the country. With over 1,000 Khelo India centres now operational, the scheme not only supports modern sports but also revives traditional Indian games such as Gatka, Kalarypattu, and Kho Kho. Hosting the games in Bihar underscores the government's commitment to regional inclusion and enhancing sports infrastructure nationwide.

questions.question: What is India’s rank in the 2025 Human Development Index as per the UNDP report?
questions.explanation: In the 2025 Human Development Report released by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), India has been placed at the 130th position out of 193 countries and territories. The report, titled "A Matter of Choice: People and Possibilities in the Age of AI", evaluates countries based on various human development parameters such as health, education, and income. The top three countries in the index are Iceland, Norway, and Switzerland, while South Sudan is ranked last. India’s position highlights the ongoing challenges and the need for continued progress in improving human development outcomes across the country.

questions.question: What is Moody’s revised GDP growth forecast for India for the year 2025?
questions.explanation: Moody’s Ratings, in its May 2025 update to the Global Macro Outlook, has revised India’s GDP growth forecast for the calendar year 2025 downward to 6.3%. The downgrade from the earlier estimate of 6.5% is attributed to rising global trade and policy uncertainty, particularly from evolving U.S. trade strategies, and heightened geopolitical tensions across multiple regions, including the India-Pakistan border and the South China Sea. Additionally, financial market volatility and tight global liquidity conditions have added to the economic risks. Despite this, Moody’s maintained India’s 2026 growth forecast at 6.5%, expecting conditions to stabilise over time.

questions.question: In which year was the Civil Defence Act enacted in India?
questions.explanation: The Civil Defence Act was enacted in 1968 as a strategic legislative response to the growing security concerns following the 1962 war with China and the 1965 war with Pakistan. Its primary aim is to ensure the protection of civilians, infrastructure, and property from possible hostile attacks via air, land, or sea. The Act empowers the government to establish the Civil Defence Corps and lays down the authority to frame rules and regulations necessary for its implementation. It marked a critical step in institutionalising civil preparedness during times of national emergencies or external aggression.

questions.question: How many new IITs are included in the ₹11,828.79 crore expansion plan approved by the Union Cabinet?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet has approved a substantial investment of ₹11,828.79 crore under a Phase-B construction plan aimed at expanding five new Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs). These IITs are located in Tirupati (Andhra Pradesh), Palakkad (Kerala), Bhilai (Chhattisgarh), Jammu (Jammu & Kashmir), and Dharwad (Karnataka). The expansion plan is designed to strengthen academic infrastructure and improve the overall capacity of these institutions, enabling them to better serve the growing demand for quality technical education in India. This move highlights the government's ongoing commitment to enhancing the higher education sector.

questions.question: What is the name of the military operation launched by India targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir?
questions.explanation: In response to the brutal terrorist attack in Pahalgam that resulted in the deaths of 25 Indian nationals and one Nepali citizen, the Indian Armed Forces launched a counteroffensive named Operation Sindoor. This military operation specifically targeted terrorist infrastructure within Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir, locations known for facilitating and directing attacks against India. A total of nine sites were struck in this operation, emphasising India's intent to respond decisively to cross-border terrorism and to protect national security. The operation demonstrates a strategic and calculated military posture aimed at dismantling terror networks across the border.

questions.question: On which date is World Athletics Day celebrated annually?
questions.explanation: World Athletics Day is observed every year on May 7 to promote sports and fitness, especially among the youth. It aims to raise awareness about the importance of athletics as a foundation for physical well-being and to inspire young people to engage in physical activity. The day is part of a broader initiative by World Athletics, formerly known as the International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF), to popularise track and field sports globally. While the first World Athletics Day was celebrated on May 15, 1996, the current annual celebration is firmly established on May 7.

questions.question: Which bank has launched the largest staff engagement initiative in the Indian banking sector to empower its workforce?
