questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new CEO of Deutsche Bank’s India-based Global Capability Centre in 2025?
questions.explanation: Stefan Schaffer has been appointed as the Chief Executive Officer of Deutsche Bank’s India-based Global Capability Centre (GCC) as of June 2, 2025. In addition to this role, he will serve as the Global CIO for Corporate Functions and Head of Global Technology Centres. With prior experience leading the Bucharest Technology Center and the Shared Applications and Services vertical, Schaffer brings a strategic focus on reusability, simplification, and innovation. His leadership marks Deutsche Bank’s continued emphasis on India’s role in global operations, where over 20,000 employees contribute across cities like Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, and Jaipur.

questions.question: Which institution projected India’s household net financial savings to reach ₹22 lakh crore in FY2024–25?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI), through its latest economic research report, projected that India’s household net financial savings could reach ₹22 lakh crore in FY2024–25, amounting to 6.5% of the Gross National Disposable Income (GNDI). This projection marks a significant rise from previous years and reflects growing economic confidence and household financial stability post-pandemic. The SBI report not only highlights this surge in savings but also analyzes broader financial trends including the Reserve Bank of India's record ₹2.69 lakh crore surplus transfer, an 8.19% increase in its balance sheet, and a notable shift in fraud patterns in the financial sector.

questions.question: In which city did the Minister of State for Defence announce the expansion of NCC by 3 lakh cadets?
questions.explanation: The Minister of State for Defence, Sanjay Seth, announced at a conference in Bhopal that the National Cadet Corps (NCC) would undergo a major expansion by adding 3 lakh cadets. This move is part of a broader initiative to increase the total strength of NCC cadets across India to between 17 and 20 lakh, in line with the Prime Minister’s vision. The NCC, headquartered in New Delhi, plays a crucial role in fostering discipline, patriotism, and leadership among youth. The announcement made in Bhopal underlines the city’s importance in national defence-related developments and strategic youth engagement.

questions.question: Who won Poland’s presidential runoff election recently?
questions.explanation: Karol Nawrocki emerged victorious in Poland's presidential runoff election as an independent candidate supported by the opposition Law and Justice party. He triumphed over Rafal Trzaskowski, the Mayor of Warsaw and candidate from the ruling Civic Coalition, who secured just over 49 per cent of the vote. Born in 1983 in Gdansk, Nawrocki is poised to take over the presidency from Andrzej Duda. His election marks a significant political development in Poland and indicates a shift in public sentiment toward the opposition-backed candidate amid evolving national and regional dynamics.

questions.question: On which date is World Bicycle Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Bicycle Day is celebrated annually on June 3. The United Nations General Assembly established this day in 2018 to acknowledge the versatility, longevity, and environmental benefits of the bicycle as a means of transportation. It highlights the importance of cycling as a simple, affordable, and sustainable mode of travel that contributes to health and reduces carbon emissions. Observing World Bicycle Day aims to encourage governments and individuals alike to incorporate cycling into everyday life to support sustainable development and public health.

questions.question: Which country became the world’s top creditor nation in 2024, overtaking Japan after 34 years?
questions.explanation: In 2024, Germany surpassed Japan to become the world’s largest creditor nation, ending Japan’s 34-year dominance in this category. The shift was primarily driven by Germany's rising current account surplus—reaching €240 billion—and favourable currency movements, particularly the appreciation of the euro against the Japanese yen. These factors increased the value of Germany’s foreign assets relative to Japan’s. Although Japan achieved a record net asset value, Germany’s higher growth and asset valuation led to a total of ¥569 trillion ($3.9 trillion), surpassing Japan’s ¥533 trillion ($3.7 trillion). This development reflects evolving global trade balances and investment flows.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the Chairman of Tata Chemicals effective May 30, 2025?
questions.explanation: S. Padmanabhan, a distinguished Tata Group veteran and an alumnus of IIM Bangalore (PGP 1982), has been appointed as the Chairman of Tata Chemicals effective May 30, 2025. His appointment marks a significant moment in Tata Chemicals' leadership journey, highlighting the Tata Group's tradition of nurturing internal talent. Padmanabhan has held key roles at TCS, Tata Power, and Tata Chemicals over a career spanning four decades. Recognized for his operational acumen and strategic leadership, his new role comes at a critical time as Tata Chemicals expands its global presence and focuses on sustainability and speciality chemicals.

questions.question: In which region has one-third of the seats been reserved for women in the Hill Development Councils?
questions.explanation: One-third of the total seats in the Hill Development Councils have been reserved for women in the region of Ladakh. This move comes after President Droupadi Murmu promulgated the Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council (Amendment) Regulation Rules, 2025. The amendment aims to promote greater gender representation and empowerment in local governance. The reservation will be implemented through rotation, with seats being allotted to different territorial constituencies in sequence, as notified officially through a gazetted order. This regulation strengthens the Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council Act, 1997, reinforcing inclusive political participation at the grassroots level.

questions.question: Where is the Indian Institute of Corporate Affairs (IICA) establishing its first regional campus in the Northeast?
questions.explanation: The Indian Institute of Corporate Affairs (IICA), under the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, is setting up its first regional campus in Shillong, Meghalaya. This initiative is funded by ₹100.95 crore from the PM-DevINE scheme, which aims to accelerate growth in the Northeast region. The new campus, located in New Shillong Township within the Knowledge City cluster, will focus on specialized training, research, and policy advisory in areas such as corporate governance, ESG, CSR, and insolvency. This move reflects the government’s commitment to regional empowerment and integrating the Northeast into the national development agenda.

questions.question: Which Indian state approved a 20% police reservation for former Agniveers under the Agneepath scheme in 2025?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh approved a 20% horizontal reservation for ex-Agniveers in police recruitment, including positions like Constable, PAC, Mounted Constable, and Fireman. This decision, made on June 3, 2025, aims to facilitate the reintegration of youth trained under the Agneepath scheme into civil services, providing them with career opportunities after their four-year military tenure. The policy includes a 3-year age relaxation and applies within all existing reservation categories, reflecting the state government’s commitment to honouring the service of Agniveers and enhancing the police force with disciplined, trained personnel.

questions.question: Which Indian state celebrates its Formation Day on June 2nd, marking its 11th anniversary in 2025?
questions.explanation: Telangana Formation Day, celebrated on June 2nd, marks the official formation of India’s 29th state in 2014. The day symbolizes the culmination of a long struggle for self-determination, regional identity, and administrative autonomy. The movement addressed regional disparities and cultural underrepresentation experienced by Telangana when it was merged with Andhra Pradesh in 1956. The state's creation was driven by a history of protests, including the Jai Telangana Movement and efforts by leaders like K. Chandrasekhar Rao. Telangana Formation Day honours resilience, cultural pride, and the quest for equitable development and governance.

questions.question: How many Indian languages does the BharatGen AI model support?
questions.explanation: BharatGen is a newly launched multimodal AI model developed in India that supports 22 Indian languages. This initiative was introduced at the BharatGen Summit and is part of the National Mission on Interdisciplinary Cyber-Physical Systems (NM-ICPS). Led by the TIH Foundation for IIT & IoE at IIT Bombay, BharatGen aims to foster innovation in AI that is ethical, multilingual, and deeply connected to Indian cultural values. The model's support for 22 languages ensures it can cater to a wide and diverse population, promoting inclusivity and better accessibility in AI technologies across the country.

questions.question: Which organization launched a $10 billion urban infrastructure plan to transform India’s cities?
questions.explanation: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) announced a $10 billion investment program over five years aimed at transforming India’s urban infrastructure. The plan includes expansions of metro rail systems, regional rapid transit systems (RRTS), and upgrades to core urban infrastructure such as water, sanitation, and waste management. This initiative was unveiled during a meeting between ADB President Masato Kanda and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in May 2025. The program focuses on sustainable, inclusive, and resilient city development, supporting India’s vision for “Viksit Bharat @ 2047.” It also seeks to mobilize both sovereign and private capital, leveraging platforms like the Urban Challenge Fund (UCF) for effective urban transformation.

questions.question: Whose portrait has been removed from the new Bangladeshi currency notes?
questions.explanation: The new Bangladeshi currency notes no longer include the portrait of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, who is considered the founding father of Bangladesh. Instead, the notes now feature images of Hindu and Buddhist temples, national landmarks, and cultural artwork. This decision came in the wake of recent political changes following the ouster of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman's daughter. The removal of his image marks a significant shift in national symbolism and political direction, reflecting the new government's effort to represent broader cultural elements rather than specific political figures.

questions.question: Which team won their maiden IPL title in the 2025 season?
questions.explanation: Royal Challengers Bengaluru clinched their first-ever Indian Premier League (IPL) title in the 2025 season by defeating Punjab Kings by 6 runs in a closely contested final held in Ahmedabad. This marked a historic win for the franchise after 18 seasons of the tournament. Several individual performances stood out this season: Sai Sudarshan won the Orange Cap for scoring the most runs, while Prasidh Krishna earned the Purple Cap for taking the most wickets. Vaibhav Suryavanshi was named the Curvv Super Striker of the Season, and Mohammed Siraj led in dot balls under the TATA IPL Green Dot Balls category.

questions.question: Which country is India collaborating with to build its first-ever indigenous Polar Research Vessel (PRV)?
questions.explanation: India is partnering with Norway to build its first-ever indigenously manufactured Polar Research Vessel (PRV). The collaboration is between India’s Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers Ltd. (GRSE) and the Norwegian firm Kongsberg. This partnership formalized through an MoU signed in June 2025, marks a significant step towards enhancing India’s capabilities in polar scientific research and maritime technology. The PRV will support polar and oceanic exploration under the National Centre for Polar and Ocean Research (NCPOR), advancing India’s self-reliance in polar missions and contributing to international scientific cooperation.

questions.question: What percentage of ₹2,000 notes remain in circulation after the RBI's withdrawal drive?
questions.explanation: Only 1.74% of ₹2,000 notes remain in circulation following the Reserve Bank of India’s withdrawal that began on May 19, 2023. This marks a significant reduction from the original value of ₹3.56 lakh crore to just ₹6,181 crore by May 31, 2025. The withdrawal process has been largely successful, with 98.26% of the currency returned. Citizens can still exchange or deposit these notes at 19 designated RBI Issue Offices or through India Post for credit into bank accounts. The move is part of a broader effort to phase out high-denomination currency and promote cleaner note practices in the economy.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression observed annually?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression is observed every year on June 4. It was established by the United Nations in 1982, initially to highlight the plight of children affected by the Lebanon War. Over the years, its focus has broadened to recognize and honour children across the globe who suffer physical, mental, and emotional abuse due to various forms of aggression. The day serves as a call to action to protect the rights of children and to foster global awareness about the impact of violence on their well-being and development.

questions.question: Which state has announced the introduction of basic military education from Class 1?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra has announced a pioneering initiative to introduce basic military education starting from Class 1. The move, led by School Education Minister Dada Bhuse, aims to instill discipline, patriotism, and physical fitness in students from an early age. The training will be provided with the support of approximately 2.5 lakh retired soldiers, along with sports teachers, members of the National Cadet Corps (NCC), and Scouts and Guides. This initiative reflects the state’s commitment to strengthening character-building and national values in young learners, positioning Maharashtra as a leader in innovative educational reforms.

questions.question: Who has been elected President of the 80th UN General Assembly session?
questions.explanation: Annalena Baerbock of Germany has been elected as the President of the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly. In her new role, she has committed to acting as an honest broker and unifier for all 193 member states, emphasizing inclusivity and collaboration. Her election marks a significant moment in international diplomacy, reflecting Germany’s growing influence on the global stage. Alongside her appointment, Niger was selected to occupy the first seat in the Assembly Hall, and several Vice-Presidents and officers were also elected to support the functioning of the session.

questions.question: On which date is World Environment Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Environment Day is observed every year on June 5 as the United Nations’ flagship initiative to raise global awareness and drive action on pressing environmental issues. It was established in 1972 and has since become a major platform engaging over 150 countries worldwide. The 2025 theme, “Beat Plastic Pollution,” highlights the urgent need to reduce plastic waste that harms ecosystems, wildlife, and human health. The Republic of Korea is hosting the 2025 celebrations, showcasing its leadership in environmental policies and innovative waste management.

questions.question: Which Indian state recently had the Khichan and Menar wetlands added to the Ramsar List of Wetlands of International Importance?
questions.explanation: Khichan and Menar wetlands, located in Rajasthan, were recently added to the Ramsar List of Wetlands of International Importance, increasing India’s total number of Ramsar sites to 91. Khichan in Phalodi is known for attracting thousands of migratory Demoiselle Cranes and is a vital stopover along the Central Asian Flyway. Menar, near Udaipur, is famous as a “bird village” with over 150 bird species, including flamingos and pelicans. This designation highlights India’s commitment to conserving crucial ecosystems and promoting biodiversity through both government efforts and local community participation.

questions.question: What is Nomura’s forecasted GDP growth rate for India in FY26?
questions.explanation: Nomura has projected that India’s GDP growth will slow down to 6.2% in FY26, a slight decline from the 6.5% growth recorded in FY25 and the sharp 9.2% expansion in FY24. This forecast reflects concerns about weakening fundamental economic indicators such as sluggish automobile sales and slow bank credit growth, despite strong headline data like GST collections. The moderation signals a cautious outlook amid global uncertainties and an uneven domestic recovery, contrasting with the Reserve Bank of India’s steady 6.5% growth estimate for the same period.

questions.question: Who is the primary beneficiary of the newly launched C CARES 2.0 portal?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Coal launched the C CARES Version 2.0 portal to enhance the welfare of coal workers by streamlining provident fund (PF) and pension disbursements. Developed by the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC), the portal enables real-time tracking of claims, significantly reducing settlement times. This initiative aims to improve social security benefits for coal workers by providing faster and more transparent access to their financial entitlements, reflecting the government’s focus on welfare and efficiency in managing workers’ benefits.

questions.question: Which country became the 101st WTO member to formally accept the Agreement on Fisheries Subsidies?
questions.explanation: Nicaragua became the 101st member of the World Trade Organization (WTO) to accept the Agreement on Fisheries Subsidies on June 2, 2025. This agreement aims to combat harmful fishing practices such as illegal, unreported, and unregulated (IUU) fishing by banning subsidies that contribute to overfishing and environmental damage. Nicaragua’s acceptance brings the total number of acceptances closer to the required 111 for the agreement to enter into force, marking a crucial milestone in global marine conservation and sustainable fisheries management efforts.

questions.question: Who was sworn in as the 21st President of South Korea, pledging to reopen dialogue with North Korea and maintain a strong alliance with the United States?
questions.explanation: Lee Jae-myung, leader of the Liberal Democratic Party, was sworn in as South Korea’s 21st President for a five-year term. His election marked a commitment to balancing diplomacy by reopening dialogue with North Korea while maintaining a strong security alliance with the United States. His main competitor was Kim Moon-soo from the conservative People Power Party. Lee’s presidency is expected to influence South Korea’s domestic and international policies, especially concerning peace efforts on the Korean Peninsula and relations with global powers.

questions.question: Which country has been elected to the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) for the term 2026-28?
questions.explanation: India has been elected to serve on the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) for a two-year term from 2026 to 2028. ECOSOC is a principal organ of the UN that focuses on advancing sustainable development across economic, social, and environmental dimensions. The council plays a critical role in shaping policies and coordinating efforts among UN agencies to address global challenges, making India's election significant for its increased engagement in international economic and social governance.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Director of the Prime Ministers Museum and Library for a three-year term?
questions.explanation: Ashwani Lohani, a veteran administrator and former CMD of Air India as well as ex-Chairman of the Railway Board, has been appointed as the Director of the Prime Ministers Museum and Library (PMML) for a three-year tenure. His extensive leadership experience in sectors like aviation, railways, and tourism positions him to bring transformative changes to the PMML, an institution dedicated to preserving the legacy of India's Prime Ministers. This appointment was approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet, filling the vacancy after the previous director’s exit.

questions.question: Which e-commerce firm recently received an NBFC licence from the Reserve Bank of India to enter the direct lending space?
questions.explanation: Flipkart has become the first major Indian e-commerce platform to receive a Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) licence from the Reserve Bank of India. This licence allows Flipkart to lend directly to its customers and sellers, enabling it to operate independently in the credit space without intermediaries such as banks or third-party NBFCs. This move marks a significant fintech milestone for Flipkart, expanding its fintech ecosystem through its app, super.money, and transforming the online retail lending landscape in India.

questions.question: Which Indian state has begun exporting green vegetables to Dubai through its cooperative marketing federation, VEGFED?
questions.explanation: Bihar has initiated the export of green vegetables produced by its cooperative marketing federation, VEGFED, which operates similarly to the milk cooperative COMFED. The first consignment, weighing 1,500 kilograms, was shipped to Dubai via Varanasi. This marks a significant step in promoting agricultural exports from Bihar and expanding its market reach internationally. The next planned shipment is set for Singapore, showcasing Bihar’s growing role in the export of fresh produce and enhancing the cooperative movement in the state’s agricultural sector.

questions.question: Where was the National Agro-RE Summit 2025, attended by Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, held?
questions.explanation: The National Agriculture-Renewable Energy Conference 2025, also known as the National Agro-RE Summit 2025, was organized by the National Solar Energy Federation of India (NSEFI) and held in New Delhi. Union Minister of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Shivraj Singh Chouhan, participated in the event where he released the federation’s report and annual reference book focused on agriculture and renewable energy. This summit highlights the growing integration of renewable energy initiatives within India’s agricultural sector, emphasizing sustainable development and innovation.

questions.question: Which country was the destination of India’s first Tri-Services All-Women Sailing Team’s historic international open-sea expedition?
questions.explanation: India’s first Tri-Services All-Women Sailing Team completed a pioneering international open-sea expedition by sailing 1,800 nautical miles to Seychelles aboard the indigenous vessel ‘Triveni’. This two-month mission, spanning from April 7 to June 4, 2025, was a landmark achievement showcasing the skill, endurance, and teamwork of women officers from the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force. The voyage demonstrated India’s maritime capabilities, strengthened diplomatic ties with Seychelles, and highlighted women's empowerment within the Indian Armed Forces, marking a significant milestone in military history.

questions.question: In which year will the Government of India conduct the Population Census incorporating caste enumeration for the first time in decades?
questions.explanation: The Population Census of India is scheduled to be conducted in two phases with the primary reference date as March 1, 2027, for most regions. This census will mark a significant milestone by including caste enumeration after a long gap, enabling more detailed socio-economic data collection. The census had been postponed since 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic, making 2027 the year to resume this vital demographic exercise to aid governance, planning, and social welfare policy formulation.

questions.question: To how many centres are the National Polio Surveillance Network (NPSN) in India planned to be reduced by 2026-27?
questions.explanation: The Government of India, in partnership with the World Health Organization (WHO), has outlined a plan to gradually reduce the number of National Polio Surveillance Network (NPSN) centres. Originally established in 1997, this network was crucial in achieving India’s polio-free status in 2014. As part of the proposed restructuring, the number of centres will be reduced from 280 in 2024-25 to 140 by the year 2026-27. This transition marks a strategic shift in public health resource allocation while maintaining vigilance against the potential resurgence of the disease.

questions.question: Which institute's researchers have developed a novel nanozyme to prevent abnormal blood clotting?
questions.explanation: Researchers from the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) have developed a novel metal-based nanozyme designed to prevent abnormal blood clotting. This breakthrough is particularly significant in addressing conditions such as Pulmonary Thromboembolism (PTE) and thrombosis associated with COVID-19. Nanozymes are artificial nanomaterials that mimic the activity of antioxidant enzymes to control reactive oxygen species (ROS), thereby helping to regulate platelet activity and prevent dangerous clot formations. The IISc team’s innovation could pave the way for advanced treatments in managing life-threatening clotting disorders.

questions.question: On which dates was the 55th Monetary Policy Committee meeting of the RBI held in June 2025?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) held its 55th Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting from June 4 to 6, 2025. This meeting was led by Governor Shri Sanjay Malhotra and took place during a period of dynamic global and domestic economic shifts. Key decisions included a 50 basis point cut in the repo rate, a shift from an "Accommodative" to "Neutral" policy stance, and other liquidity adjustments. The dates of the meeting are crucial, as they mark when these impactful monetary decisions were made, directly influencing interest rates, inflation outlook, and economic strategy going forward.

questions.question: With which country has India recently brought a new Bilateral Investment Treaty (BIT) into force?
questions.explanation: India has recently enforced a new Bilateral Investment Treaty (BIT) with Kyrgyzstan, replacing the earlier agreement that had been in place since May 12, 2000. The treaty is designed to provide a stable and transparent framework to promote and protect investments by investors from both countries. By ensuring legal safeguards and continuity in investment protection, the agreement aims to enhance economic cooperation and mutual confidence between India and Kyrgyzstan, encouraging more robust bilateral trade and financial engagement in the years to come.

questions.question: In which country is Mount Etna, Europe’s most active volcano, located?
questions.explanation: Mount Etna is located in Sicily, a region in southern Italy. It is renowned as Europe’s most active volcano and has been erupting for thousands of years. With a history of eruptions documented over at least 2,700 years, it holds one of the world’s longest records of volcanic activity. As a UNESCO World Heritage site, Mount Etna is not only a geological landmark but also a cultural and historical symbol for the region. The frequent eruptions and continuous volcanic activity make it a notable feature of Italy’s natural landscape.

questions.question: With which country has India agreed to enhance cooperation in the media and entertainment sector?
questions.explanation: India and Vietnam have agreed to strengthen cooperation in the media and entertainment sector as part of their ongoing strategic partnership. The two nations share a longstanding diplomatic relationship that reached its 50th anniversary in 2022. In 2016, the bilateral ties were upgraded to a Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, reflecting mutual trust and growing collaboration across various domains. This recent initiative in media and entertainment is a reflection of the deepening engagement and shared cultural interests between the two countries, promoting people-to-people connections and economic opportunities in the creative industries.

questions.question: In which Indian state has the country’s first Variable Speed Pumped Storage Plant (PSP) begun operations?
questions.explanation: India’s first Variable Speed Pumped Storage Plant (PSP) has commenced operations at Tehri in the state of Uttarakhand. Developed by THDC India Ltd. under the Ministry of Power, this plant marks a significant advancement in energy storage and grid stability. The PSP operates by moving water between two reservoirs to store and generate electricity based on demand, offering a flexible and efficient solution for integrating renewable energy sources. This milestone not only supports energy sustainability but also strengthens the state's role in India’s growing power infrastructure.

questions.question: Which company has expanded LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky’s role to also oversee its Office productivity division?
questions.explanation: On June 4, 2025, Microsoft announced a significant leadership change by expanding LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky’s responsibilities to include oversight of its Office productivity suite. This includes key products such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, and the AI-powered Microsoft 365 Copilot. The decision reflects Microsoft’s strategic vision to integrate artificial intelligence deeply into workplace tools while creating a unified ecosystem between its productivity offerings and professional networking platform, LinkedIn. Roslansky’s new role aims to enhance user experience and cross-platform functionality as Microsoft intensifies efforts to lead the future of work through seamless, AI-driven digital environments.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Chairman of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister in June 2025?
questions.explanation: S Mahendra Dev, an eminent economist with a distinguished career in development economics, rural studies, and public policy, has been appointed as the Chairman of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM) as of June 5, 2025. With academic credentials including a PhD from Delhi School of Economics and post-doctoral work at Yale University, Dev has held various prestigious roles, such as Director of IGIDR and editor of Economic and Political Weekly. His appointment reflects a renewed emphasis on development-centric policy advice, especially in agriculture and rural economy, as India navigates key economic reforms and inclusive growth strategies.

questions.question: What is the new name of the Test series played between India and England?
questions.explanation: The historic Test series between India and England has been officially renamed the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, replacing the previous titles—the Pataudi Trophy (in England) and the Anthony de Mello Trophy (in India). This renaming is a tribute to two of the greatest Test cricketers: James Anderson, England's highest wicket-taker in the format, and Sachin Tendulkar, India’s most-capped Test player and one of the game’s most celebrated batsmen. The announcement was made by the ECB and BCCI and reflects a move to honour cricketing legends while enhancing the legacy and emotional connection of fans with the India-England rivalry.

questions.question: Who won the Norway Chess tournament title in 2025?
questions.explanation: Magnus Carlsen, the Norwegian grandmaster and world number 1, secured his seventh Norway Chess tournament title in 2025 held in Stavanger. He outperformed competitors such as Fabiano Caruana, who finished second, and Gukesh, who placed third. Carlsen’s victory further solidifies his reputation as one of the strongest chess players globally. The Norway Chess tournament is a prestigious event that attracts top international players, making his seventh win a significant achievement in his career. Anna Muzychuk clinched the Women's Norway Chess 2025 title with a final score of 16.5 points, finishing undefeated in classical play.

questions.question: Which company recently received the GMPCS licence to launch satellite internet services in India?
questions.explanation: Starlink, the satellite internet venture by Elon Musk’s SpaceX, has officially received the GMPCS (Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite) licence from India’s Department of Telecommunications. This regulatory approval allows Starlink to provide satellite-based broadband services across the country, making it the third operator in India’s satellite communication market after OneWeb and Jio Satellite Communications. With a trial spectrum expected soon, Starlink is poised to demonstrate its compliance with India’s security and technical standards before launching full-scale operations. This development strengthens India's growing focus on next-generation connectivity solutions in remote and underserved regions.

questions.question: Who received the ‘Most Impactful Environmentalist’ award on World Environment Day?
questions.explanation: Acharya Prashant, a philosopher and author, was honored with the ‘Most Impactful Environmentalist’ award by the Green Society of India on World Environment Day. This award recognized his unique contribution to merging spiritual clarity with environmental awareness. His work has inspired millions to embrace sustainable living practices, highlighting the importance of mindfulness and responsibility towards nature. Such recognition emphasizes the growing connection between spiritual wisdom and environmental stewardship in addressing global ecological challenges.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the brand ambassador for Dettol’s new ‘Icy Cool’ personal care range launched in May 2025?
questions.explanation: Dettol selected MS Dhoni as the face of its newly launched ‘Icy Cool’ personal care range in May 2025. Known as “Captain Cool,” Dhoni embodies the qualities of calmness and resilience, which align perfectly with the campaign’s theme—providing cooling relief and germ protection during the intense Indian summer. The product line includes soaps, body wash, and handwash designed to combat heat-related hygiene issues such as excessive sweating and germ buildup. The partnership leverages Dhoni’s strong national appeal and trusted public image to communicate the brand’s commitment to seasonal relevance, hygiene, and comfort through an engaging commercial campaign.

questions.question: Which Indian state developed molecular diagnostic test kits to detect deadly brain-infecting amoebae?
questions.explanation: Kerala’s State Public Health Laboratory in Thiruvananthapuram has made a significant scientific breakthrough by developing PCR-based molecular diagnostic kits capable of detecting five dangerous species of free-living amoebae, including Acanthamoeba spp., which causes amoebic meningoencephalitis. This achievement marks the first time the presence of Acanthamoeba spp. has been confirmed in a human sample using an in-house developed kit. Previously, such samples had to be sent to national laboratories, causing delays in diagnosis and treatment. With this advancement, Kerala can now conduct its own confirmatory testing, enabling faster, more accurate diagnoses and improving the chances of effective treatment and survival.

questions.question: Who won the 6th Stepan Avagyan Memorial chess tournament?
questions.explanation: Aravindh Chithambaram, an Indian Grandmaster, won the 6th Stepan Avagyan Memorial chess tournament held in Jermuk, Armenia. He scored 6.5 points over 9 rounds, tying with fellow Indian Grandmaster R. Praggnanandhaa. However, Aravindh secured the title by winning on tie breaks using the Sonneborne-Berger system, which considers the strength of the opponents defeated. This victory highlights Aravindh’s strong performance and strategic gameplay in an internationally competitive field.

questions.question: Which Indian company has partnered with Dassault Aviation to manufacture the fuselage of Rafale fighter aircraft in India?
questions.explanation: Dassault Aviation, a French aerospace company, has partnered with Tata Advanced Systems Limited to jointly manufacture the fuselage of the Rafale fighter aircraft in India. This collaboration marks the first time the critical fuselage component will be produced outside France. As part of the agreement, Tata will establish a state-of-the-art production facility in Hyderabad, enhancing India’s defence manufacturing capabilities and supporting the ‘Make in India’ initiative in the aerospace sector.

questions.question: What is the new Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio set by the RBI for gold loans up to ₹2.5 lakh, effective from April 1, 2026?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India has increased the Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio for gold loans up to ₹2.5 lakh from 75% to 85%, effective April 1, 2026. This change is part of a broader strategy to enhance credit access for small-ticket borrowers while maintaining robust risk management practices. The decision comes amid a surge in gold loan demand and rising non-performing assets (NPAs) in this segment. By allowing a higher LTV, borrowers can access more funds against the same amount of gold, offering critical financial relief, especially to those in the lower income brackets. However, stricter lender protocols will be enforced to ensure systemic stability.

questions.question: On which date is World Food Safety Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Food Safety Day is observed annually on June 7. Established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2018, this day highlights the importance of safe food to public health, food security, and economic prosperity. The observance involves global campaigns and actions to promote food safety awareness and encourage collaboration among governments, producers, and consumers. The choice of June 7 has been consistent since the first global observance in 2019, making it a fixed date dedicated to this important cause.

questions.question: Which country is hosting the G-7 Summit that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to attend in 2025?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to attend the G-7 Summit in 2025, which will be hosted in Kananaskis, Alberta, Canada. The invitation was extended by Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, and Modi’s acceptance marks a pivotal moment in improving India-Canada relations. This will be Modi’s first visit to Canada since 2015, coming after years of diplomatic tensions over issues like the Khalistan separatist movement and the Nijjar case. The summit and Modi's participation are expected to pave the way for renewed diplomatic, economic, and people-to-people engagement between the two nations.

questions.question: Which country has patented technology for launching UAVs from an orbital space station?
questions.explanation: Russia has developed and patented a pioneering technology that enables the launching of automatic spacecraft, including UAVs, directly from an orbital station. This innovation marks the creation of the world’s first drone platform in space, equipped with robots for maintenance tasks. The technology is set to be tested on the Russian Orbital Station (ROS) and has future applications planned for lunar exploration. This advancement highlights Russia’s ongoing efforts to expand capabilities in space technology and autonomous operations beyond Earth.

questions.question: What number of meetings of the Niti Aayog Governing Council was held under the theme 'Viksit Rajya for Viksit Bharat@2047'?
questions.explanation: The 10th meeting of the NITI Aayog Governing Council focused on the theme "Viksit Rajya for Viksit Bharat@2047," aiming to promote cooperative federalism and align state-specific development goals with national objectives. This meeting emphasized removing policy bottlenecks to encourage trade and investment, improving security preparedness, and fostering sustainable development. Various states presented their demands and proposals, ranging from fiscal autonomy to sectoral reforms in areas like water management, infrastructure, and skilling. Identifying the meeting as the 10th in sequence is essential to contextualize the evolving role of the Governing Council in shaping India’s long-term development trajectory.

questions.question: Under which Article has the Centre issued regulations for Ladakh to address the demands of its people?
questions.explanation: The Centre has issued regulations for Ladakh under Article 240, which empowers the President to make regulations for the peace and good governance of certain Union Territories. These regulations have introduced domicile-based job reservations, provisions for reservations, preservation of local languages, and representation for women. Although the Sixth Schedule status was widely requested, the Centre opted for regulations under Article 240 to address the demands of the people of Ladakh, providing some level of autonomy and protection.

questions.question: In which region is the Chenab Bridge, the world's highest arch-railway bridge, located?
questions.explanation: The Chenab Bridge is located in Jammu & Kashmir and holds the distinction of being the world’s highest arch-railway bridge. Towering 359 metres above the Chenab River, this engineering marvel is part of the strategically vital Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Rail Link Project. The region’s rugged Himalayan terrain posed significant challenges, requiring advanced geotechnical solutions like cement grouting and rock anchors. Designed for resilience against seismic activity and strong winds, the bridge exemplifies India’s infrastructural capabilities in high-risk zones. Its location in a border-sensitive area further underlines its national importance, serving both developmental and strategic purposes in the Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir.

questions.question: What is the new qualifying asset threshold for NBFC-MFIs as a percentage of total net assets?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced the qualifying asset threshold for NBFC-MFIs from 75% to 60%. This change allows NBFC-MFIs to diversify their loan portfolio, freeing up 15% of asset space. The move is expected to provide operational flexibility, balance sheet stability, and better cross-cycle earnings, ultimately enhancing service delivery to poor households and enabling MFIs to customize financial products for low-income and underserved segments.

questions.question: What is India’s global rank in terms of solar energy capacity as of 2025?
questions.explanation: India holds the 3rd position globally in solar energy capacity, reflecting its rapid progress in the renewable energy sector. With a dramatic rise in solar capacity from just 2.63 GW in 2014 to 108 GW in 2025—a 41-fold increase—India has become a clean energy powerhouse. This transformation is fueled by initiatives like the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, ISTS charge waivers, and ambitious programs like PM Surya Ghar and PM-KUSUM. India's strategic focus on solar energy not only advances its own sustainability goals but also significantly contributes to global clean energy efforts.

questions.question: Under which year was the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) enacted?
questions.explanation: India plans to regulate online real money gaming (RMG) under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002, aiming to enhance financial transparency and user protection. The move responds to the sector’s rapid growth and the associated risks of illicit financial flows. RMG platforms, including fantasy sports and poker, have surged in popularity, especially among youth, driven by affordable internet, mobile accessibility, and digital payments. However, concerns about money laundering through complex transaction layering and cross-border fund integration have prompted the government to consider applying the 2002 legislation to strengthen oversight and reduce vulnerabilities in the digital gaming landscape.

questions.question: In which state is the Neolithic habitation site of Daojali Hading located?
questions.explanation: Daojali Hading, a Neolithic habitation site over 2,700 years old, is located in the Dima Hasao district of Assam. The site has revealed both domestic artefacts and early metallurgical activity, including polished stone tools, cord-marked pottery, and grinding stones. The presence of jadeite stones suggests ancient trade links with East and Southeast Asia. Daojali Hading is one of the prominent Neolithic sites in Northeastern India, showcasing the region's rich cultural and archaeological heritage. The site provides valuable insights into the lives of ancient people in the region.

questions.question: By how many basis points was the repo rate reduced?
questions.explanation: The repo rate was reduced by 50 basis points to 5.5%, representing the third cut since February 2025. This move by the central bank is designed to stimulate economic growth at a time when inflation is well within the targeted range, thereby allowing for monetary easing. A 50 basis point reduction can significantly lower borrowing costs across sectors—affecting home loans, vehicle finance, and business credit. This helps encourage credit demand and boosts consumption and investment, which are key drivers of economic recovery. Such rate cuts are also vital for monetary policy transmission and support the broader macroeconomic goal of sustaining growth.

questions.question: Where was the ICGEB meeting, highlighting India's biotech advancements, recently held?
questions.explanation: The International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology (ICGEB) meeting was recently held in New Delhi, emphasizing India's growing leadership in biotechnology. The event marked the inauguration of the DST-ICGEB Bio-foundry, the first public-funded platform aimed at advancing bio-based innovations. As part of the BioE3 policy, India aims to strengthen its bio-manufacturing ecosystem, contributing to economic growth, environmental sustainability, and employment. The bioeconomy has witnessed rapid expansion, growing from USD 10 billion in 2014 to over USD 165 billion in 2024. With major vaccine developments and global recognition, India continues to assert itself as a global biotechnology hub.

questions.question: In which year was India's first comprehensive bankruptcy law enacted?
questions.explanation: India enacted its first comprehensive bankruptcy law in 2016, marking a major shift in how financial distress and insolvency were handled. The law aimed to create a more structured, time-bound, and creditor-friendly insolvency resolution process, replacing the earlier fragmented systems. This legislation introduced a framework that enabled faster debt recovery, improved borrower behaviour, and enhanced credit discipline. Its impact has been profound—over 30,000 cases settled pre-admission, a notable reduction in debt costs for distressed firms, and improved governance. Identifying 2016 as the year of enactment is vital to understanding the chronology and evolution of insolvency reforms in India.

questions.question: In which city is the World Expo 2025 being held, where the India Pavilion has been ranked among the top five?
questions.explanation: The World Expo 2025 is being hosted in Osaka, Japan, where the India Pavilion has gained significant recognition by securing a spot among the top five pavilions. The pavilion highlights India’s cultural heritage, advancements in Ayurveda, space technology (ISRO), and sustainable development initiatives. Organized by the Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts, it reflects India’s global soft power and innovation. The Expo serves as a platform for nations to showcase their achievements, and India’s strong presence underscores its growing influence in areas of tradition, science, and sustainability on the world stage.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Fertiliser Association of India (FAI)?
questions.explanation: Sailesh C. Mehta, Managing Director of Deepak Fertilizers and Petrochemicals Corporation Ltd., has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Fertiliser Association of India (FAI). With over 40 years of experience in the fertiliser sector, Mehta succeeds N. Suresh Krishnan (MD & CEO of Paradeep Phosphates Ltd.). Known for his expertise in sustainable agriculture and efficient fertiliser practices, Mehta aims to strengthen industry-government collaboration and promote balanced nutrient usage to enhance farm productivity. His leadership comes at a crucial time as India focuses on food security and eco-friendly fertiliser solutions.

questions.question: Which migratory bird species has Tamil Nadu specifically protected by declaring Dhanushkodi as a sanctuary in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Greater Flamingo is the focal species of conservation in Tamil Nadu's newly declared Dhanushkodi Sanctuary (524.7 hectares). Announced on World Environment Day 2025, this sanctuary safeguards critical habitats for these migratory birds within the Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve. The area hosts over 10,700 wetland birds along the Central Asian Flyway, emphasizing India’s commitment to international biodiversity agreements. The move also aims to balance ecotourism and local livelihoods while preserving mangroves, mudflats, and sand dunes that sustain flamingo populations.

questions.question: Who won the Women's Singles title at the French Open 2025, becoming the youngest American champion since Serena Williams in 2002?
questions.explanation: Coco Gauff secured her first French Open title by defeating world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the final. At just 21 years old, she became the youngest American woman to win at Roland Garros since Serena Williams in 2002 and the first from the U.S. since Williams in 2015. This victory marked Gauff's second Grand Slam title, further establishing her as a leading figure in women's tennis. Her triumph highlighted her growth on clay and cemented her status as one of the sport's brightest young stars.

questions.question: Which Indian state organized the 'Bodhi Yatra' to promote its Buddhist heritage with delegates from ASEAN countries?
questions.explanation: The 'Bodhi Yatra' was organized by the Uttar Pradesh Tourism Department in collaboration with the Union Ministry of External Affairs under the Mekong-Ganga Cooperation (MGC) framework. The event aimed to highlight Uttar Pradesh's rich Buddhist heritage on the global stage, attracting 50 delegates from five ASEAN countries. This initiative reflects the state's efforts to boost cultural tourism and strengthen international ties through its historical and spiritual significance in Buddhism. Uttar Pradesh is home to key Buddhist sites like Sarnath and Kushinagar, making it a focal point for such heritage promotions.

questions.question: Who won the French Open 2025 men's singles title by defeating Jannik Sinner in a historic final?
questions.explanation: Carlos Alcaraz successfully defended his French Open title by defeating world number 1 Jannik Sinner in an epic final that lasted 5 hours and 29 minutes—the longest men's singles final in Roland Garros history. This victory marked Alcaraz's second consecutive French Open title and handed Sinner his first-ever Grand Slam final defeat. The match was hailed as an all-time classic, showcasing Alcaraz's resilience and skill on clay. This win further solidified Alcaraz's status as one of the brightest young stars in tennis, continuing his rapid rise in the sport.

questions.question: Which country dominated the Taiwan Athletics Open 2024 by winning 12 gold medals and topping the medal tally?
questions.explanation: India delivered an outstanding performance at the Taiwan Athletics Open, a World Athletics Continental Tour Bronze event, securing a total of 16 medals—12 gold, 3 silver, and 1 bronze. The team started strong by winning gold in all six events on Day 1 and continued their dominance by adding 10 more medals on the final day. This remarkable achievement highlighted India's growing prowess in track and field, marking one of its most successful campaigns in an international athletics meet. The victory underscored the nation's rising talent in global athletics competitions.

questions.question: According to the World Bank Report 2022-23, what is India's current extreme poverty rate?
questions.explanation: The World Bank's latest report highlights India's significant achievement in reducing extreme poverty from 27.1% in 2011-12 to just 5.3% in 2022-23, using an updated poverty line of $3 per day (adjusted for inflation and purchasing power parity). This decline reflects the success of economic growth, welfare schemes (like food subsidies), and targeted poverty alleviation programs. The report also notes that 171 million people were lifted out of poverty in this period, with rural-urban gaps narrowing substantially. Despite global economic challenges, India's progress sets a benchmark for poverty reduction efforts worldwide.

questions.question: Who has made history by becoming India's first female Aide-De-Camp (ADC) to a state Governor?
questions.explanation: Squadron Leader Manisha Padhi of the Indian Air Force (2015 batch) has created history by becoming India's first female Aide-De-Camp (ADC) to a state Governor. She was formally appointed to assist Mizoram Governor Hari Babu Kambhampati in November 2024. This landmark achievement marks a significant step toward gender inclusivity in India's armed forces, breaking traditional barriers in ceremonial military roles. Previously posted at Air Force stations in Bidar, Pune, and Bhatinda, her appointment highlights the growing recognition of women officers in high-profile defence and governance positions.

questions.question: In which Indian state did Army Chief Upendra Dwivedi inaugurate the community radio station 'Ibex Tarana 88.4 FM'?
questions.explanation: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi inaugurated Ibex Tarana 88.4 FM, a community radio station, in Jyotirmath, Uttarakhand, during his visit to assess troop readiness in the Garhwal region. This initiative, the first Army-backed community radio in a border area, aims to strengthen civil-military ties, promote local culture, and provide educational, employment, and disaster-preparedness programs. The launch underscores the Indian Army’s role in community empowerment alongside national security, particularly in strategic frontier regions like Uttarakhand.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the part-time member of the 16th Finance Commission following the resignation of Ajay Narayan Jha?
questions.explanation: T Rabi Sankar, currently serving as Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), has been appointed as a part-time member of the 16th Finance Commission (XVIFC) by the President of India. He fills the vacancy created by Ajay Narayan Jha's resignation and will serve until the commission submits its report (due by October 31, 2025). Sankar’s expertise in central banking and financial markets is expected to strengthen the Commission’s recommendations on Centre-State fiscal relations for 2026-2031. His reappointment as RBI Deputy Governor in May 2024 underscores his influential role in economic policymaking.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with Thomas Cook to expand the distribution of its travel and student forex cards across India?
questions.explanation: Thomas Cook (India) Limited has formed a strategic partnership with Muthoot Forex, a part of the Muthoot Group, to enhance the accessibility of its Borderless Travel Card and Study Buddy Card across India. Leveraging Muthoot’s vast network of over 7,000 branches, including 43 dedicated forex outlets, the collaboration ensures these products reach customers not only in major cities but also in Tier 2 to Tier 4 towns. This move strengthens Thomas Cook’s distribution network and simplifies the availability of pre-paid forex solutions for international travellers and students, making overseas travel and education more secure and convenient for Indian citizens.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the Deputy Chief of Army Staff (Strategy) in 2025?
questions.explanation: Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai was appointed as the Deputy Chief of Army Staff (Strategy) in 2025, a key role overseeing critical areas like Military Operations, Intelligence, and Strategic Planning. A veteran of the Kumaon Regiment, Lt Gen Ghai has held significant operational commands, including as the General Officer Commanding of the Chinar Corps. He gained national prominence for his leadership during Operation Sindoor, a successful precision strike campaign targeting terrorist infrastructure. In recognition of his exceptional strategic leadership, he was also awarded the Uttam Yudh Seva Medal in 2025, solidifying his reputation as one of India’s top military strategists.

questions.question: Which former Indian cricket captain was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame in 2025?
questions.explanation: MS Dhoni, the legendary former Indian captain, was among seven cricketers inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame in 2025, recognizing his exceptional contributions to the sport. Known for his calm leadership, explosive batting, and sharp wicketkeeping, Dhoni led India to multiple ICC titles, including the 2007 T20 World Cup, 2011 ODI World Cup, and 2013 Champions Trophy. He was honoured alongside cricketing greats like Matthew Hayden, Graeme Smith, Hashim Amla, Daniel Vettori, Sarah Taylor, and Sana Mir, cementing his legacy as one of cricket's all-time greats.

questions.question: Which AI initiative has partnered with Indian Railways to provide multilingual support across railway services?
questions.explanation: BHASHINI, under the Digital India initiative, has partnered with Indian Railways to bring multilingual AI solutions to key platforms like NTES and RailMadad. This collaboration aims to improve public access to railway services by integrating technologies such as Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), Text-to-Speech (TTS), Text-to-Text Translation, and Optical Character Recognition (OCR). The partnership facilitates real-time communication and service delivery in 22 Indian languages, promoting digital inclusion and linguistic accessibility. It represents a strategic effort to bridge language barriers and enhance passenger experience, particularly for those more comfortable interacting in regional languages.

questions.question: On which date is World Accreditation Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Accreditation Day is celebrated globally on June 9 each year to highlight the importance of accreditation in improving quality, safety, and efficiency across industries. In 2025, India marked the day with events like the launch of the revamped NABL Portal and the Gunvatta Samarpan initiative, focusing on empowering MSMEs through global standards. The Quality Council of India (QCI) organized the celebrations in New Delhi, emphasizing accreditation's role in boosting competitiveness, sustainability, and market access for small businesses while aligning with international quality ecosystems.

questions.question: Where was the new parasitic wasp species 'Losgna Occidentalis' discovered in India?
questions.explanation: The parasitic wasp species 'Losgna Occidentalis' was discovered in Chandigarh, highlighting the region's unexplored biodiversity. Belonging to the Ichneumonidae family (Darwin wasps), these insects play a crucial role in biological pest control by laying eggs in or on other arthropods. This discovery underscores the importance of further research into India's diverse ecosystems, as many species remain undocumented. Chandigarh's urban and semi-urban habitats may host more such unique species, emphasizing the need for conservation efforts even in developed areas to maintain ecological balance and natural pest management systems.

questions.question: Which country hosted the 11th BRICS Parliamentary Forum in June 2025?
questions.explanation: The 11th BRICS Parliamentary Forum was hosted by Brazil in its capital Brasilia on 4–5 June 2025, bringing together parliamentary delegations from all 10 member nations, including India. The Indian delegation, led by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, participated in discussions on global cooperation. Notably, India was announced as the next host for the 12th BRICS Parliamentary Forum in 2026, continuing the group's tradition of rotational leadership. This forum strengthens parliamentary diplomacy among emerging economies, addressing shared challenges in governance and development.

questions.question: Under which year's Indian Patents Act can compulsory licensing be invoked for life-saving drugs?
questions.explanation: The Indian Patents Act, of 1970, includes provisions for compulsory licensing under Section 84, allowing the government or third parties to produce patented drugs without the patent owner's consent under specific conditions. This is particularly crucial for making life-saving medicines accessible and affordable for rare disease patients. The Act balances patent protection with public health needs, ensuring that intellectual property rights do not hinder essential medical access. Recent demands by rare disease patients highlight the ongoing relevance of this legal provision in addressing healthcare affordability in India.

questions.question: Where was India’s first International Agri Hackathon held, which introduced the ‘Clean Plant Programme’?
questions.explanation: India’s first International Agri Hackathon took place in Pune, where the Union government launched the ‘Clean Plant Programme’. This initiative focuses on supplying disease-free horticultural plants to farmers, starting with Maharashtra, to enhance agricultural productivity. Key crops like grapes, oranges, and pomegranates will benefit from this program, ensuring healthier yields. The event highlights Pune’s growing role in agri-innovation and sustainable farming solutions, aligning with national efforts to modernize agriculture and improve farmer livelihoods through technology and research-driven interventions.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the Bikram Lock Canal Bank solar power project inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The Bikram Lock Canal Bank solar power project was inaugurated in Bihar's Patna district as part of the state's ‘Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali’ campaign. This initiative aims to promote renewable energy and reduce environmental damage caused by traditional energy sources. The project is located along a 2-kilometre stretch of the main canal at Bikram, highlighting Bihar's commitment to sustainable development and green energy solutions. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's involvement underscores the state's focus on expanding solar energy infrastructure to meet future energy demands while minimizing ecological impact.

questions.question: In which city is India’s first e-waste recycling park being developed?
questions.explanation: India’s first dedicated e-waste recycling park is being set up in Holambi Kalan, a locality in North Delhi. This initiative by the Delhi government marks a significant step towards building a sustainable urban ecosystem. Spread across 11.4 acres, the facility will handle up to 51,000 tonnes of e-waste annually and will focus on formalizing the recycling sector. It aims to generate green jobs, reduce landfill dependency, and promote the circular economy by extracting valuable raw materials from electronic waste. The park will serve as a model for similar projects across India, encouraging eco-conscious infrastructure development.

questions.question: Which country celebrates the Poson Poya festival to mark the arrival of Buddhism over 2,000 years ago?
questions.explanation: Poson Poya is a significant Buddhist festival celebrated in Sri Lanka to honour the introduction of Buddhism to the island in the 3rd century BCE. It commemorates the moment when Arahat Mahinda, son of Indian Emperor Ashoka, delivered the first Buddhist sermon to King Devanampiyatissa at Mihintale. This event is regarded as the formal beginning of Theravāda Buddhism in Sri Lanka. Celebrations involve religious observances, illuminated streets, and pilgrimages to Mihintale and Anuradhapura. In 2025, the Sri Lankan government arranged special train services to facilitate pilgrim travel, and the Indian High Commission contributed with an exhibition on shared Buddhist heritage.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Play observed annually?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Play is celebrated annually on June 11, serving as a unified global effort to highlight the importance of play in human development, particularly for children. This date was chosen to raise awareness about the need to incorporate play into everyday life across educational, social, and policy contexts. Since its first observance on June 11, 2024, the day has become a platform for governments, educators, caregivers, and organizations to advocate for play-friendly environments. Recognizing June 11 as the official day ensures consistent, coordinated efforts worldwide to promote the value and necessity of play.

questions.question: Which city ranked 6th globally in under-construction data centre capacity, according to Cushman & Wakefield’s 2025 report?
questions.explanation: Mumbai has been ranked 6th globally out of 97 cities for under-construction data centre capacity in the 2025 edition of Cushman & Wakefield’s Global Data Center Market Comparison report. With 335 MW currently being developed, Mumbai also leads the Asia-Pacific region and accounts for over half of India’s total data centre capacity. This growth is fueled by increasing demand from hyperscalers, expanding AI and cloud computing applications, and strong digital and power infrastructure. The city’s data centre boom is expected to raise operational capacity by 62%, underscoring Mumbai’s emergence as a major global hub for digital infrastructure development.

questions.question: In which Indian state will the country’s first underwater museum and artificial coral reef be developed?
questions.explanation: India’s first underwater museum and artificial coral reef is set to be established near Nivati Rocks at Vengurla in the Sindhudurg district of Maharashtra. The site will revolve around the decommissioned Indian Navy warship INS Guldar, which will serve as a centrepiece to promote both marine biodiversity and tourism. Supported by the central government, the project aims to attract eco-tourism through activities such as scuba diving and, in the future, submarine tours. The museum will not only contribute to marine conservation by fostering artificial reefs but will also open new avenues for sustainable tourism and environmental education.

questions.question: Which company announced the launch of its first mass-market AR smart glasses, named “Specs”, scheduled for 2026?
questions.explanation: Snap Inc., the parent company of Snapchat, announced that it will launch its first-ever consumer-focused AR smart glasses, named "Specs", in 2026. This marks a major strategic push into the wearable augmented reality space, positioning Snap to compete directly with tech giants like Meta, which already has AR smart glasses on the market. Snap’s announcement reflects over a decade of AR development and a $3 billion investment in this technology. The new smart glasses will be lightweight, powered by Snap’s AR tools like Lens Studio, and are intended for mass-market use, distinguishing them from Snap’s previous limited or developer-only releases.

questions.question: Which Indian city has recently been declared the country's ‘Leopard Capital’ due to its high population of free-ranging wild leopards?
questions.explanation: Bengaluru has recently earned the title of India’s ‘Leopard Capital’ after a comprehensive year-long survey by the Holématthi Nature Foundation revealed an estimated 80–85 wild leopards living on the city’s outskirts. This surpasses Mumbai’s leopard population of 54 and highlights Bengaluru’s unique ecological setting as a major metropolitan area coexisting with apex predators. The survey covered areas like Bannerghatta National Park and adjacent forested zones, using over 250 camera traps across 282 sq km. The findings emphasize the city's rich biodiversity and the urgent need for sustainable conservation strategies to ensure long-term leopard-human coexistence in urban fringe habitats.

questions.question: Who won the gold medal in the women’s 10km race at the Austrian Racewalking Championships?
questions.explanation: At the Austrian Racewalking Championships held in Innsbruck, Priyanka Goswami secured the gold medal in the women’s 10km race with an impressive time of 47:54. This achievement marks a significant highlight in her athletic career and underscores India’s growing presence in the international racewalking circuit. Her victory contributed to an overall strong showing by Indian racewalkers, with Sandeep Kumar winning silver in the men’s 35km event and Ram Baboo claiming bronze. Goswami’s performance not only earned her top honours but also reflected her continued consistency and dominance in the sport at an international level.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Global Tourism Ambassador for the Maldives in 2025?
questions.explanation: In June 2025, Katrina Kaif was officially named the Global Tourism Ambassador for the Maldives by the Maldives Marketing and Public Relations Corporation (MMPRC). This move aims to rejuvenate the country's tourism appeal, particularly among Indian and international travellers, and aligns with the Maldives' broader strategy to position itself as a premier luxury destination. Kaif’s strong global image, especially in South Asia, is expected to amplify the outreach of campaigns such as the Visit Maldives Summer Sale. Her appointment also aligns with diplomatic efforts to strengthen India-Maldives ties ahead of PM Modi’s visit, marking a blend of tourism promotion and soft diplomacy.

questions.question: Which country is set to host eight nuclear reactors to be built by Russia under a bilateral agreement?
questions.explanation: Iran has confirmed a major energy collaboration with Russia, where eight nuclear reactors will be constructed across the country to boost its civilian nuclear infrastructure. The agreement, reaffirmed by Mohammad Eslami, head of the Atomic Energy Organisation of Iran (AEOI), marks a significant step in Iran’s strategic plan to triple its nuclear energy output. The project is being carried out in partnership with Russia’s state nuclear agency Rosatom, with four reactors specifically planned in Bushehr Province. This initiative reflects growing energy ties between Tehran and Moscow while helping Iran reduce its reliance on fossil fuels.

questions.question: Which Indian state has recorded a 20% increase in cotton cultivation in 2025 as part of a crop diversification strategy?
questions.explanation: Punjab has experienced a significant 20% rise in cotton cultivation in 2025, expanding from 2.49 lakh acres to 2.98 lakh acres—an increase of over 49,000 acres. This growth is part of the state's broader effort to diversify crops and reduce reliance on paddy. Districts such as Fazilka, Mansa, Bathinda, and Sri Muktsar Sahib have led the increase, supported by government measures like a 33% subsidy on cotton seeds and mandatory digital registration for farmers. The initiative aims to promote sustainable agricultural practices and improve the state’s ecological balance by reducing water-intensive crops.

questions.question: What is the World Bank's retained GDP growth forecast for India in FY2025–26?
questions.explanation: The World Bank has maintained its GDP growth projection for India at 6.3% for FY2025–26, despite downgrading forecasts for 70% of global economies due to trade tensions and weak investment. India remains the fastest-growing major economy, supported by strong domestic demand, a resilient services sector, and moderating inflation. The RBI's monetary policy easing and expected fiscal consolidation further bolster this outlook. While global growth is projected at just 2.3%—the slowest since 2008 (excluding recessions)—India's steady performance highlights its economic resilience amid worldwide challenges.

questions.question: Which Indian state has introduced a geo-tagged 13-digit unique ID system for infrastructure projects?
questions.explanation: The Maharashtra government has launched a geo-tagged 13-digit unique ID system for all infrastructure projects to enhance transparency and monitoring. This digital initiative, implemented through the Infra ID portal, will help track projects in real time, prevent duplication, and improve inter-departmental coordination. The system will first be tested in the Wardha district before expanding statewide by October 2025, with all projects since 2020 expected to be registered by March 2026. This reform aims to streamline infrastructure management and ensure better governance through centralized, digitized project data.

questions.question: Which company has signed a nuclear energy partnership with Talen Energy to supply power to data centres?
questions.explanation: Amazon has entered into a long-term nuclear energy agreement with Talen Energy to power its AWS data centres with electricity from the Susquehanna nuclear plant in Pennsylvania. The deal, which will last until 2042, aims to supply up to 1,920 megawatts of power. Additionally, Amazon and Talen plan to collaborate on future energy initiatives, including exploring the development of new Small Modular Reactors. This strategic move underscores Amazon's commitment to cleaner energy sources and highlights the growing role of nuclear power in supporting the infrastructure needs of major tech companies.

questions.question: In which state is Bardoli located, where the culmination event of Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan is being held?
questions.explanation: The culmination of the Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan is being held in Bardoli, a historically significant location in the state of Gujarat. The event will feature a farmers’ conference attended by key leaders, including Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel. This gathering aims to highlight and support agricultural advancements and new initiatives intended to boost productivity and sustainability in the region. Hosting the event in Bardoli, known for its agricultural legacy, aligns with the government’s efforts to empower farmers and reinforce the importance of agricultural development at both state and national levels.

questions.question: In which country was the Karlsruhe Tritium Neutrino Experiment (KATRIN) conducted to study neutrino mass?
questions.explanation: The Karlsruhe Tritium Neutrino Experiment (KATRIN), a major scientific initiative focused on measuring the mass of neutrinos, was conducted in Germany. Researchers involved in this project analyzed data from five experimental runs between 2019 and 2021, examining over 36 million electron events. Their findings established a new upper limit for the mass of neutrinos, determining that the total mass of the three known types is less than 8.8 × 10⁻⁷ times the mass of an electron. This experiment represents a significant step forward in the field of particle physics and highlights Germany’s leading role in advanced scientific research.

questions.question: Who has been recommended by the FSIB for the role of MD & CEO of LIC?
questions.explanation: R Doraiswamy has been recommended by the Financial Services Institutions Bureau (FSIB) for the position of Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC), the country's largest life insurer. With over 38 years of experience at LIC, Doraiswamy has served in various capacities, including operations, marketing, technology, and training. His extensive career background and leadership across critical functions made him the top candidate among four senior LIC executives interviewed on June 11, 2025. The final approval of his appointment now awaits the decision of the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet.

questions.question: What is India’s rank in the Global Gender Gap Index 2025 published by the World Economic Forum?
questions.explanation: In the Global Gender Gap Index 2025 released by the World Economic Forum, India has slipped to the 131st position out of 148 countries. This marks a decline of two spots from the previous year and reflects the ongoing challenges India faces in achieving gender parity. With a parity score of just 64.1%, India remains among the lowest-ranked countries in South Asia. In comparison, Bangladesh led the region at 24th place, followed by countries like Nepal (125), Sri Lanka (130), Bhutan (119), Maldives (138), and Pakistan (148), highlighting regional disparities in gender equality progress.

questions.question: On which date is the World Day Against Child Labour observed annually?
questions.explanation: The World Day Against Child Labour is observed globally every year on June 12 to raise awareness and promote action against child labour. In 2024, the ILO and UNICEF released a report revealing that 138 million children were engaged in child labour, emphasizing the urgent need for accelerated efforts. The theme "Progress is clear, but there’s more to do: let’s speed up efforts!" highlights both achievements and the ongoing challenges in eliminating child labour. This day serves as a crucial reminder to strengthen policies and interventions protecting children's rights worldwide.

questions.question: Which banks from which two countries have received approval to establish IFSC Banking Units in GIFT City, Gujarat?
questions.explanation: Prominent banks from France and the UAE have received in-principle approvals to set up IFSC Banking Units (IBUs) in GIFT City, Gujarat, marking a significant milestone in India’s emergence as a global financial hub. French banks like Natixis and Credit Agricole, and UAE-based institutions such as First Abu Dhabi Bank PJSC and Mashreq Bank, are among those expanding their presence. These approvals are part of broader efforts by the International Financial Services Centres Authority (IFSCA) to attract top-tier global banking institutions to GIFT City. With this, the total number of IBUs has risen to 31, reflecting the rapid internationalization of India’s financial landscape.

questions.question: Where was the 2nd Session of the IALA Council held, where India participated as Vice President?
questions.explanation: The 2nd Session of the IALA Council took place in Nice, France, with India participating as the Vice President of the International Organization for Marine Aids to Navigation (IALA). The IALA Council serves as the principal decision-making body for global standards on marine navigation aids.
