This marks a shift from the earlier system that allowed women from any state to benefit from the reservation. The policy aims to enhance women's participation in governance and prioritise local candidates in public employment. Alongside this, the Bihar cabinet has also approved the establishment of the Bihar Youth Commission to support skill development, employment, and educational opportunities for the state's youth. These decisions are viewed as critical steps toward inclusive development and empowerment within Bihar.

questions.question: From which Indian Navy warship was the indigenous Extended Range Anti-Submarine Rocket (ERASR) successfully tested?
questions.explanation: The successful user trials of the indigenous Extended Range Anti-Submarine Rocket (ERASR) were conducted from INS Kavaratti, a frontline warship of the Indian Navy. Developed by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), ERASR enhances India's underwater combat capabilities by accurately detecting and neutralising enemy submarines. The tests, carried out between June 23 and July 7, 2025, involved 17 rockets fired at varying distances to verify performance under operational conditions. INS Kavaratti’s role in these trials highlights its strategic importance and reflects India’s growing focus on self-reliance in cutting-edge defence technology and naval warfare systems.

questions.question: Where did Asia’s oldest elephant, ‘Vatsala’, pass away in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Vatsala, Asia’s oldest elephant, passed away at over 100 years of age in the Panna Tiger Reserve, Madhya Pradesh, on July 8, 2025. Originally from the Nilambur forests of Kerala, she was relocated to Madhya Pradesh in the 1970s and became a central figure in tiger tracking and forest patrol at Panna National Park. Even after retirement in 2003, she remained active in conservation efforts by mentoring younger elephants. Panna Tiger Reserve, known for its success in tiger reintroduction after facing extinction from poaching, gained further prominence through Vatsala’s iconic presence and contribution to wildlife conservation in the region.

questions.question: Which country is set to become the 21st member of the eurozone by adopting the euro on January 1, 2026?
questions.explanation: Bulgaria will officially join the eurozone on January 1, 2026, becoming the 21st member to adopt the euro as its official currency. The European Union finance ministers gave final approval for this move on July 8, 2025. Bulgaria will replace its national currency, the lev, at a fixed rate of 1.95583 lev per euro. The adoption of the euro is expected to improve economic stability, enhance integration with Western Europe, and shield the country from external influences. Despite internal political challenges and public concerns, the Bulgarian government views this as a landmark moment in the nation’s economic development.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as Apple’s new Chief Operating Officer (COO) in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Sabih Khan has been appointed as Apple’s new Chief Operating Officer (COO), taking over from Jeff Williams, who is set to retire. With nearly 30 years at Apple, Khan has played a crucial role in managing global supply chains and driving operational excellence. He holds degrees in Mechanical Engineering and Economics, and his career includes notable experience at GE Plastics before joining Apple in 1995. As Senior Vice President of Operations, he helped Apple navigate major global challenges, including the COVID-19 pandemic and geopolitical disruptions. His elevation reflects Apple’s focus on operational resilience and strategic leadership amid shifting global dynamics.

questions.question: Which Indian state has announced plans to build Asia’s biggest jungle safari in the Aravalli Hills?
questions.explanation: Haryana has announced that it will build Asia’s largest jungle safari in the Aravalli Hills, covering approximately 10,000 acres of forest land. This ambitious project aims to protect wildlife, promote eco-tourism, and create employment opportunities for local communities. The initiative is being closely monitored by Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini and supported by both the Forest and Tourism Departments. By using modern, eco-friendly technology and drawing inspiration from successful models like the Vantara Wildlife Facility in Gujarat, Haryana hopes to lead the way in environmental conservation and green development. The project reflects a balanced approach to tourism and ecological preservation.

questions.question: Which state launched the Mukhya Mantri Sehat Yojana, providing ₹10 lakh annual cashless healthcare to all families?
questions.explanation: The Mukhya Mantri Sehat Yojana was launched by the state of Punjab under the leadership of Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann. The scheme aims to provide cashless medical treatment up to ₹10 lakh annually for every family in the state, including beneficiaries of existing central health schemes. This initiative ensures that healthcare is accessible to nearly 3 crore residents across government and private hospitals. By distributing digital health cards and eliminating previous colour-coded card systems, the scheme simplifies access to treatment for over 2000 diseases, making it one of the most comprehensive healthcare programs in India.

questions.question: Which power unit did Adani Power acquire for ₹4,000 crore to boost its total capacity to 18,150 MW?
questions.explanation: Adani Power Ltd acquired the 600 MW Vidarbha Unit, located in Nagpur, Maharashtra, for ₹4,000 crore through the insolvency resolution process. This acquisition, completed on July 7, 2025, was approved by the National Company Law Tribunal and adds significantly to the company’s growing energy portfolio. The Vidarbha Unit, formerly operated by Vidarbha Industries Power Ltd, consists of two 300 MW units powered by domestic coal. This strategic purchase increases Adani Power’s total operating capacity to 18,150 MW, reinforcing its position as India’s largest private thermal power producer and aligning with its target of reaching 30,670 MW by 2030.

questions.question: Which city is set to receive a new Akashvani Kendra under the BIND scheme?
questions.explanation: Ujjain is the city chosen for the establishment of a new Akashvani Kendra as part of the Broadcasting Infrastructure and Network Development (BIND) scheme. This initiative, launched in January 2023 by the Ministry of Information & Broadcasting, aims to enhance the broadcasting capabilities of Prasar Bharati. The BIND scheme, with an approved financial outlay of ₹2,539.61 crore, is focused on upgrading and expanding infrastructure across the country to improve public broadcasting services. The selection of Ujjain signifies the government's commitment to decentralize broadcasting facilities and promoting regional connectivity in information dissemination.

questions.question: Which company became the first publicly traded firm to reach a $4 trillion market value?
questions.explanation: Nvidia became the first publicly listed company in the world to reach a $4 trillion market valuation on July 9, 2025. This milestone reflects not only Nvidia’s explosive growth—driven by advances in AI and semiconductor technology—but also the dominance of the tech sector in global financial markets. Nvidia’s share price has surged approximately 1,350% since October 2022, significantly outpacing major indexes like the S&P 500. With its massive influence on indexes such as the S&P 500 and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index, Nvidia now plays a pivotal role in shaping market trends and investor sentiment across the technology industry.

questions.question: Which Indian state launched the Smart Mosquito Surveillance System (SMoSS) using AI and drones to combat mosquito-borne diseases?
questions.explanation: Andhra Pradesh has launched a cutting-edge initiative named Smart Mosquito Surveillance System (SMoSS) to fight mosquito-borne diseases like dengue and malaria. The system combines AI, drones, sensors, and IoT devices to monitor mosquito populations and environmental factors in real time. The project is being piloted across six cities, including Visakhapatnam, Vijayawada, and Nellore. With over 5,500 dengue cases reported in 2024 alone, this data-driven approach allows targeted spraying, reducing unnecessary chemical use. It also integrates mobile apps and hospital data to track disease hotspots and improve public health response. The initiative marks a major advancement in digital health surveillance in India.

questions.question: Who was honoured with a commemorative postage stamp on their 125th birth anniversary on July 9, 2025?
questions.explanation: Syama Prasad Mookerjee was honoured on his 125th birth anniversary with the release of a commemorative postage stamp by the Government of India on July 9, 2025. The event was organized by the Ministry of Culture at Siri Fort Auditorium in Delhi and featured patriotic performances and a tribute exhibition. Mookerjee is remembered for his significant contributions to India’s development, particularly in education, industry, and national integration. The stamp, along with a First Day Cover and Brochure, was made available nationwide, highlighting his legacy and inspiring citizens with his vision for a unified and self-reliant India rooted in cultural values.

questions.question: Which country approved the first malaria medicine specifically designed for small babies in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Switzerland, through its medical authority Swissmedic, approved the world’s first malaria medicine for infants weighing between 2 and 5 kilograms on July 9, 2025. This groundbreaking approval was for a drug developed by Novartis, a Swiss pharmaceutical company based in Basel. The approval was granted under a fast-track process in partnership with the World Health Organisation to ensure quicker access in developing countries. The new treatment targets vulnerable infants who previously relied on less suitable medications adjusted from those made for older children. This is especially significant for Africa, where infant malaria remains a leading cause of child mortality.

questions.question: Which country became the first where NPCI signed a technology agreement with a central bank to implement a UPI-like digital payment system?
questions.explanation: Namibia is the first country where the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) entered into a technology agreement with the central bank to implement a UPI-like digital payments system. This move is part of a broader initiative to deepen economic ties between India and Namibia. In addition to digital payments, the two nations signed Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) in several other areas, including health, medicine, entrepreneurship development, and bilateral cooperation. Establishing a digital payments framework reflects growing global interest in India's fintech solutions and marks a milestone in strengthening Indo-African economic and technological partnerships.

questions.question: In which Indian city did the Japan Coast Guard Ship Itsukushima arrive for a six-day training visit in July 2025?
questions.explanation: The Japan Coast Guard Ship Itsukushima arrived at Chennai Port on July 7, 2025, for a six-day training visit as part of Japan’s Global Ocean Voyage Training. This visit aimed to deepen cooperation and strengthen the operational partnership between the Indian and Japanese Coast Guards in the Indo-Pacific region. Activities included joint sea exercises, official meetings, ship tours, and a Sea Riders exchange programme involving Indian officers travelling to Singapore. The event reinforced shared maritime goals such as safety, openness, and security under India’s SAGAR vision and the Indo-Pacific Oceans Initiative. Chennai served as the central location for these collaborative efforts.

questions.question: Under which article of the Constitution is the National Commission for Scheduled Castes (NCSC) mandated to submit an annual report on the status of Constitutional safeguards for Scheduled Castes?
questions.explanation: Article 338 of the Indian Constitution mandates the National Commission for Scheduled Castes (NCSC) to submit an annual report to the President detailing the status of Constitutional safeguards for Scheduled Castes. This report ensures accountability and monitors the implementation of protections and welfare measures for Scheduled Castes. The 2023-24 report was recently submitted to President Droupadi Murmu, as required by this constitutional provision. The NCSC plays a crucial role in safeguarding the rights and interests of Scheduled Castes, and Article 338 reinforces its authority and responsibilities.

questions.question: What is the name of the Indian Navy's first indigenously built Diving Support Vessel (DSV) recently inducted?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy has inducted its first indigenously designed and constructed Diving Support Vessel (DSV) named Nistar. Built by Hindustan Shipyard Limited, the vessel was officially handed over during a ceremony in Visakhapatnam. Nistar is specially designed for deep-sea diving and submarine rescue operations—an advanced capability that only a few navies globally possess. The name “Nistar” comes from Sanskrit, symbolising liberation, rescue, or salvation, reflecting the ship’s mission profile. This induction marks a significant step toward self-reliance in critical naval capabilities under India’s ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ initiative.

questions.question: In which city has the 'Saheli Smart Card' been launched to replace the pink ticket system for free bus travel?
questions.explanation: The 'Saheli Smart Card' has been launched in New Delhi by the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) to replace the earlier pink ticket system, enabling free bus travel specifically for women and transgender persons residing in Delhi. To qualify, users must provide valid address proof and an Aadhaar card. The initiative is part of a broader push toward digitisation and transparency in public transport, integrating features like the National Common Mobility Card (NCMC). It is designed to eliminate fraud, ensure only genuine residents benefit, and support cashless, modern travel through QR-based ticketing, mobile apps, and card readers across the capital.

questions.question: Where is the AI-operated restaurant WOOHOO, featuring Chef Aiman, located?
questions.explanation: WOOHOO, an innovative restaurant set to debut in central Dubai near the iconic Burj Khalifa, features an AI chef named Chef Aiman. Chef Aiman is a culinary large language model (LLM) designed to create menus and craft the restaurant's ambience using advanced knowledge in food science, molecular gastronomy, and international cuisines. While human staff handle the food assembly, the concept merges cutting-edge technology with gastronomy, positioning Dubai at the forefront of AI innovation in the food industry. The project is spearheaded by Ahmet Oytun Cakir, CEO of Gastronaut, signalling a shift toward AI-driven culinary experiences.

questions.question: Which bridge in Mumbai was recently renamed as Sindoor Bridge in honour of Operation Sindoor?
questions.explanation: The bridge that was recently renamed as Sindoor Bridge is the Carnac Bridge in Mumbai. This renaming was part of a larger effort to shed colonial-era names and honour Indian achievements. The new name commemorates Operation Sindoor, a military mission against terrorist camps, and symbolizes both national pride and historical correction. The original Carnac Bridge, named after British Governor James Rivett-Carnac, had become structurally unsafe and was demolished in 2022. After reconstruction, the 328-meter-long, four-lane bridge was inaugurated on July 10, 2025, by CM Devendra Fadnavis. It now stands as a symbol of modern Indian resilience and post-colonial identity.

questions.question: Which state launched 'Operation Kalanemi' to take action against fake saints?
questions.explanation: On July 10, 2025, Uttarakhand launched 'Operation Kalanemi' under the leadership of Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami. The initiative aims to identify and take strict legal action against individuals impersonating saints to deceive people, especially targeting innocent devotees. The operation derives its name from Kalanemi, a demon in Hindu mythology who misled people by appearing saintly. Given Uttarakhand's spiritual significance with destinations like Haridwar, Rishikesh, and Kedarnath, the move is seen as a serious step to protect religious integrity and social harmony while preventing misuse of faith for personal or financial gain.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the next CEO and MD of Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) starting August 1, 2025?
questions.explanation: Priya Nair has been appointed as the new CEO and Managing Director of Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL), effective from August 1, 2025. She will take over from Rohit Jawa, who is stepping down after a two-year term. Priya, who began her career at HUL in 1995, has held various leadership roles in sales and marketing and was most recently the President of Beauty & Wellbeing at Unilever. Her vast experience and deep understanding of both Indian and global markets position her well to lead HUL through the next phase of growth in India’s dynamic FMCG sector.

questions.question: Which platform must be used for all Indian government payments above ₹75 crore starting July 16, 2025?
questions.explanation: Starting from July 16, 2025, all Indian government payments exceeding ₹75 crore are required to be processed through the RBI’s e-Kuber system. This decision aims to enhance transparency, efficiency, and accuracy in handling large-value government transactions. e-Kuber, developed by the Reserve Bank of India, offers features like real-time tracking, 24-hour reconciliation, and quicker settlements. By centralising and digitizing high-value transactions through e-Kuber, the government seeks to reduce processing delays and improve accountability in public fund disbursement and usage.

questions.question: Which district won the Kerala Fisheries Department’s Excellence Award 2025?
questions.explanation: Kasaragod district in Kerala was honoured with the Fisheries Department Excellence Award 2025 for its exceptional performance in implementing fisheries-related schemes effectively at the grassroots level. The award, given as part of the Annual State Farmer Awards, acknowledges districts that demonstrate leadership and efficiency in aquaculture and fisheries development. Kasaragod's recognition highlights its commitment to sustainable fishery practices, support for local fishermen, and innovation in the sector. The award encourages other districts to adopt best practices and improve the livelihood of those dependent on fisheries across the state.

questions.question: What is the projected global economic growth rate for 2025 according to the UNCTAD report?
questions.explanation: According to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) report titled “Trade and Development Foresights 2025: Under Pressure – Uncertainty Reshapes Global Economic Prospects,” global economic growth is expected to slow down to 2.3% in 2025. The report reviews the impact of financial uncertainty, trade tensions, and development challenges on the global economy. This lower growth forecast reflects concerns over rising geopolitical instability, inflation, and weaker demand in key economies. It highlights the need for stronger multilateral cooperation and strategic economic planning to navigate an increasingly complex global landscape.

questions.question: Which country will host the Shooting World Cup in 2027 and the World Junior Championship in 2028?
questions.explanation: India has been selected by the International Shooting Sport Federation (ISSF) to host two prestigious shooting events—the Shooting World Cup in 2027 and the World Junior Championship in 2028. This decision was announced by the National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) on July 10, 2025. The move underscores India's growing influence in global shooting sports and is expected to provide invaluable exposure to both junior and senior Indian shooters. Alongside these events, India is also set to launch the Shooting League of India in November 2025. These initiatives aim to elevate the sport's profile nationally and enhance competitive standards.

questions.question: Who set a new national record in the 100 meters with a time of 10.18 seconds?
questions.explanation: Animesh Kujur, a talented sprinter from Chhattisgarh, made headlines by setting a new national record in the 100 meters with a time of 10.18 seconds at the Dromia International Sprint Meet in Greece. This achievement reflects his rising stature in Indian athletics. In addition to this feat, Animesh previously broke the national record in the 200 meters by clocking 20.32 seconds during the Asian Athletics Championship in South Korea. His consistent performances in both sprint events mark a significant step forward for Indian sprinting on the international stage, highlighting his potential to compete at the highest level.

questions.question: What is India’s current position in the latest FIFA world rankings as of July 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s men’s football team dropped to the 133rd position in the July 2025 FIFA world rankings, marking its lowest placement since December 2016. This steep decline followed two back-to-back losses in June — a 0-2 defeat to Thailand and a 0-1 loss to Hong Kong. As a result, India fell six spots from its previous rank of 127 and also experienced a drop in rating points from 1132.03 to 1113.22. The team’s recent poor form, including just one win in eight matches, led to the departure of head coach Manolo Marquez and has raised concerns about India’s prospects in the upcoming AFC Asian Cup qualifiers.

questions.question: Which Indian state launched the ‘Gajah Mitra’ scheme to reduce human-elephant conflicts?
questions.explanation: The ‘Gajah Mitra’ scheme was launched by the Assam government to address the escalating issue of human-elephant conflict in the state. With over 1,400 human and 1,209 elephant deaths between 2000 and 2023, Assam recognized the urgent need for action. The scheme targets 80 high-risk areas and includes strategies like growing elephant-friendly crops such as bamboo and Napier grass to reduce intrusion into villages. It also deploys rapid response teams to guide elephants away safely. By promoting non-violent methods and involving communities, the scheme aims to ensure peaceful coexistence and reduce tragic encounters between people and wildlife.

questions.question: Which state received the IESA Industry Excellence Award 2025 for leadership in battery manufacturing?
questions.explanation: Telangana was honoured with the IESA Industry Excellence Award 2025 in the State Leadership – Battery Manufacturing category during the 11th India Energy Storage Week held in New Delhi. The award highlights Telangana's commitment to advancing battery production and clean energy technology through progressive policies like the Telangana EV and Energy Storage Policy. The state has created industrial zones, attracted significant investment, and built a robust ecosystem for energy storage and electric vehicle components. This recognition reinforces Telangana's role as a growing hub for energy innovation and positions it to lead India’s transition to a sustainable energy future.

questions.question: On which date is World Population Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Population Day is observed annually on July 11 to raise awareness about global population issues. It was established in 1989 by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP). In 2025, the global population will surpass 8.1 billion, with India becoming the most populous nation. The observance aims to draw attention to population-related challenges and solutions, with the 2025 theme focusing on empowering young people in shaping their family futures. This day provides an important platform for highlighting reproductive health, family planning, and gender equality on a global scale.

questions.question: What Grandmaster number did Harikrishnan A. Ra achieve for India?
questions.explanation: Harikrishnan A. Ra, a 23-year-old chess player from Chennai, has become India’s 87th Grandmaster after securing his final GM norm at the La Plagne Chess Festival in France. This accomplishment is the result of a 7-year-long journey that began when he became an International Master. His achievement not only marks a personal milestone but also reflects India’s rapid rise in the global chess community. With this title, Harikrishnan joins the ranks of elite Indian chess players, contributing to the country's strong presence in the sport on an international level.

questions.question: Who was honoured with the 'Hem Bahadur Malla Award 2080' for their contributions to judicial leadership and institutional development?
questions.explanation: The 'Hem Bahadur Malla Award 2080' was conferred on former Chief Justice Kalyan Shrestha, Nepal's 25th Chief Justice, in recognition of his outstanding contributions to judicial leadership, institutional development, transitional justice, inclusive democracy, and environmental justice. The award commemorates Hem Bahadur Malla, founder of the Salt Trading Corporation. Justice Shrestha's work has significantly impacted Nepal's legal and democratic framework, making him a deserving recipient of this prestigious honour that celebrates excellence in public service and nation-building.

questions.question: Which country has qualified for the 2026 T20 World Cup for the first time in its history?
questions.explanation: Italy’s men’s cricket team has created history by qualifying for the 2026 T20 World Cup for the very first time. Led by former Australian Test opener Joe Burns, the team secured its spot through the ICC T20 Men's Europe Region Final. This qualification marks a significant milestone in Italy’s cricketing journey, highlighting the sport's growing global reach. Although the Netherlands topped the qualifying group with an unbeaten run, Italy’s performance was strong enough to earn them a place in the upcoming World Cup, which will be jointly hosted by India and Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Where was the first Governing Council meeting of the NCC Alumni Association, chaired by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, held?
questions.explanation: The first Governing Council meeting of the National Cadet Corps Alumni Association (NCCAA) was chaired by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in New Delhi. The NCCAA is envisioned as a platform to connect former and current NCC cadets, fostering a spirit of unity and continuity among members of the world’s largest uniformed youth organisation. Holding the meeting in the national capital underlines the importance of the initiative and reflects the government's support for strengthening youth involvement in nation-building. The association is poised to play a significant role in energising and modernising the NCC framework going forward.

questions.question: Where will India host its first Global Conference on Manuscript Heritage in September 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s first Global Conference on Manuscript Heritage will take place from September 11 to 13, 2025, at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. Organised by the Ministry of Culture, this international event aims to protect and promote India’s vast manuscript legacy. The conference will feature over 500 delegates, including global scholars, and will include exhibitions, conservation demonstrations, and workshops. It also marks a symbolic tribute to Swami Vivekananda’s 1893 speech in Chicago by aligning the dates accordingly. A key highlight will be the release of the New Delhi Declaration on Manuscript Heritage, guiding global preservation and research efforts in ancient knowledge.

questions.question: Who became the first male cricketer in professional cricket history to take five wickets in five balls?
questions.explanation: Curtis Campher, an all-rounder from Ireland, made history by becoming the first male cricketer in professional cricket to claim five wickets in five consecutive deliveries. This extraordinary feat occurred during an Inter-Provincial T20 Trophy match held in Dublin, featuring Munster Reds against North-West Warriors. While Kelis Ndhlovu of Zimbabwe was the first cricketer overall (in women’s cricket) to achieve this milestone, Campher’s record is significant as it marks a first in the men’s game. Such rare accomplishments highlight the unpredictability and excitement of T20 cricket, and Campher’s performance will be remembered as a standout moment in the sport’s history.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the Astra Beyond Visual Range Air-to-Air Missile (BVRAAM) successfully test-fired by the IAF and DRDO?
questions.explanation: The Astra missile, a Beyond Visual Range Air-to-Air Missile (BVRAAM) developed indigenously by the DRDO, was successfully test-fired by the Indian Air Force from a Sukhoi-30 Mk-I aircraft over Odisha. This marks a significant advancement in India's self-reliant defence capabilities. The Astra missile boasts a range of over 100 km and incorporates sophisticated guidance and navigation technologies. Odisha has become a key location for missile testing due to its strategic coastal ranges and established defence infrastructure. This test further strengthens the operational readiness and technological edge of India’s air defence systems.

questions.question: Which state has officially declared Sarvajanik Ganeshotsav as a state festival in 2025?
questions.explanation: On July 10, 2025, Maharashtra officially recognised Sarvajanik Ganeshotsav as a state festival, marking a significant cultural development. The announcement was made by Cultural Affairs Minister Ashish Shelar during a session of the Legislative Assembly. This move ensures government support, promotion, and financial assistance for organising large-scale Ganesh celebrations across the state. Originating in 1893 under the leadership of Lokmanya Tilak, the festival was historically intended to foster unity and nationalism during British rule. Today, it remains a powerful symbol of Maharashtra’s cultural pride, community spirit, and heritage. Declaring it a state festival elevates its importance and preserves its legacy.

questions.question: What is the name of the high-intensity annual security exercise launched by the Indian Army to protect the Shri Amarnath Yatra in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army has initiated a high-intensity annual security operation named ‘Operation SHIVA 2025’ to safeguard the Shri Amarnath Yatra. This operation is especially significant due to elevated threats posed by Pakistan-backed proxy groups. It involves meticulous coordination between the Indian Army, civil administration, and Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) to ensure the safety and smooth conduct of the pilgrimage. The launch of this operation highlights the strategic importance of the Yatra and the proactive measures taken to neutralise any potential threats to national security and civilian safety.

questions.question: What has been recently added to the UNESCO World Heritage List from India in 2025?
questions.explanation: On July 11, 2025, UNESCO added the Maratha Military Forts of India to its prestigious World Heritage List during the 47th session of the World Heritage Committee in Paris. This recognition honours 12 historically significant forts built by the Maratha Empire between the 17th and 19th centuries in Tamil Nadu. These forts are spread across various terrains hills, coasts, and plains and showcase strategic military architecture, water conservation systems, and innovative use of natural landscapes. Forts like Raigad, Pratapgad, and Sindhudurg reflect the legacy of leaders like Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The inclusion highlights their global cultural value and ensures better preservation and international awareness.

questions.question: At which ISRO facility were the hot tests of the Gaganyaan Service Module Propulsion System conducted on July 3, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) carried out two successful hot tests of the Gaganyaan Service Module Propulsion System (SMPS) on July 3, 2025, at its Propulsion Complex located in Mahendragiri, Tamil Nadu. This facility is crucial for propulsion-related development and testing. These hot tests simulated real flight conditions to ensure the system's performance and reliability under operational stress. The successful validation at Mahendragiri marked a significant milestone in ISRO’s preparations for India’s first human spaceflight mission under the Gaganyaan programme. The choice of this location reflects its specialised infrastructure for high-precision propulsion experiments.

questions.question: Which police station became the first in India to receive the IS/ISO 9001:2015 certification from the Bureau of Indian Standards?
questions.explanation: Arthunkal Police Station, located in the Alappuzha district of Kerala, made history by becoming India’s first police station to earn the IS/ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System certification from the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS). The certification, awarded on July 10, 2025, acknowledges the station's excellence in crime prevention, investigation, public grievance redressal, and community policing. The recognition aligns with Kerala Police’s broader initiative to modernise policing under the Modernised Cherthala Police Programme. This achievement sets a national benchmark, highlighting how structured reforms and adherence to global quality standards can elevate public trust and operational efficiency in law enforcement.

questions.question: Who was reappointed as the Chairperson of the Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) for the 2025–26 term?
questions.explanation: Abhijit Kishore, the Chief Operating Officer of Vodafone Idea Ltd, was reappointed as the Chairperson of the Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) for the 2025–26 term during its Annual General Body meeting held on July 9, 2025, in New Delhi. With over 30 years of experience in the telecom sector, Kishore has been instrumental in steering Vodafone Idea through key industry transitions. His reappointment reflects the confidence the industry has in his leadership, especially as India pushes forward with 5G deployment and broader digital infrastructure goals. His continued role ensures strategic consistency at a time of significant technological evolution.

questions.question: Which of the following organisations is NOT directly involved in launching student skill development or training programs with NESTS in 2025?
questions.explanation: Tata Motors collaborated with the National Education Society for Tribal Students (NESTS) to launch a five-year partnership aimed at helping tribal students gain practical job training and engineering diplomas through the Kaushalya Program. This “Learn and Earn” model gives eligible Class 12 graduates of Eklavya Model Residential Schools an opportunity to gain real-world experience while studying. Students are also offered stipends, meals, uniforms, insurance, and potential employment through the “One Trainee, One Job” promise. The collaboration represents a major step in empowering tribal youth with technical skills and long-term employment opportunities.

questions.question: Which country had three Khmer Rouge sites added to the UNESCO World Heritage List in July 2025?
questions.explanation: On July 11, 2025, UNESCO recognised three historical sites in Cambodia—Tuol Sleng Genocide Museum, M-13 prison, and Choeung Ek Killing Fields—as World Heritage Sites. These places were used by the Khmer Rouge regime between 1975 and 1979 for torture, imprisonment, and executions, during which nearly 1.7 million people died. This is Cambodia's first inscription of modern historical sites linked to recent conflict and genocide, marking a significant step in acknowledging painful modern history. The move aims to honour victims, educate future generations, and ensure that such tragedies are never repeated. The recognition also promotes peace, remembrance, and healing.

questions.question: Who won the 2025 United Nations Population Award for her work against sex-selective abortions and promoting gender equality?
questions.explanation: Varsha Deshpande, a dedicated women's rights activist from Satara, Maharashtra, was awarded the 2025 United Nations Population Award for her pioneering efforts in preventing sex-selective abortions and advancing gender equality. Over three decades, she has led campaigns that challenge patriarchal norms, exposed illegal abortion practices, and supported legal reforms through her organisation, Dalit Mahila Vikas Mandal. Her activism has particularly focused on marginalised women and girls, especially from Dalit communities. The award was presented on World Population Day in New York, recognising her powerful grassroots impact and contributions to reproductive rights and women’s dignity in India.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the Deputy Chief Information Security Officer at the State Bank of India in June 2025?
questions.explanation: Babitha B P was appointed as the Deputy Chief Information Security Officer at the State Bank of India in June 2025. In her new position, she will be responsible for leading infrastructure security and overseeing special cybersecurity projects, ensuring the safety and trustworthiness of SBI’s digital banking platforms. With rising digital threats in the financial sector, her appointment reflects the bank’s commitment to strengthening cyber resilience. It also highlights the increasing recognition of women leaders in tech and cybersecurity, marking a significant step toward both security innovation and gender inclusivity in India's banking industry.

questions.question: Where was the Trade Facilitation Conference 2025 inaugurated by MoS Pankaj Chaudhary?
questions.explanation: The Trade Facilitation Conference 2025 was inaugurated by Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on July 12, 2025, in New Delhi. The event, themed “Scientific Excellence for Seamless Trade,” focused on enhancing India's trade mechanisms through improved testing and compliance systems. It was organised by the Central Revenues Control Laboratory (CRCL) and the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC). The choice of New Delhi as the venue underscores its status as a hub for major government-led initiatives and international conferences, especially those related to finance and trade development.

questions.question: By which year does India aim to achieve net-zero carbon emissions, as supported by the new electric truck subsidy scheme?
questions.explanation: India has committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by the year 2070. This long-term environmental goal is backed by various initiatives, including the newly launched electric truck incentive scheme under the PM E-DRIVE programme. Introduced on July 12, 2025, this scheme supports eco-friendly freight movement by offering up to ₹9.6 lakh in subsidies per electric truck, thereby encouraging adoption in high-emission sectors like logistics, cement, and steel. The move is designed to reduce the carbon footprint of heavy-duty transportation, which currently contributes a significant portion of greenhouse gas emissions in India.

questions.question: Which Indian state will plant over 5 lakh saplings on the Harela festival in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand is set to celebrate the Harela festival on July 16, 2025, by planting more than 5 lakh saplings across the state, aiming to break its previous plantation record. The event is themed “Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam” and “Harela Ka Tyohar Manao, Dharti Maa Ka Rin Chukao,” promoting environmental awareness and sustainable practices. Saplings will be planted across public and residential areas, and the initiative will see participation from schools, local communities, and government bodies. This ambitious drive reflects Uttarakhand’s strong commitment to green initiatives and climate-conscious development.

questions.question: Who won the Wimbledon men's final on July 13, 2025, defeating Carlos Alcaraz to claim his first Wimbledon title?
questions.explanation: Jannik Sinner defeated Carlos Alcaraz in four sets to win his first Wimbledon title on July 13, 2025. This victory marked a major moment in his career as it ended Alcaraz’s impressive 24-match winning streak and his dominance at Wimbledon. Sinner, who had lost to Alcaraz in the French Open final just a month earlier, showed incredible mental toughness and physical endurance, especially when saving two break points in a tense fourth set. With this win, Sinner not only captured his fourth Grand Slam title but also solidified his place as a leading force in men’s tennis.

questions.question: In which city is Tesla set to launch its first experience centre in India?
questions.explanation: Tesla is set to mark its formal entry into the Indian market by launching its first experience centre in Mumbai. The showroom will be located in the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC), one of the city's major commercial hubs. This strategic move comes as Tesla begins testing the Indian market with electric vehicle (EV) and merchandise imports worth around $1 million, mainly sourced from China and the United States. While no manufacturing commitment has been made yet, the Mumbai launch is significant as it signals Tesla's intent to establish a strong retail presence and gauge consumer interest in India’s growing EV sector.

questions.question: Which country signed a 5-year Diammonium Phosphate (DAP) fertilizer supply agreement with India in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Saudi Arabia signed a significant 5-year agreement with India in July 2025 to supply 3.1 million metric tons of Diammonium Phosphate (DAP) fertilizer annually. The deal, finalised during Union Minister JP Nadda’s visit, was made with Saudi firm Maaden and includes major Indian partners like IPL, KRIBHCO, and CIL. This agreement marks a considerable increase from the 1.9 million metric tons supplied the previous year and aims to enhance India's fertilizer security. In addition to DAP, both nations discussed expanding into other fertilizers like Urea, along with joint investment opportunities and cooperation in health and pharmaceuticals.

questions.question: Which country became the first in the world to launch a Traditional Knowledge Digital Library (TKDL) using AI to preserve ancient medicine systems?
questions.explanation: India made history on July 12, 2025, by launching the world’s first Traditional Knowledge Digital Library (TKDL), a groundbreaking initiative that digitally preserves and protects the country’s ancient medicinal systems like Ayurveda, Unani, Siddha, and more. The platform uses Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools to analyse, organise, and apply traditional knowledge in modern healthcare. It also aims to prevent biopiracy and promote scientific innovation. The World Health Organisation recognised this achievement as a model for blending traditional wisdom with modern technology. India’s leadership in combining AI with traditional medicine has set a new global standard for health innovation and cultural preservation.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chairperson of the National Medical Commission (NMC) in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Dr Abhijat Sheth has been appointed as the new Chairperson of the National Medical Commission (NMC) by the Central Government in July 2025. This leadership change comes at a time when the NMC is under investigation for serious corruption allegations, including bribery and misuse of inspection data. Dr Sheth was previously serving as the President of the National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS), an institution responsible for conducting key medical exams like NEET-PG. He takes over from Dr B.N. Gangadhar, who had resigned in October 2024 but remained in office until a suitable successor was found.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the first woman Director General of the Railway Protection Force (RPF)?
questions.explanation: Sonali Mishra, a 1993 batch IPS officer from the Madhya Pradesh cadre, has been appointed as the first woman Director General of the Railway Protection Force (RPF). She will assume charge on August 1, 2025, after the retirement of Manoj Yadava. Her appointment is a historic milestone, as it marks the first time a woman will lead the RPF since its establishment. Mishra has held several significant roles in Indian policing, including being the first woman BSF commander along the India-Pakistan border and leading BSF formations in Kashmir. Her exemplary service has earned her top police honours for both distinguished and meritorious service.

questions.question: Which Indian state recently approved a set of welfare schemes, including the Gaja Mitra Scheme and a stipend for monks?
questions.explanation: On July 11, 2025, the Assam Cabinet approved several major welfare initiatives aimed at enhancing rural livelihoods, supporting traditional industries, and conserving wildlife. Key measures include salary hikes for Gaon Pradhans and Anganwadi workers, the introduction of the Gaja Mitra Scheme in eight districts to reduce human-elephant conflicts, and stipends for celibate monks in Satras. The government also introduced schemes to support artisans and students, including GST reimbursements for bell metal industries and monthly payments for Class X students. These actions align with Assam’s broader 2025–26 Budget goals and aim to uplift various segments of society while preserving cultural identity.

questions.question: Which country reached a historic agreement in 2025 to grant more autonomy to New Caledonia while keeping it within its republic?
questions.explanation: In July 2025, France and New Caledonia finalised a landmark agreement aimed at resolving long-standing tensions over independence. The deal grants New Caledonia more autonomy by establishing it as a state within the French Republic, offering a compromise between full independence and continued integration. The move comes in response to deadly protests in 2024 and seeks to preserve peace while protecting the rights of the Indigenous Kanak population. The agreement includes provisions for dual nationality, voting rights based on residency, and future referendums. Strategically located and rich in nickel, New Caledonia remains crucial to France’s Indo-Pacific presence.

questions.question: Which Indian state has launched a technology-driven initiative to revive 75 small rivers and tributaries?
questions.explanation: The Uttar Pradesh government has initiated a comprehensive river revival program targeting 75 small rivers and tributaries, involving premier technical institutes like IIT Kanpur, IIT BHU, and IIT Roorkee. These institutions are developing customised revival plans considering geographical, ecological and social parameters. The multi-departmental effort represents one of India's most systematic attempts at aquatic ecosystem restoration, combining scientific expertise with coordinated governmental action. This large-scale environmental intervention underscores UP's commitment to water resource management, particularly focusing on smaller water bodies that are crucial for rural water security but often overlooked in conservation programs.

questions.question: Which Indian state became the first to officially join the Cruise Bharat Mission to boost maritime tourism?
questions.explanation: Gujarat became the first Indian state to officially join the Cruise Bharat Mission, a national initiative launched to make India a global cruise tourism hub by 2029. With a coastline stretching 2,340 km—the longest among Indian states—Gujarat is now focusing on building cruise infrastructure and developing new cruise circuits. Key destinations in the state, like Diu, Dwarka, Veraval, and Jamnagar, will be connected through coastal routes, enhancing tourist accessibility. The state’s early involvement sets a strong example for other coastal regions and is expected to generate economic benefits through tourism, job creation, and infrastructure investment.

questions.question: Which country hosted the multinational military exercise Talisman Sabre 2025, marking India's first participation?
questions.explanation: Australia hosted Exercise Talisman Sabre 2025, its largest bilateral military drill, where India participated for the first time. The exercise involved 35,000 troops from 19 nations, including the US, Japan, and Germany, with activities spanning multiple Australian regions. This participation strengthens India-Australia defence ties and enhances Indo-Pacific security cooperation. The drills included live-fire exercises, amphibious landings, and air combat operations, showcasing advanced military capabilities. India's inclusion reflects its growing strategic role in regional security partnerships alongside key allies. The opening ceremony was held aboard HMAS Adelaide in Sydney, led by Australian and US military officials.

questions.question: In which state was India’s first digital nomad village launched in 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s first digital nomad village was launched in Yakten, located in the Pakyong district of Sikkim, on July 15, 2025. The initiative, named ‘Nomad Sikkim’, is a collaborative effort between the Pakyong district administration and the NGO Sarvahitey. It offers broadband-equipped homestays for remote workers, enabling a blend of modern work life with traditional rural living. The village is equipped with strong internet connectivity, reliable power backups, and cultural experiences like local cuisine and folk performances. This model addresses seasonal income gaps for homestay owners and aims to inspire similar developments in other rural parts of India.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian to be featured on the TIME100 Creators List in 2025?
questions.explanation: Prajakta Koli, popularly known by her YouTube handle @MostlySane, became the first Indian to be featured on the TIME100 Creators List in 2025. She has been a major force in digital entertainment since launching her comedy YouTube channel in 2015. Beyond content creation, she authored her debut novel Too Good to Be True in 2024 and actively supports social causes, having partnered with Michelle Obama to promote girls’ education globally. Additionally, she was named India’s first UNDP Youth Climate Champion, highlighting her influence not just in entertainment but also in global advocacy efforts.

questions.question: Which company has been selected as Tesla’s insurance partner in India?
questions.explanation: ACKO, a leading digital insurance provider in India, has partnered with Tesla to provide insurance solutions for its electric vehicles as the company enters the Indian market. This collaboration is aimed at offering a seamless, fully digital insurance experience, from policy purchase to claim settlement. The plans will be specifically tailored to suit the unique requirements of electric vehicles, including Tesla’s high-performance models. By integrating insurance into the EV purchase process, this move simplifies car ownership and supports the broader adoption of electric mobility in India, aligning with the country's sustainability and clean energy goals.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new MD and CEO of LIC, effective from July 15, 2025?
questions.explanation: R Doraiswamy has been appointed as the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC), starting July 15, 2025, and will serve until August 28, 2028. He brings over 38 years of experience at LIC across departments such as operations, marketing, IT, and pensions. Before his appointment, he served as Executive Director (IT/Software Development). His selection followed recommendations by the Financial Services Institutions Bureau and was approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet. This leadership change is significant for LIC, India’s largest insurer, ensuring stable and experienced guidance in a key financial institution.

questions.question: Which country is investing €163 million to acquire a 10.89% stake in Eutelsat?
questions.explanation: The United Kingdom is set to invest €163 million in Eutelsat, acquiring a 10.89% stake in the satellite communication firm. Eutelsat, backed by the Bharti Group, is the world’s second-largest satellite communications provider, positioned as a competitor to Starlink. This investment increases Eutelsat’s capital raise from €1.35 billion to €1.50 billion and reflects the UK’s strategic move to diversify its state ownership in critical communication infrastructure. Alongside the UK’s investment, Bharti is also contributing an additional €150 million, reinforcing the company's global positioning and financial stability in the space communication industry.

questions.question: In which state is the Behdeinkhlam Festival, known for its spiritual significance and cultural unity, celebrated?
questions.explanation: The Behdeinkhlam Festival is celebrated in Jowai, located in the West Jaintia Hills of Meghalaya. This sacred festival belongs to the Pnār community and translates to “driving away the plague.” It holds deep spiritual meaning, symbolising the community’s efforts toward spiritual cleansing, resilience, and unity. The celebrations are marked by colourful processions, rhythmic drumbeats, and the parading of large, decorated wooden structures called Rots. The festival blends ancient tradition with modern themes, reflecting both the heritage and evolving identity of the region. It remains a vital expression of Meghalaya’s cultural richness and community spirit.

questions.question: With which country did India conduct the PASSEX naval exercise near Mumbai in July 2025?
questions.explanation: India and Greece conducted a joint PASSEX (Passing Exercise) in the Arabian Sea near Mumbai on July 10, 2025. This exercise featured key naval units like the Indian Navy's INS Tarkash and the Greek Navy’s HS Psara. The drill included cross-deck helicopter landings, tactical maneuvers, and communication exercises, aimed at improving interoperability and mutual understanding. It highlights the growing strategic partnership between India and Greece, especially after the relationship was elevated to a Strategic Partnership in 2023. Naval cooperation like PASSEX reflects shared interests in maritime security and broader defence collaboration between the two nations.

questions.question: On which date is World Youth Skills Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Youth Skills Day is celebrated every year on July 15, as declared by the United Nations General Assembly in 2014. The day was first observed in 2015 and aims to emphasise the crucial role of skills development in enhancing youth employment, fostering decent work opportunities, and encouraging entrepreneurship. In 2025, the event marks its 10th anniversary with the theme “Youth Empowerment through AI and Digital Skills,” focusing on equipping young people with modern tools and knowledge to thrive in a rapidly evolving digital world. The day serves as a global platform to recognise and promote youth skill-building efforts.

questions.question: Where will the 7th Asia-Pacific Regional Committee Meeting of the International Solar Alliance be held?
questions.explanation: The 7th Regional Committee Meeting of the International Solar Alliance (ISA) for the Asia-Pacific region is scheduled to be held in Colombo. This meeting will focus on accelerating solar energy adoption, fostering cross-border solar interconnections, and promoting emerging clean technologies across the region. The ISA, co-founded by India and France in 2015, is headquartered in Gurugram, India, and plays a key role in uniting countries to harness solar power for sustainable development. Hosting the meeting in Colombo underscores Sri Lanka’s growing role in regional renewable energy initiatives and its commitment to sustainable energy solutions.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new CEO of Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages, starting September 8, 2025?
questions.explanation: Hemant Rupani has been announced as the new CEO of Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages Pvt Ltd (HCCB), with his term beginning on September 8, 2025. He will take over from Juan Pablo Rodriguez, who is moving to a different role within the Coca-Cola system. Rupani brings over 20 years of experience from global companies, most recently serving as Business Unit President for Southeast Asia at Mondelez International. His leadership background across FMCG, telecom, and technology—including key roles at PepsiCo, Vodafone, and Infosys—positions him well to guide HCCB’s next phase of growth and strengthen its presence in the Indian beverage market.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the interim MD and CEO of Karnataka Bank starting from 16 July 2025?
questions.explanation: Raghavendra S Bhat was appointed as the interim Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of Karnataka Bank effective 16 July 2025, following the resignation of the former MD & CEO, Srikrishnan Hari Hara Sarma. With over four decades of experience at Karnataka Bank, Bhat joined as a clerk in 1981 and rose through the ranks to become Chief Operating Officer in 2019. His appointment as interim CEO is for a three-month period or until a permanent successor is appointed. His longstanding association with the bank ensures operational stability during this leadership transition phase.

questions.question: Who won the Wimbledon 2025 men’s doubles title?
questions.explanation: Julian Cash and Lloyd Glasspool won the Wimbledon 2025 men’s doubles title, marking their first Grand Slam victory as a team. They were seeded fifth in the tournament and defeated Rinky Hijikata and David Pel in the final. The British duo had an impressive season, also winning at Queen’s Club and Eastbourne. Their victory is especially historic, as they became the first all-British team to win the Wimbledon men’s doubles title since Pat Hughes and Raymond Tuckey in 1936, ending an 89-year wait for Britain in this category.

questions.question: Which Indian state recently approved a bill for strict action against the sacrilege of holy texts?
questions.explanation: Punjab has approved the Punjab Prevention of Offences Against Holy Scripture(s) Bill, 2025, with the goal of enforcing strict punishment for sacrilegious acts against holy texts. This legislative step reflects the state's intent to safeguard religious sentiments and maintain communal harmony. Alongside this bill, the Punjab Cabinet also passed the Punjab State Development Tax (Amendment) Bill, 2025, and the Punjab Appropriation Acts (Repeal) Bill, 2025. These approvals collectively demonstrate the state's active engagement in strengthening both religious protections and administrative reforms within its legislative framework.

questions.question: CTBC Bank, which applied to open a new unit in GIFT City, is the largest private bank of which country?
questions.explanation: CTBC Bank, Taiwan’s largest private sector bank, has applied to open an International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) Banking Unit in GIFT City, Gujarat. This move is part of Taiwan’s broader push to expand its financial presence in India and strengthen bilateral economic ties. CTBC Bank already has a long-standing presence in India, having opened its first branch in New Delhi in 1996. The new unit at GIFT City will offer international banking services and occupy over 3,100 sq. ft. in Brigade Towers. This initiative also reflects Taiwan’s interest in supporting its banking sector’s global growth, especially in South Asia.

questions.question: Which Indian state became the leading producer of processed potatoes in 2024–25?
questions.explanation: Gujarat emerged as the top producer of processed potatoes in India during 2024–25, a significant milestone in the agricultural sector. This achievement is largely attributed to the state's modern farming techniques, effective government support, and strong infrastructure, including advanced cold storage facilities. Districts like Banaskantha, Sabarkantha, and Aravalli have shown exceptional performance, particularly Banaskantha, which recorded 18.70 lakh tonnes of output. The potatoes grown—such as Lady Rosetta and Kufri Chipsona—are ideal for making French fries and chips, aligning with global standards. Gujarat's success is also boosting exports and reducing India’s dependency on potato imports.

questions.question: In which Indian state is BITS Pilani planning to open the country’s first AI Plus Campus?
questions.explanation: BITS Pilani is set to establish India’s first AI Plus Campus in Amaravati, Andhra Pradesh, with an investment of Rs 1,000 crore. Announced on July 14, 2025, this groundbreaking project aims to offer high-quality education in Artificial Intelligence and allied fields. The campus will feature modern infrastructure, including smart buildings, renewable energy, and IoT-based services, and is designed to provide global exposure through university partnerships and industry internships. The initiative is aligned with Andhra Pradesh's broader vision of becoming a hub for advanced education and aims to tackle real-world challenges using AI in agriculture, healthcare, and climate resilience.

questions.question: In which city did the Indian Army conduct the ‘Prachand Shakti’ military drill?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army's ‘Prachand Shakti’ military drill was held in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, by the Ram Division under the Kharga Corps. This high-tech demonstration focused on integrating advanced technologies like drones, AI-enabled systems, and loitering munitions into battlefield operations. The exercise aimed to showcase how these innovations can enhance infantry performance in strike operations, making soldiers more agile and resilient. As part of the Army’s ‘Year of Tech Absorption’ initiative, this event also emphasised the importance of indigenous defence technologies and reducing dependency on foreign equipment to strengthen national security and operational readiness.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the country’s first Aqua Tech Park inaugurated?
questions.explanation: India’s first Aqua Tech Park was inaugurated in Sonapur, near Guwahati, Assam, by Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. The park aims to introduce advanced fish farming technologies such as aquaponics and biofloc systems to boost fish production and increase farmers' income. Set up by the NGO Kolong Kopili in collaboration with NABARD, ICAR-CIFA, Selco Foundation, and the Fishery Department, the park is designed to modernise aquaculture in Assam. Despite being rich in water resources, Assam has traditionally relied on other states for fish. This park will empower local farmers and youth by offering training and creating employment opportunities in the fisheries sector.

questions.question: In which year is the new Machilipatnam port expected to be operational?
questions.explanation: The revival of the historic Machilipatnam port in Andhra Pradesh is a major infrastructure project with its completion expected by the end of 2026. Construction is already nearly halfway done, with workers operating in two shifts and major engineering tasks like dredging and breakwater building underway. The project faced several delays since 2007, but gained momentum after the formation of the Machilipatnam Port Development Corporation in 2020. With an investment of ₹5,155 crore, the first phase includes four berths and uses advanced techniques like tetrapod placement to manage sea waves. The operational target year is set for 2026, promising significant regional economic growth.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the new CEO and MD of GIFT City in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Sanjay Kaul, a 2001-batch IAS officer from the Kerala cadre, was appointed as the new Managing Director and CEO of GIFT City (Gujarat International Finance Tec-City) in Gandhinagar on July 15, 2025. He will serve on deputation for three years, replacing Tapan Ray. Kaul brings extensive administrative experience, including previous roles in Gujarat, where he led the Tourism Corporation and Gujarat Informatics Ltd. Prior to this, he was serving as Joint Secretary in the Ministry of Culture. As CEO of GIFT City, Kaul will oversee one of India’s most ambitious smart city projects aimed at becoming a global financial services hub.

questions.question: Who was known as the world’s oldest marathon runner and the ‘Turbaned Tornado’?
questions.explanation: Fauja Singh, famously known as the ‘Turbaned Tornado’, was the world’s oldest marathon runner who passed away at the age of 114 after a tragic accident on the Jalandhar-Pathankot highway in Punjab. Born in 1911, he took up running at 89 and completed multiple marathons across major global cities like London, New York, and Toronto. He also carried the Olympic torch for both the 2004 Athens and 2012 London Olympics. Fauja Singh became a global symbol of strength, endurance, and fitness in old age, featuring alongside sports icons like Muhammad Ali and David Beckham in international campaigns.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the 'My Deed' NGDRS pilot project launched for land registration reform?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh launched the ‘My Deed’ NGDRS (National Generic Document Registration System) pilot project on July 11, 2025, aiming to digitise and simplify land registration. Spearheaded by Chief Minister Thakur Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu, this project allows citizens to register property online, requiring just one visit to the tehsil office. The initiative is currently active in ten tehsils across ten districts, including Bilaspur, Chamba, Kangra, and Shimla. The project is part of a broader push toward paperless and transparent governance, accompanied by other digital reforms like e-Roznamcha and Kaarguzari to enhance efficiency and accountability in the revenue sector.

questions.question: On which corridor will India trial Japan’s E5 Shinkansen bullet train?
questions.explanation: India plans to test Japan’s E5 Shinkansen bullet train on the Mumbai–Ahmedabad corridor, which is part of its high-speed rail initiative. This 508-km route is the designated stretch for the trial and eventual commercial use of both E5 and the upcoming E10 (Alfa-X) Shinkansen, which is expected to run by 2030. The corridor is a key part of India’s transportation modernisation efforts, with trains designed to operate at very high speeds using advanced technology like Automatic Train Control (ATC), eliminating the need for traditional trackside signals.

questions.question: Which country developed the world’s lightest brain controller to guide bees like flying robots?
questions.explanation: A team of scientists from the Beijing Institute of Technology in China developed the world’s lightest brain controller, weighing only 74 milligrams, designed to guide the flight of bees. This breakthrough turns bees into insect cyborgs capable of being used for military and rescue operations in areas that are difficult for humans or machines to access. The device works by sending electronic signals through tiny needles inserted into the bee’s brain, allowing precise control of its movements. Inspired by earlier efforts in Singapore, this Chinese version is significantly lighter and represents a major advancement in bio-robotics and mind-machine interfaces.

questions.question: Which Indian city was ranked the world’s most affordable student city in the QS Best Student Cities Rankings 2026?
questions.explanation: In the QS Best Student Cities Rankings 2026, New Delhi was recognised as the world’s most affordable student city, earning a top score of 96.5 on the affordability index. This achievement reflects the city’s low cost of education and living, combined with its academic strengths through institutions like IIT Delhi and the University of Delhi. Delhi also performed well in employer activity, ranking within the global top 50 for graduate employability. Alongside Delhi, other Indian cities like Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Chennai also climbed in rankings, highlighting India’s growing presence as a global education hub under initiatives like NEP 2020 and Study in India.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the RoRo ferry service on the Mandovi River launched?
questions.explanation: India’s first RoRo (Roll-on/Roll-off) ferry service on the Mandovi River was launched in Goa on July 14, 2025. This service connects Chorao Island and Ribandar, significantly reducing travel time and improving daily commuting. The ferries, named Gangotri and Dwarka, are designed to carry both passengers and vehicles, and feature modern amenities like air-conditioned seating and emergency medical kits. Operated under the BOOT model by Vijai Marine Shipyards, the service was implemented with no cost to the state government. The project aims to enhance water transport in Goa and boost tourism in the region.

questions.question: Which country launched the advanced communications satellite Dror-1 in July 2025?
questions.explanation: On July 13, 2025, Israel successfully launched its most advanced communications satellite, Dror-1, into space using SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral, USA. Developed by Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI), Dror-1 is designed to meet Israel’s communication needs for the next 15 years across military, government, and civilian sectors. The satellite, weighing 4.5 tonnes and equipped with large antennas, will operate in geostationary orbit, delivering secure and high-capacity communication services. The launch highlights Israel’s technological capabilities in space and its partnership with private firms like SpaceX to enhance national infrastructure through advanced satellite systems.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the Sigandur cable-stayed bridge inaugurated in July 2025?
questions.explanation: The Sigandur cable-stayed bridge, inaugurated on July 16, 2025, by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, is located in Shivamogga district, Karnataka. Spanning 2.44 km across the Sharavathi backwaters, it is India’s second-longest cable-stayed bridge and significantly enhances road connectivity between Sagara and Sigandur, especially for pilgrims visiting the Chowdeshwari Temple. Built at a cost of over ₹470 crore, the bridge restores vital access lost after the construction of the Linganamakki dam in the 1960s. This project is part of Karnataka’s broader highway development push, which includes several major corridors and improvements in road infrastructure across the state.

questions.question: Which country acquired the GE-F404 engine to power its indigenous Tejas Mk 1A fighter aircraft?
questions.explanation: India has acquired the GE-F404 engine from GE Aerospace to power its homegrown Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Tejas Mk 1A. This move is pivotal for enhancing the Indian Air Force's combat capabilities and addressing the urgent need to modernise its fleet as older aircraft like the MiG-21 are phased out. Under a ₹5,375 crore agreement signed in 2021, GE is to supply 99 engines, supporting the production of 83 Tejas jets initially, with plans for 97 more. The integration of the F404 engine, along with advanced features like AESA radar and BVR missile capability, marks a major step in India's indigenous defence development.

questions.question: Which West Indies cricketer recently announced retirement from international cricket, marking the end of a legendary T20 career?
questions.explanation: Andre Russell, the dynamic all-rounder from the West Indies, has officially announced his retirement from international cricket. Known for his explosive batting and fierce pace bowling, Russell was a key figure in the West Indies' T20 World Cup triumphs in 2012 and 2016. Debuting in 2010, he played 84 T20 Internationals, 56 ODIs, and one Test match, making a lasting impact in the shortest format. His remarkable T20I strike rate of 163.08 and significant contributions with the ball made him one of the most feared T20 players globally. His final appearances will be against Australia in July 2025 at Sabina Park.

questions.question: Which company recently received in-principle approval from the RBI for a Cross-Border Payment Aggregator license?
questions.explanation: EximPe has secured in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India to operate as a Payment Aggregator – Cross Border (PA-CB). This approval signifies a crucial milestone in India’s fintech ecosystem, particularly for digital trade and cross-border transactions. With a focus on the high-growth India-Asia corridor, EximPe aims to simplify and strengthen the digital payment infrastructure for SMEs involved in international commerce. The license enables the company to streamline regulatory compliance, currency conversion, and secure transactions. Backed by investor funding and a growing client base, EximPe is well-positioned to enhance India’s cross-border e-commerce and B2B payment landscape.

questions.question: Which Indian state launched the country’s first Tribal Genome Sequencing Project to improve healthcare for tribal communities?
questions.explanation: Gujarat has taken a pioneering step by launching India’s first Tribal Genome Sequencing Project. This initiative, led by the Gujarat Biotechnology Research Centre (GBRC), aims to improve healthcare access for tribal communities through genomic science. The project will sequence the genomes of 2,000 tribal individuals across 17 districts to detect genetic markers linked to diseases such as sickle cell anaemia, thalassemia, and cancer. It also seeks to establish a comprehensive genetic database for future medical research. By integrating tribal welfare with advanced genomics, Gujarat sets a strong precedent for inclusive, data-driven public health planning in India.

questions.question: On which date is the World Day for International Justice observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Day for International Justice is observed every year on July 17 to commemorate the adoption of the Rome Statute in 1998, which established the International Criminal Court (ICC). This day highlights the global commitment to upholding international criminal justice and holding perpetrators of serious crimes such as genocide, war crimes, and crimes against humanity accountable. The observance also aims to raise awareness about victims' rights, promote cooperation among countries, and reinforce the rule of law as a pillar of global peace and security. Events are organised worldwide, including educational programs, survivor testimonies, and social media campaigns under #JusticeDay2025.

questions.question: Which Indian state announced free electricity up to 125 units per month ahead of the 2025 Assembly Elections?
questions.explanation: Bihar, under the leadership of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, announced a major welfare initiative offering free electricity up to 125 units per month for all domestic consumers starting August 1, 2025. This decision is expected to benefit over 16.7 million households across the state. The scheme is part of a broader push toward affordable energy access, renewable power adoption, and economic relief for low-income families. It also serves as a strategic move in the run-up to the 2025 Assembly Elections, blending electoral considerations with long-term sustainability and climate goals, particularly through the promotion of solar energy initiatives.

questions.question: Which institution launched ‘Gyanodaya’ – a Centre for Pedagogical Innovation and Publishing?
questions.explanation: IIM Kozhikode has launched ‘Gyanodaya’, a Centre for Pedagogical Innovation and Publishing, as part of its Vision 2047. This initiative is aligned with the National Education Policy (NEP) and aims to transform the landscape of management education. Gyanodaya focuses on blending Indian knowledge systems with contemporary teaching methodologies, emphasising inclusivity, innovation, and global relevance. Key components include the development of peer-reviewed academic materials, the introduction of novel pedagogical models, and the publication of original case studies and research. Operated through IIMK’s in-house manuscript platform Pandulipi, Gyanodaya is positioned as a global hub for educational research and knowledge dissemination.

questions.question: On which date was World Snake Day observed and celebrated at Bannerghatta Biological Park in 2025?
questions.explanation: World Snake Day was celebrated on July 16, 2025, at Bannerghatta Biological Park in Bengaluru, highlighting the importance of snake conservation. The event brought together conservationists, India Post, and NGOs to foster awareness through creative mediums like philately and interactive wildlife education. Over 500 students participated in sessions focused on snake ecology, coexistence, and ecosystem importance. By engaging the youth and promoting understanding of snakes, the event aimed to combat fear, reduce human-snake conflicts, and inspire conservation-oriented behaviour. Celebrating on July 16, aligned with global observance of World Snake Day, reinforces the message of biodiversity protection and environmental responsibility.

questions.question: How many districts are targeted under the PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana approved by the Union Cabinet?
questions.explanation: The PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana, recently approved by the Union Cabinet, is focused on enhancing agricultural productivity and promoting crop diversification. This ambitious scheme targets 100 districts that have been specifically identified due to their low agricultural productivity, limited cropping intensity, and insufficient credit flow. The initiative also emphasises sustainable farming practices, better post-harvest storage solutions, improved irrigation systems, and increased access to credit for farmers. By focusing on these 100 districts, the government aims to uplift underperforming agricultural regions and ensure a more balanced and productive agricultural landscape across the country.

questions.question: Who received the Kalinga Ratna Award 2024 from President Droupadi Murmu?
questions.explanation: Dharmendra Pradhan, the Union Education Minister, was honoured with the Kalinga Ratna Award 2024 by President Droupadi Murmu. The award ceremony took place in Cuttack, Odisha, during the 600th birth anniversary celebration of Adikabi Sarala Das. The Kalinga Ratna Award is an annual recognition given by the Sarala Sahitya Sansad to individuals who have demonstrated excellence in the fields of education, literature, culture, or public service. This prestigious recognition highlights Pradhan’s contributions in the area of education and public service at the national level.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Director (Engineering & R&D) at Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)?
questions.explanation: Ajay Kumar Shrivastava has been appointed as the Director (Engineering & R&D) at Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), bringing with him nearly four decades of experience in the aerospace sector.
