Starting his journey as a Management Trainee in 1988, Shrivastava has held key leadership roles, including heading the Aircraft Research & Design Centre (ARDC) and the Transport Aircraft Research & Design Centre (TARDC). His work has significantly advanced indigenous aircraft programs and reduced import dependence through successful indigenisation. His appointment is poised to strengthen HAL’s R&D framework and accelerate India's progress in defence and civil aviation innovation under the Make in India initiative.

questions.question: Where was the 57th International Chemistry Olympiad (IChO) 2025 held, where India won two gold and two silver medals?
questions.explanation: The 57th International Chemistry Olympiad (IChO) 2025 was held in Dubai, UAE, where India achieved an impressive result by securing two gold and two silver medals. The event brought together students from 90 countries, and India’s sixth-place global ranking highlighted the effectiveness of its national Olympiad program led by the Homi Bhabha Centre for Science Education (HBCSE). Dubai, as the host city, provided the stage for showcasing global academic talent, and India’s performance not only demonstrated the strength of its school-level science education but also reinforced its reputation in the international academic arena.

questions.question: From which state were the Prithvi-II and Agni-I ballistic missiles successfully test-fired on July 17, 2025?
questions.explanation: The successful test-firing of the nuclear-capable Prithvi-II and Agni-I ballistic missiles took place at the Integrated Test Range in Chandipur, Odisha, on July 17, 2025. These tests were carried out under the Strategic Forces Command to validate India’s operational and technical readiness of its strategic missile systems. Odisha, home to critical defence infrastructure like the Chandipur testing range, plays a pivotal role in India’s missile development and deployment efforts. By conducting these tests in Odisha, India, not only demonstrated the reliability of its homegrown missile technology but also reinforced its strategic deterrence posture and rapid-response capabilities amid evolving regional security dynamics.

questions.question: By which year does the Indian government plan to implement the CAFE-III and CAFE-IV norms for cleaner vehicles?
questions.explanation: The Indian government is preparing to implement the CAFE-III and CAFE-IV norms over a ten-year period from 2027 to 2037. These norms are part of a broader push to enhance fuel efficiency and reduce CO₂ emissions across all passenger vehicles under 3,500 kg, including those powered by petrol, diesel, LPG, CNG, hybrids, and electric powertrains. CAFE, which stands for Corporate Average Fuel Efficiency, was introduced in 2017 by the Bureau of Energy Efficiency under the Ministry of Power. The target year 2037 marks the end of this regulatory roadmap aimed at ensuring cleaner and more energy-efficient transportation in India.

questions.question: Which organisation emerged as the largest development partner for Nepal in the fiscal year 2024/25?
questions.explanation: In the fiscal year 2024/25, Nepal received foreign aid commitments surpassing its budget estimates, with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) contributing the largest share—over Rs. 118 billion—primarily focused on environmental projects. This placed ADB ahead of other development partners, including the World Bank, which committed around Rs. 100 billion in sectors like roads, disaster resilience, bridges, and trade. Notably, ADB was also the top donor in the previous fiscal year (2023/24), demonstrating its continued commitment and leading role in supporting Nepal’s development priorities.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as SVEEP icons for Bihar by the Election Commission of India?
questions.explanation: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has appointed Nitu Chandra and Kranti Prakash Jha as SVEEP icons for Bihar. SVEEP, which stands for Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation, is the ECI’s flagship program aimed at increasing voter awareness and participation, especially in regions with historically low voter turnout as public figures with strong roots in Bihar, Nitu Chandra and Kranti Jha are expected to use their influence to connect with citizens and encourage informed and active electoral engagement. Their selection aligns with the broader goal of strengthening democracy through inclusive voter education initiatives.

questions.question: Which state launched Vidarbha’s first integrated steel plant in Gadchiroli?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra launched Vidarbha’s first integrated steel plant in Gadchiroli, marking a significant milestone in the region’s industrial development. This project, spearheaded by Lloyds Metals & Energy Limited (LMEL), includes a 4.5 million tonne per annum steel plant at Konsari and a 5 million tonne iron ore grinding unit at Hedri. A key highlight is the state’s first iron ore slurry pipeline, spanning 85 km and reducing transport emissions by 55%. The initiative not only addresses longstanding underinvestment in the mineral-rich but economically backwards district but also promotes sustainable, resource-based industrial growth, paving the way for Vidarbha to become a key industrial hub in Maharashtra.

questions.question: Which city received the 'Super Swachh League City' award and ranked fourth in Swachh Survekshan 2024-25 despite facing floods in 2024?
questions.explanation: Vijayawada, located in Andhra Pradesh, earned national recognition by ranking fourth in the Swachh Survekshan 2024-25 and receiving the prestigious 'Super Swachh League City' award. This achievement is especially notable given the city’s resilience in maintaining high cleanliness and sanitation standards despite severe flooding in September 2024. The recognition reflects a combination of strong civic administration, infrastructure, waste management strategies, and active citizen participation. Vijayawada’s consistent progress aligns with India's broader cleanliness initiatives under the Swachh Bharat Mission and supports global sustainability objectives such as the Paris Agreement and Net Zero Emissions goals, reinforcing its status as a model for urban development.

questions.question: Which city from Karnataka entered the Super Swachh League in the Swachh Survekshan 2024–25 rankings?
questions.explanation: Mysuru made a significant comeback in the Swachh Survekshan 2024–25 by entering the prestigious Super Swachh League, becoming the only city from Karnataka to achieve this distinction. Recognised for consistent sanitation excellence, the city showcased effective civic engagement, strong sanitation systems, and impactful cleanliness campaigns led by both the administration and local communities. This accomplishment is particularly meaningful given Mysuru’s earlier status as India’s cleanest city in 2016 and affirms its long-term commitment to sustainable urban hygiene. The Super Swachh League designation highlights not just cleanliness at a point in time but sustained performance, making Mysuru a model for other cities aiming for holistic urban cleanliness.

questions.question: Which state government informed the High Court about drafting rules to limit police visits to disputed properties?
questions.explanation: The Uttar Pradesh government has informed the Allahabad High Court that it will be preparing guidelines to regulate police conduct in civil disputes, specifically restraining officers from visiting properties under litigation without prior court approval. These proposed rules also aim to prevent direct contact between police personnel and advocates representing parties involved in such disputes. This move came in response to a public interest litigation (PIL), reflecting the state’s intent to ensure due legal process and avoid potential misuse of authority in property-related legal matters.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Prime Minister of Ukraine, replacing Denys Shmyhal?
questions.explanation: Yuliia Svyrydenko has been appointed as the new Prime Minister of Ukraine, marking a significant leadership change during wartime. Formerly serving as the Economy Minister, Svyrydenko replaces Denys Shmyhal, who has now taken over as Defence Minister. This reshuffle represents the first major political transition since the onset of the war in 2022 and is part of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s broader strategy to strengthen Ukraine’s wartime governance. Svyrydenko is recognised for her strategic role in advancing Ukraine’s international economic ties, including her involvement in critical mineral deal negotiations with the United States, showcasing her leadership credentials in a pivotal period.

questions.question: How many central government schemes have been merged into the Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana (PMDDKY)?
questions.explanation: The Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana (PMDDKY) is a major agricultural reform initiative introduced in the Union Budget 2025–26. It consolidates 36 central government schemes under 11 ministries into a unified framework aimed at enhancing productivity, sustainability, and efficiency in farming. This merger addresses issues of overlap and fragmentation in agricultural support programs. By uniting these schemes, PMDDKY promotes decentralised planning, district-specific interventions, and improved coordination, making implementation more impactful. With an annual outlay of ₹24,000 crore over six years, it targets 100 low-performing districts and aims to benefit around 1.7 crore farmers across India.

questions.question: In which city was the Mahila Aarogyam Kaksh wellness facility for women government employees inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The Mahila Aarogyam Kaksh was inaugurated at Shastri Bhawan in New Delhi by the Department of Legal Affairs under the Ministry of Law and Justice. Launched on 18th July 2025 by Union Minister of State Shri Arjun Ram Meghwal, this wellness facility marks a significant step toward promoting physical and mental well-being among women employees in government offices. Developed from a repurposed garage, the space includes a fully equipped gym and a private lactation room, reflecting a shift in workplace culture that prioritises inclusivity, health, and self-care. The initiative aligns with the Fit India Movement and Viksit Bharat vision.

questions.question: What is the name of India’s first indigenously designed and constructed Diving Support Vessel commissioned by the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: INS Nistar is India’s first indigenously designed and built Diving Support Vessel (DSV), commissioned by the Indian Navy at Visakhapatnam. Constructed by Hindustan Shipyard Limited, the vessel significantly enhances India’s underwater capabilities, including saturation diving and submarine rescue features possessed by only a few navies worldwide. With advanced systems like Remotely Operated Vehicles (ROVs) and a Self-Propelled Hyperbaric Life Boat, INS Nistar is built for operations up to 300 metres deep. It supports the Indian Navy’s strategic objective of maritime self-reliance and aligns with the Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative, positioning India as a key submarine rescue partner in the region.

questions.question: In which state did Prime Minister Modi launch ₹7,200 crore worth of infrastructure projects under the Viksit Bharat Mission?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched infrastructure projects worth ₹7,200 crore in Bihar, specifically in the city of Motihari, as part of the broader Viksit Bharat Mission. This major investment targets urban renewal, housing development, and improved public utilities across cities such as Patna, Gaya, and Motihari. The project aims to bridge regional development gaps and support Bihar’s transformation into an economic hub. With over three lakh pucca houses already delivered in Motihari, the initiative highlights the NDA government’s commitment to inclusive growth and positions Bihar as a vital component of India’s future development trajectory, leading to 2047.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Managing Director of Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL)?
questions.explanation: Dr J Ravishankar, a 2001-batch IAS officer, has been appointed as the new Managing Director of Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL), replacing Maheshwar Rao. His appointment comes during a critical period of metro expansion and public scrutiny following fare hikes and delays in key metro projects. Dr Ravishankar brings extensive administrative experience, having served in various state departments including Agriculture, Housing, and Urban Development. His leadership is expected to improve transparency, stakeholder engagement, and project delivery as BMRCL expands its network to over 220 km by 2029, particularly with the commissioning of the Yellow, Pink, and Blue lines.

questions.question: Which state is the focus of the MoU between the Ministry of Tribal Affairs and Coal India Ltd to boost tribal education?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Tribal Affairs and Coal India Ltd have signed an MoU to improve tribal education, specifically in Chhattisgarh. This initiative will impact over 28,000 tribal students across 68 Eklavya Model Residential Schools (EMRS). As part of its CSR efforts, Coal India has allocated ₹10 crore to support areas such as digital education, healthcare, and entrepreneurship.

questions.question: Where was the first campus of the Indian Institute of Creative Technology (IICT) inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The first campus of the Indian Institute of Creative Technology (IICT) was inaugurated in Mumbai by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. This initiative aims to strengthen the AVGC-XR (Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, Comics – Extended Reality) ecosystem by offering advanced training aligned with industry demands. IICT is set to play a vital role in building a future-ready workforce for the creative economy. The institute has also partnered with leading global tech companies, including Google, Meta, Microsoft, and Apple, to ensure a high-quality curriculum and exposure for students.

questions.question: In which city was the NSCSTI 2.0 launched by Union Minister Dr. Jitendra Singh?
questions.explanation: Union Minister Dr. Jitendra Singh launched the National Standards for Civil Service Training Institutes 2.0 (NSCSTI 2.0) in New Delhi at the Civil Services Officers Institute (CSOI). This initiative, developed by the Capacity Building Commission (CBC), aims to enhance the training framework for civil services by focusing more on outcomes. It reduces the evaluation metrics from 59 to 43, making the system more streamlined and performance-driven. Inputs from over 160 CSTIs, domain experts, and assessors contributed to its creation, and the approach includes hybrid learning to meet future-ready training goals.

questions.question: Which institute developed a sunlight-based, eco-friendly method to synthesise hydrogen peroxide directly from water?
questions.explanation: Researchers at the S. N. Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences (SNBCBS) have innovated a sustainable method to produce hydrogen peroxide (H₂O₂) directly from water using sunlight. This process is environmentally friendly, as it results in only water and oxygen as byproducts, offering a cleaner alternative to conventional chemical methods. The key material enabling this method is Mo-DHTA COF, which plays a crucial role in the reaction. This advancement highlights the institute's contribution to green chemistry and sustainable industrial processes.

questions.question: In which city did Union Minister Piyush Goyal inaugurate the IIMUN Conference 2025?
questions.explanation: Union Minister Piyush Goyal inaugurated the IIMUN Conference 2025 in Noida. The event, organised by India’s International Movement to Unite Nations (I.I.M.U.N.), is a three-day conference that brings together adolescents to engage in global issues through an Indian perspective. The initiative emphasises developing glocal citizenship—thinking globally while acting locally. As part of the conference, participants are encouraged to commit to one of three social goals: planting a tree, educating someone, or feeding someone. The focus on Noida as the venue underscores the city’s growing relevance in hosting large-scale educational and youth-oriented events.

questions.question: Which country designated The Resistance Front (TRF) as both a Foreign Terrorist Organisation and a Specially Designated Global Terrorist entity in 2025?
questions.explanation: In July 2025, the United States officially designated The Resistance Front (TRF) as both a Foreign Terrorist Organisation (FTO) and a Specially Designated Global Terrorist (SDGT). This decision followed the group’s involvement in a deadly attack in Pahalgam, which killed 26 civilians. The designation enables the imposition of economic sanctions, travel bans, and asset freezes, while also allowing legal action against any U.S.-based support networks. This move significantly boosts global efforts to curb terrorist financing and operations and reflects deepening counter-terrorism cooperation between India and the U.S., especially concerning Pakistan-backed proxy groups like TRF, which operates under Lashkar-e-Taiba’s influence.

questions.question: On which date is International Moon Day observed annually to commemorate the Apollo 11 Moon landing?
questions.explanation: International Moon Day is celebrated every year on July 20 to mark the anniversary of the historic Apollo 11 mission, during which astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the Moon in 1969. This date was chosen because it symbolises a major milestone in human achievement and space exploration. Declared by the United Nations General Assembly in 2021, the observance serves not only to honour this momentous occasion but also to promote international cooperation and sustainability in lunar exploration. The first celebration of this day occurred on July 20, 2022.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian male swimmer to complete the 50m butterfly in under 24 seconds at the World University Games 2025?
questions.explanation: B. Benediction Rohit made history at the FISU World University Games 2025 in Rhine-Ruhr, Germany, by becoming the first Indian male swimmer to complete the 50m butterfly in under 24 seconds. His semifinal timing of 23.96 seconds broke a 7-year-old national record previously held by Virdhawal Khade, who had clocked 24.09 seconds. Rohit also surpassed that same record earlier during the heats, showing consistent and elite-level performance. This milestone is not only a personal achievement for Rohit but also a testament to India’s evolving stature in international swimming, inspiring a new generation of athletes and expanding the country's sporting potential.

questions.question: Which organisation partnered with NIEPID to implement a standardised curriculum for children with intellectual disabilities in India?
questions.explanation: The Jai Vakeel Foundation (JVF) partnered with the National Institute for Empowerment of Persons with Intellectual Disabilities (NIEPID) to create a nationwide, uniform education model for children with intellectual disabilities (CwID). Signed on July 18, 2025, this MoU is a major component of the Disha Abhiyan initiative and aims to provide scalable curriculum solutions, digital tools, regional language resources, and professional training for educators. The collaboration addresses long-standing disparities in education access and aligns with Sustainable Development Goals like quality education and reduced inequalities.

questions.question: Which institution collaborated with RRI and IISER Kolkata in a study showing that quantum noise can enhance or create entanglement?
questions.explanation: IISc Bangalore partnered with Raman Research Institute (RRI) and IISER Kolkata in a groundbreaking study that challenges long-held assumptions about quantum noise. Traditionally considered detrimental, quantum noise was found to sometimes enhance, revive, or even create entanglement—particularly in intraparticle systems. The research highlighted that amplitude damping noise could have constructive effects on entanglement, unlike phase damping or depolarising noise, which generally degrade it. The team also introduced a Global Noise Model and developed analytical tools to predict entanglement behaviour in noisy environments, marking a significant advancement in designing practical and robust quantum technologies.

questions.question: What is the key focus of the recently launched project under the PM VIKAS scheme by the Ministry of Minority Affairs?
options: Skill training and women entrepreneurship development
Renewable energy deployment in tribal belts
Health and nutrition services for children
questions.answer: Skill training and women entrepreneurship development
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Minority Affairs launched a project under the Pradhan Mantri Virasat Ka Samvardhan (PM VIKAS) scheme focusing on skill training and women entrepreneurship development. This initiative aims to equip 150 youth with training in Internet of Things (IoT) and 300 women with entrepreneurship training. The broader PM VIKAS scheme integrates prior initiatives to support skilling, education, and leadership development in minority and artisan communities. It emphasises convergence with other ministries and links to credit facilities to promote self-reliance and employment. The initiative also encourages trained women to become 'Biz Sakhis' entrepreneurial mentors within their communities.

questions.question: In which Indian state are the Banni Grasslands, identified for cheetah reintroduction under Project Cheetah, located?
questions.explanation: The Banni Grasslands, located in Gujarat near the Great Rann of Kutch, are Asia’s largest grassland ecosystem and have been selected as a potential site for cheetah reintroduction under Project Cheetah. These grasslands offer an ideal habitat due to their resemblance to African savannahs, including vast open spaces and a mix of grasslands and scrublands. The Gujarat Forest Department has prepared a 600-hectare enclosure, bolstered the herbivore population, and developed key infrastructure to support the reintroduction effort. This initiative aims to restore cheetahs—declared extinct in India in 1952—and revive ecological balance while also supporting regional biodiversity conservation.

questions.question: What is the name of the most massive black hole merger ever detected by the LIGO-Virgo-KAGRA collaboration?
questions.explanation: The black hole merger designated as GW231123 is the most massive ever observed by the LIGO-Virgo-KAGRA (LVK) collaboration. This cosmic event involved two black holes with masses around 100 and 140 times that of the Sun, resulting in a final black hole weighing approximately 225 solar masses. Unlike most stellar black holes, which are under 60 solar masses, GW231123 stands out due to its exceptional size and rapid spin. Detected in 2025, the gravitational waves from this merger had travelled for billions of years before reaching Earth, offering scientists deeper insight into black hole formation and the dynamics of extreme astrophysical phenomena.

questions.question: Where were the Swachh Survekshan Awards 2024-25 conferred by the President of India?
questions.explanation: The Swachh Survekshan Awards 2024-25, organised by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA), were conferred in New Delhi by the President of India. This 9th edition introduced new changes like the Super Swachh League (SSL) category to ensure consistent top performers, such as Indore, do not dominate the regular rankings, giving a fair chance to emerging cities. Additionally, for the first time, cities were ranked based on population brackets to foster equitable competition among Urban Local Bodies (ULBs). Hosting the awards in New Delhi highlights the national importance of the Swachh Bharat Mission and urban sanitation efforts.

questions.question: When is World Chess Day celebrated annually to commemorate the founding of FIDE?
questions.explanation: World Chess Day is observed every year on July 20 to honour the founding of the International Chess Federation (FIDE) in 1924. This global celebration recognises chess as more than a game—it is a tool for cognitive development, social inclusion, and international cooperation. The day was proposed by UNESCO in 1966 and continues to be marked worldwide through educational activities, chess tournaments, and cultural events. The observance draws attention to the game's historical roots in ancient India and its journey to becoming a universally respected intellectual sport.

questions.question: Which organisation has rolled out its 2,500th electric locomotive, achieving the milestone in just 8 years?
questions.explanation: Banaras Locomotive Works (BLW) reached a major milestone by rolling out its 2,500th electric locomotive, specifically a WAP-7 class with 6,000 horsepower. This achievement was accomplished within just 8 years since electric locomotive production began at BLW in 2017. Known for its significant contribution to Indian Railways, BLW has also extended its reach globally by exporting locomotives to Mozambique. In the financial year 2024–25 alone, the unit manufactured 472 electric locomotives, showcasing both scale and efficiency in production. This milestone reflects BLW’s pivotal role in advancing India’s railway electrification and modernisation goals.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian woman to reach the semifinals of the FIDE Women’s Chess World Cup?
questions.explanation: Koneru Humpy created history by becoming the first Indian woman to advance to the semifinals of the FIDE Women’s Chess World Cup. The prestigious tournament took place in Batumi, Georgia, in 2025. Humpy secured her place in the final four by defeating China’s Song Yuxin in the quarterfinals. This remarkable achievement marks the first time any Indian, male or female, has reached the semifinals of this global chess event. Her performance not only reflects her individual brilliance but also highlights the growing strength of Indian women in international chess competitions.

questions.question: What is the incentive amount offered under PM Modi’s 2025 scheme for first-time private sector employees?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a ₹15,000 incentive scheme on July 19, 2025, aimed at encouraging first-time employment in the private sector, particularly targeting youth in states like Bihar. The initiative seeks to address unemployment and reduce migration by offering financial support to individuals entering formal private jobs for the first time. With a planned rollout from August 1, 2025, and a substantial budget allocation of ₹1 lakh crore, the scheme is positioned to make a significant impact on local job creation, youth retention, and overall economic development in underemployed regions such as East Champaran and beyond.

questions.question: In which state is the Saaral Vizha 2025 monsoon cultural festival celebrated?
questions.explanation: Saaral Vizha 2025 is a vibrant monsoon cultural festival celebrated in Courtallam, located in the Tenkasi district of Tamil Nadu. Known for its scenic waterfalls and misty monsoon climate, the region hosts this event annually during July. The festival blends natural beauty with cultural richness, featuring classical and folk performances, exhibitions, and public competitions. It promotes Tamil Nadu’s traditional art forms such as Bharatanatyam, Nagaswaram, and silambam, while also serving as a platform for community engagement and cultural revival. The event underscores Tamil Nadu’s commitment to preserving its heritage through inclusive governance and public participation.

questions.question: Which state government launched a milk subsidy scheme to boost the dairy sector by offering ₹5 per litre to farmers?
questions.explanation: The Assam government has introduced a milk subsidy scheme aimed at enhancing the dairy sector in the state. Through this initiative, dairy farmers will receive a subsidy of ₹5 per litre of milk, provided the milk is supplied to cooperative societies for further processing. The primary objectives of the scheme are to increase dairy production, raise the income levels of farmers, and encourage a rural dairy revolution. By supporting local producers and strengthening cooperative channels, Assam seeks to improve the sustainability and profitability of dairy farming in the region.

questions.question: Where was the 66th International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) 2025 held?
questions.explanation: The 66th International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) in 2025 took place in the Sunshine Coast, a coastal region in Australia. India achieved its highest-ever rank at the IMO, finishing 7th globally with an impressive total of 193 out of 252 points. The Indian team secured 3 gold medals, 2 silver, and 1 bronze, marking a historic performance. Although the results were officially announced in Mumbai by the Homi Bhabha Centre for Science Education, the competition itself was hosted in Australia, which served as the international venue for this major academic event.

questions.question: What is the name of the multi-stage malaria vaccine candidate being developed in India?
questions.explanation: AdFalciVax is India’s first indigenous recombinant chimeric malaria vaccine candidate, designed to combat the deadly Plasmodium falciparum parasite. It is a multi-stage vaccine that targets two critical stages of the parasite’s life cycle, enhancing its effectiveness against malaria. Developed through a collaborative effort between the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and the Department of Biotechnology–National Institute of Immunology (DBT–NII), this innovative vaccine represents a significant milestone in India’s public health and biomedical research initiatives. AdFalciVax reflects the country’s growing capabilities in tackling infectious diseases through indigenous scientific advancements.

questions.question: Which country will host the next three World Test Championship (WTC) finals in 2027, 2029, and 2031?
questions.explanation: England has been selected to host the next three World Test Championship (WTC) finals scheduled for 2027, 2029, and 2031. These finals are planned for June to align with the English cricket season and take advantage of favourable weather conditions. England has already served as the venue for previous WTC finals in 2021 (Southampton), 2023 (The Oval), and 2025 (Lord’s), making it a consistent choice for this prestigious event. The country’s well-established cricket infrastructure and historical significance in the sport contribute to its continued role as the host for these international matches.

questions.question: Who won the Men's Singles title at the Japan Open 2025 badminton tournament?
questions.explanation: China's Shi Yuqi claimed the Men's Singles title at the Japan Open 2025 by defeating defending champion Alex Lanier of France in a thrilling final. After a tight first game (21-17), Shi dominated the second game (21-15) to secure victory. This win marked a significant career resurgence for Shi, reestablishing him among badminton's elite players. The tournament highlighted Asia's badminton dominance, with China emerging as the most successful nation overall. Shi's strategic gameplay and clutch performance at critical moments (winning 4 consecutive points at 17-17 in the first game) demonstrated his championship mentality on this BWF World Tour Super 750 stage.

questions.question: Who won the Long Jump title at the Portugal Sports Meet, part of the World Athletics Continental Tour?
questions.explanation: Murali Sreeshankar emerged as the winner of the Long Jump title at the Portugal Sports Meet, which is a part of the World Athletics Continental Tour – Bronze level. He achieved a leap of 7.75 metres in the second round to secure the top position. Sreeshankar, who is also known for winning a silver medal at the Asian Games, outperformed his competitors at this international event. Piotr Tarkowski from Poland and Chris Mitrevski from Australia followed him in second and third place, respectively, making Sreeshankar’s performance the highlight of the meet.

questions.question: To whom did Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar submit his resignation, citing health reasons?
questions.explanation: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar submitted his resignation on the first day of the Monsoon Session, citing health reasons. As per constitutional protocol under Article 67(a) of the Indian Constitution, the resignation was addressed to the President of India, who currently is Droupadi Murmu. The resignation took immediate effect, and Dhankhar also stepped down from his role as Chairman of the Rajya Sabha. During his departure, he reflected on the honour of serving as Vice President and praised India’s economic progress and its increasing stature on the global stage.

questions.question: Which country has been confirmed as the host of the 2025 Chess World Cup by FIDE?
questions.explanation: India has been officially confirmed by FIDE as the host nation for the 2025 Chess World Cup, which will take place from October 30 to November 27, 2025. The tournament will follow a knockout format and feature 206 players, with the top three securing spots in the 2026 Candidates Tournament. Although the specific host city is yet to be announced, this event marks another significant milestone in India’s growing presence in global chess. India has already hosted major events like the 2022 Chess Olympiad, the Tata Steel Chess India, the 2024 World Junior Championships, and the 2025 Women’s Grand Prix (5th leg).

questions.question: Which state government signed an MoU with IIT Bombay to offer a Public Policy Certificate Course to CM Fellowship Programme fellows?
questions.explanation: The state government that signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with IIT Bombay is Maharashtra. The agreement is part of an initiative to provide a Public Policy Certificate Course to fellows participating in the Chief Minister’s (CM) Fellowship Programme. The MoU was signed in the presence of CM Devendra Fadnavis, highlighting the government's focus on improving governance and encouraging innovative approaches in public service. Initiated in 2015, the CM Fellowship Programme is now being expanded to the district level, demonstrating Maharashtra’s continued commitment to strengthening public administration through strategic partnerships.

questions.question: Which state government signed an MoU with FTII to promote the creators’ economy and train rural youth?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra has taken a strategic step by signing an MoU with the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII), Pune. This initiative is focused on empowering rural youth by training and certifying them for roles in the rapidly growing creators’ economy, which has seen remarkable growth—from ₹92,000 crore to ₹1 lakh crore in just 100 days. The collaboration also introduces state-level FTII admissions, thereby opening up opportunities for youth from villages and small towns to pursue careers in the film and media industry. This move underscores Maharashtra’s focus on inclusive development in creative sectors.

questions.question: Which state became the first in India to cap electors per polling booth below 1,200?
questions.explanation: Bihar has set a new benchmark in electoral reforms by becoming the first state in India to reduce the maximum number of electors per polling station to below 1,200. This change, implemented through the State Instructional Representation (SIR) order dated June 24, 2025, aims to reduce overcrowding and enhance voter convenience. As a result of this initiative, the number of polling stations in the state increased by 12,817, taking the total to 90,712 from the earlier 77,895. The revised cap, down from the previous 1,500 voters per booth, is a significant step toward more efficient and accessible election management.

questions.question: In which city was the NeVA Seva Centre inaugurated to mark the beginning of paperless lawmaking?
questions.explanation: The NeVA (National e-Vidhan Application) Seva Centre was inaugurated in New Delhi on July 21, 2025, marking a key milestone in India's journey toward paperless and transparent legislative processes. Spearheaded by the Delhi Legislative Assembly and supported by the Ministry of Parliamentary Affairs, this initiative aligns with the broader “One Nation, One Application” concept. The project aims to digitise all legislative documents and operations, thereby reducing paper usage, enhancing accessibility, and supporting eco-friendly governance. Features include smartphone-based access to legislative information, dedicated training sessions, and a state-of-the-art centre equipped with high-speed systems to facilitate digital lawmaking.

questions.question: On which date is World Brain Health Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Brain Health Day is observed every year on July 22 to highlight the importance of neurological well-being and the need for preventive care across all age groups. Established by the World Federation of Neurology in 2014, the day aims to increase awareness about brain-related disorders such as dementia, stroke, and Parkinson’s disease. The 2025 theme, “Brain Health for All Ages,” emphasises inclusive access to neurological care and the need for early interventions. Activities on this day encourage healthier lifestyles involving adequate sleep, exercise, and diet, along with promoting mental resilience and neuroplasticity for better brain health throughout life.

questions.question: Which state is setting up a Hornbill Conservation Centre at the Anamalai Tiger Reserve?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu has approved the establishment of a dedicated Hornbill Conservation Centre at the Anamalai Tiger Reserve in Coimbatore. This initiative is aimed at protecting hornbill species native to the Western Ghats, including the Great Hornbill, Malabar Grey Hornbill, Malabar Pied Hornbill, and Indian Grey Hornbill. Funded by ₹1 crore from the Endangered Species Conservation Corpus Fund, the centre will focus on scientific research, ecological restoration, and community involvement. Key activities will include nest monitoring, habitat restoration with native trees, and a nest adoption programme. The project reflects Tamil Nadu’s commitment to avian conservation and biodiversity protection in a critical ecological zone.

questions.question: Which bank raised ₹25,000 crore through India’s largest-ever Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP) in July 2025?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) made history on July 22, 2025, by raising ₹25,000 crore through a Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP), marking the largest such fundraising in the Indian capital market. The issue was oversubscribed 4.5 times, reflecting immense investor confidence in SBI’s robust fundamentals, long-term growth strategy, and India’s economic outlook. The QIP attracted significant interest from both foreign and domestic institutional investors and was priced at a premium of ₹817 per share. The capital raised will enhance SBI’s Common Equity Tier-1 ratio, support credit expansion across retail, MSME, and corporate segments, and bolster its leadership in digital banking and financial resilience.

questions.question: On which date is National Mango Day observed annually in India?
questions.explanation: National Mango Day is celebrated every year on July 22 in India to honour the mango, often referred to as the "king of fruits." The mango holds significant cultural, historical, and economic importance in the country. India not only leads the world in mango production and export but also has a rich history of mango cultivation spanning over 4,000 years. The fruit is deeply interwoven with Indian folklore, literature, and traditions. Observing this day helps promote awareness of mango’s heritage and supports its appreciation as a seasonal delicacy primarily available during the summer months.

questions.question: Which union territory launched a One-Time Regularisation Scheme in 2025 for unauthorised constructions?
questions.explanation: In 2025, the Government of Puducherry introduced a One-Time Regularisation Scheme (OTRS) aimed at addressing decades of unauthorised constructions and violations of approved building plans. Applicable to structures built between May 1, 1987 and July 16, 2025, the scheme enables property owners to legalise their buildings through a transparent digital platform—the Online Building Permission System (OBPS) developed by NIC. The initiative helps streamline urban planning, improve access to essential utilities, and reduce legal disputes. With structured fees, exemptions for government buildings, and incentives for educational institutions, Puducherry’s OTRS reflects a balanced approach to urban regularisation and compliance.

questions.question: Who is stepping down as the First Deputy Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund in August 2025?
questions.explanation: Gita Gopinath, a renowned Indian-American economist, is set to resign as the First Deputy Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in August 2025. Her tenure at the IMF was marked by pivotal contributions during major global crises, including the COVID-19 pandemic and the Russia-Ukraine conflict. She joined the IMF in 2019 as Chief Economist and was later promoted to the No. 2 position in 2022. Known for her academic rigor and policy leadership, Gopinath played a key role in global economic discourse, influencing multilateral strategies on fiscal stimulus, debt relief, and climate finance. She will return to Harvard University to continue her work in academia.

questions.question: On which date is National Flag Day observed to mark the adoption of the Indian National Flag?
questions.explanation: National Flag Day is observed on July 22 each year to commemorate the historic adoption of the Indian National Flag in 1947, just weeks before the country gained independence. The flag was formally adopted by the Constituent Assembly under the leadership of Dr. Rajendra Prasad. It was designed by Pingali Venkayya, who began working on the concept after his service in the British Army during the South African campaign. The day is celebrated with the theme “One Nation, One Flag: United in Sacrifice, Committed to Peace,” honouring the flag’s role as a symbol of unity and national pride.

questions.question: Which Indian state is launching the country’s first Mining Tourism Project to promote its mineral heritage?
questions.explanation: Jharkhand is pioneering India's first Mining Tourism Project, leveraging its status as a mineral-rich state to promote cultural and educational tourism. With nearly 40% of India’s mineral reserves, Jharkhand is using this initiative to highlight its industrial heritage, create jobs, and diversify tourism offerings. The project, launched in collaboration with Central Coalfields Limited (CCL), includes guided tours of operational mines like the North Urimari open-cast mine and nearby cultural landmarks. Tour circuits such as the Rajrappa and Patratu routes blend mining exposure with visits to temples and scenic valleys, making it a unique blend of education, heritage, and eco-tourism.

questions.question: Which city’s government announced a 7 crore rupee cash reward for Olympic medalists under the Mukhyamantri Khel Protsahan Yojana?
questions.explanation: The New Delhi government has significantly increased the cash reward for Olympic and Paralympic medal winners to ₹7 crore under the Mukhyamantri Khel Protsahan Yojana. This is a major step up from the previous ₹3 crore reward and is aimed at motivating athletes to perform at the highest level. Additionally, the policy includes provisions for Grade A government jobs for gold and silver medalists, ensuring long-term security and recognition for sporting excellence. The decision was taken during a cabinet meeting led by Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, reflecting the government's commitment to promoting sports and rewarding achievement.

questions.question: Which country withdrew from UNESCO for the second time?
questions.explanation: The United States, under President Donald Trump, withdrew from UNESCO in 2025, just two years after rejoining under President Joe Biden. The administration cited ideological conflicts and accused UNESCO of promoting “woke” and divisive agendas that contradict American values. This withdrawal follows a history of strained relations, with previous exits in 1984 and 2017 over perceived anti-Israel bias and financial mismanagement. Although the U.S. contributed about 8% of UNESCO’s budget, the impact is more symbolic, reflecting a shift toward unilateralism and weakening multilateral efforts in areas like education, cultural preservation, and global cooperation, while potentially increasing the influence of nations like China.

questions.question: On which date is National Broadcasting Day celebrated annually in India?
questions.explanation: National Broadcasting Day is observed every year on July 23 to honour the inception of organised radio broadcasting in India, which began in 1927 with the establishment of the Indian Broadcasting Company (IBC). This day acknowledges the evolution and influence of radio in India's journey—from its role in pre-independence communication to its transformation into a modern, digital platform through All India Radio (AIR). The celebration emphasises how radio has contributed to national integration, public education, and rural outreach, evolving over the decades to include AI-driven services, mobile apps, and digital platforms, while continuing to connect over 98% of the population.

questions.question: Which country introduced the GENIUS Act to regulate dollar-pegged stablecoins under federal law?
questions.explanation: The GENIUS Act was signed by US President Donald Trump to establish the first federal regulatory framework specifically for stablecoins pegged to the US dollar. Stablecoins are digital currencies designed to hold a steady value by linking them to traditional fiat currencies like the USD. The GENIUS Act brings such digital assets under federal regulation in the United States, requiring compliance with auditing and supervision standards set by US law. This move positions the United States as a pioneer in the formal regulation of blockchain-based stablecoins.

questions.question: Which organisation signed an MoU with the Ministry of Rural Development to promote the Bima Sakhi Yojana?
questions.explanation: The Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) partnered with the Ministry of Rural Development to implement the Bima Sakhi Yojana, a targeted initiative designed to empower rural women through structured insurance career opportunities. This collaboration supports broader national goals such as financial inclusion, women-led development, and rural economic upliftment. Under the scheme, women are trained and enrolled as insurance agents, gaining access to performance-based stipends and long-term career benefits. Integrated with the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana – National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM), the program also aligns with efforts to reduce poverty and promote entrepreneurship among rural women.

questions.question: With which country did India sign MoUs for five High Impact Community Development Projects (HICDPs)?
questions.explanation: India and Nepal signed Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) for five High Impact Community Development Projects (HICDPs), focusing on key sectors like education and health. These projects, funded under Indian Grant Assistance, aim to strengthen grassroots-level development in Nepal and will be executed through local authorities and municipalities. The total estimated cost for these initiatives is NPR 390 million. This collaboration highlights the ongoing efforts to enhance bilateral ties between India and Nepal through development cooperation and people-centric projects that directly benefit communities in Nepal.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Mission Director of the Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) under NITI Aayog?
questions.explanation: Deepak Bagla has taken on the role of Mission Director for the Atal Innovation Mission (AIM), a major initiative under NITI Aayog aimed at promoting innovation and entrepreneurship across India. Prior to this appointment, he served as the Managing Director and CEO of Invest India, showcasing his experience in investment and policy implementation. His leadership at AIM is expected to strengthen the mission's goals of scaling innovation-driven initiatives and aligning them with India's national development objectives. This appointment is seen as a strategic move to boost the impact of AIM through experienced governance.

questions.question: From which country did the Indian Army receive its first batch of Apache AH-64E attack helicopters?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army received its first batch of Apache AH-64E attack helicopters from the United States, marking a key milestone in India's military modernisation. These advanced helicopters, developed by Boeing, offer cutting-edge combat capabilities including Hellfire and Stinger missiles, modern avionics, and high survivability in diverse terrains. The acquisition, finalised through a government-to-government deal, reflects the deepening defence partnership between India and the U.S. The Apache helicopters will significantly enhance the Army’s operational autonomy, especially in high-altitude and border regions, while also reducing dependence on the Indian Air Force for tactical air support in offensive operations.

questions.question: Which state approved a 1% stamp duty exemption for women on property purchases up to one crore rupees?
questions.explanation: The Uttar Pradesh Cabinet has approved a major policy change to support women’s financial empowerment by granting a 1% stamp duty exemption on property purchases valued up to one crore rupees, provided the property is registered in a woman's name. This move significantly expands the previous benefit, which was limited to properties worth ₹10 lakh with a maximum relief of ₹10,000. The initiative is designed to encourage greater female ownership of assets, promote gender equality, and enhance the social standing of women within families and society at large.

questions.question: Which Indian state’s rubber plantations are currently threatened by the ambrosia beetle infestation?
questions.explanation: Kerala is facing a serious threat to its rubber plantations due to an infestation of the ambrosia beetle (Euplatypus parallelus), an invasive pest originally from Central and South America. These beetles introduce harmful fungi, including Fusarium ambrosia and Fusarium solani, into the trees, disrupting water flow and reducing latex output. The mutualistic relationship between the beetles and fungi causes extensive internal damage to the trees, making recovery nearly impossible. As rubber farming is vital to Kerala's economy, the infestation poses a significant agricultural and financial risk. The situation calls for targeted, region-specific management strategies and early detection systems.

questions.question: In which country was a replica of the Ashoka Pillar unveiled at the Waskaduwa Sri Subhuthi Viharaya in July 2025?
questions.explanation: On July 21, 2025, a replica of the Ashoka Pillar was unveiled at the Waskaduwa Sri Subhuthi Viharaya, a prominent Buddhist temple in Kalutara district, Sri Lanka. This initiative serves as a powerful symbol of the deep-rooted spiritual and cultural connections between India and Sri Lanka, particularly through their shared Buddhist heritage. The pillar honours Emperor Ashoka’s vital role in the spread of Buddhism, especially his contribution to Sri Lankan Buddhist civilisation through his children, Arhat Mahinda and Arhat Sangamitta. Sponsored by Tibetan Buddhist leader Kyabje Ling Rinpoche, the project exemplifies India’s commitment to preserving and promoting regional Buddhist ties.

questions.question: Which launch vehicle is scheduled to carry the ISRO-NASA NISAR satellite into orbit on July 30, 2025?
questions.explanation: The GSLV-F16 rocket, developed by ISRO, is set to launch the NISAR (NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar) satellite on July 30, 2025, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota. This mission is a significant collaboration between ISRO and NASA, representing over a decade of joint development. NISAR will be the world’s first satellite to use dual-frequency SAR (Synthetic Aperture Radar) technology for civilian Earth observation. The GSLV-F16 will place the 2392 kg satellite into a Sun-synchronous orbit, allowing it to provide all-weather, day-and-night coverage of the Earth’s surface every 12 days, with applications in climate science, disaster management, and agriculture.

questions.question: Which country’s scientists developed a method to convert CO₂-derived methanol into white sugar using an in vitro biotransformation system?
questions.explanation: Scientists from China have made a significant scientific breakthrough by developing an innovative method to produce white sugar (sucrose) without relying on traditional agricultural sources like sugarcane or sugar beets. This process uses an in vitro biotransformation (ivBT) system, which is a lab-based enzymatic technique. Importantly, the methanol used in this method can be synthesised from industrial waste or directly from carbon dioxide (CO₂), making the process not only efficient but also environmentally sustainable. This development represents a step forward in carbon utilisation and sustainable food production technologies.

questions.question: What is India’s new rank in the Henley Passport Index after making the biggest jump in 2025?
questions.explanation: India made a significant improvement in the Henley Passport Index 2025 by jumping 8 places, moving from 85th to 77th position. This is the biggest improvement by any country in the current edition of the rankings. With this new position, Indian passport holders can now travel to 59 destinations without a visa. The rankings highlight global mobility, and India’s leap reflects increasing international acceptance and stronger diplomatic ties. While Singapore retained the top spot, India’s movement to the 77th position is a notable development in the context of global travel freedom and international relations.

questions.question: Which country is set to implement a sugar-based tax on sweetened beverages starting January 2026?
questions.explanation: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) will begin enforcing a sugar-based excise tax on sugar-sweetened beverages (SSBs) from January 2026. This policy introduces a variable tax rate calculated per litre, depending on the sugar content per 100ml of the drink. The more sugar a beverage contains, the higher the tax levied on it. The primary goal of this move is to reduce excessive sugar consumption and encourage manufacturers to reformulate their products with lower sugar levels. By targeting sugar intake through taxation, the UAE is taking a preventive approach to combat rising health issues such as obesity and diabetes.

questions.question: Which bank was named the World’s Best Consumer Bank for 2025 by Global Finance magazine?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) was honoured as the World’s Best Consumer Bank for 2025 by Global Finance magazine, a prestigious recognition reflecting its leadership in customer-focused and technology-driven banking. As India’s largest public sector bank, SBI has prioritised digital transformation, financial inclusion, and rural outreach to deliver seamless and accessible services to its vast customer base. Key innovations like vernacular voice banking, AI-powered personalisation, and 24/7 digital support have positioned SBI as a global benchmark in retail banking. This accolade highlights not only the bank’s evolution but also India’s growing presence in the international financial landscape.

questions.question: On which date is World Drowning Prevention Day observed annually?
questions.explanation: World Drowning Prevention Day is observed every year on July 25 to raise global awareness about drowning, a major yet often overlooked public health issue. With an estimated 236,000 lives lost annually—most of them children and individuals in low- and middle-income countries—this day serves as a call to action for coordinated efforts across governments, organisations, and communities. The United Nations General Assembly formally recognised this observance through Resolution A/RES/75/273 in April 2021. The day underscores the urgent need for effective, cost-efficient measures to reduce drowning risks and save lives, particularly in vulnerable populations where water safety is a daily concern.

questions.question: In which state was the National Sickle Cell Anaemia Elimination Mission inaugurated by PM Modi on 1st July 2023?
questions.explanation: The National Sickle Cell Anaemia Elimination Mission was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 1st July 2023 in Shahdol, Madhya Pradesh. This significant health initiative is being implemented under the National Health Mission (NHM) in a mission-mode approach, with the goal of eliminating sickle cell anaemia from India by 2047. The program focuses on raising awareness, early diagnosis, and treatment accessibility, particularly in tribal and affected regions. Madhya Pradesh, due to its considerable tribal population and prevalence of the disease, was chosen as the launch site for this landmark public health campaign.

questions.question: Which Indian airport ranked among the world’s top 10 international airports in the Travel + Leisure World’s Best Awards 2025?
questions.explanation: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) in Mumbai earned a place among the world’s top 10 international airports in the Travel + Leisure World’s Best Awards 2025. With a score of 84.23, it is the only Indian airport to achieve this distinction for three consecutive years. This recognition highlights India’s growing reputation in global aviation, reflecting excellence in customer experience, technological innovation, infrastructure, and operational efficiency. Spread over 1,900 acres, CSMIA handles over 55 million passengers annually and offers advanced features like DigiYatra, biometric check-ins, 68 e-gates, and extensive global connectivity, positioning it as a leading aviation hub.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day for Judicial Well-being observed annually?
questions.explanation: The International Day for Judicial Well-being is observed annually on July 25, following its official recognition by the United Nations General Assembly in March 2025. This day honours the emotional, mental, and physical well-being of judges and magistrates who carry out their duties under considerable pressure and scrutiny. The date also marks the anniversary of the Nauru Declaration, the world’s first UN-backed initiative exclusively focused on judicial health. By dedicating this day to judicial well-being, the international community acknowledges that the delivery of fair and effective justice is deeply tied to the wellness of those entrusted to uphold the law.

questions.question: Which state's Assembly is setting up a 'Shaurya Vatika' to honour Kargil martyrs?
questions.explanation: The Rajasthan Assembly is establishing a ‘Kargil Shaurya Vatika’ within its premises to pay tribute to the soldiers who laid down their lives during the 1999 Kargil War. This memorial initiative involves the planting of 1100 saplings in the garden as a symbol of remembrance and respect. The inauguration of the Shaurya Vatika is scheduled to take place on Hariyali Amavasya, a day traditionally associated with greenery and planting. This project serves as a heartfelt gesture by the state to commemorate the bravery and sacrifice of the nation's armed forces.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian woman to reach the final of the FIDE Women’s World Cup 2025?
questions.explanation: Divya Deshmukh, a 19-year-old Indian chess prodigy, created history by becoming the first Indian woman to reach the final of the FIDE Women’s World Cup 2025, held in Batumi, Georgia. In the semifinals, she secured a remarkable win against former World Champion Tan Zhongyi from China. Her achievement not only marks a milestone for Indian chess but also earned her a place in the FIDE Candidates Tournament, which brings her one step closer to competing for the Women’s World Chess Championship title. This historic performance places Divya among the elite of international women’s chess.

questions.question: Where will the 4th edition of World Food India 2025 be held?
questions.explanation: The 4th edition of World Food India 2025 is scheduled to take place at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi from 25th September. Organised by the Ministry of Food Processing Industries, this four-day event carries the theme “Processing for Prosperity” and aims to gather stakeholders, industry leaders, and innovators under one roof. The goal is to promote advancements in food processing and share best practices that can drive the sector forward. Hosting the event in the capital city underscores its national importance and provides a central platform for international and domestic participants.

questions.question: Which country became the first G7 nation to announce recognition of the State of Palestine in 2025?
questions.explanation: In September 2025, France announced its decision to officially recognise the State of Palestine, making it the first G7 country to do so. This foreign policy shift was declared by President Emmanuel Macron and reflects France’s growing concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and the stalled peace process in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The move is both symbolic and strategic, aiming to support a ceasefire, promote the demilitarisation of Hamas, and foster the establishment of a sovereign Palestinian state that coexists with Israel. France's recognition carries significant diplomatic weight as a UN Security Council permanent member and may influence other Western nations.

questions.question: What is the name of the extended-range, drone-launched missile recently test-fired by DRDO?
questions.explanation: The ULPGM-V3, also known as ULM-ER (Extended Range), is the latest and most advanced variant of India’s indigenous UAV-launched precision Guided Missile series developed by DRDO. Successfully test-fired at the National Open Area Range in Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh, the ULPGM-V3 integrates precision targeting with unmanned aerial systems. It features a fire-and-forget mechanism, passive homing via an imaging infrared seeker, and a dual-thrust propulsion system. With a range of up to 4 km in daylight and 2.5 km at night, it is capable of neutralising both static and moving targets. This milestone reflects India's growing defence autonomy and technological advancement.

questions.question: What is the name of the young, sun-like star around which astronomers have observed the earliest stages of rocky planet formation?
questions.explanation: Astronomers have, for the first time, observed the birth of a new solar system and the early stages of rocky planet formation around a star named HOPS-315. This significant discovery was made using advanced instruments like the James Webb Space Telescope and ALMA. They detected crucial elements like silicon monoxide gas and silicate minerals in the disk surrounding the star, indicating early planetary formation. HOPS-315 is of particular interest because it resembles our Sun and provides insights into how Earth-like planets might commonly form across the universe.

questions.question: Which bank received RBI approval for Warburg Pincus to acquire up to a 9.99% stake?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India has granted approval to Warburg Pincus, a global private equity firm, to acquire up to a 9.99% stake in IDFC First Bank. This strategic investment, amounting to ₹4,876 crore (approximately $587 million), will be made via Warburg’s affiliate, Currant Sea Investments B.V. The transaction involves the purchase of about 81.27 crore Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares (CCPS) at a price of ₹60 each. This move is expected to strengthen the capital base of IDFC First Bank and reflects increasing investor confidence in India's private banking sector.

questions.question: What is the percentage of ethanol blending in petrol that India achieved ahead of its 2030 target?
questions.explanation: India achieved a significant energy milestone by reaching 20% ethanol blending in petrol by 2025, five years earlier than its original target year of 2030. This achievement reflects a major leap in India’s transition toward renewable fuels and underscores its commitment to sustainability, energy security, and climate goals. The Ethanol Blending Programme, initiated in 2003, has rapidly advanced from 1.5% blending in 2014 to 20% in 2025. This progress not only reduces dependence on imported crude oil but also generates substantial savings in foreign exchange, lowers CO₂ emissions, and supports millions of farmers through increased income from ethanol-producing crops.

questions.question: By what percentage did India’s net FDI inflows fall in May 2025, according to the RBI bulletin?
questions.explanation: In May 2025, India witnessed a staggering 98% year-on-year decline in net Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) inflows, dropping to just $35 million from over $2 billion in May 2024. This significant fall was driven by a sharp increase in repatriation by foreign investors and a drop in gross inflows. Despite the downturn, India’s economic resilience is evident from its strong foreign exchange reserves of $696.7 billion, which provide more than 11 months of import cover and cover 95% of external debt. The situation highlights the volatility of global capital flows and the importance of maintaining macroeconomic stability.

questions.question: Who defeated Pankaj Advani 5–4 in the IBSF World 6-Red Snooker Championship final?
questions.explanation: Riley Powell, a 16-year-old Welsh prodigy, edged Pankaj Advani 5–4 to clinch the IBSF World 6-Red Snooker Championship title. The victory was particularly dramatic because it came on Advani’s 40th birthday, when he was chasing a remarkable 29th world crown. Powell’s composed comeback, precise potting, and ability to handle pressure in the deciding frames stood out throughout the match. By denying one of cue sports’ most decorated champions yet another title, Powell announced himself on the global stage and underscored the emergence of a new generation capable of challenging long-established greats.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI)?
questions.explanation: Ajay Seth, a 1987-batch IAS officer from the Karnataka cadre and former Finance Secretary, has been appointed as the new Chairman of IRDAI. His vast experience in economic affairs, infrastructure development, and public finance positions him as a strategic leader for India’s insurance regulator. With the post of IRDAI Chairman vacant since March 2025, his appointment brings much-needed stability and direction. Seth is expected to focus on expanding insurance access, driving digital innovation, improving regulatory transparency, and protecting policyholders. His leadership is seen as critical to advancing reforms and fostering trust in the fast-evolving insurance sector.

questions.question: For which country did India resume issuing tourist visas in July 2025 after a five-year suspension?
questions.explanation: On July 24, 2025, India resumed issuing tourist visas to Chinese citizens after a five-year suspension that began in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic and heightened bilateral tensions following the Galwan Valley clash. This diplomatic move signals a thaw in strained India-China relations and demonstrates India’s renewed focus on soft power and tourism. The decision also aligns with the reopening of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, a pilgrimage of significant cultural importance for many Chinese-origin devotees. Resuming visas for Chinese tourists is expected to boost inbound tourism, cultural exchange, and economic activity, especially in hospitality and religious tourism sectors.

questions.question: Who recently surpassed a net worth of $1.1 billion due to Alphabet’s AI-driven growth?
questions.explanation: Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Alphabet Inc., has reached a net worth of $1.1 billion, marking his entry into the billionaire club. His financial rise is attributed largely to Alphabet’s AI-focused strategy and a surge of over 120% in its stock value since early 2023. Pichai, who joined Google in 2004 and later became CEO of Alphabet, has played a key role in the company’s transformation into an AI powerhouse. With investments of nearly $50 billion in AI infrastructure in 2024 and strategic acquisitions like DeepMind, his leadership reflects both long-term vision and a unique path to wealth through innovation and stewardship.

questions.question: Where was India’s first hydrogen-powered train coach successfully tested on July 25, 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s first hydrogen-powered train coach was successfully tested at the Integral Coach Factory (ICF) in Chennai on July 25, 2025. This pioneering effort is a key milestone in India's transition to green transportation under its “Hydrogen for Heritage” initiative. The hydrogen-powered coach represents a cleaner alternative to diesel engines, producing zero tailpipe emissions and only releasing water vapour. ICF’s role in developing this coach reflects the nation's growing capabilities in clean energy technology and its commitment to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2070. The project aligns with global trends and enhances India’s standing in sustainable rail innovation.

questions.question: Which country is offering free tourist visas to citizens of 40 countries to promote tourism and economic recovery?
questions.explanation: Sri Lanka has decided to expand its free visa policy to include citizens from 40 countries as a strategy to boost tourism and support its ongoing economic recovery. The policy, which has already been in effect since March 2023 for countries like India, China, Russia, Indonesia, Thailand, Malaysia, and Japan, received recent cabinet approval for broader implementation. By easing entry requirements for tourists, Sri Lanka aims to attract more international visitors and generate vital foreign exchange, which plays a crucial role in revitalising its post-crisis economy and strengthening the tourism sector.

questions.question: Which institute developed an eco-friendly composite material using the bamboo species ‘Bambusa tulda’?
questions.explanation: Researchers at IIT Guwahati have successfully developed an eco-friendly composite material by utilising ‘Bambusa tulda’, a fast-growing bamboo species native to Northeast India. This innovative material has been created by combining bamboo with biodegradable polymers, resulting in a sustainable alternative suitable for use in automobile applications. The development aligns with global efforts to reduce plastic usage and promote green technologies in manufacturing. By leveraging the natural strength and renewability of bamboo, the project not only addresses environmental concerns but also showcases the potential of indigenous resources in driving technological innovation in India.

questions.question: Who is the second-highest run-scorer in the history of Test cricket, behind only Sachin Tendulkar?
questions.explanation: Joe Root has emerged as the second-highest run-scorer in Test cricket history with a remarkable tally of 13,409 runs. This puts him ahead of legendary cricketers such as Rahul Dravid (13,288), Jacques Kallis (13,289), and Ricky Ponting (13,378). The only player ahead of Root is India’s Sachin Tendulkar, who leads with an unmatched 15,921 Test runs. Root’s achievement underscores his consistency and excellence in the longest format of the game and cements his place among the greats of cricket.

questions.question: On which date is Kargil Vijay Diwas observed annually?
questions.explanation: Kargil Vijay Diwas is celebrated every year on July 26 to honour the courage, dedication, and sacrifice of Indian soldiers who fought during the Kargil War in 1999. This war involved reclaiming key positions in the Kargil sector of Ladakh from Pakistani infiltrators. The day serves as a reminder of India’s military prowess and the resilience of its armed forces under challenging conditions. In 2025, the nation observed the 26th anniversary of this historic victory, paying tribute to those who gave their lives defending the country’s territorial integrity.

questions.question: Which country did India sign 4 MoUs and 3 agreements with during PM Modi's recent visit?
questions.explanation: During Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to the Maldives, India and the Maldives signed four Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) and three agreements covering key areas such as fisheries and aquaculture, digital solutions, and the recognition of the Indian Pharmacopoeia. The visit also marked the celebration of the 60th anniversary of the Maldives’ independence. Additionally, India extended a Line of Credit worth ₹4,850 crore to support various developmental projects in the Maldives. These initiatives highlight the strategic and diplomatic significance of India’s relationship with the island nation in the Indian Ocean region.

questions.question: Who was awarded the prestigious GP Birla Memorial Award in 2025 for outstanding contributions to India’s space programme?
questions.explanation: Dr. V Narayanan, the current Chairman of ISRO and Secretary of the Department of Space, was honoured with the GP Birla Memorial Award in 2025. The award recognises his exceptional contributions to India's space programme, particularly in advancing cryogenic propulsion systems and leading landmark missions like Gaganyaan, Chandrayaan-3, and Aditya-L1. His leadership has significantly elevated India’s status in global space research. Conferred by the GP Birla Archaeological, Astronomical and Scientific Institute, this prestigious award celebrates individuals who have made notable impacts in science and education, further placing Dr. Narayanan alongside some of India’s most renowned scientific minds.

questions.question: Deficiency of which nutrient has been linked to psychological and neurodevelopmental conditions according to a recent study?
questions.explanation: A major new study has found that vitamin D deficiency may play a significant role in the development of psychological and neurodevelopmental conditions. The research highlights that low vitamin D levels are not only a personal health concern but also a biological factor that can be passed down through generations, potentially affecting brain development as well as bone health. Conducted in Denmark, the study's conclusions are also consistent with clinical observations in countries like India. This reinforces the importance of maintaining adequate vitamin D levels, especially during pregnancy and early childhood, to support both mental and physical health.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the first woman Vice-Chancellor of Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU) in 2025?
questions.explanation: Prof Uma Kanjilal made history in 2025 by becoming the first woman Vice-Chancellor of IGNOU, the world’s largest open university. With over 36 years of experience in Open and Distance Learning (ODL), she has played a pivotal role in India’s digital education landscape. Her leadership in national initiatives like SWAYAM and SWAYAM PRABHA has been central to advancing accessible and technology-driven education. Before her appointment, she served in several academic and administrative positions, including as Pro Vice Chancellor and Acting VC. Her elevation is a landmark achievement for gender equity in higher education and a major step toward digitally inclusive learning in India.

questions.question: With which country did India conduct the joint military exercise ‘Bold Kurukshetra 2025’?
questions.explanation: ‘Bold Kurukshetra 2025’ is a bilateral joint military exercise conducted between India and Singapore, aimed at enhancing urban warfare capabilities, counter-terrorism readiness, and joint tactical operations. Held in the desert terrain of Jodhpur, Rajasthan, the exercise showcases the growing strategic defence partnership between the Indian Army and the Singapore Armed Forces. It features advanced combat simulations, use of modern technology, and real-time strategic coordination to strengthen interoperability. This exercise is part of broader military cooperation that includes naval and air engagements like SIMBEX and Joint Air Training, reinforcing both countries’ commitment to regional security and Indo-Pacific stability.

questions.question: Which international organisation released the note titled "Growing Retail Digital Payments: The Value of Interoperability", highlighting the impact of UPI?
questions.explanation: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) released a detailed note titled "Growing Retail Digital Payments: The Value of Interoperability", recognising the transformative role of India’s Unified Payments Interface (UPI) in the digital finance landscape. The IMF highlighted UPI’s ability to scale rapidly, offer real-time secure payments, and foster financial inclusion. UPI’s interoperability — allowing seamless transactions across platforms and banks — was a key point of emphasis, as it enables widespread adoption and innovation. The report also underscores India’s leadership in global digital payment systems, with UPI accounting for a major share of global real-time transactions and being adopted across multiple countries.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day for Women and Girls of African Descent observed annually?
questions.explanation: The International Day for Women and Girls of African Descent is observed annually on July 25. This day is dedicated to celebrating the achievements, resilience, and leadership of women and girls of African heritage worldwide. It brings attention to the intersecting challenges they face due to racial, gender, and economic discrimination. The observance highlights their role in driving societal progress despite systemic barriers, and aligns with several UN Sustainable Development Goals, including Gender Equality and Reduced Inequalities. By commemorating this date, the global community is reminded of the need for continued advocacy and action toward equity and justice.

questions.question: By approximately what percentage did the coral cover in Lakshadweep decline between 1998 and 2022?
questions.explanation: Between 1998 and 2022, the coral cover in Lakshadweep dropped from 37.24% to 19.6%, marking an approximate 50% reduction over 24 years.
