questions.question: Which bank has introduced global UPI services through its bob इ Pay app?
questions.explanation: Bank of Baroda has introduced international UPI services via its bob इ Pay app, making cross-border digital payments more accessible for both resident Indians and NRIs. The new features include UPI Global Acceptance, foreign inward remittances, and dedicated UPI access for NRI account holders. Customers can now make payments to merchants abroad, receive money from Singapore in real-time, and NRIs can link their NRE/NRO accounts to use UPI seamlessly. With a daily transaction limit of ₹1,00,000, the initiative strengthens Bank of Baroda’s role in digital banking innovation while aligning with India’s push for global adoption of UPI services.

questions.question: With which country did India sign a trade cooperation pact to boost cooperative exports in August 2025?
questions.explanation: India signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Zambia to strengthen cooperative trade alliances and expand export opportunities. Announced by Union Home Minister and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah in the Lok Sabha, the pact is part of India’s broader strategy to grow its cooperative export network under the National Cooperative Exports Ltd (NCEL). The agreement will promote cooperative-to-cooperative linkages, enhance market access for Indian products in Zambia, and create opportunities for joint ventures. Alongside Zambia, NCEL also secured trade deals in Senegal and Indonesia. This partnership is expected to deepen South–South cooperation and contribute to India’s export growth.

questions.question: Which country partnered with India at the 3rd Ministerial Roundtable in New Delhi to strengthen their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership?
questions.explanation: India and Singapore held the 3rd India-Singapore Ministerial Roundtable (ISMR) in New Delhi, underscoring their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. The meeting focused on six pillars of cooperation: digitalization, skill development, sustainability, healthcare, advanced manufacturing, and connectivity. With high-level ministerial participation from both sides, the roundtable highlighted Singapore’s role as a key partner in India’s Act East Policy and Indo-Pacific strategy. Singapore is among India’s largest foreign investors and acts as a gateway to ASEAN markets, making it central to regional cooperation. This roundtable reaffirmed mutual commitment to innovation, economic growth, and strategic collaboration in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: In which state has the Cabinet approved the ₹8,146 crore Tato-II Hydro Electric Project?
questions.explanation: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has cleared the construction of the Tato-II Hydro Electric Project in Shi Yomi district of Arunachal Pradesh with an outlay of ₹8,146.21 crore. Designed to generate 700 MW of clean energy through four units of 175 MW each, the project is expected to produce 2,738.06 million units annually. It will bring multiple benefits including 12% free power to the state, additional local development funding, employment opportunities, and infrastructure upgrades such as roads, bridges, schools, and hospitals. Strategically, it strengthens renewable energy capacity and integrates Arunachal Pradesh into the national power and economic framework.

questions.question: Which country announced it will recognise the State of Palestine at the UN General Assembly in September 2025?
questions.explanation: Australia announced a major foreign policy decision to formally recognise the State of Palestine at the 80th United Nations General Assembly in September 2025. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese emphasised that this move aims to support the long-pursued two-state solution, help achieve a ceasefire in Gaza, and push for the release of hostages. The recognition will be conditional on governance reforms by the Palestinian Authority, including elections, demilitarisation, and ensuring Hamas plays no role in governance. With over 138 UN member states already recognising Palestine, Australia’s step adds to the growing global momentum pressing for peace in the Middle East.

questions.question: In which year has India officially bid to host the Commonwealth Games, as approved by the Indian Olympic Association?
questions.explanation: India, through the Indian Olympic Association (IOA), has officially approved a bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games. This move is strategically significant as it would bring the event back to India exactly 20 years after New Delhi hosted the Games in 2010. Hosting in 2030 would highlight India’s ability to organise large-scale global sporting events, boost sports infrastructure, and enhance youth participation in athletics. Additionally, it would serve as an important step in India’s broader vision of sports diplomacy, promoting international cooperation, tourism, and regional development while reaffirming its place on the global sporting stage.

questions.question: In which states recently will the two new Defence Industrial Corridors be established to boost India’s self-reliance in defence?
questions.explanation: The government has announced the establishment of two new Defence Industrial Corridors in Maharashtra and Assam, aimed at strengthening India’s Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative in the defence sector. These corridors will enhance indigenous manufacturing, reduce import dependency, and create significant employment opportunities in advanced defence production. Building on the success of the existing corridors in Uttar Pradesh and Tamil Nadu, the new ones are expected to foster collaboration between public sector units, private firms, startups, and academia. Maharashtra’s clusters will leverage its strong industrial base, while Assam’s corridor will promote regional growth and integration into national defence manufacturing.

questions.question: Which country received 5 tonnes of cowpea seeds from India as humanitarian aid under the Act East Policy?
questions.explanation: India sent five metric tonnes of cowpea (black-eyed pea) seeds to Fiji as part of its Act East Policy, reinforcing its commitment to supporting Indo-Pacific partners. The aid was handed over in Sabeto, Nadi, through the High Commission of India in Suva, to strengthen agricultural resilience, food security, and farmer empowerment in Fiji. Cowpea seeds are drought-tolerant and protein-rich, making them highly beneficial for adapting to climate challenges and enhancing nutrition. This initiative not only supports Fiji’s agricultural sector but also deepens bilateral cooperation, reflecting India’s role as a reliable partner in humanitarian and developmental assistance across the region.

questions.question: Which state recorded a fivefold increase in GST evasion cases, reaching ₹39,577 crore in FY25?
questions.explanation: Karnataka witnessed a massive spike in GST evasion during FY25, with cases surging to ₹39,577 crore across 1,254 instances, alongside nine arrests. This represents a fivefold jump compared to the previous year’s evasion figure of ₹7,202 crore. According to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman’s report to the Lok Sabha, enhanced enforcement, improved analytics, and better data-sharing mechanisms contributed to this rise in detection. Voluntary tax payments amounted to ₹1,623 crore, reflecting partial compliance. Importantly, the government clarified that central GST authorities had not issued notices solely based on UPI transactions, addressing concerns raised by small traders in Bengaluru.

questions.question: In which city is the Birbal Sahni Institute of Palaeosciences (BSIP), that signed an MoU with IGNCA, headquartered?
questions.explanation: The Birbal Sahni Institute of Palaeosciences (BSIP) is headquartered in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh. It is a premier research institute dedicated to the study of plant fossils, earth history, and climate change. The recent MoU signed between BSIP and the Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts (IGNCA) aims to combine scientific and cultural insights for broader public engagement. By integrating these two domains, the collaboration intends to showcase India’s diverse achievements globally. Lucknow’s role as the home of BSIP emphasises the city’s contribution to both scientific research and academic excellence in India.

questions.question: Who recently launched the official logo, website, and brochure for Bharat Steel in New Delhi?
questions.explanation: H.D. Kumaraswamy, the Minister of Steel and Heavy Industries, unveiled the official logo, website, and brochure for Bharat Steel in New Delhi. Bharat Steel is positioned as the Ministry’s flagship international conference and exhibition focused on the steel ecosystem. Scheduled for 2026 in the National Capital, it is expected to be the largest steel exhibition in India, showcasing innovation, technology, and advancements in the sector. The initiative underscores the government’s commitment to promoting India’s steel industry globally, strengthening industrial visibility, and creating a platform for collaboration between domestic and international stakeholders.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new CEO of SMFG India Credit, marking the first major leadership change since SMFG’s takeover of Fullerton India Credit?
questions.explanation: Ravi Narayanan, a seasoned banking professional and former Group Executive at Axis Bank, has been appointed as the CEO of SMFG India Credit. His appointment is significant as it represents the first major leadership shift since SMFG’s complete acquisition of Fullerton India Credit. Narayanan brings extensive expertise in retail liabilities, branch banking, and products, making him a strong fit to lead the company into its next phase of growth. Unlike his predecessors, who were closely tied to Fullerton’s legacy, Narayanan’s entry reflects SMFG’s clear intent to drive a new strategic direction with an operational model that aligns more closely with its global vision.

questions.question: Which state secured the overall team titles in both boys' and girls' categories at the 4th Sub Junior (U-15) National Boxing Championships?
questions.explanation: Haryana showcased its dominance in the 4th Sub Junior (U-15) National Boxing Championships by clinching the overall team titles in both the boys' and girls' categories. In the boys’ section, Haryana achieved 4 gold, 2 silver, and 6 bronze medals, securing the top spot. The girls’ team outperformed with 5 gold, 4 silver, and 5 bronze, totaling 57 points to claim their crown. This victory highlights Haryana’s strong grassroots boxing culture and commitment to nurturing young talent. The state has a longstanding tradition of producing champion boxers, and these results further cement its position as a powerhouse in Indian boxing.

questions.question: By which year does NASA plan to build a nuclear reactor on the Moon?
questions.explanation: NASA has accelerated its plans to establish a sustainable human presence on the Moon by aiming to build a nuclear reactor by 2030. The project is central to ensuring a steady and reliable power supply for future lunar bases, critical for both human survival and technological operations. The reactor is expected to generate 100 kilowatts, which, though modest compared to onshore wind turbines, will be sufficient for lunar conditions. This timeline underscores NASA’s long-term strategy for lunar colonization, while also positioning the United States ahead in the global competition, as China and Russia plan similar stations by 2035.

questions.question: Under ‘Mission Sudarshan Chakra’, what will India’s critical establishments be protected with?
questions.explanation: ‘Mission Sudarshan Chakra’, launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on August 15, 2025, is a landmark national security initiative focused on protecting India’s vital establishments through indigenous technology. The mission represents a major stride towards Aatmanirbhar Bharat by aiming to reduce dependency on foreign systems and create a comprehensive multi-layered security shield. It integrates advanced surveillance, cyber protection, and physical defence in one unified framework, ensuring a proactive approach to national security. By anchoring protection on indigenous research and innovation, the mission not only strengthens defence infrastructure but also reflects India’s cultural ethos of self-reliance and resilience in the face of emerging threats.

questions.question: How many consecutive Independence Day speeches has Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered from the Red Fort as of 2025?
questions.explanation: In 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi set a historic milestone by delivering his 12th consecutive Independence Day address from the Red Fort. This achievement allowed him to surpass Indira Gandhi’s record of 11 consecutive speeches, making him the second-longest continuous speaker after Jawaharlal Nehru, who holds the record with 17. Modi’s streak began in 2014 and has continued uninterrupted for 12 years, reflecting both his political dominance and electoral success across three Lok Sabha terms. The Independence Day address is a significant tradition, where the Prime Minister outlines national priorities, achievements, and future goals to the people of India.

questions.question: Which institution’s researchers developed Compound 3b to restore the effectiveness of Meropenem against drug-resistant bacteria?
questions.explanation: IIT Roorkee researchers have developed Compound 3b, a significant breakthrough in the fight against antibiotic resistance. This compound works to restore the potency of Meropenem, a commonly used antibiotic, against drug-resistant bacteria such as KPC-2-producing Klebsiella pneumoniae. These pathogens are among the top global health threats identified by the WHO, as they can withstand existing treatments, leading to severe and untreatable infections. By countering this resistance, Compound 3b opens new avenues for effective medical treatment against superbugs. The development underscores IIT Roorkee’s growing contribution to advanced medical and pharmaceutical research aimed at addressing global healthcare challenges.

questions.question: Which bank recently reduced its minimum average balance requirement for new urban savings accounts to ₹15,000 after facing public backlash?
questions.explanation: ICICI Bank, India’s second-largest private lender, faced widespread criticism after it sharply raised the minimum average balance (MAB) for new urban savings account holders from ₹10,000 to ₹50,000. This move drew heavy backlash from customers and financial experts, as the hike was seen as disproportionate compared to other banks like SBI, which has removed MAB requirements altogether. Responding swiftly, ICICI Bank revised the policy, lowering the urban MAB to ₹15,000, while also reducing thresholds in semi-urban areas. The revision highlights how customer feedback and market competition play a decisive role in shaping banking policies, balancing profitability with inclusivity.

questions.question: Who retained the post of General Secretary (Administration) of the Constitution Club of India after defeating Sanjeev Balyan?
questions.explanation: Rajiv Pratap Rudy, senior BJP leader and Member of Parliament from Saran, secured re-election as the General Secretary (Administration) of the Constitution Club of India (CCI). In a highly competitive contest, he defeated BJP colleague Sanjeev Kumar Balyan by a margin of 102 votes after 25 rounds of counting. This outcome not only confirmed Rudy’s leadership position within the CCI but also highlighted the internal divisions within the party, given that both candidates were seasoned leaders. His victory ensures continuity in the administration of this prestigious club, which serves as a significant platform for political and bipartisan engagement in India.

questions.question: Which state government recently doubled the JP Senani Pension and increased the honorarium for BLOs?
questions.explanation: The Bihar government has taken a significant step to honor the contributions of political prisoners jailed during the Emergency by doubling the pension under the JP Senani Scheme. Those imprisoned for 1 to 6 months will now receive ₹15,000, up from ₹7,500, while those jailed for over 6 months will get ₹30,000, compared to the earlier ₹15,000. Additionally, the government has also increased the honorarium for Booth Level Officers (BLOs), reflecting its commitment to welfare measures. This move not only recognises historical sacrifices but also strengthens the state’s social support system for beneficiaries.

questions.question: Which Tata Group company has partnered with Eutelsat to launch OneWeb LEO satellite services in India?
questions.explanation: Nelco Limited, a subsidiary of the Tata Group, has partnered with Eutelsat to introduce OneWeb Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite services in India. This collaboration is a significant step in enhancing connectivity solutions, especially in areas where traditional networks are weak or unavailable. The service will cover the entire Indian landmass, territorial waters, maritime routes, and aerial corridors, making it crucial for industries such as aviation, shipping, defence, and rural communication. By leveraging advanced satellite technology, Nelco and Eutelsat aim to bridge India’s digital divide and support the nation’s growing demand for reliable, high-speed internet access.

questions.question: What was India’s Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation recorded in July 2025?
questions.explanation: In July 2025, India’s Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation stood at -0.58%, marking the second consecutive month of deflation in wholesale prices. This decline was largely influenced by falling prices of food articles, mineral oils, crude petroleum, natural gas, and basic metals. WPI inflation reflects the overall change in prices at the wholesale level, differentiating it from the Consumer Price Index (CPI), which measures changes at the consumer level. The negative WPI figure indicates easing cost pressures for businesses, potentially impacting input costs, supply chains, and the broader inflation trajectory of the economy in the coming months.

questions.question: Who won the Quantbox Chennai Grand Masters 2025 Chess Title?
questions.explanation: The Quantbox Chennai Grand Masters 2025 witnessed a historic victory by German Grandmaster Vincent Keymer, who became the first sole champion in the event’s history. He secured the title with one round to spare after drawing his game with Jorden van Foreest. This achievement not only gave him the prestigious tournament title but also propelled him into the world’s Top 10 live chess ratings for the very first time, marking a milestone in his career. While Round 8 saw all matches end in draws, Indian players Arjun Erigaisi and Karthikeyan Murali remained strong contenders for second and third positions.

questions.question: L. Ganesan, who recently passed away at the age of 80, was serving as the Governor of which state at the time of his death?
questions.explanation: L. Ganesan, a veteran BJP leader and former Rajya Sabha member, passed away at the age of 80 while serving as the 21st Governor of Nagaland. Born in Thanjavur in 1945, he had a long political career, including his tenure as a Rajya Sabha member from Madhya Pradesh in 2016. He also held key gubernatorial responsibilities, serving as the Governor of Manipur from August 2021 to February 2023 and taking additional charge of West Bengal between July and November 2022. Since February 2023, he had been serving in Nagaland, where his sudden demise marked the end of his public service journey.

questions.question: What type of GST structure has the Centre proposed in its latest reform?
questions.explanation: The Centre has proposed a Two-Slab GST structure as part of its next-generation tax reform. This system introduces two main slabs—5% and 18%—along with a 40% levy on sin goods like tobacco and pan masala. The 5% slab will include daily-use and common goods, while the 18% slab will cover aspirational and white goods, such as refrigerators and televisions, that currently fall under the 28% category. Essential food items remain exempt, ensuring relief for households. The overhaul is aimed at simplifying the indirect tax system, resolving disputes, correcting inverted duty structures, reducing compliance burdens, and boosting overall consumption and GDP growth.

questions.question: By what percentage did India’s merchandise exports grow in July 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s merchandise exports in July 2025 registered a 7.3% growth, reaching $37.24 billion. This rise was driven by strong performances in sectors such as electronics, pharmaceuticals, engineering goods, chemicals, and gems & jewellery. Notably, electronic goods exports rose sharply by 34%, highlighting India’s increasing role in global high-tech supply chains, aided by Production Linked Incentive (PLI) schemes. While exports rose, imports also increased by 8.6% to $64.59 billion, pushing the trade deficit to an eight-month high of $27.35 billion. Despite this imbalance, the export growth indicates resilience in India’s trade sector amid volatile global market conditions.

questions.question: In which country are the Indian Naval Ships INS Rana and INS Jyoti participating in the SLINEX-25 naval exercise in August 2025?
questions.explanation: The SLINEX-25 naval exercise is being held in Sri Lanka, with the harbour phase in Colombo and the sea phase in nearby waters from 14–18 August 2025. Indian naval vessels INS Rana and INS Jyoti are joined by Sri Lanka’s SLNS Gajabahu and SLNS Vijayabahu, along with assets from the Sri Lanka Air Force. Activities include gunnery drills, seamanship exercises, VBSS operations, and cultural exchanges. This 12th edition of SLINEX reflects the strong naval partnership under India’s MAHASAGAR initiative, aimed at enhancing maritime interoperability, strengthening trust, and building collective security in the Indian Ocean Region against common challenges.

questions.question: Where is the first-ever Khelo India Water Sports Festival being held?
questions.explanation: The first-ever Khelo India Water Sports Festival is being hosted at the picturesque Dal Lake in Srinagar. The festival features a vibrant logo showcasing a Shikara against the backdrop of snow-capped mountains and pine trees, symbolizing the region’s natural beauty. Its mascot, the Himalayan Kingfisher, reflects the theme of water and nature. More than 400 athletes from 36 states and Union Territories are participating in events such as rowing, canoeing, and kayaking. Organised by the Jammu & Kashmir Sports Council in collaboration with the Union Ministry of Youth Affairs, this festival highlights Srinagar’s potential as a hub for water sports.

questions.question: How long was Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Independence Day speech in 2025 that set a record as the longest such address by an Indian Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered a landmark Independence Day speech on August 15, 2025, from the Red Fort that lasted 103 minutes. This became the longest Independence Day address by any Indian Prime Minister to date. Such extended speeches reflect his detailed communication style, covering multiple aspects of governance, achievements, and future vision. The record-setting length also highlighted the significance he placed on connecting with citizens on the nation’s 79th Independence Day. By surpassing previous records, the 103-minute duration stands out in history as a benchmark for Independence Day speeches.

questions.question: Under the new FASTag Annual Pass launched by NHAI, how many toll crossings are allowed before the pass expires?
questions.explanation: The FASTag Annual Pass, introduced by NHAI on 15 August 2025, provides a year-long facility for non-commercial vehicle owners to travel seamlessly across national highways without repeated toll recharges. Priced at ₹3,000, the pass remains valid for one year or 200 toll crossings, whichever occurs first. This scheme simplifies highway travel by removing the inconvenience of frequent FASTag top-ups and ensuring zero toll deductions after activation. With nationwide coverage across 1,150 toll plazas and tech-enabled features through the Rajmargyatra App, it enhances convenience, reduces congestion, and supports a smoother, more efficient toll payment ecosystem.

questions.question: Which organization released special picture postcards and a golden cancellation to mark the 50th anniversary of the film Sholay in 2025?
questions.explanation: To celebrate the 50th anniversary of the legendary film Sholay on August 15, 2025, India Post released two exclusive picture postcards, a presentation pack, and a golden cancellation. This tribute was unveiled by the Maharashtra Postal Circle in the presence of the Sippy family and other dignitaries. The release highlighted the unique legacy of Sholay, which originally premiered on August 15, 1975, and remains a milestone in Indian cinema. By merging philately with cultural heritage, India Post not only honored a cinematic masterpiece but also reinforced its tradition of commemorating significant national icons, events, and achievements through postal memorabilia.

questions.question: In which state did ISRO inaugurate a new space laboratory in collaboration with the Muskaan Foundation?
questions.explanation: ISRO, in partnership with the Muskaan Foundation, inaugurated a space laboratory in Mechuka, Shi-Yomi district of Arunachal Pradesh, on August 16, 2025. The facility, named the Pasang Wangchuk Sona ISRO Space Laboratory, was launched to provide rural students with hands-on exposure to space science and STEM learning. Situated in a remote area near the India-China border, this initiative reflects ISRO’s commitment to making advanced education accessible even in geographically challenging regions. By fostering curiosity and innovation among youth, the laboratory aims to inspire the next generation of scientists and strengthen India’s future space research and technology capabilities.

questions.question: What was the level of India’s foreign exchange reserves as of August 8, 2025?
questions.explanation: As of August 8, 2025, India’s foreign exchange reserves surged by $4.74 billion to reach $693.62 billion. This increase was driven by gains in foreign currency assets, gold reserves, Special Drawing Rights (SDRs), and India’s reserve position with the International Monetary Fund (IMF). Foreign currency assets alone rose by $2.37 billion, while gold reserves added $2.16 billion. The rise highlights India’s strong external sector fundamentals, with the reserves positioned close to their all-time high of $704.885 billion recorded in September 2024. Such robust reserve levels enhance India’s ability to cushion external shocks, stabilise the rupee, and maintain financial resilience.

questions.question: Which Indian state's traditional bullfighting sport 'Dhirio' was banned in 1996 under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act?
questions.explanation: Goa's traditional bullfighting sport Dhirio, where two bulls lock horns in combat, was banned by the Bombay High Court in 1996 following a fatal incident and animal cruelty concerns. Rooted in Portuguese colonial heritage, this harvest-season event was once central to Goan village culture. Unlike Spanish bullfights, Dhirio pits bulls against each other without human combatants. While some MLAs advocate for its legalization (citing cultural preservation and tourism potential), the ban remains under India's animal welfare laws, mirroring debates around Tamil Nadu's Jallikattu. The sport continues to influence Goan diaspora betting cultures despite the prohibition.

questions.question: Which football club was ranked as the world’s most valuable in the Brand Finance Football 50–2025 report?
questions.explanation: Real Madrid was ranked as the world’s most valuable football club in the Brand Finance Football 50–2025 report, with a brand value of €1.921 billion and an impressive brand strength score of 94.9. This marked the fourth consecutive year that the Spanish giants retained their top position, reflecting their dominance both on and off the field. The club’s success was driven by its record 15th UEFA Champions League title, massive global fanbase, merchandising strength, and strategic sponsorships. Real Madrid’s consistent brand growth highlights its unmatched influence in global football and its ability to maintain commercial and sporting excellence simultaneously.

questions.question: Where was the Putin-Trump summit of August 2025 held?
questions.explanation: The much-anticipated summit between Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump was held at the Elmendorf-Richardson military base in Anchorage, Alaska. While the meeting lasted three hours, it ended without a peace deal on the Ukraine conflict. Both leaders, however, described the dialogue as constructive and expressed optimism for continued engagement. The choice of Alaska carried symbolic significance, being geographically positioned between the U.S. and Russia, underscoring its role as a neutral yet strategic venue. Although no concrete agreement emerged, the summit marked an important diplomatic interaction with potential implications for future negotiations.

questions.question: In which country is the Taita Hills region located, where innovative beehive fences are being used to prevent human-elephant conflicts?
questions.explanation: The Taita Hills region is located in southern Kenya, near Tsavo East and Tsavo West National Parks, where human-elephant conflicts have been significant due to elephants raiding crops in unfenced farmlands. Local farmers have adopted innovative solutions like beehive fences and crop diversification to sesame, supported by organizations like Save the Elephants. Kenya records 30-35 annual human deaths from such conflicts, making these conservation efforts crucial for both wildlife protection and human livelihoods in this East African nation known for its rich biodiversity and wildlife tourism.

questions.question: By which year does India aim to develop a fully indigenous multi-layered air defence shield under the Sudarshan Chakra Mission?
questions.explanation: The Sudarshan Chakra Mission envisions India developing a fully indigenous multi-layered air defence system by 2035. This shield aims to protect both strategic military assets and civilian infrastructure from aerial threats, including drones, missiles, and fighter jets. The system will integrate radar networks, AI-driven sensors, missile interceptors, and directed energy weapons, ensuring nationwide coverage. The initiative underscores India’s focus on self-reliance in defence technology, reducing dependence on foreign suppliers, enhancing deterrence against regional adversaries, and safeguarding civilian and critical infrastructure across the country.

questions.question: Which institute collaborated with Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) to develop biodegradable alternatives to single-use plastics?
questions.explanation: The Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) has partnered with IIT Guwahati to pioneer biodegradable alternatives to single-use plastics. As part of this initiative, eco-friendly compostable bed-roll bags have been introduced on trains, replacing traditional plastic bags used for distributing linen. The material, developed at IIT Guwahati’s R&D facility, is fully biodegradable, compostable, and designed to meet operational standards while ensuring environmental safety. This collaboration demonstrates how academic research can provide practical solutions to environmental challenges, particularly in sensitive ecosystems like the Northeast. By reducing plastic waste, this initiative supports India’s mission to phase out single-use plastics and promote sustainable practices.

questions.question: In which year were the Merchant Shipping Bill, Carriage of Goods by Sea Bill, and Coastal Shipping Bill passed to modernise India’s maritime legal framework?
questions.explanation: The Merchant Shipping Bill, Carriage of Goods by Sea Bill, and Coastal Shipping Bill were passed in 2025 to replace outdated colonial-era laws and modernise India’s maritime legal framework. These bills align national legislation with international conventions, improve sea safety, environmental protection, and seafarer welfare, and boost India’s maritime trade efficiency. The reforms also aim to increase coastal cargo handling, enhance infrastructure planning, and strengthen maritime security, promoting India’s economic and trade ambitions while supporting a future-ready shipping ecosystem integrated with global standards.

questions.question: Which country has directed NASA to prepare for the early termination of the OCO-2 and OCO-3 satellites?
questions.explanation: The United States has directed NASA to prepare for the early termination of OCO-2 and OCO-3, satellites designed to monitor atmospheric carbon dioxide and crop health. These satellites provide critical data on CO2 sources and sinks, seasonal and regional variations, and plant growth worldwide. By operating in polar and ISS orbits, OCO-2 and OCO-3 help track the impact of forests and other carbon sinks on climate systems, providing information essential for climate policy and mitigation strategies. The decision reflects the US’s role in leading Earth observation and climate research initiatives.

questions.question: Who received a singles wild card entry into the U.S. Open 2025 at the age of 45?
questions.explanation: Venus Williams, a 7-time Grand Slam singles champion and 2-time U.S. Open champion, was granted a wild card entry into the U.S. Open 2025 at the age of 45. This achievement makes her the oldest singles player at the U.S. Open in more than 40 years. Earlier in the summer, she also became the oldest woman to win a tour-level singles match since 2004. Her inclusion is both historic and inspiring, showcasing her enduring talent, resilience, and the respect she continues to command in the world of professional tennis.

questions.question: In which city were the World Humanoid Robot Games featuring over 500 robots held?
questions.explanation: The World Humanoid Robot Games took place in Beijing, bringing together over 500 robots from 16 countries in a four-day event. The competition featured 26 unique events ranging from athletics like track and field and soccer to creative performances such as dancing and even combat sports like kickboxing. One highlight was a humanoid robot completing a 100-meter sprint in 21.5 seconds, showcasing the rapid progress of robotics. Hosting such an international event in Beijing underscores the city’s growing role as a global hub for innovation, technology, and scientific advancement, especially in artificial intelligence and robotics.

questions.question: In which city was India’s first all-women operated clean street food hub inaugurated?
questions.explanation: India’s first all-women operated clean street food hub, named “Mauli,” was inaugurated in Kandivani, Mumbai by Union Minister Piyush Goyal, who is also the MP from North Mumbai. The hub is completely managed by women from Self-Help Groups (SHGs), highlighting women’s empowerment and entrepreneurship in the food sector. These women were trained under the FoSTaC (Food Safety Training and Certification) initiative to ensure that food businesses meet high standards of hygiene, safety, and cleanliness. This milestone reflects a step forward in both gender inclusivity and the promotion of safe, hygienic street food culture in urban India.

questions.question: Which state achieved the highest case disposal rate of 277% in July 2025?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu recorded the highest consumer case disposal rate of 277% in July 2025, far surpassing other states as well as the National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission (NCDRC). This means Tamil Nadu disposed of more than twice the number of cases filed during the month, reflecting exceptional efficiency in its consumer grievance redressal system. Alongside Tamil Nadu, states like Rajasthan, Telangana, Himachal Pradesh, and Kerala also achieved impressive disposal rates above 100%. The success highlights the growing impact of the e-Jagriti platform, which enables online complaint filing, real-time tracking, and virtual hearings, thereby strengthening consumer justice delivery in India.

questions.question: Where is the 30th National Ayurveda Seminar on Child Health being organised by the Ministry of Ayush?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Ayush, through Rashtriya Ayurveda Vidyapeeth, is hosting its 30th National Seminar on Child Health in New Delhi. The 2025 theme, “Management of Illness and Wellness in Paediatrics through Ayurveda,” highlights the integration of traditional Ayurvedic approaches with evidence-based practices to address child health concerns. This two-day seminar is set to bring together scholars, practitioners, researchers, and students, creating a collaborative platform to explore innovative and time-tested solutions in paediatric care. The choice of New Delhi as the venue underscores its role as a hub for national-level health and research initiatives.

questions.question: Which country is set to host the Asian Open Short Track Speed Skating Trophy 2025?
questions.explanation: India will host the Asian Open Short Track Speed Skating Trophy 2025, marking its debut in the field of winter sports. The event will take place from 20–23 August 2025 at Maharana Pratap Sports College in Raipur, Dehradun, Uttarakhand. Organised by the Ice Skating Association of India (ISAI), the tournament will feature nine race categories, ranging from 222 meters to a 5000-meter relay. With the participation of over 11 Asian countries, this event is a significant milestone in India’s journey toward promoting winter sports and showcasing its capacity to organise international-level sporting competitions.

questions.question: Which Indian shuttler won her first International Challenge title at the Malaysia International Challenge 2025?
questions.explanation: Devika Sihag, a 20-year-old Indian badminton player, clinched her first International Challenge title at the Malaysia International Challenge 2025 held in Ipoh. She secured this achievement by defeating her compatriot and fifth seed Isharani Baruah in the women’s singles final. This victory adds to her growing list of accomplishments, which include titles at the Swedish Open and Portugal International in 2024. More recently, she also captured the senior National Badminton Championships crown in Bengaluru. Devika’s consistent performance highlights her rising stature in Indian badminton and signals a promising future on the international stage.

questions.question: What is the name of the first major Atlantic hurricane of 2025?
questions.explanation: The first major Atlantic hurricane of 2025 was named Erin. It reached peak intensity as a Category-5 storm with maximum sustained winds of 240 km/h before being downgraded to Category-4 by the US National Hurricane Center. Positioned just north of the Caribbean Islands, Erin posed significant threats of heavy rainfall and severe weather across the northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico. As the initial major storm of the hurricane season, Erin underscores the critical importance of preparedness, monitoring, and early warnings in minimizing risks to human life and infrastructure in vulnerable coastal regions.

questions.question: From which date will NPCI discontinue UPI peer-to-peer ‘collect requests’ to curb fraud?
questions.explanation: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has announced that peer-to-peer ‘collect requests’ on UPI will be discontinued starting October 1, 2025. This feature, which allowed one user to request payment approval from another, had become a major loophole exploited by fraudsters, despite transaction caps and limits. By mandating only payer-initiated (push) transactions such as QR code scans or manual entry of recipient details, NPCI aims to strengthen digital payment security. The move affects all UPI apps including PhonePe, Google Pay, and Paytm, and is expected to enhance trust, reduce fraud risks, and ensure safer digital transactions nationwide.

questions.question: Which planet is the target of Russia’s planned Venera-D mission scheduled for launch between 2034–2036?
questions.explanation: Russia’s upcoming Venera-D mission is focused on exploring Venus, one of the most challenging planets to study due to its extreme surface conditions. Planned for launch between 2034 and 2036, the mission will be developed with contributions from the Space Research Institute (IKI) and Lavochkin Association. It is designed to carry advanced scientific instruments, including an orbiter, a lander, and a balloon probe, to conduct comprehensive research on the planet’s atmosphere and surface. This mission represents Russia’s renewed interest in planetary exploration and builds on its historic legacy of Venus missions during the Soviet era.

questions.question: Who has been given additional charge as the Governor of Nagaland following the demise of La Ganesan?
questions.explanation: Ajay Kumar Bhalla, a 1984-batch IAS officer from the Assam-Meghalaya cadre, has been entrusted with additional charge as the Governor of Nagaland after the vacancy left by the passing of La Ganesan. Bhalla has had an extensive career, having served as the Union Home Secretary for nearly five years until August 22, 2024. He was appointed as the Governor of Manipur on January 3, 2025, and now expands his responsibilities to Nagaland as well. His administrative experience and leadership are seen as vital in handling key governance matters in the northeastern region of India.

questions.question: In which city did Foxconn launch a new plant to begin iPhone 17 production in India?
questions.explanation: Foxconn, Apple’s largest manufacturing partner, launched a new facility in Devanahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka, dedicated to producing the iPhone 17. This unit is Foxconn’s second-largest plant globally outside of China, emphasizing Bengaluru’s growing importance as a global technology and manufacturing hub. The new facility strengthens India’s role in Apple’s international supply chain, signaling a strategic shift in diversifying production beyond China. With Bengaluru already known as India’s “Silicon Valley,” this development reinforces the city’s status as a critical center for advanced electronics manufacturing and innovation, while also boosting India’s presence in the global smartphone industry.

questions.question: Which institute collaborated with Assam Rifles to promote drone technology for defence and security?
questions.explanation: Assam Rifles entered into a collaboration with IIIT Manipur to promote drone technology specifically for defence and security applications. This partnership involved the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding at Mantripukhri and the launch of an Advanced Drone Training and Refresher Course. The program was designed to equip Assam Rifles personnel with skills in drone flight operations, proper maintenance, and DGCA-certified training. Such collaborations highlight the growing importance of academic–defence partnerships in advancing indigenous technological capabilities, enhancing operational efficiency, and ensuring that security forces remain well-trained in modern surveillance and defence tools.

questions.question: On which date is World Humanitarian Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Humanitarian Day is observed annually on August 19 to pay tribute to humanitarian workers who lost their lives or were injured while serving others in crisis situations. The date was chosen in memory of the 2003 Canal Hotel bombing in Baghdad, Iraq, which killed 22 people, including Sergio Vieira de Mello, the UN’s top humanitarian official in Iraq. The UN General Assembly formalised this observance in 2009 to highlight the importance of humanitarian efforts worldwide. This day not only commemorates fallen workers but also raises global awareness about humanitarian assistance and the challenges faced in delivering aid.

questions.question: What was India’s unemployment rate in July 2025 for individuals aged 15 years and above?
questions.explanation: In July 2025, India’s unemployment rate fell to 5.2% for individuals aged 15 years and above, reflecting an improvement compared to 5.6% in June 2025. This decline indicated a positive trend in employment generation across the country. The data also revealed gender-specific figures, with the unemployment rate for females at 5.1% and males at 5.3%. Regionally, rural areas recorded a lower rate of 4.8%, significantly better than the urban unemployment rate of 6.8%. Such statistics provide insights into labor market dynamics and help policymakers design targeted interventions to sustain job growth and reduce regional disparities.

questions.question: Which company will commence sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) production at its Panipat refinery in December 2025?
questions.explanation: Indian Oil Corporation is set to begin sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) production in December 2025 at its Panipat refinery with a planned annual capacity of 35,000 tonnes. The initiative is designed to support India’s international airline SAF blending targets by 2027, helping reduce the aviation sector’s carbon footprint. Notably, the project will use used cooking oil as a feedstock, aligning with global sustainability practices. Indian Oil has also secured ISCC CORSIA certification, ensuring compliance with international carbon reduction and sustainability standards. This development highlights India’s commitment to green energy and its role in advancing cleaner aviation fuels.

questions.question: Which bank launched a collateral-free personal loan scheme of up to ₹4 lakh for Agniveers on India’s 79th Independence Day?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) introduced a special collateral-free personal loan scheme for Agniveers on the occasion of India’s 79th Independence Day. Under this initiative, Agniveers holding an SBI salary account can borrow up to ₹4 lakh with zero collateral, zero processing fee, and a flat interest rate of 10.50%. The repayment tenure is aligned with the Agnipath scheme, ensuring flexibility for beneficiaries after service. Alongside, SBI also revised its IMPS fee structure, imposing nominal charges on online transfers above ₹25,000 while continuing to offer exemptions for certain account holders. These measures strengthen SBI’s support for defence personnel and digital banking users.

questions.question: Which city launched the world’s first AI-powered passenger corridor to replace immigration counters?
questions.explanation: Dubai has introduced an AI-powered passenger corridor at Dubai International Airport (DXB), marking a groundbreaking shift in air travel. This initiative, part of the “Travel Without Borders” vision, enables travelers to clear immigration in as little as 14 seconds without presenting passports or documents. The corridor uses artificial intelligence, facial recognition, and biometric verification to authenticate passengers seamlessly, while automatically flagging suspicious cases for review. Initially launched in Terminal 3’s First and Business Class lounges, the system supports up to 10 passengers at once. By removing traditional passport counters, Dubai sets a new global benchmark for frictionless and secure international travel.

questions.question: Who was crowned Miss Universe India 2025 and will represent India at the 74th Miss Universe in Thailand?
questions.explanation: Manika Vishwakarma from Ganganagar, Rajasthan, was crowned Miss Universe India 2025 in Jaipur, emerging victorious among 50 contestants from across the country. Her win secures her place as India’s representative at the 74th Miss Universe pageant to be held in Thailand. Manika’s journey has been remarkable, beginning with her title of Miss Universe Rajasthan 2024, which paved her way to the national stage. She credits her mentors and supporters for shaping her growth in pageantry, which she describes as a platform that develops character beyond competition. India now looks forward to continuing its legacy of Miss Universe triumphs through her.

questions.question: Which institute partnered with Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) to develop biodegradable alternatives to single-use plastics?
questions.explanation: Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) collaborated with IIT Guwahati to work on developing biodegradable alternatives to single-use plastics. This partnership is focused on addressing the pressing issue of plastic pollution by creating sustainable and eco-friendly solutions for railway operations as well as passenger services. As part of the first phase of the project, eco-friendly green bed-roll bags were introduced on NFR trains, marking a significant step toward reducing non-biodegradable waste. This initiative not only strengthens India’s fight against plastic pollution but also demonstrates the role of academic–industry partnerships in driving impactful environmental innovation.

questions.question: Who won India’s first gold medal at the 16th Asian Shooting Championship in Shymkent, Kazakhstan?
questions.explanation: Kapil Bainsla from Palwal, Haryana secured India’s first gold medal at the 16th Asian Shooting Championship held in Shymkent, Kazakhstan. He triumphed in the 10m air pistol men junior final with a total score of 243.0, narrowly defeating Uzbekistan’s Ilkhombek Obidjonov by 0.6 points. His victory was significant as it set the momentum for India on the opening day of the tournament, where the country bagged one gold, two silvers, and one bronze overall. Kapil’s achievement highlights the rising talent in India’s shooting sport, showcasing determination and precision on the international stage.

questions.question: On which date is World Photography Day celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: World Photography Day is observed every year on August 19 to celebrate the art, science, and impact of photography across the globe. It provides an opportunity to acknowledge how photography influences culture, history, and communication. For 2025, the theme has been chosen as “My Favorite Photo,” encouraging individuals to reflect on and share images that hold personal meaning. Additionally, World Photography Week runs from August 12–26, motivating people to participate in global conversations by sharing impactful photographs using the hashtag #WorldPhotographyWeek. This celebration emphasises the role of photography as both a creative medium and a tool for storytelling.

questions.question: Which country’s tourism board has partnered with TikTok to promote tourism through a creator-led campaign?
questions.explanation: TikTok has collaborated with the Nepal Tourism Board to promote tourism by showcasing the country’s cultural richness and natural beauty. The campaign will be driven by local as well as international creators, who will share short-form videos highlighting Nepal’s must-see attractions and unexplored destinations. Running through 2025, the initiative will also feature a dedicated #VisitNepal in-app experience, designed to engage global audiences. This partnership reflects a modern approach to tourism promotion, leveraging the wide reach of social media platforms like TikTok to boost international visibility and attract more travelers to Nepal.

questions.question: How many Tejas Mark 1A fighter jets has India approved for purchase under the ₹62,000 crore deal in 2025?
questions.explanation: India has approved the purchase of 97 Tejas Mark 1A fighter jets under a ₹62,000 crore deal, marking a major step towards strengthening the Indian Air Force (IAF) and promoting self-reliance in defence manufacturing. This order comes in addition to an earlier purchase of 83 jets, bringing the total number of Tejas Mark 1A aircraft ordered to 180. The new fleet will replace the ageing MiG-21s, enhancing the IAF’s operational capabilities with modern avionics, advanced radar, and electronic warfare systems. With 65% indigenous content, the deal boosts the Make in India mission, supports HAL, creates jobs, and strengthens India’s defence exports potential.

questions.question: In which year was the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act originally enacted?
questions.explanation: The Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act was originally enacted in 1957 as the primary legislation to regulate the mining sector in India. Its purpose was to provide a legal framework for the development, control, and regulation of mines and minerals. Over the years, it has been amended multiple times to suit changing industrial needs and economic conditions. The 2025 Amendment introduced significant updates such as provisions for leaseholders to include additional minerals, and the establishment of the National Mineral Exploration Trust to enhance mineral exploration and development across the country.

questions.question: Which city became India’s first to get portable solar panels installed between railway tracks?
questions.explanation: Varanasi became the first city in India to have a portable solar panel system installed between railway tracks. The project was commissioned at Banaras Locomotive Works (BLW) by Indian Railways as part of its sustainability drive. The system spans 70 metres, consisting of 28 solar panels capable of generating 15 kWp of power. Unlike fixed systems, this arrangement is removable and offers operational flexibility, marking a significant step toward green energy in the transport sector. This innovation reflects Indian Railways’ commitment to reducing its carbon footprint and promoting renewable energy solutions in everyday infrastructure.

questions.question: How many Indian students were flagged off to participate in the Sakura Science Programme 2025 in Japan?
questions.explanation: A total of 34 Indian students were flagged off to take part in the Sakura Science Programme 2025 held in Japan. This initiative, launched in 2014 by Japan and joined by India in 2016, is organised by the Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST). The programme encourages international youth exchange in science and technology, fostering collaboration and mutual learning among young participants. Apart from India, countries such as Egypt, Ghana, Kenya, Nigeria, South Africa, Zambia, and other Asian nations are also part of this initiative, making it a significant platform for global scientific cooperation and cultural exchange.

questions.question: The new NABL Medical Application Portal has been launched for laboratories applying under which international standard?
questions.explanation: The National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL) has launched a new Medical Application Portal specifically designed for laboratories applying under ISO 15189:2022. This standard is globally recognised for defining quality and competence requirements in medical laboratories, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and safety in diagnostic testing. The digital portal simplifies application processes, offers real-time status tracking, and introduces multi-user access for better accountability. By streamlining accreditation procedures, it aims to enhance India’s healthcare infrastructure, reduce human errors, and speed up approvals. Accreditation under ISO 15189:2022 strengthens trust in diagnostic services, making it critical for patient safety and effective healthcare delivery.

questions.question: Which new Indian Institute of Management (IIM) is set to be established with a ₹550 crore grant under the IIM Amendment Bill 2025?
questions.explanation: The Lok Sabha has passed the Indian Institutes of Management (Amendment) Bill, 2025, approving the establishment of IIM Guwahati in Assam with a central financial grant of ₹550 crore. This move is significant as it brings premier management education to the Northeast, addressing a long-standing regional demand. Guwahati, already a key educational and economic hub, will now host one of India’s most prestigious institutions, thereby fostering inclusive growth, attracting talent, and boosting local development. IIM Guwahati is expected to strengthen higher education infrastructure, encourage entrepreneurship, create jobs, and integrate the Northeast more effectively into India’s academic and economic framework.

questions.question: What is the name of the newly launched portal aimed at simplifying the registration process for newspapers and periodicals?
questions.explanation: The Press Sewa portal was launched by the Press Registrar General of India (PRGI) to simplify and streamline the registration process for newspapers and periodicals. This initiative focuses on enhancing transparency, reducing delays in approvals, and improving the overall ease of doing business for publishers. Additionally, sessions like Vartalap, organised by PIB Hyderabad, were conducted to address publishers’ queries and provide them with clear guidance. By adopting digital solutions like Press Sewa, the government aims to modernise the media regulatory framework, ensuring efficient service delivery and strengthening trust between regulatory authorities and publishers.

questions.question: On which date is World Mosquito Day observed each year?
questions.explanation: World Mosquito Day is observed annually on August 20 to highlight the dangers of mosquito-borne diseases such as malaria, dengue, chikungunya, Japanese Encephalitis, and Zika virus. The day commemorates the groundbreaking discovery by Sir Ronald Ross in 1897 that malaria is transmitted through the bite of a female Anopheles mosquito. This finding transformed the global approach to disease prevention and control. Despite advancements, mosquito-borne illnesses still cause widespread health issues, especially during monsoon seasons in regions like India. The observance emphasises prevention, awareness, community participation, and global cooperation to reduce the burden of these diseases.

questions.question: In which state has the Cabinet approved the development of a Greenfield Airport at Kota-Bundi?
questions.explanation: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved the Airports Authority of India’s proposal to develop a Greenfield Airport at Kota-Bundi in Rajasthan with an investment of ₹1,507 crore. Kota, widely recognised as the industrial capital of Rajasthan and a global hub for educational coaching, has seen rising demand for better transport infrastructure. The new airport will feature a modern terminal, a longer runway capable of handling larger aircraft like the A-321, and facilities to serve up to 2 million passengers annually. This project will strengthen connectivity, boost industrial and educational growth, generate employment, and accelerate regional economic development.

questions.question: In which state has the Cabinet approved the construction of a 6-lane Capital Region Ring Road?
questions.explanation: The Cabinet has approved the construction of a 6-lane access-controlled Capital Region Ring Road in Odisha at a cost of ₹8,307.74 crore. This project includes the Bhubaneswar Bypass, which is designed to divert heavy commercial traffic away from Cuttack, Bhubaneswar, and Khordha. By reducing congestion in these key urban areas, the road will significantly enhance freight movement efficiency and lower logistics costs. Furthermore, the project is expected to stimulate socio-economic growth across the region, improve connectivity, and create opportunities for trade and industry, making it a transformative step for Odisha’s infrastructure development.

questions.question: How many consecutive days of detention lead to automatic removal of PM, CMs, and Ministers under the 2025 Bill?
questions.explanation: The Constitution (One Hundred and Thirtieth Amendment) Bill, 2025, introduced by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, specifies that the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, and other ministers will be automatically removed from office if they are detained for 30 consecutive days on charges that carry a minimum sentence of five years. This clause strengthens accountability and ensures that individuals holding the highest executive positions cannot continue in office while under prolonged detention. By fixing the threshold at 30 days, the law balances due process with public trust in governance, preventing misuse of power and safeguarding democratic integrity.

questions.question: By what percentage did India’s infrastructure output grow in July 2025 compared to the same period last year?
questions.explanation: In July 2025, India’s infrastructure output, measured by the Index of Eight Core Industries (ICI), recorded a growth of 2% compared to the same month in the previous year. This performance was largely driven by strong growth in steel and cement sectors, which posted double-digit increases of 12.8% and 11.7% respectively. Fertilizer production also contributed positively with a rise of 2%, while electricity generation showed a smaller increase of 0.5%. The 2% growth reflects resilience in core industries despite mixed performances across sectors, highlighting steel and cement as major drivers of infrastructure development during this period.

questions.question: What was India’s marine fish production recorded at in 2023–24?
questions.explanation: India’s marine fish production in 2023–24 reached 44.95 lakh tonnes, marking a significant increase from 34.76 lakh tonnes in 2020–21, with an impressive average annual growth rate of 8.9%. This surge is attributed to the government’s dual strategy of sustainable fisheries development and climate-resilient practices under initiatives such as the PM Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) and the National Innovation in Climate Resilient Agriculture (NICRA). These programs focus on ecological restoration, climate adaptation, and infrastructure support for coastal communities. The achievement not only highlights India’s growing fishery sector but also underscores its commitment to sustainability and long-term resilience against climate impacts.

questions.question: Which city launched the ‘One Freezone Passport’ initiative for a unified business license?
questions.explanation: Dubai has launched the ‘One Freezone Passport’ initiative, which allows companies licensed in one free zone to expand their operations into other free zones without the need for additional licenses. This move simplifies regulatory processes, enhances business flexibility, and reduces operational costs for global firms. Louis Vuitton became the first company to benefit from this system, facilitating its operations between Jafza and the DWTC Free Zone. By unifying its free zone ecosystem, Dubai strengthens its status as a global business hub, attracting multinational companies and fostering a more streamlined and competitive economic environment.

questions.question: Which Indian state is promoting Palmyra palm trees as a natural safeguard against lightning strikes?
questions.explanation: Odisha has initiated efforts to promote Palmyra palm trees (Borassus flabellifer) as a natural safeguard against lightning strikes, given its high vulnerability to lightning-related deaths according to IMD and NCRB data. The tree, commonly found in tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia, is known for its resilience and tall structure, which helps in dispersing lightning safely, thereby reducing the risk to human life. While the Palmyra palm holds cultural significance in Tamil Nadu as its State Tree, Odisha’s move to expand its plantation highlights a strategic environmental and safety measure to protect vulnerable communities from natural hazards.

questions.question: Who won the gold medal in the Men’s Skeet event at the Asian Shooting Championships in Shymkent, Kazakhstan?
questions.explanation: Anantjeet Singh Naruka secured the gold medal in the Men’s Skeet event at the Asian Shooting Championships held in Shymkent, Kazakhstan. He outperformed Kuwait’s Mansour Al Rashidi in the final to claim the top podium position, showcasing exceptional skill and composure under pressure. This victory highlights India’s growing presence in the shooting sport on the international stage. Alongside his triumph, Saurabh Chaudhary and Suruchi Inder Singh contributed to India’s medal tally by winning bronze in the 10 meter air pistol mixed team event, reflecting the country’s strength across multiple shooting disciplines.

questions.question: What is the top speed achieved by the Agni-5 Intermediate Range Ballistic Missile during its test?
questions.explanation: The Agni-5 Intermediate Range Ballistic Missile, successfully test-fired from the Integrated Test Range at Chandipur, Odisha, is capable of reaching speeds up to Mach 24, making it one of the fastest strategic missiles in India’s arsenal. The launch was conducted under the Strategic Forces Command and validated all key operational and technical parameters. This speed enables the missile to cover vast distances within minutes, ensuring high precision and deterrence capabilities. Alongside Agni-5, India has also maintained operational readiness of other systems like Prithvi-II and Agni-I, strengthening the country’s layered missile defence and strategic strike capability.

questions.question: On which date is World Entrepreneurs’ Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Entrepreneurs’ Day is observed annually on August 21 to honour innovators and business leaders who contribute to economic growth, job creation, and societal progress. This global observance highlights the resilience, creativity, and leadership of entrepreneurs ranging from small business owners to large-scale startup founders. Celebrated in over 170 countries, the day fosters awareness about the value of entrepreneurship and its role in driving GDP, innovation, and social change. By commemorating this day, governments, academic institutions, and business communities encourage entrepreneurial education, inspire new leaders, and strengthen ecosystems that nurture sustainable enterprise worldwide.

questions.question: Which institution developed AI-based antibiotics to combat drug-resistant infections like MRSA and Neisseria gonorrhoeae?
questions.explanation: Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have successfully developed two potential antibiotics using generative AI to address the growing challenge of drug-resistant infections. These antibiotics are specifically designed to target Neisseria gonorrhoeae, the bacterium responsible for gonorrhea, and methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), a leading cause of hospital-acquired infections. The application of AI in drug discovery accelerates the identification of effective compounds, reducing the time and cost involved in traditional research. This breakthrough represents a significant advancement in the fight against antimicrobial resistance, offering hope for novel treatments against some of the most dangerous superbugs threatening global health.

questions.question: On which date is World Senior Citizens’ Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Senior Citizens’ Day is observed every year on August 21 to honour the invaluable contributions of elderly people and to highlight the importance of serving them with dignity, respect, and compassion. First proclaimed by U.S. President Ronald Reagan in 1988 and later recognised globally by the United Nations in 1990, the day has grown into a worldwide observance. It emphasises the need to address challenges such as health issues, social isolation, and financial insecurity faced by senior citizens. Celebrating this day also promotes intergenerational solidarity, ensuring that elders’ wisdom and experiences remain central to community growth and policy-making.

questions.question: Who became the first player to win the PFA Player of the Year award three times in English football history?
questions.explanation: Mohamed Salah made history by becoming the first footballer ever to win the PFA Player of the Year award three times. In the 2024–25 season, Salah not only secured this prestigious honour but also claimed the Premier League Player of the Season, the Golden Boot, and the Playmaker award. His tally of 29 goals and 18 assists was instrumental in Liverpool’s Premier League triumph, finishing 10 points clear of Arsenal. Salah had previously won the PFA award in 2018 and 2022, but his third triumph in 2025 established a new benchmark in English football excellence.

questions.question: Which country conducted the large-scale missile drill called “Sustainable Power 1404” in the Gulf of Oman?
questions.explanation: The missile drill “Sustainable Power 1404” was carried out by Iran in the Gulf of Oman and the northern Indian Ocean. This exercise, which included warships, air units, missile defense systems, and precision-strike cruise missiles such as Nasir and Qadir, was aimed at strengthening combat readiness and reinforcing maritime deterrence. The drills followed the June 2025 conflict involving Israel and were viewed as a counter-response to Israeli military simulations targeting Iranian nuclear sites. By showcasing resilience and advanced strike capabilities, Iran sought to signal both regional power projection and preparedness for any future escalation.

questions.question: What is the primary impact of the SASCI scheme, which sanctioned ₹3,295.76 crore for 40 projects across India?
questions.explanation: The SASCI scheme, with a sanctioned outlay of ₹3,295.76 crore, is primarily aimed at boosting tourism development in India, particularly by promoting lesser-known but iconic destinations. The initiative focuses on creating comprehensive and responsible tourism experiences through 100% central funding support. Projects are selected using a challenge-based model to ensure quality, transparency, and long-term sustainability. These projects cover heritage restoration, eco-tourism, spiritual site development, and modern tourist amenities. By enhancing connectivity, infrastructure, and visitor facilities, the scheme significantly increases the attractiveness of such destinations, generating employment opportunities and uplifting local economies while fostering sustainable growth.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day Commemorating the Victims of Acts of Violence Based on Religion or Belief observed every year?
questions.explanation: The International Day Commemorating the Victims of Acts of Violence Based on Religion or Belief is observed annually on August 22. It was proclaimed by the United Nations General Assembly in 2019 through Resolution A/RES/73/296. The day highlights the importance of protecting freedom of religion and belief, while also condemning violence and extremism carried out in their name. By honouring victims of religious persecution and hate crimes, the observance promotes tolerance, interfaith dialogue, and accountability among states. It reinforces universal human rights enshrined in the UDHR, ensuring that religious freedom remains a core pillar of peace and democracy worldwide.

questions.question: Which country launched the Nusuk Umrah service to help international pilgrims apply for visas and book related services online?
questions.explanation: Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of Hajj and Umrah launched the Nusuk Umrah service to simplify and modernise the pilgrimage process for international visitors. The platform enables pilgrims to directly apply for Umrah visas and book essential services online, including accommodation, transportation, and guided tours. By offering both integrated packages and customizable options, the initiative enhances convenience and accessibility for millions of Muslims worldwide. This digital service reflects Saudi Arabia’s broader strategy of improving the pilgrimage experience, supporting Vision 2030 goals, and ensuring that religious tourism is streamlined, transparent, and aligned with global digital transformation trends.

questions.question: What was the percentage of cotton import duty that India suspended until September 30, 2025, to support the garment industry?
questions.explanation: India suspended the 11% cotton import duty until September 30, 2025, as a relief measure for its garment and textile industry. This sector, which employs millions, has been under pressure from high input costs and growing competition from countries like China, Bangladesh, and Vietnam. The duty suspension reduces raw material costs, giving exporters breathing space to remain competitive in global markets. Additionally, the move benefits U.S. cotton growers by expanding their market access in India. It also serves as a diplomatic gesture to ease trade tensions with the U.S., while reinforcing India’s role in the global textile supply chain.

questions.question: Around which planet did NASA discover its 29th satellite, named S/2025 U1?
questions.explanation: NASA announced the discovery of the 29th satellite orbiting Uranus, designated S/2025 U1. The discovery was made by a team from the Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) on February 2, 2025. The new moon is estimated to be about 10 kilometers in diameter and orbits Uranus at a distance of roughly 56,000 kilometers. This finding expands our understanding of Uranus’s satellite system and provides new insights into the planet’s complex gravitational interactions. Such discoveries help astronomers study the history of planetary formation, the evolution of outer solar system bodies, and the dynamics of moons orbiting distant planets.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Commissioner of Police, Delhi, after the retirement of Sanjay Arora in August 2025?
questions.explanation: Satish Golcha, a 1992-batch IPS officer from the AGMUT cadre, has been appointed as the new Commissioner of Police, Delhi. He assumed charge after Sanjay Arora’s retirement and the interim tenure of Shashi Bhushan Kumar Singh. Golcha has held several key positions in his career, including DGP of Arunachal Pradesh, Special Commissioner in Delhi Police, and DG (Prisons) overseeing Tihar, Mandoli, and Rohini jails. Known for his experience in law & order, intelligence, and his tenure in the CBI, his appointment ensures continuity in Delhi Police leadership at a time when the capital faces increasing law and order challenges.

questions.question: Which Indian state launched the ‘Shramshree’ Scheme to support returning migrant workers with financial aid, job training, and self-employment opportunities?
questions.explanation: The ‘Shramshree’ Scheme was launched by West Bengal to address the challenges faced by migrant workers returning from other states due to linguistic discrimination and harassment. Under the scheme, each eligible worker receives ₹5,000 per month for up to one year or until employment is secured. In addition, returnees are provided job cards, rural employment opportunities, skill development training, and financial assistance for self-employment. This initiative reflects West Bengal’s commitment to rehabilitating its workers by offering both immediate financial support and long-term livelihood solutions, ensuring their reintegration into the state’s economy.

questions.question: With which regional bloc did India recently sign the Terms of Reference to begin negotiations for a Free Trade Agreement (FTA)?
questions.explanation: India signed the Terms of Reference with the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU) to begin negotiations for a Free Trade Agreement. The EAEU comprises Armenia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyz Republic, and Russia. This agreement lays the groundwork for boosting bilateral trade, supporting MSMEs, and diversifying India’s market access in Eurasia. With bilateral trade already reaching USD 69 billion in 2024, the FTA is expected to further accelerate growth across sectors like pharmaceuticals, IT services, textiles, machinery, and agriculture. Strengthening these ties not only enhances India’s trade prospects but also deepens its strategic and economic footprint in the Eurasian region.

questions.question: When is ISRO scheduled to conduct the first Gaganyaan test flight?
questions.explanation: ISRO has announced that the first test flight of India’s maiden human space mission, Gaganyaan, will take place in December 2025. This unmanned test will validate crucial systems such as the crew escape mechanism, orbital module, and launch dynamics. Out of the 9,000 required tests for the mission, around 7,700 (80%) have already been successfully completed, with the rest expected by March 2026. The Gaganyaan mission is designed to send three astronauts into low Earth orbit for up to seven days, showcasing India’s capability in human spaceflight and marking a milestone in the country’s growing space exploration journey.

questions.question: On which date is National Space Day observed annually in India to commemorate the Chandrayaan-3 soft landing?
questions.explanation: National Space Day is celebrated on August 23 every year to honour the historic achievement of Chandrayaan-3’s Vikram lander successfully performing a soft landing on the lunar surface on August 23, 2023. This milestone marked India as the first country to land near the Moon’s south pole, showcasing the nation’s growing space capabilities. The 2025 theme, "Aryabhatta to Gaganyaan: Ancient Wisdom to Infinite Possibilities," reflects India’s journey from its ancient astronomical heritage to ambitious modern space missions. The observance also highlights future endeavors such as the NASA-ISRO NISAR mission, reinforcing India’s global role in space exploration.

questions.question: In which state did the Indian Army initiate Exercise Samanvay Shakti 2025?
questions.explanation: Exercise Samanvay Shakti 2025 was initiated by the Indian Army in the Tinsukia district of Assam. This 10-day long military-civil integration exercise is aimed at enhancing coordination between the armed forces, state agencies, and civil administration. The participation of the Indian Army, Indian Air Force, police, intelligence agencies, and district administration reflects its holistic approach toward strengthening cooperation and mutual understanding. Conducting such exercises in Assam also highlights the region’s strategic importance and the need for cohesive action in managing security, communication, and disaster response mechanisms effectively for both military and civil purposes.

questions.question: Which country led the APAC region in commercial leasing demand and new office supply in H1 2025?
questions.explanation: India emerged as the leading office market in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region during the first half of 2025, accounting for 70% of the leasing demand and 48% of the new office supply. Alongside China and Singapore, India contributed nearly 80% of the total new office supply across the region. The strong momentum was driven by robust demand for Grade A office spaces, fueled by corporate expansions, the growth of Global Capability Centers (GCCs), and the overall resilience of India’s local market. This positioned India as the top-performing commercial real estate hub in APAC for H1 2025.

questions.question: Which country is collaborating with India to jointly develop a 120-kilonewton jet engine for the AMCA fighter aircraft?
