questions.explanation: India and France have entered into a significant defence collaboration to co-develop a 120-kilonewton jet engine for India’s fifth-generation Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA). The project involves DRDO from India and Safran from France, with an estimated cost of $7 billion. While the initial batch of AMCA aircraft will use GE-414 engines, the indigenously co-developed engine with France will power future aircraft. The collaboration is expected to ensure 100% technology transfer, boosting India’s defence self-reliance and strengthening bilateral strategic ties. This initiative represents a major leap toward advanced indigenous capabilities in aerospace and defence technology.

questions.question: Which bank has inaugurated a Centre of Excellence for MSMEs in Gurugram?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) has launched a Centre of Excellence for MSMEs at its State Bank Academy in Gurugram. This initiative is aimed at strengthening the MSME ecosystem by focusing on skill development, innovation, and knowledge sharing. It will provide significant support to MSME promoters, startups, and other stakeholders in the sector. Moreover, the Centre of Excellence is expected to foster collaboration between academia, industry, government institutions, and banking professionals. By doing so, SBI is contributing to the growth and sustainability of the MSME sector, which is a vital component of India’s economic development and employment generation.

questions.question: Where is the headquarters of the International Solar Alliance located?
questions.explanation: The International Solar Alliance (ISA), launched jointly by India and France at COP21 in Paris in 2015, has its headquarters in Gurugram, India. With 123 Member and Signatory Countries, the ISA focuses on promoting solar energy as a clean and affordable source of power worldwide. Its initiatives emphasise supporting Least Developed Countries and Small Island Developing States, where energy access challenges are most acute. By facilitating cooperation with global institutions, ISA works toward large-scale deployment of solar solutions, enabling sustainable development, reducing carbon emissions, and contributing significantly to global climate action efforts.

questions.question: In which state was a public hearing held for the 1,200MW Kalai-II hydroelectric project?
questions.explanation: The 1,200MW Kalai-II hydroelectric project is located in Anjaw district of Arunachal Pradesh, where a public hearing was conducted by the state’s Pollution Control Board to secure environmental clearance. With an investment of around Rs 14,000 crore, the project is being developed by THDC India Ltd and is designed as a run-of-river with pondage hydroelectric scheme. It is expected to generate free power worth Rs 318 crore annually, contributing significantly to both the state’s energy output and its revenue. This project highlights Arunachal Pradesh’s vast hydropower potential and its importance in India’s renewable energy landscape.

questions.question: Which country has been verified by WHO for eliminating rubella, marking a major milestone in the South-East Asia Region?
questions.explanation: Nepal has achieved a landmark public health milestone by being verified for eliminating rubella, also known as German measles. This recognition by the World Health Organization highlights Nepal’s strong immunization campaigns and health system efforts. Rubella is a contagious viral disease that can lead to rashes, fever, and swollen lymph nodes, and while often mild, it poses serious risks to pregnant women, including congenital defects in newborns. The elimination was made possible largely due to the widespread use of the measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine. This milestone strengthens regional progress toward ending measles and rubella by 2026.

questions.question: Which airline signed an MoU with Indian Oil for the supply of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) to reduce carbon emissions?
questions.explanation: Air India has entered into a collaboration with Indian Oil to promote sustainable aviation practices through the use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF). This partnership is significant as Indian Oil recently became the first Indian company to achieve ISCC CORSIA certification for SAF production at its Panipat Refinery, meeting international emission standards. The agreement between Air India and Indian Oil marks an important step in reducing the carbon footprint of India’s aviation sector. It highlights the industry’s commitment to adopting greener technologies, aligning with global environmental goals, and contributing toward long-term climate sustainability.

questions.question: In which state is the Khavda Solar Energy Project, where NTPC Green commissioned 49 MW in August 2025, located?
questions.explanation: The Khavda Solar Energy Project is situated in Bhuj, Gujarat, where NTPC Green Energy Ltd has begun commercial supply of 49 MW as part of its broader 300 MW solar initiative. Earlier phases of 142.2 MW and 32.8 MW were also made operational in June 2025, highlighting steady progress in the project’s rollout. Gujarat has been a leading state in India’s renewable energy sector due to its favorable geography and policy support. This development underlines NTPC Green’s commitment to expanding its clean energy portfolio, aligning with India’s long-term renewable energy and sustainability goals.

questions.question: In which state was the first Green Hydrogen plant inaugurated?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh marked a significant milestone in India’s clean energy journey with the inauguration of its first Green Hydrogen plant in Gorakhpur by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Developed by Torrent Power and Torrent Gas, the plant is designed to produce 72 tonnes of green hydrogen annually. This hydrogen will be blended with natural gas and distributed to households, CNG stations, and industries, making it the largest blending initiative in India’s City Gas Distribution sector. The project not only enhances the adoption of green hydrogen but also aligns with India’s larger vision of sustainable energy and reducing dependence on fossil fuels.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the next US Ambassador to India and Special Envoy for South and Central Asia by Donald Trump?
questions.explanation: Sergio Gor, a long-time aide to Donald Trump, has been appointed as the next US Ambassador to India and Special Envoy for South and Central Asia. At just 38, Gor brings a diverse background, having been born in Uzbekistan, lived in Malta, and later migrated to the US. His career includes roles with John McCain, Rand Paul, and eventually joining Trump’s political circle. He co-founded Winning Team Publishing with Donald Trump Jr. and played a central role in Trump’s second term as Director of Presidential Personnel. His dual appointment signals Trump’s strategic shift in US-India relations amid growing trade and geopolitical tensions.

questions.question: In which country was the 23rd AIBD General Conference, where India was elected Chairman of the Executive Board, held?
questions.explanation: The 23rd General Conference of the Asia-Pacific Institute for Broadcasting Development (AIBD) was hosted in Phuket, Thailand, from 19–21 August 2025. During this event, India was elected as the Chairman of the AIBD Executive Board with the highest number of votes, marking a return to leadership after last serving in 2016. The conference carried the theme “Media for People, Peace & Prosperity,” bringing together global broadcasting stakeholders to deliberate on content collaboration, media development, and policy exchange. Hosting the conference in Thailand reinforced its role as a hub for regional cooperation in media and broadcasting development.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new ex officio member of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) by the RBI ahead of the October 2025 policy meeting?
questions.explanation: Indranil Bhattacharyya, Executive Director of the Reserve Bank of India, has been appointed as the newest ex officio member of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), replacing Rajiv Ranjan ahead of the October 2025 policy meeting. With over 28 years of experience in central banking, Bhattacharyya has played a significant role in monetary policy formulation, having also served as Executive Director of the Department of Economic and Policy Research. His international experience at the Qatar Central Bank and academic background from JNU further strengthen his expertise. His appointment ensures continuity and expertise in the RBI’s critical policy-making body.

questions.question: Which institution released the report titled “Rethinking Homestays: Navigating Policy Pathways” in collaboration with IAMAI?
options: Internet and Mobile Association of India
questions.explanation: NITI Aayog, in partnership with the Internet and Mobile Association of India (IAMAI), launched the report “Rethinking Homestays: Navigating Policy Pathways” on 22 August 2025. The report presents a comprehensive roadmap to strengthen India’s homestay and BnB ecosystem by balancing cultural authenticity, economic opportunity, and sustainable tourism practices. It emphasises creating light-touch regulatory frameworks, promoting public–private collaboration, and encouraging digital empowerment for scaling the sector. By positioning homestays as both cultural bridges and economic drivers, the report highlights their role in rural job creation, heritage preservation, and boosting India’s tourism growth in alignment with inclusive development goals.

questions.question: How many nations are participating in SEMICON India 2025 at Yashobhoomi, New Delhi?
questions.explanation: SEMICON India 2025, scheduled from September 2–4 at Yashobhoomi in New Delhi, is India’s largest semiconductor and electronics showcase. The event will host participation from 33 nations, along with 350 exhibitors and 50+ global industry leaders. With the theme “Building the Next Semiconductor Powerhouse,” it aims to strengthen India’s position in the global semiconductor ecosystem. The event will feature high-profile keynotes, roundtables, and discussions on supply chain resilience, sustainability, and advanced chip manufacturing. By attracting international collaboration and highlighting India’s growing semiconductor mission, the participation of 33 nations underlines its strategic importance in the global electronics sector.

questions.question: In which city did Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurate ₹5,200 crore worth of development projects, including metro extensions and the Kona Expressway?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for development projects worth over ₹5,200 crore in Kolkata, West Bengal, on 22 August 2025. The initiatives included major metro network extensions such as the Noapara–Jai Hind Bimanbandar line for direct airport access, the Sealdah–Esplanade line reducing travel time drastically, and the Beleghata–Hemanta Mukhopadhyay section enhancing IT hub connectivity. Alongside these, he laid the foundation for the six-lane elevated Kona Expressway, expected to boost trade, tourism, and logistics. These projects highlight Kolkata’s transformation into a modern urban mobility hub while strengthening its historical role in India’s economic development.

questions.question: Which state has become India’s first fully digitally literate state under the Digi Kerala project?
questions.explanation: Kerala has been declared India’s first fully digitally literate state after successfully completing Phase I of the Digi Kerala project. The initiative reached 1.5 crore individuals across 83.46 lakh families, identifying 21.88 lakh digitally illiterate persons and training 21.87 lakh of them with a remarkable 99.98% success rate. What makes this achievement historic is the inclusiveness of the program, ensuring participation across age groups, including a 104-year-old trainee. By leveraging grassroots governance and community-led training, Kerala has empowered its citizens to access e-governance portals, welfare schemes, and digital financial services, effectively bridging the digital divide.

questions.question: Who has been re-elected as the President of the Advertising Agencies Association of India (AAAI) for 2025-26?
questions.explanation: Srinivasan K Swamy, Executive Group Chairman of R K Swamy Ltd, has been re-elected as the President of the Advertising Agencies Association of India (AAAI) for 2025-26. This marks his fourth term as AAAI President, coinciding with the association’s 80th anniversary of representing the advertising industry in India. Swamy, a veteran leader in the advertising and communications sector, is recognised for his influential role in advancing collaboration, ethical practices, and policy advocacy. His prior leadership experience (2004–2007) and continued industry influence ensure strong guidance for AAAI as it navigates challenges and opportunities in the digital era.

questions.question: Which bank became the first public sector bank in India to migrate its corporate website to the secure ‘.bank.in’ domain?
questions.explanation: Punjab National Bank (PNB) has become the first public sector bank in India to migrate its corporate website to the highly secure ‘.bank.in’ domain, complying with the RBI’s directive on enhancing cybersecurity in the banking sector. This transition was supported by the Institute for Development and Research in Banking Technology (IDRBT), ensuring stronger digital security and trust in online banking services. The initiative highlights PNB’s commitment to safeguarding customer data and adapting to modern technological advancements. With its roots established by Dyal Singh Majithia and Lala Lajpat Rai, PNB continues to uphold its legacy under the leadership of MD & CEO Ashok Chandra.

questions.question: Which Indian cricketer, known as "India’s Modern Wall," retired from all forms of cricket on August 24, 2025?
questions.explanation: Cheteshwar Pujara, India’s dependable No. 3 Test batsman, announced his retirement from all formats of cricket on August 24, 2025. Often called “India’s Modern Wall,” he carried forward the legacy of Rahul Dravid by playing long, patient innings and providing stability to the Indian batting lineup. With 103 Test matches, 7,195 runs, and 19 centuries, Pujara is India’s 8th highest run-scorer in Test history. His most memorable performance came during the 2018–19 Test series in Australia, where he scored 521 runs and played a pivotal role in India’s historic first-ever series win there. His retirement signifies the end of an era of classical Test batting.

questions.question: Which company announced plans to open its first India office in New Delhi in 2025?
questions.explanation: OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT, has announced that it will establish its first office in India in New Delhi later in 2025. This marks a significant step in its global expansion and aligns closely with India’s national initiative, the IndiaAI Mission, which promotes inclusive and trusted AI development. India is ChatGPT’s second-largest market and among the top five developer hubs worldwide, making it a strategic choice for OpenAI’s first South Asian office. The Delhi hub will focus on supporting students, developers, educators, and enterprises by expanding AI accessibility, fostering collaborations with academic and industry stakeholders, and contributing to AI-powered solutions in areas like governance, agriculture, and recruitment. This move highlights India’s growing role as a global AI powerhouse.

questions.question: What was the total value of India’s seafood exports in FY2024–25?
questions.explanation: India’s seafood exports for FY2024–25 recorded a total value of USD 7.45 billion, reflecting a slight increase from USD 7.38 billion the previous year. Despite the growth in value, the overall export volume declined to 16.98 lakh tonnes from 17.81 lakh tonnes, showing challenges in international market demand and supply chain dynamics. Frozen shrimp continued to dominate, contributing USD 5.17 billion and nearly 70% of the total earnings, consolidating India’s global leadership in shrimp exports. The United States remained the largest buyer, followed by China, the European Union, Southeast Asia, Japan, and the Middle East, highlighting India’s wide-reaching seafood trade network.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Deputy National Security Advisor (NSA) to Prime Minister Narendra Modi?
questions.explanation: Anish Dayal Singh, a 1988-batch IPS officer of the Manipur cadre and former CRPF chief, has been appointed as the Deputy National Security Advisor (NSA) to Prime Minister Narendra Modi. With a distinguished career in internal security, counter-insurgency, and intelligence, Singh brings over three decades of experience to his new role. He previously led the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) and the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF), where he implemented major initiatives like the establishment of Forward Operating Bases in Naxal-affected areas, election security management, and restructuring of battalions for better operational efficiency. His expertise strengthens India’s security framework under NSA Ajit Doval, enhancing inter-agency coordination and strategic planning.

questions.question: Which organization successfully tested the maiden Integrated Air Defence Weapon System (IADWS) off the Odisha coast?
questions.explanation: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) successfully carried out the maiden test of the Integrated Air Defence Weapon System (IADWS) off the Odisha coast. This advanced system integrates multiple cutting-edge defence technologies, including the Quick Reaction Surface-to-Air Missile (QRSAM), Very Short Range Air Defence System (VSHORADS), and a laser-based Directed Energy Weapon (DEW). The system is centrally managed through a Command & Control Centre developed by the Defence Research and Development Laboratory (DRDL). Additionally, VSHORADS and DEW were developed by Research Centre Imarat (RCI) and the Centre for High Energy Systems and Sciences (CHESS), marking a significant step in strengthening India’s air defence capabilities.

questions.question: In which state did the CISF launch its first all-women commando unit?
questions.explanation: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) launched its first all-women commando unit in Madhya Pradesh, marking a major step towards strengthening gender inclusivity in paramilitary forces. The training for this unit is being conducted at the Regional Training Centre in Barwaha, where 30 women personnel are undergoing an intensive 8-week advanced course. The training modules include physical fitness, advanced weapons handling, live-fire drills, rappelling, and survival techniques. Once trained, these women commandos will be deployed in Quick Reaction Teams (QRTs) and Special Task Forces (STFs), enhancing the force’s operational capabilities while promoting women’s empowerment in security services.

questions.question: Which state emerged as the overall champion in the first Khelo India Water Sports Festival held at Dal Lake, Srinagar?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh secured the top position in the first-ever Khelo India Water Sports Festival, which took place over three days at Dal Lake in Srinagar. The state dominated water sports, particularly kayaking and canoeing, where it won all four gold medals. In total, Madhya Pradesh bagged 18 medals, comprising 10 gold, 3 silver, and 5 bronze, making it the clear champion. Odisha followed with 10 medals, while Kerala secured the third spot with seven. The event was organised by the Sports Authority of India (SAI) and the J&K Sports Council, marking a significant milestone in promoting water sports in India.

questions.question: Which state government announced a ₹1 crore life insurance cover for municipal staff and ₹20 lakh cover for outsourced workers in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Government of Andhra Pradesh, under the leadership of Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu, launched a welfare initiative on August 23, 2025, during the Swachh Andhra–Swarna Andhra campaign in Peddapuram, Kakinada district. The scheme provides a ₹1 crore life insurance cover for municipal staff and a ₹20 lakh cover for outsourced workers in case of accidental death or permanent disability. Additionally, education assistance of up to ₹8 lakh will be offered for their children. This initiative not only ensures financial and educational support for vulnerable civic workers but also reflects the government’s vision of inclusive governance and its commitment to building “Swarna Andhra” (Golden Andhra Pradesh).

questions.question: What is the name of the U.S. Air Force’s secretive spaceplane, also known as the Orbital Test Vehicle (OTV)?
questions.explanation: The X-37B, officially known as the Orbital Test Vehicle (OTV), is a highly secretive U.S. spaceplane developed initially by NASA and later managed by Boeing for the Department of Defense. Operated today by the U.S. Space Force, the X-37B has carried out multiple classified missions since its first launch in 2010. Measuring around 9 meters in length with a 4.5-meter wingspan, it resembles a mini space shuttle and features a payload bay comparable to a small pickup truck bed. Its standout capability is reusability and endurance, with the ability to remain in orbit for over 900 days. The program is widely believed to test advanced space technologies, materials, and sensors, potentially serving as a platform for future space dominance in an era of growing strategic competition.

questions.question: Which state launched the 11-week ‘Swachh Kurukshetra – Mera Kurukshetra, Mera Abhimaan’ cleanliness mission?
questions.explanation: Haryana launched the 11-week-long ‘Swachh Kurukshetra – Mera Kurukshetra, Mera Abhimaan’ mission under the leadership of Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini. The campaign, held from August 24 to November 7, 2025, aims to transform Kurukshetra into the cleanest and most beautiful city in India. The launch event took place at Gita Gyan Sansthanam, Kurukshetra, where citizens and officials pledged their commitment to cleanliness. A campaign poster was also unveiled. This initiative is part of the larger Haryana Shehr Swachhta Abhiyan – 2025, designed to promote sustainable cleanliness practices and foster civic pride across the state.

questions.question: To which country has India temporarily suspended its international postal services starting August 25, 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s Department of Posts announced the suspension of international postal services to the United States of America from August 25, 2025. This decision came after the U.S. government, under Executive Order 14324, revoked the de minimis exemption that previously allowed imports valued up to USD 800 to enter duty-free. The new rules impose customs duties on all shipments, with only gift items up to USD 100 exempt. Airlines handling mail shipments to the U.S. refused carriage due to the lack of operational clarity, forcing India to halt most postal categories. Letters, documents, and low-value gifts remain permitted, but broader services are suspended until systems stabilise.

questions.question: Who clinched the gold medal in the women’s 48kg category at the Commonwealth Weightlifting Championships 2025 in Ahmedabad?
questions.explanation: Mirabai Chanu achieved a remarkable comeback by winning gold in the women’s 48kg category at the Commonwealth Weightlifting Championships 2025 held in Ahmedabad. She lifted a total of 193kg, which included 84kg in snatch and 109kg in clean & jerk, setting new Commonwealth records in each segment as well as in the overall total. This outstanding performance not only secured her the gold medal but also guaranteed her direct qualification for the Glasgow 2026 Commonwealth Games. Chanu’s victory further strengthens her position as one of India’s most celebrated athletes in international weightlifting.

questions.question: Which country signed a Letter of Intent with the World Food Programme to supply fortified rice globally in 2025?
questions.explanation: India signed a Letter of Intent (LoI) with the World Food Programme (WFP) on August 25, 2025, to supply fortified rice to crisis-hit regions worldwide. Fortified rice, enriched with vital nutrients such as iron, folic acid, and vitamin B12, plays a crucial role in addressing hidden hunger caused by nutrient deficiencies. India’s agricultural surplus makes it a dependable global supplier, and this step strengthens its humanitarian commitment under the principle of Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam, meaning "the world is one family." The partnership not only ensures immediate food aid but also enhances long-term global food security, reinforcing India’s leadership role in combating hunger.

questions.question: In which city did PM Modi launch projects worth ₹5,400 crore at Khodaldham Ground?
questions.explanation: PM Modi inaugurated and laid the foundation of projects worth ₹5,400 crore at Khodaldham Ground in Ahmedabad. These projects aim to significantly boost Gujarat’s connectivity and infrastructure, including metro networks, modern bus services, and the addition of 3,000 km of new rail tracks with complete electrification. The redevelopment of Sabarmati Ashram is also a major highlight, envisioned as a global symbol of peace and heritage. The projects further cover diverse sectors such as urban development, energy, roads, and railways, reflecting a holistic approach to modernizing Ahmedabad and enhancing its role as a key hub for growth and progress.

questions.question: Who has taken charge as the MD & CEO of IndusInd Bank for a three-year term until August 2028?
questions.explanation: Rajiv Anand has been appointed as the new MD & CEO of IndusInd Bank, beginning his three-year tenure that will run until August 2028. His assumption of leadership marks a significant transition for the bank, as it has also led to the dissolution of the previously established 'Committee of Executives' and the 'Oversight Committee of the Board.' With Anand at the helm, the bank is expected to focus on stability, growth, and strategic reforms, signaling a fresh chapter in its leadership and governance framework aimed at strengthening operational efficiency and long-term performance.

questions.question: At which naval base will the Indian Navy commission the stealth frigates INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri on 26 August 2025?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy will commission the advanced Project 17A stealth frigates INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri on 26 August 2025 at the Naval Base in Visakhapatnam. This dual commissioning, overseen by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, is historic as it marks the simultaneous induction of two frontline surface combatants built at different shipyards—Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd. (Mumbai) and Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers (Kolkata). With enhanced stealth features, modern propulsion systems, and advanced weapons, these ships embody India’s Aatmanirbhar Bharat vision in defence production. Their induction into the Eastern Fleet at Visakhapatnam strengthens maritime readiness and reinforces India’s strategic focus on the eastern seaboard.

questions.question: Which country is hosting the first Art & Culture Festival from September 5–27, 2025?
questions.explanation: The first Art & Culture Festival is being organised in Nepal from September 5–27, 2025, across multiple venues including Kathmandu, Bhaktapur, Kirtipur, Lalitpur, and Hadigaon. This 22-day event coincides with the traditional Indra Jatra celebrations at Basantpur Durbar Square, where the Living Goddess Kumari, Ganesh, and Bhairav are taken out on wooden chariots. By linking the festival with a vibrant cultural tradition, Nepal aims to attract both domestic and international visitors, highlighting its rich heritage and diverse artistic expressions while boosting cultural tourism in the region.

questions.question: In which country did the Indian women shooters sweep the 25m pistol junior individual medals at the Asian Shooting Championship?
questions.explanation: The Indian women’s shooting team showcased an outstanding performance at the Asian Shooting Championship held in Shymkent, Kazakhstan. In the 25m pistol junior individual event, Payal Khatri won gold, Naamya Kapoor secured silver, and Tejaswani earned bronze, completing a clean sweep of the podium. Additionally, the trio also won gold in the team event, further cementing India’s dominance in the competition. Beyond this, Bhowneesh Mendiratta secured a silver medal in the men’s trap, while Neeru Dhanda and Aashima Ahlawat brought home gold and bronze respectively in the women’s trap, highlighting India’s rising stature in shooting sports.

questions.question: Which space agency unveiled the new CHAPEA Mars habitat to simulate year-long missions?
questions.explanation: NASA has introduced the second CHAPEA (Crew Health and Performance Exploration Analog) habitat, a 1,700 sq. ft. 3D-printed structure designed to simulate Mars mission conditions. The initiative involves four crew members living in isolation for a full year to replicate the challenges of long-duration space missions. Participants will conduct scientific experiments, grow vegetables, maintain the habitat, and engage in simulated spacewalks. The program is crucial for assessing the physical and psychological impacts of extended missions, providing vital insights for future human exploration of Mars. NASA’s step highlights its commitment to preparing astronauts for interplanetary travel.

questions.question: On which date is Women’s Equality Day observed every year in the United States?
questions.explanation: Women’s Equality Day is observed annually in the United States on August 26, commemorating the certification of the 19th Amendment in 1920, which granted American women the constitutional right to vote. This day not only celebrates the historical victory of women securing suffrage after decades of activism, including the efforts initiated at the Seneca Falls Convention of 1848, but also serves as a reminder of ongoing struggles. Issues such as wage inequality, underrepresentation of women in leadership, and barriers in healthcare and education highlight the importance of continued advocacy. August 26 remains a powerful symbol of progress and unfinished work toward gender equality.

questions.question: Which state’s High Court became the first in India to publish guidelines on the use of AI in the district judiciary?
questions.explanation: The Kerala High Court has taken a pioneering step by becoming the first in India to publish a comprehensive set of guidelines on the adoption of AI in the district judiciary. This initiative focuses on using AI responsibly to support judicial efficiency while ensuring safeguards against misuse. AI tools can assist in case management by sorting, tagging, and prioritizing matters, thereby reducing the administrative burden on court staff. This complements earlier efforts such as the Supreme Court’s AI tool SUPACE, which helps judges identify relevant precedents. Kerala’s move marks an important milestone in integrating technology with justice delivery.

questions.question: Which city hosted the Global Spiritual Conclave aimed at boosting spiritual tourism?
questions.explanation: The Global Spiritual Conclave was held in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, with the objective of promoting spiritual tourism, preserving cultural heritage, and encouraging dialogue on responsible hospitality. Organised by the Tourism Department with support from the Ministry of Tourism, the event was inaugurated by Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat in the presence of Chief Minister Mohan Yadav. Ujjain, being one of India’s most significant spiritual and cultural centers, was chosen as the venue to highlight its heritage and potential as a global hub for spiritual tourism, making the conclave an important step in strengthening India’s cultural tourism landscape.

questions.question: Where did the Suru Summer Festival 2025 begin with a rare August snowfall?
questions.explanation: The Suru Summer Festival 2025 was held in Suru Valley, Ladakh, and became historic due to an unprecedented August snowfall. This rare climatic event transformed the festival into a snow festival, attracting global attention and highlighting Ladakh’s unpredictable yet fascinating environment. The inauguration was graced by Union Minister Kiren Rijiju as the Chief Guest and Lieutenant Governor Kavender Gupta as the Guest of Honour. The snowfall not only enhanced the natural beauty of Ladakh but also underlined the region’s distinct cultural and environmental identity, making the festival a remarkable and unforgettable celebration.

questions.question: Under NHAI’s ‘Project Aarohan, which group is the primary beneficiary of scholarships and mentorship support?
questions.explanation: ‘Project Aarohan, launched by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI), is designed to support the educational aspirations of toll plaza employees children. The program, unveiled in New Delhi by Chairman Shri Santosh Kumar Yadav, provides scholarships, mentorship, and skill-building opportunities for students from marginalised and economically weaker sections. With an initial fund of ₹1 crore for 2025–26, the initiative covers 500 students from Class 11 to graduation and offers higher scholarships to 50 exceptional students pursuing post-graduation. Beyond financial assistance, the project also emphasises mentorship, career guidance, and skill development, ensuring holistic growth and preparing beneficiaries for future success.

questions.question: Which country partnered with the United States to launch the largest-ever Super Garuda Shield exercise in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Super Garuda Shield is a major military exercise jointly conducted by the United States and Indonesia. It originated in 2007 as a bilateral drill between the two nations’ armies and later expanded into a multinational exercise in 2022, involving numerous Indo-Pacific allies such as Japan, Australia, Singapore, and several others. The 2025 edition is described as the largest ever, highlighting Indonesia’s central role in organizing and hosting the exercise alongside the U.S. This collaboration demonstrates Indonesia’s strategic significance in regional security and its growing involvement in multinational defence cooperation.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new CEO of Nayara Energy?
questions.explanation: Teymur Abasguliyev, a senior executive from SOCAR Turkiye Enerji A.Ş., has been appointed as the new CEO of Nayara Energy. His appointment follows the exit of Alessandro Des Dorides and other European executives, who stepped down due to European Union sanctions linked to Nayara Energy’s association with Rosneft. An Azerbaijan national, Abasguliyev is an experienced professional with a background in finance and energy, having worked at PricewaterhouseCoopers and served as CFO at SOCAR Turkiye Enerji A.Ş. His leadership is expected to provide stability for Nayara Energy, which operates one of India’s largest private refineries and a vast retail fuel network.

questions.question: Which country has set a target of attracting 1 million Indian tourists annually by enhancing connectivity and promoting luxury travel?
questions.explanation: Oman has announced its ambitious plan to attract one million Indian tourists annually, building on the 700,000 visitors from India in 2024. This initiative highlights the nation’s strategy to strengthen cultural and economic ties with India while diversifying its economy beyond oil revenues under Vision 2040. Recognising India as a priority market, Oman is focusing on high-value tourism segments such as luxury travel, destination weddings, MICE events, and adventure tourism. To support this, Oman has improved visa policies, enhanced air connectivity with major Indian cities, and launched promotional campaigns like ‘Focus Oman,’ showcasing its natural landscapes and cultural heritage.

questions.question: On which date is International Dog Day celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: International Dog Day is observed annually on August 26 to honour the invaluable role of dogs in human life. Founded in 2004 by animal welfare advocate Colleen Paige, the date was chosen because it marked the day her family adopted their first rescue dog, “Sheltie.” The celebration highlights dogs’ contributions as loyal companions, working partners in law enforcement, therapy, and rescue missions. It also spreads awareness about adoption, discourages unethical breeding, and emphasises dog welfare worldwide. By dedicating this day, people are encouraged to adopt shelter dogs and honour the selfless service dogs provide in society.

questions.question: Which country launched its first national guidelines for animal blood banks to improve veterinary healthcare and biosafety?
questions.explanation: India has introduced its first-ever national guidelines for animal blood banks, marking a major milestone in veterinary healthcare. Issued by the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying on 25 August 2025, the framework establishes standards for donor screening, blood typing, biosafety, and ethical practices in animal blood transfusion. These guidelines address the lack of structured protocols that often led to risks during emergency transfusions. By promoting voluntary donation, establishing state-level blood banks, and creating a digital network for real-time tracking, India is advancing animal welfare. The integration of the One Health approach further strengthens links between human, animal, and environmental health.

questions.question: Which state government is set to launch the ‘No Helmet, No Fuel’ road safety campaign from September 1, 2025?
questions.explanation: The ‘No Helmet, No Fuel’ campaign is being launched by the Uttar Pradesh government as a proactive measure to improve road safety. Running from September 1 to 30, 2025, the campaign mandates that fuel stations across the state will refuse to provide fuel to two-wheeler riders who are not wearing helmets. This initiative aims to promote responsible behavior among riders, reduce road accident fatalities, and enforce the importance of helmet use. The directive has been structured for coordinated implementation under the supervision of District Magistrates and District Road Safety Committees (DRSCs), ensuring effective enforcement across Uttar Pradesh.

questions.question: At which location did the ‘RAN SAMWAD-2025’ tri-service dialogue begin?
questions.explanation: The ‘RAN SAMWAD-2025’ tri-service dialogue was inaugurated at the Army War College in Madhya Pradesh. This important event brings together representatives from the Army, Navy, and Air Force to deliberate on critical issues of war, warfare, and warfighting. Organised under the guidance of the Chief of Defence Staff, it is curated by HQ Integrated Defence Staff and the Centre for Joint Warfare Studies (CENJOWS). The dialogue aims to enhance communication, foster interaction, and improve cooperation among military communities. Hosting the event in Madhya Pradesh underscores the state’s strategic significance as the home of the Army War College.

questions.question: Which country has passed a law banning mobile phones in school classrooms starting from March 2026?
questions.explanation: South Korea has enacted a new law that prohibits the use of mobile phones in classrooms beginning in March 2026. The measure is designed to address rising concerns over youth social media addiction and its negative impact on academic performance and mental well being. With nearly all citizens connected digitally, the country faces increasing challenges related to overexposure among students, including anxiety and sleep disruption. By formalising previously informal rules at a national level, the legislation applies across primary, middle, and high schools, with exceptions only for students with disabilities or educational purposes, marking a major step toward healthier learning environments.

questions.question: On which date is World Lake Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Lake Day is observed annually on August 27 to highlight the importance of conserving and sustainably managing lakes, which are crucial freshwater ecosystems. Lakes provide drinking water, support agriculture and industry, and are home to diverse species that sustain ecological balance. They also play a vital role in regulating climate, acting as carbon sinks, and mitigating extreme weather impacts. Economically, they support fisheries, tourism, and livelihoods. However, lakes worldwide face threats from pollution, climate change, and unsustainable practices. By designating August 27 as World Lake Day, the UN encourages global awareness, cooperation, and restoration efforts to protect these vital ecosystems.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new non-executive chairman of J&K Bank till March 2028, subject to RBI approval?
questions.explanation: J&K Bank has appointed veteran banker S Krishnan as its new non-executive chairman, with the appointment valid until March 2028 pending RBI approval. With over 40 years of experience in the banking sector, Krishnan has previously served as the Managing Director & CEO of Punjab & Sind Bank and Tamilnad Mercantile Bank, and is currently an Independent Director on the J&K Bank board. His extensive expertise in governance, compliance, and financial inclusion makes him a strategic choice to strengthen J&K Bank’s oversight and align with national banking standards, while also boosting investor confidence during its ongoing reforms.

questions.question: Which test launch of SpaceX’s Starship was recently completed successfully from Texas?
questions.explanation: SpaceX achieved a significant milestone by completing its 10th successful test launch of the Starship vehicle from its Starbase facility in Texas. This fully reusable two stage launch system, comprising the Super Heavy booster and the Starship upper stage, demonstrated controlled splashdowns, re-ignition in space, and payload deployment with Starlink simulators. These advancements strengthen SpaceX’s vision of sustainable, affordable space travel and are critical for future deep space missions. The test provided valuable data for NASA’s Artemis III lunar mission scheduled in 2027, highlighting Starship’s role as the designated lunar lander and paving the way for future Moon and Mars exploration.

questions.question: By which year is India projected to become the world’s second largest economy in PPP terms, according to the EY report?
questions.explanation: India is projected to become the world’s second largest economy in purchasing power parity (PPP) terms by 2038, with an estimated GDP of USD 34.2 trillion. This milestone will be driven by multiple factors including a youthful demographic profile, strong domestic demand, and high savings rates that fuel capital formation. Additionally, India’s declining debt-to-GDP ratio, coupled with structural reforms such as GST, IBC, UPI-led financial inclusion, and production-linked incentives, will support sustainable growth. Investments in infrastructure, renewable energy, and emerging technologies further strengthen this trajectory, positioning India as a global growth engine and a key player in the future economic landscape.

questions.question: Till which year has the lending under the PM SVANidhi Scheme been extended after the recent restructuring by the Union Cabinet?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet has approved the restructuring of the PM SVANidhi Scheme and extended its lending operations till 31 March 2030. This extension provides a longer financial window for street vendors and small businesses to access affordable credit. With a total outlay of ₹7,332 crore, the scheme also introduces features like UPI-linked RuPay Credit Cards for eligible beneficiaries and digital cashback incentives to promote digital transactions. Additionally, coverage is widened beyond statutory towns to include census towns and peri-urban areas, thereby ensuring greater inclusivity and long term support for grassroots entrepreneurship.

questions.question: With which continent did India’s trade surpass USD 100 billion in 2024–25?
questions.explanation: India’s trade with Africa reached a historic milestone of over USD 100 billion in 2024–25, reflecting deepening economic and strategic ties between the two regions. This achievement nearly doubles the USD 56 billion recorded in 2019–20, underscoring rapid growth in commerce and investment. India has invested more than USD 75 billion in Africa since 1996, positioning itself among the continent’s top five investors. Beyond trade, India has extended concessional loans, grant aid, and thousands of scholarships to African students. These efforts, coupled with collaboration in renewable energy and disaster resilient infrastructure, showcase a strong and expanding partnership rooted in mutual development.

questions.question: In which city did Punjab National Bank inaugurate its first startup focused branch?
questions.explanation: Punjab National Bank (PNB) inaugurated its first startup focused branch in New Delhi to encourage entrepreneurship and innovation. The branch has been set up under the framework of the Startup India initiative, which promotes the growth of startups across the country. This specialised branch aims to offer comprehensive financial solutions, tailored banking facilities, and advisory services for entrepreneurs. By situating it in the national capital, PNB intends to provide easier access to resources, credit, and financial support, strengthening the startup ecosystem and contributing to the growth of emerging businesses in India.

questions.question: In which country will India deploy over 700 personnel to participate in ‘Exercise Bright Star 2025’?
questions.explanation: India will be sending over 700 troops to Egypt for ‘Exercise Bright Star 2025,’ one of the largest multilateral military exercises in the Middle East and North Africa. Initially launched in 1980 as a bilateral drill between Egypt and the United States, Bright Star has since grown into a major tri-service exercise involving multiple nations. India’s participation, with personnel from the Army, Navy, and Air Force, will focus on integrated drills, live firing, cyber warfare modules, and command post exercises. This deployment enhances India’s defence diplomacy, boosts interoperability with global partners, and underscores its commitment to regional peace and stability.

questions.question: How many members are part of the National Designated Authority (NDA) set up to regulate India’s carbon market?
questions.explanation: The National Designated Authority (NDA) for carbon markets has been constituted with 21 members as a statutory body under the Environment Ministry. It is chaired by the Environment Secretary and includes representatives from key ministries like External Affairs, Steel, Renewable Energy, Power, and NITI Aayog. The creation of this 21-member body is a mandatory step under Article 6 of the Paris Agreement, which was further finalised at COP29 in Baku (2024). The NDA will serve as the nodal regulator, overseeing India’s participation and compliance in global carbon markets.

questions.question: The BNHS recently signed an MoU with which state government for the eco-restoration of the Ujani reservoir wetland?
questions.explanation: The Bombay Natural History Society (BNHS) partnered with the Maharashtra Water Resources Department through an MoU to restore the Ujani reservoir wetland. Located on the Bhima river in western Maharashtra, this man made wetland at Bhigwan is an important ecological zone. It has been recognised as an Important Bird Area (IBA) under the Central Asian Flyway, serving as a crucial habitat for migratory birds. Apart from ecological importance, the wetland also plays a vital role in supporting agriculture, hydropower generation, drinking water supply, and fisheries in the region, making its restoration a priority for sustainable development.

questions.question: By what percentage did India’s Index of Industrial Production (IIP) grow in July 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s Index of Industrial Production (IIP) recorded a 3.5% year-on-year growth in July 2025, improving from 1.5% in June 2025. The growth was primarily driven by a strong 5.4% rise in manufacturing, which offset a sharp -7.2% decline in mining. Electricity output saw a marginal rise of 0.6%. Within manufacturing, sectors such as basic metals, electrical equipment, and non-metallic mineral products showed notable increases, with growth rates of 12.7%, 15.9%, and 9.5% respectively. This industrial performance highlights resilience in key sectors like infrastructure and consumer goods, reflecting positive momentum in India’s overall economic landscape.

questions.question: Which company announced a $3.43 billion investment in a new aluminium smelter and coal power plant?
questions.explanation: National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO), a public sector enterprise under the Ministry of Mines, has announced an investment of ₹300 billion (~$3.43 billion) to establish a new aluminium smelter in Odisha and a coal-based power plant. This five-year investment plan will be financed through a combination of debt and internal accruals. Of the total, ₹180 billion is dedicated to the smelter while ₹120 billion is earmarked for the power plant. The project aims to strengthen India’s aluminium production capacity, reduce dependence on imports, and create thousands of jobs. Odisha’s rich bauxite reserves and industrial base make it an ideal location for this strategic expansion.

questions.question: With which country did India sign an MoU to strengthen cooperation in agriculture and allied sectors?
questions.explanation: India and Bhutan signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) in Thimphu to enhance cooperation in agriculture and allied sectors, reflecting their strong bilateral ties. The agreement was signed by Devesh Chaturvedi, Secretary of India’s Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare, and Thinley Namgyel, Secretary of Bhutan’s Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock. Key areas of collaboration include agricultural research, livestock health, post-harvest management, food processing, and climate-resilient practices. A Joint Technical Working Group (JTWG) was also formed to oversee implementation and ensure timely results. This MoU strengthens food security, rural development, and South-South cooperation between India and Bhutan.

questions.question: Which institution performed India’s first robotic laser cataract surgery?
questions.explanation: Army Hospital Research and Referral (AHRR) achieved a historic milestone by becoming India’s first government institute and South Asia’s second to perform robotic custom laser cataract surgery. The breakthrough was made possible using the advanced ALLY Adaptive Cataract Treatment System, which allows for bladeless, computer-guided, and highly precise eye surgery. The hospital’s Ophthalmology Department has now entered the domain of robotic and laser-assisted cataract surgery, known as FLACS. This innovation not only showcases India’s progress in adopting cutting-edge medical technologies but also enhances patient safety, precision, and outcomes in complex eye procedures.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the IMF Executive Director for a three-year term starting August 28, 2025?
questions.explanation: Former RBI Governor Urjit Patel has been appointed as Executive Director at the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for a three-year term beginning on August 28, 2025. Patel, who served as the 24th Governor of the Reserve Bank of India from September 2016 to December 2018, brings vast experience in central banking, economic reforms, and global finance. His tenure at RBI witnessed significant events such as demonetisation, the implementation of GST, and debates on central bank autonomy. Now, as IMF Executive Director, Patel will represent India and other nations in his constituency, strengthening India’s voice in international financial policymaking.

questions.question: In which city were the new ‘U-Special’ buses for college students launched?
questions.explanation: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta inaugurated a new fleet of ‘U-Special’ buses in New Delhi, reviving a service once popular among Delhi University students. These electric, air-conditioned buses are equipped with CCTV cameras and panic buttons, ensuring both comfort and safety. The initiative reflects a dual commitment—supporting student welfare by easing their daily commute while also advancing sustainable public transport in the capital. Beyond buses, the CM also addressed student concerns over recent Delhi Metro fare hikes and promised to explore concession passes. This integrated approach demonstrates efforts to create a safer, more affordable, and environmentally conscious transit system.

questions.question: Where was MILMEDICON 2025 inaugurated by Raksha Rajya Mantri Sanjay Seth?
questions.explanation: MILMEDICON 2025, an international conference on military medicine, was inaugurated by Raksha Rajya Mantri Sanjay Seth on 28 August 2025 at the Manekshaw Centre in New Delhi. Organised by the Directorate General of Medical Services (Army), the event focused on advanced trauma care, AI in military medicine, and the centenary of the Military Nursing Service. The conference served as a global platform, attracting participation from more than 15 countries, where experts discussed innovations in battlefield medicine, women’s evolving role in combat healthcare, and emergency medical strategies. Hosting the event in New Delhi highlighted India’s commitment to advancing military healthcare and fostering international collaboration.

questions.question: On which date is National Sports Day 2025 celebrated in India?
questions.explanation: National Sports Day in India is celebrated every year on August 29 to honour the birth anniversary of Major Dhyan Chand, the legendary hockey player widely known as the “Hockey Wizard.” In 2025, the day carries the theme “Sport to Promote Peaceful and Inclusive Societies,” highlighting the unifying power of sports. The celebration emphasises physical fitness, teamwork, and inclusivity while aligning with global Olympic values like friendship, respect, and equality. As part of the observance, the Fit India Mission organises nationwide events, fitness drives, and community programs to encourage citizens to actively participate in sports and adopt healthier lifestyles.

questions.question: Which country launched its first National Biofoundry Network under the BioE3 Policy in 2025?
questions.explanation: In 2025, India launched its first National Biofoundry Network (NBN) under the BioE3 Policy, a landmark initiative to drive indigenous biomanufacturing and strengthen the country’s biotechnology ecosystem. This network, comprising six premier institutions, is designed to provide end-to-end solutions from research and design to prototyping, testing, and scaling biotech innovations. With a strong focus on synthetic biology, gene editing, climate-smart agriculture, and green biotechnology, the initiative aims to achieve a $300 billion bioeconomy by 2030. It will also generate employment, foster youth-led innovation, and position India as a global hub for sustainable biotechnology and entrepreneurship.

questions.question: Which organization partnered with the School Education Department to integrate MBU status with the UDISE+ system?
questions.explanation: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has partnered with the Department of School Education to link the Mandatory Biometric Update (MBU) status of Aadhaar-linked school children with the UDISE+ system. UDISE+ (Unified District Information System for Education Plus) is a critical database managed by the Department of School Education & Literacy under the Ministry of Education. By integrating MBU status, the collaboration ensures better monitoring of children’s biometric updates and helps maintain more accurate educational records. This initiative strengthens the linkage between Aadhaar and educational data, ultimately improving governance, efficiency, and accountability in the school system.

questions.question: Which company signed a 15-year LNG supply agreement with ADNOC for the Ruwais project?
questions.explanation: The agreement was signed between ADNOC and Indian Oil Corporation for a 15-year period. Under this deal, ADNOC will supply 1 million tonnes per annum of liquefied natural gas (LNG) from its Ruwais LNG project. This agreement highlights India’s strategic move to secure long-term energy supplies, ensuring steady availability of cleaner fuel for its growing economy. LNG deliveries will reach multiple ports across India, strengthening the nation’s energy infrastructure and security while supporting the transition toward lower-carbon energy sources. This partnership also reflects growing international energy collaborations between the UAE and India.

questions.question: In which state was India’s first full-scale OSAT semiconductor facility inaugurated?
questions.explanation: India inaugurated its first full-scale Outsourced Semiconductor Assembly and Test (OSAT) facility in Sanand, Gujarat, marking a pivotal milestone in the country’s semiconductor roadmap. The facility, developed by CG Semi, was inaugurated by Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel. With investments exceeding ₹7,600 crore, Gujarat is positioning itself as the "Silicon State of India," driving semiconductor manufacturing, job creation, and talent development. This OSAT plant will handle chip assembly, packaging, and testing, playing a critical role in India’s self-reliance strategy under the India Semiconductor Mission. The project also reflects strong global industry collaboration and academic partnerships.

questions.question: Which state will host the Filmfare Awards 2025 for the second consecutive year?
questions.explanation: Gujarat has been selected to host the 70th edition of the Filmfare Awards in 2025, making it the second year in a row for the state to organize this prestigious event. The decision follows the successful hosting of the 2024 ceremony at GIFT City in Gandhinagar. An MoU was signed between Gujarat Tourism Corporation and Worldwide Media (WWM) to facilitate the arrangements. The Filmfare Awards are among the most celebrated platforms recognizing artistic and technical excellence in Hindi cinema. Hosting such an event strengthens Gujarat’s position as a growing hub for cultural and entertainment activities.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with the Department of Posts to implement the DIGIPIN digital addressing system in India?
questions.explanation: The Department of Posts, under the Ministry of Communications, has collaborated with MapmyIndia to implement DIGIPIN, India’s new digital addressing system. DIGIPIN, short for Digital PIN, assigns unique geocodes to every address, enabling precise geolocation, seamless navigation, and efficient service delivery. MapmyIndia, as India’s leading geospatial technology provider, will supply base maps, integrate real-time address generation, and embed DIGIPIN navigation tools into its Mappls platform. This initiative is expected to transform logistics, e-governance, and digital service ecosystems by offering citizens accurate addresses, businesses optimised supply chains, and governments improved planning and public service delivery.

questions.question: On which date is National Small Industry Day 2025 observed in India?
questions.explanation: National Small Industry Day is observed every year on August 30 to honour and recognise the vital contributions of small-scale industries in India’s growth journey. These industries are considered the backbone of the economy, as they significantly contribute to GDP, exports, employment generation, and inclusive development. The day has been celebrated since 2001 following a government initiative that sought to strengthen small businesses through better infrastructure, timely payments, and technology access. Observing this day highlights the importance of promoting entrepreneurship, preserving cultural skills, and bridging rural-urban divides in India’s industrial ecosystem.

questions.question: Which Indian IT company has partnered with Mastercard to integrate Mastercard Move into its Finacle platform for faster cross-border payments?
questions.explanation: Infosys has partnered with Mastercard to strengthen global cross-border payment solutions by integrating Mastercard Move into its Finacle banking platform. Mastercard Move is a portfolio of advanced money transfer capabilities that supports real-time, secure, and scalable transactions across more than 200 countries and 150 currencies. By embedding this system within Infosys Finacle, financial institutions can reduce integration complexities, improve payment speed and reliability, and enhance risk management. This collaboration highlights the growing role of digital payments in banking, while also supporting the increasing global demand for remittances, particularly in Asia, where India is a leading beneficiary of cross-border money flows.

questions.question: What was India’s GDP growth rate in Q1 FY26 (April–June 2025)?
questions.explanation: India’s GDP growth in Q1 FY26 stood at 7.8%, marking a strong performance that exceeded both RBI and market expectations. This growth was significantly higher than the 6.5% recorded in Q1 FY25, showcasing resilience in the economy despite global uncertainties. The services sector emerged as the top performer with 9.3% growth, followed by robust rebounds in manufacturing and construction. Agriculture also played a vital role, growing at 3.7% due to a favorable monsoon. Strong government spending and increased investments further boosted the economy, while private consumption remained relatively subdued. This growth reflects India’s strong macroeconomic fundamentals.

questions.question: Which company has launched a dedicated Artificial Intelligence and Services Transformation Unit and appointed Amit Kapur as its head?
questions.explanation: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), India’s largest IT services firm, has launched a new Artificial Intelligence and Services Transformation Unit to strengthen its AI-led business strategy. This unit aims to consolidate TCS’ existing AI capabilities, create domain-specific AI solutions, drive IT operational efficiency, and enhance partnerships in the AI ecosystem. Amit Kapur, a seasoned TCS leader with over 20 years of experience and prior head of the UK & Ireland business, has been appointed as the unit’s head. The move positions TCS as a frontrunner in India’s IT industry, setting a benchmark for rivals while accelerating AI adoption for global clients.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the Nuakhai harvest festival primarily celebrated?
questions.explanation: The Nuakhai festival is one of the most important cultural and agrarian celebrations of Odisha, particularly in the western region of the state. Observed annually on the panchami tithi of the Bhadraba month, it symbolises the first consumption of the newly harvested rice after offering it to the deity. The festival emphasises gratitude for agricultural abundance, family unity, and community bonding. Rich in rituals such as Beheren, Lagna Dekha, and Bali Paka, Nuakhai is not just about harvest but also cultural identity, marked by traditional Sambalpuri attire, folk dances like Dalkhai and Rasakeli, and vibrant social gatherings across Odisha.

questions.question: Which company is building a solar project in Kutch that will be three times the size of Singapore?
questions.explanation: Reliance Industries is spearheading one of the world’s largest clean energy transformations by setting up massive solar, hydrogen, and battery gigafactories in Jamnagar and Kutch. The company’s solar project in Kutch, covering 550,000 acres (about three times the size of Singapore), is designed to become a national powerhouse capable of meeting nearly 10% of India’s electricity needs. Alongside, Reliance is establishing battery and electrolyser gigafactories to drive large-scale renewable energy production. These initiatives not only position Reliance as a leader in clean energy but also aim to make India a global hub for green hydrogen and its derivatives.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana approved to provide financial aid for women’s self-employment?
questions.explanation: The Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana was recently approved by the Bihar government under the leadership of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. The scheme is designed to empower women by providing an initial financial grant of ₹10,000 directly into their bank accounts, ensuring transparency through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT). After six months, successful beneficiaries may receive further assistance of up to ₹2 lakh to expand their ventures. It encourages women to engage in small-scale businesses such as dairy, handicrafts, and retail, while also creating local market spaces for them. The initiative aims to enhance livelihoods, reduce migration, and boost rural entrepreneurship in Bihar.

questions.question: Who won first place in the Zurich Diamond League 2025 men’s javelin event with a season-best throw of 91.51m?
questions.explanation: At the Zurich Diamond League Final 2025, Germany’s Julian Weber emerged victorious in the men’s javelin event with a commanding performance, registering two throws over 90m, including his winning 91.51m effort. This season-best throw secured him the top spot ahead of India’s Neeraj Chopra, who finished second with 85.01m, and Trinidad & Tobago’s Keshorn Walcott, who claimed third with 84.95m. Weber’s dominance highlighted his exceptional form, with consistent strong throws across the competition. The event also extended Neeraj Chopra’s incredible streak of 26 consecutive top-two finishes, underlining his consistency, while Weber’s performance reaffirmed his standing as a world-class javelin thrower.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of the Victims of Enforced Disappearances observed every year?
questions.explanation: The International Day of the Victims of Enforced Disappearances is observed annually on August 30, drawing attention to one of the most serious violations of human rights. Enforced disappearance involves the abduction or detention of individuals by state authorities or their agents, followed by a refusal to acknowledge their whereabouts, leaving them outside legal protection. This practice causes immense suffering not only to the victims but also to their families and communities. The United Nations General Assembly officially designated August 30 for this observance in 2010, with the aim of promoting accountability, justice, and global awareness of such grave violations.

questions.question: Where will BioFach India 2025 be held, bringing together organic producers, buyers, businesses, and policymakers?
questions.explanation: BioFach India 2025 is scheduled to take place at the India Expo Centre and Mart in Greater Noida. The event is a key platform for the organic sector, featuring participation from more than 27 Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) from India’s North-Eastern Region under the Mission Organic Value Chain Development program. It will provide opportunities for farmers to showcase their organic products, connect with buyers, and engage with businesses and policymakers. Such exhibitions play a vital role in promoting sustainable agriculture, enhancing market access for farmers, and shaping future strategies for the organic sector in India.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as India’s new High Commissioner to Canada in 2025?
questions.explanation: Dinesh K Patnaik, a 1990-batch officer of the Indian Foreign Service, has been appointed as India’s High Commissioner to Canada, signaling a diplomatic reset between the two nations. The appointment comes after strained ties in 2023 following allegations related to the Nijjar controversy. Patnaik’s experience as Ambassador to Spain, Cambodia, and Morocco, along with his roles in the UK and ICCR, positions him to handle sensitive negotiations effectively. His parallel appointment alongside Christopher Cooter as Canada’s envoy to India reflects a joint effort to normalise relations, restore diplomatic channels, and revitalise cooperation in trade, education, and migration.

questions.question: Where was the two-day national conference of the SC-ST Parliamentary Committee inaugurated by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla?
questions.explanation: The national conference of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Parliamentary Committee was inaugurated by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla in Bhubaneswar. This event is notable because it is the first time such a conference is being held outside the national capital. The theme of the conference focuses on the role of parliamentary and legislative committees in advancing the welfare, development, and empowerment of SCs and STs. Hosting the conference in Bhubaneswar signifies a step toward decentralization and inclusivity, aiming to strengthen dialogue, representation, and policymaking for marginalised communities at a regional level.

questions.question: Who won the gold medal in the Men’s 25m Standard Pistol individual event at the 16th Asian Shooting Championship in Shymkent, Kazakhstan?
questions.explanation: Gurpreet Singh secured the gold medal in the Men’s 25m Standard Pistol individual event at the 16th Asian Shooting Championship held in Shymkent, Kazakhstan. His performance was part of India’s impressive outing, where the country achieved a ‘double gold.’ In addition to his individual success, Gurpreet Singh, along with Amanpreet Singh and Harsh Gupta, won the gold medal in the team event of the same category. These victories further underline India’s growing dominance in shooting sports, with additional gold medals also being won in the 50m Rifle Prone Junior team and 25m Standard Pistol Junior team events.

questions.question: Which country's submersible, Nautile, was used by Indian aquanauts for a dive in the Atlantic Ocean as part of the Samudrayaan Project preparations?
questions.explanation: Two Indian aquanauts undertook a dive into the Atlantic Ocean aboard France’s submersible Nautile as part of preparatory work for the Samudrayaan Project. Samudrayaan is India’s first human deep-sea mission under the Deep Ocean Mission, aiming to send three humans in Matsya-6000 to a depth of 6,000 meters by 2027. France is among the few nations with advanced manned deep-sea exploration capabilities, alongside the US, Russia, China, and Japan. By collaborating with France, India strengthens its technological expertise in oceanography and submersible design, particularly in preparation for developing Matsya-6000, a vital component of its strategic deep-sea exploration goals.

questions.question: With which international economic organization has India signed the Terms of Reference (ToR) to launch negotiations on a Free Trade Agreement (FTA)?
questions.explanation: India has signed the Terms of Reference (ToR) with the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU) to initiate negotiations on a Free Trade Agreement. Established in 2015 and headquartered in Moscow, the EAEU includes Armenia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, and Russia. The bloc ensures free movement of goods, services, capital, and labor while promoting regional economic integration. For India, this engagement holds immense significance by providing access to a USD 6.5 trillion market, enhancing energy security, and strengthening trade diversification beyond the US and EU. It also supports India’s connectivity initiatives such as the INSTC and Chennai–Vladivostok Corridor, paving the way for long-term strategic cooperation.

questions.question: Which tech company launched the AI photo editing tool originally codenamed “Nano Banana,”?
questions.explanation: Google introduced its next-generation AI photo editing tool, initially known as “Nano Banana” and later released as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image. Developed by Google DeepMind, this tool leverages natural language prompts to simplify complex editing tasks such as character consistency, design mixing, and image merging. It allows users to edit photos creatively by changing hairstyles, adding costumes, or merging multiple photos into a single coherent frame. Accessible through the Gemini app, Google AI Studio, and Vertex AI, the tool is affordable and designed for both casual users and enterprise developers, showcasing Google’s leadership in AI-powered creativity.

questions.question: Which country was struck by Typhoon Kajiki, leading to extensive flooding, crop losses, and fatalities?
questions.explanation: Typhoon Kajiki struck the coastal provinces of Vietnam, causing severe flooding, major crop losses, and multiple deaths. The storm originated over the Philippines, intensified over the South China Sea, and impacted China and Vietnam as a Category 2 storm on the Saffir-Simpson scale. Vietnam, a Southeast Asian country with its capital in Hanoi, is bordered by China, Laos, Cambodia, and the South China Sea. Key rivers like the Mekong and the Red River support its agriculture, while the Annamite Cordillera forms a prominent mountain range. Vietnam’s vulnerability to tropical cyclones makes such natural disasters highly destructive.

questions.question: What was the purpose of ISRO’s first Integrated Air Drop Test (IADT-1) for the Gaganyaan mission?
options: To test the orbital module propulsion system
To test the human-rated launch vehicle
questions.explanation: The IADT-1 was designed to validate the parachute-based deceleration system of the Crew Module for the Gaganyaan mission. Ensuring safe landing is a critical component of human spaceflight. This test was carried out with the collaboration of ISRO, DRDO, the Indian Air Force, Indian Navy, and Indian Coast Guard. It ensured that the parachutes and deceleration systems worked in real-world conditions to guarantee astronaut safety during re-entry and landing.

questions.question: With which country did India recently hold the 2+2 Intersessional Dialogue to advance a new 10-year defence framework and strengthen Indo-Pacific cooperation?
questions.explanation: India recently held the 2+2 Intersessional Dialogue with the United States to review and enhance their strategic partnership. This dialogue serves as a mid-cycle review of the broader 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue, which was first launched between India and the US in 2018. The meeting focused on boosting defence production, trade, and energy security while reinforcing cooperation under the US-India COMPACT framework. Both nations reaffirmed their commitment to a free, open, and prosperous Indo-Pacific, working closely through the Quad along with Japan and Australia. The initiative is particularly significant as India prepares to host the 2025 Quad Leaders Summit.

questions.question: Where was India’s first mobile tempered glass factory inaugurated in 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s first-ever mobile tempered glass factory was inaugurated in Noida on August 30, 2025, by Union Minister of Electronics and IT Shri Ashwini Vaishnaw. The facility, established by Optiemus Electronics in collaboration with Corning Incorporated, USA, will manufacture tempered glass under the premium “Engineered by Corning” brand. This milestone strengthens the Make in India and Atmanirbhar Bharat initiatives by reducing import dependence and creating jobs. With an initial investment of ₹70 crore, the plant begins with a 25-million-unit annual capacity and 600 jobs, while a planned ₹800 crore Phase 2 expansion is expected to significantly boost production and employment.

questions.question: Which country will send its first official pickleball team to the World Cup in the USA?
questions.explanation: India is set to make history by sending its first official pickleball team to the World Cup in Florida, scheduled from October 27 to November 2. The Indian Pickleball Association (IPA) organised two-day national selection trials in Ahmedabad, with more than 140 players competing across Open, U-16, and 50+ categories. Following the trials, the selected players will undergo specialised high-performance training to prepare for the international challenge. The tournament is sanctioned by the Global Pickleball Federation, marking a significant step in India’s growing engagement with this fast-emerging sport.

questions.question: In which region was the rare dragonfly species Crocothemis erythraea recently reconfirmed?
questions.explanation: The rare dragonfly species Crocothemis erythraea has been reconfirmed in the Western Ghats, specifically in the high-altitude Shola forests and montane grasslands of Kerala and Tamil Nadu. This rediscovery is significant because the species, usually found in Europe, Central Asia, and the Himalayas, was earlier misidentified due to its resemblance to the more common Crocothemis servilia. Scientists believe it may have reached South India during the Ice Age and survived in cooler highland habitats. The finding emphasises the Western Ghats’ status as a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the world’s top biodiversity hotspots, highlighting urgent conservation needs.

questions.question: In which state will India’s first Multi-Lane Free Flow (MLFF) tolling system be implemented?
questions.explanation: India’s first Multi-Lane Free Flow (MLFF) tolling system will be implemented at the Choryasi Fee Plaza on NH-48 in Gujarat. This advanced tolling technology eliminates physical barriers, using FASTag, RFID readers, and Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) cameras for seamless, electronic toll collection. The system reduces congestion, saves travel time, lowers fuel consumption, and cuts vehicle emissions while ensuring transparent toll revenue collection. The initiative was formalised through an agreement between Indian Highways Management Company Limited (IHMCL), promoted by NHAI, and ICICI Bank. Gujarat thus becomes the first state to pioneer this barrier-free tolling system in India.

questions.question: Which Indian state ranks fifth in electric bus adoption and plans to expand its fleet to over 1,000?
questions.explanation: Odisha has secured the fifth position in India for electric bus adoption, currently operating 450 e-buses as part of its clean transport initiative. The state has ambitious plans to expand its fleet to more than 1,000 buses, strengthening its role as a green mobility leader in Eastern India. With urban operations already running in Bhubaneswar, Cuttack, and Puri, Odisha plans to extend services to cities such as Sambalpur, Jharsuguda, Keonjhar, Berhampur, and Angul. The initiative is supported by modern infrastructure, including charging stations and smart ticketing systems, aligning with India’s broader push toward sustainable urban transportation.

questions.question: Which tech company has partnered with the International Cricket Council (ICC) to promote women’s cricket globally?
