questions.explanation: The International Cricket Council (ICC) has entered into a strategic partnership with Google to enhance the global visibility and accessibility of women’s cricket. This collaboration leverages Google’s wide range of products, including Android, Google Gemini, Google Pay, and Google Pixel, to provide fans with live updates, highlights, personalised content, and localised experiences. With the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 in India and Sri Lanka, and the Women’s T20 World Cup 2026 in England and Wales approaching, this alliance is expected to significantly boost fan engagement, inspire younger audiences, and foster greater participation in women’s cricket worldwide.

questions.question: When will India observe National Nutrition Week in 2025?
questions.explanation: National Nutrition Week 2025 in India will be observed from September 1 to 7 with the theme “Eat Right for a Better Life.” The initiative highlights the importance of balanced diets, mindful eating, portion control, and reducing junk food intake. It is aligned with government programs such as POSHAN Abhiyaan and the Mid-Day Meal Scheme, aiming to address malnutrition and promote healthier lifestyles across the country. The week-long observance will include workshops, health camps, and awareness drives, reinforcing India’s broader commitment to achieving Zero Hunger and ensuring nutritional security for its citizens.

questions.question: What is the name of India’s first AI-powered tribal language translator launched by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs?
questions.explanation: Adi Vaani is India’s first AI-powered translator designed specifically for tribal languages. Launched by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, this innovative platform aims to preserve and promote India’s diverse linguistic heritage while ensuring cultural equity and digital inclusion. India is home to 461 tribal languages, many of which are endangered, and Adi Vaani provides tools like text-to-text, speech-to-speech, text-to-speech, and OCR for manuscript preservation. Initially supporting Santali, Bhili, Mundari, and Gondi, the platform is scalable to cover more dialects. Developed by a consortium of premier institutes including IIT Delhi, Adi Vaani ensures tribal communities actively participate in the nation’s digital transformation.

questions.question: Which organization became the first Indian NGO to win the 2025 Magsaysay Award?
questions.explanation: Educate Girls, an NGO founded by Safeena Husain in 2007, has been honoured with the 2025 Magsaysay Award, often regarded as Asia’s Nobel Prize for social impact. This milestone makes it the first Indian NGO ever to win this prestigious recognition. The organization has dedicated itself to enrolling out-of-school girls, ensuring their retention in classrooms, and working toward breaking the intergenerational cycle of poverty. The award ceremony is scheduled for November 7 in Manila, where recipients from countries like the Maldives and the Philippines will also be recognised for their contributions to society.

questions.question: Which country has been ranked as Asia’s safest in the 2025 Global Peace Index?
questions.explanation: In the 2025 Global Peace Index, Singapore has been recognised as Asia’s safest country, securing the 6th position worldwide. Despite dropping one spot from the previous year, Singapore’s overall peace score improved to 1.357, reflecting its strong governance, social stability, and effective safety measures. The Global Peace Index, compiled by the Institute for Economics and Peace, evaluates 163 nations on parameters such as societal safety, conflict levels, and militarisation. Within Asia, Singapore led the rankings ahead of Japan, Malaysia, and Bhutan. Globally, Iceland retained the top spot as the most peaceful nation, while India ranked 115th.

questions.question: In which state was the joint high-altitude exercise Achook Prahar conducted by the Indian Army and ITBP?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army and the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) successfully carried out the high-altitude exercise Achook Prahar in Arunachal Pradesh. This exercise was conducted under simulated combat conditions to test interoperability, layered defence systems, and rapid response mechanisms in the eastern sector. It highlighted the preparedness of the armed forces to respond to potential challenges in difficult terrains. The exercise also follows earlier integrated drills such as Prachand Prahar and Poorvi Prahar conducted in the same region, reinforcing India’s strategic focus and operational readiness along its eastern borders.

questions.question: Which country signed a $267 million deportation deal with Nauru for relocating non-visa holders?
questions.explanation: Australia signed a $267 million deal with Nauru to manage the relocation of non-visa holders. The arrangement involves a significant financial commitment, including an upfront payment of A$408 million and an annual payment of A$70 million for managing deportees. Nauru, a small Pacific island nation, has long been central to Australia’s offshore refugee processing system. The deal came in the wake of a 2023 High Court ruling in Australia that ended indefinite detention practices. While Australia views the deal as a migration control measure, it has been heavily criticized by human rights groups for potentially breaching international refugee protection laws.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the 29th Controller General of Accounts (CGA) of India in September 2025?
questions.explanation: Ms. T.C.A. Kalyani, a 1991-batch officer of the Indian Civil Accounts Service (ICAS), has been appointed as the 29th Controller General of Accounts (CGA) of India on September 1, 2025. With over 34 years of experience in public finance, governance, and digital transformation, she has contributed significantly to initiatives such as Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) for fertilizers, digital reforms in MTNL, and financial restructuring of key PSUs. She has also held critical roles across ministries including Defence, Finance, and Home Affairs. As CGA, Ms. Kalyani will oversee central government accounts, financial reporting, and reforms, while advancing transparency and efficiency. Her appointment also marks a step forward for women’s representation in top financial leadership roles within the Indian government.

questions.question: In which state did the Indian Army conduct the Yudh Kaushal 3.0 exercise?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army successfully conducted the Yudh Kaushal 3.0 exercise in Arunachal Pradesh’s high-altitude terrain, demonstrating its preparedness for modern multi-domain warfare. The drill emphasised the integration of cutting-edge technologies, drone-based surveillance, precision strikes, and AI-enabled operational concepts. Specialised units like ASHNI platoons were deployed to showcase tactical agility and innovation. The exercise also highlighted India’s Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative by incorporating domestically developed defence technologies. Alongside Yudh Kaushal 3.0, a parallel exercise named Achook Prahar was conducted to test inter-agency coordination with the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), reinforcing joint operational effectiveness in challenging border regions.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Air Officer-in-Charge Maintenance at the Indian Air Force Headquarters?
questions.explanation: Air Marshal Sanjiv Ghuratia, AVSM, VSM, has taken charge as the Air Officer-in-Charge Maintenance (AOM) at the Indian Air Force Headquarters. With a distinguished service career spanning 37 years, he is recognised for his deep technical expertise and leadership in aviation logistics and maintenance. Commissioned in 1988 in the Aeronautical Engineering branch, he has pursued higher studies at institutions such as BITS Pilani, Madras University, and Bhopal University. He has also served on the UN mission in Congo and received commendations for his contributions. Decorated with the Vishisht Seva Medal and the Ati Vishisht Seva Medal, his appointment underscores the IAF’s focus on technical excellence and operational readiness.

questions.question: What is the new FDI limit announced for India’s insurance sector under the 2025 amendment rules?
questions.explanation: The Indian government has announced a landmark reform by allowing 100% Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in the insurance sector, replacing the previous 74% cap. This change is part of the Indian Insurance Companies (Foreign Investment) Amendment Rules, 2025, and aims to attract significant foreign capital into the sector. The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) will oversee the verification of such investments under the automatic route to ensure transparency. The reform is expected to encourage global insurers to enter the Indian market, foster innovation, strengthen competition, and provide much-needed capital. With India’s insurance industry projected to grow at 7.1% annually, this move is positioned to accelerate expansion and modernization.

questions.question: What is the name of the new commando battalions being raised by the Indian Army to enhance strike capabilities?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army is raising five new commando battalions named "Bhairav" to significantly boost its strike capabilities. Each battalion will consist of 250 soldiers selected from existing infantry units. These specialised units are being deployed with the objective of strengthening India’s response along sensitive borders with China and Pakistan while also relieving the Para-Special Forces from certain operational pressures. The Bhairav battalions will be equipped with cutting-edge technology, including drones, surveillance systems, and tactical gadgets. They are planned to be strategically stationed across the Northern Command, the western desert region, and the eastern hilly terrain to ensure rapid and effective responses.

questions.question: Which city will host the Badminton World Championships in August 2026?
questions.explanation: New Delhi has been selected to host the prestigious Badminton World Championships in August 2026. This marks a significant event for India, as the country will organise the tournament after a gap of 17 years, the last time being in Hyderabad in 2009. The official announcement was made during the closing ceremony of the 2025 Paris championships, where the symbolic handover took place involving the BWF president, the French federation chief, and the Badminton Association of India’s general secretary. Hosting this championship highlights India’s growing stature in global badminton and showcases New Delhi as a major international sports destination.

questions.question: Which Indian state will receive the 16th-century Vrindavani Vastra on loan from the British Museum in 2027?
questions.explanation: The 16th-century Vrindavani Vastra, a silk tapestry crafted under the guidance of Srimanta Sankardeva, will be loaned to Assam by the British Museum in 2027. This masterpiece, originally commissioned by Koch king Nara Narayan, portrays episodes from the life of Lord Krishna and reflects the rich Vaishnavite heritage of Assam. The textile represents a unique blend of spirituality and artistic excellence, deeply rooted in the cultural identity of the region. Acquired by the British in 1904, its return, even as a loan, underscores growing global discussions on the repatriation of cultural artefacts to their places of origin.

questions.question: Where was the 25th Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) Summit 2025 held, which was attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi?
questions.explanation: The 25th Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) Summit in 2025 was held in Tianjin, China, from August 31 to September 1. Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the summit and emphasised India’s vision for SCO under three strategic pillars: Security, Connectivity, and Opportunity. His address focused on combating terrorism, enhancing regional connectivity through projects like the Chabahar Port and the International North-South Transport Corridor (INSTC), and promoting innovation and cultural exchanges. He also proposed a Civilizational Dialogue Forum to strengthen people-to-people ties. The summit highlighted India’s commitment to regional stability, counter-terrorism cooperation, and reforms in global governance to reflect current geopolitical realities.

questions.question: On which date is World Coconut Day celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: World Coconut Day is celebrated annually on September 2 to highlight the cultural, nutritional, and economic significance of coconuts worldwide. The observance marks the founding of the Asian Pacific Coconut Community (APCC) in 1969, which plays a crucial role in coordinating research, development, and trade among major coconut-producing nations like India, Indonesia, the Philippines, and Sri Lanka. Coconuts are essential to tropical economies, providing food, beverages, health products, and raw materials for crafts and industries. In India, states like Kerala, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka lead in coconut production, and the Coconut Development Board organises events, exhibitions, and awards to commemorate the day.

questions.question: What is Morgan Stanley’s revised GDP growth forecast for India for FY26?
questions.explanation: Morgan Stanley has upgraded India’s GDP growth forecast for FY26 to 6.7%, revising it upward from the earlier estimate of 6.2%. The decision is driven by India’s strong 7.8% GDP growth in Q1, reflecting robust private and government consumption, healthy investment momentum, and supportive agricultural output due to a good monsoon. Additionally, impending GST cuts and the festive season are expected to further boost domestic demand. While external headwinds such as weaker exports and higher US tariffs pose challenges, these are likely to be offset by resilient rural consumption and front-loaded government expenditure, strengthening India’s growth trajectory.

questions.question: Which Indian state plans to celebrate the Bathukamma festival in the style of Rio Carnival to attract international tourists?
questions.explanation: Telangana has announced plans to celebrate the Bathukamma festival on the lines of Brazil’s Rio Carnival, aiming to draw international tourists to the state. Bathukamma is a floral festival dedicated to goddess Gowri, where women create beautiful floral arrangements and participate in vibrant cultural festivities. This year, the celebrations will begin on the 21st at the Thousand Pillar Temple in Warangal. The state also aspires to set a Guinness World Record for the largest gathering of women. By promoting Bathukamma globally, Telangana seeks to showcase its rich cultural heritage and boost tourism opportunities.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) in September 2025?
questions.explanation: Rajit Punhani, a 1991-batch IAS officer of the Bihar cadre, has been appointed as the new CEO of the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) from September 1, 2025. With over three decades of administrative experience, he has served in diverse roles at the Centre, state governments, and international platforms. His contributions include spearheading pension and insurance schemes for unorganised workers, reforming indirect taxes leading to the GST framework, and launching health initiatives such as the world’s largest maternal messaging program. His leadership at FSSAI comes at a crucial time as India focuses on food safety reforms, regulatory modernization, and public health priorities.

questions.question: What is the name of India’s first fully indigenous 32-bit microprocessor developed for space missions?
questions.explanation: Vikram-3201 is India’s first fully indigenous 32-bit microprocessor, developed jointly by ISRO’s Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre (VSSC) and the Semiconductor Laboratory (SCL) in Mohali. Fabricated using a 180 nm CMOS process, it marks a leap in India’s semiconductor self-reliance under the Atmanirbhar Bharat mission. The processor succeeds the earlier 16-bit Vikram-1601, bringing enhanced processing power, floating-point computation, and resilience to extreme temperatures, vibration, and radiation. It also supports the Ada programming language, crucial for aerospace systems. Successfully tested onboard the PSLV-C60 mission, this milestone positions India as a rising power in chip design and space-grade semiconductor technology.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as India’s new Ambassador to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) in 2025?
questions.explanation: Dr. Deepak Mittal has been appointed as India’s new Ambassador to the United Arab Emirates (UAE), succeeding Sunjay Sudhir, who retires in September 2025. A 1998-batch Indian Foreign Service officer, Dr. Mittal has extensive diplomatic experience, including key postings in the Prime Minister’s Office and as India’s Ambassador to Qatar. He was also pivotal in initiating India’s first formal diplomatic contact with the Taliban in 2021. His appointment comes at a crucial time, as the UAE remains one of India’s most important partners in West Asia, with strong ties in energy, trade, diaspora welfare, defence, and strategic cooperation.

questions.question: On which date is Skyscraper Day observed annually to honour the legacy of Louis Sullivan, the father of skyscrapers?
questions.explanation: Skyscraper Day is celebrated every year on September 3, coinciding with the birth anniversary of Louis H. Sullivan, who is regarded as the “father of skyscrapers.” The day is dedicated to recognizing the innovation, engineering brilliance, and architectural creativity that made these towering structures possible. Skyscrapers symbolise progress, efficient urban planning, and cultural pride by transforming skylines and redefining city identities. Iconic towers like the Petronas Towers, The Shard, and others exemplify this legacy. By celebrating on September 3, the world pays tribute to Sullivan’s architectural vision while also acknowledging the continuing evolution of skyscraper design and urban innovation.

questions.question: Which city secured the top rank as the safest city for women in India according to the NARI 2025 report?
questions.explanation: Kohima, the capital of Nagaland, was ranked as the safest city for women in India in the NARI 2025 report released by the National Commission for Women (NCW). The rankings were based on feedback from 12,770 women across 31 major cities and considered parameters like workplace safety, trust in authorities, harassment reporting, and night-time mobility. Kohima’s first-place ranking highlights the strong safety culture, community vigilance, and gender inclusivity present in Nagaland. Along with Aizawl and Gangtok, the Northeast region showcased a dominant presence in the top five, reflecting its positive approach toward women’s security and urban well-being.

questions.question: Which country’s students will benefit from the 1,000 e-scholarships announced by India for the academic year 2025–26?
questions.explanation: India has extended 1,000 e-scholarships to Afghan students for the academic year 2025–26 under the Special Scholarship Scheme for Afghan Nationals (SSSAN). The scholarships will be facilitated through the e-VidyaBharati (e-VB) i-learn portal, allowing Afghan youth to pursue undergraduate and postgraduate courses from Indian universities entirely online. This initiative supports education, capacity building, and long-standing people-to-people ties between India and Afghanistan. It is particularly significant given Afghanistan’s ongoing socio-political challenges that have disrupted its education system. By continuing this scholarship programme for the third consecutive year, India reaffirms its commitment to Afghan human resource development and regional goodwill.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the 14th edition of Exercise MAITREE between India and Thailand being conducted in 2025?
questions.explanation: The 14th edition of Exercise MAITREE between the Indian Army and the Royal Thai Army began on September 1, 2025, at the Joint Training Node (JTN) in Umroi, Meghalaya. This exercise, first initiated in 2006, is aimed at improving interoperability, trust, and joint operational capabilities in counter-terrorism and semi-urban warfare. India is represented by the Madras Regiment, while Thailand has deployed personnel from the 1st Infantry Battalion, 14th Infantry Brigade. With training modules covering tactical drills, arms handling, and UN Charter-based operations, the exercise highlights the deepening defence cooperation between India and Thailand in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: Which company received safety clearance from DGCA for ground handling operations?
questions.explanation: DGCA granted safety clearance to Air India SATS Airport Services Pvt Ltd, making India only the second country in the Asia Pacific region after Malaysia to adopt this robust ICAO-aligned safety framework. This clearance highlights the country’s commitment to enhancing aviation safety standards by strengthening safety management systems (SMS) and ensuring stricter regulatory oversight in ground handling operations. Such a move ensures operational efficiency, passenger safety, and compliance with global standards, reinforcing Air India SATS’ reputation as a reliable ground-handling service provider in India’s rapidly growing aviation sector.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the Bihar Rajya Jeevika Nidhi Saakh Sahkari Sangh Limited launched by PM Modi?
options: Credit access for rural women entrepreneurs
questions.answer: Credit access for rural women entrepreneurs
questions.explanation: The Bihar Rajya Jeevika Nidhi Saakh Sahkari Sangh Limited was launched with the core aim of providing credit access for rural women entrepreneurs through a digital, transparent, and affordable financial model. With an initial infusion of ₹105 crore, the cooperative seeks to empower over 20 lakh women by enabling them to start or expand income-generating activities in small businesses, agriculture, and rural services. Unlike microfinance institutions that often charge high interest, this initiative offers low-interest loans directly into beneficiaries’ bank accounts. It strengthens Bihar’s self-help group ecosystem, enhances financial inclusion, and aligns with women-led development schemes like Lakhpati Didi and Bank Sakhi.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Kapas Kisan App launched by Union Textiles Minister Giriraj Singh?
options: Train rural youth in digital literacy
questions.explanation: The Kapas Kisan App was launched to empower cotton farmers by digitizing the Minimum Support Price (MSP) procurement process. It provides farmers with a transparent and farmer-first platform where they can self-register, book delivery slots, and track payments in real time. By cutting out middlemen and reducing paperwork delays, the app ensures timely transactions and prevents distress sales, protecting farmers from volatile market conditions. Supporting multiple Indian languages, the app is designed for inclusivity and ease of use. This initiative not only enhances farmer welfare but also aligns with Digital India and agri-tech innovation goals to modernise the cotton sector.

questions.question: Which state has increased its power capacity from 1,400 MW in 2000 to 30,000 MW in 2025?
questions.explanation: Chhattisgarh, formed in 2000, has transformed into one of India’s major power hubs by expanding its electricity capacity from 1,400 MW to 30,000 MW in just 25 years. With ₹3 lakh crore of new investment commitments, the state is poised to double this capacity to nearly 60,000 MW in the coming years, supported by both thermal and renewable energy projects. The inauguration of a new 1,320 MW power plant, the construction of a joint headquarters in Nava Raipur for power companies, and outreach to global investors underline its growth trajectory. Solar power initiatives under schemes like PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana are furthering the state’s commitment to sustainability while ensuring energy security and economic development.

questions.question: Which state has recently approved amendments to labour laws allowing longer daily working hours in the private sector?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra has approved significant amendments to its labour laws, increasing the maximum daily working hours for private sector employees. Under the Factories Act, the limit has been extended from 9 to 12 hours with mandatory rest breaks after 6 hours, while the overtime cap has been raised from 115 to 144 hours per quarter. Similarly, under the Maharashtra Shops and Establishments Act, daily working hours have been raised from 9 to 10, with an overtime cap of 144 hours per quarter. These changes are designed to attract investment, create jobs, and strengthen worker rights, with safeguards such as double overtime pay and written consent for extended hours. The reforms align Maharashtra with other states that have already modernised their labour frameworks.

questions.question: Which state has launched the Autumn Calendar 2025 featuring global artists, the Cherry Blossom Festival, and grassroots music initiatives?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya has introduced its Autumn Calendar 2025 as part of a cultural and tourism initiative designed to showcase the state’s rich traditions, natural beauty, and growing role as a global cultural hub. The calendar includes major attractions such as the internationally recognised Cherry Blossom Festival, grassroots music projects that empower local artists, international kayaking competitions, motorsport events, and literary dialogues. These activities not only promote Meghalaya as a vibrant tourism destination but also stimulate the local economy by creating income opportunities in hospitality, handicrafts, and services. By blending culture, sports, and sustainability, the Autumn Calendar strengthens the state’s identity and enhances global exposure.

questions.question: Which institution secured the top position in the NIRF Rankings 2025 for the seventh consecutive year?
questions.explanation: IIT Madras has once again topped the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2025, maintaining its position as India’s leading educational institution for the seventh consecutive year. Released by the Ministry of Education, the 10th edition of NIRF rankings assessed institutions across 17 categories, including engineering, law, medicine, management, agriculture, and sustainable development. IIT Madras stood out not only in the overall category but also in engineering, innovation, and sustainable development, showcasing its consistent excellence in teaching, research, and innovation. This recognition strengthens its global reputation and aligns with India’s vision of “Viksit Bharat 2047” by promoting world class education and research.

questions.question: From which date will SEBI’s new intraday monitoring framework become effective?
questions.explanation: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has introduced a new intraday monitoring framework with the objective of ensuring greater market stability and reducing systemic risks. Under this framework, net intraday positions in equity index derivatives are capped at ₹5,000 crore, replacing the earlier end-of-day cap of ₹1,500 crore. The gross intraday exposure limit of ₹10,000 crore per entity remains unchanged. Exchanges are instructed to take multiple random snapshots during trading hours, including peak sessions, to monitor compliance. This framework officially comes into effect on October 1, 2025, marking a significant regulatory shift in market risk management.

questions.question: With which country has India signed a Joint Credit Mechanism (JCM) agreement to boost carbon trading and green investments?
questions.explanation: India has entered into a landmark Joint Credit Mechanism (JCM) agreement with Japan under Article 6.2 of the Paris Agreement. This collaboration aims to enhance carbon trading, promote green investment, and accelerate sustainable innovation. The partnership is strategically important as it comes amid challenges like U.S. tariffs on Indian goods and China’s restrictions on rare earth exports. Japan’s role provides India with an alternative pathway to strengthen clean energy development and manufacturing. Additionally, the JCM facilitates bilateral carbon credit trading, technology transfer, and capacity building, helping India progress toward its Net Zero 2070 target while positioning both nations as leaders in sustainable climate action ahead of COP30.

questions.question: Which institution is pioneering AI tools for Indian languages and cultural heritage under the Bhashini project?
questions.explanation: IIT Jodhpur has taken a leading role in advancing artificial intelligence for India’s linguistic and cultural landscape. Through its Vision, Language and Learning Group (VL2G), led by Prof. Anand Mishra, the institute has developed open source APIs capable of recognizing and translating scene text in 13 Indian languages, improving multilingual navigation, accessibility, and real time translation. Beyond language, IIT Jodhpur collaborates with IGNCA and TIH-iHUB Drishti to restore and digitise ancient manuscripts, safeguarding India’s cultural heritage. Additionally, with Accenture Labs, it is building advanced video AI systems for skill assessment, workplace safety, and healthcare. This pioneering work strengthens India’s digital future and supports the India@2047 vision of inclusive innovation.

questions.question: Where is the World Boxing Championships set to begin?
questions.explanation: The World Boxing Championships is scheduled to commence in Liverpool, United Kingdom, marking the first edition under the newly formed governing body, World Boxing. This tournament is notable for bringing both men and women together in the same championship structure. India, coming off a strong 2023 performance with four women’s gold medals in Delhi and three men’s bronzes in Tashkent, is fielding a balanced team. Star boxers like Nikhat Zareen in the 51kg category and Lovlina Borgohain in the 75kg category will headline India’s campaign. Hosting the championships in Liverpool underscores the city’s growing profile in international sporting events.

questions.question: Which state has successfully led the first eradication of the invasive plant Senna spectabilis?
questions.explanation: Kerala has become the first state to carry out a large scale eradication of the invasive plant species Senna spectabilis, clearing 383 acres in Wayanad. Originally introduced in the 1980s for its bright yellow flowers, this species from South America rapidly turned invasive, forming dense thickets that damage soil quality, block the growth of native plants, and reduce food availability for wildlife. While its spread has been reported in states such as Andhra Pradesh, Goa, and Maharashtra, Kerala’s proactive step sets an example for biodiversity conservation. Experts emphasise that early action is essential to protect the fragile ecosystems of the Western Ghats.

questions.question: What are the revised GST slabs under the new structure effective from September 2025?
questions.explanation: The GST Council has undertaken a major reform by reducing the number of slabs from four to two, fixing them at 5% and 18%. In addition, a new 40% slab has been introduced for sin goods such as tobacco, liquor, sugary drinks, and luxury items to discourage their consumption and increase revenue. Essential goods, along with healthcare and education related items, will now become more affordable under the 5% slab, while most durable goods will attract 18%. Coal has been shifted into the 18% category, making it costlier. This restructuring aims to simplify compliance, reduce confusion, ease consumer budgets, and boost demand across sectors.

questions.question: How many judges has the Supreme Court Collegium recommended for appointment to the Allahabad High Court?
questions.explanation: The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the appointment of 26 judges to the Allahabad High Court, which is currently struggling with a record number of vacancies. Out of a sanctioned strength of 160 judges, only 84 are in position, leaving 76 seats vacant—nearly half the court’s capacity. The fresh recommendations consist of 14 judicial officers and 12 advocates, including two senior women lawyers, Garima Parshad and Swarupama Chaturvedi. This move represents one of the largest single batches of recommendations for any High Court in recent years. By strengthening the Allahabad High Court, the initiative aims to reduce case backlogs, improve efficiency, and ensure faster delivery of justice while also promoting greater gender diversity in the judiciary.

questions.question: What is the new 24-hour cumulative UPI transaction limit for select categories like insurance, capital markets, and loan collections effective from September 15, 2025?
questions.explanation: Starting September 15, 2025, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) revised the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) limits for specific high-value Person to Merchant (P2M) transactions made through verified merchants. The per-transaction cap has been raised to ₹5 lakh, while the daily cumulative limit has been increased to ₹10 lakh. This enhanced limit covers sectors such as capital markets, insurance, government tax payments, credit card settlements, EMI collections, and travel bookings. The decision aims to strengthen India’s digital payments ecosystem, making UPI more versatile for high-value financial activities while ensuring secure, real-time, and cashless transactions at scale.

questions.question: Where was the 5th Central Advisory Council meeting under RERA held?
questions.explanation: The 5th Central Advisory Council meeting under the Real Estate (Regulation and Development) Act (RERA) took place in New Delhi. The meeting was significant as it witnessed the launch of the Unified RERA portal by Housing Minister Manohar Lal. The portal is designed to improve transparency, accountability, and timely project delivery in the real estate sector. The event also emphasised the importance of states and union territories fully implementing RERA to safeguard the interests of citizens, particularly homebuyers, by ensuring a more regulated and transparent housing market.

questions.question: In which city was Arundhati Roy’s memoir Mother Mary Comes To Me launched?
questions.explanation: The memoir Mother Mary Comes To Me by Arundhati Roy was launched in Kochi, marking the first time one of her books was unveiled in her home state, Kerala. The launch event was jointly organised by Penguin Random House and DC Books at St Teresa’s College, Kochi. The memoir is deeply personal, reflecting on her mother’s influence, her own journey as a daughter and writer, and her relationship with her brother LKC. The celebrated writer K. R. Meera introduced the book during the event, which added to its cultural significance and highlighted Roy’s strong literary presence in Kerala.

questions.question: In which state was the Royal Bhutan Buddhist Temple inaugurated at Rajgir?
questions.explanation: The Royal Bhutan Buddhist Temple was inaugurated at Rajgir in Bihar, an important historical and spiritual site associated with Buddhism. Rajgir holds great significance as it is the place where Lord Buddha performed penance and delivered several teachings. The inauguration ceremony was led by Bhutan’s Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay along with India’s Union Minister Kiren Rijiju, conducted with traditional Bhutanese rituals and Buddhist customs. The temple stands as a strong symbol of the enduring cultural and spiritual ties between India and Bhutan, reflecting their shared heritage and commitment to strengthening bilateral friendship through religious and cultural collaboration.

questions.question: Which bank signed an MoU with DPIIT to support startups under the Startup India initiative?
questions.explanation: ICICI Bank has partnered with the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) to support DPIIT-recognised startups under the Startup India initiative. The MoU, signed on September 4, 2025, introduces a Startup Engagement Programme that will provide accelerator access, structured mentorship, pilot opportunities, and ecosystem networking for startups. ICICI Bank’s Mumbai-based accelerator will serve as a hub for product-based startups, offering workspaces and opportunities to connect with industry leaders, investors, and clients. This collaboration not only empowers early- and growth-stage startups but also helps them test their solutions in real-world environments, enhancing innovation and scalability.

questions.question: Which country banned 26 unregistered social media platforms including Facebook, WhatsApp, and Instagram in September 2025?
questions.explanation: Nepal banned 26 unregistered social media platforms on September 4, 2025, under its Directive for Regulation of Social Media Use, 2080. The platforms included globally popular services like Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, YouTube, and X (formerly Twitter). The decision was announced by Nepal’s Minister of Communications and Information Technology, Prithvi Subba Gurung, after platforms failed to comply with requirements such as registering with the government, establishing a local office, and appointing a contact person in Nepal. TikTok, which had earlier been banned, was reinstated after registration in 2024, while Telegram continues to remain banned due to concerns over misuse.

questions.question: On which date is Teacher’s Day celebrated every year in India?
questions.explanation: Teacher’s Day in India is celebrated every year on September 5, marking the birth anniversary of Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, India’s second President and a renowned philosopher. This tradition began in 1962, when Dr. Radhakrishnan suggested that instead of celebrating his birthday, it would be a privilege if it were observed as Teacher’s Day. The day serves as a national tribute to educators who inspire and shape future generations. In 2025, the theme “Inspiring the Next Generation of Learners” underscores the evolving role of teachers in guiding students not just academically, but also in creativity, innovation, and character building.

questions.question: Who will be honoured with the Prof. V.K. Gokak Award in Bengaluru on September 7, 2025?
questions.explanation: Anand V. Patil, a celebrated writer known for his outstanding contributions to children’s literature, will receive the Prof. V.K. Gokak Award in Bengaluru on September 7, 2025. He has previously been honoured with the Kendra Sahitya Akademi’s Bal Sahitya Award, and his works have played a key role in nurturing creativity and values among young readers. The award, instituted in memory of Prof. Vinayaka Krishna Gokak, a Jnanpith awardee and a towering figure in Kannada literature, honours writers who significantly enrich Indian literary traditions. This recognition underscores Patil’s role in advancing children’s literature and preserving linguistic heritage.

questions.question: Which city is hosting the 3rd North East Aviation Summit and Ministers’ Conference on regional connectivity?
questions.explanation: The 3rd North East Aviation Summit and Ministers’ Conference is being hosted in Itanagar, the capital of Arunachal Pradesh. This marks the first time the state has hosted such a significant aviation event. The summit brings together Union Minister Rammohan Naidu, MoS Murlidhar Mohol, and various state ministers to discuss vital issues related to the aviation sector. Key focus areas include airport expansion, the introduction of helicopters, seaplanes, and drones, along with Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul (MRO) activities. Organised by the Ministry of Civil Aviation in collaboration with FICCI and the Arunachal government, the event highlights regional connectivity goals.

questions.question: Where was the North Eastern Zone Badminton Championship inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The North Eastern Zone Badminton Championship was inaugurated in Tripura by Chief Minister Manik Saha. The event brought together more than 200 players from different northeastern states including Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, and Sikkim. Tripura has recently invested heavily in sports infrastructure, building eight synthetic turfs, two tracks, and two indoor halls. In addition, floodlights were installed at Agartala’s Avananta football ground to allow night play. Future plans include constructing two more indoor halls, setting up a 200-bed hostel, and creating 50 open gyms across the state to encourage wider sports participation and nurture local talent.

questions.question: In which state was India’s first Vulture Conservation Portal launched?
questions.explanation: India’s first Vulture Conservation Portal was launched in Assam through a joint initiative by We Foundation India and the Zoology Department of Gauhati University. This digital platform is designed to create a nationwide network focused on safeguarding vultures, which play a crucial role in maintaining ecological balance by preventing the spread of diseases through carrion disposal. The initiative emphasises grassroots-level awareness, particularly using local languages, to ensure wider community participation. With India hosting nine vulture species, five of which are listed as Critically Endangered by the IUCN, the portal aims to address threats like poisoning, habitat loss, and human disturbances.

questions.question: Who recently assumed charge as the new Mines Secretary?
questions.explanation: Piyush Goyal, a 1994 batch IAS officer from the Nagaland cadre, has been appointed as the new Mines Secretary. He took charge after V.L. Kantha Rao and brings with him rich administrative experience, having previously served as the CEO of NATGRID. His leadership comes at a pivotal moment when India is emphasizing the development of critical minerals such as lithium, cobalt, nickel, and rare earths. These resources are central to supporting India’s clean energy transition, ensuring greater self-reliance in strategic sectors, and helping the country progress toward its ambitious net-zero emission targets.

questions.question: Where was India’s first port-based Green Hydrogen Pilot Project inaugurated?
questions.explanation: India’s first port-based Green Hydrogen Pilot Project was inaugurated at VOC Port in Tamil Nadu by Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal. The project is part of a broader initiative worth over ₹150 crore that also includes a Green Methanol bunkering facility, solar and wind energy projects, development of a multi-cargo berth, improved road infrastructure, and a maritime heritage museum. This milestone strengthens India’s commitment to clean energy and sustainable port operations, making VOC Port a pioneer in integrating renewable energy with maritime infrastructure. The inauguration also coincided with the 154th birth anniversary of freedom fighter VO Chidambaranar in Tuticorin.

questions.question: How many Aadhaar authentications were recorded by UIDAI in August 2025?
questions.explanation: UIDAI achieved a record milestone by registering 221 crore Aadhaar authentications in August 2025, marking a 10.3% growth compared to the same period in 2024. This surge reflects India’s increasing reliance on digital identity verification for various services. A significant highlight was face authentication, which rose sharply to 18.6 crore in August 2025 from 6.04 crore in August 2024, bringing the cumulative total of face-based transactions to over 213 crore. More than 150 entities now utilise AI-driven face authentication, offering secure and convenient service delivery across multiple sectors, thereby strengthening India’s digital transformation journey.

questions.question: Which organization has partnered with The Art of Living to enhance employee well-being through structured programs?
questions.explanation: Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL), a Maharatna Central Public Sector Enterprise, has entered into a partnership with The Art of Living to improve employee well-being. The collaboration focuses on delivering structured programs that emphasise emotional resilience, mindfulness, and leadership development. These initiatives are designed to help employees manage stress effectively, enhance productivity, and foster a more harmonious workplace environment. By aligning individual well-being with organizational growth, SAIL aims to build a healthier, more motivated workforce. This initiative also reflects the growing emphasis on mental health and holistic development in India’s corporate and public sector ecosystem.

questions.question: Who has been included under the new cashless medical treatment scheme announced by UP CM Yogi Adityanath?
questions.explanation: UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced a major welfare measure by extending cashless medical treatment facilities to teachers across the state. This includes teachers from primary, secondary, and aided schools, along with Shiksha Mitras and other educational staff. The initiative is expected to benefit nearly nine lakh teachers and their families, reducing their financial stress during illnesses or emergencies. Alongside this, he also marked Teachers’ Day by honouring educators, distributing tablets, and inaugurating smart classrooms. These steps highlight the government’s commitment to improving the welfare of teachers and strengthening the education system in Uttar Pradesh.

questions.question: Which project was jointly inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi and Singapore PM Lawrence Wong on September 4, 2025?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong virtually inaugurated the PSA Mumbai Terminal Phase-II at Jawaharlal Nehru Port (JNPA) on September 4, 2025. This expansion has raised the terminal’s capacity to 4.8 million TEUs, officially making it the largest container terminal in India. Operated by Singapore-based PSA International, the facility is equipped with state-of-the-art cranes, automated systems, and a direct rail link to the Dedicated Freight Corridor. The project not only enhances India’s maritime infrastructure but also strengthens India-Singapore economic cooperation. It will significantly reduce logistics costs, improve cargo efficiency, and boost India’s competitiveness in global trade.

questions.question: Which countries will host the ICC Women’s ODI World Cup 2025?
questions.explanation: The ICC Women’s ODI World Cup 2025 is scheduled to be jointly hosted by India and Sri Lanka from September 30 to November 2, 2025. Matches will be played across five venues, with Pakistan’s fixtures specifically set to take place in Colombo. The tournament will feature eight teams—India, Australia, England, South Africa, New Zealand, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and Pakistan—competing in 28 league matches under a round-robin format. The knockout stage venues will be finalised depending on Pakistan’s qualification. Australia enters the tournament as the defending champion, having already secured seven titles, making them the most successful team in Women’s World Cup history.

questions.question: Who has recently won a rare third term as the Prime Minister of Jamaica?
questions.explanation: Andrew Holness, leader of the Jamaica Labour Party, has secured a rare third term as the Prime Minister of Jamaica after his party won 34 seats in the 2025 elections. His campaign focused strongly on economic reforms, particularly the promise of reducing income tax rates from 25% to 15%, which appealed to a broad section of the population. His opponent, Mark Golding, conceded defeat, marking another significant victory for Holness’s leadership. Jamaica, located in the Caribbean region of North America, has Kingston as its capital, the Jamaican Dollar as its currency, and English as its official language.

questions.question: In which country is Adani Power collaborating with Druk Green Power to set up a Rs 6,000 crore hydroelectric project?
questions.explanation: Adani Power has partnered with Druk Green Power Corporation to establish a 570MW hydroelectric project in Bhutan with a massive investment of Rs 6,000 crore. The project will be developed under the BOOT (Build, Own, Operate, Transfer) model, ensuring long-term sustainability and infrastructure development in the region. The agreements, including a power purchase agreement and concession agreement, were signed in the presence of Bhutan’s Prime Minister Dasho Tshering Tobgay and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani. This collaboration strengthens the energy cooperation between India and Bhutan, supporting clean power generation and promoting regional energy security in South Asia.

questions.question: Who has recently taken oath as the new Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court?
questions.explanation: Justice Shree Chandrashekhar has been sworn in as the new Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court. The oath was administered by Maharashtra Governor C P Radhakrishnan at Raj Bhavan in Mumbai. Before this elevation, he had been serving as the Acting Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court and had also held the role of Acting Chief Justice of the Jharkhand High Court. His appointment reflects his significant judicial experience and contributions. As Chief Justice, he is expected to bring stability and guidance to one of India’s most prominent High Courts, playing a crucial role in upholding justice and strengthening the legal system.

questions.question: By which year does Niti Aayog aim to double India’s pulses production to 51.57 million tonnes?
questions.explanation: Niti Aayog has set a long-term vision to double India’s pulses production by 2047, raising output to 51.57 million tonnes. This plan is designed to secure the country’s nutritional and food requirements while ensuring surplus production in the decades ahead. The strategy involves achieving self-sufficiency in pulses by 2030 and then scaling up production further through technological innovations, climate-smart agriculture, and region-specific cultivation models. By focusing on seed quality, advanced farming tools, and resilience against climate stress, the roadmap highlights a holistic approach to strengthening India’s agricultural sector and empowering farmers for sustainable growth.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the UK Deputy Prime Minister on 5 September 2025 following Angela Rayner’s resignation?
questions.explanation: David Lammy, previously serving as the UK Foreign Secretary, was appointed Deputy Prime Minister, Justice Secretary, and Lord Chancellor on 5 September 2025. His elevation came after Angela Rayner resigned amid a tax scandal, triggering a major cabinet reshuffle led by Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer. Lammy’s appointment was seen as a strategic move to stabilise the Labour leadership during a politically turbulent period, with the government facing a £40 billion budget shortfall and upcoming economic challenges. By placing trusted allies like Lammy in key roles, Starmer aimed to reinforce authority and navigate internal party dynamics effectively.

questions.question: By when is ISRO’s Kulasekarapattinam spaceport expected to be fully operational?
questions.explanation: ISRO’s second spaceport at Kulasekarapattinam in Tamil Nadu is projected to be completed and operational by December 2026. This facility, spread over 2,300 acres, will primarily cater to Small Satellite Launch Vehicles (SSLVs), with a planned capacity of 20–25 launches annually. Its coastal location near the equator allows safe, efficient launches into polar and sun-synchronous orbits, crucial for Earth observation satellites. Besides easing pressure on the Sriharikota spaceport, the new complex is expected to boost regional economic growth, generate employment, and foster aerospace innovation, strengthening India’s capacity to meet rising global demand for small satellite launches.

questions.question: How many countries pledged postwar security guarantees for Ukraine at the Paris summit in September 2025?
questions.explanation: A total of 26 nations pledged postwar security guarantees for Ukraine at the Paris summit on September 4, 2025, announced by French President Emmanuel Macron. This collective commitment includes land, sea, and air support options to protect Ukraine after the ongoing war with Russia ends. The coalition, informally called the “coalition of the willing,” seeks to deter renewed Russian aggression, reinforce Ukraine’s sovereignty, and prepare a long-term security framework. While some countries may directly deploy troops, others plan to contribute through training, equipping, or financing. This united stance underscores Europe’s determination to secure stability and prevent future conflicts.

questions.question: Who was elected as the new Prime Minister of Thailand on September 5, 2025?
questions.explanation: Anutin Charnvirakul, leader of the Bhumjaithai Party, was elected as Thailand’s new Prime Minister on September 5, 2025, securing 63% of the parliamentary vote. His victory marked a major shift in Thai politics, ending the long-standing dominance of the Pheu Thai Party and signaling the decline of the Shinawatra family’s influence. Known for his role in managing Thailand’s COVID-19 response and for spearheading the decriminalization of cannabis, Anutin is considered a pragmatic dealmaker. His success was also due to a strategic pact with the People’s Party, which supported him in exchange for promises of constitutional reform and fresh elections.

questions.question: Which country has formally supported India’s plan to patrol the Malacca Strait?
questions.explanation: Singapore has endorsed India’s initiative to patrol the Malacca Strait, a critical maritime chokepoint connecting the Indian Ocean and the South China Sea. This strategic move enhances regional maritime security, counters concerns over Chinese naval activity, and strengthens India’s Act East and Indo-Pacific strategies. The agreement was announced during Singaporean Prime Minister Lawrence Wong’s visit to India on September 4, 2025, alongside signing five new pacts covering green energy, technology, and defence cooperation. Singapore’s support reflects the deepening bilateral partnership and commitment to safeguarding one of the world’s busiest sea lanes, which handles over 60% of global maritime trade.

questions.question: Who has been reappointed as the non-executive chairman of Yes Bank by RBI for the term September 2025 to May 2027?
questions.explanation: R Gandhi, a former Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, has been reappointed as the part-time non-executive chairman of Yes Bank for the period from September 20, 2025, to May 13, 2027. With over 37 years of experience in central banking, Gandhi has contributed significantly to regulation, payment systems, and currency management in India. His leadership at Yes Bank is seen as vital in ensuring governance stability and reinforcing investor confidence, especially after the bank’s restructuring phase following the 2020 crisis. His regulatory credibility and oversight strengthen the bank’s long-term planning and compliance framework.

questions.question: What is the name of the campaign launched in 2025 to boost PMAY-U 2.0?
questions.explanation: Angikaar 2025 is a two-month nationwide campaign launched by the Union Minister for Housing and Urban Affairs to strengthen the implementation of PMAY-U 2.0. Running from 4th September to 31st October 2025, the campaign focuses on bridging last-mile delivery gaps, raising awareness about housing benefits, and fast-tracking applications for urban housing. It covers more than 5,000 Urban Local Bodies, prioritises vulnerable groups, and integrates related welfare schemes like CRGFTLIH and PM Surya Ghar. Angikaar 2025 is designed to ensure that no eligible urban family is left behind in the mission of affordable and sustainable housing for all.

questions.question: Which Indian cricketer has been signed as the brand ambassador for Skechers to promote its cricket footwear in India?
questions.explanation: Skechers has appointed Mohammed Siraj, one of India’s leading fast bowlers, as its brand ambassador to expand its presence in the cricket footwear market. Known for his pace and consistency, Siraj has become a standout performer in both international cricket and the IPL. His inspiring journey and growing popularity among the youth make him an ideal fit for Skechers’ campaign, which aims to highlight performance-driven products at affordable prices. With this collaboration, Skechers seeks to strengthen its foothold in India’s cricketing landscape and position itself alongside global sportswear giants like Adidas, Puma, and Nike.

questions.question: How long will the totality of the September 2025 Blood Moon last?
questions.explanation: The September 2025 Blood Moon is remarkable because it will last for a total of 82 minutes, making it the longest total lunar eclipse of the year. This duration surpasses the usual range of 60–70 minutes, giving skywatchers an extended opportunity to observe the Moon’s transformation into a deep red hue caused by Earth’s atmosphere scattering sunlight. Such extended eclipses are rare and hold both scientific and cultural importance, allowing astronomers to study atmospheric conditions while also captivating audiences across Asia, Africa, Europe, and Australia.

questions.question: Which country unveiled a colon cancer vaccine after successful preclinical trials at the EEF 2025?
questions.explanation: Russia’s Federal Medical-Biological Agency (FMBA) announced a significant breakthrough by unveiling a colon cancer vaccine during the Eastern Economic Forum (EEF) 2025. The vaccine demonstrated promising results in preclinical trials, with a 60–80% reduction in tumour size, improved survival rates, and no recorded adverse effects. It specifically targets colorectal cancer, which is one of the world’s leading causes of cancer-related deaths. If approved by regulators, this would become Russia’s first immunotherapy treatment for colorectal cancer. Furthermore, FMBA is also working on developing vaccines for glioblastoma and melanoma, marking a major stride in cancer research and treatment.

questions.question: Who has been re-elected as the President of Guyana?
questions.explanation: Mohamed Irfaan Ali, the leader of the People’s Progressive Party (PPP), has been re-elected as the President of Guyana with a decisive mandate. His party secured more than double the votes of its nearest rival, marking a stronger position than in the 2020 elections. Guyana, situated on the northern Atlantic coast of South America, has its capital at Georgetown and its Prime Minister as Mark Phillips. Ali’s re-election reflects continued public confidence in his leadership and the PPP’s governance, further shaping Guyana’s political stability and regional influence in South America.

questions.question: On which date will International Literacy Day 2025 be observed?
questions.explanation: International Literacy Day 2025 will be observed on September 8 with global events focusing on the theme “Promoting Literacy in the Digital Era.” The day emphasizes the importance of digital literacy, highlighting access to digital platforms, the creation of content, and safe engagement in online spaces. It also brings attention to critical aspects such as privacy, ethics, sustainability, and critical thinking while navigating digital environments. Since its inception in 1967, International Literacy Day has played a vital role in advocating literacy as a fundamental human right, fostering awareness and collective efforts to achieve global educational equality.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the new Deputy Prime Minister of the UK after Angela Rayner’s resignation?
questions.explanation: David Lammy, who was serving as the UK’s Foreign Secretary, has been appointed as the Deputy Prime Minister following Angela Rayner’s resignation due to a tax scandal involving underpaid stamp duty. Rayner stepped down from both her Deputy PM role and position as Labour’s deputy leader, creating a significant shift within the party’s leadership structure. In the subsequent reshuffle led by Prime Minister Keir Starmer, Yvette Cooper was moved to the role of Foreign Secretary, while Shabana Mahmood became the new Home Secretary. Lammy’s elevation reflects his rising influence within the government and the Labour Party.

questions.question: Which city will host the 28th ITTF-ATTU Asian Table Tennis Team Championships in October 2025?
questions.explanation: Bhubaneswar has been chosen as the host city for the 28th ITTF-ATTU Asian Table Tennis Team Championships in October 2025. This prestigious event will feature both men’s and women’s team competitions and also act as a qualifier for the 2026 ITTF World Team Championships. It is the first time that Odisha will host an Asian-level table tennis tournament, marking a significant achievement for the state. The championships are expected to draw top teams from powerhouse nations such as China, Japan, South Korea, Singapore, along with emerging teams, making Bhubaneswar a major hub for global table tennis action.

questions.question: Which bank signed a ₹21,000 crore MoU with the Rajasthan government under the Rising Rajasthan initiative?
questions.explanation: Punjab National Bank (PNB) signed a significant ₹21,000 crore Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Rajasthan government as part of the Rising Rajasthan initiative. The collaboration focuses on empowering MSMEs, promoting women entrepreneurs, and strengthening digital financial inclusion across the state. PNB aims to facilitate easier access to credit, encourage adoption of modern technology, and provide financial support to women-led enterprises. As part of this initiative, 2,000 loan letters were distributed to women entrepreneurs in Jaipur. This MoU represents a step toward socio-economic development and inclusive growth, reinforcing PNB’s role in driving financial empowerment in Rajasthan.

questions.question: Which country won its first-ever men’s compound team gold at the 2025 World Archery Championships?
questions.explanation: India created history by winning its first-ever men’s compound team gold at the 2025 World Archery Championships. The Indian team secured a narrow 235–233 victory over France in a thrilling final, showcasing exceptional composure under pressure. Key performances came from Rishabh Yadav, Priyansh Saini, and Aman Fuge, whose teamwork and precision proved decisive. In addition, Rishabh Yadav also bagged a silver medal in the mixed team event alongside Jyothi Surekha Vennam. While the women’s team ended their eight-year medal streak with an early exit, Coach Teja’s tactical planning and strategies were instrumental in India’s landmark achievement.

questions.question: Which Indian naval ship participated in Papua New Guinea’s 50th Independence Day celebrations?
questions.explanation: INS Kadmatt, an Indian Navy ship, played a key role in Papua New Guinea’s 50th Independence Day celebrations. The ship’s naval band performed at the Military Tattoo in Port Moresby, where bands from various nations came together to promote unity and cultural harmony through music. India’s martial and melodic tunes were particularly appreciated during the event. Additionally, INS Kadmatt’s crew visited the Bomana War Cemetery to honour the memory of World War II heroes, including the unsung Indian soldiers who fought bravely. This act highlighted India’s respect for shared history and its commitment to international friendship.

questions.question: Which country won its 4th Men’s Asia Cup Hockey title with a 4-1 victory over South Korea?
questions.explanation: India emerged victorious in the Men’s Asia Cup Hockey, defeating South Korea 4-1 to secure its 4th title. The goals came from Sukhjeet, Amit Rohidas, and Dilpreet Singh, who scored twice, giving India a commanding win. This triumph also earned India a direct qualification spot for the 2026 Men’s Hockey World Cup to be held in the Netherlands and Belgium. After an 8-year gap, India reclaimed continental hockey supremacy, reflecting its strong preparation, teamwork, and resilience. To celebrate the achievement, Hockey India announced cash rewards of ₹3 lakh for players and ₹1.5 lakh for the support staff.

questions.question: In which city will Minister Pralhad Joshi inaugurate the NABL-accredited NTH Chemical Laboratory?
questions.explanation: The newly inaugurated NTH Chemical Laboratory is located in Ghaziabad. This facility is designed to enhance testing and analysis in multiple sectors such as water, food packaging, construction materials, fertilizers, plastics, and metals. With advanced equipment like AAS, ICP-AES, OES, GC-MS, HPLC, and Ion Chromatograph, the lab aims to support both industrial needs and public health by ensuring strict safety and quality compliance. Establishing such a facility in Ghaziabad strengthens the city’s role in national-level research and development, while also helping industries adhere to international testing and regulatory standards.

questions.question: Which country launched the advanced spy satellite Ofek-19 on 2nd September 2025?
questions.explanation: Israel successfully launched the Ofek-19 satellite on 2nd September 2025 using a Shavit rocket from the Palmachim Airbase. Ofek-19 is a Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR)-based reconnaissance satellite designed to provide high-resolution images with sub-half-metre accuracy, offering effective all-weather and day-night surveillance. Its primary role is to monitor regional threats from Iran, Syria, and Hezbollah, significantly strengthening Israel’s defence and intelligence-gathering capabilities. This launch further enhances Israel’s independent space program and highlights its strong security and technological cooperation with the United States, marking a major step in safeguarding national and regional security interests.

questions.question: In which city will Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurate the Combined Commanders’ Conference on October 15, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Combined Commanders’ Conference 2025 will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Kolkata on October 15, 2025. The event, themed “Year of Reforms – Transforming for the Future,” will bring together top civil and military leadership to deliberate on reforms, transformation, and operational preparedness in India’s defence sector. Such conferences are pivotal for aligning strategic defence priorities with long-term national goals. Additionally, during the same visit, PM Modi is scheduled to launch the Swasth Nari Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan on October 17, further highlighting the government’s integrated approach towards national security and societal development.

questions.question: In whose honour will the Reserve Bank of India issue a ₹100 commemorative coin on September 13, 2025, to mark his birth centenary?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India will issue a ₹100 commemorative coin on September 13, 2025, to celebrate the birth centenary of Bharat Ratna Dr. Bhupen Hazarika. Known as a legendary Assamese singer, poet, composer, and social reformer, Hazarika’s contributions went far beyond music—he became a cultural icon who championed harmony, social justice, and human dignity. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil the coin in Guwahati, alongside the release of a comprehensive biography. Year-long centenary celebrations will include renaming of memorials, creation of a museum, and cultural programs across India, honouring Hazarika’s enduring legacy and influence on society.

questions.question: Which tennis player became the first woman since Serena Williams to win back-to-back US Open titles in 2025?
questions.explanation: Aryna Sabalenka made history at the 2025 US Open by successfully defending her title, becoming the first woman since Serena Williams in 2014 to achieve consecutive victories at the tournament. She defeated Amanda Anisimova in straight sets, marking her fourth career Grand Slam title and her 100th Grand Slam match win. Despite setbacks earlier in the year at the Australian Open and Roland Garros, Sabalenka showcased immense resilience and mental strength to triumph on the New York hard courts. This victory not only silenced doubts about her consistency but also solidified her reputation as one of the dominant forces in women’s tennis.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Hero MotoCorp, effective 5 January 2026?
questions.explanation: Hero MotoCorp, India’s leading two-wheeler manufacturer, has appointed Harshavardhan Chitale as its new CEO, effective from 5 January 2026. This leadership transition comes after the resignation of Niranjan Gupta in April 2025 and the interim role of Vikram Kasbekar. Chitale, an IIT Delhi alumnus and Director’s Gold Medalist, brings over 30 years of global leadership experience, including his role as Global CEO of Signify’s €4 billion Professional Business. His expertise in industrial automation, IoT innovation, and global operations is expected to accelerate Hero’s shift toward electric mobility, digitalisation, premiumisation, and sustainability, aligning with the company’s long-term strategic vision.

questions.question: Which country clinched the bronze medal by defeating Oman in the CAFA Nations Cup 2025?
questions.explanation: India achieved a historic milestone at the CAFA Nations Cup 2025 by defeating Oman in a tense bronze medal match. The game ended 1-1 in regulation time, with Udanta Singh scoring the equalizer for India. In the penalty shoot-out, India triumphed 3-2, thanks to crucial saves by goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu and missed penalties by Oman. This victory not only secured the bronze medal but also marked India’s first-ever international football win against Oman, a significant achievement in the nation’s football journey. The win reflects India’s growing presence and competitive spirit in Asian football tournaments.

questions.question: What was the theme of the International Conference on Space 2025 inaugurated by Dr. Jitendra Singh?
options: Exploring Space: Pathways to the Future
Harnessing Space for Global Progress: Innovation, Policy & Growth
questions.answer: Harnessing Space for Global Progress: Innovation, Policy & Growth
questions.explanation: The International Conference on Space 2025, inaugurated by Dr. Jitendra Singh, carried the theme “Harnessing Space for Global Progress: Innovation, Policy & Growth.” The event emphasised India’s ambitious vision, including establishing a Bharatiya Space Station by 2035 and a human Moon mission by 2040. Dr. Singh highlighted the role of more than 300 startups that are fueling innovation in the space sector following major reforms. The conference also focused on global cooperation, reflecting how space technology can drive progress in innovation, policy, and sustainable growth. This theme underscores space as a catalyst for international collaboration and scientific advancement.

questions.question: With which country did India recently sign a Bilateral Investment Agreement in New Delhi to boost trade, investor protection, and cooperation in fintech, cybersecurity, and innovation?
questions.explanation: India signed a Bilateral Investment Agreement with Israel in September 2025 to strengthen economic cooperation and boost mutual investments. The agreement provides legal certainty to investors, ensures safeguards against expropriation, guarantees transparent regulations, and establishes an independent arbitration mechanism for dispute resolution. Currently, bilateral investments stand at around USD 800 million, but the new pact is expected to significantly increase capital flows, especially in cybersecurity, defence technologies, fintech, and high-tech innovation. The partnership reflects both nations’ shared vision of economic resilience, technological advancement, and long-term collaboration, reinforcing India’s global position in innovation-driven growth.

questions.question: Which Indian state has announced plans to establish a space city and two defence hubs with a combined investment of ₹3,400 crore?
questions.explanation: Andhra Pradesh has launched an ambitious plan to strengthen its role in India’s space and defence sectors. The state government has partnered with Skyroot Aerospace to establish a space city in Tirupati with a ₹400 crore investment, aimed at private satellite launches and cost-effective launch vehicles. Alongside, two defence hubs are being set up in Madakasira with an investment of ₹3,000 crore, focusing on aerospace components, defence electronics, and weapon systems. Together, these initiatives position Andhra Pradesh as a future hub for space technology and defence manufacturing, creating jobs, boosting exports, and supporting India’s self-reliance mission.

questions.question: On which date is World Physiotherapy Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Physiotherapy Day is observed annually on September 8 to honour the invaluable contribution of physiotherapists in enhancing movement, rehabilitation, and overall quality of life. Established in 1996 by World Physiotherapy, the date marks the organization’s founding in 1951. The 2025 theme, “Healthy Ageing: Preventing Frailty and Falls,” underscores the importance of physiotherapy in supporting older adults to maintain independence, prevent injuries, and promote healthy lifestyles. This observance not only raises global awareness about physiotherapy’s role in healthcare but also highlights its significance in tackling age-related challenges, chronic diseases, and movement-related disorders across all populations.

questions.question: On which date is World Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy Day is observed annually on September 7 to raise awareness about Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD), a rare genetic disorder that leads to progressive muscle weakening, affecting mobility, breathing, and heart functions. The 2025 theme, "Family: The Heart of Care," emphasises the vital role families play in managing the challenges of this condition and supporting affected children. The Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD) marked the day through online sessions, webinars, and awareness programs. Observing this day globally highlights the need for research, care strategies, and inclusive support systems for those impacted by DMD.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new global brand ambassador for Levi’s, symbolizing the brand’s shift towards relaxed and comfort-first denim fits?
questions.explanation: Levi’s has chosen Bollywood actress Alia Bhatt as its new global brand ambassador, reflecting the brand’s strategic move to align with changing fashion trends. Women’s fashion is shifting away from tight silhouettes towards relaxed, wide-leg, and comfort-first denim fits. Alia Bhatt, known for her strong influence in both cinema and fashion, perfectly embodies this evolution, resonating with younger audiences globally. Her association allows Levi’s to position itself as a culturally relevant, style-led brand that appeals to Gen Z and millennials. This collaboration highlights authenticity, self-expression, and Levi’s ambition to evolve beyond heritage denim into a trend-forward fashion icon.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of NHPC Limited?
questions.explanation: Bhupender Gupta has been appointed as the new Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of NHPC Limited, taking over from Raj Kumar Chaudhary, who retired in June 2025. Approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet, his appointment comes at a crucial time when NHPC is diversifying beyond hydropower into solar, wind, and other renewable energy sources. With over three decades of experience in project execution, operations, and strategic planning, Gupta is well-suited to lead NHPC’s green transformation. His leadership is expected to accelerate stalled hydro projects, expand solar and wind initiatives, and strengthen India’s renewable energy mission, aligning with the 2030 clean energy targets.

questions.question: In which state launch Phases II & III of the Godavari water project?
questions.explanation: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy inaugurated Phases II and III of the Godavari water project, a significant initiative aimed at meeting the state’s water requirements. The project will supply 20 TMC of water, with 16 TMC allocated for Hyderabad’s drinking water needs and 4 TMC dedicated to river revival. The CM also criticised the earlier government for stalling the Pranahita Chevella project and assured the construction of the Tummidihatti barrage. Additionally, emphasis was placed on rejuvenating the Musi river, taking inspiration from successful river restoration efforts like the Ganga, Yamuna, and Sabarmati. This project highlights Telangana’s commitment to sustainable water management.

questions.question: Where were the 3rd trilateral consultations between India, Iran, and Armenia held?
questions.explanation: The 3rd round of trilateral consultations involving India, Iran, and Armenia was held in Tehran, the capital of Iran. The discussions focused on strengthening regional cooperation with a special emphasis on connectivity projects, including the International North-South Transport Corridor (INSTC) and Armenia’s Crossroads of Peace initiative. These talks also touched upon expanding economic ties, enhancing trade, and exploring broader areas of mutual interest. The trilateral platform reflects a shared vision for better connectivity and stability in the region. The next round of consultations is scheduled to take place in Armenia, continuing the momentum of this important dialogue.

questions.question: Which institute signed an MoU with the Sports Authority of India’s NCSSR to promote sports science and innovation?
questions.explanation: The Sports Authority of India’s National Centre of Sports Science Research (SAI-NCSSR) signed a Memorandum of Understanding with IIT Delhi to advance sports science and promote indigenous innovation in sports equipment. This partnership aligns with the government’s vision of Atmanirbhar Bharat and Garv se Swadeshi by reducing dependence on imported equipment and fostering self-reliance. Core objectives include athlete performance enhancement, injury prevention, rehabilitation strategies, and inclusive support for para-athletes. A major highlight of this collaboration was the inauguration of a state-of-the-art Biomechanics Laboratory at IIT Delhi, designed to analyse athlete movement, optimise training, and strengthen India’s sports ecosystem through scientific insights.

questions.question: Which public sector company signed an MoU with NSTFDC to empower tribal students in Eklavya Model Residential Schools?
