questions.explanation: Coal India Limited (CIL), in collaboration with the National Scheduled Tribe Finance and Development Corporation (NSTFDC), signed a Memorandum of Understanding to support the holistic development of tribal students studying in Eklavya Model Residential Schools (EMRS). The initiative focuses on four major areas: digital access, career mentorship, menstrual hygiene management, and teacher capacity building. CIL will provide digital infrastructure such as desktops, UPS systems, and tablets, while also supporting career guidance programs and exposure visits. Additionally, the project includes health interventions like sanitary napkin vending machines and teacher training workshops. This MoU is strategically aligned with the goals of inclusive education, equity, and social empowerment, especially in coal-bearing and tribal-dominated regions.

questions.question: Which state government has ordered a probe into recognition of courses and admissions in universities and colleges?
questions.explanation: The government of Uttar Pradesh has initiated a probe into the recognition of courses and admissions across all universities, colleges, and institutions in the state. Divisional Commissioners have been directed to set up Special Investigation Teams (SITs) comprising administrative, police, and education officers to carry out the investigation. Institutions are required to provide affidavits, recognition certificates, and detailed information about their courses. Any cases of illegal admissions or unapproved courses will invite strict action, including mandatory refunds of fees along with interest. This move underscores the state’s commitment to ensuring transparency, accountability, and quality standards in higher education.

questions.question: Where was the UPI–UPU Integration launched during the 28th UPU Congress?
questions.explanation: The UPI–UPU Integration was launched in Dubai during the 28th UPU Congress by Jyotiraditya Scindia. This integration connects India’s Unified Payments Interface (UPI) with the Universal Postal Union (UPU) platform, making global remittances faster, safer, and more affordable. By linking the systems, India aims to enhance financial inclusion, strengthen cross-border digital transactions, and reduce the cost of sending money internationally. Additionally, India pledged USD 10 million towards innovation, e-commerce, and digital payments. This initiative also aligns with the United Nations’ sustainable development goal of reducing global remittance costs to below 3% by 2030, thus empowering millions of migrant workers and their families.

questions.question: Which state received ₹1,600 crore aid from PM Modi for flood relief?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a relief package of ₹1,600 crore for the flood-hit state of Punjab. The package includes not only financial assistance through the State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) and PM-Kisan scheme but also ex-gratia payments for families of the deceased and injured. In addition, PM CARES funds will support orphans, while reconstruction efforts will be undertaken under the PM Awaas Yojana–Gramin. Schools will receive assistance through the Samagra Shiksha program, and further support is planned for farmers once a detailed damage report is finalised. This comprehensive aid package underscores the government’s commitment to Punjab’s recovery.

questions.question: Where will India fund the construction of a new Accident & Emergency Unit under the recently signed MoU with Sri Lanka?
questions.explanation: India has committed to funding the construction of a modern Accident & Emergency Unit in Mannar, Sri Lanka, with a grant of LKR 600 million. The MoU for this project was signed by Indian envoy Santosh Jha and Sri Lankan Health Secretary Anil Jasinghe. The facility will be a two-storey unit equipped with advanced medical infrastructure, aimed at strengthening emergency care services and easing overcrowding in hospitals. This initiative is part of India’s broader healthcare support to Sri Lanka, which also includes contributions to the Suwa Seriya 1990 ambulance service and multiple hospital upgrade projects, reflecting strong bilateral cooperation in public health.

questions.question: On which date is World Suicide Prevention Day 2025 observed?
questions.explanation: World Suicide Prevention Day is observed annually on September 10 to raise awareness about suicide prevention and promote global action. The 2025 observance is marked under the triennial theme “Changing the Narrative,” which emphasises reducing stigma, encouraging open dialogue, and prioritizing mental health at all levels. Each year, more than 720,000 people die by suicide worldwide, making it a leading cause of death among young people. By dedicating this day, global organizations like the International Association for Suicide Prevention (IASP) and the World Health Organization (WHO) aim to foster compassion, evidence-based prevention, and proactive support systems.

questions.question: Who has been elected as the 15th Vice President of India?
questions.explanation: CP Radhakrishnan, the NDA nominee, has been elected as the 15th Vice President of India. He secured 452 votes, defeating Justice B Sudershan Reddy, who received 300 votes, in an election that recorded a 98.20% turnout. With 15 votes declared invalid and 13 MPs abstaining, the contest was significant but decisive. A seasoned politician, Radhakrishnan has previously served as a two-time Member of Parliament and also as the Governor of Maharashtra. His election was widely welcomed, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighting his long-standing service to society and administrative experience. He succeeds Jagdeep Dhankhar in this prestigious constitutional position.

questions.question: In which country is the multilateral military exercise ZAPAD 2025 being held with Indian forces' participation?
questions.explanation: ZAPAD 2025 is a significant multilateral military exercise being hosted in Russia, with the active participation of Indian forces. The exercise involves the Indian Army’s KUMAON Regiment leading a contingent of 57 Army personnel, 7 from the Air Force, and 1 from the Navy. The key objectives are to enhance interoperability, foster greater cooperation among participating nations, and strengthen counter-terrorism preparedness. Moreover, the exercise emphasises joint planning, tactical drills, and the integration of emerging technologies in modern warfare. By engaging in this event, India seeks to deepen defence ties with Russia and build operational synergy in multinational scenarios.

questions.question: Who secured a second term as Prime Minister of Norway in the 2025 parliamentary elections?
questions.explanation: Jonas Gahr Stoere, leader of Norway’s Labour Party, secured a second consecutive term as Prime Minister following the parliamentary elections held on September 8, 2025. His party won 87 out of 169 seats, narrowly surpassing the majority threshold. Despite the victory, Stoere faces challenges in governing due to a fragmented parliament and the surge of the right-wing Progress Party, which won a record 48 seats. His new term will involve navigating sensitive issues such as climate policy, oil and gas investments, taxation reforms, and foreign policy decisions tied to Norway’s $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund, requiring coalition consensus.

questions.question: Which country inaugurated the Grand Renaissance Dam, Africa's largest hydroelectric project?
questions.explanation: The Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD) was inaugurated by Ethiopia and is considered Africa's largest hydroelectric project. Located on the Blue Nile River, around 30 km upstream from Sudan, the dam plays a central role in Ethiopia's vision of self-reliance, economic development, and regional influence. The Blue Nile contributes about 85% of the Nile's waters, making the project geopolitically significant for neighboring countries as well. Ethiopia regards the GERD not only as a means of generating power and promoting regional energy trade but also as a symbol of national pride and independence.

questions.question: Which organization received the SSLV production technology from ISRO under its 100th technology transfer agreement?
questions.explanation: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) became the recipient of ISRO’s 100th technology transfer agreement, enabling it to independently manufacture Small Satellite Launch Vehicles (SSLVs). The agreement was signed with the involvement of ISRO, NSIL, and IN-SPACe, marking a milestone in India’s space journey. Under the deal, HAL will receive training and support over 24 months to master SSLV production processes, technology integration, and flight preparedness. This initiative will help India strengthen its self-reliant space ecosystem while capturing opportunities in the rapidly expanding global small-satellite launch market. SSLVs, known for cost-effectiveness and quick turnaround, are crucial for future commercial missions.

questions.question: Which institution launched the “Never Alone” AI-based mental health and wellness program on World Suicide Prevention Day?
questions.explanation: AIIMS New Delhi launched the “Never Alone” program to address the critical issue of student suicides by providing affordable, accessible, and technology-driven mental health support. The program integrates artificial intelligence to offer 24/7 virtual as well as offline consultations with qualified mental health professionals through a user-friendly web-based app that can be accessed on WhatsApp. It also ensures personalised and secure mental health screenings. The affordability of the service, priced at just 70 paise per student per day for institutions with 5,000 students, makes it a scalable and impactful initiative to improve student mental health and reduce risks of self-harm.

questions.question: In which state is the ₹4,447 crore Mokama–Munger greenfield highway project being developed?
questions.explanation: The ₹4,447 crore Mokama–Munger highway project is being developed in Bihar as part of the larger Buxar–Bhagalpur High-Speed Corridor. Approved under the Hybrid Annuity Mode (HAM), the 82.4 km 4-lane greenfield highway will significantly enhance connectivity across Eastern Bihar, passing through Mokama, Barahiya, Lakhisarai, Jamalpur, and Munger. The project is strategically important as it supports key regional industries, including the Ordnance Factory Corridor in Munger, the Jamalpur Locomotive Workshop, food processing hubs, and the Bhagalpur silk and textile industry. By improving mobility and reducing freight costs, the highway will drive economic growth, create jobs, and strengthen Bihar’s logistics network.

questions.question: Who overtook Elon Musk to become the world’s richest person in September 2025?
questions.explanation: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison surpassed Elon Musk to become the world’s richest person in September 2025, with his net worth soaring to $395.7 billion. This dramatic rise was fueled by a 41% surge in Oracle’s stock, its biggest jump since 1992, largely driven by booming demand for AI and cloud computing services. Oracle’s strong revenue forecasts and rapid cloud growth positioned the company as a major contender against tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google. Ellison’s wealth increase of $101 billion in a single day highlights the transformative impact of AI-driven enterprise solutions on global markets and billionaire rankings.

questions.question: What is Fitch Ratings’ upgraded forecast for India’s GDP growth in FY25?
questions.explanation: Fitch Ratings revised India’s FY25 GDP growth forecast upward to 6.9%, an increase from its earlier estimate of 6.5%. This revision reflects strong domestic demand, resilient private sector activity, and the positive impact of GST reforms. Consumer spending and supportive financial conditions, including stable interest rates and liquidity, have strengthened India’s economic outlook despite global trade challenges. GST reforms are expected to further enhance compliance, lower costs of doing business, and stimulate consumption. Fitch also projects India’s economy will maintain robust momentum in the medium term, averaging 6.3% growth by FY27, keeping the country ahead of global growth trends.

questions.question: On which date is National Forest Martyrs Day observed in India every year?
questions.explanation: National Forest Martyrs Day is observed on September 11 each year to pay tribute to those who sacrificed their lives while protecting India’s forests and biodiversity. The day commemorates the Khejarli Massacre of 1730 in Rajasthan, where Amrita Devi Bishnoi and 363 villagers gave their lives to save Khejri trees, a historic act that later inspired the Chipko Movement. In 2025, the theme is “Remembering Martyrs, Protecting Forests”, highlighting the importance of honouring past sacrifices while encouraging active participation in conservation. Activities such as tree plantation drives, awareness campaigns, and memorial ceremonies reinforce the commitment to environmental protection.

questions.question: In which country was India’s first overseas Atal Innovation Centre inaugurated by Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan in 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s first overseas Atal Innovation Centre was inaugurated in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) by Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan at the IIT Delhi–Abu Dhabi campus in September 2025. This landmark step extends India’s Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) beyond its borders, creating a hub for research, entrepreneurship, and collaboration in global education and innovation. The centre is expected to strengthen India–UAE academic ties while encouraging students and researchers to develop solutions for international challenges. Alongside the inauguration, new academic programs in Energy and Sustainability (Ph.D.) and Chemical Engineering (B.Tech) were also launched, highlighting the commitment to knowledge exchange and innovation.

questions.question: Which country launched the world’s first Digital Tribal University, Adi Sanskriti?
questions.explanation: The world’s first Digital Tribal University, Adi Sanskriti, was launched in India by Durgadas Uikey, Minister of State for Tribal Affairs, at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. This initiative represents a pioneering step in promoting tribal education, art, culture, and traditional knowledge through digital platforms. Adi Sanskriti is designed as a comprehensive e-learning and digital academy, offering resources to both national and international audiences. Along with education, it also serves as an online marketplace for tribal crafts and heritage, helping to preserve and promote indigenous traditions while empowering tribal communities in the modern digital economy.

questions.question: On which date will World First Aid Day 2025 be observed?
questions.explanation: World First Aid Day 2025 will be observed on September 13, aligning with the tradition of marking the event on the second Saturday of September each year. Established by the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, this day highlights the critical role of first aid in saving lives and reducing the severity of injuries. The 2025 theme, “First Aid and Climate Change,” emphasises preparedness for emergencies linked to floods, wildfires, and heatwaves. By promoting first aid education, the observance empowers individuals and communities to respond effectively in crises, making societies safer and more resilient.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the first photographic evidence of the elusive Pallas’s cat recently captured?
questions.explanation: The first photographic documentation of the Pallas’s cat in India was made in Arunachal Pradesh during a wildlife survey. The Pallas’s cat (Otocolobus manul) is a rare and little-studied species of wild cat, known for its gray or tan coat that adapts seasonally to provide camouflage. While its distribution has previously been confirmed in regions like Sikkim, Bhutan, and Nepal, this evidence from Arunachal Pradesh marks an important extension of its known range in the eastern Himalayas. This finding adds to the ecological significance of Arunachal Pradesh and highlights the importance of continued biodiversity surveys in the state.

questions.question: At how many airports was the Fast Track Immigration-Trusted Traveller Program inaugurated by Union Home Minister Amit Shah?
questions.explanation: Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched the Fast Track Immigration-Trusted Traveller Program through video conferencing at five airports—Lucknow, Thiruvananthapuram, Trichy, Calicut, and Amritsar. This program is designed to make immigration procedures faster, smoother, and more secure for Indian Nationals as well as Overseas Citizens of India (OCI). The initiative builds upon the program earlier launched in Delhi in 2024 and marks a significant step toward modernizing India’s border management system. By reducing wait times and streamlining processes, it improves travel efficiency and strengthens India’s reputation for providing traveler-friendly infrastructure at its airports.

questions.question: Which bank signed an MoU with TCIL to enhance IT infrastructure and accelerate digital banking services?
questions.explanation: Punjab National Bank (PNB) signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Telecommunications Consultants India Limited (TCIL) on 3 September 2025 to strengthen its IT systems and digital banking capabilities. The partnership focuses on areas like system integration, IT infrastructure rollout, and regulatory-compliant deployments, ensuring PNB delivers secure, resilient, and customer-centric services. TCIL will provide consultancy, project management, and execution support, helping PNB meet rising customer demands while maintaining robust cybersecurity standards. This collaboration not only strengthens PNB’s competitive position in the digital banking sector but also aligns with the broader Digital India mission to expand secure financial services nationwide.

questions.question: What is the route of the newly launched daily time-tabled parcel train announced by the Union Railways Minister?
questions.explanation: The Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the launch of a daily parcel train running from Badgam in the Kashmir Valley to Adarsh Nagar in Delhi. This initiative is designed to benefit traders, especially fruit and handicraft dealers, by providing a reliable and time-bound logistics solution to expand their reach across India. The Jammu-Srinagar line becoming operational further strengthens connectivity, enabling the transport of goods such as apples efficiently. The service not only boosts trade but also creates better integration of Kashmir with the rest of the country through a consistent supply chain network.

questions.question: Who has become Nepal’s first woman Prime Minister after being appointed as the interim leader following Gen-Z protests?
questions.explanation: Sushila Karki, Nepal’s first female Chief Justice, has been sworn in as the country’s first woman Prime Minister, serving as an interim leader after Gen-Z-led protests toppled the previous government. Known for her integrity and fearless stance against corruption, she emerged as the consensus choice among youth representatives, the Nepali Army, and the President. Her judicial career includes landmark contributions, and she previously faced political resistance due to her zero-tolerance approach to corruption. At 73, her appointment represents both a generational and ideological shift in Nepalese politics, symbolizing a push toward transparency, accountability, and democratic renewal in the nation.

questions.question: Which financial institution signed a $126 million loan agreement with India to promote sustainable tourism in Uttarakhand?
questions.explanation: India signed a $126 million loan agreement with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to boost sustainable tourism in Uttarakhand, particularly focusing on Tehri Garhwal District. The project is expected to benefit nearly 87,000 local residents while enhancing the experience for about 2.7 million annual visitors. The funding will help in strengthening tourism planning, improving infrastructure, ensuring proper sanitation and waste management, and enhancing disaster preparedness in the region. By promoting environmentally responsible and culturally sensitive tourism, the project aims to balance economic development with ecological preservation, creating long-term benefits for both local communities and visitors.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Chairperson of the NSE Governing Board with SEBI’s approval?
questions.explanation: Srinivas Injeti, a retired 1983-batch IAS officer, has been appointed as the Chairperson of the NSE Governing Board with SEBI’s approval. With over 40 years of experience in financial services, regulation, and governance, he has held key positions such as Secretary of the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, where he implemented landmark reforms including the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code. He was also the founding Chairperson of the International Financial Services Centres Authority, contributing to fintech growth and sustainable finance. His broad career includes roles in sports administration, pharmaceuticals pricing, and global governance, making him well-suited for leading the NSE’s oversight.

questions.question: Where did IIM Ahmedabad inaugurate its first international campus with a global MBA program?
questions.explanation: IIM Ahmedabad launched its first global campus in Dubai on 11 September 2025, marking a historic step in the internationalization of Indian higher education. The inauguration, held at Dubai International Academic City, was attended by leaders from both India and the UAE, including Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum and India’s Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan. The Dubai campus begins operations with a one-year global MBA program for professionals, aligning with Dubai’s vision of becoming an education and innovation hub. This milestone strengthens India-UAE educational cooperation and reflects IIMA’s vision of being “Indian in spirit, global in outlook.”

questions.question: In which city was SAJEX 2025 launched to strengthen India’s jewellery trade with Saudi Arabia and the GCC?
questions.explanation: SAJEX 2025 was launched in Jeddah as part of India’s efforts to boost jewellery trade with Saudi Arabia and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC). Organised by the Gem & Jewellery Export Promotion Council with support from the Indian Consulate in Jeddah, the Indian Embassy in Riyadh, and the Ministry of Commerce & Industry, the event was hosted at the Jeddah Superdome from September 11–13. Featuring over 200 exhibitors and thousands of buyers, it showcased diamonds, coloured gemstones, gold jewellery, and lab-grown diamonds. This initiative aligns with Saudi Arabia’s Vision 2030 and underscores India’s leadership in the global jewellery industry.

questions.question: In which state did the Zoological Garden record the first successful conservation breeding of Asian Giant Tortoises in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Manipur Zoological Garden achieved a milestone in 2025 by successfully carrying out the first artificial incubation of Asian Giant Tortoises, resulting in 28 hatchlings from a single nest. This critically endangered species, Manouria emys phayrei, is native to Northeast India and parts of Southeast Asia. The initiative, undertaken in collaboration with the India Turtle Conservation Programme (ITCP), focuses not only on captive breeding but also on reintroducing the tortoises into their natural habitats. This achievement highlights Manipur’s pioneering role in reptile conservation, enhances biodiversity protection, and sets a model for other states to adopt similar scientific conservation efforts.

questions.question: In which city was the Indian Navy’s new base, INS Aravali, commissioned on 12th September 2025?
questions.explanation: INS Aravali, the Indian Navy’s newly commissioned base, was inaugurated in Gurugram on 12th September 2025 in a ceremony presided over by Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi. The establishment of this base strengthens the Navy’s administrative and logistical capabilities, thereby boosting India’s Maritime Domain Awareness (MDA). It also plays a crucial role in supporting advanced communication and information centres, enhancing strategic readiness. This initiative is closely aligned with the Prime Minister’s MAHASAGAR vision, which focuses on maritime security and growth. Choosing Gurugram as the site reflects its strategic importance in coordinating naval operations inland.

questions.question: What was India’s retail inflation rate in August 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s retail inflation, measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), stood at 2.07% in August 2025, rising from 1.61% in July. Even with this uptick, the figure remained well below the Reserve Bank of India’s 4% target, offering relief to households and leaving room for accommodative monetary policy. The increase was largely driven by higher prices in categories like vegetables, meat, fish, oil, fats, and personal care, even though food inflation overall remained in deflation for the third straight month. With inflation still comfortably within RBI’s tolerance band, the environment supports economic growth while maintaining price stability.

questions.question: From which city was the Indian Navy car rally flagged off on 13th September 2025?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy car rally was flagged off from New Delhi on 13th September 2025 by Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi, Chief of the Naval Staff. The rally aimed to foster stronger connections with citizens, particularly in Uttar Pradesh, while also spreading maritime awareness. Covering nearly 1700 kilometers, the journey included key cities such as Agra, Lucknow, Varanasi, and Kanpur. During this rally, the Navy engaged with veterans, NGOs, and local communities. Launching the event from New Delhi, the capital city, highlighted the national significance of the outreach initiative and underscored the Navy’s commitment to public engagement.

questions.question: Who has been recommended by the Financial Services Institutions Bureau to become the next Managing Director of SBI?
questions.explanation: The Financial Services Institutions Bureau (FSIB) has recommended Ravi Ranjan, who is currently serving as the Deputy Managing Director, for the role of Managing Director of the State Bank of India. He is set to replace Vinay M Tonse, whose tenure ends on November 30, 2025. The final approval of this recommendation will be decided by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. This recommendation reflects FSIB’s key role in ensuring strong leadership in major financial institutions, and the appointment of Ravi Ranjan will mark a significant step in SBI’s leadership transition.

questions.question: What was the primary objective of the MoU signed between NIFT Patna and Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited?
questions.explanation: The MoU between NIFT Patna and Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited was primarily aimed at empowering Jeevika Didis, who are women associated with self-help groups (SHGs). The collaboration seeks to provide them with specialised training in garment manufacturing, quality control, and machinery operation. Beyond training, the initiative also ensures sustainable livelihood opportunities by linking these women with employment at ABFRL’s upcoming Begusarai unit. By focusing on empowering Jeevika Women, the project aspires to initially benefit around 3.5 lakh women, thereby creating a large-scale impact on women’s economic independence and skill development in Bihar.

questions.question: In which state did APEDA open its first regional office to boost agri-exports?
questions.explanation: The Agricultural & Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA) opened its first regional office in Patna, Bihar, inaugurated by Piyush Goyal during the Bihar Idea Festival. This office is set up to make exporter services more accessible, streamline registration, and provide market support directly within the state. Earlier, exporters from Bihar had to rely on APEDA’s office in Varanasi, which caused delays in services. By establishing the office in Bihar, the initiative directly connects local farmers and agribusinesses with global markets, enabling them to scale exports, boost income, and contribute significantly to the state’s economic growth.

questions.question: Which city will host the 5th Coast Guard Global Summit in 2027?
questions.explanation: The 5th Coast Guard Global Summit is scheduled to be hosted in Chennai in 2027, coinciding with the Golden Jubilee of the Indian Coast Guard. This major three-day event will bring together global Coast Guard representatives to deliberate on maritime challenges, strengthen international collaboration, and foster trust among nations. Highlights will include an International Fleet Review and a World Coast Guard Seminar, both aimed at promoting interoperability and addressing shared maritime issues. Hosting the summit in Chennai, a key coastal hub of India, reflects its strategic maritime significance and the city’s role in global maritime cooperation.

questions.question: Where did the International Government Communication Forum (IGCF) 2025 conclude?
questions.explanation: The International Government Communication Forum (IGCF) 2025 concluded in Sharjah, underscoring the critical role of communication in improving quality of life. The event featured the Sharjah Government Communication Award (SGCA) under the theme “Communication for Quality of Life.” Experts from around the globe participated in discussions on pressing issues such as artificial intelligence, food security, health, education, and sustainability. They highlighted the importance of ethical, human-centered communication in effective policymaking. Hosting this significant forum in Sharjah reflects the city’s growing role as a hub for dialogue on global governance, innovation, and social well-being.

questions.question: Which country voted in favour of the UNGA resolution endorsing the two-state solution for Palestine on 12th September 2025?
questions.explanation: On 12th September 2025, India voted in favour of the UN General Assembly resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration” on the two-state solution for Palestine. The resolution, backed by 142 nations, reaffirmed the global commitment to establishing a sovereign and independent Palestine coexisting peacefully with Israel within secure and recognised borders. India’s vote was consistent with its long-standing position of supporting Palestine’s statehood while recognizing Israel’s right to live in peace and security. This balanced diplomatic approach reinforces India’s role as a proponent of peace through dialogue, even as it maintains strong strategic ties with both Palestine and Israel.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve, where tigers from Tadoba-Andhari and Pench reserves are being translocated, located?
questions.explanation: The Sahyadri Tiger Reserve is located in Maharashtra, spread across Kolhapur, Sangli, Satara, and Ratnagiri districts of the Western Ghats. Established in 2010, it was formed by merging Chandoli National Park and Koyna Wildlife Sanctuary. Although rich in dense forests and biodiversity, the reserve has largely been home to transient tigers without a stable breeding population. To revive its tiger population, the Union Environment Ministry and NTCA approved the capture and translocation of 8 tigers from Tadoba-Andhari and Pench Tiger Reserves. This initiative will help restore predator-prey balance, strengthen ecological corridors, and align with India’s wider Project Tiger conservation goals.

questions.question: The SPREE-2025 initiative by ESIC is launched under which Act?
questions.explanation: The SPREE-2025 (Scheme for Promoting Registration of Employers and Employees) has been launched under the provisions of the ESI Act, 1948. This Act forms the foundation of India’s Employees’ State Insurance framework, providing health insurance and social security benefits to workers. SPREE-2025, active from 1st July to 31st December 2025, encourages unregistered employers and employees, including temporary and contractual workers, to register voluntarily without the fear of retrospective penalties or inspections. By simplifying compliance and promoting wider registration, the initiative strengthens India’s social security net while ensuring that more workers receive the health and insurance benefits guaranteed under the ESI Act, 1948.

questions.question: Which Indian state is set to host the 10th Ayurveda Day on 23rd September 2025 at the All India Institute of Ayurveda (AIIA)?
questions.explanation: The 10th Ayurveda Day will be hosted in Goa on 23rd September 2025 at the All India Institute of Ayurveda (AIIA). Goa was chosen as the venue due to its global appeal, reputation in wellness tourism, and cultural diversity, making it an ideal international stage. The celebration carries the theme “Ayurveda for People & Planet,” aligning traditional medicine with modern sustainability goals. By selecting Goa, the Ministry of Ayush aims to highlight India’s commitment to advancing Ayurveda through world-class infrastructure and global outreach, strengthening its position as both a healthcare solution and a sustainable lifestyle practice.

questions.question: Which institution has become India’s first government medical college to offer training on the da Vinci Robotic Surgical System?
questions.explanation: AIIMS Delhi has created history by becoming the first government medical college in India to provide training on the da Vinci Robotic Surgical System. Installed at its Skills, E-Learning and Telemedicine (SET) Facility, this system marks a significant advancement in medical education and surgical innovation. Alongside the Hugo Robotic Trainer, AIIMS now has two dedicated robotic systems exclusively for training medical students, residents, faculty, and healthcare professionals. This initiative is vital as it democratises access to advanced surgical training, reduces dependence on foreign institutions, enhances patient care outcomes, and positions AIIMS Delhi as a global hub for surgical innovation and excellence.

questions.question: Which biofuel is India currently exploring for blending with diesel after ethanol-diesel trials did not succeed?
questions.explanation: India is now focusing on isobutanol blending with diesel as part of its biofuel strategy, following unsuccessful ethanol-diesel trials. Isobutanol (C₄H₁₀O) is a four-carbon alcohol with higher energy density than ethanol, making it more compatible with diesel. It is less hygroscopic, which reduces risks of corrosion in pipelines and engines. Trials by the Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) are underway for 10% isobutanol–diesel blends, and its use is also being studied in CNG–isobutanol flex-fuel options for tractors. This initiative supports the National Biofuel Policy 2018, aiming to reduce oil imports, enhance farmer incomes, and promote sustainable energy solutions.

questions.question: What digital platform was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 12th September 2025 to digitise and preserve India’s manuscript heritage?
questions.explanation: The Gyan Bharatam Portal, launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi, on 12th September 2025, is a landmark initiative to digitise, preserve, and provide public access to India’s vast manuscript heritage. It functions as a national digital repository enriched with AI-driven tools for search, translation, and annotation. Beyond preservation, it encourages research, publication, capacity building, and global collaborations, making ancient knowledge accessible worldwide. This initiative supports India’s vision of cultural revival and aligns with the National Education Policy 2020, while strengthening the idea of a Viksit Bharat by valuing knowledge traditions as a foundation of future progress. The launch coincided with the International Conference on “Reclaiming India’s Knowledge Legacy through Manuscript Heritage,” highlighting the theme of reviving India’s ancient wisdom in a modern digital format.

questions.question: Which constitutional provisions were highlighted by the Supreme Court while addressing discrimination against meritorious PwD candidates being denied upward mobility to unreserved seats?
questions.explanation: The Supreme Court emphasised Articles 14 and 16 of the Constitution while questioning the practice of forcing meritorious Persons with Disabilities (PwD) to remain in reserved seats even when they qualify in the unreserved/general category. Article 14 guarantees equality before the law, while Article 16 ensures equal opportunity in matters of public employment. Denial of upward mobility to PwD candidates was termed “hostile discrimination,” as it unfairly restricts their opportunities compared to SC/ST/OBC candidates who enjoy such mobility. By invoking these provisions, the Court reinforced that reservation is about inclusion and enabling equality, not charity, and must ensure fairness, dignity, and true empowerment for PwDs.

questions.question: What is the name of the world’s first-ever Tri-service all-women sailing circumnavigation expedition flagged off by the Defence Minister?
questions.explanation: The world’s first-ever Tri-service all-women sailing circumnavigation expedition has been named Samudra Pradakshina. It was flagged off by the Defence Minister and symbolises Nari Shakti, the jointness of the Armed Forces, Aatmanirbhar Bharat, and India’s maritime vision. Led by Lt Col Anuja Varudkar, a crew of 10 women officers will sail for nine months aboard the indigenously built IASV Triveni, covering 26,000 nautical miles. Their route includes crossing the Equator twice, rounding the three great Capes, and navigating the challenging Southern Ocean and Drake Passage. The mission also integrates scientific studies on microplastics and ocean health, while advancing India’s maritime diplomacy globally.

questions.question: With which country’s Kachin Independence Army (KIA) is India collaborating to secure rare-earth mineral samples?
questions.explanation: India is collaborating with the Kachin Independence Army (KIA) in Myanmar to secure rare-earth mineral samples and diversify its supply chain beyond China. The KIA, founded in 1961, controls the Chipwe-Pangwa mining belt in Kachin state, a key source of heavy rare earths such as dysprosium and terbium. These minerals are crucial for advanced technologies, including EVs, missiles, medical equipment, and renewable energy systems. As China dominates global rare earth production and processing, India’s partnership with Myanmar aims to strengthen supply security, reduce strategic dependence, and support the goals of the National Critical Mineral Mission (NCMM) launched in 2025.

questions.question: In which city was Purple Fest 2025, celebrating inclusion and empowerment of Divyangjan, organised?
questions.explanation: Purple Fest 2025 was organised in Noida on 10–11 September 2025 by the Indian Sign Language Research and Training Centre (ISLRTC) in collaboration with Amity University. The event aimed to celebrate the dignity, creativity, and empowerment of Divyangjan, featuring art exhibitions, entrepreneurship stalls, cultural programs, and rehabilitation education. It promoted a rights-based perspective that views disability not as a limitation but as a source of strength, aligning with the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016. By bringing together policy, purpose, and participation, the festival reinforced the importance of equality, inclusion, and respect as fundamental rights for persons with disabilities.

questions.question: Which company installed the first Lanza-N 3D Air Surveillance Radar on an Indian warship?
questions.explanation: Tata Advanced Systems successfully installed the first Lanza-N 3D Air Surveillance Radar, a naval variant of Indra’s radar, on an Indian warship. This milestone was part of a $145-million agreement signed in 2020. Over the next decade, Tata will locally assemble and integrate 19 additional radars for the Indian Navy. The Lanza-N radar system is designed for advanced long-range air defence and anti-missile operations, making it highly suitable for the demanding conditions of the Indian Ocean. This initiative highlights Tata’s growing role in strengthening India’s indigenous defence manufacturing capabilities and enhancing naval preparedness.

questions.question: Which country held its first Maritime Security and Disarmament Dialogue with India in Oslo on 13 September 2025?
questions.explanation: India and Norway held their inaugural Maritime Security, Disarmament, and Non-Proliferation Dialogue in Oslo on 13 September 2025. This marked a significant step in strengthening their strategic partnership, focusing on maritime stability, adherence to international law, and cooperation in global security matters. The discussions covered nuclear and conventional disarmament, maritime law under UNCLOS, and protection of critical infrastructure like ports and undersea cables. Both nations also committed to countering piracy, smuggling, and trafficking while enhancing capacity building and surveillance. Norway’s involvement highlights its role as a leading maritime power and NATO member, while India gains a crucial partner in the North Atlantic and Arctic security framework.

questions.question: What was India’s overall position at the ISSF World Cup 2025 (Rifle/Pistol) in Ningbo, China?
questions.explanation: India secured the 5th position overall at the ISSF World Cup 2025 in Ningbo, China. This performance was highlighted by Esha Singh’s gold medal in the women’s 10m air pistol event and Meghana Sajjanar’s first World Cup medal, a bronze in the women’s 10m air rifle. Despite strong individual performances, India ranked behind China, USA, Norway, and Italy in the overall medal standings. China dominated the competition with a massive haul of 41 medals, including 16 gold. India’s 5th place finish showcased the growing strength of its shooting contingent on the global stage.

questions.question: On which date is Engineers Day 2025 celebrated in India to honour Sir M. Visvesvaraya?
questions.explanation: Engineers Day 2025 is celebrated on September 15 across India to commemorate the birth anniversary of Sir Mokshagundam Visvesvaraya, born in 1861 at Muddenahalli, Karnataka. Widely regarded as one of India’s greatest engineers, he made pioneering contributions in civil engineering, dam construction, flood management, and urban planning. His leadership as the Diwan of Mysore from 1912–1918 modernised the state through industries, schools, and railways. Awarded the Bharat Ratna in 1955, he remains a symbol of engineering brilliance. Since its first observance in 1967, Engineers Day has inspired innovation and celebrated the role of engineers in shaping India’s future.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Director of the All India Institute of Ayurveda (AIIA), New Delhi?
questions.explanation: Professor Pradeep Kumar Prajapati has taken charge as the Director of the All India Institute of Ayurveda (AIIA), New Delhi. His appointment is for a tenure of five years or until superannuation. Prof. Prajapati brings with him an extensive academic background, having earlier served as Vice-Chancellor of Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan Rajasthan Ayurved University in Jodhpur. Additionally, he had a long association with Gujarat Ayurved University, Jamnagar, where he contributed significantly to Ayurvedic research and academics. His leadership at AIIA is expected to further strengthen Ayurvedic education, research, and clinical practices at the national level.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Democracy 2025 observed globally?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Democracy 2025 is observed on September 15 to highlight the significance of democratic governance, citizen participation, and the protection of fundamental rights. First established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2007, it was aligned with the Universal Declaration on Democracy adopted by the Inter-Parliamentary Union in 1997. Each year, the observance serves as a reminder of the importance of democracy in ensuring political equality, accountability, and the inclusion of marginalised voices. The 2025 theme, “Achieving Gender Equality, Action by Action,” emphasises that democracy thrives only when gender equality and inclusiveness are fully realised.

questions.question: Who clinched gold in the women’s 57kg category at the World Boxing Championships 2025 in Liverpool?
questions.explanation: Jaismine Lamboria emerged victorious in the women’s 57kg category at the World Boxing Championships 2025 held in Liverpool. She defeated Poland’s Szermeta Julia with a 4-1 scoreline to secure the gold medal. This achievement highlighted her dominance in the ring and added to India’s success at the tournament. Alongside Jaismine, Nupur and Pooja also contributed by winning silver and bronze respectively in their categories. Meenakshi Hooda defeated Nazym Kyzaibay in the 48 kg category. However, it was Jaismine’s remarkable performance and determination that earned her the top spot, making her the standout achiever for India at the prestigious championship.

questions.question: In which city did PM Modi unveil a ₹100 coin and postage stamp to honour the centenary of Dr Bhupen Hazarika?
questions.explanation: The centenary celebration of Bharat Ratna Dr Bhupen Hazarika was marked by PM Modi unveiling a special ₹100 coin and a postage stamp in Guwahati. This location holds deep cultural significance as it is closely tied to Hazarika’s legacy in Assam and the Northeast. Known as the “Bard of Brahmaputra,” Hazarika composed over 1,500 songs that conveyed themes of humanity, justice, and patriotism while popularising the folk traditions of the region. By choosing Guwahati for this tribute, the event highlighted the enduring influence of Hazarika’s contributions to Indian music and culture.

questions.question: Which country defeated Switzerland 3–1 in the Davis Cup World Group I 2025 to qualify for the 2026 Davis Cup Qualifiers?
questions.explanation: India defeated ninth-seeded Switzerland 3–1 in the Davis Cup World Group I 2025 tie held at the Swiss Tennis Arena in Biel. This historic victory ended a 32-year drought, marking India’s first away win against a European nation since 1993, when Leander Paes and Ramesh Krishnan led India past France. Sumit Nagal sealed the tie with an impressive straight-sets victory over Henry Bernet in the reverse singles. The win not only highlighted India’s resilience but also secured their spot in the 2026 Davis Cup Qualifiers. It reaffirmed India’s potential to compete at the highest levels of world tennis.

questions.question: In which state did PM Modi inaugurate the world’s first bamboo-based 2G bioethanol plant?
questions.explanation: PM Modi inaugurated the world’s first bamboo-based 2G bioethanol plant at Numaligarh in Assam, with an investment of ₹5,000 crore. This landmark project highlights India’s commitment to clean energy and sustainable development. The plant plays a vital role in supporting India’s E20 ethanol blending target, achieved in 2025, by producing ethanol from bamboo, which is abundant in the Northeast. It follows a zero-waste model, generating not only ethanol but also green chemicals, carbon dioxide, bio-coal, and 25 MW of green power. The project positions Assam as a leader in renewable energy innovation while boosting local bamboo-based industries.

questions.question: Which state government disbursed over ₹1,000 crore under the Namo Lakshmi Yojana to support girls’ education?
questions.explanation: The Gujarat government launched a massive financial initiative by disbursing more than ₹1,000 crore under the Namo Lakshmi Yojana to benefit 10.49 lakh girls studying in Classes 9 to 12. Each girl receives ₹50,000 spread across four years, regardless of whether she is already covered under other scholarships, with payments streamlined through a dedicated Namo Lakshmi portal. In addition, 1.5 lakh students pursuing science education were supported with ₹161+ crore through the Namo Saraswati Vigyan Sadhana Yojana. This program underscores Gujarat’s focus on encouraging education, particularly for young girls, and promoting STEM learning among students.

questions.question: Who has become the first woman Attorney General of Nepal?
questions.explanation: Sabita Bhandari, a senior advocate, has been appointed as the new Attorney General of Nepal, making history as the first woman to hold this prestigious position. Her appointment was made by President Ramchandra Paudel based on the recommendation of Prime Minister Sushila Karki. She succeeds Ramesh Badal in this vital constitutional role. This development is significant not only for Nepal’s judiciary but also for gender representation in the country’s governance. With its capital in Kathmandu, Nepal continues to evolve in terms of inclusivity and leadership representation, marking a milestone in its political and legal landscape.

questions.question: Which country appointed “Diella,” the world’s first AI cabinet minister?
questions.explanation: Albania made global history by becoming the first country to appoint an artificial intelligence-powered cabinet minister, named “Diella.” Announced by Prime Minister Edi Rama during the Socialist Party assembly in Tirana, Diella was given the critical responsibility of managing public procurement—a sector often vulnerable to corruption and inefficiency. Unlike human ministers, Diella is a virtual AI avatar integrated into the E-Albania digital governance portal. The role aims to ensure fairness, transparency, and efficiency by reducing human bias and streamlining bureaucratic processes. This groundbreaking initiative places Albania at the forefront of digital governance and sparks worldwide debate on AI in politics.

questions.question: In which country’s coast was the Freedom Edge military exercise conducted in September 2025?
questions.explanation: The Freedom Edge military exercise, conducted from September 15–19, 2025, was held near Jeju Island, South Korea. This trilateral exercise involved the United States, South Korea, and Japan, focusing on missile defence, air and naval operations, cyber coordination, and medical evacuation drills. It represents the most advanced trilateral drill to date and highlights growing defence cooperation between the three allies in response to North Korea’s nuclear and missile advancements. While the exercise emphasised deterrence, Pyongyang condemned it as a provocation, warning of consequences. The event also aligns with commitments made at the Camp David summit to strengthen trilateral security.

questions.question: Who became India’s first-ever Speed Skating World Champion by winning gold in the senior men’s 1000m sprint at the 2025 World Championships?
questions.explanation: Anandkumar Velkumar created history by becoming India’s first-ever Speed Skating World Champion at the 2025 World Championships in Beidaihe, China. He won gold in the senior men’s 1000m sprint with a timing of 1:24.924. This achievement followed his bronze medal in the 500m sprint, making him the first Indian to medal in the senior category at this prestigious event. Alongside him, Krish Sharma added glory by winning gold in the junior 1000m sprint. Anandkumar’s journey from a junior silver medalist to a global gold winner marks a turning point for Indian roller sports, inspiring a new generation of athletes.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer observed each year?
questions.explanation: The International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer is observed annually on September 16. The United Nations General Assembly declared this date in 1994 to commemorate the signing of the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer in 1987. This treaty became the first in history to achieve universal ratification in 2009, underscoring its global importance. The observance highlights the ongoing efforts to protect the ozone layer, which shields life on Earth from harmful ultraviolet radiation. The 2025 theme, “From science to global action,” emphasises the critical link between research and international cooperation.

questions.question: In which city was the 16th Combined Commanders’ Conference (CCC) reviewed by PM Narendra Modi?
questions.explanation: The 16th Combined Commanders’ Conference (CCC) was held in Kolkata, West Bengal, where Prime Minister Narendra Modi reviewed the preparedness and security measures of the Armed Forces. The theme for the 2025 conference was set as ‘Year of Reforms – Transformation for the Future’. The CCC, first held in 1953, is recognised as the highest-level defence dialogue forum that brings together India’s political leadership and senior military commanders. Conducted once every two years, this platform plays a key role in shaping strategic defence policies, reviewing security scenarios, and ensuring military readiness for future challenges.

questions.question: In which country did INS Nistar participate in the multinational submarine rescue drill, Exercise Pacific Reach 2025?
questions.explanation: INS Nistar, India’s indigenously built Diving Support Vessel, took part in Exercise Pacific Reach 2025 held in Singapore. This biennial event brings together more than 40 nations to strengthen submarine rescue capabilities and maritime cooperation. During the exercise, INS Nistar acted as the mothership for Deep Submergence Rescue Vehicles (DSRV), playing a vital role in the operations. The drill was structured in two phases – Harbour and Sea – to comprehensively test coordination, preparedness, and technical proficiency. Participation in such multinational exercises not only enhances India’s naval capabilities but also promotes stronger defence ties with global partners.

questions.question: Which country, along with the UK, launched the ‘Atlantic Partnership for Advanced Nuclear Energy’?
questions.explanation: The United States, in collaboration with the United Kingdom, launched the ‘Atlantic Partnership for Advanced Nuclear Energy’. This initiative focuses on strengthening cooperation in nuclear energy development, accelerating the deployment of advanced reactors, and reducing dependency on Russian nuclear fuel sources. The agreements involve US-based companies building nuclear projects overseas, showcasing America’s leading role in the global nuclear sector. These deals will be officially signed during President Donald Trump’s state visit to London. The partnership highlights a strategic effort to secure clean energy solutions while reinforcing transatlantic ties in the field of nuclear technology and energy security.

questions.question: In which city did Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurate India’s largest sports complex?
questions.explanation: Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated India’s largest and most modern sports complex in Naranpura, Ahmedabad. Constructed at a cost of ₹825 crore, the facility is equipped with state-of-the-art infrastructure, including a world-class aquatic complex, advanced arrangements for both indoor and outdoor sports, and comprehensive training and residential amenities for athletes. This complex is a significant step toward enhancing India’s sporting ecosystem and promoting grassroots as well as professional sports. Its development reflects the government’s commitment to fostering world-class sports infrastructure, enabling athletes to receive better training, and supporting India’s long-term sporting ambitions.

questions.question: Where was the third vessel of the five-ship Diving Support Craft (DSC A22) launched?
questions.explanation: The DSC A22, which is the third vessel in the five-ship Diving Support Craft project, was launched in Kolkata. This vessel has been constructed by Titagarh Rail Systems Ltd under a Ministry of Defence contract signed in 2021. The Diving Support Crafts are designed for crucial naval functions like submarine rescue, salvage operations, underwater inspection, hull cleaning, and diver training. Their construction follows the rules of the Indian Register of Shipping and involves hydrodynamic testing at NSTL, Visakhapatnam. The launch in Kolkata highlights the city’s growing role in India’s indigenous naval shipbuilding program.

questions.question: Who was sworn in as the 10th Chief Justice of the Manipur High Court on September 15, 2025?
questions.explanation: Justice M Sundar was sworn in as the 10th Chief Justice of the Manipur High Court on September 15, 2025, following the retirement of Justice Kempaiah Somashekar. Born in Chennai in 1966, Justice Sundar graduated from Madras Law College as part of its first integrated law course batch and enrolled as an advocate in 1989. His judicial career began in 2016 when he was elevated as a permanent judge of the Madras High Court, where he later became the second senior-most judge. His appointment to Manipur was recommended by the Supreme Court Collegium, highlighting his seniority and expertise in constitutional and civil law.

questions.question: Whose tenure as Executive Director of Punjab National Bank has been extended until March 2027?
questions.explanation: Shri M. Paramasivam’s tenure as Executive Director of Punjab National Bank (PNB) has been extended until March 31, 2027, or until further orders. The decision was formalized by the Department of Financial Services under the Ministry of Finance and reflects the government’s confidence in his leadership. As Executive Director, he has been instrumental in overseeing banking operations, driving credit growth, and enhancing corporate governance within PNB. His extension ensures continuity in leadership during a critical phase when public sector banks are implementing post-consolidation reforms, strengthening digital infrastructure, and navigating global economic and regulatory challenges.

questions.question: In which state was the 14th Sirarakhong Hathei Chilli Festival inaugurated to promote the GI-tagged Hathei chilli?
questions.explanation: The 14th Sirarakhong Hathei Chilli Festival was held in Sirarakhong Village, Ukhrul district of Manipur, celebrating the state’s GI-tagged Hathei chilli. This chilli is known for its bright red colour, strong aroma, and medium pungency, making it a unique agricultural product with significant culinary and commercial value. The festival blended cultural showcases with economic initiatives such as buyer-seller meets, market linkages for farmers, and tree plantation drives under the ‘Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam’ campaign. By promoting agri-tourism and biodiversity, the event highlights Manipur’s rich cultural identity and commitment to sustainable agricultural development.

questions.question: Who has been reappointed as the Executive Director of UN Women for a second term starting September 2025?
questions.explanation: Dr. Sima Bahous, a seasoned Jordanian diplomat, has been reappointed as the Executive Director of UN Women for a second term beginning on 11 September 2025 by UN Secretary-General António Guterres. During her first term, she advanced gender equality in global policy, enhanced operational transparency, and strengthened crisis response with a focus on women’s leadership. Her reappointment comes at a critical moment, coinciding with the launch of the UN Women Strategic Plan 2026–2029, which emphasizes eliminating violence against women, boosting economic participation, and embedding gender equality into sustainable development. This ensures continuity and strong leadership in global gender advocacy.

questions.question: Which district secured the top position in the Inspire Award 2025 by submitting 7,403 student ideas?
questions.explanation: Muzaffarpur, a district in Bihar, achieved the first position in the Inspire Award 2025 rankings by contributing an impressive 7,403 innovative student ideas. This remarkable achievement highlights the region’s strong emphasis on nurturing creativity and scientific thinking among school students. The Inspire Award – MANAK scheme, which targets students from classes 6 to 10, is designed to promote original and socially relevant ideas that can lead to practical solutions for community challenges. Muzaffarpur’s leading performance showcases how grassroots innovation is being fostered at the school level, setting a benchmark for other districts across India.

questions.question: On which date is World Patient Safety Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Patient Safety Day is observed every year on September 17 as a global initiative led by the World Health Organization. Established in 2019, the day seeks to highlight the critical importance of ensuring safe healthcare practices, reducing preventable harm, and promoting accountability in medical systems. In 2025, the theme focuses on “Safe Care for Every Newborn and Every Child,” emphasizing the protection of vulnerable groups such as infants and young children. The observance not only raises awareness but also encourages collaboration among healthcare providers, policymakers, and patients to strengthen systems for safer, more reliable care worldwide.

questions.question: Who won the FIDE Grand Swiss tournament for the second consecutive year?
questions.explanation: Vaishali Rameshbabu achieved a remarkable milestone by winning the FIDE Grand Swiss tournament for the second year in a row. Her victory was sealed with a final-round draw against former Women’s World Champion Tan Zhongyi in Uzbekistan, reflecting her consistency and resilience at the highest levels of competitive chess. This accomplishment further elevates her status as one of India’s leading women chess players. In the previous edition of the tournament, India celebrated a double victory as Vidit Gujrathi captured the men’s title, showcasing the country’s growing strength in the global chess arena.

questions.question: How many new sites has India added to UNESCO’s Tentative List of World Heritage Sites?
questions.explanation: India recently enriched its cultural and natural heritage representation by adding seven new sites to UNESCO’s Tentative List of World Heritage Sites. This brings the total number of Indian properties on the list to 69. The seven newly added sites include the Deccan Traps in Maharashtra, the Geological Heritage of St Mary’s Island Cluster in Karnataka, the Meghalayan Age Caves, the Naga Hill Ophiolite, Erra Matti Dibbalu, the Tirumala Hills, and the Varkala Cliff. This development highlights India’s efforts to preserve and showcase its geological and cultural diversity on a global platform.

questions.question: Which state government launched multiple campaigns as part of the Seva Parv 2025 celebrations?
questions.explanation: The Uttar Pradesh government has initiated several large-scale campaigns to mark the Seva Parv 2025 celebrations. These include the plantation of 15 lakh saplings to promote environmental sustainability, the Swachh Utsav to strengthen cleanliness drives, and the Swasth Nari Sashakt Parivar Abhiyan aimed at empowering women through health and blood donation camps. Additionally, the Urban Development Department will observe “Swachhata Hi Seva 2025,” reinforcing the importance of sanitation. These initiatives reflect a holistic approach by the state government, addressing environment, health, and cleanliness in alignment with sustainable development and community welfare goals.

questions.question: What global rank did Kotak811 achieve in banking app downloads during the first half of 2025?
questions.explanation: Kotak Mahindra Bank’s Kotak811 app achieved the 3rd position globally in banking app downloads in the first half of 2025, according to Sensor Tower. It recorded over 16 million downloads, surpassing SBI’s Yono app, which ranked 4th with 14 million downloads. This milestone marks a 250% year-on-year growth, making Kotak811 the fastest-growing banking app worldwide during this period. Remarkably, the surge came despite RBI restrictions earlier in the year that temporarily halted new digital onboarding. Kotak811’s digital-first, customer-centric model has played a pivotal role in its rapid adoption and global recognition.

questions.question: Which company has become the new lead sponsor of Team India in a ₹579 crore deal for 2025–2028?
questions.explanation: Apollo Tyres secured the role of Team India’s lead sponsor after winning a highly competitive bidding process organized by the BCCI. The ₹579 crore agreement covers 121 bilateral matches and 21 ICC fixtures from 2025 to 2028, replacing Dream11 as the previous sponsor. Apollo Tyres outbid Canva and JK Cements, setting one of the highest sponsorship values in Indian cricket history. This partnership provides Apollo with prime visibility on the Indian team’s jerseys across some of the most globally watched cricket tournaments, enhancing its international recognition and expanding its market presence in over 100 countries.

questions.question: What was India’s overall unemployment rate in August 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s overall unemployment rate in August 2025 stood at 5.1%, reflecting an improvement in both urban and rural employment conditions. Male unemployment dropped to 5.0%, reaching a five month low, while rural unemployment fell significantly from 5.1% in May to 4.3% in August. A notable highlight was the rise in female labour force participation, which climbed from 32% in June to 33.7% in August. These numbers suggest that the economy was stabilizing with more job opportunities emerging across regions, marking a positive trend in employment and workforce engagement during that period.

questions.question: On which date will World Bamboo Day 2025 be celebrated?
questions.explanation: World Bamboo Day 2025 will be observed on September 18 to raise awareness about bamboo’s ecological, cultural, and economic importance. First celebrated in 2009 during the 8th World Bamboo Congress in Bangkok, the day is coordinated by the World Bamboo Organization. The 2025 theme, “Next Generation Bamboo: Solution, Innovation, and Design”, highlights bamboo’s potential in climate resilience, sustainable livelihoods, and modern design. India, one of the largest bamboo producers, plays a key role through initiatives like the National Bamboo Mission, which promotes bamboo cultivation, processing, and innovation. Bamboo’s versatility makes it a critical resource for rural economies and environmental sustainability.

questions.question: Which team won the 2025 Duleep Trophy by defeating South Zone?
questions.explanation: The 2025 Duleep Trophy was won by Central Zone, who defeated South Zone by 6 wickets in the final. This victory marked Central Zone’s first Duleep Trophy title since the 2014-15 season, breaking a long gap and re-establishing their presence in domestic cricket. The team was captained by Rajat Patidar, who added this triumph to his successful run as an IPL player for Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Yash Rathod’s remarkable knock of 194 runs earned him the Player of the Match award, playing a decisive role in Central Zone’s championship victory.

questions.question: With which country did India sign an agreement to establish a satellite tracking and communication station near Diego Garcia?
questions.explanation: India signed a landmark agreement with Mauritius to set up a satellite tracking and communication station near Diego Garcia, located in the Chagos Archipelago. This initiative strengthens India’s strategic footprint in the Indian Ocean Region, an area of immense geopolitical significance due to its proximity to critical sea lanes. The station will enable India to monitor satellites and receive data more effectively, bolstering both scientific and defence related capabilities. Partnering with Mauritius, a close maritime ally, further deepens bilateral ties and highlights the growing cooperation between the two nations in space and regional security matters.

questions.question: What is India’s rank in the Global Innovation Index 2025?
questions.explanation: India has achieved the 38th position in the Global Innovation Index (GII) 2025, published by the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO). This marks a significant improvement from its 48th rank in 2020, showcasing India’s growing focus on research, knowledge outputs, and innovation driven growth. India also holds the top spot among lower middle income economies and in the Central and Southern Asia region. The GII evaluates 139 countries across more than 80 indicators spanning seven pillars, including infrastructure, human capital, institutions, and knowledge outputs. India’s rise demonstrates the success of its innovation ecosystem and its ability to leverage technology for economic development.

questions.question: Which state announced the expansion of the Chief Minister’s Nishchay Self Help Allowance Scheme for unemployed graduates?
questions.explanation: Bihar, under the leadership of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, expanded the Chief Minister’s Nishchay Self Help Allowance Scheme to support unemployed graduates from Arts, Science, and Commerce streams. The scheme targets young individuals between the ages of 20 and 25 who are actively searching for jobs and are not enrolled in further studies. Beneficiaries will receive a monthly allowance of ₹1,000 for up to two years, providing crucial financial support during their job seeking phase. This initiative reflects Bihar’s commitment to empowering its youth and reducing the financial hardships faced by unemployed graduates in the state.

questions.question: Where was the MANTHAN 2025 national conference inaugurated by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh?
questions.explanation: The MANTHAN 2025 national conference was inaugurated in New Delhi by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. Organised by the Directorate General of Defence Estates, the two day conference focused on the theme Strategic Roadmap to Aatmanirbhar Bharat @2047. The event highlighted the Defence Estates Department’s role in managing defence land and emphasised the importance of long term planning for strengthening India’s self reliance in the defence sector. Hosting the conference in the national capital provided a platform for policy makers, defence officials, and experts to collaborate on strategies that align with the country’s vision for 2047.

questions.question: On which date is International Equal Pay Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: International Equal Pay Day is observed annually on September 18 to highlight the global issue of the gender pay gap and the need for equal pay for equal work. Despite advances in gender equality, women worldwide still earn about 20% less than men, with structural and cultural factors such as occupational segregation, unpaid care work, and stereotypes contributing to this disparity. The observance, backed by the United Nations, ILO, and UN Women, is linked to SDG 5 (Gender Equality) and SDG 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth). It emphasises that closing the pay gap strengthens economic resilience, productivity, and social justice.

questions.question: What percentage stake did SBI sell in Yes Bank to Japan’s Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC)?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) sold a 13.18% stake in Yes Bank to Japan’s Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC) for ₹8,889 crore, marking one of the largest cross border deals in India’s banking sector. This transaction highlights growing global investor confidence in India’s financial reforms and the strengthening of strategic banking ties between India and Japan. The sale, which involved 413.44 crore equity shares, was completed after approvals from the RBI, CCI, and SBI’s board. Importantly, SBI retains a minority stake in Yes Bank, while SMBC now has clearance to raise its stake further, up to 24.99%.

questions.question: In which district of Madhya Pradesh did Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurate the PM Mitra Park?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the PM Mitra Park in Dhar district, Madhya Pradesh, as part of the government’s initiative to establish seven integrated textile parks across India. This park is envisioned as a self contained ecosystem that brings together spinning, weaving, processing, designing, and garment production in one location. It also aims to revive the cultural legacy of Maheshwari sarees, inspired by the vision of Devi Ahilyabai Holkar. By linking heritage with modern industry, the park is expected to empower artisans, create employment for rural youth, support farmers with fair cotton pricing, and strengthen India’s global textile competitiveness.

questions.question: Who is the author of the book Demography, Representation, Delimitation: The North–South Divide in India?
questions.explanation: The book Demography, Representation, Delimitation: The North–South Divide in India is authored by Ravi K Mishra. It examines the critical debates around delimitation, focusing on the redrawing of Lok Sabha constituency boundaries and its implications for representation in India. Mishra highlights the demographic divide between the northern and southern states, countering the idea that southern states deliberately controlled population growth. Instead, he argues that they simply moved earlier through the demographic transition. His work provides an in-depth analysis of representation, fairness, and the challenges of balancing political power across regions.

questions.question: In which state will the revised EVM ballot paper design be used for the first time in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Election Commission of India (ECI) recently introduced a revised design for EVM ballot papers to improve voter experience, focusing on visibility, readability, and uniformity. The updated design includes colored candidate photos, a standard font style, and a maximum of 15 candidates per sheet with the NOTA option placed after the last candidate. Importantly, the ECI confirmed that this new ballot paper design will first be implemented in the Bihar Elections of 2025, making Bihar the pioneering state for this initiative aimed at strengthening transparency and voter convenience.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as India’s new Ambassador to South Korea?
questions.explanation: Senior diplomat Gourangalal Das, a 1999-batch Indian Foreign Service officer, has been appointed as India’s next Ambassador to South Korea. Currently serving as Joint Secretary in the East Asia Division of the Ministry of External Affairs, he has played a vital role in managing India’s diplomatic engagements with key East Asian nations, including overseeing sensitive negotiations with China during the Eastern Ladakh border standoff. His appointment reflects India’s Act East Policy and Indo-Pacific strategy, highlighting the growing importance of South Korea as a partner in trade, technology, defence, and regional security. With his extensive East Asia expertise, Das is expected to strengthen bilateral cooperation and strategic ties between India and South Korea.

questions.question: Which country has sent the first hilsa consignment to India for Durga Puja 2025?
questions.explanation: Bangladesh has resumed its seasonal export of hilsa fish to India for Durga Puja 2025, though in a reduced quantity of 1,200 metric tonnes—the lowest since 2019. The first consignment of around 32 tonnes arrived in West Bengal via the Petrapole border on September 17, 2025. Hilsa from the Padma River in Bangladesh is particularly prized for its superior taste and cultural significance during Bengal’s biggest festival. The export window runs from September 16 to October 5, giving importers a limited period to complete shipments. This trade is seen as part of India-Bangladesh goodwill diplomacy, highlighting the strong cultural and economic ties between the two nations.

questions.question: Which country signed a mutual defence agreement with Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Pakistan and Saudi Arabia have entered into a significant mutual defence agreement during Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s official visit to Riyadh. The central feature of this pact is the collective security clause, under which any act of aggression against one nation will be regarded as aggression against both. This deepens the long-standing strategic and defence ties between the two countries, reinforcing regional security cooperation. The agreement comes at a critical geopolitical moment, following heightened tensions in the Gulf after an Israeli attack on Hamas leadership in Qatar, a close US ally. This move highlights Saudi Arabia’s pivotal role in regional defence alliances.

questions.question: Which Indian institute signed an MoU with Vietnam National University to boost research in AI, medical technology, and innovation?
questions.explanation: On September 18, 2025, IIT Kanpur and Vietnam National University (VNU) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to strengthen academic and research collaboration. The agreement focuses on key areas such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), medical technology, smart cities, drone applications, and advanced material research. This partnership is expected to foster joint research projects, enhance student and faculty exchange programs, and contribute to the socio-economic needs of both nations. It also aligns with India’s Act East Policy by deepening academic and technological ties with Southeast Asia. For Vietnam, the collaboration offers access to India’s expertise in cutting-edge STEM fields, thereby advancing innovation and capacity building.

questions.question: Which country has recently announced a new emissions reduction target of 62% by 2035 under the Paris Agreement?
questions.explanation: Australia has significantly raised its climate ambition by setting a new emissions reduction target of 62% by 2035, based on 2005 levels. Announced by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, this target builds upon the earlier pledge of a 43% cut by 2030. The move aligns with Australia’s obligations under the Paris Agreement and responds to growing domestic risks such as bushfires, droughts, rising sea levels, and biodiversity loss. The country has faced global criticism for its reliance on fossil fuels, making this updated target an important step toward decarbonisation. Backed by recommendations from the Climate Change Authority, it underscores Australia’s intent to balance economic development with climate responsibility.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the Technical Cooperation Programme signed between India and FAO?
questions.explanation: India has partnered with the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) through a Technical Cooperation Programme with the key goal of building world-class Blue Ports. This initiative, led by the Department of Fisheries, focuses on modernizing fishing port infrastructure by integrating cutting-edge technologies such as 5G connectivity, artificial intelligence, and automation.
