The aim is to strengthen the marine economy, improve sustainability, and enhance export potential. As part of the framework, three pilot harbours in Diu, Puducherry, and Gujarat have been approved with a combined investment of ₹369.8 crore, setting the foundation for a global-standard Blue Economy infrastructure in India.

questions.question: By how many basis points did the US Federal Reserve cut its benchmark interest rate in its first 2025 rate reduction?
questions.explanation: The US Federal Reserve reduced its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points (bps), bringing the range to 4.00%–4.25%. This marks the first rate cut of 2025 and signals the beginning of a potential easing cycle. The decision was influenced by signs of a cooling labour market, slower economic growth, and moderating inflation that remains above the 2% target. The Fed’s move aims to lower borrowing costs, encourage business investment, and support consumer spending, while still balancing the risks of inflation. Globally, the cut is expected to shape monetary policy sentiment, impacting capital flows, debt markets, and investor strategies across emerging and developed economies.

questions.question: What is the name of the new framework launched by SEBI to attract low-risk foreign investors such as sovereign wealth funds and pension funds?
questions.explanation: SEBI has introduced SWAGAT-FI, a specialised framework designed to attract low-risk foreign investors, including sovereign wealth funds and pension funds. This framework aims to provide a more stable and investor-friendly environment by extending the registration period from 3 years to 10 years, thereby ensuring long-term participation in Indian markets. To further ease operations, a dedicated digital portal has been established, significantly reducing onboarding time to just one week. Additionally, it streamlines access to GIFT-IFSC, India’s international financial hub, making the investment process more efficient and transparent. This initiative strengthens India’s financial ecosystem globally.

questions.question: Who has become Bihar’s first Woman FIDE Master in chess?
questions.explanation: Marium Fatima, a young chess talent from Muzaffarpur, has created history by becoming Bihar’s first Woman FIDE Master (WFM). This achievement marks a significant milestone not only in her personal career but also in Bihar’s sporting legacy. The WFM title, awarded by the Fédération Internationale des Échecs (FIDE), recognises players who achieve a rating threshold of over 2100 and consistently perform at an international standard. Marium’s accomplishment reflects her strategic acumen, dedication, and perseverance in the sport of chess. Her success has drawn recognition from the Bihar State Sports Authority and will inspire upcoming players, especially young women, to pursue excellence in chess.

questions.question: In which year is the India-AI Impact Summit scheduled to be held?
questions.explanation: The India-AI Impact Summit is scheduled to take place in 2026, marking the first time a global AI summit will be hosted by a nation from the Global South. The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) unveiled the official logo and initiatives for the event. The summit will focus on democratizing access to AI while ensuring safe and trusted ecosystems guided by the principles of People, Planet, and Progress. Flagship programs such as UDAAN Pitch Fest, YuvaAI, AI by HER, and the Global Innovation Challenge will encourage innovation, entrepreneurship, and inclusive participation in shaping AI’s future.

questions.question: Which country’s Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) agency upgraded India’s sovereign credit rating to BBB+?
questions.explanation: India’s sovereign credit rating was upgraded to BBB+ by Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I), a well-known credit rating agency based in Japan. The upgrade reflects growing confidence in India’s strong domestic demand, prudent fiscal management, and external stability. This marks the third upgrade India has received in 2025, following earlier positive revisions by Morningstar DBRS and S&P Global Ratings. R&I also acknowledged India’s ongoing structural reforms, such as the two-tier GST system and infrastructure expansion. The move strengthens India’s global investment appeal while reinforcing Japan’s role in recognizing India’s growing economic resilience and potential on the world stage.

questions.question: Who has been proposed as the next First Deputy Managing Director of the IMF by Kristalina Georgieva?
questions.explanation: Daniel Katz, a senior U.S. Treasury official and Chief of Staff to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, has been nominated by IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva as the next First Deputy Managing Director, the second-highest position at the IMF. If approved by the IMF Executive Board, his appointment will take effect on October 6, 2025. Katz brings over a decade of experience in domestic and international economic policy, including work on U.S.-China trade, financial stability, and coordination with multilateral institutions like the IMF and World Bank. His nomination follows Gita Gopinath’s departure and reflects strategic leadership continuity in global finance.

questions.question: In which country did Typhoon Mitag make landfall?
questions.explanation: Typhoon Mitag, the 17th typhoon of the year, made landfall in Guangdong Province, China, particularly affecting Shanwei City with strong winds of up to 25 m/s near its center. Authorities expect the typhoon to weaken gradually as it moves northwest at 10–15 km/h. In response to the threat, China’s State Flood Control initiated a Level-IV emergency to ensure preparedness and reduce potential damage. The event underlines the vulnerability of coastal provinces in China to seasonal typhoons and highlights the importance of early warning systems and effective disaster management to protect lives and infrastructure from severe weather events.

questions.question: Which company signed an MoU with Oil India Limited for the exploration of critical minerals?
questions.explanation: Oil India Limited and Hindustan Copper Limited entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to work together on the exploration of critical minerals. This collaboration particularly focuses on copper and its associated minerals, which are crucial for industrial growth and energy transition. The agreement also aligns with the objectives of the National Critical Mineral Mission, which is aimed at strengthening India’s mineral security. By engaging in this strategic partnership, Hindustan Copper and Oil India seek to ensure access to essential mineral resources, thereby supporting economic growth and technological advancement in the country.

questions.question: In which state was the ‘Anbu Karangal’ scheme for orphaned children launched by Chief Minister?
questions.explanation: The ‘Anbu Karangal’ (Hands of Love) scheme was launched in Tamil Nadu by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin on September 16, 2025. This welfare initiative provides ₹2,000 monthly financial support to orphaned children until they complete school education or reach the age of 18. In its first phase, over 6,000 children across Tamil Nadu will directly benefit. The scheme ensures uninterrupted education, protection under the Juvenile Justice Act, and access to digital resources such as laptops for college-bound orphans. Additionally, a mobile app developed with the Tamil Nadu e-Governance Agency enables transparency, real-time monitoring, and grievance redressal, ensuring effective implementation statewide.

questions.question: Where will the 10th Ayurveda Day be celebrated on 23rd September?
questions.explanation: The 10th Ayurveda Day will be celebrated on 23rd September at the All India Institute of Ayurveda in Goa. This year’s theme is "Ayurveda for People and Planet," which emphasises the significance of Ayurveda not only for individual health but also for the overall well-being of the planet. By choosing Goa as the host location, the government highlights its efforts to promote Ayurveda at a global scale. The event also underlines the growing recognition and acceptance of Ayurveda as a holistic system of health and healing worldwide.

questions.question: On which date will International Red Panda Day 2025 be celebrated?
questions.explanation: International Red Panda Day 2025 will be observed on September 20, which falls on the third Saturday of September. This global observance was launched in 2010 by the Red Panda Network to highlight the urgent need for conservation of the endangered red panda, often referred to as the “Firefox.” With fewer than 10,000 individuals left in the wild, the red panda faces threats such as habitat loss, poaching, and low reproduction rates. Celebrating the day on September 20 draws international attention, generates support for conservation projects, and strengthens community-led initiatives to protect this rare and captivating Himalayan species.

questions.question: Zubeen Garg, the legendary singer of “Ya Ali” fame who passed away in 2025, was an icon of which Indian state?
questions.explanation: Zubeen Garg, one of India’s most versatile and celebrated musicians, was an icon of Assam and the greater Northeast. Born in 1972, he built an extraordinary career spanning over three decades, with more than 38,000 songs recorded across 40 languages. He gained national recognition through the Bollywood hit “Ya Ali” from Gangster (2006), but his contribution to Assamese music and culture was unparalleled. Beyond singing, he was also a composer, actor, filmmaker, and philanthropist. His sudden passing in Singapore at age 52 left a deep void in Indian music. Leaders and fans across the country paid heartfelt tributes, acknowledging his role in carrying Assam’s cultural legacy to the national and global stage.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian bowler to take 100 wickets in T20 Internationals?
questions.explanation: Arshdeep Singh achieved a historic milestone by becoming the first Indian bowler to claim 100 wickets in T20 Internationals. He reached the landmark during India’s Asia Cup 2025 group-stage match against Oman, dismissing Vinayak Shukla as his 100th wicket. Remarkably, Arshdeep accomplished this feat in just 64 matches and 1,329 deliveries, making him the fastest fast bowler globally to reach the milestone and the fourth-fastest overall. Known for his powerplay effectiveness and death-over dominance, he has consistently outperformed peers like Haris Rauf. His achievement cements his position as one of India’s finest modern-day T20 specialists and a global pace-bowling force.

questions.question: How many natural sites has India recently added to UNESCO’s Tentative List of World Heritage Sites?
questions.explanation: India has added seven new natural sites to UNESCO’s Tentative List, bringing the country’s total Tentative List entries to 69, which includes 49 cultural, 17 natural, and 3 mixed properties. The newly added sites span various states, including Maharashtra, Karnataka, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Andhra Pradesh, and Kerala, and feature significant geological, climatic, and ecological importance. Examples include the Deccan Traps, St. Mary’s Island Cluster, Meghalayan Age Caves, and Varkala Cliffs. Inclusion in the Tentative List is a prerequisite for full UNESCO World Heritage nomination, emphasizing India’s commitment to preserving its natural heritage.

questions.question: Who has been selected to receive the Dadasaheb Phalke Award 2023 at the 71st National Film Awards?
questions.explanation: Mohanlal, the legendary Malayalam actor, has been awarded the Dadasaheb Phalke Award 2023, India’s highest honour in cinema. The award will be presented during the 71st National Film Awards ceremony on September 23, 2025. With a career spanning over four decades and more than 400 films, Mohanlal is celebrated for his versatility and contributions across Indian cinema, including Tamil, Hindi, and Telugu films. He has previously received Padma Shri (2001), Padma Bhushan (2019), five National Film Awards, and nine Kerala State Film Awards. This lifetime achievement award recognises his enduring impact on Indian cinema and his role in shaping the industry’s history.

questions.question: Which Indian state became the first to issue ID cards to Women Self-Help Group (SHG) members?
questions.explanation: Tamil Nadu became the first state in India to launch ID cards for Women Self-Help Group (SHG) members, a major step toward grassroots women empowerment. The initiative, launched by Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin on September 16, 2025, provides economic and social benefits, including free travel up to 100 km on government buses, discounts on products from state-run enterprises, and easier access to welfare schemes. Over five lakh SHGs in the state are expected to benefit, strengthening financial inclusion and legitimizing women-led economic activity. The program aligns with existing women-centric initiatives like Magalir Vidiyal Payanam and Magalir Urimai Thogai, ensuring streamlined access to benefits.

questions.question: Which organization unveiled “A New Strategic EU–India Agenda” to deepen ties with India in trade, technology, defence, and climate?
questions.explanation: The European Commission, along with EU High Representative Kaja Kallas, unveiled “A New Strategic EU–India Agenda” in Brussels to strengthen EU–India cooperation across trade, technology, defence, and climate. The initiative aims to elevate India–EU relations while addressing concerns over India’s military exercises with Russia and oil imports from Moscow. It aligns with ongoing FTA negotiations, the EU’s interest in a rules-based international order, and the growing trade volume between the two regions, which has increased nearly 90% over the last decade. The agenda also focuses on climate, technology, and strategic autonomy, balancing economic and geopolitical priorities for both India and the EU.

questions.question: Which company received RBI approval to operate as an online payment aggregator in India?
questions.explanation: PhonePe received final approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on September 19, 2025, to operate as an online payment aggregator. This authorization allows the fintech platform to provide secure and scalable digital payment solutions, particularly benefiting small and medium enterprises (SMEs) that previously lacked easy access to online payment infrastructure. As a payment aggregator, PhonePe will act as an intermediary between customers, merchants, and banks, ensuring secure transactions, operational transparency, and consumer protection. The move strengthens India’s digital payments ecosystem and supports financial inclusion by enabling seamless digital transactions for a wider range of businesses across urban and rural areas.

questions.question: Which Indian state hosted the Asian Cadet Cup 2025, inaugurated by CM Pushkar Singh Dhami?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand hosted the Asian Cadet Cup India-2025 in Haldwani, marking the first-ever international fencing event held in India. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami inaugurated the tournament on September 19, 2025, at Manaskhand Hall, Indira Gandhi International Sports Stadium. The event attracted over 250 athletes, including 150 Indian competitors and participants from countries like Tajikistan, Syria, Malaysia, Sri Lanka, Thailand, and Indonesia. The state government has launched major sports initiatives, including the first sports university and women’s sports college in Haldwani, investments in world-class infrastructure, and a sports quota in government jobs, signaling Uttarakhand’s emergence as a growing hub for athletic excellence.

questions.question: Which Indian state became the first to set up an Urban Policy Commission with a 25-year roadmap for sustainable urbanisation?
questions.explanation: Kerala is the first state in India to establish the Kerala Urban Policy Commission (KUPC), which provides a 25-year strategic roadmap to manage rapid urbanisation sustainably. The KUPC focuses on climate-sensitive urban planning, real-time urban data systems, green fees, municipal and pooled bonds, and governance reforms such as elected city cabinets. It emphasises place-based urban growth, inclusive planning, and community-driven data integration, aiming to balance development with climate resilience, cultural preservation, and social welfare. Kerala’s model serves as a benchmark for other states, offering lessons in creating climate-aware, financially empowered, and participatory urban ecosystems.

questions.question: Which port provides India an alternative trade route to Afghanistan and Central Asia, bypassing Pakistan, and serves as a strategic counterweight to China’s Gwadar Port?
questions.explanation: Chabahar Port, located in Iran’s Sistan-Baluchistan region, is India’s only deep-sea port with direct open-ocean access outside the Strait of Hormuz. Developed under the 2016 Chabahar Agreement between India, Iran, and Afghanistan, it offers a vital trade route to Afghanistan and Central Asia, bypassing Pakistan. The port enhances India’s regional connectivity via the International North-South Transport Corridor (INSTC), supports humanitarian aid, and strengthens strategic presence in the Indian Ocean. It also counters China’s Gwadar Port and BRI influence, making it central to India’s economic and geopolitical ambitions despite challenges like US sanctions.

questions.question: Which country did India agree to restart trade and strategic talks with following diplomatic consultations in September 2025?
questions.explanation: India and Canada agreed to restart bilateral dialogues on trade, defence, energy, and critical minerals following pre-Foreign Office consultations on September 19, 2025. The decision builds on discussions between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney at the G7 Summit earlier that year. The renewed talks aim to enhance market access, revive stalled trade negotiations, strengthen defence and security cooperation, and collaborate on critical minerals and civil nuclear energy. This initiative reflects both countries’ commitment to rebuilding trust, addressing previous diplomatic and consular challenges, and fostering a constructive, long-term strategic partnership.

questions.question: Which regulatory body launched the Bima Sugam digital insurance marketplace in India?
questions.explanation: The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) launched Bima Sugam, a unified digital marketplace for various insurance products including life, health, motor, travel, and general insurance. The platform, operated by the Bima Sugam India Federation (BSIF), will be rolled out in phases, with full transactional functions expected by December 2025. Bima Sugam aims to improve accessibility, transparency, and trust in insurance services, connecting insurers, brokers, agents, banks, and policyholders through a single interface. By streamlining comparison, purchase, renewal, and claim processes, the initiative supports India’s vision of “Insurance for All by 2047” and strengthens the country’s digital public infrastructure.

questions.question: Who broke Virat Kohli’s record for the fastest ODI century by an Indian?
questions.explanation: Smriti Mandhana etched her name in history by scoring the fastest ODI century ever by an Indian, surpassing Virat Kohli’s 52-ball record set in 2013. On 20 September 2025, during the 3rd ODI against Australia at the Arun Jaitley Stadium, New Delhi, she reached her hundred in just 50 balls. Her blistering knock of 125 runs off 65 balls included 17 fours and 5 sixes, and she completed her century with a massive six over midwicket. This achievement also places her second in the list of fastest women’s ODI centuries, behind only Meg Lanning’s 45-ball ton, further cementing her legacy.

questions.question: In which Indian state was Dhordo dedicated as the country’s fourth solar village?
questions.explanation: Dhordo, located in Kutch, Gujarat, was dedicated as India’s fourth solar powered village by PM Modi during the ‘Samudra Se Samriddhi’ programme in Bhavnagar. This initiative ensures that every residential electricity connection in Dhordo benefits from solar energy under the PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana. Gujarat has been a pioneer in promoting solar villages, with Modhera, Sukhi, and Masali being the other solar powered villages in the state. Dhordo’s recognition as the ‘Best Tourism Village’ by the UNWTO highlights its potential for sustainable tourism alongside renewable energy adoption, making it a model for green development in India.

questions.question: With which country did India conduct its first bilateral naval exercise in the Mediterranean Sea in September 2025?
questions.explanation: India and Greece successfully conducted their first ever bilateral naval exercise in the Mediterranean Sea, marking an important step in strengthening defence ties. The exercise, held from 13–18 September 2025, was carried out in two phases—harbour and sea. The harbour phase at Salamis Naval Base included cross deck visits, professional exchanges, and cultural interactions, while the sea phase featured advanced operations such as anti submarine drills, coordinated gun firing, and cross deck helicopter missions. With INS Trikand and HS Themistokles participating, the exercise enhanced interoperability, reinforced maritime cooperation, and highlighted the shared commitment of India and Greece to maritime security and global stability.

questions.question: On which date will World Rhino Day 2025 be observed?
questions.explanation: World Rhino Day is observed every year to spread awareness about the conservation of rhinos, which are among the most endangered species globally. In 2025, this important day falls on September 22. It serves as a reminder of the threats rhinos face, including poaching, habitat destruction, and human-wildlife conflict. Established in 2011, the day draws attention to all five existing species: Greater One-Horned, Black, White, Javan, and Sumatran rhinos. Celebrating this day emphasizes the need for stronger conservation measures and global cooperation to protect these majestic animals from extinction.

questions.question: Which Indian state recorded the highest debt-to-GSDP ratio according to the CAG report?
questions.explanation: The CAG report highlights the alarming increase in public debt among Indian states over the past decade. While several states have seen a significant rise in their debt-to-GSDP ratio, Punjab emerged with the highest figure at 40.35%. This indicates that Punjab’s debt burden, in proportion to its economic output, is more severe than other states. Nagaland followed with 37.15%, and West Bengal with 33.70%. Such high ratios raise concerns about fiscal sustainability, state finances, and the ability of governments to manage long-term liabilities while still investing in growth and development.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the India Shrimp Tariff Act introduced in the US Senate?
questions.explanation: The India Shrimp Tariff Act, introduced by US Senators Bill Cassidy and Cindy Hyde-Smith, aims to protect Louisiana’s shrimp and catfish industries from the impact of cheap shrimp imports from India. Lawmakers argue that Indian shrimp has been “dumped” into the US market at very low prices, hurting local producers, processors, and related jobs. By imposing tariffs, the Act seeks to create a level playing field, ensure fair competition, and safeguard Gulf Coast seafood industries. While this move supports domestic producers, it could also heighten trade tensions between India and the US, potentially leading to disputes at the WTO.

questions.question: Where will the Bharat International Rice Conference 2025 be held?
questions.explanation: The Bharat International Rice Conference 2025 (BIRC 2025) is scheduled to take place on October 30–31, 2025, at Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi. Organized by the Indian Rice Exporters Forum (IREF) in collaboration with APEDA under the Ministry of Commerce & Industry, the event focuses on promoting India’s rice industry. India, being the largest producer and exporter of rice globally, including premium basmati rice, will use this platform to discuss trade opportunities, technological advancements, and sustainable practices in rice production. Hosting the conference in New Delhi underscores the city’s role as a hub for major national and international trade events.

questions.question: In which country did India set up its first defence manufacturing plant in Africa?
questions.explanation: India has established its first defence manufacturing plant in Africa at Berrechid, Morocco, through Tata Advanced Systems Maroc. This facility focuses on producing Wheeled Armoured Platforms and represents a milestone under the Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative, which seeks to make India self reliant in defence production. The inauguration coincided with Defence Minister Rajnath Singh’s official visit, marking the first ever visit by an Indian Defence Minister to Morocco. This development enhances bilateral defence cooperation, strengthens India’s strategic outreach in Africa, and positions India as a global defence exporter. It also opens opportunities for joint projects, training, and industrial partnerships.

questions.question: What is the officially estimated logistics cost of India as a percentage of GDP?
questions.explanation: India’s logistics cost has been officially estimated at 7.97% of GDP, replacing earlier inflated figures of 13–14%. This estimate is based on a hybrid methodology combining secondary data with large scale nationwide surveys, ensuring a precise and data driven assessment. The report highlights improved efficiency in logistics, as reflected in reduced freight costs and turnaround times, and supports policy measures under the National Logistics Policy. Platforms like ULIP, NICDC, and programs such as SMILE and GatiShakti contribute to streamlining infrastructure, enhancing multimodal transport, and promoting India as a competitive global logistics hub.

questions.question: Where has Asia’s largest rail operations command centre been unveiled?
questions.explanation: Asia’s largest rail operations command centre has been established at Sabarmati in Ahmedabad, serving as the hub for the Western Dedicated Freight Corridor (WDFC). This state-of-the-art facility manages operations across a 1,506 km stretch spanning five states. The Sabarmati Operations Command Centre is equipped with advanced features like AI-ready systems, automated alarms, and disaster management capabilities. It also boasts a massive real-time monitoring video wall, making it the most advanced facility of its kind in the region. The centre plays a vital role in improving efficiency, safety, and coordination for freight movement in India.

questions.question: Where was the ICGS Adamya, the first Adamya-class Fast Patrol Vessel, commissioned?
questions.explanation: The ICGS Adamya, the first of eight Adamya-class Fast Patrol Vessels (FPVs), was commissioned at Paradip Port in Odisha. Built by Goa Shipyard Limited, this vessel enhances India’s coastal security and patrolling capabilities. Paradip Port, established in 1962 by Late Biju Patnaik and declared India’s eighth major port in 1966, is Odisha’s only major port. Located at the confluence of the Mahanadi River and the Bay of Bengal, the port plays a crucial role in maritime trade and strategic naval operations. Commissioning of ICGS Adamya here highlights the port’s significance in India’s defence infrastructure.

questions.question: Who was sworn in as the Chief Justice of Patna High Court at Raj Bhavan, Patna?
questions.explanation: Justice Pavankumar Bhimappa Bajanthri was recently sworn in as the Chief Justice of Patna High Court at Raj Bhavan, Patna. The oath was administered by Bihar Governor Arif Mohammad Khan in the presence of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary. The Patna High Court, established in 1916, has been pivotal in delivering landmark rulings across constitutional, criminal, and socio-economic matters. This appointment strengthens the leadership at the court, ensuring continuity in judicial excellence and upholding constitutional values in the state of Bihar.

questions.question: Who won the gold medal in the 400m at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo with the fastest time in 40 years?
questions.explanation: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone achieved a historic feat by winning the gold medal in the 400m at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo. She clocked 47.78 seconds, which is the fastest time recorded by a woman in the event since 1985. This performance not only earned her the gold medal but also placed her as the second-fastest woman in history, just behind Marita Koch’s longstanding 47.60s record. Marileidy Paulino secured the silver medal, while Salwa Eid Naser took the bronze. McLaughlin-Levrone’s achievement underscores her dominance in athletics and her place among the sport’s greatest performers.

questions.question: Where is the 28th National Conference on e-Governance (NCeG) 2025 being held?
questions.explanation: The 28th National Conference on e-Governance (NCeG) 2025 is being hosted in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, on 22–23 September 2025. The event is jointly organized by the Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances (DARPG) and the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), in collaboration with the Government of Andhra Pradesh. With the theme ‘Viksit Bharat: Civil Service and Digital Transformation,’ the conference aims to highlight the role of digital innovation in governance. The inauguration is led by Dr. Jitendra Singh and Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu, making it a significant platform for discussing technology-driven governance.

questions.question: Which international financial institution signed a $125 million loan agreement with India to upgrade infrastructure in Assam?
questions.explanation: On September 22, 2025, the Government of India signed a $125 million loan agreement with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to strengthen infrastructure in Assam. The initiative, called the Assam Urban Sector Development Project, aims to improve urban water supply, enhance flood management systems, and promote better urban governance. Around 360,000 residents are expected to benefit directly from this project. Key interventions include constructing six water treatment plants, laying 800 km of pipelines, and upgrading Guwahati’s drainage systems to reduce flooding. Additionally, institutional reforms such as GIS-based property tax databases and digital billing systems will ensure transparency and financial sustainability.

questions.question: On which date will Ayurveda Day 2025 be celebrated for the first time instead of Dhanteras?
questions.explanation: Ayurveda Day 2025 will be observed on September 23, marking the first time it is celebrated on a fixed date instead of Dhanteras, which varied every year due to the lunar calendar. The Ministry of Ayush made this change through a Gazette Notification issued on March 23, 2025, to ensure consistency and global recognition of Ayurveda. The chosen date coincides with the autumnal equinox, symbolizing balance in nature—an essential principle of Ayurveda. With the theme “Ayurveda for People and Planet,” the observance underscores Ayurveda’s role in preventive healthcare, sustainable living, and global ecological balance.

questions.question: Which country was directly struck by Super Typhoon Ragasa, causing severe winds and storm surges?
questions.explanation: Super Typhoon Ragasa made landfall on Calayan Island in Cagayan province, Philippines, bringing destructive winds of 215 kph and gusts up to 295 kph. The impact raised the risk of storm surges exceeding 3 meters, endangering coastal communities. While neighboring regions such as Taiwan, Vietnam, China, Hong Kong, and Macau prepared for heavy rains, flight cancellations, and evacuations, the Philippines bore the brunt of the initial landfall. This event highlights the vulnerability of island nations to tropical cyclones and underscores the importance of preparedness and disaster management in mitigating the impact of such devastating natural disasters.

questions.question: Who created history by winning India’s first-ever medal in the Junior Men’s One-Lap Road Sprint at the Inline Speed World Championships?
questions.explanation: Anish Raj achieved a historic milestone for India by securing a bronze medal in the Junior Men’s One-Lap Road Sprint at the 73rd Inline Speed World Championships held in Beidaihe, China. With a time of 39.714 seconds, he became the first Indian ever to win a medal in this category at the global level. His victory not only highlighted his personal talent and dedication but also marked a breakthrough for India in international roller sports. In addition to this, Anish has also proven his consistency by winning a gold medal at the 20th Asian Roller-Skating Championships in South Korea.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of IndusInd Bank effective September 22, 2025?
questions.explanation: IndusInd Bank appointed Viral Damania as its new Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Key Managerial Personnel effective September 22, 2025. His appointment comes during a leadership restructuring following a significant accounting lapse that impacted the bank’s financial stability. Damania brings over 27 years of experience in banking and professional services, having previously served as CFO of Bank of America, India, and held roles with Citibank across India, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka, as well as with PwC. His credentials as a Chartered Accountant, Company Secretary, and Information Systems Auditor strengthen his ability to enhance governance, restore investor confidence, and ensure accurate financial reporting at IndusInd Bank.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Sign Languages observed in 2025?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Sign Languages 2025 will be observed on September 23 with the theme “Sign Language Unites Us.” This day, recognized by the United Nations, emphasizes the role of sign languages in ensuring inclusion, accessibility, and cultural diversity for the deaf and hard of hearing community. The date was chosen to commemorate the establishment of the World Federation of the Deaf (WFD) in 1951, a global body advocating for deaf rights. By highlighting sign languages as tools of empathy and unity, the day underscores the importance of accessibility in education, workplaces, and public life.

questions.question: In which state did PM Modi launch ₹5,100 crore worth of infrastructure projects on September 22, 2025?
questions.explanation: On September 22, 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated infrastructure projects worth ₹5,100 crore in Arunachal Pradesh, marking a significant step in regional development and clean energy progress. These projects include major hydropower initiatives in Shi Yomi district, extensive road networks, upgraded healthcare facilities, modern fire safety systems, and a convention centre in Tawang. The hydropower projects are designed to boost India’s renewable energy capacity and create thousands of jobs, positioning Arunachal Pradesh as a key contributor to the nation’s clean energy mission. This development also strengthens connectivity and economic growth in the Northeast region of India.

questions.question: What is the new name of Ahmednagar Railway Station in Maharashtra?
questions.explanation: Ahmednagar Railway Station in Maharashtra has been renamed ‘Ahilyanagar’ in honour of Devi Ahilyabai Holkar, one of India’s most respected women rulers. Ahilyabai Holkar, who ruled between 1725 and 1795, is celebrated for her progressive governance, support for women’s rights, and contributions to spiritual architecture, including temples and ghats across India. The renaming is a tribute to her legacy of justice, compassion, and cultural development. Although the station has adopted the new name, its operational code remains unchanged as ANG, ensuring continuity for passengers and railway operations. This change preserves history while modernizing identity.

questions.question: What is India’s rank in the Global Digital Nomad Report 2025?
questions.explanation: In the Global Digital Nomad Report 2025, India secured the 38th position with a score of 84.85 among 64 countries evaluated. The report assesses nations on factors such as visa procedures, tax benefits, economic stability, quality of life, and digital infrastructure—crucial elements that attract digital nomads. While Spain emerged at the top, India’s 38th rank highlights both opportunities and challenges in becoming a preferred destination for remote workers. The ranking shows that India has potential due to its affordability and growing digital infrastructure but still needs to improve on aspects like streamlined visas and lifestyle offerings to rise further.

questions.question: Who is the author of the upcoming debut book titled "Why the Constitution Matters", set to release in 2025?
questions.explanation: The debut book "Why the Constitution Matters" is authored by former Chief Justice DY Chandrachud and will be released in 2025 by Penguin Random House. Justice Chandrachud is recognised for his progressive and landmark rulings in areas such as privacy, gender equality, LGBTQ+ rights, and freedom of expression. With more than 25 years of judicial experience, his book aims to highlight the Constitution’s role as a living document shaping democracy, justice, and individual rights. This makes him an influential voice in the legal and constitutional discourse of India.

questions.question: Which company announced a $100 billion investment in OpenAI to deploy 10 GW of AI infrastructure by 2026?
questions.explanation: Nvidia has committed $100 billion to invest in OpenAI, aiming to deploy 10 GW of AI infrastructure by 2026. This strategic partnership will involve co-optimisation of hardware and software, enabling OpenAI to scale its AI models like GPT and Codex efficiently. The initiative positions Nvidia as the preferred compute and networking partner for OpenAI, strengthening its dominance in the AI chip market. By building dedicated AI infrastructure, OpenAI gains long-term access to the compute power required for next-generation AI models. This historic investment will also influence the global AI ecosystem, prompting other tech companies to rethink their AI infrastructure strategies.

questions.question: Which country is launching the K Visa from October 1, 2025, to attract young global STEM professionals amid U.S. H-1B visa restrictions?
questions.explanation: China is introducing the K Visa starting October 1, 2025, to attract young STEM professionals and researchers worldwide. This visa offers flexible work rights, multiple entries, longer validity, and does not require a local employer or sponsor, distinguishing it from traditional Chinese work visas. The initiative is positioned as an alternative to the U.S., where recent H-1B visa restrictions and high fees have created challenges for global talent. By facilitating education, research, entrepreneurship, and cultural exchange, the K Visa aims to strengthen China’s innovation ecosystem and make the country an attractive destination for skilled professionals seeking international opportunities.

questions.question: Which state has launched the Rs 1,000 crore LEAP programme to boost innovation and create 5 lakh jobs over five years?
questions.explanation: Karnataka has launched the Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP) with a budget of ₹1,000 crore over five years. The initiative aims to create 5 lakh jobs and develop startup ecosystems beyond Bengaluru by supporting emerging tech clusters across the state, including Mysuru‑Chamarajanagar, Mangaluru‑Udupi, and Hubbali‑Belagavi‑Dharwad. LEAP provides infrastructure, funding, mentorship, and skill-building opportunities to startups from schools to global markets. The programme intends to distribute innovation more evenly across Karnataka, strengthen regional economies, and reduce migration pressures to major cities, positioning the state as a hub for sustainable, inclusive technological growth.

questions.question: Where was the 25th Interpol Asian Regional Conference, in which India was elected to the Interpol Asian Committee, held?
questions.explanation: The 25th Interpol Asian Regional Conference, where India was elected as a member of the Interpol Asian Committee, took place in Singapore. This committee plays a crucial role in advising the Asian Regional Conference on pressing issues such as organised crime, cybercrime, terrorism, human trafficking, and drug trafficking. India’s delegation, led by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), secured its place through the election, reflecting its increasing influence in global law enforcement collaboration. The choice of Singapore as the host city further highlights its role as a strategic hub for international cooperation and security dialogue in the Asian region.

questions.question: Which state will host the 19th National Jamboree of the Bharat Scouts and Guides in November 2025?
questions.explanation: The 19th National Jamboree of the Bharat Scouts and Guides will be hosted by Uttar Pradesh from November 23–29, 2025, in Lucknow’s Vrindavan Scheme. The event will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on November 24. This is not the first time Uttar Pradesh is hosting; it also organised the 4th edition back in 1964, marking a long historical association with scouting activities. The Jamboree serves as a platform for thousands of scouts and guides across India to come together, share skills, and strengthen the spirit of unity, discipline, and service, making it a significant national event.

questions.question: Which financial institution has launched the “Savings Pro” facility offering up to 6.5% returns by auto-investing surplus funds into overnight mutual funds?
questions.explanation: Jio Payments Bank has introduced the “Savings Pro” facility to help customers earn higher returns on idle funds. Under this scheme, account holders can set a minimum balance threshold starting from ₹5,000, and any surplus above this amount is automatically invested in select overnight mutual funds. The facility offers returns of up to 6.5% per annum, with flexible redemption options allowing up to 90% instant withdrawal (maximum ₹50,000) and full redemption within 1–2 working days. Savings Pro combines the liquidity of a savings account with the growth potential of short-term investments, enhancing customer convenience through a fully digital process via the JioFinance app.

questions.question: Which country is partnering with India in the Maitri 2.0 cross-incubation programme in Agritech launched by ICAR?
questions.explanation: Maitri 2.0 is the second edition of the India-Brazil Cross-Incubation Programme in Agritech, launched by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR). The initiative is designed to promote collaboration between Indian and Brazilian innovators to strengthen the agri-food ecosystem. It emphasises sustainable agriculture, the use of digital technologies, and improved value chains to make food systems more resilient. Brazil’s strong agricultural base and India’s innovation potential make this partnership strategically important, as it enables knowledge sharing, joint research, and the adoption of best practices to address global food security challenges.

questions.question: In which city was the Startup Conclave 2025, inaugurated by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, held?
questions.explanation: The Startup Conclave 2025 was inaugurated by Union Home Minister Amit Shah at Mahatma Mandir in Gandhinagar, Gujarat. The two-day event brought together over 1,000 startups, 5,000 innovators, 100 industry mentors, and 50+ venture capital funds from across India. Organised by the Gujarat State Education Department, the conclave showcased innovations in sectors like agriculture, defence, AI, clean tech, fintech, and healthcare. It also facilitated 50 MoUs and distribution of funding cheques and Letters of Intent to promising ventures. Hosting this conclave highlights Gujarat’s commitment to becoming a leading startup hub while aligning with national initiatives like Startup India, Digital India, and Aatmanirbhar Bharat.

questions.question: What was the year-on-year growth rate of India’s core industries in August 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s core industries registered a 6.3% year-on-year growth in August 2025, the highest in more than a year. This strong performance was driven by significant increases in steel (14.2%), coal (11.4%), cement (6.1%), and fertilizers (4.6%). Such growth highlights positive momentum in infrastructure and construction activity, key drivers of the economy. Although the cumulative growth for April–August 2025 stood at 2.8%, the August surge indicates improving industrial activity and resilience in core sectors. Sustained growth in these industries is vital for enhancing supply chains, boosting investment, and supporting India’s broader economic development goals.

questions.question: Which state government signed an MoU with Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited (MDL) for developing a world-class shipyard on India’s eastern coast?
questions.explanation: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited (MDL), one of India’s premier shipbuilding companies, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Government of Tamil Nadu to establish a greenfield shipyard. This collaboration is part of the Maritime Amrit Kaal Vision 2047, which focuses on strengthening India’s maritime infrastructure and capabilities. The shipyard is expected to significantly enhance the country’s naval preparedness, shipbuilding capacity, and commercial maritime activities, thereby contributing to both defense and economic growth. Tamil Nadu was chosen due to its strategic location and potential for developing world-class maritime facilities.

questions.question: Which state government launched the ₹1,000 crore LEAP (Local Economy Accelerator Programme) to promote innovation and job creation outside its capital city?
questions.explanation: The Karnataka government has introduced the Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP) with an allocation of ₹1,000 crore to stimulate innovation and job creation across the state, especially in regions beyond Bengaluru. The initiative focuses on developing industrial and entrepreneurial clusters in Mysuru-Chamarajanagar, Mangaluru-Udupi, Hubbali-Belagavi-Dharwad, Tumkur, Kalaburagi, and Shivamogga. The programme will run for a duration of five years with a targeted goal of generating 5 lakh jobs. By decentralizing opportunities, Karnataka aims to strengthen regional economies, reduce overdependence on Bengaluru, and create a balanced ecosystem for sustainable growth.

questions.question: In which city was the 28th National Conference on e-Governance 2025 held, where a key declaration on India’s digital transformation was adopted?
questions.explanation: The 28th National Conference on e-Governance was hosted in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, on September 23, 2025, where the landmark declaration on India’s digital transformation was adopted. Organised by DARPG, MeitY, and the Government of Andhra Pradesh, the conference focused on the theme “Viksit Bharat: Civil Service and Digital Transformation.” The declaration emphasised the role of advanced technologies like AI, blockchain, IoT, and data analytics in governance, along with priorities such as cybersecurity, digital literacy, and inclusive growth. Visakhapatnam was also endorsed as a future IT and innovation hub, underlining its significance in India’s digital journey.

questions.question: Who has recently assumed charge as the Controller General of Communication Accounts (CGCA) under the Ministry of Communications?
questions.explanation: Vandana Gupta, a 1990 batch officer of the Indian Post & Telecommunication Accounts and Finance Service (IP&TAFS), officially took charge as the Controller General of Communication Accounts (CGCA) on September 22, 2025. With over three decades of experience, she has served in key telecom circles across Maharashtra, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, and Gujarat, along with critical roles in the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) and the Department of Posts (DoP). Her career also includes senior positions at GASAB under the CAG, the Ministry of Women and Child Development, the National Commission for Women, and GGSIP University. Her appointment reflects her leadership in telecom finance, audits, and governance.

questions.question: Who chaired the 49th meeting of PRAGATI on 24 September 2025 to review ₹65,000 crore worth of infrastructure projects?
questions.explanation: The 49th meeting of PRAGATI (Pro-Active Governance and Timely Implementation) was chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 24 September 2025. This ICT-enabled platform is a key governance tool developed by the Prime Minister’s Office to fast-track development projects, improve coordination between the Centre and States, and ensure timely delivery of public assets. In this meeting, eight major projects worth ₹65,000 crore across sectors such as mining, railways, water resources, industrial corridors, and power were reviewed. Modi emphasised timely execution, resolving bottlenecks, and adopting a result-oriented approach to accelerate India’s infrastructure growth.

questions.question: On which date is World Pharmacists Day observed each year to honour pharmacists' contributions to public health and medical safety?
questions.explanation: World Pharmacists Day is celebrated annually on September 25 to recognise the vital role pharmacists play in healthcare, including public health and medication safety. The day was established by the International Pharmaceutical Federation (FIP) in 2009, commemorating FIP’s founding on September 25, 1912. Each year, a theme is chosen to highlight key aspects of pharmacy practice; for 2025, the theme is “Think Health, Think Pharmacist.” Observing this day emphasises pharmacists’ contribution to healthcare systems worldwide and encourages public awareness about their essential services in improving health outcomes.

questions.question: Where will World Food India 2025 be held from September 25–28?
questions.explanation: World Food India 2025 is scheduled to be held at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, from September 25–28. Organised by the Ministry of Food Processing Industries, the event will showcase India’s role as a global leader in sustainable food systems. The summit will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and will witness participation from partner countries such as New Zealand and Saudi Arabia, along with focus countries including Russia, UAE, Japan, and Vietnam. Hosting the event in New Delhi reflects its strategic importance as the nation’s capital and a hub for international engagements.

questions.question: Which quick-commerce platform partnered with the Ministry of Labour and Employment to create 10,000 jobs via the NCS Portal?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Labour and Employment signed an MoU with Zepto in September 2025 to enhance job opportunities and youth employability through the National Career Service (NCS) Portal. Under this partnership, Zepto will provide 10,000 urban job opportunities, particularly benefiting youth, women, and first-time job seekers. The initiative also focuses on improving employability by formalising gig workers, integrating them with the e-Shram portal, and linking them to social security benefits. This collaboration bridges the gap between informal and formal employment, creating structured opportunities in the gig economy while strengthening social protection and skill development pathways.

questions.question: Which country’s business council signed MoUs with Indian partners to deepen trade ties and strengthen the CEPA framework?
questions.explanation: The UAE-India Business Council (UIBC) signed three important Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) on 24 September 2025 to enhance bilateral trade and cooperation between India and the UAE. These agreements were made with the UAE-India CEPA Council (UICC), Services Export Promotion Council (SEPC), and multiple regional chambers of commerce. The focus is on implementing the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) more effectively by supporting priority sectors such as IT, healthcare, logistics, tourism, education, and engineering. The MoUs aim to foster institutional collaboration, facilitate grassroots CEPA execution, and enable MSMEs and startups to benefit from UAE’s global trade networks.

questions.question: Which Indian shipyard signed an MoU with HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering to enhance maritime capabilities?
questions.explanation: Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) entered into a strategic MoU with HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering to strengthen India’s maritime sector. As part of this collaboration, CSL is investing ₹3,700 crore in a Block Fabrication Facility (BFF) in Kochi, which will support the construction of large commercial vessels and create around 2,000 direct jobs. Additionally, CSL plans to establish a ₹15,000 crore shipyard in Tamil Nadu, expected to generate 10,000 jobs. These initiatives not only boost India’s shipbuilding capacity but also align with the nation’s long-term vision of becoming a global maritime hub.

questions.question: At which port was India’s first electric truck fleet with swappable batteries launched?
questions.explanation: India’s first fleet of electric heavy-duty trucks with swappable batteries was launched at the Jawaharlal Nehru Port Authority (JNPA) on September 25, 2025. The initiative, flagged off by the Union Minister of Ports, Shipping & Waterways, Shri Sarbananda Sonowal, is a major step toward decarbonising port operations and promoting sustainable logistics. The EV fleet features quick battery-swapping technology to minimise downtime, improve energy efficiency, and reduce emissions. With plans to convert 90% of JNPA’s 600-truck fleet to electric by December 2026, the project demonstrates the commercial viability of green logistics, supports India’s maritime competitiveness, and aligns with national initiatives like PM Gati Shakti and Maritime India Vision 2030.

questions.question: Where did Dr. S. Jaishankar host the FIPIC Foreign Ministers' Meeting?
questions.explanation: Dr. S. Jaishankar, India’s External Affairs Minister, hosted the Forum for India-Pacific Islands Cooperation (FIPIC) Foreign Ministers' Meeting in New York. FIPIC, initiated by India in 2014, brings together 14 Pacific Island Countries to strengthen cooperation in areas such as trade, climate change, and sustainable development. Hosting the meeting in New York, a major diplomatic hub, underscores India’s commitment to enhancing its engagement with Pacific Island nations while facilitating discussions on regional and global issues. The gathering provided an opportunity for collaborative dialogue, reinforcing India’s strategic partnerships and promoting mutual interests in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: In which country has India’s UPI recently been launched, starting with duty-free stores at Hamad International Airport?
questions.explanation: India’s Unified Payments Interface (UPI) has been launched in Qatar, beginning with Hamad International Airport’s duty-free stores. This makes Qatar the eighth country to accept UPI, facilitating real-time, cashless payments for Indian tourists and reducing dependency on foreign currency or international cards. The rollout is part of a collaboration between NPCI International Payments Ltd (NIPL), Qatar National Bank (QNB), and Japanese payments gateway NETSTARS. By enabling seamless transactions, UPI supports both Indian travelers and local Qatari businesses, promoting digital payment adoption and strengthening India’s international financial footprint while enhancing convenience and security for tourists in high-traffic commercial zones.

questions.question: On which date is World Environmental Health Day celebrated each year?
questions.explanation: World Environmental Health Day is observed annually on September 26. Established by the International Federation of Environmental Health (IFEH) in 2011, the day aims to raise awareness about the importance of environmental health in promoting public well-being. The theme “Clean Air, Healthy People” emphasises the critical link between a clean environment and human health. IFEH, a nonprofit organization founded in 1986 and headquartered in London, uses this day to highlight global environmental challenges, encourage best practices, and foster collaboration among professionals, governments, and communities to ensure healthier and sustainable living conditions worldwide.

questions.question: With which country did India sign a Mutual Recognition Arrangement (MRA) for organic products under the ECTA?
questions.explanation: India and Australia signed a Mutual Recognition Arrangement (MRA) for organic products as part of the India-Australia Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement (ECTA). This arrangement enables both countries to mutually accept each other’s organic certification standards, reducing trade barriers and making it easier for certified producers to access markets. The Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA) from India and the Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Forestry (DAFF) from Australia are the implementing agencies. This collaboration strengthens trade relations, supports sustainable farming practices, and promotes greater consumer confidence in organic products across both nations.

questions.question: Which city will host the 11th Asian Aquatics Championship in 2025?
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad will host the 11th Asian Aquatics Championship from September 28 to October 11, 2025, marking the first time India is organizing this prestigious continental event. The Veer Savarkar Sports Complex in Narangpura serves as the venue, providing international-standard infrastructure for swimming, diving, artistic swimming, and water polo. Over 900 athletes from 29 Asian countries are expected to participate. Hosting this event not only gives Indian athletes the chance to compete at home but also strengthens India’s long-term aspirations to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games and potentially the 2036 Olympic Games, while promoting grassroots aquatic sports and talent development.

questions.question: Where was the 7th Future Food Forum 2025 held?
questions.explanation: The 7th Future Food Forum 2025 took place in Dubai, a global hub for international conferences and innovation-driven discussions. The event brought together leaders from governments, businesses, and academia to explore crucial themes such as sustainable proteins, consumer trends, agri-tech, and food innovation. By hosting the forum, Dubai reinforced its position as a strategic center for fostering collaborations that address global food system challenges and opportunities. This builds on the forum’s legacy since its inception in 2019 in the UAE, further showcasing Dubai’s commitment to sustainable development and its leadership in advancing the global food ecosystem.

questions.question: On which date is World Contraception Day observed each year?
questions.explanation: World Contraception Day is observed annually on September 26 to promote awareness about the full range of contraceptive methods and support reproductive autonomy globally. Established in 2007, the day encourages informed choice and access to contraception while addressing barriers such as social, cultural, and economic constraints. It emphasises preventing unintended pregnancies, reducing maternal mortality, advancing gender equality, and countering myths and stigma surrounding contraception. Governments, NGOs, health providers, and civil society participate in campaigns that educate individuals, expand access, and foster dialogue about reproductive rights, making it a crucial day for global public health and empowerment.

questions.question: In which state will PM Modi transfer ₹10,000 each to 75 lakh women under the Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana?
questions.explanation: The Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana aims to economically empower women in Bihar by providing ₹10,000 each to 75 lakh beneficiaries through Direct Benefit Transfer. Scheduled for September 26, 2025, the initiative targets women from economically weaker sections, enabling them to start micro-enterprises such as tailoring units, shops, or agriculture-related activities. A follow-up grant of ₹2 lakh is available after a six-month performance review. Managed by the Rural and Urban Development Departments and leveraging the Jeevika Self-Help Group network, the scheme supports self-employment, financial inclusion, and women’s entrepreneurship, while also aligning with Bihar’s socio-economic development and pre-election priorities.

questions.question: Which institution has been nominated as a UN Centre of Excellence for AI?
questions.explanation: IIT Madras has been nominated as a UN Centre of Excellence (CoE) for Artificial Intelligence, highlighting India’s growing influence in global AI development. This designation supports efforts to address the AI skills gap, foster ethical AI governance, and promote collaboration across the Global South. Under India’s AI Mission, initiatives include training 10 million people annually, deploying 38,000 GPUs, and making 300 open-source AI models available. IIT Madras’s recognition as a CoE strengthens its role as a leading research and education hub in AI, positioning India at the forefront of innovation and responsible AI deployment internationally.

questions.question: Which missile did India successfully test from a rail-based launcher, marking a strategic advancement in mobile defense capabilities?
questions.explanation: India successfully tested the Agni Prime missile from a rail-based launcher, demonstrating a significant enhancement in mobile strategic defense capabilities. With a range of up to 2,000 km, the Agni Prime, also known as Agni-P, is a lighter, more accurate, and faster-to-deploy addition to India’s Agni missile series. The rail-based launchability enhances India’s second-strike nuclear capability and overall deterrence posture, while reducing vulnerability compared to fixed silos. Equipped with advanced communication systems, autonomous launch mechanisms, and protective safeguards, the test showcases India’s growing ability to integrate strategic assets with civil infrastructure, ensuring rapid, flexible, and secure missile deployment.

questions.question: Which city is set to launch a 15-km autonomous corridor for driverless transport by 2026?
questions.explanation: Dubai is preparing to launch a 15-km dedicated corridor for driverless transport, known as the Dubai Autonomous Zone (DAZ), by 2026. This initiative is part of the city’s ambitious goal to make 25% of daily trips autonomous by 2030. The corridor will connect major hubs such as Al Jaddaf Metro Station, Dubai Creek Harbour, and Dubai Festival City. It will integrate multiple transport modes including RoboTaxis, RoboBuses, autonomous shuttles, delivery bots, and self-driving marine abras. Partnerships with Uber and WeRide will also bring app-based RoboTaxi services to the public, reinforcing Dubai’s global leadership in smart mobility.

questions.question: In which state did PM Narendra Modi unveil a ₹1.22 lakh crore development package from Banswara?
questions.explanation: The ₹1.22 lakh crore development package was announced in Rajasthan by Prime Minister Narendra Modi from Banswara. This package emphasises clean energy, tribal welfare, better connectivity, and social welfare schemes. A major share of ₹90,000 crore is earmarked for projects across five states, with significant allocations for Rajasthan such as the ₹42,000 crore Mahi Banswara Atomic Power Project and multiple solar power projects in districts like Jaisalmer, Jalore, Sikar, and Phalodi. Additionally, ₹13,180 crore has been set aside for strengthening transmission infrastructure. These initiatives aim to boost Rajasthan’s energy sector and uplift tribal regions significantly.

questions.question: When is World Tourism Day 2025 observed?
questions.explanation: World Tourism Day 2025 is observed on September 27, with the theme “Tourism and Sustainable Transformation,” under the leadership of the UNWTO. The date was specifically chosen to mark the anniversary of the adoption of the UNWTO Statutes in 1970, and the day has been formally celebrated since 1980. This global observance highlights the importance of tourism as a key driver of economic growth, contributing over 10% to the world’s GDP while supporting millions of jobs across diverse sectors. It also emphasises the need for sustainable practices to ensure long-term benefits for communities, cultures, and the environment.

questions.question: Which country launched its first Sovereign Mobility Cloud at the Dubai World Congress for Self-Driving Transport?
questions.explanation: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has introduced its first Sovereign Mobility Cloud during the Dubai World Congress for Self-Driving Transport. This initiative is a significant step toward strengthening the country’s autonomous mobility strategy. The Sovereign Mobility Cloud serves as a secure and trusted infrastructure for mobility data and autonomous systems, ensuring that sensitive information is stored within the UAE’s jurisdiction and regulated by national laws. By doing so, the UAE enhances its technological sovereignty, reinforces data security, and establishes a foundation for future advancements in smart transport and autonomous vehicle ecosystems.

questions.question: Who became the first mycologist to lead the Botanical Survey of India (BSI) as its 13th Director?
questions.explanation: Dr. Kanad Das made history by becoming the first mycologist to assume the role of Director of the Botanical Survey of India (BSI), taking charge as its 13th Director. The BSI, functioning under the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC), has been a premier institution since 1890 for cataloguing, documenting, and conserving India’s vast plant biodiversity. Headquartered in Kolkata with 11 regional centres across the country, the BSI plays a crucial role in protecting floral resources. Dr. Das’s appointment highlights the growing recognition of mycology in India’s biodiversity conservation framework.

questions.question: Which three countries are co-hosting the 2026 FIFA World Cup represented by mascots Clutch, Maple, and Zayu?
questions.explanation: The 2026 FIFA World Cup will be co-hosted by the United States, Canada, and Mexico, and the official mascots—Clutch the Bald Eagle, Maple the Moose, and Zayu the Jaguar—were unveiled to symbolise these nations. Each mascot embodies the culture, values, and natural heritage of its respective country, emphasizing unity and diversity. This marks the first time FIFA has introduced multiple mascots for a senior men’s World Cup, aligning with the multi-nation hosting format. The tournament, the largest ever with 48 teams and 104 matches, will highlight North America’s role in global football and celebrate the shared spirit of the game.

questions.question: Which state government distributed scholarships worth ₹2,825 crore to 4 lakh students in the academic year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The state that implemented this massive scholarship distribution is Uttar Pradesh. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath handed over scholarships in Lucknow to around 4 lakh students, with a total value of ₹2,825 crore allocated in the academic year 2025-26. These scholarships are primarily aimed at helping students from disadvantaged backgrounds continue their education. Since 2017, the state has consistently emphasised educational support by benefitting over 2 crore students through various scholarship schemes, reflecting its commitment to social welfare and inclusive growth in the education sector.

questions.question: Which country signed a Strategic Civil Nuclear Cooperation Agreement with the United States?
questions.explanation: Turkey entered into a Strategic Civil Nuclear Cooperation Agreement with the United States during President Erdoğan’s visit to the White House. This agreement is designed to accelerate Turkey’s nuclear energy ambitions by focusing on both large-scale nuclear power plants and the integration of Small Modular Reactors (SMRs). It complements Turkey’s ongoing Akkuyu Nuclear Power Plant project developed with Russia, showing the country’s strategy to diversify partnerships in the nuclear sector. Through this collaboration, Turkey strengthens its position in the global energy landscape, enhances energy security, and moves closer to achieving its long-term sustainability and energy diversification goals.

questions.question: In which state is India’s first Dugong Conservation Reserve in Palk Bay located?
questions.explanation: India’s first Dugong Conservation Reserve is situated in Palk Bay, Tamil Nadu, and has recently gained global recognition at the World Conservation Congress 2025 in Abu Dhabi. Established in 2022 under the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972, the reserve spans over 12,250 hectares of vital seagrass meadows, which serve as the primary feeding grounds for dugongs. Dugongs, also known as "sea cows," are listed as Vulnerable on the IUCN Red List, making their protection critical. This reserve not only safeguards the dugong population but also promotes the conservation of marine ecosystems, biodiversity, and sustainable livelihoods for coastal communities.

questions.question: Which country proposed the creation of a BRICS Grain Exchange at the 2024 BRICS Summit in Kazan?
questions.explanation: Russia proposed the establishment of a BRICS Grain Exchange during the 2024 BRICS Summit in Kazan, and the idea was later endorsed in the Kazan Declaration. The initiative is designed to strengthen agricultural trade within the BRICS grouping by creating independent grain pricing benchmarks. This would reduce reliance on existing Western-dominated exchanges such as the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME), thereby offering BRICS nations greater autonomy in agricultural trade. For India and other BRICS members, the exchange holds potential to stabilise pricing, enhance food security, and foster a more balanced global agricultural market.

questions.question: Who won the 2025 Krishi Media Award for outstanding contributions to agricultural journalism and farmer awareness?
questions.explanation: Amshi Prasannakumar, a veteran journalist from Mysuru, received the Hombale Samhita Harinikumar Alumni Krishi Media Award – 2025 for his exceptional work in agricultural journalism. His career has focused on raising awareness among farmers about agricultural practices, policies, and innovations through both print and electronic media. The award, presented by the Alumni Association of the University of Agricultural Sciences, Bangalore, recognises journalists who significantly contribute to rural development and farmer welfare. Amshi’s efforts have empowered thousands of farmers, highlighting the crucial role of media in promoting knowledge and sustainability in agriculture.

questions.question: Which legendary midfielder announced his retirement after the 2025 MLS season, ending a 20-year football career with Barcelona, Spain, and Inter Miami?
questions.explanation: Sergio Busquets, a highly decorated Spanish midfielder, announced his retirement at the end of the 2025 MLS season while playing for Inter Miami. Over his 20-year career, he became a key figure at Barcelona, making 722 appearances and winning 32 major trophies including 9 La Liga titles, 7 Copa del Reys, and 3 UEFA Champions League trophies. Internationally, he earned 143 caps for Spain, winning the 2010 FIFA World Cup and 2012 UEFA Euro Championship. Renowned for his tactical intelligence, positional awareness, and composure, Busquets has left an enduring legacy in global football.

questions.question: By what percentage did India’s smartphone exports to the US increase year-on-year in August 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s smartphone exports to the United States surged by 148% year-on-year in August 2025, according to the India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA). Exports to the US rose from USD 388 million in August 2024 to USD 965 million in August 2025, showcasing the sector’s robust performance under the Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme. Despite some reports suggesting a slowdown, ICEA clarified that the growth demonstrates resilience in India’s smartphone export ecosystem, driven by high-volume production, strategic partnerships with global manufacturers, and seasonal factors that typically influence monthly shipment trends. This growth reinforces India’s rising prominence in global smartphone exports.

questions.question: What was India’s ranking in the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) Index 2025?
questions.explanation: India achieved its best-ever position in the SDG Index 2025, ranking 99th out of 167 countries, an improvement from 109th in 2024. This rise reflects progress in infrastructure and basic services, although challenges remain in achieving SDG 3 related to Good Health and Well-being. Key issues include maternal and child mortality rates, life expectancy, out-of-pocket healthcare expenditure, and incomplete immunisation coverage. To enhance progress, measures such as universal health insurance, strengthening primary health centres, school health education, cross-sectoral coordination, and accelerated implementation of schemes like Ayushman Bharat and Poshan Abhiyaan are recommended.

questions.question: Where was the 71st National Film Awards ceremony, honouring the best of Indian cinema for 2023, held?
questions.explanation: The 71st National Film Awards ceremony took place at Vigyan Bhawan in New Delhi on September 23, 2025. President Droupadi Murmu felicitated the winners, including Mohanlal, who received the Dadasaheb Phalke Award. New Delhi, as the capital city, often hosts major national events, and Vigyan Bhawan is a prominent venue for such high-profile ceremonies. The awards recognised excellence across various categories in Indian cinema, highlighting socially relevant films, veteran actors, and new-age talents, emphasizing the city’s role as a hub for cultural and cinematic celebrations.

questions.question: What regulatory action did the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) take against Datta Finance and Trading Pvt Ltd due to violations in digital lending operations?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India cancelled the NBFC (Non-Banking Financial Company) licence of Datta Finance and Trading Pvt Ltd because it violated digital lending guidelines. The company outsourced core lending functions such as customer sourcing, KYC verification, loan disbursal, and recovery, which breaches RBI’s Fair Practices Code and Digital Lending Guidelines. The cancellation prevents Datta Finance from offering or recovering loans and signals RBI’s strict enforcement of ethical conduct and regulatory compliance in the digital lending sector. This move highlights RBI’s emphasis on consumer protection and oversight of financial service providers.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of setting up 500 new Atal Tinkering Labs in Jammu & Kashmir under the Frontier Region Programme?
options: Promoting higher education in urban areas
Strengthening innovation at the school level
questions.answer: Strengthening innovation at the school level
questions.explanation: The launch of 500 new Atal Tinkering Labs (ATLs) in Jammu & Kashmir under the Frontier Region Programme aims to strengthen innovation at the school level. These labs provide students with access to 3D printing, robotics, AI kits, and coding platforms, enabling them to develop STEM skills, solve local challenges, and prepare for future careers. The initiative, supported by ATL Sarthi and private sector partners like Boeing and Amazon India, also includes mentorship and teacher training, creating an ecosystem that fosters hands-on learning and cultivates creativity and problem-solving abilities among young learners in remote and underserved regions.

questions.question: Where was the ISSF Junior World Cup 2025, where India won five medals, held?
questions.explanation: The ISSF Junior World Cup 2025 took place at the Dr Karni Singh Shooting Range in New Delhi. India, hosting the event for the first time, showcased exceptional performance by winning five medals, including a clean sweep in the women’s 50m prone rifle event. The tournament featured 208 shooters from 19 countries, with the 69-member Indian contingent performing strongly on home soil. Hosting the event highlighted India’s growing stature in international shooting sports and provided young athletes with a platform to gain experience, exposure, and recognition at a global level.

questions.question: In which state has the Cabinet approved the ₹3,822 crore NH-139W greenfield highway project to boost trade, tourism, and regional connectivity?
questions.explanation: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs approved the construction of a 4-lane greenfield highway on NH-139W in Bihar, covering the Sahebganj–Areraj–Bettiah section. The project, executed under the Hybrid Annuity Mode (HAM), spans 78.942 km with an estimated cost of ₹3,822.31 crore. It aims to enhance connectivity between Patna and Bettiah, facilitate Indo-Nepal trade, promote tourism, and support economic growth through smoother freight movement and employment generation. By linking multiple economic and social nodes, the highway aligns with the PM Gati Shakti Master Plan, positioning Bihar as a hub for regional development and international trade.

questions.question: Which iconic fighter jet did the Indian Air Force retire after 62 years of service in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Indian Air Force retired the MiG-21 in 2025, marking the end of a 62-year service history. First inducted in 1963 at Air Force Station Chandigarh, the MiG-21 became India’s first supersonic fighter aircraft and formed the backbone of the IAF for decades. Over 870 aircraft were procured, participating in major operations including the 1965 and 1971 wars, the 1999 Kargil conflict, and the 2019 Balakot airstrikes. Renowned for its speed, maneuverability, and reliability, the MiG-21 was gradually replaced by modern aircraft like the Sukhoi Su-30MKI, Rafale, and Tejas LCA, with its retirement symbolising a significant step in India’s air force modernisation.

questions.question: Who inaugurated the National Conclave 2025 on Ex-Servicemen Welfare organised by the Department of Ex-Servicemen Welfare (DESW)?
questions.explanation: The National Conclave 2025 on Ex-Servicemen Welfare was inaugurated by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.
