The two-day conclave was organised by the Department of Ex-Servicemen Welfare (DESW) with the theme “Viksit Bharat and Ex-Servicemen Welfare.” It brought together representatives from Rajya Sainik Boards and Zila Sainik Boards across India to discuss welfare measures for ex-servicemen and their families. By inaugurating this event, Rajnath Singh emphasised the government’s continued commitment to ensuring social security, rehabilitation, and respect for veterans who have served the nation, reinforcing the importance of their role in building a stronger and more developed India.

questions.question: Which state is home to Gokul Jalashaya in Buxar and Udaipur Jheel in West Champaran, recently designated as Ramsar Wetlands?
questions.explanation: The state of Bihar is home to both Gokul Jalashaya in Buxar (448 hectares) and Udaipur Jheel in West Champaran (319 hectares), which have been designated as Ramsar Wetlands. Ramsar sites are globally recognised as wetlands of international importance under the Ramsar Convention. Their inclusion emphasises Bihar’s ecological contribution in maintaining biodiversity, supporting migratory birds, and providing essential ecosystem services such as groundwater recharge and flood control. With these new sites, India’s total number of Ramsar wetlands has reached 93, covering an expansive area of 13,60,719 hectares, reflecting its growing commitment to wetland conservation.

questions.question: Which country won the Asia Cup Final 2025 by 5 wickets at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium?
questions.explanation: India won the Asia Cup Final 2025 by defeating Pakistan by 5 wickets at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium on September 28, 2025. After winning the toss and choosing to bowl, India restricted Pakistan to 146 all out, with key contributions from bowlers like Kuldeep Yadav (4/30), Varun Chakravarthy (2/30), and Jasprit Bumrah (2/25). In their chase, India overcame an early loss of three wickets to successfully reach 150/5 in 19.4 overs, thanks to Tilak Varma’s unbeaten 69* and Shivam Dube’s 33. This victory highlights India’s strong middle-order performance and strategic bowling under pressure.

questions.question: Which state will host statewide eight-day trade shows across all 75 districts to promote Khadi and MSMEs?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh has announced the organization of statewide eight-day trade shows across all its 75 districts from October 9–16. The initiative was revealed by the Khadi and Village Industries sector during the UP International Trade Show (UPITS) in Greater Noida. These exhibitions will feature entrepreneurs from Khadi, textiles, and One District One Product (ODOP) sectors. By scaling up from divisional-level events to a state-wide initiative, Uttar Pradesh aims to boost its local economy, strengthen MSMEs, provide greater exposure for traditional products, and encourage entrepreneurship, ultimately enhancing trade opportunities at national and international levels.

questions.question: Which location has been identified by Oil India Ltd (OIL) for its first confirmed natural gas discovery, showcasing major energy potential?
questions.explanation: Oil India Ltd (OIL) announced its first confirmed natural gas discovery off the Andaman Islands, marking a major milestone in India’s offshore energy exploration. The Hydrocarbon Resource Assessment Study (HRAS) has estimated around 371 million metric tonnes of oil equivalent (MMTOE) in the Andaman Basin, which is part of the Bengal-Arakan sedimentary system. Located at the tectonic boundary between the Indian and Burmese plates, the basin contains favorable geological conditions such as stratigraphic traps. This discovery significantly boosts India’s prospects for future energy self-reliance while highlighting the strategic importance of the Andaman region in hydrocarbon exploration.

questions.question: In which city was the 2nd National Mediation Conference 2025 inaugurated by Chief Justice of India, Justice BR Gavai?
questions.explanation: The 2nd National Mediation Conference 2025 was inaugurated in Bhubaneswar by the Chief Justice of India, Justice BR Gavai. The event highlighted the importance of mediation as a tool for dispute resolution, stressing that its effectiveness comes from consistent practices rather than solely from legal provisions. The two-day conference featured five interactive technical sessions chaired by Supreme Court judges, creating a platform for exchanging knowledge and best practices in mediation. Hosting the conference in Bhubaneswar also emphasises the growing importance of regional centers in advancing legal reforms and strengthening alternative dispute resolution mechanisms in India.

questions.question: On which date is World Heart Day observed every year to raise awareness about heart health and cardiovascular disease prevention?
questions.explanation: World Heart Day is observed annually on September 29 as a global initiative to promote heart health and prevent cardiovascular diseases (CVDs). Established in 2000 by the World Heart Federation in collaboration with the World Health Organization, the day emphasises that most heart-related deaths are preventable through lifestyle modifications. The 2025 theme, “Small Lifestyle Changes, Big Health Benefits,” highlights the importance of simple habits such as healthy eating, regular physical activity, stress management, and quality sleep. By focusing on prevention and early detection, World Heart Day encourages individuals, communities, and governments worldwide to prioritise cardiovascular health.

questions.question: Which country won the 7th SAFF U-17 Championship title by defeating Bangladesh 4-1 in a penalty shootout at Colombo?
questions.explanation: India clinched the 7th SAFF U-17 Championship title after defeating Bangladesh 4-1 in a thrilling penalty shootout at the Racecourse International Stadium in Colombo. This victory marked India’s seventh U-17 title, further cementing its dominance in South Asian football. Under the guidance of coach Bibiano Fernandes, who has now secured his fifth SAFF championship win, the team showcased resilience and skill. Earlier in May 2025, Fernandes also led India to victory in the SAFF U-19 Championship in Arunachal Pradesh. The win highlights the consistent growth of India’s youth football program and its strong presence in regional tournaments.

questions.question: The Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve, recently inducted into the UNESCO World Network of Biosphere Reserves, is located in which state?
questions.explanation: The Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve in Himachal Pradesh has been included in the UNESCO World Network of Biosphere Reserves during the World Congress of Biosphere Reserves held in Hangzhou, China. Covering an area of 7,770 sq. km in the Western Himalayas, this reserve was originally designated a national biosphere reserve in 2009. Its recognition by UNESCO now makes it India’s 13th site in the global network. The inclusion highlights the ecological significance of the fragile cold desert ecosystem, which supports unique biodiversity, cultural heritage, and sustainable development initiatives, marking a step forward in international conservation efforts.

questions.question: Which state had its VAT exemption on locally manufactured asbestos sheets and bricks struck down by the Supreme Court for being discriminatory?
questions.explanation: The Supreme Court struck down a 2007 notification by the Rajasthan government that provided a VAT exemption on locally manufactured asbestos sheets and bricks. The Court ruled that such exemptions were discriminatory under Article 304(a) of the Constitution, as they favored local products over similar goods from other states. This decision reinforces the principle of free trade within India, ensuring that state taxation policies do not create unfair advantages for local industries. By invalidating the exemption, the Court emphasised that all states must adhere to constitutional guidelines promoting equal economic opportunity and trade fairness across India.

questions.question: Who has been elected unopposed as the 37th BCCI President at the 94th annual general meeting?
questions.explanation: Mithun Manhas, former Delhi captain, has been elected unopposed as the 37th BCCI President at the 94th annual general meeting. He succeeds Roger Binny, who resigned in August 2025, while Rajeev Shukla had been serving as interim vice-president. Manhas brings with him a rich domestic cricketing career spanning two decades from 1997 to 2017, during which he played 157 first-class matches scoring 9714 runs, 130 List A matches scoring 4126 runs, and 91 T20 games amassing 1170 runs. His appointment reflects the growing trend of experienced cricketers contributing to cricket administration in India.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of Tata Motors effective October 1, 2025?
questions.explanation: Shailesh Chandra has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of Tata Motors starting October 1, 2025, with his tenure set to last three years. He will continue as MD of Tata Passenger Electric Mobility Ltd., reflecting the company’s focus on electric vehicles. This leadership change occurs alongside a corporate demerger, creating separate entities for commercial vehicles and passenger/electric vehicles. Chandra’s extensive experience with Tata Motors since 2016, particularly in electric mobility, positions him to drive unified growth across passenger and electric vehicle segments, highlighting the strategic rationale behind his appointment.

questions.question: Which organization was awarded the Changemaker of the Year at the BusinessLine Changemaker Awards in September 2025 for its contributions to indigenous strategic technologies?
questions.explanation: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) received the Changemaker of the Year Award at the BusinessLine Changemaker Awards in September 2025. Under the leadership of DG Raja Babu Ummalaneni, DRDO has advanced India’s indigenous defence technology programs, promoting self-reliance in critical strategic systems. The recognition highlights DRDO’s pivotal role in driving national transformation through research and development in defence, reinforcing the importance of technological innovation for strategic autonomy and enhancing India’s defence capabilities in line with the Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative.

questions.question: Where will Union Minister of State for Textiles, Pabitra Margherita, inaugurate the “Best of India – Indian Apparel and Textile Fair” in October 2025?
questions.explanation: Union Minister of State for Textiles, Pabitra Margherita, will visit Moscow, Russia, from October 1 to 3, 2025, to inaugurate the “Best of India – Indian Apparel and Textile Fair.” The event is designed to enhance the visibility and presence of Indian exporters in the Russian and CIS markets. The visit also includes discussions to strengthen bilateral cooperation in trade, industry, and textiles, reflecting India’s strategic efforts to expand its export footprint and foster stronger economic ties with Russia. The fair serves as a key platform for promoting Indian textile products internationally.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, effective October 9, 2025?
questions.explanation: Shirish Chandra Murmu has been appointed as the Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India for a three-year term starting October 9, 2025. He will succeed Rajeshwar Rao and brings extensive experience in banking supervision, regulation, and financial policy formulation. As Deputy Governor, Murmu will contribute to strengthening RBI’s leadership in monetary policy, financial regulation, and banking supervision. His administrative expertise is expected to play a key role in ensuring policy continuity, enhancing financial stability, and supporting economic growth amid evolving domestic and global economic challenges.

questions.question: Who has been reappointed as the Attorney General of India for a second term starting October 1, 2025?
questions.explanation: Senior Advocate R Venkataramani has been reappointed as the Attorney General of India for a further two-year term, effective October 1, 2025, continuing as the country’s chief legal officer until September 30, 2027. The Attorney General is the primary legal advisor to the Government of India and represents it in the Supreme Court and High Courts. Venkataramani, who became the 16th Attorney General in 2022, has an extensive career in constitutional, criminal, and administrative law, and his reappointment reflects confidence in his legal expertise and counsel on matters of national importance.

questions.question: Where is Asia’s largest wastewater treatment plant, to be inaugurated by the Delhi Jal Board, located?
questions.explanation: The Delhi Jal Board is inaugurating Asia’s largest wastewater treatment plant in Okhla, covering 40 acres with a total project cost of ₹1,161.18 crore, funded by JICA. The plant is designed to serve approximately 40 lakh residents in South Delhi and is equipped to generate power and produce A-class sludge after sewage treatment. This project represents a major step in improving urban wastewater management, enhancing environmental sustainability, and supporting resource recovery. The Okhla plant underscores Delhi’s commitment to modernizing its infrastructure while addressing critical water treatment and public health needs.

questions.question: Which country will be connected to India through the newly announced cross-border rail projects at Kokrajhar-Gelephu and Banarhat-Samtse?
questions.explanation: India and Bhutan have agreed to develop two cross-border rail projects: Kokrajhar-Gelephu and Banarhat-Samtse, with a total investment of ₹4,033 crore. These projects, announced by Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, will connect key Bhutanese cities—Gelephu and Samtse—to India via rail routes originating from Kokrajhar in Assam and Banarhat in West Bengal. The initiatives aim to enhance bilateral connectivity, facilitate trade and travel, and strengthen economic and cultural ties between the two nations. These rail links mark a significant step in improving regional transportation infrastructure and cross-border cooperation.

questions.question: Where has India launched its first Integrative Oncology Research and Care Centre (IORCC) combining Ayurveda, Yoga, and modern cancer care?
questions.explanation: India inaugurated its first Integrative Oncology Research and Care Centre (IORCC) at the All India Institute of Ayurveda in Dhargal, Goa. This centre uniquely blends traditional therapies like Ayurveda, Yoga, and Panchakarma with modern oncology treatments, aiming to provide holistic rehabilitation for cancer patients. It also serves as a research and training hub, developing evidence-informed protocols and building capacity in integrative oncology. The initiative marks a transformative step in India’s healthcare approach, promoting collaboration between traditional and modern medical systems to enhance patient recovery, reduce side effects, and improve overall quality of life.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Awareness of Food Loss and Waste observed each year?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Awareness of Food Loss and Waste is observed annually on September 29. Established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2019, the day aims to raise global awareness about the impact of food loss and waste on sustainable consumption and production patterns. It aligns with Sustainable Development Goal 12, specifically Target 12.3, which seeks to halve food waste at retail and consumer levels and reduce food losses along production and supply chains by 2030. Observing this day highlights the importance of responsible food management, resource conservation, and reducing environmental impact worldwide.

questions.question: On which date is International Translation Day observed each year?
questions.explanation: International Translation Day is celebrated annually on September 30 to honour language professionals who play a crucial role in connecting nations, promoting understanding, and fostering peace and development. The United Nations General Assembly officially recognized this day in 2017 through resolution 71/288. It also commemorates St. Jerome, the patron saint of translators, acknowledging his historic contributions as a Bible translator. The day highlights the importance of translation in cultural exchange, diplomacy, and global communication, emphasizing the role of translators in bridging linguistic and cultural gaps worldwide.

questions.question: By what percentage did SIDBI’s net profit increase in FY25 compared to FY24?
questions.explanation: SIDBI’s net profit for FY25 grew by 19.5%, reaching an all-time high of ₹4,811 crore compared to ₹4,026 crore in FY24. This strong performance reflects not only the bank’s ability to generate sustainable growth but also its focus on maintaining asset quality, with net NPAs at 0%. Alongside this, SIDBI expanded its loan portfolio, strengthened MSME support through digital and green finance initiatives, and improved total income and EPS. The 19.5% profit growth underscores SIDBI’s robust role in India’s MSME ecosystem and its strategic alignment with national development goals.

questions.question: In which country was Telugu Language Day 2025 celebrated with the P4 awareness programme?
questions.explanation: Telugu Language Day 2025 was celebrated in Saudi Arabia, bringing together over 2,000 attendees, including NRIs, to highlight the cultural heritage of the Telugu-speaking community abroad. The event promoted the P4 model (Public–Private–People Partnership) initiated by the Andhra Pradesh government, emphasizing social and economic empowerment and the vision of “zero poverty by 2047.” Key dignitaries, including ministers and community leaders, participated virtually and in person, showcasing the global presence of the Telugu diaspora. The celebration reinforced the importance of language, culture, and collaborative development initiatives in uniting communities across borders.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day of Older Persons observed each year?
questions.explanation: The International Day of Older Persons is observed every year on October 1, following the United Nations General Assembly’s 1990 resolution (45/106). The 2025 theme, “Older Persons Driving Local and Global Action: Our Aspirations, Our Well-Being and Our Rights”, highlights the active role of older persons in shaping societies, promoting health equity, financial stability, and community resilience. The observance emphasises not only protecting the rights and dignity of older individuals but also recognizing them as vital contributors to social, cultural, and economic progress. It aligns with the Madrid International Plan of Action on Ageing, promoting inclusivity for all ages.

questions.question: Which district in Chhattisgarh has been officially declared India’s first child marriage-free district?
questions.explanation: Balod district in Chhattisgarh has become India’s first officially certified child marriage-free district under the “Child Marriage Free India” campaign. The milestone was achieved after two years of zero reported child marriage cases and verification of all 436 gram panchayats and nine urban bodies. The accomplishment reflects coordinated efforts by local administration, panchayats, Anganwadi workers, and community members in raising awareness and ensuring compliance with legal provisions. This achievement sets a national benchmark for social reform and demonstrates that grassroots participation, combined with government support, can effectively eliminate harmful practices like child marriage.

questions.question: What is the revised GDP growth forecast for India in FY26 according to the Asian Development Bank (ADB)?
questions.explanation: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has lowered India’s GDP growth forecast for FY26 to 6.5%, down from its earlier estimate of 6.7%. This revision reflects the impact of elevated U.S. tariffs, which are expected to affect around 60% of India’s exports to the U.S., slowing growth momentum in the second half of 2025-26. Despite strong domestic demand, infrastructure investment, and ongoing structural reforms, global trade challenges are likely to dampen India’s expansion. The ADB also projected a similar 6.5% growth rate for FY27, highlighting continued caution amid external headwinds for the Indian economy.

questions.question: In which state was the third edition of the Unmesha International Literature Festival 2025 held?
questions.explanation: The third edition of the Unmesha International Literature Festival 2025 was hosted in Patna, Bihar, from 25th to 28th September. Bihar was chosen not only as the venue but also as a symbolic representation of India’s rich intellectual and cultural heritage. The state has historically been a cradle of knowledge, with ancient institutions like Nalanda and Vikramshila, spiritual centers like Bodh Gaya and Vaishali, and deep contributions to India’s democratic, political, and social fabric. Hosting the festival here highlighted Bihar’s global legacy in literature, art, and cultural dialogue while showcasing its vibrant traditions like Mithila painting and Chhath Puja.

questions.question: In which Indian state was Exercise ‘Drone Kavach’ conducted by the Indian Army in September 2025?
questions.explanation: Exercise ‘Drone Kavach’ was conducted by the Spear Corps of the Indian Army in the forward areas of Eastern Arunachal Pradesh from September 25 to 28, 2025. The four-day exercise focused on next-generation drone warfare and counter-drone technologies, involving the Indian Army and Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP). It tested tactical maneuvers, target acquisition, and neutralization techniques, enhancing operational readiness in sensitive border regions. The exercise underscores the Army’s commitment to modernization, technology integration, and preparedness for multi-domain battlefield scenarios, while also reflecting the strategic importance of Arunachal Pradesh in national defence and security.

questions.question: From which date will the Acoustic Vehicle Alerting System (AVAS) become mandatory for all existing EV models in India?
questions.explanation: The government of India has announced that from October 1, 2027, all electric cars, buses, and trucks in production will be required to have an Acoustic Vehicle Alerting System (AVAS). This system is designed to improve pedestrian safety by producing artificial sounds that alert road users to the presence of near-silent EVs. While newly launched EV models must include AVAS from October 2026, the broader implementation for all models comes into force in October 2027. This step aligns India with global EV safety regulations while addressing the risks posed by the quiet operation of electric vehicles.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of Sony Pictures Networks India (SPNI) until 2029?
questions.explanation: Gaurav Banerjee has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of Sony Pictures Networks India (SPNI), officially known as Culver Max Entertainment, with his term extended until August 2029. He took over leadership following the departure of long-time CEO NP Singh and was confirmed through shareholder approval at the AGM in August 2025. His tenure, starting in August 2024, represents a five-year extension that ensures leadership stability for the company. Under his guidance, SPNI continues to strengthen its television and OTT presence through SonyLIV, backed by strong financials and a significant subscriber base in India.

questions.question: Which Indian state’s tourism department won the Global Tourism Award 2025?
questions.explanation: The Andhra Pradesh Tourism Department received the Global Tourism Award 2025 in recognition of its outstanding efforts to promote the state as a leading tourist destination. The award highlighted initiatives in sustainable tourism, heritage conservation, and cultural promotion. Andhra Pradesh offers diverse attractions, including spiritual sites like Tirupati, heritage locations such as Lepakshi temple, coastal tourism along Visakhapatnam, and eco-adventure destinations like Araku Valley. The department’s work in infrastructure development, community-based tourism, and smart technology integration has strengthened its global visibility, boosted international tourist arrivals, and supported local economic development while preserving the state’s cultural and natural heritage.

questions.question: By how much has the Union Cabinet increased the Dearness Allowance (DA) for Central Government employees and pensioners effective July 1, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet approved a 3% hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) for Central Government employees and Dearness Relief (DR) for pensioners, effective from July 1, 2025. This increase raises the DA rate from 55% to 58% of Basic Pay/Pension and benefits over 1.18 crore people, including 49.19 lakh employees and 68.72 lakh pensioners. The move aims to offset rising inflation and maintain purchasing power. The financial impact of this hike is estimated at ₹10,083.96 crore annually. This adjustment follows the periodic DA revisions under the 7th Central Pay Commission formula to protect the livelihood of government employees and retirees.

questions.question: According to the Forbes Real-Time Billionaires tracker in October 2025, who became the first person in history to achieve a net worth of $500.1 billion?
questions.explanation: Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla, has become the first individual in history to reach a net worth of $500.1 billion as of October 2025, according to Forbes. His massive fortune is primarily attributed to the growth and valuation of his companies—Tesla, SpaceX, and xAI. Tesla’s strong stock performance, combined with SpaceX’s $400 billion valuation and xAI’s rising worth, have propelled Musk far ahead of other billionaires. With a proposed $1 trillion compensation plan from Tesla, analysts project he could become the world’s first trillionaire by 2033.

questions.question: Who won the gold medal in the Women’s Compound Open category at the 2025 World Para Archery Championships in Gwangju, South Korea?
questions.explanation: Sheetal Devi, the remarkable para archer from Jammu & Kashmir, clinched her maiden gold medal in the Women’s Compound Open event at the 2025 World Para Archery Championships held in Gwangju, South Korea. She defeated Türkiye’s Oznur Cure Girdi, a three-time world champion, with a score of 146–143. Born without arms due to phocomelia, Sheetal uses her legs and chin to shoot, showcasing extraordinary determination and precision. Her achievement, along with silver and bronze in team events, marks a historic milestone for Indian para archery and highlights her exceptional talent and resilience on the global stage.

questions.question: Who won the 62nd National Chess Championship held in Guntur, Andhra Pradesh?
questions.explanation: Grandmaster P Iniyan from Tamil Nadu emerged as the champion of the 62nd National Chess Championship held in Guntur, Andhra Pradesh. He remained unbeaten across 11 rounds, securing 7 victories and 4 draws. Although he finished with the same score as 15-year-old International Master H. Goutham Krishna from Kerala, Iniyan claimed the title based on a superior Buchholz score. His consistent performance and strategic brilliance throughout the tournament earned him the prestigious national title along with a prize of ₹6 lakh, further strengthening his reputation as one of India’s top chess players.

questions.question: In which city is the 12th World Para Athletics Championship 2025 being held?
questions.explanation: The 12th World Para Athletics Championship 2025 is being hosted in New Delhi at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium. This marks India’s first time hosting the prestigious global para-sport event, which features over 1,000 athletes from more than 100 nations competing across 186 medal events. The championship, held from September 27 to October 5, 2025, is a major milestone for Indian para sports and serves as a qualifying event for the 2028 Los Angeles Paralympics. New Delhi’s selection underscores India’s growing role in organizing large-scale international sporting events.

questions.question: Which international organization partnered with the ICC to launch the ‘Promise to Children’ campaign during the 2025 Women’s Cricket World Cup?
questions.explanation: The International Cricket Council (ICC) joined hands with UNICEF to launch the ‘Promise to Children’ campaign during the 2025 ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup. The initiative focuses on promoting children’s rights to education, healthcare, safety, and equal opportunities through the global influence of cricket. Featuring UNICEF ambassador Ayushmann Khurrana and Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana, the campaign uses social media engagement, cricket clinics, and public pledges to inspire global action for child welfare. UNICEF’s involvement underscores its long-standing mission to protect and empower children worldwide through collaborative partnerships and advocacy.

questions.question: In which Indian state is Tata Group establishing the country’s first private-sector helicopter Final Assembly Line (FAL) to build the Airbus H125?
questions.explanation: Tata Group, in collaboration with Airbus, is setting up India’s first private-sector helicopter Final Assembly Line (FAL) in Vemagal, Karnataka. The facility will assemble, test, and deliver Airbus H125 helicopters for both civil and defence purposes, with production expected to begin in 2027. This marks a major step in India’s aerospace manufacturing capability, positioning the country as a key aviation hub in Asia. The Karnataka location was chosen for its industrial infrastructure and strategic importance in supporting India’s growing aerospace ecosystem.

questions.question: How many new NIELIT centres were inaugurated along with the launch of the NIELIT Digital University platform?
questions.explanation: The NIELIT Digital University (NDU) platform was launched by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to promote accessible and high-quality digital education across India, especially in emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity, Data Science, and Semiconductors. Alongside this launch, five new NIELIT centres were inaugurated in Muzaffarpur, Balasore, Tirupati, Lunglei, and Daman. These centres aim to bridge the digital divide, strengthen regional skill development, and ensure that advanced technical education reaches students and professionals in underserved areas, aligning with India’s broader vision for a digitally empowered society and knowledge-based economy.

questions.question: Which agricultural sector is the focus of India’s newly launched Mission for Aatmanirbharta?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet approved the Mission for Aatmanirbharta in Pulses, aiming to strengthen India’s self-reliance in this vital agricultural sector. With an outlay of ₹11,440 crore for 2025-26 to 2030-31, the mission targets a production of 350 lakh tonnes of pulses, reducing dependency on imports and ensuring stable incomes for 2 crore farmers. The initiative includes assured procurement of key pulses like Tur, Urad, and Masoor under the Price Support Scheme (PSS) for the next four years. This program is a strategic effort to boost domestic production, enhance food security, and support the livelihoods of pulse farmers across India.

questions.question: Which Indian cricketer set a new record in the ICC Men’s T20I Batter Rankings by reaching 931 rating points?
questions.explanation: Abhishek Sharma created history by achieving the highest-ever rating in the ICC Men’s T20I Batter Rankings with 931 points. His record-breaking performance came after scoring a brilliant half-century against Sri Lanka during the Asia Cup. This milestone surpassed the previous best rating of 919 held by England’s Dawid Malan. In the same update, Varun Chakravarthy retained his position as the top-ranked T20I bowler, while Pakistan’s Saim Ayub became the leading all-rounder, overtaking India’s Hardik Pandya. Abhishek’s achievement highlights his growing stature as one of India’s most dynamic and consistent T20 batsmen.

questions.question: In which city did the 11th World Green Economy Summit (WGES) take place?
questions.explanation: The 11th World Green Economy Summit (WGES) was held in Dubai at the World Trade Centre, bringing together 3,300 participants from over 30 countries. The summit focused on the theme “Innovating for Impact: Accelerating the Future of the Green Economy” and ran alongside the Water, Energy, Technology, and Environment Exhibition (WETEX). Additionally, the Global Alliance on Green Economy (GAGE) unveiled its 2024-2025 portfolio during the event. Dubai’s hosting of this summit highlights its growing role as a hub for sustainable development discussions, innovation in green technologies, and international collaboration on environmental initiatives.

questions.question: Which country was re-elected to Part II of the ICAO Council, recognizing its major role in global air navigation infrastructure and aviation safety?
questions.explanation: India was re-elected to Part II of the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Council during the 42nd ICAO Assembly held in Montreal, Canada, on September 27, 2025. This re-election underscores India’s vital contribution to international air navigation services, aviation safety, and global air transport development. As a member in Part II, India continues to play a crucial role in shaping aviation policies, promoting international cooperation, and advancing sustainable aviation practices. The recognition highlights India’s technical expertise, expanding aviation infrastructure, and its leadership within the global civil aviation community under the United Nations framework.

questions.question: Which Indian state’s Bathukamma Festival achieved two Guinness World Records for the largest floral arrangement and the most synchronised female dance event?
questions.explanation: Telangana earned global recognition when its Bathukamma Festival set two Guinness World Records — one for the largest floral arrangement and another for the most synchronised female dance event. The vibrant festival, symbolizing devotion to Goddess Gauri and the celebration of feminine energy, featured over 300 artisans crafting a massive floral structure in 72 hours and thousands of women performing traditional dances in unison. Bathukamma, deeply rooted in Telangana’s agrarian and cultural traditions, coincides with Navratri and promotes eco-friendly practices, women’s empowerment, and community harmony, showcasing the state’s rich cultural heritage on an international stage.

questions.question: The MY Bharat Mobile App launched by Union Minister Dr. Mansukh Mandaviya is primarily aimed at which purpose?
questions.explanation: The MY Bharat Mobile App, launched by Union Minister Dr. Mansukh Mandaviya on 1 October 2025, is designed for Youth Empowerment. It brings the MY Bharat platform to mobile devices, enabling young citizens to access volunteering, internships, AI-based career tools, and national campaigns conveniently. The app integrates with Common Services Centres (CSCs) to extend digital access to rural areas, bridging the digital divide and fostering inclusion. With over 1.81 crore youth registered, it enhances opportunities for skill development, leadership, and civic engagement—helping India’s youth actively participate in nation-building and social transformation.

questions.question: Who won the silver medal in the women’s 48kg category at the World Weightlifting Championships 2025 held in Førde, Norway?
questions.explanation: Mirabai Chanu secured the silver medal in the women’s 48kg category at the World Weightlifting Championships 2025 in Førde, Norway. She achieved a total lift of 199kg, with 84kg in the snatch and 115kg in the clean and jerk. This competition marked her return to the world stage after her last World Championship appearance in 2022 and her second outing since finishing fourth at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Her consistent performance reinforces her status as one of India’s most successful and determined weightlifters on the global platform.

questions.question: What was the total GST collection recorded in India for September 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections for September 2025 reached ₹1.89 lakh crore, marking a 9.1% year-on-year growth and 1.5% increase over August 2025. This strong performance came despite recent tax rate reductions under the GST 2.0 reforms, which lowered GST on 375 items to boost consumption. The robust collection reflects healthy consumer demand, improved compliance, and the positive impact of rate rationalisation. It also highlights India’s fiscal resilience and economic stability as the government continues implementing reforms to strengthen revenue growth amid evolving market conditions and festive demand.

questions.question: Who was honoured with the Tamil Nadu Scientist Award (TANSA) 2022 in Environmental Science for his contributions to marine research and sustainable environmental practices?
questions.explanation: Dr. R. Arthur James, Professor and Chair of Marine Science at Bharathidasan University, received the Tamil Nadu Scientist Award (TANSA) 2022 in Environmental Science. He was recognised for his exceptional contributions to marine research and promoting sustainable environmental practices. The award included a ₹50,000 cash prize and a citation, highlighting the importance of his scientific work in advancing environmental awareness and research in Tamil Nadu. His achievements reflect both academic excellence and practical impact in environmental sustainability.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of Union Bank of India for a three-year term?
questions.explanation: Asheesh Pandey has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of Union Bank of India for a three-year term. Previously, he served as the Executive Director at the Bank of Maharashtra, where he gained significant experience in banking operations and credit management. His appointment was approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet and recommended by the Financial Services Institutions Bureau (FSIB) on May 30, 2025. This leadership change is part of the government’s effort to strengthen governance and drive efficiency across India’s public sector banks.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of the Central Bank of India for a three-year term?
questions.explanation: Kalyan Kumar has been appointed as the Managing Director and CEO of the Central Bank of India for a three-year term. He previously served as the Executive Director at Punjab National Bank (PNB) and will succeed M. V. Rao upon his superannuation in July 2025. His appointment was approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet and recommended by the Financial Services Institutions Bureau (FSIB) on May 30, 2025. With extensive experience in the banking sector, Kalyan Kumar’s leadership is expected to strengthen governance, enhance profitability, and drive digital transformation within the Central Bank of India.

questions.question: Which organization launched the IMAP mission to study the heliosphere, solar wind, and energetic particles from the Earth-Sun Lagrange Point 1 (L1)?
questions.explanation: NASA launched the Interstellar Mapping and Acceleration Probe (IMAP) mission to explore the heliosphere and space weather. The mission aims to map the boundary of the heliosphere, study solar wind, energetic particles, and magnetic fields, and understand how solar particles are energised. Additionally, IMAP helps study the heliosphere’s role in shielding Earth from harmful galactic radiation. Positioned at the Earth-Sun Lagrange Point 1 (L1), it provides a stable vantage point for continuous observations, enabling researchers to better understand space weather and its impact on Earth and the solar system.

questions.question: Which Indian athletes achieved a one-two finish in the Men’s Javelin Throw F44 event at the 2025 World Para Athletics Championships?
options: Sandip Sanjay Sargar and Sandeep Chaudhary
questions.answer: Sandip Sanjay Sargar and Sandeep Chaudhary
questions.explanation: Sandip Sanjay Sargar and Sandeep Chaudhary achieved a historic one-two finish in the Men’s Javelin Throw F44 event at the 2025 World Para Athletics Championships. Sargar secured the gold medal with a personal best throw of 62.82 m, while Chaudhary earned the silver with a season-best of 62.67 m. Their exceptional performances highlighted India’s growing dominance in para-athletics and showcased the country’s depth of talent in field events. This result not only demonstrated individual excellence but also contributed significantly to India’s overall medal tally, reflecting consistency, determination, and world-class sporting spirit.

questions.question: Which Indian state’s coast is expected to be affected by Cyclone Shakhti?
questions.explanation: Cyclone Shakhti, the first cyclonic storm in the Arabian Sea during the post-monsoon season, is forecasted to impact the Gujarat coast, especially the areas around Dwarka. The cyclone, named by Sri Lanka, is anticipated to intensify as it approaches land. Gujarat’s long Arabian Sea coastline makes it particularly vulnerable to such weather systems, which often bring strong winds, heavy rainfall, and potential disruptions to coastal communities and infrastructure. The state has been placed on high alert, and preparations are underway to mitigate possible damage and ensure the safety of residents.

questions.question: Who is set to become Japan’s first female Prime Minister after winning the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) leadership election?
questions.explanation: Sanae Takaichi has been elected as the leader of Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), making her set to become Japan’s first-ever female Prime Minister. She secured victory in a runoff election against Agriculture Minister Shinjiro Koizumi, following the resignation of outgoing Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba. Takaichi’s election marks a historic moment in Japanese politics, as she breaks a long-standing gender barrier in the country’s top political office. Her leadership is expected to shape Japan’s domestic policies and international relations, while also inspiring greater representation of women in political and administrative leadership roles.

questions.question: Which Indian state has introduced the E-Bond system for import and export businesses?
questions.explanation: The Maharashtra government has implemented the E-Bond system to modernise and digitise the process of bond execution for import and export businesses. By introducing this system, Maharashtra has become the 16th state in India to adopt digital bonds, marking a shift from traditional stamp paper bonds to an online, paperless format. This initiative aims to enhance efficiency, minimise manual paperwork, and reduce processing time in trade-related operations. It also supports the state’s broader goal of promoting digital governance and ease of doing business, especially in key sectors like logistics, trade, and export management.

questions.question: In which city will India host the Chiefs’ Conclave of the United Nations Troop Contributing Countries (UNTCC)?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army is organizing the Chiefs’ Conclave of the United Nations Troop Contributing Countries (UNTCC) in New Delhi. This significant event will bring together senior military leaders from over 30 nations to deliberate on the future of UN peacekeeping operations. The discussions will aim to enhance global cooperation, improve coordination among troop-contributing countries, and strengthen the preparedness of UN missions. Hosting the event in New Delhi underscores India’s long-standing commitment to international peacekeeping efforts and its pivotal role as one of the largest contributors of troops to UN peacekeeping missions worldwide.

questions.question: Which country hosted the Exercise Pacific Reach 2025 (XPR-25) where the Indian Navy showcased its submarine rescue capability?
questions.explanation: Exercise Pacific Reach 2025 (XPR-25) was hosted by the Republic of Singapore Navy and witnessed the Indian Navy demonstrating its advanced submarine rescue capabilities. This event was particularly significant as it marked the first time India’s Deep Submergence Rescue Vehicle (DSRV) performed a dive outside the Indian Ocean Region. Conducted aboard INS Nistar by the Submarine Rescue Unit (East), the exercise involved multiple successful rescue trials, showcasing India’s operational proficiency and strengthening regional naval cooperation. Singapore’s role as host highlights its strategic position in fostering maritime partnerships across the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: On which date is World Animal Day observed each year?
questions.explanation: World Animal Day is observed on October 4 every year to promote global awareness about animal rights, welfare, and conservation. The day aligns with the feast of St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of animals, symbolizing compassion toward all living beings. First celebrated in 1925 by Heinrich Zimmermann in Berlin, the observance date was officially moved to October 4 in 1929. In 2025, World Animal Day marks its 100th anniversary, with the theme “Save Animals, Save the Planet,” emphasizing the interconnection between protecting animals and sustaining the Earth’s ecosystems.

questions.question: Which country issued an orange alert for Typhoon Matmo?
questions.explanation: China’s national observatory issued an orange alert for Typhoon Matmo as it approached the country’s southern coastline. The storm was forecasted to make landfall between Guangdong and Hainan provinces, bringing with it heavy rainfall, strong winds, and the risk of flooding and landslides. Typhoon Matmo, also known locally as Paolo in the Philippines, had already been one of the 16 tropical cyclones affecting the region that year. The alert represents China’s second-highest level of weather warning, underscoring the seriousness of the threat and the country’s preparedness efforts to mitigate the storm’s potential impact on coastal areas.

questions.question: In which city did Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman launch the 'Aapki Punji Aapka Adhikar' campaign?
questions.explanation: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman launched the ‘Aapki Punji Aapka Adhikar’ campaign in Gandhinagar, Gujarat. The initiative focuses on helping citizens claim their rightful unclaimed financial assets from banks, insurance companies, and other financial institutions. With over ₹1.82 lakh crore worth of unclaimed assets lying dormant across the country, the campaign seeks to create awareness and streamline the process of reclaiming funds. Launching the campaign in Gandhinagar, a hub of financial and administrative activity, highlights the government’s commitment to improving financial inclusion and ensuring citizens have rightful access to their financial resources.

questions.question: In which place did Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav launch the ‘Namo Van’ initiative?
questions.explanation: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav launched the ‘Namo Van’ project in Manesar to mark the beginning of Wildlife Week 2025 celebrations. The initiative aligns with the year’s theme, ‘Sewa Parv,’ emphasizing service toward nature and environmental preservation. As part of the event, a large-scale plantation drive was organised under the ‘Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam’ campaign, encouraging citizens to plant trees in honour of their mothers. The ‘Namo Van’ project aims to promote biodiversity conservation, enhance green cover, and raise awareness about the importance of protecting wildlife and preserving India’s rich ecological heritage.

questions.question: In which state did Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurate the Sabar Dairy Plant?
questions.explanation: Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated the Sabar Dairy Plant in Rohtak, Haryana. This dairy facility, built with an investment of ₹350 crore, is the largest in India and aims to significantly boost the dairy sector in the region. The plant is expected to enhance milk production capacity, improve quality standards, and strengthen supply chains across the National Capital Region (NCR). By providing a modern processing infrastructure, it will help farmers secure better income and contribute to rural economic growth. The project reflects the government’s focus on promoting self-reliance and efficiency in India’s dairy industry.

questions.question: Which country’s regulatory authority approved the Alzheimer’s drug Lecanemab for early-stage use?
questions.explanation: Australia’s Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) approved Lecanemab (marketed as Leqembi) for treating early-stage Alzheimer’s disease, making it the second disease-modifying therapy cleared in the country. Lecanemab is a monoclonal antibody that targets amyloid-beta plaques, slowing cognitive decline and disease progression in patients with mild Alzheimer’s or mild cognitive impairment. Approval comes with safety measures, including MRI monitoring, due to risks like brain swelling and microhemorrhages. While the drug offers hope to early-stage patients, its high cost and limited accessibility remain challenges. This approval reflects Australia’s commitment to advancing dementia care and addressing rising Alzheimer’s prevalence.

questions.question: Which company purchased $6.6 billion worth of OpenAI shares, contributing to its $500 billion valuation?
questions.explanation: OpenAI achieved a $500 billion valuation following a $6.6 billion secondary share sale to SoftBank. This sale involved shares from current and former employees and reflects investor confidence in OpenAI’s rapid growth and strong revenue performance. The transaction did not dilute company capital but provided liquidity for early stakeholders. OpenAI’s revenue for the first half of 2025 reached $4.3 billion, driven by the expansion of ChatGPT Enterprise and Pro plans, integrations with Microsoft Copilot, and demand for custom AI solutions. SoftBank’s investment highlights the global interest in generative AI and positions OpenAI for potential strategic opportunities in technology and capital markets.

questions.question: Which country renamed the island where Zubeen Garg passed away as “Zubeen Garg Island” on Google Maps?
questions.explanation: Singapore honoured legendary Assamese singer Zubeen Garg by renaming the island where he tragically died as “Zubeen Garg Island” on Google Maps. Garg, aged 52, passed away during a scuba diving accident while on a yacht outing in Singapore. This tribute reflects his significant impact on music, both in Assam and Bollywood, with iconic songs such as “Ya Ali” from Gangster. The renaming not only commemorates his legacy but also underscores the global reach of his artistic contributions. Such gestures highlight the recognition of influential cultural figures beyond their home countries.

questions.question: Which organization will install QR code sign boards on National Highways to improve transparency and commuter convenience?
questions.explanation: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has announced the installation of QR code sign boards along National Highways to enhance transparency, safety, and commuter convenience. These boards will provide real-time information on highway numbers, project timelines, and emergency contacts, including the 1033 helpline. They will also guide travelers to nearby facilities such as hospitals, petrol pumps, police stations, and vehicle repair shops. Strategically placed at toll plazas, wayside amenities, and highway endpoints, the initiative aims to support smart infrastructure development, improve navigation, and strengthen emergency preparedness for road users across India.

questions.question: For which type of crops has the government hiked the Minimum Support Prices (MSP) for the 2026‑27 marketing season?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet has approved a significant increase in the Minimum Support Prices (MSP) for all mandated Rabi crops for the 2026‑27 marketing season. This move aims to provide better returns to farmers, encourage crop diversification, and ensure profitability in farming. Safflower received the highest MSP hike, followed by wheat, gram, lentil, rapeseed, mustard, and barley. Alongside this, the Mission for Aatmanirbharta in Pulses was launched to boost domestic pulse production. By raising MSPs for Rabi crops, the government seeks to stabilise farmers’ income, incentivise production, and reduce dependency on imports.

questions.question: In which Indian state will the A Ramachandran Museum open on October 5, 2025?
questions.explanation: The A Ramachandran Museum is set to open on October 5, 2025, in Kollam, Kerala, honouring the legacy of the celebrated modern Indian artist. Housed within the Sree Narayana Guru Cultural Complex, the museum showcases Ramachandran’s original paintings, sketches, and multimedia presentations, highlighting his mastery of urban realism, mythology, and Kerala mural art. Inaugurated by Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, the museum aims to preserve his contributions to art and education while promoting public engagement with Indian visual traditions. The initiative underscores Kerala’s commitment to institutionalizing artistic heritage and supporting contemporary art appreciation.

questions.question: In which city did the National Conference on Land Administration and Disaster Management begin on October 3, 2025?
questions.explanation: The two-day National Conference on Land Administration and Disaster Management commenced on October 3, 2025, at Mahatma Mandir in Gandhinagar. The conference focuses on modernizing land governance, enhancing disaster resilience, and securing citizens’ land rights through digitization and innovation. Key initiatives launched include the Integrated Land Administration (ILA) System, Revenue Diary, and the distribution of SVAMITVA cards to nomadic tribe families. The event brings together revenue officers and experts from across India to share best practices, discuss process reforms, and integrate disaster risk management into land use planning, strengthening transparency, efficiency, and institutional coordination nationwide.

questions.question: Who authored the book “Mahatma Gandhi and the Environment” that explores Gandhi’s ecological philosophy?
questions.explanation: “Mahatma Gandhi and the Environment: Analysing Gandhian Environmental Thought” was authored by renowned environmental scientist T. N. Khoshoo. The book delves into Gandhi’s philosophy on nature, sustainability, and resource use, emphasizing simplicity, minimalism, and the interconnectedness between humans and the environment. With a foreword by Dr. R. K. Pachauri, the work contextualizes Gandhi’s ideas for modern ecological challenges, highlighting themes such as sustainable resource use, village-centric development, and the balance between industrial growth and rural upliftment. Khoshoo’s book encourages integrating Gandhian principles into policy to achieve a sustainable, equitable, and environmentally conscious future.

questions.question: Which country has agreed with India to resume direct air services by late October 2025?
questions.explanation: India and China have agreed to restart direct air services between designated cities by late October 2025, marking a step toward the normalization of bilateral relations. These flights were suspended during the COVID-19 pandemic and disrupted further due to border tensions. The resumption is part of a broader effort to restore diplomatic, trade, and people-to-people exchanges, including tourism and education. Civil aviation authorities from both countries have revised the Air Services Agreement to facilitate this connectivity. Major hubs like Delhi, Mumbai, Beijing, and Shanghai are expected to benefit, strengthening economic and cultural ties between the two nations.

questions.question: Who has reclaimed the top spot in the Hurun India Rich List 2025?
questions.explanation: Mukesh Ambani, Chairman of Reliance Industries, has reclaimed the title of India’s richest person in the Hurun India Rich List 2025, with a net worth of ₹9.55 lakh crore. He surpassed Gautam Adani, who ranks second with ₹8.15 lakh crore, while Roshni Nadar Malhotra became India’s richest woman and entered the top three for the first time. The list highlights India’s growing billionaire count, now exceeding 350, and showcases trends like rising young entrepreneurs, significant wealth gains, and the prominence of self-made individuals. Ambani’s leadership in the list underscores his enduring influence in India’s corporate and economic landscape.

questions.question: Who were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discoveries on peripheral immune tolerance?
options: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi
Michael Rosbash, Michael Young, and Jeffrey Hall
questions.answer: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi
questions.explanation: The 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine was awarded to Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi for their pioneering research on peripheral immune tolerance. Their work identified regulatory T cells (Tregs) and the Foxp3 gene, which are critical in preventing the immune system from attacking the body’s own tissues. These discoveries have transformed immunology and provided new strategies for treating autoimmune diseases, cancer, and transplant rejection. Sakaguchi discovered Tregs, while Brunkow and Ramsdell identified the Foxp3 gene, linking their findings to a deeper understanding of immune system regulation.

questions.question: Off the coast of which city is the 10th National Pollution Response Exercise (NATPOLREX-X) being conducted by the Indian Coast Guard?
questions.explanation: The 10th National Level Pollution Response Exercise (NATPOLREX-X) is being conducted by the Indian Coast Guard off the Chennai coast in Tamil Nadu. This biennial exercise tests India’s preparedness and response capabilities for large-scale marine oil spills, involving multiple national and international stakeholders. Key objectives include evaluating inter-agency coordination, demonstrating technological innovations in pollution control, and strengthening maritime environmental governance. The exercise deploys pollution control vessels, aircraft, and specialised equipment, highlighting India’s commitment to safeguarding its 7,500 km coastline and Exclusive Economic Zone while enhancing global cooperation in marine environmental protection.

questions.question: On which date is World Cerebral Palsy Day 2025 observed?
questions.explanation: World Cerebral Palsy Day is observed annually to raise awareness about cerebral palsy, a common physical disability in childhood. In 2025, it falls on October 6. The day emphasises inclusion, equality, and empowerment for people affected by CP and their families. The theme for 2025, “Unique and United,” highlights both the individual strengths of those with CP and the collective effort needed for accessibility, dignity, and social integration. Recognizing this date helps promote understanding and support for the global CP community.

questions.question: When is World Habitat Day 2025 observed?
questions.explanation: World Habitat Day is observed annually on the first Monday of October to highlight the state of human settlements and the right to adequate shelter. In 2025, it falls on October 6. The day draws attention to urgent urban challenges such as climate change, conflict, and inequality, under the theme “Urban Crisis Response.” It also marks the start of Urban October, a month-long campaign promoting sustainable urban development and resilience. The observance includes global discussions, community programs, and initiatives to advance inclusive, safe, and resilient cities, aligning with Sustainable Development Goal 11.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the first Namo Biodiversity Park, also called ‘Namo Van,’ inaugurated?
questions.explanation: Rajasthan’s first Namo Biodiversity Park was inaugurated on 5 October 2025 at Pratap Bandh, Alwar, by Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav. The park, designed as a “green lung” for the region, aims to enhance urban greenery, improve air quality, and preserve the native flora and fauna of the Aravalli ecosystem. It integrates sustainable practices such as native tree plantation, eco-trails, educational zones, and rainwater harvesting. The initiative supports biodiversity conservation, climate resilience, and community participation, contributing to India’s environmental goals and the Lifestyle for Environment (LiFE) movement, promoting eco-friendly lifestyles and climate adaptation measures.

questions.question: From which date has UIDAI waived Aadhaar biometric update fees for children aged 7–15 years?
questions.explanation: UIDAI has waived all charges for Mandatory Biometric Updates (MBUs) for children aged 7–15 years, effective from October 1, 2025, for one year. This policy aims to simplify access to Aadhaar-based welfare services for nearly 6 crore children across India. Biometric updates, which include fingerprints, iris scans, and photographs, are essential for accurate identity authentication as children grow. The fee waiver ensures that updates can be completed without financial burden, even if the update is done outside the previously recommended age windows, supporting inclusion and ease of access to public services.

questions.question: In which city was the Centre for Makhana Excellence launched by Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan?
questions.explanation: The Centre for Makhana Excellence was launched in Patna, Bihar, during a Makhana Festival attended by Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan. The centre aims to enhance quality control, promote value addition, and support the growth of the makhana industry in India. Alongside the launch, the Minister released the report “Makhana to the world — from culture to prosperity,” highlighting strategies to expand the market reach and economic potential of this aquatic crop. The initiative reflects the government’s focus on boosting agricultural innovation and promoting regional specialties for national and global markets.

questions.question: Which country is participating with India in Exercise Konkan 2025 to enhance maritime cooperation?
questions.explanation: Exercise Konkan 2025 is a joint maritime exercise between the Indian Navy and the Royal Navy of the United Kingdom, held from 5 to 12 October off India’s western coast. The exercise aims to strengthen interoperability, enhance maritime security, and reinforce the India–UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership under Vision 2035. It involves complex drills, including anti-air, anti-surface, and anti-submarine warfare, with deployment of aircraft carriers, submarines, and other frontline naval assets from both nations. The UK’s participation underscores its strategic engagement in the Indo-Pacific region and its commitment to regional stability.

questions.question: In which country is the 68th Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference, attended by India’s delegation, being held?
questions.explanation: The 68th Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference is being held in Bridgetown, Barbados, with the theme “The Commonwealth – A Global Partner.” India’s parliamentary delegation is led by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla. Organised annually by the Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA), the conference brings together legislators from member countries to discuss governance, democracy, and collaborative initiatives. India’s participation underscores its engagement with Commonwealth nations, allowing for exchange of best practices, strengthening diplomatic ties, and contributing to discussions on global parliamentary cooperation and development strategies across member states.

questions.question: In which city are the BWF World Junior Championships 2025 being held in India?
questions.explanation: The BWF World Junior Championships 2025 are being hosted in Guwahati, Assam, from October 6 to 19. This marks the return of the prestigious tournament to India after 17 years, with the previous edition held in Pune in 2008. The event features 36 national teams competing in the Suhandinata Cup (mixed team event) and the Eye-Level Cup (individual events including singles, doubles, and mixed doubles). Hosting the championship underscores India’s growing role in international badminton, providing a platform for top junior shuttlers and introducing a new best-of-three relay scoring system to enhance the competitiveness and viewer engagement of matches.

questions.question: Which organization constructed the world’s highest motorable road at 19,400 feet in Ladakh’s Mig La Pass?
questions.explanation: The world’s highest motorable road at 19,400 feet in Ladakh’s Mig La Pass was built by the Border Roads Organisation (BRO) under Project Himank. This achievement surpasses the previous record set at Umling La Pass and highlights BRO’s expertise in high-altitude construction. The road serves both strategic military purposes, enhancing troop mobility near the Line of Actual Control, and civilian benefits, improving connectivity and tourism potential. BRO’s innovative engineering in extreme terrains demonstrates India’s capacity for infrastructure development in challenging environments, solidifying its global recognition in high-altitude road construction.

questions.question: Which state inaugurated its first commercial coal mine at Namchik, marking a significant step in economic and energy development?
questions.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh inaugurated its first commercial coal mine at Namchik-Namphuk in Changlang district on 6 October 2025, marking its entry into India’s coal-producing states. The project, managed by Coal Pulz Pvt Ltd (CPPL), holds approximately 1.5 crore tonnes of coal reserves and is expected to generate over ₹100 crore annually for the state. This development strengthens India’s energy security, provides employment opportunities, and stimulates local economic growth. It also signifies the integration of the North East region into national industrial and mineral supply chains, promoting long-term regional and technological development.

questions.question: On which date is World Cotton Day celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: World Cotton Day is celebrated annually on October 7 to highlight the significance of cotton in the global economy and support for cotton-producing countries. The day was officially recognised by the United Nations General Assembly on 30 August 2021, following a proposal by the Cotton-4 nations—Benin, Burkina Faso, Chad, and Mali—later joined by Côte d’Ivoire. The first celebration took place on 7 October 2019 at the World Trade Organization (WTO) headquarters in Geneva, emphasizing cotton’s role in trade, livelihoods, and sustainable development.

questions.question: Where did the 69th National School Games (NSG) commence?
questions.explanation: The 69th National School Games began in Jammu & Kashmir, organised by the Directorate of Youth Services & Sports of the region. The event brought together 30 teams representing different States and Union Territories, competing across six venues in various sports such as Football, Wushu, Taekwondo, and Table Tennis. The inauguration was carried out by Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, highlighting Jammu & Kashmir’s commitment to promoting youth sports and fostering national-level athletic talent.

questions.question: Which country is launching the National Camel Sustainability Initiative (NCSI) to address the decline in its camel population?
questions.explanation: The National Camel Sustainability Initiative (NCSI) is being launched by India through the Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying. The initiative aims to address the concerning decline in the camel population across the country, especially in the traditional camel-rearing regions of Rajasthan and Gujarat. With nearly 90% of India’s camels found in these two states, the program focuses on conservation, sustainable management, and livelihood support for herders to ensure the long-term survival and welfare of the species.

questions.question: Which country has launched Southeast Asia’s first coral larvae cryobank to preserve coral genetic diversity?
questions.explanation: The Philippines has established Southeast Asia’s first coral larvae cryobank, marking a major step toward marine biodiversity conservation. This initiative, developed in collaboration with research institutions from Taiwan, Indonesia, Malaysia, and Thailand, aims to freeze and preserve coral larvae to protect genetic diversity. The cryobank serves as a safeguard against coral loss caused by climate change, pollution, and ocean acidification. By preserving coral species for future restoration, the Philippines is demonstrating regional leadership in reef conservation and sustainable marine ecosystem management.

questions.question: Which country approved a plan to remove four zeros from its national currency, the rial, to combat inflation?
questions.explanation: Iran has approved a monetary reform plan to remove four zeros from its national currency, the rial, in an effort to simplify financial transactions and address severe inflation. With inflation rates exceeding 35% over a prolonged period, the rial’s value has significantly declined, prompting the need for this reform. The Central Bank of Iran has been given two years to make preparations, followed by a three-year transition phase. This decision reflects Iran’s attempt to stabilise its economy and restore confidence in its currency amid ongoing financial challenges.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the Mera Hou Chongba festival, celebrating Hill-valley unity, observed?
questions.explanation: The Mera Hou Chongba festival is celebrated in Manipur and is a unique cultural event that symbolises Hill-valley unity, promoting communal harmony among all indigenous communities. Observed annually on the 15th lunar day of the Mera month in the Meitei calendar, the festival features traditional rituals and a ceremonial march from the Royal Palace to Kangla. It stands out as the only festival in Manipur where participants from all indigenous communities come together, highlighting the state’s rich heritage, social cohesion, and the celebration of cultural diversity.

questions.question: Who won the Nobel Prize in Physics 2025 for their work on quantum tunnelling and energy quantisation in electric circuits?
options: Roger Penrose, Reinhard Genzel, Andrea Ghez
Alain Aspect, John F. Clauser, Anton Zeilinger
David J. Wineland, Serge Haroche, Shuji Nakamura
John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret, John M. Martinis
questions.answer: John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret, John M. Martinis
questions.explanation: The Nobel Prize in Physics 2025 was awarded to John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret, and John M. Martinis for their groundbreaking contributions to the discovery of macroscopic quantum mechanical tunnelling and energy quantisation in electric circuits. Their research has played a crucial role in advancing the understanding of quantum mechanics at a macroscopic scale, leading to major innovations in superconducting circuits and quantum computing technologies. This achievement highlights the profound connection between theoretical physics and practical applications in next-generation computing systems.

questions.question: Which country announced a €4.7 billion investment to join the NATO Pipeline System (NPS)?
questions.explanation: Poland has announced a €4.7 billion investment to become part of the NATO Pipeline System (NPS), a critical infrastructure established during the Cold War to supply fuel and lubricants to NATO forces. The NPS spans approximately 10,000 kilometers across 12 countries and includes extensive storage and distribution facilities such as depots, refineries, and air bases. Poland’s participation aims to strengthen its defence logistics, enhance energy security, and contribute to NATO’s overall operational readiness and strategic resilience in Europe.

questions.question: Which state government has approved land allocation for a new film city in Igatpuri?
questions.explanation: The Maharashtra government has approved the allocation of land for establishing a new film city in Igatpuri, located in the Nashik district. The proposed project will be modeled after Mumbai’s famous Dadasaheb Phalke Chitranagri, featuring state-of-the-art indoor studios, outdoor sets, and modern filming facilities. Situated about 150 km from Mumbai, the new film city aims to boost the state’s entertainment industry, attract filmmakers, and promote tourism in the region while easing pressure on Mumbai’s existing film infrastructure.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian to win a medal at the Judo Junior World Championships?
questions.explanation: Linthoi Chanambam, a 19-year-old judoka, created history by becoming the first Indian to win a medal at the Judo Junior World Championships held in Lima, Peru. She earned a bronze medal in the women’s 63 kg category after defeating Joni Geilen of the Netherlands. Her achievement marks a significant milestone for Indian judo, showcasing the country’s growing presence in international martial arts competitions and inspiring young athletes to pursue excellence in the sport through determination and discipline.

questions.question: In which country has India launched UPI payments at Lulu Group supermarkets to enable real-time digital transactions for Indian residents?
questions.explanation: India launched UPI (Unified Payments Interface) at Lulu Group supermarkets in Qatar on 6 October 2025, led by Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal. This initiative allows over 830,000 Indian residents and tourists in Qatar to make low-cost, real-time digital payments using India’s homegrown UPI system. The project, in partnership with NPCI International Payments Ltd (NIPL), Qatar National Bank (QNB), and NETSTARS, marks Qatar as the eighth country to adopt UPI. The move strengthens cross-border trade, facilitates faster remittances, and promotes India’s fintech innovation globally while providing wider payment options for local merchants.

questions.question: Which state became the first in India to abolish its Madrasa Board?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand became the first state in India to abolish its Madrasa Board after the Governor approved the Uttarakhand Minority Education Bill, 2025. The new legislation requires all Madrasas to register with the Uttarakhand Minority Education Authority and affiliate with the Uttarakhand School Education Board. This move aims to integrate minority educational institutions into the mainstream education system, ensuring uniform standards, improved quality of education, and better administrative oversight while promoting inclusivity and modernization of the educational framework across the state.

questions.question: Which vessel was commissioned into the Indian Navy on 6 October 2025 to strengthen coastal defence and indigenous shipbuilding capabilities?
questions.explanation: INS Androth, India’s second anti-submarine warfare shallow water craft, was commissioned on 6 October 2025 at the Naval Dockyard, Visakhapatnam. Part of the Arnala-class series and built by Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers (GRSE) in Kolkata, the ship incorporates over 80% indigenous content, reflecting India’s push for self-reliance in naval defence. Designed for coastal anti-submarine missions, maritime surveillance, and search-and-rescue operations, INS Androth enhances India’s underwater domain awareness and coastal security, contributing strategically to regional stability and the Indian Navy’s operational readiness in littoral waters.

questions.question: What is the World Bank’s revised GDP growth forecast for India for FY26?
questions.explanation: The World Bank has upgraded India’s GDP growth forecast for FY26 to 6.5%, up from the earlier estimate of 6.3%. This upward revision is driven by strong domestic demand, a resilient rural economy, and the positive impact of Goods and Services Tax (GST) reforms that have enhanced revenue collection and formalization. India is expected to remain the fastest-growing major economy globally, supported by rising consumption, improved agricultural output, and infrastructure spending. Despite these optimistic projections, the World Bank has cautioned about potential risks from global economic uncertainty and external shocks, such as the U.S. tariff on Indian exports.

questions.question: On which date is Indian Air Force Day celebrated each year?
questions.explanation: Indian Air Force Day is celebrated annually on October 8, commemorating the founding of the IAF in 1932. The day honours the courage and dedication of IAF personnel while showcasing India’s air power through air shows, parades, and exhibitions. The 2025 celebrations focus on modernization and operational readiness, highlighting advanced aircraft and technologies such as Rafale, Tejas, and C-17. IAF Day reflects both the historical legacy of the force and its evolution into a modern, capable air force, serving as a symbol of national strength, agility, and defence preparedness.

questions.question: Who were honoured with the Lifetime Achievement awards at the CEAT Cricket Rating Awards?
questions.explanation: BS Chandrasekhar, a legendary Indian leg-spinner, and Brian Lara, one of the greatest batsmen from the West Indies, received the prestigious Lifetime Achievement awards at the CEAT Cricket Rating Awards. This recognition highlights their immense contributions to the sport—Chandrasekhar for his match-winning spells in the 1960s and 1970s, and Lara for his record-breaking batting feats, including his 400* in Tests. The awards celebrate their lasting impact on international cricket and their roles as icons who inspired generations of players and fans alike.

questions.question: Who were awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2025 for their work on molecular constructions with large spaces for gases and chemicals?
options: Ahmed Zewail, Roald Hoffmann, and Frances Arnold
Jean-Pierre Sauvage, Fraser Stoddart, and Ben Feringa
Carolyn Bertozzi, Morten Meldal, and K. Barry Sharpless
Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M Yaghi
questions.answer: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M Yaghi
questions.explanation: The 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M Yaghi for pioneering the design of molecular structures that create large, porous spaces allowing gases and chemicals to flow efficiently. Their groundbreaking work has practical applications in harvesting water, capturing carbon dioxide, storing toxic gases, and catalyzing chemical reactions. The three scientists will share the prize money of 11 million Swedish crowns (around Rs 10 crore).
