This recognition highlights their transformative contribution to chemistry, particularly in materials science and sustainable technologies with significant global impact.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the next Director-General of UNESCO?
questions.explanation: Khaled el-Enany, Egypt’s former minister of antiquities and tourism, has been appointed as the next Director-General of UNESCO. With a background in archaeology and heritage preservation, El-Enany brings extensive experience in managing cultural and historical assets to the role. UNESCO, founded in 1945 and headquartered in Paris, focuses on fostering global peace and security through cooperation in education, science, culture, and communication. India, a founding member since 1948, continues to collaborate actively with UNESCO and hosts two of its offices. El-Enany’s appointment signifies a renewed emphasis on global cultural preservation and cooperation.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the brand ambassador for the Viksit Bharat Buildathon 2025?
questions.explanation: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian to reach the International Space Station (ISS), has been appointed as the brand ambassador for the Viksit Bharat Buildathon 2025. This Buildathon is India’s largest school-level hackathon, designed to involve over one crore students from 1.5 lakh schools across the country. It encourages young innovators to develop prototypes and creative solutions to real-world challenges. By choosing Shubhanshu Shukla, an inspirational space pioneer, as its ambassador, the initiative aims to motivate students to pursue innovation, scientific thinking, and contribute to building a technologically advanced and self-reliant India.

questions.question: Which edition of the Dehradun Literature Festival will be held in 2025?
questions.explanation: The 2025 Dehradun Literature Festival marks its 7th edition, celebrating literature, art, and cultural dialogue. The event will feature distinguished personalities such as Former Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud, filmmaker Imtiaz Ali, writer and columnist Shobhaa De, and singer Usha Uthup. With the theme “Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam: Voices of Unity,” the festival emphasises the spirit of global harmony and shared human values. Hosted at the Doon International School in Dehradun, the festival continues to serve as a vibrant platform for authors, artists, and thinkers to exchange creative ideas and cultural perspectives.

questions.question: Which company partnered with IICT and FICCI to develop creative-technology talent in India?
questions.explanation: Netflix has entered into a partnership with the Indian Institute of Creative Technology (IICT) and FICCI to foster the growth of creative-technology talent in India. The collaboration, announced during the 25th edition of FICCI Frames, aims to nurture young creators through training and educational opportunities. As part of this initiative, Netflix will utilise its Netflix Fund for Creative Equity to provide scholarships to deserving students. This partnership reflects Netflix’s commitment to promoting diversity, inclusion, and innovation in India’s growing media and entertainment sector by empowering future creative professionals.

questions.question: Which company onboarded India’s Unified Payments Interface (UPI) as its first payments system partner on its global platform?
questions.explanation: PayPal has integrated India’s Unified Payments Interface (UPI) as the first payments system partner on its newly launched global platform, PayPal World. This collaboration significantly enhances UPI’s global reach, enabling seamless cross-border transactions and positioning it as an international standard in digital payments. For PayPal, the integration provides access to India’s rapidly growing digital payment market, while consumers and merchants benefit from instant, secure, and cost-effective transactions. The partnership also strengthens PayPal’s competitive position against other fintech players and sets a precedent for global interoperability between national payment infrastructures and international platforms.

questions.question: In which Indian state will the Swadeshi Mela-2025 be organised to promote local entrepreneurship and indigenous products?
questions.explanation: The Swadeshi Mela-2025 will be organised in Noida, located in Uttar Pradesh, as part of the state’s initiative to encourage local entrepreneurship and promote indigenous products. The event aims to showcase and support the manufacture, sale, and exhibition of locally made goods, including handicrafts, handlooms, agricultural items, and innovative startup products. By organizing this international trade show, Uttar Pradesh seeks to empower small businesses, strengthen the local economy, and advance the vision of self-reliance under the broader “Swadeshi” movement promoting India’s domestic industries.

questions.question: In which country was India’s third Very Large Gas Carrier, Shivalik, built?
questions.explanation: Shivalik, India’s third Very Large Gas Carrier (VLGC), was constructed in South Korea, a nation known for its advanced shipbuilding technology and maritime engineering expertise. With a storage capacity of 82,000 cubic metres, Shivalik features state-of-the-art safety, temperature control, and operational systems, ensuring efficient gas transportation. The vessel has been inducted into the Shipping Corporation of India Limited’s (SCI) fleet, joining its predecessors Sahyadri and Anandamayi. This addition strengthens India’s maritime capabilities and supports the nation’s growing energy logistics infrastructure for liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) transport.

questions.question: Which country will unveil its first national Red List of Endangered Species at the IUCN World Congress 2025?
questions.explanation: India will launch its first national Red List of Endangered Species at the IUCN World Conservation Congress 2025 in Abu Dhabi. This initiative highlights species at risk within India and strengthens national conservation priorities. As one of the 17 mega-diverse countries, India hosts over 45,000 plant species and nearly 100,000 animal species across unique ecosystems like the Himalayas, Western Ghats, and Sundarbans. The Red List will provide critical scientific data to guide conservation decisions, address habitat loss, and support global biodiversity targets under the Convention on Biological Diversity, reinforcing India’s commitment to preserving its rich natural heritage.

questions.question: Which global investment firm launched its India credit platform and appointed Apurva Shah as Managing Director?
questions.explanation: Blackstone, one of the world’s largest investment firms, has launched its India credit platform as part of its expansion strategy in the country. The firm appointed Apurva Shah as Managing Director to head private credit origination operations in India. Blackstone Credit & Insurance (BXCI), managing around $484 billion in assets, is the world’s largest third-party credit platform. This move reinforces Blackstone’s commitment to strengthening its presence in India’s financial sector and expanding its focus on private credit opportunities across diverse market segments.

questions.question: Where was India’s first commercial electric truck battery swapping and charging station inaugurated?
questions.explanation: India’s first commercial electric truck battery swapping and charging station was inaugurated at the Delhi International Cargo Terminal (DICT) in Panchi Gujran village, Sonipat. The initiative, led by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, aims to encourage the use of electric vehicles in heavy transport. By enabling efficient battery swapping, it helps lower logistics costs, reduce dependency on imported fuel, and promote sustainable transportation. This marks a significant step towards achieving India’s goal of cleaner, more energy-efficient freight movement in the logistics and transportation sector.

questions.question: Which state government has empowered drug inspectors to inspect chemicals used in medicine and syrup manufacturing?
questions.explanation: The Uttar Pradesh government has introduced new measures to enhance pharmaceutical quality control by empowering drug inspectors to examine chemicals used in medicine and syrup production. This initiative aims to prevent the manufacture and distribution of adulterated or counterfeit medicines. Additionally, inspectors have been authorised to file FIRs against firms involved in such illegal practices. These reforms strengthen regulatory oversight in the pharmaceutical sector, ensuring the safety and reliability of medical products for consumers while reinforcing Uttar Pradesh’s commitment to public health and drug quality assurance.

questions.question: Which bank launched the ‘Innovation Banking’ initiative with a $1 billion allocation to support Indian startups?
questions.explanation: HSBC India has introduced the ‘Innovation Banking’ initiative to provide customised financial and banking solutions for startups at various stages of growth—from seed funding to IPO. The program includes a $1 billion allocation in non-dilutive debt capital, enabling startups to access funding without giving up equity. This move aims to strengthen India’s startup ecosystem by offering long-term financial support and innovative credit solutions, reflecting HSBC’s commitment to nurturing entrepreneurial ventures and driving economic growth through technological innovation and business development.

questions.question: Which company expanded its AI-powered no-code app builder, Opal, to 15 countries including India and Japan?
questions.explanation: Google has expanded its AI-driven no-code app builder, Opal, to 15 countries including India, Japan, Brazil, South Korea, and Canada. Developed by Google Labs, Opal enables users to create functional applications simply by describing them in natural language. This expansion is a major step in Google’s mission to democratise app development and make AI tools accessible to both developers and non-coders globally. With features like a visual editor, debugging tools, and instant sharing, Opal empowers users to design and deploy customised apps efficiently, promoting inclusivity in the digital innovation space.

questions.question: Which state government announced the creation of the “Gyana Yagnya Mandap” digital library?
questions.explanation: The government of Odisha has announced the establishment of the “Gyana Yagnya Mandap” digital library in Puri. This initiative aims to digitally preserve and provide access to rare records, manuscripts, and sacred documents related to the Jagannath Temple. The library will be constructed on the site of the old Raghunandan Library near the temple premises. By combining technology with cultural preservation, this project will benefit devotees, researchers, and historians, ensuring that valuable religious and historical knowledge remains accessible to future generations while promoting Odisha’s rich spiritual heritage.

questions.question: Which state signed an MoU with the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) to produce Green Hydrogen from paddy straw?
questions.explanation: Punjab has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) to establish a Pilot Demonstration Project for Green Hydrogen production from biomass, particularly paddy straw. This initiative aims to tackle the recurring issue of stubble burning, which causes severe air pollution in northern India. By converting paddy residue into clean fuel, the project not only contributes to environmental protection but also offers new economic opportunities for farmers. The collaboration represents a forward-looking approach toward sustainable energy development and rural economic empowerment in Punjab.

questions.question: In which country was a 12,000-year-old pillar carved with a human face recently unearthed?
questions.explanation: A remarkable archaeological discovery was made in southeastern Turkiye, where a 12,000-year-old T-shaped pillar featuring a carved human face was unearthed at the Karahantepe site in Şanlıurfa Province. This finding represents the earliest known depiction of a human face carved directly onto a pillar, offering significant insights into Neolithic art and symbolism. The discovery sheds light on early human self-expression and religious or cultural practices, contributing valuable knowledge to the study of ancient civilizations and their development of artistic and symbolic representation during the Neolithic era.

questions.question: Where will India host the 8th International Solar Alliance Assembly in October 2025?
questions.explanation: India will host the 8th International Solar Alliance (ISA) Assembly from October 27–30, 2025, at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. The summit will bring together leaders, policymakers, and stakeholders from 124 countries to discuss strategies for global solar energy collaboration, affordable access, and scaling adoption across sectors like agriculture, transport, and healthcare. Hosting the ISA Assembly underscores India’s leadership in renewable energy, as it continues to expand its non-fossil fuel electricity capacity and position itself as a global hub for clean energy innovation. The event also aligns with India’s vision of a carbon-neutral future.

questions.question: Who won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Literature for his compelling and visionary oeuvre?
questions.explanation: Hungarian novelist and screenwriter Laszlo Krasznahorkai received the 2025 Nobel Prize in Literature for his profound and visionary body of work. Often referred to as the “writer of the apocalypse,” Krasznahorkai’s novels explore themes of existential dread, human resilience, and the search for meaning in chaotic times. The Nobel committee honoured him for his ability to reaffirm the transformative power of art amidst apocalyptic terror. His richly complex narratives and stylistic mastery have earned him global acclaim as one of the most distinctive voices in contemporary world literature.

questions.question: Which company partnered with Anthropic to integrate the Claude large language model into its software ecosystem?
questions.explanation: IBM has partnered with Anthropic to integrate Claude, Anthropic’s advanced large language model (LLM), into its software ecosystem. This collaboration is focused on creating secure, high-performance, and governed AI tools suitable for enterprise environments. By embedding Claude into IBM’s platforms, the company aims to move beyond experimental AI applications and enable practical, scalable deployments for businesses. The partnership reflects the growing trend of integrating cutting-edge AI models into enterprise software, enhancing capabilities such as automation, natural language processing, and data-driven decision-making while maintaining compliance and security standards.

questions.question: Which country hosted the world’s first live underwater interview to promote ocean conservation?
questions.explanation: Palau, a Pacific island nation comprising 340 islands, hosted the world’s first live underwater interview to highlight the importance of ocean conservation. The interview utilised the innovative LiFi Talking Mask technology, which transmits sound underwater using light, allowing clear communication beneath the sea. Palau’s initiative emphasises the nation’s vulnerability to rising sea levels and its commitment to protecting marine ecosystems. This pioneering event combined technology, awareness, and environmental advocacy, setting a global example for creative methods to engage the public in marine conservation and climate change awareness.

questions.question: Who won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her courageous efforts in promoting democracy and peaceful transition in Venezuela?
questions.explanation: The 2025 Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to Maria Corina Machado, a Venezuelan politician and democracy activist recognised for her relentless struggle for democratic rights and peaceful political transition in Venezuela. As the founder of Súmate, she has spent decades advocating for free elections, judicial independence, and nonviolent resistance against authoritarianism. Despite facing persecution, threats, and exclusion from elections, Machado’s leadership has united Venezuela’s opposition and inspired global movements for peaceful reform. Her recognition by the Norwegian Nobel Committee underscores the power of civilian courage and the link between democracy and lasting peace worldwide.

questions.question: With which country did India sign key defence agreements in October 2025 to enhance military cooperation and Indo-Pacific security?
questions.explanation: India signed crucial defence agreements with Australia in October 2025 during Defence Minister Rajnath Singh’s visit to Canberra. The pacts aim to deepen strategic and military collaboration, focusing on defence manufacturing, cybersecurity, maritime domain awareness, and joint military exercises. Both sides emphasised their shared commitment to maintaining peace, stability, and a free Indo-Pacific region. The agreements also seek to boost interoperability between the armed forces, facilitate technology transfer, and encourage defence industry partnerships under India’s Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative, marking a significant advancement in the India–Australia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.

questions.question: Which state launched dedicated Tourism Police units to enhance tourist safety and the overall tourism experience?
questions.explanation: Telangana has introduced dedicated Tourism Police units aimed at improving the safety and security of tourists while enhancing their overall experience in the state. The initiative began with a week-long induction program for the first batch of 80 personnel at the National Institute of Tourism and Hospitality Management (NITHM) in Hyderabad. By establishing specialised units focused on tourism-related security, Telangana seeks to create a safer and more welcoming environment for visitors. This step also highlights the state’s commitment to boosting tourism, ensuring that tourists can explore its cultural, historical, and natural attractions with confidence and peace of mind.

questions.question: In which city did the 6th edition of the Global Fintech Fest (GFF) 2025 commence?
questions.explanation: The 6th Global Fintech Fest (GFF) 2025 was inaugurated at the Jio World Centre in Mumbai, marking one of the largest gatherings of global financial innovators and leaders. The three-day event, themed “Empowering Finance for a Better World Powered by AI,” focuses on fostering collaboration among regulators, fintech companies, and investors. It aims to drive innovation, explore emerging technologies in finance, and discuss strategies for inclusive financial growth. Hosting the event in Mumbai, India’s financial capital, underscores the city’s strategic importance in fintech development and global financial connectivity.

questions.question: Who made history by winning India’s first-ever Mrs Universe crown in 2025?
questions.explanation: Sherry Singh created history by becoming the first Indian to win the Mrs Universe 2025 title at the grand finale held in Manila, Philippines. Competing against 120 contestants from around the world, she impressed the judges with her confidence, intellect, and advocacy for women’s empowerment and mental health awareness. Her win marks a significant milestone for India in global beauty pageantry, showcasing the strength and grace of Indian women. The Mrs Universe platform celebrates not just beauty but also leadership and compassion, making Sherry Singh’s achievement a source of national pride and inspiration worldwide.

questions.question: Which country launched the National Red List Roadmap and Vision 2025–2030 at the IUCN World Conservation Congress 2025?
questions.explanation: India launched its National Red List Roadmap and Vision 2025–2030 at the IUCN World Conservation Congress 2025, aiming to strengthen biodiversity conservation efforts. Unveiled by Union Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh, the initiative sets the groundwork for compiling National Red Data Books for both flora and fauna by 2030. The roadmap is designed to systematically assess species’ conservation status, raise awareness about threatened biodiversity, and guide policy measures for habitat protection. This step reinforces India’s commitment to global environmental goals, sustainable ecosystem management, and the protection of endangered species across its diverse ecological landscapes.

questions.question: Which country launched its first-ever National Child Safeguarding Policy to ensure child safety across all sectors of society?
questions.explanation: Fiji has introduced its first National Child Safeguarding Policy, establishing a comprehensive framework to protect children across all sectors. The policy mandates that services involving children be safe, respectful, and child-friendly, aiming to prevent harm and promote well-being. This initiative addresses growing regional concerns about child safety in the Pacific and sets a national benchmark for other countries to follow. By creating clear guidelines and accountability mechanisms, Fiji strengthens its commitment to child protection, ensuring that all children have access to secure environments where their rights, dignity, and development are prioritised.

questions.question: With which country did India issue a Joint Statement in October 2025 highlighting cooperation in trade, defence, technology, and education?
questions.explanation: India and the United Kingdom released a comprehensive Joint Statement on October 9, 2025, during UK Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer’s official visit to India. The discussions focused on enhancing collaboration in multiple sectors including defence, technology, climate action, and education. Both nations reaffirmed their commitment to the early ratification of the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and launched several joint initiatives like the India–UK Climate Finance Initiative and the Connectivity and Innovation Centre. The visit strengthened bilateral ties and underscored the shared vision for sustainable growth, innovation, and global strategic cooperation between India and the UK.

questions.question: What is the name of the indigenous anti-drone grid launched by the Indian Army to enhance real-time airspace control?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army has launched SAKSHAM, an indigenous Counter-Unmanned Aerial System (UAS) Grid, marking a major step in strengthening India’s air defence and counter-drone capabilities. Developed in collaboration with Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL), Ghaziabad, SAKSHAM—short for Situational Awareness for Kinetic Soft and Hard Kill Assets Management—integrates radar, AI, and electro-optical sensors to detect, track, and neutralise aerial threats. Operating through the Army Data Network, it provides a unified airspace picture up to 10,000 feet. The system supports the Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative and enhances battlefield readiness against modern drone warfare threats.

questions.question: On which date is National Post Day 2025 celebrated in India?
questions.explanation: National Post Day 2025 is celebrated on October 10 to honour the immense contributions of India Post to the nation’s communication, logistics, and financial inclusion systems. Established by the Government of India in 1982, the day recognises the transformation of India Post from a traditional letter delivery network into a modern digital, financial, and e-commerce service provider. It also highlights India Post’s vital role in empowering rural communities, facilitating welfare schemes, and strengthening last-mile connectivity across the country. The observance forms part of National Postal Week, celebrated from October 9 to 15 every year.

questions.question: Which organization launched the Viksit Bharat Strategy Room at LBSNAA to foster analytical thinking and data-driven governance among future administrators?
questions.explanation: NITI Aayog, in collaboration with the Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration (LBSNAA), inaugurated the Viksit Bharat Strategy Room (VBSR) at Mussoorie. The VBSR is designed as an innovative governance hub aimed at enhancing analytical skills, promoting data-driven decision-making, and encouraging innovative approaches among India’s administrative cadre. This initiative supports capacity building for future leaders, equipping them with tools to address complex policy challenges. By integrating technology, research, and strategic thinking, the VBSR strengthens evidence-based governance and contributes to India’s vision of efficient and responsive public administration.

questions.question: In which state was the ‘Sardar@150 – Unity March’ campaign launched to commemorate the 150th birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel?
questions.explanation: The ‘Sardar@150 – Unity March’ campaign was launched in Punjab by Governor Gulab Chand Kataria in Chandigarh to celebrate the 150th birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. The initiative aims to promote the spirit of unity, patriotism, and nation-building among the youth through various national-level activities such as creative competitions and awareness drives. Running until December 6th, this campaign honours Sardar Patel’s legacy as the “Iron Man of India,” highlighting his pivotal role in integrating the nation and inspiring future generations to uphold the values of integrity and collective progress.

questions.question: On which date is World Mental Health Day observed every year?
questions.explanation: World Mental Health Day is observed every year on October 10 to raise awareness about mental wellbeing, reduce stigma, and promote access to mental health care globally. Established in 1992 by the World Federation for Mental Health, the day has become a global movement supported by the World Health Organization (WHO). The 2025 theme, “Access to Services – Mental Health in Catastrophes and Emergencies,” emphasises ensuring psychological support during crises such as wars, pandemics, and natural disasters. The observance highlights mental health as a fundamental human right and encourages collective action for inclusive and accessible care worldwide.

questions.question: Which bank launched the “My Business QR” initiative to provide small merchants with a digital storefront and QR-based commerce identity?
questions.explanation: HDFC Bank launched the “My Business QR” at the Global Fintech Fest (GFF) 2025 in partnership with Vyaparify. The initiative empowers small and medium businesses to establish a digital storefront and unique commerce identity through a single QR code. Integrated with HDFC’s SmartHub Vyapar app, it enables merchants to showcase business details, accept payments, and interact with customers digitally without needing a website or technical setup. This innovation supports India’s vision for digital financial inclusion by helping millions of retailers transition from offline to online operations, improving accessibility, customer engagement, and growth opportunities.

questions.question: Which Indian state signed an MoU with Spain’s Fira Barcelona International to establish a world-class convention centre?
questions.explanation: Maharashtra has entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Fira Barcelona International, a renowned organization from Spain, to develop a world-class convention centre in Nagpur. The project, announced by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, aims to create a state-of-the-art facility equipped with modern amenities and excellent connectivity by various modes of transport. Beyond infrastructure development, the convention centre is expected to serve as a cultural and economic hub, hosting international conferences, exhibitions, and events that can boost tourism, generate employment, and strengthen Maharashtra’s position as a global business destination.

questions.question: With which country did India conduct its first-ever Combined Carrier Strike Group exercise during Exercise Konkan 2025?
questions.explanation: India and the United Kingdom conducted their first Combined Carrier Strike Group exercise during Exercise Konkan 2025, held from October 5–9 off India’s western coast. The exercise marked a major milestone in bilateral defence cooperation and maritime partnership between the Indian Navy and the Royal Navy. Featuring India’s INS Vikrant and the UK’s HMS Prince of Wales, along with other naval assets, the drills included air-sea warfare, anti-submarine operations, and joint tactical manoeuvres. This historic event strengthened Indo-UK strategic ties and showcased their shared commitment to maintaining stability and security in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: Who has joined Microsoft and Anthropic as a senior adviser in the global technology sector?
questions.explanation: Rishi Sunak, the former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, has taken up advisory roles with Microsoft and Anthropic, an artificial intelligence company. His involvement highlights the growing collaboration between political leaders and the tech industry in shaping AI policy and innovation. Sunak has also pledged to donate all earnings from these positions to The Richmond Project, a charity he co-founded with his wife, Akshata Murty. This move underscores his commitment to leveraging his global influence for social good and advancing responsible technology development.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Interim CEO of Castrol India starting January 2026?
questions.explanation: Castrol India announced a key leadership change with the appointment of Saugata Basuray as the Interim CEO, effective from January 2026. He will take over following the resignation of Kedar Lele, who steps down as Managing Director at the end of December 2025. Basuray, a long-serving Castrol professional since 1999, currently holds the position of Wholetime Director & Head of B2C Sales and will retain these responsibilities alongside his interim CEO role. His appointment reflects the company’s focus on maintaining continuity and leveraging internal leadership strength during a critical period of strategic transformation in the lubricant industry.

questions.question: Which country has approved the withdrawal from the Plutonium Management and Disposition Agreement (PMDA) with the United States?
questions.explanation: Russia’s lower house of parliament has approved the country’s withdrawal from the Plutonium Management and Disposition Agreement (PMDA) with the United States. The PMDA, signed in 2000 and implemented in 2011, required both nations to dispose of 34 tonnes of weapons-grade plutonium each—enough to produce around 17,000 nuclear warheads. The agreement was aimed at reducing nuclear stockpiles and preventing proliferation. Russia’s decision to exit marks a setback for nuclear disarmament efforts and reflects rising tensions between the two major powers over strategic and security concerns in global geopolitics.

questions.question: Which organization, along with IRENA, signed an MoU to promote the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy?
questions.explanation: The International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) during the IUCN World Conservation Congress in Abu Dhabi. This collaboration aims to promote a global shift from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources while ensuring environmental sustainability. The partnership focuses on balancing energy transition goals with conservation priorities, minimizing ecological impacts, and supporting sustainable development practices. By uniting conservation expertise and renewable energy advocacy, IUCN and IRENA intend to foster greener, more responsible energy systems for a sustainable global future.

questions.question: Which Indian state hosted the 3rd edition of the International Purple Fair 2025?
questions.explanation: The 3rd International Purple Fair 2025 was hosted in Goa and inaugurated by Chief Minister Dr. Pramod Sawant. The event carried the theme “Celebration of Inclusion, Talent, and Empowerment” and aimed to highlight the capabilities and contributions of persons with disabilities (PwDs). It served as a platform to showcase their talent, entrepreneurship, and innovative spirit while promoting social inclusion and accessibility. By organizing such an event, Goa demonstrated its commitment to empowering differently-abled individuals and encouraging greater participation in social and economic development.

questions.question: Under which Article does the Supreme Court hold that judicial officers with seven years of practice as advocates before joining judicial service are eligible for direct recruitment as District Judges?
questions.explanation: Article 233 of the Indian Constitution deals with the appointment of District Judges. The Supreme Court clarified that judicial officers who had completed seven years of practice as advocates before entering the judicial service are eligible for direct recruitment as District Judges under this Article. Earlier, only practising advocates with seven years of experience were considered eligible, excluding in-service judicial officers. This ruling ensures broader eligibility and promotes fairness in judicial appointments while maintaining the integrity and experience criteria necessary for the position of District Judge.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian fast bowler to play 50 matches across all international formats?
questions.explanation: Jasprit Bumrah achieved a historic milestone by becoming the first Indian fast bowler to play 50 matches across all international formats—Tests, ODIs, and T20Is. He reached this landmark during the second Test against the West Indies at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi on October 10, 2025. Bumrah’s accomplishment highlights his consistency, fitness, and versatility across formats. Known for his unique action and precision, he joins an elite group of Indian players, including MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli, and Rohit Sharma, who have achieved 50+ appearances across all formats, solidifying his status among India’s greatest modern pacers.

questions.question: How many major Indian ports have been recognised as Green Hydrogen Hubs under the National Green Hydrogen Mission?
questions.explanation: Under the National Green Hydrogen Mission, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy has identified three major Indian ports as Green Hydrogen Hubs. These include Deendayal Port Authority in Gujarat, V.O. Chidambaranar Port Authority in Tamil Nadu, and Paradip Port Authority in Odisha. This initiative aims to promote sustainable energy infrastructure and accelerate India’s transition towards clean hydrogen production and export. Recognizing these ports as hubs is a strategic step to establish India as a global leader in the green hydrogen ecosystem, boosting both environmental and economic growth.

questions.question: In which city was the 90th Foundation Day of the National Sugar Institute (NSI) celebrated?
questions.explanation: The 90th Foundation Day of the National Sugar Institute (NSI) was celebrated in Kanpur, with Union Minister Prahlad Joshi attending as the chief guest. During the event, the minister announced the introduction of regular B.Tech and M.Tech programs related to the sugar industry. These courses will be offered by NSI in collaboration with IIT Kanpur, aiming to enhance technical expertise, research, and innovation in the sugar sector. Holding the event in Kanpur highlights the city’s longstanding association with sugar education and industry development in India.

questions.question: Which country partnered with India to launch the Connectivity & Innovation Centre for 6G development, network security, and inclusive connectivity?
questions.explanation: India partnered with the United Kingdom to establish the India-UK Connectivity & Innovation Centre, focusing on 6G technology, network security, and inclusive connectivity. Both governments committed £24 million over four years to support the initiative. The centre will be implemented jointly by UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) and India’s Department of Telecommunications (DoT). This collaboration strengthens technological ties, promotes innovation in next-generation telecommunications, and ensures secure, accessible digital infrastructure. It demonstrates the growing role of international partnerships in advancing research, connectivity, and technological development globally.

questions.question: How many new commodities were added to the e-NAM platform in its latest expansion?
questions.explanation: The National Agriculture Market (e-NAM) platform expanded its coverage by adding 9 new agricultural commodities, increasing the total tradable items to 247. The newly added commodities include Green Tea, Tea, Aswagandha Dry Roots, Mustard Oil, Lavender Oil, Mentha Oil, Virgin Olive Oil, Lavender Dried Flower, and Broken Rice. This expansion strengthens India’s digital agriculture ecosystem by providing farmers and traders greater access to markets, ensuring quality-based pricing, and reducing dependency on intermediaries. The Directorate of Marketing and Inspection (DMI) has set standardized quality parameters for these commodities, promoting transparency and fair trade across the platform.

questions.question: Which Indian athletes won gold medals in Men’s High Jump T47 and Women’s 100m T12 at the 2025 World Para Athletics Championships?
questions.explanation: Nishad Kumar and Simran Sharma won gold medals at the 2025 World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi. Nishad Kumar secured gold in the Men’s High Jump T47 with a leap of 2.14 meters, breaking his own Asian record, while Simran Sharma triumphed in the Women’s 100 meters T12 with a personal best of 11.95 seconds. Their victories were part of a historic day for India, which also won two bronze medals, highlighting the nation’s growing prominence in global para athletics and the exceptional talent of its athletes.

questions.question: In which city was the One integrated mobility app launched for seamless public transport?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched ‘Mumbai One’, India’s first unified mobility app, to integrate ticketing across 11 public transport services in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR). The app allows commuters to book a single digital ticket for metro, buses, suburban trains, monorail, and taxis, supporting a trilingual interface in Marathi, Hindi, and English. It provides real-time journey planning, QR-based cashless payments, and safety features like emergency support. Hosted on Google Cloud Platform using Kubernetes Engine, the app is designed to handle up to 50 lakh transactions daily, significantly enhancing convenience, accessibility, and efficiency for Mumbai’s public transport users.

questions.question: Which organization launched IRSA 1.0, India’s first standardized software architecture for military Software Defined Radios?
questions.explanation: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), in collaboration with the Integrated Defence Staff and Tri-Services, launched IRSA 1.0, India’s first standardized software framework for Software Defined Radios (SDRs). IRSA 1.0 enables interoperability across military communication systems, allowing radios from different vendors to work together efficiently. It adopts the NATO SCA 4.1 standard, tailored for Indian needs, and supports multiple hardware environments like GPPs, DSPs, and FPGAs. This initiative strengthens indigenous defence technology, aligns with Atmanirbhar Bharat, and positions India for potential export of IRSA-compliant systems, enhancing secure, network-centric military operations.

questions.question: In which Indian state is Eli Lilly investing $1 billion to expand its pharmaceutical manufacturing and global supply operations?
questions.explanation: US-based pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly announced a $1 billion investment in Telangana, specifically Hyderabad, to expand manufacturing and global supply of medicines for diabetes, cancer, Alzheimer’s, and other conditions. The state was chosen for its strong life sciences ecosystem, skilled workforce, robust infrastructure, and industry-friendly policies. This investment builds on the company’s existing Global Capability Centre in Hyderabad and is expected to enhance India’s role in the global pharmaceutical value chain. Additionally, it will generate thousands of jobs, promote skill development, and strengthen academic-industry collaboration, boosting Telangana’s reputation as a pharmaceutical hub.

questions.question: Who is the target group for the fourth edition of the SPARK program launched by the government?
questions.explanation: The fourth edition of the SPARK (Studentship Program for Ayurveda Research Ken) program has been launched to encourage scientific curiosity and research skills among undergraduate Ayurveda students. Specifically, the program targets 300 BAMS (Bachelor of Ayurvedic Medicine and Surgery) students from colleges recognized by the National Commission for Indian System of Medicine (NCISM). Each selected student will receive a studentship of ₹50,000 to support their research initiatives. By focusing on Ayurveda students, the initiative aims to strengthen evidence-based research in traditional medicine and nurture the next generation of scholars in India’s ancient healthcare system.

questions.question: In which city did the Manipur Global Buyers and Sellers Summit 2025 commence?
questions.explanation: The Manipur Global Buyers and Sellers Summit 2025 was inaugurated at the City Convention Centre in Imphal by Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla. The summit, organized under the theme “Bridging Business Sans Borders,” is part of the Raising and Accelerating MSME Performance (RAMP) initiative by the Ministry of MSME, Government of India. It aims to promote trade, investment, and collaboration among small and medium enterprises (SMEs) by providing a platform for global buyers and sellers to connect. Hosting the summit in Imphal emphasizes the government’s focus on regional economic development and boosting MSME growth in North-East India.

questions.question: Which country launched Southeast Asia’s first Coral Larvae Cryobank to preserve coral genetic diversity?
questions.explanation: The Philippines has pioneered Southeast Asia’s first Coral Larvae Cryobank, aimed at preserving coral genetic diversity and safeguarding vital reef ecosystems. Using advanced cryopreservation techniques, coral larvae are frozen at ultra-low temperatures to halt biological activity, allowing future revival for reef restoration and research. The initiative is part of a multinational collaboration across the Coral Triangle region, which holds over 75% of the world’s coral species and nearly a third of reef fish species. This effort addresses threats from climate change, bleaching events, and human activities, contributing to marine biodiversity conservation and the resilience of coastal ecosystems.

questions.question: Which country has been allowed by the U.S. to establish a military training facility at Mountain Home Air Force Base in Idaho?
questions.explanation: The United States has approved the establishment of a military training facility by Qatar at Mountain Home Air Force Base in Idaho. This agreement enables Qatari F-15QA fighter jets and pilots to participate in joint training programs with U.S. forces over the next decade. Qatar already holds the status of a major non-NATO ally and hosts the largest U.S. military base in West Asia. This collaboration further strengthens strategic defence ties between the two nations, enhancing interoperability, joint readiness, and mutual security interests in the broader Middle Eastern and global defence landscape.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction observed globally?
questions.explanation: The International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction is observed globally on October 13. Established in 1989 following a United Nations General Assembly initiative, the day aims to promote a global culture of risk awareness and proactive disaster reduction. The 2025 theme, “Fund Resilience, Not Disasters,” emphasises the importance of investing in preparedness, mitigation, and resilient infrastructure rather than solely responding to disasters after they occur. Observing this day encourages governments, communities, and individuals to implement strategies that reduce vulnerability, enhance emergency response, and foster sustainable, disaster-resilient societies worldwide.

questions.question: In which city did the 78th WHO Regional Committee Session for South-East Asia begin?
questions.explanation: The 78th session of the WHO Regional Committee for South-East Asia commenced in Colombo, bringing together health leaders from across the region to discuss key public health priorities. India’s Minister of State for Health, Anupriya Patel, is set to participate in the plenary session, emphasizing India’s active engagement in regional health initiatives. The conference focuses on enhancing cooperation among member countries to strengthen health systems, improve pandemic preparedness, and foster sustainable healthcare solutions. Hosting the event in Colombo underscores Sri Lanka’s growing role in regional and global health diplomacy.

questions.question: In which country is the 19th Mid-Term Ministerial of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) being held?
questions.explanation: The 19th Mid-Term Ministerial of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) is being hosted in Kampala, Uganda, with Uganda holding the NAM Chair for the 2024–26 term. Kirti Vardhan Singh, Minister of State for External Affairs, is leading the Indian delegation to the event. The theme of the ministerial, "Deepening Cooperation for Shared Global Affluence," emphasises the importance of solidarity and partnership among NAM member countries to promote equitable global development and mutual prosperity. Uganda’s leadership role reinforces its commitment to fostering stronger South-South cooperation and advancing NAM’s founding principles.

questions.question: Which state has set December 15, 2025, as the deadline to provide pure tap water to every household?
questions.explanation: The Uttar Pradesh government has announced December 15, 2025, as the target date to ensure pure tap water supply to every household in the Vindhya and Bundelkhand regions. This initiative falls under the ‘Jal Jeevan Mission – Har Ghar Nal Yojana’, a flagship program aimed at improving rural water accessibility and public health. So far, more than 1.98 crore rural households across 85,364 villages have already been provided with tap water connections. The project highlights the state’s commitment to improving living standards, promoting hygiene, and ensuring equitable access to clean drinking water for all citizens.

questions.question: Which country has recently become the newest State Member of the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)?
questions.explanation: Armenia has joined the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) as its newest State Member, a development announced during the IUCN World Conservation Congress in Abu Dhabi. This membership allows Armenia to access global expertise, innovative conservation tools, and foster international partnerships aimed at protecting biodiversity. Additionally, Armenia is preparing to host COP17 of the Convention on Biological Diversity in 2026, positioning the country as a key player in global environmental conservation efforts. Joining the IUCN strengthens Armenia’s capacity to implement sustainable development initiatives and enhance ecological protection at both national and international levels.

questions.question: In which city will the fourth edition of the India-Australia joint military exercise AUSTRAHIND 2025 be held?
questions.explanation: The fourth edition of the India-Australia joint military exercise, AUSTRAHIND 2025, will be held in Perth, Australia. This exercise involves a 120-member Indian Army contingent led by a Battalion of Gorkha Rifles. AUSTRAHIND aims to deepen defence cooperation between the two countries by enhancing interoperability, tactical coordination, and the sharing of best practices in sub-conventional warfare. Conducting the exercise in Perth underscores Australia’s commitment to joint defence training and strategic collaboration with India, fostering stronger military partnerships that contribute to peace, security, and stability across the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: Which country unveiled the Hwasong-20, its most powerful intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM)?
questions.explanation: North Korea unveiled the Hwasong-20, described as its most powerful intercontinental ballistic missile, during a military parade led by Kim Jong Un. The missile is considered North Korea’s strongest nuclear strategic weapon and is believed to have the range to strike targets as far as the U.S. mainland. This display of military strength highlights North Korea’s ongoing commitment to advancing its missile and nuclear capabilities. The event, attended by international dignitaries, served as a signal of the country’s technological progress and its intent to assert itself in global security dynamics.

questions.question: How many beaches in Maharashtra have received the prestigious Blue Flag certification?
questions.explanation: Five beaches in Maharashtra—Shrivardhan and Nagaon in Raigad, Parnaka in Palghar, and Guhagar and Ladghar in Ratnagiri—have been awarded the Blue Flag certification. This international recognition is granted by Denmark’s Foundation for Environmental Education (FEE) to beaches that meet 33 stringent criteria encompassing cleanliness, safety, environmental management, and sustainability. The certification highlights Maharashtra’s commitment to maintaining high environmental standards and promoting eco-friendly tourism. Achieving Blue Flag status not only enhances the beaches’ global visibility but also encourages conservation practices, public awareness, and responsible tourism development along the coastline.

questions.question: In which city did the 10th anniversary edition of Expand North Star 2025 take place?
questions.explanation: The 10th anniversary edition of Expand North Star 2025 was launched at Dubai Harbour, organised under the umbrella of GITEX GLOBAL — the world’s largest technology and AI gathering. Hosted by the Dubai Chamber of Digital Economy and organised by the Dubai World Trade Centre, the event serves as a global hub for collaboration among emerging AI-driven economies. Since its founding in 2016, Expand North Star has evolved into a premier platform connecting startups, investors, and tech innovators. The 2025 edition in Dubai underscores the city’s growing influence as a leading international center for technological innovation and entrepreneurship.

questions.question: Who won the Seychelles presidential election?
questions.explanation: Patrick Herminie, leader of the United Seychelles party, emerged victorious in the Seychelles presidential election with 52.7% of the vote, defeating the incumbent Wavel Ramkalawan, who secured 47.3%. Herminie’s victory not only gave his party control of the presidency but also solidified its dominance in parliament. Having previously served as the speaker of parliament from 2007 to 2016, Herminie’s political experience and leadership played a significant role in his successful campaign and the subsequent consolidation of his party’s power.

questions.question: In which state did PM Narendra Modi lay the foundation stone for the first Integrated Aqua Park?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone for Nagaland’s first Integrated Aqua Park at Tzudikong under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana. This initiative aims to strengthen the fisheries sector in Nagaland by focusing on fish and seed production. The park will serve as a major resource centre, providing high-quality inputs, market linkages, and fair pricing mechanisms for fishery products. It represents a key step toward sustainable development and economic growth in the region, promoting livelihood opportunities for local fish farmers and entrepreneurs.

questions.question: In which city has the government declared 41 square kilometres of the Southern Ridge area as a reserved forest?
questions.explanation: The Delhi government has designated approximately 41 square kilometres of the Southern Ridge area in New Delhi as a reserved forest. This significant environmental step aims to combat rising pollution levels and preserve the city’s ecological balance. By protecting the Ridge — one of the last remaining natural green zones in the capital — the initiative focuses on improving air quality, maintaining soil fertility, and enhancing biodiversity. The government also plans to plant indigenous tree species in these areas, reinforcing New Delhi’s commitment to sustainable urban development and long-term environmental conservation.

questions.question: Who has been named the President-Elect of the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) for the 2025–26 term?
questions.explanation: Anant Goenka, Vice Chairman of the RPG Group, has been appointed as the President-Elect of the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) for the 2025–26 term. He will officially assume charge after the conclusion of FICCI’s 98th Annual General Meeting in New Delhi, succeeding Harsha Vardhan Agarwal. Goenka’s leadership is expected to bring a fresh perspective to the organization’s initiatives, particularly in advancing India’s industrial competitiveness, sustainability efforts, and global trade engagement, reflecting his experience in steering diversified business enterprises under the RPG Group.

questions.question: What literacy rate has the Siddi tribal community recently achieved, earning praise from the President of India?
questions.explanation: The Siddi tribal community, recognised as a Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group (PVTG), has achieved an impressive literacy rate of 72%. This milestone highlights the success of government and community initiatives aimed at improving education among marginalised groups. Historically of Bantu-African origin, the Siddis have long faced geographical and socio-economic challenges. Reaching 72% literacy demonstrates a major step toward inclusion, empowerment, and access to better livelihoods. It reflects increased school enrollment, awareness of educational schemes, and the community’s growing participation in India’s developmental framework.

questions.question: On which date is World Standards Day celebrated annually to honour contributions to international standards?
questions.explanation: World Standards Day is observed every year on October 14 to recognise the efforts of experts and organizations in developing international standards that facilitate global trade, safety, and innovation. The day is promoted by leading standardization bodies, including the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC), the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). Each year, a theme highlights the importance of standards in improving global quality of life; for 2025, the theme is “A Shared Vision for a Better World,” emphasizing collaboration and the role of standards in creating a safer and more efficient world.

questions.question: In which city is Google investing $15 billion to establish a world-class Artificial Intelligence (AI) data centre?
questions.explanation: Google announced a $15 billion investment to set up a major Artificial Intelligence (AI) data centre in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. This facility, with an initial capacity of 1 gigawatt and plans for multi-gigawatt expansion, represents Google’s largest AI infrastructure investment outside the United States. The project underscores India’s growing importance as a global AI and cloud computing hub, strengthening the country’s digital ecosystem, enhancing data processing capabilities, and creating significant employment opportunities in advanced technology sectors within the region and beyond.

questions.question: In which state did Amit Shah lay the foundation stone for the Special Operations Training Centre of the National Security Guard (NSG)?
questions.explanation: Union Home Minister Amit Shah laid the foundation stone for the Special Operations Training Centre of the National Security Guard (NSG) in Manesar, Haryana. This state-of-the-art facility is designed to provide advanced training to NSG personnel in counter-terrorism operations, tactical response, and crisis management. The centre will significantly strengthen India’s elite commando force, ensuring better preparedness for high-risk missions. Alongside this initiative, a new NSG hub will also be established in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh, expanding the national network of specialised security hubs across key cities such as Mumbai, Chennai, and Hyderabad.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Executive Director of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) with effect from October 9, 2025?
questions.explanation: Sonali Sen Gupta has been appointed as the Executive Director of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) effective October 9, 2025. With over three decades of experience at the RBI, she brings extensive expertise in banking regulation, supervision, and financial inclusion. In her new role, she will oversee three critical departments—Consumer Education and Protection, Financial Inclusion and Development, and Inspection. Her appointment reflects the RBI’s emphasis on strengthening consumer protection, expanding financial inclusion, and ensuring robust regulatory oversight within India’s financial system.

questions.question: What was India’s retail inflation rate in September 2025, marking an eight-year low?
questions.explanation: India’s retail inflation dropped to 1.54% in September 2025, the lowest level recorded in the past eight years. This decline from 2.07% in August 2025 was driven by easing food prices and sustained deflation in essential food items. Rural inflation was recorded at 1.07%, while urban inflation stood at 2.04%, reflecting a broad-based moderation across segments. Food inflation remained negative for the fourth consecutive month at -2.28%, the lowest since December 2018. This sharp decline indicates improved supply conditions, stable fuel prices, and effective monetary and fiscal measures to control price pressures.

questions.question: In which city was India’s first Semiconductor Innovation Museum inaugurated on October 12, 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s first Semiconductor Innovation Museum was inaugurated in Hyderabad by the Technology Chip Innovation Program (T-Chip) on October 12, 2025. The museum aims to promote innovation, investment, and public awareness in semiconductor technology while showcasing India’s advancements in AI chips, robotics, and EV systems. Hyderabad has become a major hub for semiconductor research and fabless chip design, hosting global companies like AMD and Qualcomm. This initiative enhances India’s push toward becoming a global semiconductor powerhouse and underscores Hyderabad’s growing role in advanced electronics and deep-tech innovation.

questions.question: Which airline introduced the “Fare Se Fursat” initiative offering passengers fixed airfares?
questions.explanation: The “Fare Se Fursat” initiative was launched by Alliance Air under the leadership of Civil Aviation Minister Rammohan Naidu Kinjarapu. This innovative scheme aims to provide passengers with fixed airfares, reducing the uncertainty and stress caused by fluctuating ticket prices. Initially introduced on a pilot basis across select routes until the end of the year, the program seeks to evaluate its impact on passenger satisfaction and affordability. By ensuring predictable pricing, Alliance Air aims to enhance travel convenience and promote greater trust and transparency in India’s domestic aviation sector.

questions.question: Which country has become the first to achieve the triple elimination of mother-to-child transmission of hepatitis B, HIV, and syphilis, as validated by the WHO?
questions.explanation: The Maldives has made history by becoming the first country in the world to achieve the triple elimination of mother-to-child transmission of hepatitis B, HIV, and syphilis, as certified by the World Health Organization (WHO). This remarkable public health milestone reflects the country’s strong healthcare infrastructure, universal antenatal coverage, and near-total screening of pregnant women for key infections. With over 95% of expectant mothers receiving antenatal care, Maldives has demonstrated an exemplary model for integrated disease prevention and maternal-child health programs, setting a global benchmark for small island nations in public health success.

questions.question: In which city did the 45th GITEX Global, featuring 6,800+ exhibitors and 2,000 startups, officially open in 2025?
questions.explanation: The 45th edition of GITEX Global, the world’s largest technology and AI showcase, opened in Dubai from October 13 to 17, 2025, at the Dubai World Trade Centre and Dubai Harbour. The event brings together over 6,800 exhibitors and 2,000 startups from more than 180 countries, focusing on AI, quantum computing, biotechnology, and sustainable technologies. It serves as a strategic platform for innovation, international partnerships, and policy dialogue. Dubai’s hosting of GITEX 2025 highlights its role as a global hub for digital transformation, attracting top tech leaders, investors, and policymakers worldwide.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the International Monetary Fund’s first Deputy Managing Director effective October 6, 2025?
questions.explanation: Dan Katz has been appointed as the IMF’s first Deputy Managing Director, effective October 6, 2025. Nominated by IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva and approved by the IMF Executive Board, Katz brings extensive experience in global finance and economic policy. He previously served as Chief of Staff at the U.S. Department of the Treasury, advising on domestic and international economic strategy, including the U.S.-Ukraine partnership. Katz’s background also includes senior advisory roles, think tank research, and private-sector experience at Goldman Sachs and a global macro hedge fund, equipping him to navigate complex global economic and financial challenges.

questions.question: Which Indian state has emerged as the leader in UPI transaction intensity, according to the RBI’s September 2025 bulletin?
questions.explanation: Telangana has topped the list of Indian states in terms of UPI (Unified Payments Interface) transaction intensity, as highlighted in the Reserve Bank of India’s September 2025 bulletin. The study revealed that southern and western states such as Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Delhi also reported high per capita UPI usage. Telangana’s leadership reflects its strong digital infrastructure, tech-savvy population, and effective promotion of digital payment systems, reinforcing its position as a key hub for fintech adoption and innovation within India’s rapidly expanding digital economy.

questions.question: In which city was the 11th Asian Aquatics Championships hosted for the first time in India?
questions.explanation: The 11th Asian Aquatics Championships were hosted in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, marking the first time India organised this prestigious continental event. Held at the Veer Savarkar Sports Complex, the championship witnessed outstanding performances by athletes from across Asia. China emerged as the dominant nation with 54 medals, while India delivered its best-ever showing with a total of 13 medals. Hosting the event in Ahmedabad showcased India’s growing infrastructure and capability to organise large-scale international sporting events, strengthening its position in the global sports arena.

questions.question: Which state government has decided to establish Divyang Rehabilitation Centres at every divisional headquarters to support people with disabilities?
questions.explanation: The Uttar Pradesh government, under the leadership of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, has announced the establishment of Divyang Rehabilitation Centres at all divisional headquarters. These centres aim to provide comprehensive support for persons with disabilities, ensuring their full integration into mainstream society. The facilities will offer a range of services including medical care, educational assistance, psychological counselling, and vocational training, all under one roof. This initiative reflects the government’s commitment to inclusivity, empowerment, and equal opportunity for differently-abled individuals across the state.

questions.question: Which Indian space-tech startup is set to launch the world’s first multi-sensor Earth Observation (EO) satellite, Mission Drishti, in Q1 2026?
questions.explanation: GalaxEye, an Indian space-tech startup, is preparing to launch Mission Drishti in the first quarter of 2026, marking the debut of the world’s first multi-sensor Earth Observation (EO) satellite. The 160 kg satellite will be India’s largest privately developed satellite and will feature the country’s highest-resolution imaging sensor. This breakthrough mission represents a major step forward for India’s private space sector, combining advanced imaging technologies to deliver unprecedented Earth observation capabilities that can support applications in climate monitoring, disaster management, and national security.

questions.question: What is India’s rank in the Henley Passport Index 2025?
questions.explanation: In the Henley Passport Index 2025, India’s passport ranks 85th, marking a slip from its previous position of 80 in 2024. The index evaluates passports based on the number of destinations their holders can access without a prior visa. India’s fluctuating rank reflects global changes in visa policies, security considerations, and diplomatic engagements. While Singapore tops the index with visa-free access to 193 countries, India’s position highlights challenges in travel freedom for its citizens compared to neighboring countries like China (64th) and Bhutan (89th). The ranking underscores the influence of international relations on global mobility.

questions.question: Which country pledged $10 million to enhance disaster resilience in the Asia-Pacific region through its Aid Agency?
questions.explanation: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) pledged $10 million through its UAE Aid Agency to strengthen community resilience against natural disasters across the Asia-Pacific region. The initiative supports the “Community Resilience to Natural Disasters Programme” in collaboration with Emirates Nature-WWF and the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF). Announced at the 2025 IUCN World Conservation Congress in Abu Dhabi, this commitment demonstrates the UAE’s proactive role in global humanitarian and environmental initiatives, emphasizing sustainable development, disaster preparedness, and support for vulnerable communities facing climate-related risks.

questions.question: What percentage of Provident Fund (PF) balance can subscribers now withdraw under the new EPFO reforms approved by Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya?
questions.explanation: The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has implemented a landmark reform allowing subscribers to withdraw 100% of their Provident Fund (PF) balance. This decision, approved under the leadership of Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya, benefits over 7 crore members across India. The reform enhances financial flexibility for workers, simplifies withdrawal procedures, and minimises bureaucratic hurdles. By enabling full access to PF savings, the initiative supports individuals in managing urgent financial needs, encourages transparency, and aligns with the government’s broader goal of improving ease of living for employees in both organised and unorganised sectors.

questions.question: Which country celebrated 70 years of diplomatic ties with India by signing multiple MoUs, announcing free visas, and agreeing on an oil refinery deal in 2025?
questions.explanation: In 2025, India and Mongolia commemorated 70 years of diplomatic relations with significant agreements and initiatives. During Mongolian President Khurelsukh Ukhnaa’s visit to New Delhi, the two nations signed ten MoUs covering areas such as humanitarian aid, heritage restoration, digital cooperation, and resource exploration. India also announced support for Mongolia’s first major oil refinery and offered free e-visas to Mongolian citizens to strengthen people-to-people ties. Cultural and educational collaborations, including linking Nalanda University with Mongolia’s Gandan Monastery and digitising ancient manuscripts, further deepened bilateral relations, highlighting a multifaceted partnership built over seven decades.

questions.question: What is the revised GDP growth forecast for India in 2025 as per the IMF?
questions.explanation: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has revised India’s GDP growth forecast for 2025 upward to 6.6%, reflecting stronger-than-expected economic performance in the first quarter of the year. This revision accounts for robust domestic demand in consumption and services, policy continuity, and infrastructure investments, which helped offset the impact of newly imposed US tariffs. Despite external trade pressures, India’s economy maintained momentum due to these factors. However, the IMF has slightly reduced the 2026 forecast to 6.2%, citing potential delayed effects of tariffs, global economic uncertainties, and risks related to trade tensions.

questions.question: In which country was the Sharm El-Sheikh Summit held where the “Trump Declaration for Enduring Peace and Prosperity” was signed?
questions.explanation: The Sharm El-Sheikh Summit took place in Egypt, where U.S. President Donald Trump, along with the leaders of Egypt, Qatar, and Turkey, signed the “Trump Declaration for Enduring Peace and Prosperity.” This declaration aimed to promote a ceasefire and a sustainable peace framework for Gaza, focusing on ending hostilities, improving humanitarian access, and ensuring stability in the region. Egypt’s role as host highlighted its longstanding diplomatic influence in Middle Eastern peace initiatives and its continued efforts to facilitate dialogue among regional powers for achieving long-term security and cooperation.

questions.question: Who is the author of the book "Ready, Relevant and Resurgent II: Shaping a Future Ready Force" released by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in New Delhi?
questions.explanation: The book "Ready, Relevant and Resurgent II: Shaping a Future Ready Force" was authored by Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan. Released by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in New Delhi, the publication outlines a detailed vision for making India’s Armed Forces more agile, technologically advanced, and strategically equipped to address evolving security challenges. It highlights the ongoing efforts to strengthen defence preparedness and build a future-ready force capable of safeguarding national interests in an increasingly complex global environment.

questions.question: Which technology company partnered with EY India to launch the AI Skills Passport, a program aimed at equipping youth with AI skills?
questions.explanation: Microsoft collaborated with EY India to introduce the AI Skills Passport, a free online learning initiative created to help India’s youth acquire essential artificial intelligence (AI) competencies. Targeted at individuals aged 16 and above, the program seeks to bridge the growing digital skills gap and prepare learners for future job markets increasingly shaped by AI technologies. By providing accessible, high-quality AI education, the partnership underscores Microsoft’s commitment to fostering digital inclusion, empowering the next generation of innovators, and supporting India’s transition toward a tech-driven economy.

questions.question: In which city was the 16th International Railway Equipment Exhibition-2025 held?
questions.explanation: The 16th International Railway Equipment Exhibition-2025 was inaugurated by Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. Recognised as Asia’s largest and the world’s second-largest railway exhibition, it featured over 450 exhibitors from more than 15 countries. The event showcased cutting-edge innovations, sustainable solutions, and advanced railway and metro products. Hosting the exhibition in New Delhi highlights India’s strategic focus on modernizing its railway infrastructure, promoting international collaboration, and positioning itself as a hub for technological advancements in the global rail industry.

questions.question: On which date is World Anaesthesia Day celebrated every year to commemorate the first successful use of ether anaesthesia?
questions.explanation: World Anaesthesia Day is observed annually on October 16 to honour the groundbreaking event in 1846 when ether anaesthesia was publicly used for the first time, revolutionizing surgical procedures. The discovery, demonstrated by William T. G. Morton and followed by the first painless surgery performed by Dr. John Collins Warren, marked a turning point in medical history. This day celebrates the vital role of anaesthesiology in healthcare and its contribution to making surgeries safer and more humane. The 2025 theme, “Anaesthesiology in Health Emergencies,” highlights its crucial role in crisis medical care.

questions.question: Which organization successfully tested the Military Combat Parachute System (MCPS) from a record altitude of 32,000 feet?
questions.explanation: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) achieved a significant milestone by successfully testing the Military Combat Parachute System (MCPS) from an altitude of 32,000 feet — the highest deployment ever for an indigenous system. Developed jointly by ADRDE (Agra) and DEBEL (Bengaluru), this advanced parachute system ensures safe and controlled deployment above 25,000 feet. The success of this test highlights DRDO’s progress in developing high-altitude military technology, strengthening India’s self-reliance and operational capabilities in defence research and innovation.

questions.question: At which institution will Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman inaugurate the dhaRti BioNest Incubation Centre?
questions.explanation: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to inaugurate the dhaRti BioNest Incubation Centre at IIT Dharwad, a significant initiative to promote biotechnology innovation and entrepreneurship. The centre has already supported 15 startups, each receiving ₹50 lakh under the Elevate Karnataka scheme. The project received funding support of ₹5.2 crore from the MPLADS fund allocated by Nirmala Sitharaman and ₹5 crore from BIRAC. This collaboration aims to strengthen India’s startup ecosystem, particularly in the biotech sector, and enhance research-driven innovation through academic-industry partnerships at IIT Dharwad.

questions.question: Which port has Pakistan offered to the United States for development and commercial operations to enhance trade access to critical minerals?
questions.explanation: Pakistan has extended an offer to the United States to develop and operate Port Pasni, situated in the Gwadar district of Balochistan. This strategic port, located along the Arabian Sea, lies approximately 113 km east of the China-operated Gwadar Port and 286 km from Iran’s Chabahar Port. The initiative aims to boost bilateral trade and give the US a foothold in accessing critical minerals, reinforcing regional economic cooperation and maritime connectivity.

questions.question: Which state has amended its Uniform Civil Code (UCC) to ease marriage registration rules for citizens of Nepali, Bhutanese, and Tibetan origin residing there?
questions.explanation: The state of Uttarakhand has amended its Uniform Civil Code (UCC) to simplify marriage registration for residents of Nepali, Bhutanese, and Tibetan origin. This reform allows these communities to register their marriages without the requirement of an Aadhaar card, promoting inclusivity and administrative convenience. The Uttarakhand Uniform Civil Code Act, 2024, makes the registration of marriages, divorces, and live-in relationships mandatory and imposes penalties for non-compliance. This amendment reflects Uttarakhand’s progressive approach to ensuring equality and uniformity in personal civil laws within the framework of the UCC.

questions.question: On which date is World Food Day observed every year to promote awareness about food security and sustainability?
questions.explanation: World Food Day is celebrated every year on October 16 to raise awareness about global food security, sustainable agricultural practices, and the goal of achieving Zero Hunger. Established by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations, the day was first observed in 1981. The 2025 observance marks the 80th anniversary of the FAO’s founding. The theme for the celebration, “Sustainable Food Systems for a Healthy Planet,” highlights the importance of responsible production and equitable access to nutritious food worldwide.

questions.question: Which international organization collaborated with UNESCO to implement the Virtual Museum of Stolen Cultural Objects?
questions.explanation: UNESCO launched the Virtual Museum of Stolen Cultural Objects during MONDIACULT 2025, a pioneering global initiative aimed at combating the illicit trafficking of cultural property. The project was developed in response to calls from Member States for coordinated international efforts to protect cultural heritage. Financially supported by Saudi Arabia, the museum is implemented in collaboration with INTERPOL, which plays a crucial role in tracing, recovering, and preventing the illegal trade of stolen artifacts. This partnership underscores the importance of global cooperation in safeguarding humanity’s shared cultural legacy through technology and law enforcement.

questions.question: In which country will UPI payments soon be accepted following the partnership between NPCI International Payments Ltd (NIPL) and NTT DATA?
questions.explanation: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) services will soon be available in Japan through a partnership between NPCI International Payments Ltd (NIPL) and NTT DATA. NTT DATA operates CAFIS, the country’s largest card transaction network, linking banks, ATMs, and merchants nationwide. This collaboration will allow Indian travelers to make payments at Japanese merchant outlets by scanning QR codes and paying directly in Indian Rupees (INR). The initiative strengthens digital connectivity between India and Japan, promotes cashless transactions abroad, and highlights India’s growing global influence in digital payment innovation and fintech integration.

questions.question: Which bank is implementing Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR)-based Multi-Lane Free Flow (MLFF) tolling on NH-48?
