questions.explanation: Jio Payments Bank (JPBL) is set to deploy ANPR-based Multi-Lane Free Flow (MLFF) tolling at Shahjahanpur and Manoharpura toll plazas on NH-48, between Gurugram and Jaipur. This initiative is part of NHAI’s pilot project for barrier-free tolling, which allows vehicles to pass through toll plazas without stopping, ensuring automatic and seamless toll deduction. By integrating advanced technology with banking services, Jio Payments Bank is facilitating faster, more efficient toll collection, reducing congestion, and enhancing the travel experience for commuters. This project also showcases the growing role of digital payments in infrastructure and transport sectors.

questions.question: By what percentage has India’s wild elephant population declined according to the first DNA-based elephant census under SAIEE 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s first DNA-based elephant census conducted under the All-India Synchronous Elephant Estimation (SAIEE) 2025 recorded an 18% decline in the wild elephant population. The latest estimate shows 22,446 elephants, a decrease from 27,312 in 2017. This scientific census, carried out by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) in collaboration with Project Elephant and the Wildlife Institute of India (WII), provides more accurate data for wildlife management. The findings highlight growing concerns over habitat loss, human-elephant conflict, and the urgent need for enhanced conservation measures across India’s elephant ranges.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with Bharti Airtel to enhance cloud services in India through the Airtel Cloud Platform?
questions.explanation: Bharti Airtel, India’s second-largest telecom operator, has joined forces with IBM to strengthen cloud service offerings via the Airtel Cloud Platform. This partnership allows IBM’s enterprise-grade cloud and AI tools to be hosted within India, ensuring compliance with data localization laws. By combining Airtel’s network infrastructure with IBM’s advanced cloud solutions, the collaboration provides businesses with secure, scalable, and high-performance cloud services. It also highlights India’s focus on leveraging global technology partnerships to enhance domestic cloud capabilities, improve digital transformation, and support the growing demand for data-driven enterprise solutions.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with the Government of India to create 2.5 lakh job opportunities annually through the National Career Service (NCS) portal?
questions.explanation: The Government of India has entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Zomato to generate around 2.5 lakh job opportunities every year through the National Career Service (NCS) portal. This collaboration aims to integrate gig and platform-based employment into India’s formal job ecosystem. By doing so, it seeks to provide better access to job opportunities for youth, ensure transparency in recruitment, and support the rapidly growing gig economy by offering structured and officially recognised employment pathways.

questions.question: What is the name of the smart ring developed by Muse Wearables that enables both health tracking and contactless payments?
questions.explanation: Ring One is an innovative smart ring created by Muse Wearables, an IIT-Madras-incubated startup. It merges health monitoring features with seamless contactless payment capabilities, making it a multifunctional wearable device. The ring utilises advanced tokenization technology to ensure secure transactions and includes a Secure Element chip for added data protection. By simply tapping the ring on an NFC terminal, users can make payments without carrying their phone, card, or wallet, offering both convenience and enhanced digital security in everyday life.

questions.question: Which company has been awarded the project to construct the 12.9 km ropeway from Sonprayag to Kedarnath, reducing the trek from nine hours to 36 minutes?
questions.explanation: The Adani Group has been awarded the project to build a 12.9 km ropeway from Sonprayag to Kedarnath, cutting the current nine-hour trek to just 36 minutes. The ₹4,081 crore project will employ Tri-cable Detachable Gondola (3S) technology, enhancing stability and safety in high-altitude conditions. Designed to carry 1,800 passengers per hour per direction, it aims to boost pilgrimage accessibility, tourism, and regional economic development in Uttarakhand. Built under a Public-Private Partnership model, Adani will operate the ropeway for 29 years, generating local employment opportunities while ensuring safer and faster travel for pilgrims, particularly the elderly and those with health concerns.

questions.question: On which date is the International Day for the Eradication of Poverty observed each year?
questions.explanation: The International Day for the Eradication of Poverty is observed annually on October 17, as designated by the United Nations. Established to raise awareness about poverty and honour the efforts of those living in poverty, the day emphasises dignity, justice, and inclusive development. In 2025, the theme focuses on family-centric poverty eradication, highlighting the importance of supportive institutions and policies that respect and empower families, particularly marginalised and vulnerable communities. The observance calls for transforming social support systems to ensure trust, fairness, and effective aid for those experiencing poverty worldwide.

questions.question: Which state won the 30th Senior Women’s National Football Championship – Rajmata Jijabai Trophy?
questions.explanation: Manipur emerged victorious in the 30th Senior Women’s National Football Championship, clinching the Rajmata Jijabai Trophy by defeating West Bengal 1-0 in the final held at the RKM Ashrama Ground in Narainpur, Chhattisgarh. This win marks Manipur’s record 23rd title in the history of the tournament, showcasing the state’s long-standing dominance in women’s football. The winning goal was scored by Lynda Kom Serto in the 93rd minute, highlighting the team’s determination and resilience. Manipur’s continued success underscores its strong football culture and consistent talent development at the grassroots level.

questions.question: Who has been elected as the first Asian Chair of the IUCN Species Survival Commission (SSC)?
questions.explanation: Vivek Menon, the founder of the Wildlife Trust of India (WTI), has been elected as the new Chair of the Species Survival Commission (SSC) under the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). His election marks a historic milestone as he becomes the first Asian to hold this prestigious global position. The SSC plays a crucial role in assessing species conservation status, developing action plans, and guiding global biodiversity efforts. Menon’s leadership signifies a strengthening of Asia’s representation in global wildlife conservation initiatives and highlights India’s growing influence in environmental protection and biodiversity preservation.

questions.question: What is India’s rank on the 2025 Henley Passport Index?
questions.explanation: India’s passport rank has declined to the 85th position in the 2025 Henley Passport Index, dropping from its previous rank of 80th in 2024. The Henley Passport Index evaluates countries based on the number of destinations their citizens can access without requiring a visa. Indian passport holders currently enjoy visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 57 countries. Meanwhile, Singapore continues to lead the index, having one of the world’s strongest passports. This ranking emphasises the importance of international mobility and the varying degrees of travel freedom granted by different national passports.

questions.question: Which Indian para powerlifter won a bronze medal in the 65kg Legend (Masters) category at the 2025 Para Powerlifting World Championships in Cairo?
questions.explanation: Joby Mathew, an accomplished Indian para powerlifter, won the bronze medal in the 65kg Legend (Masters) category at the 2025 Para Powerlifting World Championships held in Cairo, Egypt. He achieved a total lift of 300kg, with successful attempts of 148kg and 152kg, surpassing his previous personal best of 150kg. This remarkable performance earned him his second World Championship medal, following his earlier bronze in Dubai in 2023. Mathew’s consistent achievements highlight his exceptional strength, perseverance, and contribution to India’s growing prominence in international para sports.

questions.question: Which Indian city has been recommended as the host city for the 2030 Commonwealth Games?
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad, located in the state of Gujarat, has been recommended as the host city for the 2030 Commonwealth Games. This major sporting event will coincide with the 100-year celebration of the Commonwealth Sport Movement. The decision was made during the Executive Board meeting of Commonwealth Sport, marking a significant milestone for India’s growing role in hosting large-scale international sports events. If finalised, this will further enhance Ahmedabad’s global recognition as a modern sports and infrastructure hub, contributing to India’s legacy in the world of competitive athletics.

questions.question: Which country is participating with India in the 5th edition of the ‘Samudra Shakti – 2025’ naval exercise at Visakhapatnam?
questions.explanation: India and Indonesia are conducting the 5th edition of the ‘Samudra Shakti – 2025’ naval exercise at Visakhapatnam, aimed at strengthening maritime cooperation between the two nations. First initiated in 2018, the exercise focuses on enhancing interoperability, mutual understanding, and the exchange of best practices in naval operations. Such joint drills improve operational readiness, foster strategic partnerships, and enable both navies to collaborate effectively during maritime security operations. This continued engagement reflects the growing significance of India-Indonesia defence relations in maintaining peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: In which city did Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurate the “Extradition of Fugitives - Challenges and Strategies” conference?
questions.explanation: The “Extradition of Fugitives - Challenges and Strategies” conference was inaugurated by Home Minister Amit Shah in New Delhi. Organised by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), the conference aimed to enhance collaboration among law enforcement agencies on issues related to the extradition of fugitives. Senior officers from both Central and State Police departments participated to discuss practical challenges, international cooperation mechanisms, and strategic frameworks to ensure more effective cross-border law enforcement. This initiative reflects India’s growing focus on strengthening its legal and diplomatic systems to handle fugitive extradition cases efficiently.

questions.question: The fifth edition of the Khelo India University Games (KIUG) will be hosted in which Indian state?
questions.explanation: The fifth Khelo India University Games (KIUG) will be held across seven cities in Rajasthan—Jaipur, Ajmer, Udaipur, Jodhpur, Bikaner, Kota, and Bharatpur. Spanning 12 days, the event will feature 23 medal sports and one demonstration sport, Kho-Kho, with participation from over 5,000 university athletes nationwide. New disciplines such as beach volleyball, canoeing and kayaking, and cycling have been introduced this year. Hosting the KIUG highlights Rajasthan’s growing importance as a center for sporting excellence and its commitment to promoting youth sports development across multiple cities in the state.

questions.question: Which country received critical Prussian Blue Capsules from India to help mitigate the effects of Cesium-137 contamination?
questions.explanation: India has extended medical assistance to Indonesia by gifting Prussian Blue Capsules, which are essential in treating internal contamination caused by radioactive substances like Cesium-137 and thallium. These capsules bind radioactive materials within the body and help remove them safely, reducing health risks associated with radiation exposure. This initiative highlights India’s commitment to supporting neighboring and partner nations in addressing public health and safety challenges, particularly in areas involving radiological emergencies and medical preparedness against potential environmental contamination.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as Hyundai India’s first Indian Managing Director and CEO effective January 1, 2026?
questions.explanation: Tarun Garg has been appointed as the first Indian MD & CEO of Hyundai Motor India Limited, effective January 1, 2026. With over 30 years of experience in the automobile industry, Garg previously held leadership roles at Maruti Suzuki and joined Hyundai in 2019 as Director of Sales, Marketing, and Service. Promoted to COO in 2023, he led record-breaking sales and strategic operations. His appointment marks a historic shift from Korean to Indian leadership, emphasizing local talent empowerment and signaling Hyundai’s commitment to India as a critical growth market while maintaining continuity in global strategic vision.

questions.question: Which company has been awarded a three-year contract by India’s MEA to operate Indian visa centres in Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou?
questions.explanation: BLS International Services Ltd has been contracted by India’s Ministry of External Affairs to establish and manage Indian Visa Application Centres in three major Chinese cities: Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou. The centres will provide technology-driven, user-friendly visa services with advanced infrastructure and multilingual staff. This contract, effective from October 14, 2025, follows India’s resumption of tourist visas for Chinese nationals, aiming to strengthen people-to-people and diplomatic ties. BLS International, a global leader in visa outsourcing and citizen services, will play a key role in facilitating efficient visa processing and enhancing bilateral engagement between India and China.

questions.question: Which company launched the ‘Pay with Mutual Fund’ feature allowing UPI payments through mutual fund redemptions?
questions.explanation: Bajaj Finserv AMC introduced the ‘Pay with Mutual Fund’ feature, enabling investors to make UPI payments directly using their mutual fund holdings. This facility leverages the Insta Redemption mechanism, allowing redemption of up to ₹50,000 or 90% of the investment in real time. By partnering with fintech firm Curie Money, Bajaj Finserv ensures seamless integration of investment and payment systems, allowing users to maintain liquidity while earning higher returns than traditional savings accounts. This innovation marks a significant step in making mutual fund investments instantly usable for everyday transactions, blending investing with payment convenience.

questions.question: Where will the 11th India International Science Festival (IISF) be held from 6 to 9 December 2025?
questions.explanation: The 11th India International Science Festival (IISF) is scheduled to take place in Chandigarh from 6 to 9 December 2025. The festival, organised under the theme “Vigyan se Samruddhi: For Atma Nirbhar Bharat,” serves as India’s flagship science outreach initiative. IISF brings together scientists, students, innovators, and the public to foster scientific awareness, collaboration, and innovation. First organised in 2015, the festival highlights India’s commitment to promoting scientific temper and engaging communities in science-led discussions, activities, and exhibitions, making Chandigarh the host city for this major national event.

questions.question: Which company developed the AI model Cell2Sentence-Scale 27B (C2S-Scale) that can decode the language of individual cells to aid cancer research?
questions.explanation: Google developed the AI model Cell2Sentence-Scale 27B (C2S-Scale), a 27-billion-parameter foundation model designed to interpret the language of individual cells. This breakthrough enables researchers to generate AI-driven hypotheses for biomedical research, accelerating the discovery of potential cancer treatments. The model’s predictions were experimentally validated, making it one of the first instances where AI directly contributed to scientific discovery rather than solely analyzing data. This innovation demonstrates the growing role of advanced AI models in transforming healthcare research and providing new approaches for understanding complex cellular mechanisms.

questions.question: Who has assumed the role of President of the Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India (Assocham) on October 17?
questions.explanation: Nirmal Kumar Minda, Executive Chairman of Uno Minda Group, has been appointed as the President of Assocham, India’s prominent industry chamber. With over five decades of experience in the auto component sector, Minda is known for driving innovation, building robust supply chains, and fostering customer-centric and people-oriented leadership. Under his guidance, Uno Minda has expanded into a global enterprise with a diverse product portfolio. His leadership at Assocham is expected to emphasise technological advancement, competitiveness, and supply chain resilience, while aligning industry advocacy with emerging trends in manufacturing and business innovation.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the Deputy Chief Minister of Gujarat during the cabinet reshuffle on 17 October 2025?
questions.explanation: Harsh Sanghavi was appointed as the Deputy Chief Minister of Gujarat on 17 October 2025 as part of a major cabinet reshuffle led by Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel. This reshuffle involved the induction of 25 ministers, with the aim of improving regional and caste representation and preparing for future elections. Sanghavi, a three-time MLA from Majura, Surat, also received independent charge of the Home Department, a portfolio traditionally held by the Chief Minister. At age 40, his appointment reflects a focus on youth leadership and administrative experience, marking the revival of the Deputy CM post after four years.

questions.question: Where did India and the Republic of Korea hold their first bilateral naval exercise, IN–RoKN, in October 2025?
questions.explanation: The first bilateral naval exercise between India and the Republic of Korea, named IN–RoKN, took place at the Busan Naval Base in South Korea. This exercise was designed to enhance maritime cooperation, build naval interoperability, and strengthen strategic ties between the two nations. The Harbour Phase focused on mutual understanding, professional exchanges, and camaraderie, while the Sea Phase involved complex joint operations and real-time drills. Conducting the exercise in South Korea highlights the host nation’s role in facilitating Indo-Pacific maritime security collaboration and underscores the significance of bilateral defence relations.

questions.question: Which organization has launched a nationwide contest to design an official Aadhaar mascot with a prize pool of ₹1 lakh?
questions.explanation: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has launched a nationwide Aadhaar Mascot Design Contest, inviting citizens to create an official visual ambassador for Aadhaar. The mascot is intended to embody Aadhaar’s core values, including trust, inclusivity, empowerment, and digital innovation, and to enhance public engagement. Participants can submit original designs via the MyGov platform by 31 October 2025, with a total prize pool of ₹1 lakh distributed among top winners. Beyond monetary rewards, the selected mascot will be used in public campaigns, serving as a symbolic representation of Aadhaar’s mission and national identity.

questions.question: Which countries have agreed to expand the scope of their Preferential Trade Agreement under the MERCOSUR framework to include more sectors and products?
questions.explanation: India and Brazil have agreed to expand their Preferential Trade Agreement (PTA) under the MERCOSUR framework, aiming to cover a broader range of sectors and products. The India–MERCOSUR Framework Agreement was originally signed in 2003, followed by the PTA in 2004, which became effective in 2009. MERCOSUR, established in 1991, includes Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, and Paraguay as full members. This expansion signifies a strengthening of economic ties between India and Brazil, promoting greater trade cooperation, market access, and bilateral economic engagement, while leveraging the regional integration of South America under MERCOSUR.

questions.question: Which Indian state leads the country in recovering lost and stolen mobile phones through the CEIR portal?
questions.explanation: Telangana has emerged as the top-performing state in India for recovering lost and stolen mobile phones via the CEIR (Central Equipment Identity Register) portal. Since its extension to Telangana in April 2023, the state has successfully recovered over 1 lakh devices, with Hyderabad alone accounting for nearly 15,000 recoveries. This achievement highlights Telangana’s effective integration of technology with law enforcement, active citizen participation, and strong public awareness campaigns. The CEIR portal allows authorities to block, trace, and return stolen devices, enhancing both personal data security and overall crime reduction.

questions.question: Who was awarded the Abel Prize 2025 for contributions to algebraic analysis and representation theory?
questions.explanation: Masaki Kashiwara, a renowned Japanese mathematician, received the Abel Prize in 2025 for his pioneering work in algebraic analysis and representation theory. He is celebrated for developing the theory of D-modules, which provides an algebraic framework to study systems of linear partial differential equations (PDEs). The Abel Prize, often regarded as the mathematics equivalent of the Nobel Prize, honours outstanding contributions that have profoundly influenced mathematical research. Kashiwara’s work has had a lasting impact on both pure mathematics and its applications, establishing him as a leading figure in modern mathematical theory.

questions.question: Which state launched the “CM Flight” initiative to empower youth for global careers?
questions.explanation: The “CM Flight” initiative was launched by the Chief Minister of Assam to provide the state’s youth with training, mentorship, exposure, and placement opportunities aimed at pursuing global careers. The programme addresses key challenges such as unemployment, skill mismatches, and brain drain by equipping young professionals with the skills required for international job markets. By fostering global employability and career readiness, Assam seeks to empower its youth, promote economic development, and enhance the state’s talent presence on a worldwide scale, making it a pioneering model in youth-centric skill initiatives.

questions.question: Who has become the first actor to join the billionaire club with a net worth of $1.4 billion?
questions.explanation: Shah Rukh Khan has become the first actor to cross the billionaire threshold, with an estimated net worth of $1.4 billion (₹12,490 crore). His wealth accumulation is driven by multiple ventures, including his film production company Red Chillies Entertainment, ownership stakes in the Kolkata Knight Riders IPL franchise, high-value brand endorsements, and strategic real estate investments. This milestone reflects not only his enduring popularity in the global entertainment industry but also his business acumen, making him a prominent figure in both cinematic and entrepreneurial circles worldwide.

questions.question: Who became the first transgender person from Karnataka to join a Supreme Court-appointed committee on equal opportunity policy for transgender rights?
questions.explanation: Akkai Padmashali, a prominent trans rights activist, has made history by becoming the first transgender person from Karnataka to serve on a Supreme Court-appointed committee focused on formulating policies for equal opportunities for transgender individuals. Her appointment is significant as it ensures direct representation of the transgender community in policymaking at the national level. The committee aims to implement court judgments and advocate equality, reflecting Ambedkar’s vision of social justice. This milestone highlights progress in inclusivity, while also addressing the need for broader representation of gender minorities in legal and social frameworks.

questions.question: Which Indian state hosted the AI Impact Summit 2025 as a pre-event to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand hosted the AI Impact Summit 2025 in Dehradun, serving as a precursor to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. Organised by the Department of IT, Government of Uttarakhand, in collaboration with the IndiaAI Mission under MeitY, the summit emphasised responsible and inclusive AI growth. Key focus areas included governance, education, healthcare, disaster management, and rural empowerment through AI. The event brought together officials, academia, and industry leaders, highlighting India’s multi-stakeholder approach to ethical AI adoption. Uttarakhand’s summit set the stage for the national-level 2026 summit, promoting India’s position as a global leader in AI for public good.

questions.question: Which organization launched the ‘We Rise’ initiative to make women-led MSMEs export-ready through mentorship and global market support?
questions.explanation: NITI Aayog, through its Women Entrepreneurship Platform (WEP), launched the ‘We Rise – Women Entrepreneurs Reimagining Inclusive and Sustainable Enterprises’ initiative in partnership with DP World. The program aims to support 100 high-potential women-led MSMEs by providing mentorship, trade access, and international market exposure, including platforms like Bharat Mart in Dubai. It integrates NITI Aayog’s extensive ecosystem of women entrepreneurs with DP World’s global trade infrastructure to enhance export readiness. The initiative promotes sustainable and inclusive business growth, capacity-building, and long-term access to global value chains for women entrepreneurs.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the newly launched LIMBS Live Cases Dashboard?
questions.explanation: The LIMBS Live Cases Dashboard, launched by Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal, enables real-time tracking of court cases involving the Government of India. Part of the Legal Information Management and Briefing System (LIMBS), it consolidates over 7 lakh active cases from 53 ministries and departments, providing data on hearings scheduled in the Supreme Court, High Courts, and subordinate courts for the next seven days. This centralised platform enhances transparency, accountability, and coordination among ministries, streamlines litigation management, reduces delays, and supports the government’s broader push for e-governance and efficient legal administration.

questions.question: Which state government has signed a three-year MoU with NorthEast United FC to promote football and establish Shillong as the 'Football Capital' of India?
questions.explanation: The Meghalaya government has entered into a three-year Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with NorthEast United FC to promote football development and position Shillong as the 'Football Capital' of India. The partnership, effective from 2025 to 2028, involves collaboration between the football club, the Department of Tourism, and the Department of Sports and Youth Affairs. This initiative aims to enhance grassroots football programs, nurture local talent, and boost sports tourism in the state, reflecting Meghalaya’s commitment to fostering a strong sporting culture and leveraging football as a tool for youth engagement and regional recognition.

questions.question: What is the Female Labour Force Participation Rate (FLFPR) in India for 2023–24?
questions.explanation: India’s Female Labour Force Participation Rate (FLFPR) has risen significantly from 23% in 2017–18 to 42% in 2023–24. This increase reflects a major improvement in gender inclusion and economic participation for women in the country. Over the past decade, India recorded the sharpest rise in women’s labour force participation among BRICS nations (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa). The growth highlights ongoing social and economic reforms, initiatives to promote women’s employment, and broader efforts to create an inclusive workforce that supports sustainable economic development and reduces gender disparities in the labour market.

questions.question: Until which date has the Government of India extended the tenure of the 16th Finance Commission in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Government of India extended the tenure of the 16th Finance Commission, chaired by Arvind Panagariya, by one month to November 30, 2025. This extension shifts the report submission deadline from October 31 to November 30, allowing additional time for finalizing recommendations on tax revenue distribution between the Centre and states for the 2026–2031 period. The Commission is also reviewing fiscal mechanisms for disaster management financing. The extension ensures thorough deliberation on key fiscal policies, equitable devolution, and performance-based grants, reflecting the importance of comprehensive guidance for Centre-State financial relations in the coming fiscal period.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the Bathou religion, followed by the Bodo community, primarily practiced and recently granted a separate census code?
questions.explanation: The Bathou religion, an indigenous faith central to the Bodo community, is primarily practiced in Assam. It emphasises nature worship and promotes harmony between humans and the natural environment. Recognizing its cultural significance, the Bathou religion has been granted a separate code in the upcoming national census, allowing better representation of the Bodo community and their traditions. This acknowledgment supports the preservation of indigenous identities and highlights Assam’s rich cultural diversity, reinforcing the importance of documenting minority faiths in national demographic surveys.

questions.question: Which country participated alongside India in the 4th edition of Naval Exercise Bongosagar 2025 held in the Bay of Bengal?
questions.explanation: Bangladesh participated with the Indian Navy in the 4th edition of Naval Exercise Bongosagar 2025, held in the Bay of Bengal in March 2025. The Bangladesh Navy deployed BNS Abu Ubaidah, while the Indian Navy was represented by INS Ranvir. The exercise focused on enhancing maritime security and included activities such as surface firing, VBSS (Visit, Board, Search, and Seizure) operations, tactical maneuvers, and strategies to address challenges like piracy and illegal fishing. This bilateral exercise strengthens naval cooperation and interoperability between India and Bangladesh, contributing to regional maritime safety and security.

questions.question: In which country was the Sultan of Johor Cup 2025, where India won the silver medal, held?
questions.explanation: The Sultan of Johor Cup 2025 was held in Malaysia, where India clinched the silver medal after a narrow 2-1 defeat to Australia in the final. This marked India’s fifth runners-up finish in the tournament, following bronze medals in the previous two editions. The event highlighted competitive international youth hockey, with Australia breaking their three-final losing streak by avenging their 2022 defeat to India. Hosting such tournaments in Malaysia emphasises the country’s growing role in promoting field hockey and providing a platform for emerging talent in the sport across Asia.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian woman compound archer to win a medal at the Archery World Cup Final by securing bronze in Nanjing, China?
questions.explanation: Jyothi Surekha Vennam made history by becoming the first Indian woman compound archer to win a medal at the Archery World Cup Final. She clinched the bronze in Nanjing, China, defeating second seed Ella Gibson of Great Britain with a score of 150-145, including a flawless 15 tens over five ends. This achievement marks India’s first-ever women’s compound medal at the season-ending final, highlighting Vennam’s precision, resilience, and her growing stature in international archery. Her performance is a milestone for Indian archery, inspiring future athletes in the sport.

questions.question: Which organization signed a $3 billion sovereign exposure exchange agreement with the World Bank to boost lending capacity for developing countries?
questions.explanation: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a $3 billion sovereign exposure exchange agreement (EEA) with the World Bank, aimed at enhancing ADB’s capacity to lend to its developing member countries. This is the first such agreement between ADB and the World Bank and the sixth EEA involving ADB since 2020, bringing the total exposure exchanged to $9 billion. These agreements allow multilateral development banks to optimise risk-sharing, expand financial resources, and support economic development projects in member countries, strengthening regional and global development financing frameworks.

questions.question: Which organization released the first global ‘State of Finance for Forests’ report highlighting underinvestment in forest finance?
questions.explanation: The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) released the inaugural State of Finance for Forests (SFF) report, providing a comprehensive global overview of forest finance in 2023. The report highlights a significant funding gap, with total forest finance at US$84 billion—well below the US$300 billion needed annually by 2030 and US$498 billion by 2050 to ensure forest conservation and sustainable management. UNEP’s findings underscore the urgent need for increased public and private investment in forests, emphasizing the critical role of financing in protecting biodiversity, mitigating climate change, and supporting sustainable development goals worldwide.

questions.question: Which Latin American country became the first to legalise euthanasia, allowing medically assisted dying for patients with incurable illnesses?
questions.explanation: Uruguay has become the first Latin American nation to legalise euthanasia, marking a significant milestone in bioethics and human rights within the region. The legislation permits medically assisted dying for patients suffering from incurable illnesses that cause unbearable pain, following five years of national debate and ethical discussion. This move reflects a growing recognition of patient autonomy and the right to die with dignity, setting a precedent for other countries in the region. Uruguay’s law balances medical, ethical, and legal considerations while advancing humane healthcare practices.

questions.question: Which country participated with India in the joint military exercise DUSTLIK-VI 2025 held in Pune?
questions.explanation: Uzbekistan participated alongside India in the joint military exercise DUSTLIK-VI 2025, conducted from April 16 to 28 at the Foreign Training Node in Pune. The exercise focused on Joint Multi-Domain Sub-Conventional Operations in a semi-urban scenario, involving India’s JAT Regiment and Indian Air Force with the Uzbekistan Army. A key aspect of the exercise was the emphasis on Battalion-level Joint Operations Centre coordination for counter-terrorism operations. This collaboration enhances interoperability, strategic partnerships, and knowledge-sharing between India and Uzbekistan in addressing contemporary security challenges.

questions.question: Who won Bolivia’s presidential election with 54.5% of the vote, ending nearly two decades of leftist rule?
questions.explanation: Rodrigo Paz, a centrist senator, won Bolivia’s presidential election with 54.5% of the votes, defeating Jorge Tuto Quiroga, who secured 45.5%. This victory marks a significant political shift in Bolivia, ending almost twenty years of leftist governance by the Movement to Socialism (MAS). Paz’s election comes at a time when the country is grappling with a severe economic crisis, signaling the electorate’s desire for change in economic and political policies. His leadership is expected to bring a centrist approach to Bolivia’s governance, addressing both economic recovery and political stabilization.

questions.question: In which city did Defence Minister Rajnath Singh inaugurate the Titanium and Superalloy Materials Plant to boost India’s defence self-reliance?
questions.explanation: The Titanium and Superalloy Materials Plant was inaugurated in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, marking a significant step in India’s pursuit of self-reliance in strategic materials for defence, aerospace, and electronics. The facility produces high-grade titanium and superalloys used in fighter jets, missiles, naval systems, and satellites. With a production capacity exceeding 6,000 tonnes annually, it supports indigenous manufacturing of critical components like turbine blades and missile parts. Located within the Uttar Pradesh Defence Industrial Corridor, this plant strengthens India’s technological and industrial base, promotes employment, and reduces dependence on foreign imports for strategic defence materials.

questions.question: On which date will Bandi Chhor Divas be celebrated in 2025?
questions.explanation: Bandi Chhor Divas in 2025 falls on October 21. This Sikh festival commemorates the release of Guru Hargobind Sahib Ji from Gwalior Fort along with 52 princes. The day coincides with Diwali but has its own unique spiritual significance, symbolizing liberation, justice, and selflessness. Sikhs celebrate it with prayers, devotional singing, lighting of lamps, and community service through langar. The festival honours the Guru’s act of ensuring freedom for others, highlighting values of equality, compassionate leadership, and collective responsibility. Its observance is widespread both in India and across the global Sikh diaspora.

questions.question: Which country developed its first fully indigenous antibiotic, Nafithromycin, and achieved a major milestone in gene therapy for hemophilia?
questions.explanation: India has developed Nafithromycin, its first homegrown antibiotic, aimed at treating resistant respiratory infections, especially in vulnerable patients. This achievement, alongside successful indigenous gene therapy trials for hemophilia, underscores India’s growing capabilities in biotechnology, pharmaceutical innovation, and clinical research. These breakthroughs were enabled by collaborations between the Department of Biotechnology and private firms like Wockhardt, reflecting a strong public-private partnership. Additionally, India’s progress in genome sequencing and precision medicine positions the country as a rising leader in healthcare innovation, reducing dependence on foreign technologies and advancing its goal of biotech self-reliance under the Viksit Bharat 2047 vision.

questions.question: Who became the first Indian to receive the WCPA-Kenton Miller Award for innovation in protected area sustainability?
questions.explanation: Dr. Sonali Ghosh, Field Director of Kaziranga National Park, became the first Indian recipient of the WCPA-Kenton Miller Award at the IUCN World Conservation Congress in Abu Dhabi, UAE. The award, established in 2006, is presented biennially by the World Commission on Protected Areas (WCPA) to recognise innovative contributions to the sustainability and management of national parks and protected areas. Dr. Ghosh’s leadership and initiatives at Kaziranga National Park have enhanced biodiversity conservation, park management, and community engagement, reflecting global standards in environmental stewardship and making India proud on the international conservation stage.

questions.question: Who has been recommended by Tata Trusts for a third term as Chairman of Tata Sons?
questions.explanation: Tata Trusts has recommended N Chandrasekaran for a third term as Chairman of Tata Sons, the principal holding company of the Tata Group. This recommendation is significant given that Tata Trusts controls 66% of Tata Sons’ equity, giving them substantial influence over leadership decisions. Chandrasekaran’s tenure has been marked by strategic initiatives and governance oversight within the conglomerate. The decision comes amid internal disagreements among the trustees, particularly on board appointments and governance matters, reflecting the importance of strong leadership continuity to maintain stability and direction in one of India’s largest and most diversified business groups.

questions.question: Which Indian spacecraft made the first direct observation of solar activity affecting the Moon’s exosphere?
questions.explanation: Chandrayaan-2, launched by ISRO in 2019, made the first direct observation of how Coronal Mass Ejections (CMEs) from the Sun impact the Moon’s exosphere. The CHACE-2 instrument on board recorded a significant increase in the density of neutral atoms and molecules, confirming that solar outbursts can dramatically alter the lunar atmosphere. This finding enhances understanding of lunar space weather, especially because the Moon lacks a global magnetic field and atmosphere, making its exosphere highly sensitive to solar activity. Chandrayaan-2’s observations contribute valuable data for future lunar missions and planetary science research.

questions.question: Who became Japan’s first female prime minister in 2025, marking a historic milestone in the country’s politics?
questions.explanation: Sanae Takaichi was elected as Japan’s first female prime minister on October 21, 2025, receiving 237 votes in the 465-seat Lower House. Her election represents both a historic breakthrough for gender representation and a political shift to the right, reflecting her conservative views modeled on Shinzo Abe and Margaret Thatcher. Takaichi advocates stricter immigration policies, traditional family values, and a stronger national security stance, while also signaling fiscal stimulus measures to address economic challenges. Her leadership is significant not only for breaking a political glass ceiling but also for influencing Japan’s domestic and international policy direction.

questions.question: Which country has launched its first-ever State Mining Readiness Index to rank States on mining efficiency, reforms, and sustainability?
questions.explanation: India has launched the inaugural State Mining Readiness Index (SMRI) as part of the Union Budget 2025–26. Developed by the Ministry of Mines, the SMRI evaluates States on operational efficiency, reform-readiness, and sustainable practices in managing non-coal mineral resources. The index aims to promote transparency, accountability, and healthy competition among States, while encouraging sustainable mining practices aligned with climate and social responsibilities. It also categorises States based on their mineral resource endowment to ensure fair benchmarking. This initiative marks a significant step in modernizing India’s mineral governance.

questions.question: Which country signed a critical minerals deal with the U.S. to reduce dependence on China and strengthen Indo-Pacific security?
questions.explanation: Australia signed an $8.5 billion critical minerals agreement with the U.S., aimed at reducing reliance on China for key minerals like lithium, nickel, and rare earth elements. The pact includes joint investment in mining and processing infrastructure, market stabilization measures, and reforms to speed up projects. It also features U.S. EXIM Bank support and plans for a gallium refinery in Western Australia. This deal strengthens strategic supply chains, supports defence and technology sectors, and reinforces Indo-Pacific security. It highlights the growing collaboration between the U.S. and Australia to secure critical resources while countering China’s dominance in the market.

questions.question: On which date is Police Commemoration Day observed in India to honour officers who died in the line of duty?
questions.explanation: Police Commemoration Day is observed annually on October 21 in India to honour police personnel who sacrificed their lives in the line of duty. The date commemorates a tragic ambush in 1959 at Hot Springs, Ladakh, where ten Indian police officers were killed and several captured by Chinese troops. The day serves to remember their courage and dedication while reinforcing morale and pride within the police forces. Ceremonies at the National Police Memorial in New Delhi, along with public events during the following Commemoration Week, highlight the sacrifices made by police personnel and strengthen public awareness of their vital role in maintaining internal security.

questions.question: By what percentage did India’s Infrastructure Output grow in September 2025 compared to the same period last year?
questions.explanation: In September 2025, India’s Infrastructure Output, measured by the Index of Eight Core Industries (ICI), registered a growth rate of 3% year-on-year. This indicates moderate expansion in the infrastructure sector, driven by positive growth in key areas such as steel, cement, electricity, and fertilizers. Although the growth rate was lower than August’s revised figure of 6.5%, it still reflects ongoing momentum in core industrial activity, contributing to the overall economic stability and infrastructural development of the country.

questions.question: In how many states has the government increased the number of notaries under the Notaries (Amendment) Rules, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Law and Justice has expanded the number of notaries in four states—Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Rajasthan, and Nagaland—through the Notaries (Amendment) Rules, 2025, notified under G.S.R. 763(E). This amendment, made under the Notaries Act, 1952, modifies the Notaries Rules, 1956, to cater to the growing demand for authentication and legal documentation services. The increase in notaries aims to improve access to legal validation services, streamline administrative processes, and ensure better legal infrastructure across these expanding regions.

questions.question: What is the name of the AI-powered web browser for macOS recently launched by OpenAI?
questions.explanation: OpenAI has introduced ChatGPT Atlas, an innovative AI-powered web browser designed specifically for macOS. Atlas combines the capabilities of web browsing with the intelligence of ChatGPT, enabling users to perform tasks more efficiently within a single platform. It features integrated contextual assistance, memory-based continuity for seamless workflow, and an advanced Agent mode for task automation. This browser offers real-time AI interaction, representing a significant step forward in blending browsing functionality with AI-driven productivity tools for enhanced user experience.

questions.question: Which country has declared a 30-day state of emergency in its capital city Lima and the adjacent province of Callao to address rising crime and unrest?
questions.explanation: Peru has declared a 30-day state of emergency in its capital, Lima, and the nearby province of Callao in response to increasing crime rates and violent protests. President José Jeri authorised the deployment of the Peruvian Armed Forces alongside the police to maintain public order and restore safety. The emergency allows temporary suspension of certain civil liberties, such as freedom of movement and assembly, and grants broader powers for law enforcement operations. This decisive measure reflects the government’s intent to tackle escalating insecurity, gang violence, and growing public dissatisfaction with the state’s handling of urban crime.

questions.question: Which country won the Under-20 FIFA World Cup by defeating Argentina 2-0 in the final held in Chile?
questions.explanation: Morocco achieved a historic milestone by winning the Under-20 FIFA World Cup in Chile, defeating Argentina 2-0 in the final. This victory marked Morocco’s first-ever World Cup title at any level and made them the first African nation since Ghana in 2009 to lift the U-20 trophy. Yassir Zabiri played a crucial role in the triumph, scoring both goals in the first half and leading Morocco to an unforgettable victory that will be remembered as a defining moment in African football history.

questions.question: What is India’s global ranking in total forest area according to the FAO’s Global Forest Resources Assessment (GFRA) 2025?
questions.explanation: According to the Global Forest Resources Assessment (GFRA) 2025 released by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), India has risen to the 9th position globally in total forest area. This achievement highlights the country’s ongoing dedication to expanding and conserving its forest cover through sustainable forestry practices and afforestation programs. Additionally, India continues to hold the 3rd position in annual forest area gain, reflecting significant efforts in reforestation and land management policies aimed at balancing ecological preservation with developmental needs.

questions.question: Which university’s researchers discovered Sinapic acid as a potential treatment for diabetic wounds?
questions.explanation: Researchers from Nagaland University have identified Sinapic acid, a naturally occurring plant compound, as a promising therapeutic agent for treating diabetic wounds. Their study marks the first global evidence showing that oral administration of Sinapic acid can significantly accelerate wound healing under diabetic conditions in preclinical models. This discovery holds immense potential for developing affordable and effective treatments for chronic wounds commonly seen in diabetic patients, contributing to advancements in medical research and promoting health innovation from India’s northeastern region.

questions.question: How many spices have been standardized under India’s leadership through the Codex Committee on Spices and Culinary Herbs (CCSCH)?
questions.explanation: Under India’s leadership, the Codex Committee on Spices and Culinary Herbs (CCSCH) has successfully standardized 19 spices since its establishment in 2013. The committee, chaired by India and supported by the Spices Board in Kochi, works under the Codex Alimentarius Commission (CAC) to develop international standards that promote food safety, fair trade, and consumer protection. During the 8th CCSCH session, standards for vanilla, large cardamom, and coriander were finalised, marking another milestone in harmonizing global spice trade practices and reinforcing India’s pivotal role in shaping food quality benchmarks worldwide.

questions.question: Which Indian state has introduced chess in school and college curricula to promote strategic thinking among students?
questions.explanation: Goa has taken a pioneering step by introducing chess into its school and college curricula, as announced by Chief Minister Dr. Pramod Sawant. The initiative aims to help students enhance strategic thinking, concentration, and decision-making skills while also boosting their confidence. The announcement coincided with the launch of the FIDE World Cup logo, an event that highlights Goa’s growing presence on the global sports stage. This move not only supports educational innovation but also contributes to the state’s cultural and economic growth through the promotion of intellectual sports.

questions.question: Which Indian naval ship participated in the Japan-India Maritime Exercise (JAIMEX) 2025 held at Yokosuka, Japan?
questions.explanation: INS Sahyadri, a Shivalik-class stealth frigate of the Indian Navy, participated in the Japan-India Maritime Exercise (JAIMEX) 2025 at Yokosuka, Japan. This exercise underscores the growing defence cooperation between India and Japan, which share a Special Strategic and Global Partnership. The collaboration highlights mutual interests in maintaining regional maritime security, strengthening interoperability, and enhancing strategic coordination between the two navies. Such joint exercises have been a key feature of their defence ties since 2014, reinforcing shared commitments toward peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the festival of Ningol Chakouba celebrated?
questions.explanation: Ningol Chakouba is a traditional festival celebrated in the northeastern state of Manipur, symbolizing the deep bond between married women and their brothers. Observed on the second day of the Meitei month of Hiyangei, the festival involves married women (Ningols) visiting their parental homes, where they are warmly welcomed and treated to a grand feast (Chakouba). The celebration reflects the values of love, respect, and family unity deeply rooted in Manipuri culture. Beyond its social significance, Ningol Chakouba also reinforces community harmony and preserves the rich cultural heritage of Manipur through shared familial traditions.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Chief Product and Business Officer at Google Cloud?
questions.explanation: Karthik Narain, a seasoned technology executive and former CTO of Accenture, has been appointed as the Chief Product and Business Officer at Google Cloud. In this role, he will oversee product and engineering teams across cloud, AI, developer tools, and Applied AI, while also leading the go-to-market strategy and collaborating with the public sector division. Narain’s appointment strengthens Google Cloud’s leadership team amid intense competition with AWS and Microsoft Azure. With over 25 years of experience in enterprise systems, AI, and cloud innovation, he is expected to accelerate Google Cloud’s global growth and drive AI-driven digital transformation for enterprise customers.

questions.question: Which Indian city has become the first to implement a Real-Time Flood Forecasting and Spatial Decision Support System (RTFF & SDSS)?
questions.explanation: Chennai has achieved a significant milestone by becoming the first Indian city to fully implement a Real-Time Flood Forecasting and Spatial Decision Support System (RTFF & SDSS) in October 2025. This initiative enhances the city’s ability to predict and manage floods with greater accuracy, thereby improving disaster preparedness and resilience against climate-induced challenges. Funded through the World Bank’s Project Development Grant Fund (PDGF), the system integrates weather data, river flow patterns, and urban drainage models. It positions Chennai as a pioneering example of how technology can strengthen urban flood management and protect vulnerable communities.

questions.question: Which institution has partnered with Coal India Limited to establish a Centre for Sustainable Energy?
questions.explanation: Coal India Limited (CIL) has entered into a strategic partnership with the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras to establish a Centre for Sustainable Energy. This collaboration aims to promote advanced research and development in clean energy technologies, low-carbon innovations, and repurposing of coal mines for sustainable applications. The initiative aligns with India’s broader goal of achieving a balanced and environmentally responsible energy transition. By combining CIL’s industry experience with IIT Madras’s research expertise, the partnership seeks to create scalable solutions that can contribute to reducing emissions and enhancing energy efficiency across sectors.

questions.question: Which Indian state is set to become the first to be officially declared free of extreme poverty?
questions.explanation: Kerala is poised to make history by becoming India’s first state to be officially declared free of extreme poverty on November 1, 2025. This achievement is the result of the state’s comprehensive Extreme Poverty Eradication Programme, launched in 2021, which identified and assisted families living in severe economic distress. Through targeted welfare initiatives, social inclusion measures, and effective governance, Kerala has significantly improved the living standards of its most vulnerable citizens. The declaration, to be made by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan in Thiruvananthapuram, highlights Kerala’s continued leadership in social welfare and equitable development.

questions.question: On which date is Mole Day celebrated each year to honour Avogadro’s Number?
questions.explanation: Mole Day is observed annually on October 23 from 6:02 a.m. to 6:02 p.m., symbolizing Avogadro’s Number, 6.02 × 10²³, which is a fundamental constant in chemistry. The celebration helps students and enthusiasts appreciate the significance of the mole concept in understanding atomic theory, chemical reactions, and quantitative analysis. Named after Amedeo Avogadro, whose pioneering work laid the foundation for modern chemistry, Mole Day often includes educational activities, experiments, and themed events. In 2025, the theme “MOLEassic Park” highlights the fun and engaging way in which science education can connect with broader cultural references.

questions.question: In which Indian state is the Gangotri Dham located?
questions.explanation: Gangotri Dham is one of the four sacred Char Dham pilgrimage sites located in the state of Uttarakhand. Situated in the Uttarkashi district, it is dedicated to Goddess Ganga and marks the origin of the holy River Ganga. Each year, the temple closes for the winter season during the Annakut festival, and the idol of Goddess Ganga is ceremonially moved to Mukhba village, her winter abode. The temple reopens in summer, attracting thousands of devotees who seek spiritual blessings in the serene Himalayan region of Uttarakhand.

questions.question: In which city is the 42nd IndianOil SERVO Surjit Hockey Tournament being held?
questions.explanation: The 42nd IndianOil SERVO Surjit Hockey Tournament is taking place in Jalandhar at the Olympian Surjit Hockey Stadium. This prestigious tournament, conducted in a league-cum-knockout format, spans 10 days and features 12 competitive teams, including IndianOil Mumbai, Indian Navy Mumbai, and RCF Kapurthala. Played under floodlights, the event not only highlights the sporting culture of Jalandhar but also provides a platform for emerging and seasoned hockey players to showcase their skills. Known for its strong hockey heritage, Jalandhar continues to be a significant hub for field hockey tournaments and talent development in India.

questions.question: Which country has officially abolished the restrictive kafala (sponsorship) system for foreign workers?
questions.explanation: Saudi Arabia has officially abolished the kafala system, marking a historic reform in its labour laws. The kafala system had long been criticized for giving employers excessive control over foreign workers, including the ability to confiscate passports, restrict job mobility, and deny exit permits. By ending this system, Saudi Arabia aims to improve workers’ rights, attract skilled foreign labour, and align its policies with global labour standards. This reform also supports the goals of Saudi Vision 2030, which seeks to modernise the kingdom’s economy and enhance its global reputation as a fair and progressive employer.

questions.question: Who has been conferred the honourary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Territorial Army?
questions.explanation: Neeraj Chopra, India’s celebrated javelin thrower and two-time Olympic medallist, has been conferred the honourary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Territorial Army. Having joined the Indian Army as a Naib Subedar in 2016, he rose through the ranks to become Subedar and later Subedar Major. Neeraj’s outstanding achievements include prestigious honours such as the Arjuna Award (2018), Khel Ratna (2021), Padma Shri (2022), and Param Vishisht Seva Medal (2022). This recognition highlights his exemplary contributions to Indian sports and his embodiment of discipline, patriotism, and excellence both on and off the field.

questions.question: In which year was the original Vegetable Oil Products, Production and Availability (Regulation) Order introduced?
questions.explanation: The Vegetable Oil Products, Production and Availability (Regulation) Order was first introduced in 2011 under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution. It was later amended and reintroduced as the VOPPA Order, 2025. The 2011 version served as the foundational regulatory framework governing the production, processing, and distribution of edible oils in India, ensuring quality control, fair trade practices, and consumer protection. The 2025 amendment builds upon this framework by introducing mandatory registration for all participants in the edible oil supply chain.

questions.question: What is the name of the new elite commando unit and drone platoons recently raised by the Indian Army?
questions.explanation: The Indian Army has raised new Bhairav Battalions along with specialised drone platoons to strengthen its rapid-response and high-mobility warfare capabilities. Each Bhairav Battalion consists of around 250 personnel and is designed to operate between regular infantry and Special Forces. These units will enhance surveillance, strike precision, and adaptability during surprise operations along India’s borders with China and Pakistan. The concept of the Bhairav Battalions and drone platoons evolved from operational lessons learned during Operation Sindoor in May 2025, reflecting India’s growing emphasis on technology-integrated military readiness.

questions.question: In which Indian state has Vedanta Group announced an additional ₹1 lakh crore investment, including a ferro-alloys plant and aluminium parks?
questions.explanation: Vedanta Group has announced an additional investment of ₹1 lakh crore in Odisha, aimed at boosting industrial growth and employment in the state. The investment plans include a ₹2,000-crore ferro-alloys plant in Keonjhar and the development of two aluminium parks, one in Jharsuguda and another location identified by the state government. This strategic move is expected to generate over 1 lakh direct and indirect jobs, enhancing Odisha’s industrial infrastructure and positioning it as a significant hub for the metals and mining sector in India.

questions.question: Which Indian state is hosting the FIDE World Cup 2025?
questions.explanation: The FIDE World Cup 2025 will be hosted in North Goa from October 31 to November 27, 2025. Goa is welcoming 206 elite chess players from 82 countries for this high-stakes knockout tournament, with a prize purse of USD 2 million. The event highlights Goa’s vibrant cultural identity through the official logo and anthem, reflecting its coastal beauty, festive spirit, and chess strategy. Hosting the World Cup also positions Goa as a global sports destination, promoting India’s soft power, tourism, and rising prominence in international chess.

questions.question: On which date is World Polio Day observed annually to highlight global efforts to eradicate polio?
questions.explanation: World Polio Day is observed every year on October 24 to raise awareness about polio, a highly infectious viral disease that primarily affects children. The 2025 theme, “End Polio: Every Child, Every Vaccine, Everywhere,” emphasises the urgent need to ensure that all children, regardless of location, receive life-saving polio vaccines. Initiated by Rotary International to honour Dr. Jonas Salk, the developer of the first effective polio vaccine, the day also supports the Global Polio Eradication Initiative led by WHO and Rotary. It highlights the importance of vaccination, global cooperation, and reaching the last remaining cases to achieve a polio-free world.

questions.question: Which country has launched the Online National Drug Licensing System (ONDLS) to track pharmaceutical solvents and ensure drug safety?
questions.explanation: India has introduced the Online National Drug Licensing System (ONDLS) in response to fatal cases linked to toxic cough syrups. Spearheaded by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO), ONDLS allows real-time tracking of high-risk pharmaceutical solvents, ensuring only verified, safe ingredients are used in drug manufacturing. The system provides end-to-end traceability, mandatory batch-wise entries, and compliance audits by state-level controllers. This initiative strengthens India’s pharmaceutical safety framework, prevents contamination, and addresses public health concerns while aligning with international standards for drug quality and regulatory oversight.

questions.question: Which country is planning to introduce legislation restricting social media access for users under 16?
questions.explanation: New Zealand is preparing to debate a bill that would restrict social media access for children under 16. Introduced by National Party MP Catherine Wedd, the legislation mandates age verification by tech companies before allowing new users to register. The move addresses rising concerns over teen mental health, cyberbullying, misinformation, and online body image pressures. If passed, New Zealand would join a small group of countries adopting strict social media access laws for minors. While proponents emphasise safety, critics warn about privacy risks and the potential ineffectiveness of such bans compared to education and parental guidance.

questions.question: Which Indian state is building its first underwater tunnel?
questions.explanation: Kerala is set to construct its first underwater tunnel between Vypin and Fort Kochi as part of the state’s coastal highway project. The ₹2,672 crore project will reduce the travel distance from 16 km to just 3 km under the Arabian Sea. Developed by the Kerala Rail Development Corporation Limited (KRDCL), the tunnel features a twin-tube design, emergency stops, escape passages, and advanced safety systems. This initiative will significantly cut travel time, reduce commuting costs, and minimize disruption to port operations, marking a major milestone in Kerala’s infrastructure and transport development.

questions.question: In which country did India achieve a kabaddi double, with both Under-18 teams winning gold at the 2025 Asian Youth Games?
questions.explanation: India secured a kabaddi double at the 2025 Asian Youth Games held in Bahrain, with both the Under-18 boys’ and girls’ teams winning gold medals. The girls’ team achieved a remarkable 75-21 victory over Iran, the largest margin in a Youth Games kabaddi final since 2013, while the boys’ team narrowly defeated Iran 35-32. This dominant performance highlights India’s continued strength in kabaddi at the youth level and underscores the nation’s growing prominence in the sport on the Asian stage, showcasing skill, teamwork, and strategic excellence.

questions.question: Which country recently became the 90th State Member of the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)?
questions.explanation: Tuvalu, one of the smallest and most climate-vulnerable nations, has joined the IUCN as its 90th State Member. Comprising nine low-lying atolls in the Pacific, Tuvalu faces threats like sea-level rise, coastal erosion, and climate-induced challenges to food and freshwater security. IUCN membership provides Tuvalu with access to global conservation expertise, international advocacy platforms, and technical support for biodiversity and climate policies. This membership also allows Tuvalu to engage with initiatives like the Green Climate Fund and Global Environment Facility, enhancing its ability to implement sustainable fisheries, marine protected areas, and community-driven climate adaptation strategies.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Chair of the WIPO Advisory Board of Judges for the term 2025–2027?
questions.explanation: Justice Prathiba M. Singh of the Delhi High Court has been appointed as the Chair of the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) Advisory Board of Judges for 2025–2027. She is the first Indian and the first Asian to hold this prestigious position, marking a significant milestone in global intellectual property law. As Chair, she will guide WIPO in aligning its policies with judicial standards worldwide. Her appointment highlights India’s growing leadership in IP law and offers strategic judicial perspectives on innovation, digital governance, and economic development.

questions.question: On which date is United Nations Day observed each year to commemorate the founding of the UN?
questions.explanation: United Nations Day is observed annually on October 24, marking the anniversary of the UN’s establishment in 1945 following the San Francisco Conference. The theme for the 80th anniversary is "Building Our Future Together". The day celebrates the UN’s commitment to global peace, security, human rights, and sustainable development. It highlights the organization’s efforts in promoting equality, reducing poverty, and addressing environmental challenges. Across the world, member nations participate in cultural programs, exhibitions, and discussions to reinforce the UN Charter’s principles, encourage cooperation among nations, and remind people of the importance of international unity and dialogue in solving global problems.

questions.question: On which date is World Development Information Day observed each year to highlight the role of information and technology in global development?
questions.explanation: World Development Information Day is observed annually on October 24, coinciding with United Nations Day, to emphasise the critical role of information and communication technology (ICT) in addressing global development challenges. The 2025 theme focuses on using digital innovation and media to foster economic progress, cooperation, and sustainable development worldwide. The day encourages public awareness about development issues, promotes informed decision-making, and empowers citizens through access to knowledge. ICT enables trade enhancement, conflict resolution, education, and connectivity, acting as a key driver for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and equitable growth in developing nations.

questions.question: In which Indian state was the manufacturing facility for Kavach 4.0, India’s next-generation Automatic Train Protection (ATP) system, inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The manufacturing facility for Kavach 4.0, India’s advanced Automatic Train Protection (ATP) system, was inaugurated by Karnataka’s IT Minister Priyank Kharge. This event highlights Karnataka’s growing prominence in the field of technology and innovation, especially in sectors like transportation safety. The collaboration between NOVA Control Tecnologix and Tata Elxsi for Kavach 4.0 showcases the state’s pivotal role in promoting cutting-edge technological advancements and supporting India’s mission to enhance railway safety infrastructure.

questions.question: In which Indian state did the Indian Coast Guard launch the two Advanced Fast Patrol Vessels, ICG Ship Ajit and ICG Ship Aparajit?
questions.explanation: The Indian Coast Guard launched two Advanced Fast Patrol Vessels—ICG Ship Ajit and ICG Ship Aparajit—at Goa Shipyard Limited in Goa. Each vessel measures 52 meters in length and weighs about 320 tonnes, marking the seventh and eighth ships in a series of eight indigenously built patrol vessels. These ships are equipped with Controllable Pitch Propellers, a technological advancement introduced for the first time in this class of vessels in India. The launch underscores Goa’s important role in India’s naval and shipbuilding capabilities, strengthening the nation’s coastal defence infrastructure.

questions.question: Who made history by winning India’s first-ever MMA medal at the Asian Youth Games in Bahrain?
questions.explanation: Veer Bhadu created history by winning India’s first-ever Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) medal at the Asian Youth Games held in Bahrain. Competing in the Men’s 80 kg category, Bhadu secured the bronze medal after a remarkable victory over Thailand’s Dechachot Barisri by unanimous decision. This achievement not only highlights Bhadu’s dedication and skill but also marks a major milestone for India in the field of combat sports. Alongside his success, Palash Mandal added another bronze in the 5000m walk race, bringing India’s total medal tally to twelve at the event.

questions.question: What is Deloitte India’s projected GDP growth rate for India in FY26?
questions.explanation: Deloitte India’s latest India Economic Outlook report projects India’s GDP growth for FY26 in the range of 6.7–6.9%, reflecting confidence in the country’s strong domestic demand and supportive policy environment. The upward revision of 0.3 percentage points from earlier estimates highlights renewed optimism in the Indian economy. Key drivers include robust private investment, rising consumer spending, and government-led reforms such as GST 2.0. The projection aligns closely with the Reserve Bank of India’s 6.8% growth forecast, emphasizing a broad consensus on India’s economic resilience despite challenges like global trade uncertainty, inflation pressures, and geopolitical risks.

questions.question: On which date is the ITBP Raising Day observed every year to commemorate the formation of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police?
questions.explanation: ITBP Raising Day is celebrated annually on October 24 to honour the establishment of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP). The ITBP was formed in 1962, following the Indo-China War, with the crucial responsibility of safeguarding India’s 3,488-km border with China across some of the world’s most challenging high-altitude terrains. The force embodies its motto, “Shaurya, Dridhata, Karm Nishtha,” which translates to “Valour, Determination, and Devotion to Duty.” The day highlights the courage and dedication of ITBP personnel who serve under extreme conditions to protect India’s frontiers.

questions.question: In which Indian state is Adani Power’s Godda Ultra Super Critical Thermal Plant located?
questions.explanation: Adani Power’s Godda Ultra Super Critical Thermal Plant is situated in Jharkhand. With a total capacity of 1,600 MW, the plant was initially developed to supply electricity to Bangladesh under a cross-border energy agreement. Recently, it has been approved for connection to India’s national electricity grid, enabling it to contribute to the country’s domestic power supply as well. This development marks a significant milestone in optimizing energy resources and enhancing regional power stability while showcasing Jharkhand’s growing importance as a hub for large-scale energy infrastructure projects.

questions.question: Who recently surpassed Sourav Ganguly to become India’s third-highest run-scorer in One Day Internationals (ODIs)?
questions.explanation: Rohit Sharma achieved a major milestone in his cricketing career by surpassing Sourav Ganguly to become India’s third-highest run-scorer in One Day Internationals (ODIs), with a total of 11,249 runs. Only Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli are ahead of him on the list. Rohit reached this feat during his 73-run knock against Australia, displaying composure and skill throughout his innings. Known for his consistency and ability to adapt, Rohit’s career highlights include 32 ODI centuries, 59 fifties, and the record for the highest individual ODI score of 264 runs against Sri Lanka.

questions.question: In which city was the Sevilla Forum on Debt launched during the 16th United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD16)?
questions.explanation: The Sevilla Forum on Debt was launched at UNCTAD16, held in Geneva. This global event, led by Spain with support from UNCTAD and UN DESA, aims to create a permanent and inclusive platform for discussions on sovereign debt challenges faced by nations. The forum’s establishment in Geneva underscores the city’s significance as a hub for international diplomacy and global economic governance. It also represents a major outcome of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development (FfD4), focusing on sustainable financial cooperation and global debt management frameworks.

questions.question: Which Indian bank was awarded the title of “World’s Best Consumer Bank 2025” by Global Finance?
questions.explanation: The State Bank of India (SBI) earned the prestigious “World’s Best Consumer Bank 2025” award from Global Finance, recognizing its excellence in innovation, digital transformation, and financial inclusion. SBI’s leadership in mobile and voice banking, along with AI-driven services and a massive customer base of over 520 million, contributed to this recognition. The bank’s flagship mobile app, with over 100 million users, reflects its success in digital accessibility. This achievement not only enhances India’s reputation in global banking but also highlights the evolving role of public sector banks in providing inclusive, tech-enabled financial services to millions across the nation.

questions.question: What is the name of the asteroid recently confirmed by NASA as Earth’s new "quasi-moon"?
questions.explanation: NASA confirmed the asteroid 2025 PN7 as a “quasi-moon” of Earth, meaning it follows a similar orbital path around the Sun but is not gravitationally bound to our planet like the Moon. Discovered by the University of Hawaii in 2025, PN7 is estimated to be between 18 and 36 metres in diameter. Its orbital behavior makes it appear as if it accompanies Earth in its journey around the Sun. NASA’s analysis confirmed that PN7 poses no danger to our planet, making it an exciting scientific discovery for understanding near-Earth objects.

questions.question: When will the Global Media and Information Literacy (MIL) Week 2025 be celebrated?
questions.explanation: The Global Media and Information Literacy (MIL) Week 2025 will be celebrated from October 24 to 31 in Cartagena de Indias, Colombia. This annual UNESCO-led event aims to promote awareness, education, and policy dialogue on the importance of media and information literacy in the digital age. The 2025 theme, “Minds Over AI: MIL in Digital Spaces,” focuses on empowering individuals to use and evaluate information ethically in an AI-driven world. The celebration brings together global stakeholders—educators, policymakers, and media professionals—to strengthen critical thinking, combat misinformation, and ensure ethical use of artificial intelligence in communication.

questions.question: In which city is India’s first glass suspension bridge, Bajrang Setu, being constructed?
questions.explanation: The Bajrang Setu, India’s first glass suspension bridge, is being built in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand. Set to open by December 2025, it will replace the historic Laxman Jhula, which was closed in 2019 due to safety concerns after nearly a century of service. The new bridge spans 132 meters and features glass walkways on both sides, allowing pedestrians to enjoy breathtaking views of the Ganga River. Designed with modern engineering standards, Bajrang Setu combines safety, durability, and visual appeal. Beyond improving connectivity, it is expected to boost tourism, local business, and Rishikesh’s reputation as a spiritual and adventure destination.

questions.question: Who won the 2025 United States Grand Prix, tightening the Formula 1 title race with five races remaining?
