questions.explanation: Max Verstappen clinched victory at the 2025 United States Grand Prix, marking his third win in four races and reigniting the Formula 1 title battle. Driving for Red Bull, Verstappen dominated from pole position, building a significant lead and showcasing his trademark consistency. The win also included success in the sprint race, reinforcing his late-season momentum. With this triumph, Verstappen now sits just 40 points behind Oscar Piastri and 26 behind Lando Norris, keeping his hopes alive for a record fifth consecutive drivers’ championship. His commanding performance in Austin highlighted his skill, resilience, and championship-caliber precision.

questions.question: What is the name of the AI-powered digital assistant launched by NPCI to assist users with UPI payment queries and grievance tracking?
questions.explanation: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has introduced ‘UPI Help’, an AI-based assistant designed to provide real-time support for users facing issues such as failed or delayed transactions, unclear payment statuses, and mandate queries. Integrated with the UPI Dispute Resolution (UDIR) framework, it automates complaint handling and ensures faster resolution without the need for manual intervention. It also allows users to manage their UPI Autopay mandates, view active subscriptions, and track grievances through a transparent system. By leveraging AI, UPI Help aims to enhance trust, convenience, and efficiency across India’s digital payment ecosystem.

questions.question: From which date will the new nomination rules under the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025 come into effect?
questions.explanation: The Central Government has announced that the updated nomination rules under the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025 will take effect from November 1, 2025. These reforms aim to make the nomination process for deposits, lockers, and safe custody articles more flexible and transparent. Customers can now nominate up to four individuals simultaneously or successively, ensuring clearer entitlement and quicker settlement in case of the depositor’s death. The changes are part of broader initiatives to strengthen governance, depositor protection, and efficiency in India’s banking system, aligning with modern financial practices and customer convenience.

questions.question: Who won the 2025 British Academy Book Prize for the work “The Burning Earth”?
questions.explanation: Sunil Amrith, an Indian-origin historian and Yale University professor, won the 2025 British Academy Book Prize for his book The Burning Earth: An Environmental History of the Last 500 Years. The £25,000 prize honours outstanding non-fiction that deepens public understanding of global issues through scholarly research. Amrith’s work traces five centuries of human-environment interaction, exploring how empire, capitalism, and industrialization have shaped ecological change worldwide. His recognition underscores the growing importance of environmental history and highlights the contributions of Indian-origin scholars to global academic discourse. The British Academy praised his book for reframing history through an ecological lens.

questions.question: What key feature does the new UPI innovation ‘Pay with Mutual Fund’ primarily enable for users?
questions.explanation: The new UPI feature ‘Pay with Mutual Fund’ enables users to make instant transactions directly from their liquid mutual fund holdings. Instead of transferring money to a bank account before payment, the system instantly redeems the required amount from the mutual fund and processes it in real time through UPI. This innovation bridges investment and payment systems, offering both liquidity and higher returns compared to traditional savings accounts. Backed by ICICI Prudential AMC, Bajaj Finserv AMC, and Curie Money, it marks a global first for India in fintech, revolutionizing how digital transactions integrate with personal investments.

questions.question: In which Union Territory has the 150-year-old Darbar Move tradition been restored after four years?
questions.explanation: The historic Darbar Move tradition has been revived in Jammu and Kashmir after being suspended for four years. This 150-year-old administrative practice involves the biannual shifting of government offices between Srinagar and Jammu—Srinagar serving as the summer capital and Jammu as the winter capital. Originally initiated in 1872 by Maharaja Gulab Singh to ensure accessible governance during harsh winters, the tradition symbolises unity and coexistence between the two regions. Its revival not only restores a significant cultural and political legacy but is also expected to boost Jammu’s winter economy, benefiting local businesses and strengthening administrative ties.

questions.question: Which country was re-elected as the Vice-Chair of the COP10 Bureau under the International Convention against Doping in Sport?
questions.explanation: India was re-elected as the Vice-Chair of the COP10 Bureau under the International Convention against Doping in Sport during the 10th Session of the Conference of Parties (COP10) held at UNESCO Headquarters in Paris. Representing the Asia-Pacific region, India’s re-election reinforces its leadership in promoting clean sport and ethical governance at the global level. The Indian delegation, led by senior officials from the Sports Ministry and NADA, actively contributed to discussions on anti-doping education, compliance, and policy reform. India’s proposal to integrate the Values Education through Sport (VETS) initiative was also praised for advancing global efforts toward integrity and fair play in sports.

questions.question: What is the approximate level India’s foreign exchange reserves reached in October 2025?
questions.explanation: India’s foreign exchange reserves crossed the $700 billion mark in October 2025, reaching $702 billion according to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). This milestone reflects strong macroeconomic fundamentals and resilience amid global financial volatility. The rise was largely driven by an increase of $6.1 billion in gold reserves, supported by higher global gold prices, even as foreign currency assets declined due to RBI’s market interventions. Maintaining such high reserves provides India with a crucial financial cushion against global uncertainties, stabilises the rupee, enhances investor confidence, and ensures sufficient import cover for over ten months, reinforcing economic stability.

questions.question: Who won silver medals for India at the U-23 World Wrestling Championships held in Serbia?
questions.explanation: Hansika Lamba and Sarika Malik secured silver medals for India at the U-23 World Wrestling Championships held in Serbia. Hansika competed in the 53kg category, where she lost 0–4 to Japan’s Haruna Morikawa in the final, while Sarika Malik, in the 55kg category, narrowly lost 1–2 to Ruka Natami. Their achievements significantly contributed to India’s overall success, as the country ended the tournament with an impressive total of seven medals, including five bronze medals in the women’s competition, marking a proud moment for Indian wrestling.

questions.question: In which city did the second edition of the Naval Commanders’ Conference 2025 conclude?
questions.explanation: The second edition of the biannual Naval Commanders’ Conference 2025 concluded in New Delhi after a three-day session that focused on strategic discussions and technological advancements within the Indian Navy. During the conference, a new digital platform named ‘NIPUN’ (Naval Intellectual Portal for Unified Knowledge) was launched to serve as an online hub for naval research and intellectual contributions. Additionally, five key naval publications were released, underscoring the Navy’s commitment to knowledge sharing, modernization, and enhancing operational readiness across India’s maritime domain.

questions.question: Which Indian Navy ship completed the 18th joint hydrographic survey with Mauritius, covering 35,000 square nautical miles?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy’s hydrographic vessel INS Sutlej successfully completed the 18th joint hydrographic survey with Mauritius, mapping around 35,000 square nautical miles of Mauritian waters. This mission, conducted under the 2005 India-Mauritius MoU on hydrographic cooperation, strengthened maritime safety, environmental management, and regional security. Equipped with advanced instruments such as multibeam echo sounders and side-scan sonar, INS Sutlej also conducted joint EEZ surveillance and anti-piracy patrols alongside the Mauritius National Coast Guard. The initiative reflects India’s broader MAHASAGAR vision—Mutual & Holistic Advancement for Security and Growth Across the Regions—promoting sustainable maritime collaboration in the Indian Ocean.

questions.question: In which city did the four-day international dance and music festival ‘Udbhav Utsav’ begin?
questions.explanation: The international dance and music festival ‘Udbhav Utsav’ commenced in Gwalior with a colorful carnival that started from Captain Roop Singh Stadium and proceeded to Jiwaji University. The festival was inaugurated at the Atal Auditorium, Jiwaji University, by Padma Shri awardees Dr. Nalini and Dr. Kamalini, both eminent Kathak dancers. This grand cultural event celebrates global art forms and promotes cross-cultural exchange through performances by artists from various countries. Gwalior, known for its deep cultural and musical heritage, serves as an ideal venue for such an international celebration of dance and music.

questions.question: In which country is Exercise Ocean Sky 2025 being hosted, with the Indian Air Force participating?
questions.explanation: Exercise Ocean Sky 2025 is being hosted by the Spanish Air Force at Gando Air Base in Spain, with participation from several allied nations, including India, Germany, Greece, Portugal, and the United States. The Indian Air Force is showcasing its Su-30MKI fighter jets during the exercise, aimed at enhancing interoperability, mutual learning, and advanced air combat skills among the participating air forces. Spain’s role as host highlights its growing collaboration with global defence partners, while India’s involvement underscores its commitment to strengthening international military cooperation and operational readiness through such joint exercises.

questions.question: On which date is World Day for Audiovisual Heritage celebrated every year?
questions.explanation: World Day for Audiovisual Heritage is observed annually on October 27 to emphasise the importance of preserving the world’s audiovisual records—films, sound recordings, broadcasts, and digital media—that capture humanity’s cultural and historical diversity. Established by UNESCO in 2005, the day commemorates the 1980 adoption of the “Recommendation for the Safeguarding and Preservation of Moving Images.” The 2025 theme, “Digitizing Our Shared UNESCO History,” highlights the urgent need to convert fragile audiovisual materials into digital formats to protect them from decay, obsolescence, and loss, ensuring that future generations can access and learn from the world’s rich audiovisual heritage.

questions.question: Which country did India defeat 10–9 in the KogniVera International Polo Cup 2024 held in New Delhi?
questions.explanation: India secured a remarkable 10–9 victory over Argentina in the KogniVera International Polo Cup 2024 at the Jaipur Polo Ground, New Delhi. Led by Sawai Padmanabh Singh of Jaipur, the Indian team displayed exceptional coordination, tactical brilliance, and precision in their gameplay. The closely contested match showcased the high skill level of both teams and highlighted India’s growing strength in international polo competitions. Argentina, known for its strong polo tradition, posed a formidable challenge, making India’s triumph a significant achievement in the global polo arena.

questions.question: Which country successfully tested the nuclear-powered ‘Burevestnik’ cruise missile, as announced by its President?
questions.explanation: The nuclear-powered ‘Burevestnik’ cruise missile was successfully tested by Russia, as announced by President Vladimir Putin. This missile is a part of Russia’s advanced strategic arsenal aimed at strengthening its nuclear deterrence and global strike capabilities. The test demonstrated impressive performance, with the missile reportedly flying for 15 hours and covering a distance of 14,000 km. Such advancements highlight Russia’s focus on maintaining a technological edge in nuclear and long-range weapons systems, reinforcing its position as a leading global military power.

questions.question: Which Indian chess players won double gold medals at the 2025 European Chess Club Cup?
questions.explanation: Indian Grandmasters Gukesh Dommaraju and Divya Deshmukh achieved remarkable success by winning two gold medals each at the 2025 European Chess Club Cup. Gukesh represented Team Super Chess, while Divya played for Cercle d’échecs de Monte-Carlo, which triumphed in the Women’s Team Championship. Their performances demonstrated exceptional strategic skill, consistency, and composure against top international players. Alongside them, Nihal Sarin also secured an individual gold, contributing to India’s strong presence in global chess and highlighting the nation’s growing dominance in both men’s and women’s categories on the world stage.

questions.question: Who has been elected as Ireland’s 10th President after a landslide victory over Heather Humphreys?
questions.explanation: Catherine Connolly, an independent left-wing politician, has been elected as Ireland’s 10th President following a decisive victory over Heather Humphreys. Representing Galway West since 2016, Connolly has built a strong reputation as a dedicated public servant and an influential voice in Irish politics. Her prior role as Deputy Speaker of the Irish Parliament showcased her leadership and integrity. Known for her grassroots connection and progressive stance, Connolly’s election reflects a shift in Ireland’s political landscape toward inclusivity and independent representation, marking a significant moment in the nation’s democratic and social history.

questions.question: What is the name of the cyclone approaching the Andhra Pradesh coast, prompting a high alert in the state?
questions.explanation: Cyclone Montha, forming over the southeast Bay of Bengal, has put Andhra Pradesh on high alert due to forecasts of heavy to very heavy rainfall and strong winds. The cyclone is expected to make landfall near Kakinada, between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam. In response, the state government has intensified its preparedness measures to minimize potential damage and ensure public safety. Cyclone Montha’s movement underscores the importance of disaster management systems and early warning mechanisms in mitigating the impact of severe weather events along India’s eastern coastline.

questions.question: Which country’s CR450 high-speed train set a world record by reaching a speed of 453 km/h during testing?
questions.explanation: China’s CR450 high-speed train reached a record-breaking speed of 453 km/h during testing, showcasing the country’s technological advancement in rail transport. Designed for the Shanghai–Chengdu corridor, the CR450 is expected to enter commercial service in 2026 with a regular operating speed of 400 km/h, making it the fastest passenger train in the world. This achievement underscores China’s leadership in high-speed rail innovation, precision engineering, and commitment to expanding sustainable, ultra-fast transportation networks that connect major economic hubs across the nation.

questions.question: Which Indian conglomerate has partnered with Meta to launch a ₹855 crore joint venture for developing enterprise AI products under the new entity REIL?
questions.explanation: Reliance Industries has partnered with Meta Platforms to establish a ₹855 crore joint venture named Reliance Enterprise Intelligence Limited (REIL), focused on developing enterprise-grade AI solutions. The collaboration aims to build AI-driven tools such as automation systems, predictive analytics platforms, and generative AI models optimised for Indian markets. This initiative aligns with India’s Digital India and Atmanirbhar Bharat missions, promoting indigenous AI innovation. It also reflects Reliance’s broader strategy to strengthen its digital ecosystem and expand into global enterprise technology, reinforcing its longstanding partnership with Meta in advancing India’s tech infrastructure.

questions.question: Which country has unveiled the Hyunmoo-5, also known as the “Monster Missile”?
questions.explanation: South Korea has introduced its most powerful ballistic missile, the Hyunmoo-5, nicknamed the “Monster Missile.” This 36-tonne, 16-meter-long road-mobile missile is designed for deep-penetration and bunker-busting missions. The Hyunmoo-5 is a central component of South Korea’s Kill Chain and Korea Massive Punishment and Retaliation (KMPR) doctrines, aimed at deterring and responding to potential threats. The development of this missile highlights South Korea’s growing emphasis on self-reliant defence capabilities and advanced missile technology in response to evolving regional security challenges on the Korean Peninsula.

questions.question: Who set a new Youth World Record and won the gold medal in the girls' 44kg weightlifting event at the Asian Youth Games in Bahrain?
questions.explanation: Indian weightlifter Priteesmitha Bhoi achieved a remarkable feat by setting a new Youth World Record at the Asian Youth Games held in Bahrain. Competing in the girls' 44kg category, she lifted 92kg in the Clean & Jerk, marking a record-breaking performance. With a total lift of 158kg across all attempts, she secured the gold medal, bringing pride to India. Her achievement highlights India’s growing strength in youth weightlifting and showcases the potential of emerging athletes on the global stage.

questions.question: Which ISRO mission is set for launch on November 2 using the LVM3 rocket carrying India’s heaviest communication satellite?
questions.explanation: The CMS-03 Mission is an upcoming ISRO launch scheduled for November 2, featuring India’s heaviest communication satellite, weighing 4,400 kg. The LVM3 launch vehicle has been moved to the launch pad at the Satish Dhawan Space Centre, Sriharikota, for this major mission. CMS-03 will enhance India’s communication capabilities by providing advanced coverage and bandwidth across the Indian subcontinent. This mission also reaffirms ISRO’s growing expertise in deploying high-capacity satellites and demonstrates the efficiency of the LVM3 rocket, which has become India’s most powerful and reliable launch vehicle for heavy payloads.

questions.question: Who has been recommended to become the 53rd Chief Justice of India following the retirement of Chief Justice Bhushan R Gavai?
questions.explanation: Justice Surya Kant has been recommended to take over as the 53rd Chief Justice of India after the retirement of Chief Justice Bhushan R Gavai. He was elevated to the Supreme Court on May 24, 2019, and will serve as CJI for about 14 months, until February 9, 2027. Notably, Justice Surya Kant will be the first Chief Justice of India hailing from the state of Haryana, marking an important milestone in the history of the Indian judiciary.

questions.question: In which state was the Grand Finale of the Model Rocketry and CANSAT India Student Competition held?
questions.explanation: The Grand Finale of the Model Rocketry and CANSAT India Student Competition took place in Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh, on the banks of the Narayani River. Organised jointly by IN-SPACe, ISRO, and the Astronautical Society of India (ASI), it stands as one of the largest student-led space competitions in the country. A total of 71 student teams from institutions across India participated, showcasing innovations in model rocketry and satellite technology, aimed at encouraging young minds to explore and contribute to India’s growing space research ecosystem.

questions.question: Which Indian state will impose a green tax on vehicles entering from other states starting December 2025 to protect its fragile Himalayan ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand will introduce a green tax from December 2025 on all vehicles entering from other states to safeguard its fragile Himalayan environment. The initiative aims to reduce vehicular emissions, discourage unnecessary traffic in eco-sensitive hill areas, and promote sustainable tourism. The tax collection will be fully automated through Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) cameras at 37 entry points, ensuring transparency and efficiency. By integrating digital governance and environmental protection, Uttarakhand becomes one of the first states to adopt a real-time, technology-driven system for ecological conservation and pollution control in hill regions.

questions.question: Who scored the third-fastest double century in Ranji Trophy history during the 2025–26 season?
questions.explanation: Prithvi Shaw achieved the remarkable feat of scoring the third-fastest double century in Ranji Trophy history, smashing 200 runs off just 141 balls in a 2025–26 season match against Chandigarh. Having moved from Mumbai to Maharashtra for the season, Shaw made an emphatic statement with this explosive performance. His aggressive batting and quick scoring rate underline his natural talent and ability to dominate domestic cricket. This innings not only reaffirmed his potential but also placed him among the elite performers in India’s premier first-class cricket tournament.

questions.question: Which country will host the first Asia Pacific Accident Investigation Group (APAC-AIG) meeting and workshop?
questions.explanation: India will host the first Asia Pacific Accident Investigation Group (APAC-AIG) meeting and workshop, marking a significant milestone in its aviation safety leadership. Organised by the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) under the Ministry of Civil Aviation, the event will feature around 90 representatives from ICAO member states and international aviation experts. Union Minister of Civil Aviation, Rammohan Naidu, will inaugurate the event. Hosting this meeting demonstrates India’s growing role in global aviation governance and its commitment to enhancing air safety standards and cooperation across the Asia-Pacific region.

questions.question: In how many states and union territories will the Election Commission conduct the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls under the second phase?
questions.explanation: The Election Commission of India has announced that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls will be carried out in 12 states and union territories as part of the second phase of the revision process. During this exercise, Booth Level Officers (BLOs) will distribute unique enumeration forms to all existing voters to ensure accuracy in voter data. Importantly, voters whose names already appeared in the 2003 electoral list are exempted from providing additional documentation. This initiative aims to maintain transparency, inclusiveness, and updated records in the electoral system across multiple regions of India.

questions.question: Where did Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurate the 'Deep Sea Fishing Vessels' under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana?
questions.explanation: Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated the 'Deep Sea Fishing Vessels' at Mazgaon Dock in Mumbai under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana. This initiative aims to enhance the fishing infrastructure and boost marine productivity. Over the next five years, the government plans to distribute 200 deep-sea fishing vessels on a cooperative basis across India. The program is a major step toward empowering fishermen, modernizing the fisheries sector, and improving the livelihoods of coastal communities while promoting sustainable fishing practices.

questions.question: In which city was the 20th East Asia Summit held where the Kuala Lumpur Declaration was adopted?
questions.explanation: The 20th East Asia Summit took place in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, where member nations adopted the Kuala Lumpur Declaration reaffirming their shared commitment to peace, stability, and multilateral cooperation. The declaration emphasised ASEAN’s central role in regional architecture and endorsed transparent, rules-based approaches to conflict resolution. It also reinforced the EAS’s informal, leaders-led framework for strategic dialogue and cooperation on security, economic, and developmental issues. Amid shifting global power dynamics and regional tensions, the summit’s outcome in Kuala Lumpur underscored the importance of collaboration, trust-building, and a unified commitment to stability across the East Asian region.

questions.question: Which passenger vessel completed its maiden voyage to Barren Island, marking a milestone in Andaman and Nicobar maritime tourism?
questions.explanation: The passenger vessel Sindhu achieved a historic feat by completing its maiden voyage to Barren Island, home to India’s only active volcano. Located about 140 km from Port Blair, Barren Island has long been a restricted zone, primarily accessible to scientists and researchers through aerial surveys. The successful journey of Sindhu marks a new chapter in Andaman and Nicobar tourism by opening sea-based access to one of India’s most unique geological sites. This development not only enhances eco-tourism prospects but also strengthens the region’s maritime connectivity and exploration initiatives.

questions.question: Which country became the 11th member of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in October 2025?
questions.explanation: East Timor, also known as Timor-Leste, officially became the 11th member of ASEAN on October 26, 2025, during the ASEAN Summit in Kuala Lumpur. This marked the culmination of a 14-year application process and symbolised the country’s successful integration into the regional community. With a population of about 1.4 million and a growing democratic system, East Timor’s membership represents ASEAN’s commitment to inclusivity and the strengthening of democratic values. It also opens new opportunities for East Timor in trade, education, and regional cooperation while enriching ASEAN’s collective political and cultural diversity.

questions.question: Which Hong Kong-based startup is launching the Feilian Constellation, the world’s first 3D wind data satellite network?
questions.explanation: Stellerus, a Hong Kong-based startup, is set to revolutionize atmospheric observation with the Feilian Constellation—the world’s first satellite network designed to capture three-dimensional wind data. The constellation will provide hourly, kilometer-scale global wind maps, improving forecasts for renewable energy, aviation safety, and disaster management. Led by Professor Hui Su, a NASA veteran, Stellerus combines advanced meteorological science with cost-effective Chinese satellite manufacturing. Partnering with Chang Guang Satellite Technology Co., the company leverages cutting-edge imaging and lightweight satellite design to make global 3D wind monitoring economically viable and technologically groundbreaking.

questions.question: Which Indian state received a $280 million World Bank loan under the Health System Improvement Programme to enhance healthcare access and climate resilience?
questions.explanation: The World Bank approved a $280 million loan for a southern Indian state under the Health System Improvement Programme to strengthen healthcare services and improve climate resilience. The initiative aims to benefit around 11 million elderly and vulnerable citizens through better chronic disease care, home-based support, and advanced digital health systems. It also promotes energy-efficient and climate-adaptive health infrastructure in districts prone to floods and heatwaves. The project highlights a model of digital integration, local governance participation, and sustainable public health management, enhancing the state’s reputation for progressive healthcare initiatives.

questions.question: Which institution signed an MoU with NCERT to enhance educational research and technology integration in line with the National Education Policy 2020?
questions.explanation: The National Council for Educational Research and Training (NCERT) has partnered with IIT Madras through a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to strengthen educational research and promote the integration of advanced technologies in learning. This collaboration aims to foster innovation in education by leveraging Information Technology, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning tools. Aligned with the objectives of the National Education Policy 2020, the partnership seeks to modernize India’s education system, enhance digital learning infrastructure, and create data-driven, inclusive, and adaptive educational models that improve both teaching methodologies and student engagement nationwide.

questions.question: On which date is International Animation Day celebrated each year to honour the birth of animation?
questions.explanation: International Animation Day is celebrated annually on October 28 to commemorate the birth of animation and honour Émile Reynaud’s pioneering work in 1892, when he presented the first public animated film using his Théâtre Optique in Paris. Established by ASIFA in 2002, the day is observed in over 50 countries, featuring screenings, workshops, and exhibitions that celebrate the art and evolution of animation. It highlights animation’s role as a universal storytelling medium, bridging cultures and languages through creativity, education, and visual innovation across both traditional and digital forms.

questions.question: Which country is set to host the Asia Pacific Accident Investigation Group (APAC-AIG) meeting and workshop for the first time in 2025?
questions.explanation: India will host the Asia Pacific Accident Investigation Group (APAC-AIG) meeting and workshop for the first time from October 28 to 31, 2025. The event, organised by the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) under the Ministry of Civil Aviation, will bring together around 90 global aviation safety experts and representatives from ICAO member states. Hosting this event reflects India’s growing leadership in global aviation safety, its commitment to international standards, and its strengthening role in regional air crash investigation and collaboration.

questions.question: What is the number of districts Uttar Pradesh will have after the creation of Kalyan Singh Nagar?
questions.explanation: Uttar Pradesh will have a total of 76 districts after the creation of Kalyan Singh Nagar, which has been carved out from tehsils of Aligarh and Bulandshahr. The new district honours the legacy of former Chief Minister Kalyan Singh, who played a significant role in the state’s political and developmental history. The government’s decision aims not only to pay tribute to the late leader but also to improve administrative efficiency, governance, and public service delivery in the region. By creating smaller districts, Uttar Pradesh seeks to strengthen local administration and ensure balanced regional development.

questions.question: Which Indian company signed an MoU with Russia’s United Aircraft Corporation (UAC) to produce SJ-100 civil commuter aircraft in India?
questions.explanation: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Russia’s United Aircraft Corporation (UAC) to jointly produce SJ-100 civil commuter aircraft in India. This collaboration represents a landmark achievement for India’s aviation sector, as the SJ-100 will become the first complete passenger aircraft manufactured domestically. The initiative aligns with the government’s ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ (self-reliant India) vision by strengthening indigenous manufacturing capabilities, reducing dependence on foreign imports, and positioning India as a key player in the global civil aviation production ecosystem.

questions.question: How many nations signed the historic United Nations Cybercrime Convention held in Hanoi?
questions.explanation: A total of 72 nations signed the United Nations Cybercrime Convention in Hanoi, marking the creation of the first-ever global treaty aimed at combating cyber threats. This landmark agreement, adopted by the UN General Assembly in 2024 after years of negotiation, establishes a universal legal framework to address crimes such as hacking, ransomware, online fraud, child exploitation, and the non-consensual sharing of intimate images. By fostering international cooperation, facilitating evidence sharing, and offering capacity-building support for developing countries, the treaty represents a significant step toward harmonizing global cyber laws and strengthening collective digital security.

questions.question: Who won the gold medal in the men’s freestyle 65kg category at the Under-23 World Wrestling Championships?
questions.explanation: Sujeet Kalkal secured a historic victory by winning the gold medal in the men’s freestyle 65kg category at the Under-23 World Wrestling Championships. He defeated Uzbekistan’s Umidjon Jalolov in the final to claim his first-ever world title. This achievement adds to Kalkal’s growing list of accolades, which already includes two U-23 Asian titles and a U-20 Asian Championship gold. His triumph is particularly significant as it was India’s only medal at the event, showcasing his exceptional skill, determination, and contribution to Indian wrestling on the global stage.

questions.question: Which country launched the world’s first yen-pegged stablecoin, JPYC, marking a major milestone in digital finance?
questions.explanation: Japan has introduced the world’s first yen-pegged stablecoin, JPYC, on October 27, 2025, through Tokyo-based startup JPYC Inc. Fully backed by Japanese yen and government bonds, the stablecoin aims to enhance digital payments and global financial interoperability while maintaining a 1:1 value with the yen. This move positions Japan as a pioneer in digital currency innovation, breaking the dominance of U.S. dollar-backed stablecoins. By promoting low-cost, fast, and secure transactions, Japan’s initiative reflects its broader goal of integrating fintech advancements with monetary stability and economic modernization in the Asia-Pacific region.

questions.question: Who became the first U.S. president to receive South Korea’s highest national honour, the Grand Order of Mugunghwa?
questions.explanation: During his visit to South Korea on October 29, 2025, Donald Trump was awarded the Grand Order of Mugunghwa, the country’s highest national honour. He also received a replica of the golden Cheonmachong crown, symbolising unity and peaceful reigns. This recognition was granted for his diplomatic efforts in fostering peace on the Korean peninsula, particularly his historic engagements with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. The event, held in Gyeongju, highlighted strengthened U.S.–South Korea relations and marked Trump as the first American president to receive this distinguished award.

questions.question: With which country did India recently sign key power agreements to build 400 kV transmission lines and boost cross-border electricity trade?
questions.explanation: India and Nepal have entered into major power agreements to strengthen their energy partnership. The deals were signed between India’s POWERGRID Corporation and the Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) in New Delhi, in the presence of both countries’ energy ministers. These agreements aim to construct two 400 kV cross-border transmission lines connecting Inaruwa (Nepal) to New Purnea (India) and Lamki/Dododhara (Nepal) to Bareilly (India). The initiative will enhance electricity trade, improve grid reliability, and promote regional energy integration. This collaboration highlights Nepal’s hydropower potential and India’s growing clean energy demand under its Neighborhood First policy.

questions.question: Which regulatory body has proposed major reforms to India’s mutual fund fee structure to enhance transparency and investor protection?
questions.explanation: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has proposed an overhaul of the mutual fund fee framework to promote transparency, fairness, and investor protection. The consultation paper suggests that taxes and government levies such as STT, GST, and stamp duty be excluded from the Total Expense Ratio (TER) and charged separately to investors. It also proposes removing the additional 5 basis points expense for Asset Management Companies (AMCs) on Assets Under Management (AUM). These reforms aim to simplify cost structures, improve investor clarity, and ensure better governance in India’s mutual fund industry.

questions.question: On which date is World Stroke Day observed in 2025?
questions.explanation: World Stroke Day is observed every year on October 29 to raise global awareness about stroke prevention, treatment, and recovery. In 2025, the Ministry of Ayush in India marked the day by promoting holistic and integrative approaches to stroke management, combining traditional Indian systems like Ayurveda, Yoga, and Naturopathy with modern medical care. The observance highlights the importance of lifestyle changes, early detection, and rehabilitation in reducing stroke-related mortality and disability. By aligning ancient practices with scientific medicine, the initiative underscores India’s commitment to preventive and restorative health care on this significant day.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with Nvidia to deploy 100,000 autonomous robotaxis starting in 2027?
questions.explanation: Uber has entered into a strategic partnership with Nvidia to deploy 100,000 autonomous robotaxis beginning in 2027, signaling a transformative step in the evolution of urban transportation. The collaboration will leverage Nvidia’s DRIVE AGX Hyperion 10 platform, designed to support Level 4 autonomy, enabling vehicles to operate without human intervention in controlled environments. Uber will manage the operational aspects of the autonomous fleet, integrating the technology into its global ride-hailing network. This initiative represents a major advancement in self-driving innovation, combining Uber’s mobility expertise with Nvidia’s AI and computing power for next-generation smart mobility solutions.

questions.question: From which Air Force Station did President Droupadi Murmu take her historic Rafale fighter jet sortie?
questions.explanation: President Droupadi Murmu took her historic Rafale fighter jet sortie from Ambala Air Force Station in Haryana on October 29, 2025. This event marked a significant milestone as she became the first Indian President to fly in the Rafale jet. Ambala, known as the base of the IAF’s 17 Squadron “Golden Arrows,” has been central to India’s Rafale operations since 2020. The sortie, lasting around 30 minutes, underscored her role as Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces and strengthened the bond between civilian leadership and military operations.

questions.question: Which ministry is set to launch the “Koyla Shakti – Smart Coal Analytics Dashboard” for real-time monitoring of coal operations in India?
options: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
questions.explanation: The “Koyla Shakti – Smart Coal Analytics Dashboard” is being launched by the Ministry of Coal as part of its digital transformation efforts in the energy sector. This real-time analytics platform aims to integrate data from coal producers, ports, and multiple ministries into a unified interface, enabling efficient tracking of the entire coal supply chain. By promoting data transparency, operational efficiency, and better coordination among stakeholders, the dashboard supports India’s goal of modernizing its coal management systems and ensuring smoother energy logistics across the country.

questions.question: What percentage of scientists are featured in Stanford University’s 2025 global list of top researchers?
questions.explanation: Stanford University’s 2025 World’s Top 2% Scientists List identifies the top-performing researchers worldwide based on a composite citation and impact metric developed by Professor John Ioannidis. The data, sourced from Elsevier’s Scopus database, evaluates career-long and annual scientific performance across various disciplines. This year’s list highlights 6,239 Indian scientists among the world’s top 2%, reflecting India’s growing presence in global research and innovation. Notably, several of these scientists come from emerging and lesser-known institutions, showcasing the expanding quality and diversity of scientific contributions across the Indian research landscape.

questions.question: Which country has unveiled the nuclear-powered underwater drone named Poseidon?
questions.explanation: Russia has introduced Poseidon, a nuclear-powered and nuclear-armed underwater drone capable of creating massive radioactive tsunamis near enemy coastlines. Announced by President Vladimir Putin, the Poseidon—formerly known as Status-6—is a next-generation strategic weapon intended to deter large-scale attacks. It features a compact nuclear reactor that is about 100 times smaller than those found in standard submarines, giving it remarkable endurance and stealth capabilities. The weapon underscores Russia’s focus on developing autonomous and nuclear-based defence systems, marking a significant escalation in global undersea warfare and strategic deterrence technologies.

questions.question: The Government of India plans to introduce new ‘Ratna’ categories as part of the revised classification and performance assessment of which entities?
questions.explanation: The Government of India is planning to reform the classification system of Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs) by introducing two new ‘Ratna’ categories in addition to the existing Maharatna, Navratna, and Miniratna statuses. This initiative aims to modernize the evaluation framework, align it with evolving market conditions, and reward efficiency, profitability, and innovation among CPSEs. A 10-member committee headed by Cabinet Secretary T.V. Somanathan has been established to review the proposal and submit recommendations before the Union Budget 2026–27. The move reflects the government’s continued efforts to enhance corporate governance and performance accountability in the public sector.

questions.question: Across which front is India conducting the tri-service military exercise ‘Ex Trishul’?
questions.explanation: ‘Ex Trishul’ is a large-scale tri-service exercise conducted by India along its Western Front, which borders Pakistan. The exercise brings together the Army, Navy, and Air Force to enhance interoperability, coordination, and joint combat readiness. Held across Gujarat and Rajasthan from October 30 to November 10, 2025, it focuses on integrated operations involving land, sea, and air components. With over 20,000 troops and advanced assets like Rafale jets, Arjun tanks, and naval destroyers, the exercise demonstrates India’s preparedness, technological strength, and commitment to maintaining security and strategic stability along its western border region.

questions.question: Where was the International Salinity Conference 3.0, WE-CARE 2025, inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The International Salinity Conference 3.0, WE-CARE 2025, was inaugurated at the ICAR–Central Coastal Agricultural Research Institute (ICAR-CCARI) in Old Goa. The event gathers 150 delegates from India and several SAARC and AARDO member nations, including Japan, Sri Lanka, Mauritius, Dubai, Oman, Kenya, Ghana, Zambia, Gambia, Eswatini, and Lebanon. Hosting the conference in Goa highlights its role as an important hub for international collaboration in addressing global salinity issues, promoting research exchange, and fostering sustainable agricultural practices across diverse regions.

questions.question: Who from Punjab recently earned the International Master (IM) title in chess after performing at the 3rd Annemasse International Masters Tournament in France?
questions.explanation: Namitbir Singh Walia from Jalandhar, Punjab, achieved the prestigious International Master (IM) title after securing fourth place at the 3rd Annemasse International Masters Tournament in France. His consistent performance, including winning the Senior State FIDE Rating Open Chess Championship earlier this year, highlights his dedication and growing prominence in Indian chess. With this achievement, Namitbir becomes Punjab’s second International Master, following Dushyant Sharma, who earned the title in 2022. His success marks a significant milestone for the state’s chess community and inspires emerging players to aim for international recognition.

questions.question: Which state’s police launched the ‘Cyber Jago’ programme to promote internet safety among school students?
questions.explanation: The ‘Cyber Jago’ programme was launched by the Punjab Police’s Cyber Crime Division with the objective of educating government school students about internet safety and responsible online behavior. The initiative also emphasizes the role of teachers and parents in building awareness through open discussions on online risks and preventive measures. As a statewide effort, Cyber Jago aims to safeguard the younger generation from cyber threats, empowering them with knowledge to navigate the digital world securely while fostering a culture of responsible internet usage across Punjab.

questions.question: Which country received India's first-ever GI-tagged Indi and Puliyankudi Limes under the APEDA-facilitated air shipment?
questions.explanation: The Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA) facilitated the first-ever air shipment of GI-tagged Indi and Puliyankudi Limes to the United Kingdom. This historic consignment consisted of 350 kg of Indi Lime from Vijayapura, Karnataka, and 150 kg of Puliyankudi Lime from Tenkasi, Tamil Nadu, totaling 500 kg. The successful export signifies a major milestone in expanding the global reach of India’s unique GI-tagged horticultural products, strengthening trade ties and promoting regional produce in international markets.

questions.question: In which country did India and the United States sign a landmark 10-year Defence Framework Agreement?
questions.explanation: India and the United States signed a landmark 10-year Defence Framework Agreement in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. This agreement marks a significant step in strengthening the US–India Major Defence Partnership by outlining long-term cooperation in areas such as defence technology, joint military exercises, and information sharing. The framework aims to enhance strategic collaboration between the two nations while contributing to regional and global security. The choice of Malaysia as the signing venue underscores its importance as a neutral ground for fostering international defence partnerships in the Indo-Pacific region.

questions.question: Who became the oldest ever ICC No. 1 ODI batter at the age of 38 years and 182 days?
questions.explanation: Rohit Sharma, at 38 years and 182 days, created history by becoming the oldest player to top the ICC Men’s ODI batting rankings. This remarkable achievement marked his first time reaching the No. 1 position in the ODI charts. By doing so, Rohit surpassed the legendary Sachin Tendulkar, who held the previous record at 38 years and 73 days in 2011. He achieved this milestone by overtaking Shubman Gill, reaffirming his consistency, experience, and dominance in world cricket even in the later years of his career.

questions.question: Which team defeated Australia to enter the Women’s ODI World Cup 2025 final?
questions.explanation: In a historic semi-final of the 2025 Women’s ODI World Cup held at DY Patil Stadium, Navi Mumbai, India defeated Australia by 5 wickets to secure a place in the final against South Africa. Chasing a mammoth target of 339 runs, India recorded the highest successful run chase in Women’s ODI history. Jemimah Rodrigues’ unbeaten 127 and Harmanpreet Kaur’s crucial 89 anchored the innings, while contributions from Richa Ghosh and Amanjot Kaur sealed the win. This victory marked India’s first appearance in a World Cup final since 2017 and ended Australia’s long unbeaten streak in the tournament.

questions.question: On which date is World Cities Day observed every year to promote sustainable urban development?
questions.explanation: World Cities Day is observed annually on October 31 to raise global awareness about the challenges and opportunities of urbanization while promoting sustainable and inclusive city development. Initiated by the United Nations General Assembly through Resolution 68/239, the day marks the conclusion of “Urban October,” an initiative led by UN-Habitat. The 2025 theme, “People-Centred Smart Cities,” emphasises leveraging technology and innovation to improve urban living standards, enhance sustainability, and prioritise human well-being. The 2025 global event, hosted in Bogotá, Colombia, aims to encourage cooperation and innovation for building resilient, inclusive, and prosperous cities worldwide.

questions.question: On which date is National Unity Day celebrated in India to honour Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel’s birth anniversary?
questions.explanation: National Unity Day, also known as Rashtriya Ekta Diwas, is celebrated every year on October 31 to commemorate the birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, the “Iron Man of India.” The day honours his crucial role in integrating over 560 princely states into a unified India after independence. In 2025, the celebration marks the 150th anniversary of Patel’s birth, with nationwide events such as the Run for Unity and cultural programs emphasizing patriotism, unity, and national integrity. This date also symbolises Patel’s enduring legacy in building a strong and united Indian nation.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the 53rd Chief Justice of India (CJI), succeeding Justice BR Gavai?
questions.explanation: Justice Surya Kant has been appointed as the 53rd Chief Justice of India, with his tenure beginning on November 24, 2025, following the retirement of Justice BR Gavai. The appointment was approved by President Droupadi Murmu based on the collegium’s recommendation. Justice Surya Kant, currently a Supreme Court judge, is known for his contributions to constitutional law, social justice, and human rights. Before his elevation, he served as Chief Justice of the Himachal Pradesh High Court and as a judge at the Punjab and Haryana High Court. His leadership is expected to guide key judicial reforms and enhance justice delivery efficiency in India.

questions.question: How many countries received $5.8 million from the Kunming Biodiversity Fund to promote nature-friendly agriculture?
questions.explanation: A total of seven countries — Cook Islands, Madagascar, Mexico, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Turkey, and Uganda — collectively received $5.8 million from the Kunming Biodiversity Fund. The funding supports projects that integrate biodiversity into agricultural practices, empower local communities, and control invasive species. Backed by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), the initiative aligns with the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework. By encouraging eco-friendly farming and strengthening biodiversity protection, the program promotes sustainable agriculture that benefits both ecosystems and local livelihoods across multiple regions.

questions.question: Which global technology company has partnered with Reliance Industries to strengthen India’s AI infrastructure and expand access to AI tools?
questions.explanation: Google has partnered with Reliance Industries to enhance India’s AI infrastructure and make artificial intelligence more accessible across the nation. The collaboration focuses on developing local AI computing power, promoting innovation, and supporting the “AI for All” mission. Through this alliance, Jio users aged 18 to 25 will receive 18 months of free access to Google Gemini Pro, empowering young Indians to explore AI technologies. The partnership also includes efforts to build AI models for Indian languages and establish domestic data centers powered by green energy, thereby boosting India’s digital inclusion, sustainability, and technological self-reliance.

questions.question: Which country co-chaired the annual health partnership meeting with India to review the 2025 Progress Report and approve Phase IV work plans for 2025–26?
questions.explanation: The annual partnership meeting between India and Norway focused on reviewing the 2025 Progress Report and approving Phase IV work plans for 2025–26 under the Norway India Partnership Initiative (NIPI). This collaboration aims to enhance public health outcomes through innovation and data-driven decision-making. One of its major achievements is the Indian Public Health Standards – Open Data Kit Tool, which enables states to identify healthcare gaps and receive focused support efficiently. The partnership showcases strong bilateral cooperation in improving maternal, newborn, and child health systems across India through technology and evidence-based planning.

questions.question: After whom has the FIDE Chess World Cup 2025 trophy been renamed?
questions.explanation: The FIDE Chess World Cup 2025 trophy has been renamed the Viswanathan Anand Cup to honour India’s legendary chess grandmaster and five-time World Champion. This decision celebrates Anand’s immense contributions to global chess and his role in inspiring generations of Indian players. Known as the “Tiger of Madras,” Anand’s achievements transformed chess into a mainstream sport in India. The renaming was announced during a ceremony in Goa, attended by key dignitaries, including the FIDE President and Indian officials. The tribute marks a proud recognition of Anand’s lasting legacy in the international chess community.

questions.question: Which senior IDAS officer took charge as the Financial Advisor (Defence Services) on November 1, 2025?
questions.explanation: Shri Raj Kumar Arora, a 1990-batch officer of the Indian Defence Accounts Service (IDAS), has assumed charge as the Financial Advisor (Defence Services) on November 1, 2025. With over three decades of experience in defence finance, budgeting, audit, and policy, he brings vast expertise to one of India’s most critical financial positions. Before this role, he served as the Controller General of Defence Accounts (CGDA) and held senior posts in the UPSC, Ministry of Defence, and Ministry of Finance. His leadership is expected to enhance fiscal efficiency, transparency, and strategic financial planning in India’s defence establishment.

questions.question: Which organization released the Hindi translation of the Lithuanian novel “The Last Day,” titled “Antim Din”?
questions.explanation: Sahitya Akademi, under the Ministry of Culture, launched the Hindi edition of Lithuanian author Jaroslavas Melnikas’s novel “The Last Day”, titled “Antim Din”. This initiative marks the first-ever translation of a Lithuanian fiction work into Hindi, representing a milestone in India–Lithuania literary collaboration. The novel, translated by Dr. Poonam Tiwari, was released at Rabindra Bhawan, New Delhi, in partnership with the Embassy of Lithuania. The event underscored the Akademi’s mission to promote global literature in Indian languages and foster cultural understanding through translation, making international literary masterpieces more accessible to Indian readers.

questions.question: On which date will World Vegan Day 2025 be celebrated?
questions.explanation: World Vegan Day 2025 will be celebrated on November 1, marking the beginning of World Vegan Month. The day is dedicated to promoting vegan living, sustainability, and compassion toward all living beings. It encourages people to adopt a plant-based lifestyle that avoids animal exploitation and supports environmental protection. Events such as awareness campaigns, vegan fairs, and cooking workshops are held globally to highlight the benefits of veganism for human health, animal welfare, and the planet. Established in 1994 by Louise Wallis of the Vegan Society UK, the day continues to inspire sustainable and ethical choices worldwide.

questions.question: Which company has partnered with OpenAI to integrate its digital wallet into ChatGPT, becoming the platform’s first integrated payments wallet?
questions.explanation: PayPal has partnered with OpenAI to become ChatGPT’s first integrated digital payments wallet, allowing users to make secure purchases directly within the AI platform. This collaboration enables seamless e-commerce by letting users click “Buy with PayPal” in ChatGPT for instant payments. The move strengthens PayPal’s role in the emerging field of AI-powered commerce, showcasing its commitment to innovation and user trust through secure checkout, buyer protection, and verified transactions. By aligning with OpenAI’s growing ecosystem, PayPal positions itself at the forefront of the digital payment revolution, blending convenience, safety, and artificial intelligence to shape the future of online shopping.

questions.question: Which country agreed to cut tariffs on Chinese imports from 57% to 47% as part of the one-year truce on rare earth exports?
questions.explanation: The United States agreed to reduce tariffs on Chinese imports from 57% to 47% following diplomatic negotiations with China in Busan, South Korea. This deal temporarily eased tensions between the two major economies, marking a one-year truce on rare earth exports. The U.S. concessions were part of a broader agreement that included China’s resumption of soybean purchases and increased action against fentanyl trafficking, reflecting efforts by both sides to stabilise trade relations and promote economic cooperation despite ongoing strategic competition.

questions.question: Which country launched the Fully Digital Marine Fisheries Census 2025 using multilingual Android apps developed by ICAR-CMFRI?
questions.explanation: India launched the Fully Digital Marine Fisheries Census 2025, marking a major technological leap in fisheries data collection. This initiative replaces traditional paper-based surveys with advanced multilingual Android applications — VyAS-BHARAT, VyAS-SUTRA, and VyAS-NAV — developed by ICAR-CMFRI. The census aims to comprehensively cover 1.2 million fisher households across 5,000 marine villages in 13 coastal states and union territories. By integrating real-time geo-referenced data, drone-based craft enumeration, and dashboard monitoring, India is modernizing fisheries management, improving data accuracy, and enabling informed policymaking for the sustainable development of the marine sector.

questions.question: Which Indian tennis legend announced his retirement after a 20-year professional career, ending with a final appearance at the Paris Masters 2025?
questions.explanation: Rohan Bopanna, one of India’s greatest tennis players, retired in 2025 after a distinguished two-decade-long career. Known for his powerful serves and exceptional doubles play, Bopanna achieved historic milestones, including winning two Grand Slam titles — the 2017 French Open mixed doubles and the 2024 Australian Open men’s doubles. He became the oldest player to reach World No. 1 in doubles at age 43. His famous partnership with Pakistan’s Aisam-ul-Haq Qureshi, dubbed the “Indo-Pak Express,” symbolised sportsmanship and unity. Bopanna’s legacy extends beyond trophies, as he inspired future Indian tennis players through perseverance and excellence on the global stage.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the Chief Product and Business Officer of Google Cloud?
questions.explanation: Karthik Narain, a seasoned technology leader and former Accenture Chief Technology Officer, has been appointed as the Chief Product and Business Officer at Google Cloud. With over 25 years of experience in cloud, AI, and enterprise transformation, Narain brings deep industry expertise to one of the world’s most competitive cloud ecosystems. In his new role, he will oversee product, engineering, and go-to-market strategies, helping Google Cloud expand its global presence and AI-driven enterprise offerings. His appointment strengthens Thomas Kurian’s leadership team and reinforces Google’s strategic push to accelerate innovation and compete effectively with AWS and Microsoft Azure in the enterprise cloud market.

questions.question: Which country launched the Shenzhou-21 mission carrying three astronauts and four lab mice to the Tiangong Space Station?
questions.explanation: China launched the Shenzhou-21 mission to its Tiangong Space Station, marking another milestone in its rapidly advancing space programme. The mission carried three astronauts — including 32-year-old Wu Fei, the nation’s youngest astronaut — and four lab mice for biological experiments in microgravity. Conducted from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre using a Long March-2F rocket, the mission aims to expand research on space-based biology, maintenance operations, and spacewalks. This achievement aligns with China’s long-term goal of landing humans on the Moon by 2030 and reinforces its position as a key global player in space exploration and scientific innovation.

questions.question: Who was elected as the 10th President of Ireland after winning about 63% of the vote in the 2025 presidential election?
questions.explanation: Catherine Connolly, an independent left-wing politician from Galway, was elected as Ireland’s 10th President with around 63% of the first-preference votes, defeating her main rival Heather Humphreys. Her victory marks a significant moment in Irish politics, being both a rebuke to the centre-right establishment and a sign of public support for progressive and inclusive values. Connolly, who has served as a Teachta Dála since 2016 and was Deputy Speaker of Parliament, campaigned on themes of social justice, neutrality in foreign policy, and equality, promising to be “a president for all” Irish citizens.

questions.question: Who has been appointed as the new Archbishop of Canterbury, becoming the first woman to lead the Church of England?
questions.explanation: Dame Sarah Mullally has made history as the first woman appointed Archbishop of Canterbury, the highest office in the Church of England. Formerly the NHS Chief Nursing Officer for England, she transitioned to the priesthood in 2006 and became the Bishop of London in 2018. Her appointment marks a major milestone for gender equality in the Anglican Church, reflecting its ongoing journey toward inclusivity and reform. Approved by King Charles III after nomination by Prime Minister Keir Starmer, she will officially take office in January 2026. Her priorities include safeguarding reforms, rebuilding trust, and promoting compassion and inclusivity in the Church’s mission.

questions.question: Who was recognised by the World Food Prize Foundation as a 2025 Top Agri-Food Pioneer for his contributions to nutrition and sustainable food systems?
questions.explanation: Chef Sanjeev Kapoor, a celebrated Indian chef and Padma Shri awardee, was honoured by the World Food Prize Foundation as one of its 2025 Top Agri-Food Pioneers. He earned this global recognition for integrating culinary innovation with nutrition advocacy, sustainable sourcing, and agricultural transformation. Kapoor’s initiatives, such as Nutri Pathshala, have connected schools, farmers, and nutrition programmes, helping deliver over 2.5 million nutrient-rich meals to children. His promotion of bio-fortified crops like iron-rich pearl millet and zinc-rich wheat has advanced both food security and community health. This recognition highlights how chefs can drive real change in agriculture and nutrition policy.

questions.question: Which company launched ‘VEER’, India’s first electric vehicle designed specifically for defence operations?
questions.explanation: Pravaig, a Bengaluru-based company, has launched VEER, India’s first indigenous electric vehicle developed for defence applications. Built under the Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative, the Pravaig VEER EV offers stealth capabilities, high terrain mobility, and quick field-repair readiness, making it ideal for modern military missions. The vehicle recently received the iDEX (Innovation for Defence Excellence) award, recognizing its contribution to indigenous defence innovation. By combining sustainability, tactical efficiency, and technological advancement, the VEER strengthens India’s self-reliance in defence manufacturing and positions the nation as a potential leader in electric military vehicle technology on the global stage.

questions.question: What is the name of the new programme launched by UIDAI to enhance Aadhaar security and promote digital innovation?
questions.explanation: SITAA, which stands for Scheme for Innovation and Technology Association with Aadhaar, is a new initiative launched by the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI). The programme aims to strengthen Aadhaar’s technological foundation by encouraging innovation and research in areas like artificial intelligence, biometric authentication, and data security. In collaboration with MeitY Startup Hub and NASSCOM, SITAA will nurture startups and researchers to develop homegrown solutions for a secure and inclusive digital identity ecosystem. It also aligns with national missions such as Digital Public Infrastructure and Atmanirbhar Bharat, fostering self-reliance and trust in India’s digital framework.

questions.question: What was the year-on-year growth rate of India's GST revenue in October 2025, which marked the slowest pace in over four years?
questions.explanation: India’s Goods and Services Tax (GST) revenue grew by 4.6% year-on-year in October 2025, reaching ₹1.96 lakh crore — the highest in five months but marking the slowest growth in over four years. Despite the moderation, revenues remained above ₹1.8 lakh crore for the tenth straight month, reflecting consistent economic activity and strong tax compliance. The slowdown was partly due to the government’s restructuring of GST slabs, which simplified the tax system by reducing higher-rate categories. This reform is expected to stimulate consumption and investment over time, helping sustain fiscal stability and support India’s long-term economic growth trajectory.

questions.question: Which team won the ICC Women’s ODI World Cup 2025 by defeating South Africa by 52 runs in the final at Navi Mumbai?
questions.explanation: India won their maiden ICC Women’s ODI World Cup title in 2025 by defeating South Africa by 52 runs in the final held at the DY Patil Sports Academy, Navi Mumbai. India posted a strong total of 298/7, powered by Shafali Verma’s 87 and Deepti Sharma’s all-round brilliance, including a fifty and five wickets. South Africa’s Laura Wolvaardt scored a valiant 101, but India’s bowlers sealed the victory. This triumph marked India’s first-ever Women’s ODI World Cup title, making it a historic achievement for Indian cricket and a defining moment for women’s sports in the country.
